title: Soaring river views and convenient location
text: I travel to Chicago a few times a year on business, but this was my first visit at the LondonHouse.  As a Hilton Honors member, I'm always looking for a Hilton property close to my work location and this one just happened to be right around the corner.  It was also a short walk from the Clark/Lake L stop to get to the airport also.  I really liked the 2nd floor lobby and bar area.  Plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. The room was beautifully renovated and had a very comfortable bed.  I will likely stay here again in the near future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing location and service
text: The London House is an awesome place to stay when visiting Chicago! The location can't get much better...you are just a across the river from the riverboat architecture tour (highly recommend as well!). The room was gorgeous! The gym was well appointed and even had a Peloton bike! I will definitely be staying here again when we come back to Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Rooftop in the City!
text: Unbelievable views and service, stop by and ask for April & Kida will take care of you! This location is the best piece of Chicago culture and style. Very modern decor and friendly staff. Drinks were good!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: In the middle of everything
text: I love this location. It‚Äôs right on the river at Michigan Ave. which makes it a close walk to the Chicago theater, millennium park, Hamilton, Art Institute, Chicago River boat tours, and shopping on Michigan Ave. Yoi must go to the rooftop bar for one of the best outside views of Chicago. My hotel room was small but big enough for two people comfortably. Finally, I left my AirPods in my room and when I called the hotel they had them and arranged to have them mailed to my home address. I would stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic customer service
text: I Travel a lot. I don't normally take much time when I leave a review.  But LondonHouse deserves my time.   The location is great. Our room was great. The customer service, which is the most important category in my opinion, was fantastic. Housekeeping staff, great. Front desk, great.   And I recommend that you get a drink in the bar upstairs, where the bartenders are amongst the best I've seen anywhere. [ The Blonde bartender seemed just a wee bit snooty, but was still very good. ]     We didn't have a chance to get a drink at the rooftop bar, because it was so busy every time we tried.    Thank you all at LondonHouse for such an enjoyable stay, and I will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First time stay in Chicago
text: For our first time in Chicago, I was very happy with our hotel selection. This hotel was perfectly located to everything that my husband and I wanted to do in Chicago. The hotel itself is so beautiful and had great amenities. I was shockingly upset once my husband and I checked into our room (after being convinced to upgrading $50 per night for our anniversary) to see Taco Bell wrappers and bags in the room that was supposedly cleaned and ready for us to stay in. I contacted the front desk and one of the housekeeping staff came immediately to solve this problem. I also noticed that when housekeeping came in to clean the room and makeup the beds, the sheets were never folded in the corners and rather the sheets were left hanging off of the side of the bed every night. I did not want to keep complaining so I remained quiet about this problem rather than taking it up with the staff. I was surprised that with such an nice hotel that simple housekeeping problems were noted. Other than those housekeeping issues, my husband and I had a great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfectly acceptable but nothing special
text: Stayed here as a family during a vacation. The hotel is really well located in the city. The room wasn‚Äôt anything special and the beds were small for doubles. So perfectly acceptable but nothing special for a standard room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel in an excellent location
text: We stayed here for 4 days and really enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly and attentive.The bed was very comfortable. I'd recommend getting a high floor facing the river as the views are amazing(and it gives you some relief from the seemingly unending traffic noise). The gym was quite nicely appointed. Some tips:1)You take the elevator UP to the second floor to check in(first elevator on the left).2)The elevators are unique in that you pick your floor on a touch screen which then tells you which elevator to    take. There are no buttons inside the elevators.3)We walked or ubered everywhere.I would  suggest NOT getting a rental car. Parking is crazy expensive.    Traffic is jammed.Not worth it..

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Place for One Night Away
text: I had a good one-night stay at LondonHouse Chicago recently. I was in the city to visit clients so it was just a quick stop-over. The hotel is centrally located so it's really easy to get around to restaurants and bars. It's also close to the river and has easy access to some fabulous views. In terms of service, the hotel did well. Check-in and check-out were easy, efficient processes. The room was nice and I would go back again without any concerns.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Satisfied
text: Satisfied with the service encounter. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Restaurant was very pleasant and food was great. Assistance with transportation was very much appreciated.  Room was clean and ready when I arrived and daily upon return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Peninsula quality with reasonable prices
text: This hotel is amazing. I‚Äôve stayed three times in 2019 and choose the 1.5 mile walk to the office over closer hotels. Rooms are clean and lovely. Location is incredible. Prices are amazing. Service is impeccable. I‚Äôve stayed in 15+ hotels in Chicago, including the Peninsula. I honestly feel like I‚Äôm getting the Peninsula level of service (and most times, better service) with insanely reasonable prices. Even the bellhops are engaging and helpful with smiles all around. Stayed in room 1133, see pics. And 2 of the 1 BR suites. Was afraid the regular room would be a letdown, but it really wasn‚Äôt.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and View
text: We booked a upper level Vista room and enjoyed the floor to ceiling windows looking along the river.  This hotel is in the middle of everything.  Between the Loop and River North.  Easy access to any transportation and very walkable!   The service and amenities were as expected (outstanding).  We received exceptional service from everyone!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic, modern and comfortable
text: It‚Äôs too bad that I only had the time to be here for one night while in town for a meeting. Nevertheless, I had a superb time in my VIP room on the 19th floor overlooking the lovely albeit busy (in summer) Chicago River. I had an incredible night of sleep in the cavernous king size room assigned to me. High-quality linens, aesthetically pleasing design, and nice toiletries, along with high tech smart TV, which allowed me to sync with my phone, and friendly front desk service make this hotel a keeper in the repertoire of hotel options for my Chicago visits.  My meeting was held at the hotel, too, and the room setup was akin to something out of a home fashion magazine. Pretty.  The rooftop restaurant on the 21st floor is a worthwhile stop for lunch (I had a delicious farm fresh salad and pricey truffle fries-topped with actual truffles, and my palette hummed!) The rooftop bar restaurant appears to be popular with trendy locals, too.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: EXCELLENT
text: Our bedroom was awesome! The hotel is nice and it is in a really good location! The staff was the best, we went there for my husband birthday and Antonhy and the rest of the staff  helped me a lot to made my husband birthday very special!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location
text: Perfect location in Chicago at Riverfront. Nice staff, clean room, huge bathroom. Walking distance from Millenium Park, Mag Mile and other cool things to do around etc.... Must try deep dish pizza at Giordano‚Äôs and Eataly as well coolest place of Italian foods.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Unforgettable experience
text: Celebrated my birthday here and what a beautiful treat it was!  We were exhausted from an 8 hour drive when upon check-in we were greeted with such a warm welcome from the two night staff that wee hour of the morning on my birthday. And a free room upgrade to top it off. The view on the rooftop was phenomenal! Walking distance to Cloud Gate and Magnificent Mile- couldn't ask for a better place. Special thanks to BES!! He is the BESt! Other than him the other hotel concierge were mediocre.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Historic hotel on the river
text: Beautiful historic hotel with a view of the Chicago River. Great central location close to the river, parks, Navy Pier, and the Magnificent Mile. Service was great. The rooms are large for a city hotel with plenty of room and the beds are comfortable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superior experience
text: Stayed here for a long weekend with my young adult daughter. The building is a Chicago architectural gem that was converted to an upscale hotel about 3 years ago. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to river walk and many other downtown attractions Our room was modern, spacious, super comfortable, and had a stunning view of the Chicago river and skyline. Service was top tier. One of the very cool things about this hotel was the rooftop bar on the 21st floor. It was accessible to the general public and there was always a huge line to board the elevator.   Hotel guest were able to bypass the line VIP style!  The rooftop was a crazy fun scene with draw dropping views Pro tips:Skip valet parking. It‚Äôs about $75 buck per day! We used the SpotHero app and found a convenient garage for about 1/3 thatIf you like coffee, there‚Äôs a Pete‚Äôs Coffee a short walk from the hotelIf you want a convenient lux meal, try Ocean Prime which is attached to the hotel Enjoy your stay!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Small and uncomfortable room
text: The Hotel is great but we got a standard room and declined a $350 upgrade fee (after 50% discount) to a river  view room for our 7-day stay. When we got into the room we found the sink quickly clogs, so we mentioned this to the front desk on our way out and when we came back from dinner it was already fixed so I give five star for customer service. The room is above average in terms of cleanliness but is small and there is one desk with one chair. The room is so small that the AC blows on your bed while you are sleeping. The other negative thing is the shower where water is a bit weak.We got coffee in the 2nd floor lounge and I have to say that the pie was excellent, but the coffee was bad and actually from corner bakery downstair is better. We had dinner at Ocean Prime and it was excellent food.Overall, I would rate the hotel at four stars.Room 1832 - stayed 7/15 to 7/20/2019.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location
text: Great location... 4 blocks away from millennium park.  You cross the bridge and you are on the magnificent mile.  Excellent view from my hotel room and from the rooftop bar.  You just cross the street and you are on the Riverwalk!!  You are half block away from the Amazon go store...  this is really cool.. specially for people like me that come from small cities.  In general tons of activities to do and you better check with the concierge.I expected bigger rooms but they were okParking is rather expensive... be prepare to shell out $75 dollars per nite.  Valet only if I recall correctly.Visit the rooftop bar during the day and at nite... great for pics and drinksIn room breakfast requires that you place an order before 11:00 PMFor Hilton Diamonds members you only get a $12 coupon discount at Land o Lake restaurant per personThey provide Robes and sleepersThe bed was soft for me but it was great.Noise can be a problem.  I heard the sirens until about mid nite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel
text: Very good value for money, Excellent Horel in Chicago very good location, nice rooftopGood rooms and good service, The staff was very friendly and I highly recommend this hotel when traveling to Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, Service & Views
text: London House is a very good high end hotel choice for travelers seeking location, service and views in Chicago. We stayed for a Saturday couples trip in June with Hilton honors points. As we waited for our room, we went to the rooftop bar & had drinks and an appetizer. Being hotel guests gets you to the front of a very long line, as it is quite popular in the good weather along the Chicago River. The service, drinks, and food were good. Our room was very nice with a spectacular river view and it was all modern. This is a great location for walking and accessing Michigan Avenue, Millennial Park, and the riverfront. The downsides to this hotel are the elevator crowds & difficult to manage key system, which requires before access swiping, which has restrictions on what arriving elevator you can take- causing crowds & waits to get to your room & the lobby. The parking is challenging as there are multiple hotels in a row all trying to valet cars on a very busy street. Overall, very good hotel & plan to return again sometime. Recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A lovely stay at this beautiful hotel!
text: Highly recommend! 1. Perfect location - despite being on the busiest intersection of Chicago, the noise level was never an issue. 2. The access to public transport is awesome, multiple bus stops just across the building and subway station is just a few minutes walk away.  3. The accommodations were luxurious and clean -- robe, slippers and the pouf shower exfoliator is a nice touch after a day of sightseeing and being outside. 4. The employees are quick to assist and does it with a smile. 5. Price is comparable if not maybe even lower than the other hotels of the same class in the area. As first-time visitors to Chicago, our stay at LondonHouse is one of the many things that made our anniversary trip special.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Spa & Rooftop Experience
text: I came to London House for spa services and brunch on Friday as a graduation gift from my amazing boyfriend!!PhD Program ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èMy spa services were amazing I felt so relaxed.It was my first time at the hotel and I‚Äôd been told their rooftop is beautiful so I took a trip to the rooftop and was greeted by Rashonda, April, Eric, and Homero.AMAZING!!!!Everyone was really friendly and helpful.The rooftop views are simply beautiful!!In the weekends with Chicago Summer events, the rooftop can get a bit crowded so just a fair warning, but if you haven‚Äôt had the opportunity to experience London House, the hotel, spa, rooftop, and restaurants, it is an absolute must!!!Ask for any of these guys, I‚Äôm sure they will ensure your experience is as wonderful as mine.Thank you so much for your hospitality!!Thank you for helping me celebrate!!RashondaAprilEricHomero You guys are the best!!!üòçüòçüòç

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: Had an excellent stay at the hotel. The staff was very courteous and professional, especially managers Kevin and Paloma! They made us feel right at home. Will definitely be returning!! The hotel was conveniently located and close to many of Chicago‚Äôs famous attractions and restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location, great service
text: The hotel is conveniently located near the river and within walking distance of a great many places of interest. The rooms were clean with great views and the service was outstanding. A good place to stay in the Loop, we will return

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel.... Great Location
text: Me and my recently stayed here for my birthday. I must say we had an amazing time. The staff was great. Being an Hilton member they made sure we had an excellent view. The location is great for downtown. Minutes away from all the top attractions. Even the breakfast was amazing. We will be returning soon. We have to have a few more drinks on the rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel if you like unbelievably nice front desk agents, nice rooms and a beautiful bar and rooftop.Loved the room, had a gorgeous view of the river and river walk. Loved how rooftop reservations were sold out when I looked online but when i checked in they said since im a guest for the night i can go up there and i will have a seat. Also a fantastic location, i was able to walk on a beautiful night for fireworks at Navy pier.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel if you like design and great view
text: Stayed with our family and couldn‚Äôt chosen a better hotel for our stay. Great service and staff, nice interior details, walking distance to everything, a fab roof top and the best classic view over the bridges.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel in Chicago
text: My wife and I stayed here in mid June and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, is well kept and the people who work there make sure you have a memorable stay. 3 people in particular during our stay were April at the rooftop bar, our server there as well Kristina and one of the bellman, Mark, were especially nice and helpful. We will definitely be back and make this our go to hotel when in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Definitely returning
text: Reception,  Matthew:  Concierge, Shannon; Bell/Door, Mark.  These three people absolutely made our short stay wonderful and their smiles and care heartwarming.  We felt very special..Thank You.  The hotel and accommodations are lovely but at the same time very comfortable.  The location could not have been better and great weather made the "river walk" a very pleasant experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Euro Feel in the Windy City
text: One of my favorite Hilton properties across the entire global portfolio.  Location:  Could not have better access to downtown, navy pier and Miracle Mile.  Great restaurant access right across the river.Amenities:  Roof top bar packed during summer months; Lobby bar has solid feel.  Workout facilities more than adequate.  Sky lobby concept works well given its only on the 2nd level.Rooms:  Make over of older building turns out to be one of the best facilities in the city.  Beds are fantastic and bathrooms more than sizeable compared to many in the city that resemble a closet space.  Love the remodel...you really cannot tell the age of the building.  Value: Winter months great value.   Summer months...they compete.  Pick when you want to come.All in all, the hotel competes for the best facility in the city.  It also has a European feel which comes across as unmatched by its local competition.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop bar
text: We went for some drinks at the rooftop bar and the views were excellent,wished we could have stayed later to see it at night but had an early flight next morning, definitely recommend this place for the views

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Hilton points stay
text: Wow! Considered the Conrad and LH in Chicago, and we were so happy we chose the LH! The location is great for all activities and fabulous restaurants. With SpotHero app we chose a slightly less expensive overnight parking right next door Club Quarters through the app. The best feature at the LH is its employees! The busy 4th of July weekend had the hotel bustling with people and activity. There were employees stationed at just the right places to help us navigate. The elevator system is different than anywhere we‚Äôve stayed, but it was no problem because strategically-positioned employees taught us the system. ALL employees were kind and friendly including Land and Lake. That hardly happens anywhere. Loved the extra amenities (like hair band and round cotton face pad) in the room, and the bar soap and lotion scents smelled wonderful. Land and Lake was delicious for breakfasts using diamond member vouchers for most of bill. The staff in the Bridges lounge at night were great. I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt have the name of the female bartender/server. She was so helpful and friendly! Hope to return here some day. I loved the interior design of the hotel too.  LH far exceeded our expectations I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt have names of employees to give them credit. Employees seemed very happy. From management to every employee this hotel should be a role model for all Hilton properties!!! Thank you!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing stay at a London House
text: Location is perfect Staff are friendly, fabulous and helpfulThe note checks in with you regularly to see how your stay was And when something was off they followed up to see if it was made right. Our 7th visit to Chicago and this was our best stay at a hotel. Would kee going back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved but there is a crowd control issue
text: We just left a 4 night stay here. We had a Suite with pull out couch in the living room for our two kids and king bedroom for us. Two nice big TVs, mini fridge, very nice. Great location in the city. Clean and modern room. Nepresso machine was nice touch.We checked in online and attempted to use our electronic key which didn‚Äôt work and I am so thankful because I got to observe all the drunk loud people on the 20th floor coming to and from the rooftop patio. We requested to be on another floor, front desk agreed that would be better for a family and easily changed, 7th floor no problem. FYI for your floor choice I would avoid 20 unless you are really wanting that kind of thing. I just have to warn you about the crowds at all times of the day and night trying to get to the rooftop patio. They have a line roped off with an staff member getting people on and off elevator but people are impatient therefore hop on guest elevators trying to get up there but doesn‚Äôt work really given the elevator system they have. They then take stairs or once you get out on a guest floor you can push any button to get to top floor. I feel it‚Äôs a safety concern for guests of  the hotel and just not a well oiled machine yet. There needs to be a better system!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful place to visit with friends
text: We came and had an amazing time! Miss April came in and really took care of us! Her personality, professionalism and kindness was amazing! Make a reservation and ask for the hostess April and have an awesome time!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 4 of july
text: Was a last minute idea that turned out to be a fun evening our room was very nice and definitely enjoyed the view ,we especially liked the rooftop bar and restaurant the drinks are lil pricey but good and we enjoyed the food and stay, the only problem was billing which was resolved other than that we had a good time

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Trip for wedding
text: Elevators broke down constantly making it hard to take care of the baby we had with us. Checking in was awful as it took forever and three people came after us and got checked in no problem. We reserved the room six months ahead time and confirmed it

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Customer Service and Hotel
text: Spent the night with my 11 year old daughter celebrating a "Daddy/Daughter" day in the city.  Check-in was a breeze and the room was a combination of modern and vintage.  The rooftop bar was unique and hopping but we were able to get a drink and take in the city view.  The bartender was creative in trying to make a special non-alcoholic drink and then offered to substitute for a simple Shirley temple when my daughter didn't prefer the watermelon.The hotel sent up a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and cookies with a note to enjoy our special day and visit!  So thoughtful and caring.  Before bed, my daughter just stared out the window at River North and the Chicago river and the lights from the great view from our room.  Checked out simply by calling down and avoiding the line and enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant since I'm a Hilton Diamond member.I highly recommend this place for a date, if you want to walk to Michigan Ave or Riverwalk, or just to come to the rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome hotel
text: Eve thing about this hotel has been amazing.. customer service, room cleaned, comfort and room services. I received a text message when I got in the room to verify everting was as I expected. And the manager replied timely to all my requests m. Great location and beautiful finish inside and out. Would come back no questions asked, thank you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: AWESOME!!!
text: Kevin and Paloma were really awesome and made our stay very enjoyable and memorable!! Michelle at the lobby bar remembered our drink orders from 1 day to the next. Anthony was very helpful in planning our outings.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hostess at the Rooftop Bar
text: I took a short trip to Chicago for the 4th. I was nervous about my reservation on the rooftop, but April was super hospitable and very friendly. It was a crazy crowd, but she managed everything perfectly. This is one of the best hangout spots in the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A MUST DO
text: First time in Chicago, staff at Londonhouse Matthew and Keith helped make it a wonderful trip.. comfortable bed...great views of the Chicago river from the rooftop bar..Yes they have a rooftop bar and a onsite restaurant. Must try frozen Pomergrade Margarita. Easy Public tranportation close by..went to Wrigley field via red line.watch the Cubs win against my NY Mets. I would differently recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London house bar
text: The host April was wonderful in helping me and my friends throughout the evening. Great host and service at the bar also . The place to be in the summer in Chi town.The music and vibe is outstanding there also.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, trendy, great bar/restaurant, clean hotel
text: Booked on our way to the city  using Priceline and were able to check in early. Easy check-in process, staff was super friendly. We enjoyed a quick snack at the rooftop bar & restaurant.  Food and drinks were excellent.  Room was very nice & clean. Would stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Wonderful Stay
text: We were at the hotel for a wedding and reception and a followup brunch the next day.  The staff here are simply outstanding. The rooms are nice size.  And it is right in the heart of Chicago within walking distance of so many attractions.  Hove to give it 5 Stars.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Stay
text: Spent one night here but wish we could have stayed longer. The room was clean and very quiet; even with being on the corner of Michigan Ave. and Wacker Dr. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. There was a nice shower head in the modern looking bathroom. We enjoyed seeing the sunrise over Lake Michigan and the beautiful lights at night from the rooftop bar. Looking forward to a return visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Tea Service is Elegant and Purposeful
text: I went to the LondonHouse for their classic tea service recently and it was incredible! They have a wide variety of teas and accompanying treats both savory and sweet. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was polished and refined. I Highly recommend it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 5 nights in chicago
text: We loved this hotel.  The location is perfect.  We had a great view.  The service was excellent.   The rooftop bar is great, but is more for the younger crowd.  We visited it during the day, (less busy).  Close to everything, and the bakery attached to the hotel was our "go to" for morning coffees and breakfast.  We went here on the suggestion of someone else, and I am glad we took their advice.  A great hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stones
text: We went to the Rolling Stones concert.We decided to stay at the Londonhouse. Glade we did. We started the afternoon on the rooftop enjoying drinks and appetizers, and the lovely views. After we checked in and changed we went next door to the oceans restaurant. The next day breakfast, and the riverwalk. The staff was great the room was very nice. Very nice

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent experience
text: Close to EVERYTHING! Across from architectural tour boats, right next to Michigan Avenue, where you can find shopping, and amazing restaurants. Matthew at the front desk was a big help too! Thanks for the late check out!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Holding a meeting at the London House
text: The meeting facilities, the personnel, and the food were all outstanding.  The meeting room had beautiful views, as well as access to an outdoor balcony that had seating.  The personnel who assisted the meeting were courteous, and helpful.  The AV equipment was up-to-date and easy to use.  The hotel itself has always been one of my favorites in Chicago and consistently provides a wonderful experience

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Spot On Service!
text: So we didn't actually stay here (but we wish we had!) so this review is based on the service we received for a tour and high tea.First of all ... Mr. Anthony. WOW This Concierge is amazing. He was so friendly, service oriented, knowledgeable and fun! He gave us a tour of the property and it's history. We never knew it's connection to Perfect Strangers! He took us through all the levels from the ground up and knew every detail and answered every question. He also arranged for our high tea the next day. As someone who has been in the industry for MANY years and comes from a hospitality family, he blew us away. We also met briefly, Ms. Shannon, their Chef Concierge. What a lovely, professional, friendly person. She was at the Concierge Desk when we arrived for our tea, so we didn't get to spend too much time with her, but the time we did was well spent. She gave us additional information and tips to make our Chicago visit more enjoyable. We didn't get to meet their third Concierge, however if they are anything like these two, then, BRAVO LONDONHOUSE. You have an ace concierge team! A Concierge Dream Team, if you will.Our tea service was wonderful. Cecil was our server. What a kind, professional young man who knows his craft WELL. We were certainly impressed with his such strong knowledge of the tea menu especially since it was fairly new! The tea options were plentiful, and the food was DELICIOUS. It doesn't look like it would fill you up, but trust me, you will be.The LondonHouse Chicago is a beautiful structure full of history and 1920s class and sophistication. The night of our tour with Anthony, the lobby had live music - soft, not too loud that you can't hear or enjoy your conversations - the young woman and her guitarist companion were a nice welcoming treat that added nicely to the ambiance. The grandeur of the former entrance was captivating. The gold, the murals and the history behind it was just great. Again, I can't speak on anything more than this, but based on this alone, I promise you that the LondonHouse Chicago is our #1 location for our next visit. It's right in the middle of it all, great spanning views of the river, classic sophistication, elegance meets modern without pompous.We are excited to start planning our next visit!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The best High Tea Place
text: I would like to thank the manager, Catalina and her team for delivering such fabulous food and service as celebrating my first Mother‚Äôs Day. The place and the staffs have brought us joy. Thanks for making our day special! Would highly recommend it to everyone.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay at LondonHouse
text: We had such a lovely time at the LondonHouse. The room was excellent, the rooftop bar was an added bonus, and the staff were accommodating and friendly. We will definitely be staying at the LondonHouse again on our next trip to Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We had a fabulous stay!
text: We upgraded to a river view room on check in, which was an added cost but so worth it. The view down the river was fantastic. Loved watching the world go by down below.  The room was great, very spacious and very quiet considering how noisy on the street it was when we were down there walking about. We had a few problems with the blind and the safe not working when we arrived but these were quickly fixed after a quick phone call to guest services. The position of this hotel is perfect for walking to all the places we wanted to see for our 5 days in Chicago. The Cloud was a 10 mins walk away and Navy Pier about 25 mins. All staff were very pleasant and helpful, particularly the bar man in the lobby area and our lovely smiley room maid who greeted us by name most mornings! We had a fabulous breakfast in the restaurant on the ground floor every morning which set us up nicely for the day. The staff in there were lovely, too. Our only complaint about this hotel is that we tried on three occasions, at different times to go up to the outdoor rooftop area and were told it was either full or there was a long wait to get a table. It was a very popular venue for people not staying at the hotel to visit. There were long queues waiting to go up in the lift in the ground floor lobby most afternoons/evenings. I would, however, definitely return here on our next visit to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Shayne was great
text: My reservation was accidentally cancelled through the main reservation center. Shayne was able to still get me a room, honoring the special rate I had booked for my room. He was great and I would go back to this hotel because of him.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Afternoon Tea Celebration
text: Celebrated my engagement at Londonhouse in two ways, both of which were incredible.First, I had a celebratory drink on the rooftop. Amazing view to enjoy the Chicago River. One of my favorite views in the city. Great drinks to match the view.Second, my family joined for afternoon tea in the Bridges Lounge. Outstanding high tea service with delicious pastries and finger sandwiches. The food was incredible and very filling. The atmosphere was wonderful and matched the tea and snacks.Catalina helped me throughout my entire planning process and is absolutely amazing. She helped me perfect my celebration, and I could not have done it without her.Highly recommend for a celebration, whether on the rooftop, in the penthouse bar or in the hotel lounge.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Long weekend getaway
text: Was in town for a long weekend and had the pleasure of staying at LondonHouse. Our experience began at check-in (and please forgive me I forgot the awesome lady that checked us in) with being moved to a city-view which overlooked the river and was stunning.  Every staff member we came into contact with was beyond upbeat and pleasant to deal with.  My wife had a massage at the Spa and thoroughly enjoyed her 110 minutes of tranquility there.  Had room service delivered one evening and the food was well prepared and satisfying.Centrally located this hotel offered everything we needed for our long weekend stay - definitely will keep it in mind for our next trip to the Windy CIty/

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Afternoon Tea
text: I had a great experience getting afternoon tea at Londonhouse. Nice ambience. Definitely more modern and trendy than other tea spots in Chicago. They give you a nice big pot of tea with plenty of refills. The scones and biscuits were FAB. I definitely recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great location for a hotel
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in December. Hotel was lovely, very pretty Christmas tress in the foyer giving it a festive welcome. Staff were friendly and helpful. Just a short walk to the shops, Navy Pier, Millennium Park and just cross the road for a boat ride on the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Light sleepers BEWARE
text: Let me start with the positives. The location is great. Walking distance to so many great attractions. We walked to the pier, Michigan Ave shopping, the bean, Millennial Park, theater district, and it‚Äôs close to the subway. It‚Äôs right across from the river, so many of the boat excursions are out your front door. The staff was friendly, rooftop bar was awesome, the ambiance is lovely. That being said, we were very disappointed in our room. I read the reviews on TripAdvisor prior to booking our stay, and upgraded our family to a ‚Äúvista room‚Äù to have ‚Äúfloor to ceiling‚Äù windows with incredible lake views. I am a light sleeper, so I always request rooms away from elevators. When we checked in, the only two rooms they had for us were near an elevator. So, that‚Äôs what we got. I tried to make the best of it, but it truly effected our trip. We were also near a stairwell, and all night we could either hear people getting off the elevators or the stairwell door opening and closing. The hotel is convenient but with that, comes a lot of street noise from E Wacker and Michigan Ave. We heard fire truck or police sirens nightly.  Not the best sleep for our 4 night stay. I‚Äôm not sure if all the vista rooms face the Trump Tower, but ours did. So our ‚Äúfloor to ceiling‚Äù views were more of that, than the river. I stayed at Loews last visit and would definitely choose that hotel over London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel in prime location.
text: We had a very enjoyable stay at the LondonHouse Chicago.  The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and the staff is very friendly and welcoming.  It's also in a great location just off Madison Avenue.  We had a room with a view of the river, which was amazing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Terrific experience
text: We stayed in a King corner suite. The room was clean, comfortable and modern. The location right along the Chicago River provided great views and easy access to all the sites by either walking or a short uber/cab ride. The restaurant on the ground floor had delicious breakfast options with fast service. I wish I could remember the name of the young woman who checked us in on the afternoon of May 22nd. She was terrific!  She helped us choose a great room as we were eligible for an upgrade and she was very accommodating to our early arrival.  I can't say enough about Mark who worked Bell/Door. He was kind, professional, authentic, efficient and knowledgeable. He took care of all of our requests including more coffee and airport transportation. He is a superstar! Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The best place to have a HIGH TEA is at LondonHouse Chicago.
text: It was such a wonderful place to have a high tea at LondonHouse. The tea was awsome and the best first experince to celerbrated Father's Day there. Services are friendly, manager is lovley, especially in each type of food has a great flavor, and the PRICES were acceptable. The decoration of the food was creative and cute. Thanks Samatha, and Catalina for this enjoyable high tea.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful stay!
text: In town for a weekend of MLB games. Flying in & out of Midway made it convenient to get back & forth on the ‚ÄúL‚Äù - quick 30 min ride, the closest stop to the hotel was at State/Lake. At the front desk Paloma & Shane were welcoming & helpful during the stay. The room was spacious with a fabulous view of the river and the bed was wonderful for a great nights sleep. The vista room view of the Chicago River was amazing & definitely the highlight of the stay! The restaurant next door Land & Lake Kitchen had a great breakfast menu - enjoyed the scramble & Benedict‚Äôs. I would absolutely stay at the LondonHouse Chicago again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago‚Äôs NeoCon trip
text: All good except for the mattress and the quality of the air conditioning. Is obviously very personal, but I like harder mattress and a very cold room when I sleep and the temperature couldn‚Äôt even reach 69...maybe a faulty thermostat...but overall a very good hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location
text: Wonderful rooms, great service and a roof deck to die for.  Was on business for a day and brought my wife for a long weekend in Chicago.  Always like this City and the location of the LondonHouse Hotel was fantastic....near everything.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in great central location
text: Lovely hotel with outstanding staff.Only small "problem" was no milk provided  with the coffee pods and the coffee machine instructions could be clearer, but very minor detail.Loved our room, with floor to ceiling window views of the Chicago river.  Also visiting the terrace was a great experience with those fantastic views over the city.Cannot praise staff highly enough during our 9-day stay.Location perfect for our visit to the annual bluesfest in Millenium park.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Good December Business Stay
text: In December, we were back in Chicago for meetings, and once more stayed at the LondonHouse, part of the Hilton Curio Collection, on the Chicago River at 85 E Upper Wacker Drive, just inside The Loop. This was our fourth stay at this hotel, and was again, a very good one.Once more, we had a room in the ‚Äúnew tower,‚Äù with views of the Chicago River. Our room, 1909, was quite comfortable. It featured a comfortable King bed, a small sitting area, an ample bathroom, and a closet large enough for all of our business clothing, since we were heading from Chicago to meetings in San Francisco, on this trip. We had plenty of drawers for clothing storage, as well. The closet had an iron, ironing board, and safe, which was a horizontal design, so that tablets, laptops and the like, did not fall out, when one opened it. I really prefer these to the vertical wall-mount safes..The bathroom, while small, had a single sink, with an adequately large vanity area, and a nice walk-in shower. This is a benefit to my wife, who has two artificial hips. The tub/shower combos are just not as comfortable, or convenient for her.We had a double thermostat setup, and both worked well. We also had remote controls for the shades in the bedroom, and with the blackout shade employed, the room was adequately dark.In the bedroom area, we had a desk, a large flat-screen TV, and a small sitting area. Then, there was another TV and small sofa, between the bedroom and the bathroom. While nice, because of the frosted glass partition between this sitting area, and the bedroom, it was not really conducive for one to be watching TV, or reading in there, while the other was trying to sleep. Still, a nice, spacious addition.Our room had ample AC and USB ports, plus good horizontal surfaces for charging devices. Being HHonors Diamond, we got bottled water during the stay.Our room, though facing the River, and East Upper Wacker Drive, was very quiet, and we also heard no noise from within the hotel.The lobby areas were decorated for Christmas, and all common spaces were lovely. There were even carolers in the lobby bar, Bridges, several times.During this stay, I dined on-property at the lobby bar, and downstairs at Land & Lake for breakfast, which was included as part of our HHonors Diamond ‚Äúpackage.‚ÄùOnce more, this was a very nice stay, at a lovely, historic and beautifully located property. My wife‚Äôs meetings were just across the River, so even in the cool December weather, she could easily walk. We also walked to several near-by restaurants, and I did some shopping, just over the River.The staff was very friendly, and we wanted for nothing. Due to the comfort and convenience, we booked again for a trip, a few months later.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing View
text: From start to finish this was a great experience.  Our room wasn‚Äôt available when we checked in, so the staff let us move to a higher floor.  The view was amazing and the room was bigger than expected.  We would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Worst experience
text: I‚Äôve stayed at hotels around the world. I‚Äôve never had a worse experience. Wedding a few floors below us was so loud the floor vibrated. The staff was unsympathetic except to tell us when the party would end at or after midnight.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Classy, Vibrant, in the Heart of the City with a heart of great service
text: Beautifully appointed rooms with spectacular views of the stunning Chicago Skyline (famous architecture, beautifully restored buildings and the lovely river walk and lake).  Great restaurant spaces and experiences.  The service was impeccable. Trevor at the front desk took impeccable care from my check-in to departure and everything in between. In addition, everyone from the cleaning staff to the bellmen stand at the ready with warm, genuine welcomes and top-notch service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible Concierge at LondonHouse
text: OMG!  We had the absolute BEST experience with one of the concierge staff (I think his name was Danny, maybe Sammy?) at Londonhouse!  He could not have been more knowledgeable about the Chicago food scene, particularly fine dining.  And I, admittedly, am quite the food snob and he knew all his stuff!  Not only did he keep up with me, but he blew me away and even thought of some out-of-the-box, off-the-beaten-path restaurants...I can't wait to try everything he mentioned from 3-michelin starred restaurants (alinea) to a restaurant in the airport (frontera), when we must sadly leave Chicago.  I really cannot bring to words how fabulous he was (he even went so far as to suggest certain dishes and drinks)!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Experience Ever!
text: I stayed at the London Hotel while I was transitioning out of Chicago and moving out of state. After a particularly rough day of moving, I decided to check into a hotel and discovered this GEM! My first hotel interaction was with BESS and was nothing short of perfection. He was kind, up-beat, professional, and incredibly welcoming. He provided me with a room that had a tremendous view as well as accommodated my garage/parking and medical alert/service dog needs. I had an amazing sleep and awoke to delicious coffee and an amazing shower- just what I needed to begin my departure! Out of all of my hotel stays, this was, bar none, the best experience to date. Great service from valet and luggage delivery- Kenny and Corey. Thank you for a wonderful stay, I will absolutely return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay here!
text: The LH exceeded our expectations.  Trevor, at the front desk, made check-in a pleasure!  We had a King room (not vista) with a view of the river.  This is a 5 star hotel in a 5 star location.  We would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone traveling to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The best hotel!
text: We stayed here for 5 nights as a free reward stay using our Hilton honors points, and so glad we did. The location of this hotel is really excellent for everything we wanted to do in chicago - walk along the river, boat cruise, visit major attractions, shopping etc. We were also upgraded to a king bed corner studio room which was amazing, with a great view of the river, and a large walk in shower. There was some traffic noise from outside (we were on 11th floor) so would recomend a high room if that is a concern to anyone.The service was amazing, lovely toiletries and quick housekeeping service. As hilton diamond members we had $12 vouchers each for breakfast every day in the ground floor restaurant, which was good but if you go for cooked items with coffee and juice it wont go too far.. but still cheaper than other places nearby.The roof bar was also lovely but always really busy, there was nearly always a long queue in the lobby to go up and as guests of the hotel you can skip the queue but the bar is very busy. They do good happy hour drinks and the view is amazing so you can see why.Overall we couldn't recomend this hotel enough, and we would love to stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect upgrade!
text: I was staying at Club Quarters and moved to LondonHouse. What an upgrade! Well designed rooms that were exceptionally clean. Great and helpful staff. Swanky rooftop bar was an added bonus. 5 star hotel spot!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceeded Our Expectations
text: Our 25th anniversary required a splurge, so I hunted for a good deal on a special hotel in Chicago, where we started our honeymoon all those years ago. After much comparison shopping, I settled on a deal on Priceline for the London House. I upgraded from a basic room to a Vista King room, hoping for something pretty special. After an early flight into Midway airport, we took the EL train into the city, and walked the three blocks to the hotel. Arriving at about 10 am, we were met inside by the bellhops, who explained that the lobby was on the second floor, and that they could hold our bags while we did pre-check in, then the bags would be brought to the room when actual check-in happened. We checked our bags, and went up to the lobby, where Matthew checked us in, and said the room was already available. We were so pleased to be able to get to the room early to rest and freshen up, and to enjoy the iconic river view. And what a view it was! Whenever we were in the room, we just wanted to sit and stare out the window at the river, the bridges, the skyline, and the activities below us. And what a comfortable room! My wife described it as ‚Äúhomey chic,‚Äù with contemporary colors and lines, but friendly accessories. I made myself a cup of coffee with the Nespresso machine, and we napped on the very comfortable bed. We kept leftovers in the mini-fridge, and valuables in the safe. The luxurious bathroom had motion-sensing lighting, and a unique frosted-glass sliding door. Travel hack: Move the bench from under the sink into the room for an extra suitcase rack. We would have liked stronger shower pressure, a few more places to hang wet towels, and the bathroom had no ceiling fan (almost a must for me), but those minor shortcomings did not cloud our bright experience. Yes, you can hear some street sounds, especially if an emergency vehicle goes by, but they were sufficiently muffled and did not disturb our sleep.The hotel has two parts; the old building, dating back to 1923, and the brand-new glass section attached, which contains the lobby, the restaurant, and the upgraded Vista King rooms, with floor-to ceiling windows. Don‚Äôt miss the rooftop bar, spanning the width of both the old and new buildings, with its fantastic views. Take the elevator to the 21st floor, then take another elevator or the stairs up one more floor to the roof. (Drinks are expensive, but you don‚Äôt have to buy one to hang out. I splurged on one, and it was really good.) The elevator controls are unique, with a learning curve. Enter your floor number on the screen to call for the elevator; the screen will indicate which elevator to take. There are no buttons inside the elevator; trust it to take you to your floor. After a couple of times we were using it like pros.We had two heroes while visiting the London House. Matthew at the front desk first gave us a great room on the 15th floor (1510). Then, when I asked him about the ‚Äúfree breakfast‚Äù that was on my Priceline reservation, he could not find it in the hotel‚Äôs system, but he comped us the meal because it was our anniversary. (Scout‚Äôs honor it was in Priceline‚Äôs deal; I have a copy of the reservation confirmation that shows it.) The ‚ÄúAmerican Classic‚Äù breakfast in the onsite ‚ÄúLand and Lakes‚Äù restaurant was very good, by the way (see my separate review). Our other hero was Alonzo, one of the bell captains. He was so helpful to us on several occasions, and he recommended a restaurant near Millennium Park called Wildberry Pancakes, which was so good. (See my separate review of that one.)This hotel would be a great ‚Äúhome base‚Äù for exploring the city; walking distance to the Loop, State Street, and Millennium Park; a short bus, taxi or Uber ride to Navy Pier, museums, or Water Tower Place. We are pleased to say that this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Thank you, London House, Matthew, and Alonzo for making our anniversary special.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A fabulous hotel experience
text: This was my first stay at the LondonHouse Hotel and it was outstanding. The rooms are excellent, the staff provide excellent service and recommendations. The location of the hotel is perfect. The roof top bar is idea for a cocktail and the food in the restaurant was very enjoyable.My final comment is the whole experience ‚Äúworks‚Äù. It all tied together to provide a really nice stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: From the beginning....
text: From the front door of the hotel to the front desk to the front door of my room I was amazed with the look, the feel, the architecture and the cleanliness of the building and the kind, pleasant, helpful and generousness of the staff.  This place is amazing!  The food, the cocktails, the rooftop bar, the gym - I visited almost everything the hotel had and enjoyed it all but the over-the-top friendliness of the staff is what makes this place so special.  They were always checking to make sure I had what I needed, that I was happy and that I didn‚Äôt want for anything.  Kudos to Yessica, Keith, Susannah and the front desk staff and concierge for all their help.  I will definitely be staying here again and recommending that others give this place a try - they won‚Äôt be disappointed- I certainly wasn‚Äôt.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional and outstanding stay!!
text: Exceptional customer service, luxury environment and spectacular views. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a more abundant experience! All staff greeted me everywhere I went no matter what department they were in‚Äî much appreciated! Personal concierge was also outstanding. Also, the rooms were gorgeous. Will be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Trust me.... this is what a FULL SERVICE Hotel is supposed to be!
text: Im a Hilton Lifetime Diamond member. That means I travel WAY TOO MUCH! I've stayed at many hotels and experienced all leveles of service, and this by far was one of my favorites in a while!The family and I were staying at another hotel and checked out becasue of poor service and cleaniness issues. We made the move to the LondonHouse in the morning. I was unable to book the room over the phone with the Hilton service Phoneline because the system was down. While waiting in the lobby with the kids, ANTHONY (the concierge), had me sit down and helped me with book the room. ANTHONY was patient and very helpful. He got us into a wonderful room and also order for treats to be delivered to our room for the kids! The room was wonderful and even though it was behind the elevators, we never heard a thing. The room was clean and QUIET! All of the staff was friendly. The breakfast was provided by the restaurant down stairs and was delicious. The rooftop patio was amazing and had an AMAZING view of the skyline. Our waitress there was wonderful also!This hotel was a FIVE STAR destination. Everyone at the hotel was pleasurable and professional! The location was amazing and in the middle of Chicago.It is easy to complain about a hotel when service is below par, but for me to review a hotel for exemplary service is a rare thing, but the LondonHouse was deserving!This hotel made for a memorable and fun family trip to Chicago! Thank you to all the staff that turned our horrible start in Chicago around for the better!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing location, modern decor, good stay
text: First visit to the LondonHouse.  The location is excellent, overlooking the river - very near the north side yet still near the lake front and the loop.  The hotel has a very modern decor and is pretty clean.  Service was good.  Our room on the 19th floor was accessible and quite beautiful.  The view of the river is so fascinating and beautiful. The bed was fairly comfortable; very little storage space for clothes in the accessible king room we had.  Roll-in shower. On the down side, the elevator system is not only confusing but also very inefficient.  (I know, how weird can elevators be?  This system is new and just plain weird.)  The rooftop bar is nice in good weather; we visited briefly.  We also tried the restaurant once, which we liked pretty much; see separate review.  Overall, we would probably go back to staying at the Palmer House as we prefer their classic hotel setup, restaurant, and price, tho we prefer the location of the LondonHouse.  Valet parking is convenient but expensive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfection
text: Absolutely AMAZING hotel and staff!! I stayed here with my young daughters to enjoy the St. Patrick‚Äôs Day festivities. We were impressed by the high end look of the hotel and the service of each staff member we came in contact with was above and beyond. Absolutely loved it and will be back again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: I stayed here one night for a meeting.  When I checked in, the front desk person couldn't find my reservation so I pulled up my Hilton confirmation email, and it turns out that I had mistakenly booked the room for the night before. Even though this was completely my mistake, the hotel honored the reservation and the rate.  The room was beautiful (Vista King) with beautiful views,and the bed was comfortable   The rooftop bar is great.  Overall, a really nice hotel with excellent service!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome
text: Been to Chicago 20+ times; this is the place to stay; central, clean, super staff and modern rooms! Recommend the top 21st floor patio for drinks. Superbe view of Chicago river and the twin towers enjoy!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Project Manager
text: This hotel was very, very nice. Sometimes the most important thing of your stay besides cleanliness is the courtesy of the staff. We were helped by a gentleman, Shane Blidy who was incredible. He went above and beyond your normal please and thank you and was so helpful, informative and kind. We would definitely go back to this hotel to stay!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First Time in Chicago
text: I picked this hotel because of the location and also the history of it. It did not disappoint, we arrived very early in the day and the front desk was most accommodating and was able to check us in early, which was much appreciated . The location is terrifically  located and easy walking distance to most everything. The accommodations were very nice, we were on the 15th floor near the elevators and did not have any problem with noise. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a terrific job every day making sure our room had everything we needed.  I would not hesitate in recommending the LondonHouse and would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel; friendly, helpful staff; highly recommend!
text: The staff was very helpful and useful - they were customer-oriented. I especially recommend Mark, Corey (Bell). Thank you so much for a wonderful stay! Located right on Wacker Avenue on river and in downtown. Beautiful buildings surround; river walk was fun;

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Terrible for business, great for clubbing
text: Pros: Beautiful hotel, very stylish. Very good location.Cons: This hotel prides itself on its top floor lounge. They emphasize it repeatedly when you check in. Had to show my Diamond status card on my phone to ‚Äúprove‚Äù I was diamond because it wasn‚Äôt in their system. This hotel is awful for business. It has no room service after 10pm forcing you to go clubbing on the 21st floor with a bunch of drunk 20 somethings to get a burger. Oh, and a tiny Diet Coke was $5. And if that wasn‚Äôt enough, I discovered refills aren‚Äôt free! Ha ha. Oh, and don‚Äôt try to order breakfast in advance with the placard because instead of allowing you to place your order up until 2am like every other business hotel on the Loop, these guys stop working at 11pm. So, no breakfast ordering either. The check in is abysmal. 2 people working who appeared to be part of the young clubby scene and took forever. Also, bellboy staff just hangs out chatting with each other. No welcome. No, how are you today? Honestly, I‚Äôve stayed with Hilton on 5 continents and this stay is making me consider a switch to Marriott. Huge disappointment, especially for the price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location, staff, and property!
text: This hotel is quite upscale without the $800/night price tag.  Located right at the intersection of the Magnificent Mile and Wacker along the Chicago river, your hotel room can have an excellent view (upgrade to a Vista suite for floor to ceiling windows and a guaranteed river view)!  You are within walking distance to just about everything you want to do in Chicago.  The elevators are in need of maintenance and there was one I refused to take due to it not functioning correctly, but this is a minor issue.  You cannot go wrong choosing this hotel and I will stay here for work in the future and bring my family here for a weekend as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Unexpected Luxury, Ideal In Every Way
text: This new-to-us Chicago hotel located on the river right off Michigan Avenue provided incredible luxury, from the room and rooftop to the personalized attention throughout our stay.The staff was warm and welcoming without being pretentious yet you felt as if you were at a 5-star hotel given the decor and ambiance.  The room was more than adequate with luxurious touches such as spa robes, slippers, and a Nespresso machine.  The marble and granite spacious bathroom complete with toiletries that I will now be purchasing was an added bonus.Finding our way to the rooftop bar, bypassing a long line thanks to the perk of staying at the hotel, we enjoyed specialty drinks as we soaked in the sun and the breathtaking views of the river and Lake Michigan.  The view at night was just as spectacular with attentive staff to serve our nightcaps.What made LondonHouse Chicago stand out from other hotel stays is the communication with the management and concierge.  Receiving an occasional text to make sure our stay was going smoothly, I was comfortable in reaching out with a couple of questions to which I had an almost immediate response.  With comfortable, immaculate, and seemingly soundproof rooms, accompanied by great service, a stellar view and an ideal location, this is a hotel that will be my first choice when staying the night in Chicago again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location and Great Stay
text: The LondonHouse was our home for six nights while visiting Chicago. It was a perfect HQ. It is a short walk to the State and Lake Loop stop so we took the Orange line in and out from Midway. Since this was my husband's first trip to Chicago, I opted for an upgrade to a river-view King. It was a spacious room on the 12th floor with beautiful views. Facing the river didn't add much outside noise either. The room was spotless and had everything you needed. At first I thought we were short on drawer space, but I found hidden ones under the bed. Note the bathroom has the funky glass, frosted door that is more form than function. The shower pressure and temperature were consistent all week. The heating and cooling in the room worked great too. The bed was super comfortable and it had great pillows. Check-in was a breeze and we were given two water bottles. Loved the historic nature of the building and the beautiful architecture and decor. The rooftop bar was very pretty, but we didn't spend much time up there as it was still chilly. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there were so many coffee spots near the hotel. Same with dinner. We did eat at Land & Lake which was on the first floor and it was very tasty. It is a quick walk to the Mag Mile or down to Millenium Park. Great having the riverwalk so close too. Enjoyed watching the art projections on Merchandise Mart one evening.  I would definitely stay at the LH again if heading to downtown to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cool Room Great Service
text: Had a great time at LondonHouse.  Walking in greeter and luggage storage is on the first floor with reception on the second.  Chose not to get a room with a view as we didn't want a view of the Trump building.Service was amazing a baggage employees also ask if you need a cab or directions.Rooftop bar view is amazing.My only minor complaint is every time I went to get toilet paper in the bathroom the holder bar would come open as if I wanted to change the roll.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Service!
text: Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience with my fianc√©. Yessica put us in one of the best hotel rooms I‚Äôve ever seen. Didn‚Äôt want to leave.  A thank you to Grace and Kevin for their kindness and conversation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mr. & Mrs.
text: London House Hotel is a great place. Nice rooms. Exceptional views. Friendly and helpful staff. Ken at the front desk is very helpful providing names of resturants and sites to see.  We will return to Chicago and will stay at London House. 5 stars Steve Bryan

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location has pros and cons
text: This hotel is located in the spot of Fort Dearborn, arguably the birthplace of Chicago, thus it cannot be more central. It is and feels it. Right at the Chicago river. Close walking distance to everything in the city center. The views from the room are great at the river, though ours faced directly the huge Trump letters on the hotel other side of the river. Peeking to the side gave though magnificent river view. Still those letters were the default view.The biggest asset of this hotel is location.You are where everyone wants to walk and you just step in to your hotel. It is obviously busy as well. That is the downside. N Michigan Avenue is busy round the clock, and seems to be used a lot by first responders. Frequent sirens penetrate the room, which I found disturbing.The hotel has smart elevators, the staff polite. The bellboys stood especially positively out.The bed was good and everything worked and was of good quality. Still, there was nothing that would make me think this was somehow special or excellent and thus above other good hotels. Think of the location - it has pros and cons.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mothers Day Stay and Dinner
text: I know truly hope i have the names correct but my husband took myself along with the kids here for Mother‚Äôs Day. We also had dinner plan. When we got there the wait for check-in was over and hour. We were late for dinner. To add injury, we reserved a one bedroom and was given more like a studio. We return to the desk and saw Anthony (hopefully I have the correct name) he was working the concierge desk. In the end, we had new dinner reservations and we were accommodated with a different room. He was definitely a reason for us to return. Dijana at the lobby bar was also very nice and personable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location! Great hotel!
text: We loved this hotel. Its location is great, just by the River, and Michigan Avenue. The view from the room was outstanding. Rooftop bar had great view as well.Had a Big bus tour stop right around the corner. Hotel was clean and service was great.Batteries from doorknob and safe died during our stay, but they fixed it right away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Nearby everything!
text: This is a great hotel, nice rooms and decoration. It's near the main attractions of Chicago, the famous Michigan Avenue where you can shop, also near Lincoln Park and it's Bean, great restaurants also nearby and excellent view of the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Multiple Trips Here - LOVE IT!
text: I‚Äôve stayed here 3x in the past 2 years and absolutely love it for many reasons.  Rooms are clean and modern with nice finishes.  Location couldn‚Äôt be more central in the heart of Chicago with beautiful views of the river. Lobby bar area is bright and comfortable for a meeting or to hang out with girlfriends, and the rooftop is the best view in town.  But best of all are the people!  Especially the bellman, Mark and Alonso took such good care of me the past 2 visits. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mother‚Äôs Day Tea
text: I had an amazing time at High Tea for Mother‚Äôs Day. The staff was so pleasant.  Cecil was very knowledgeable and courteous. The sweets we so tasty and of course the tea was good also. Everything was excellent!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Plan Great Location
text: Very clean, modern, updated and great location, able to walk to all locations that I needed to reach.  Would stay there again next time I am in town.  Everyone on Staff was friendly and relaxed atmosphere,

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great! Not more, not less.
text: The Curio is located very well so that many attractions can be reached walking. Also, ask for a room on the higher floors and you will have a beautiful view!Staff at the front desk and throughout the whole hotel was very friendly and helpful at all times. I liked the design of the room very much - simple and modern but still cozy and calm. Bedroom and bathroom were very clean and all furniture in top condition. This place is looked after very well!What I liked most was the sleeping comfort - this was one of the best mattresses I've ever slept on! And the linen was incredibly soft. Also, I didn't hear a sound from the other rooms or the hallway, definitely no paper walls.The bathroom was huge, with a nice ample shower, very good lighting, big window and amenities from Malin + Goetz.WiFi (even the complimentary standard service I got as a silver HH) was excellent in comparison with many hotels I've stayed at.Would definitely book again and highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Afternoon Tea at Bridges
text: I recently went to LondonHouse for their afternoon tea. The ambiance, service and food was amazing! We were seated by the window so we could have a view of the city which is one of the things they are known for. Our server was very attentive making sure we were ok and if we needed anything. Their manager, Catalina, came by periodically to make sure that we were good which was nice! If you have never been to LondonHouse for their afternoon tea then you must go!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A nice surprise
text: The hotel was a nice surprise! It is very pretty and the room was great except for the need to have the curtains on all the time. The room could be a bit bigger also. The service and personnel were very nice. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mother's Day Weekend
text: We had such a perfect experience at this hotel.  One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in and so convenient to all of the attractions, shopping and restaurants.  The room was beautiful with awesome views of the city.  Service was over the top, especially Mark who checked in our luggage, gave us perfect directions and was just so friendly and helpful.  Make sure you ask for Mark when you visit this hotel and he will definitely take care of you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect girls night!
text: Stayed for a girls night and loved everything about this hotel. Handy location and lovely view if you ignore the gaudy hotel opposite. The room was beautiful and clean and the spa massage was to die for. Watch out for the lifts as there are no buttons so you have to set your floor when you call the lift. I also must say that I was staying at the Chicago athletic association for 3 days on business before this and didn't like it at all. This one was a welcome change and after relaying my bad experience on check in, I was kindly offered a free drink at the lobby bar. This closes early so I missed out that night but had a lovely, bubbly to see me off the next day! Oh, and the rooftop was enjoyable even on a cool evening with coats on.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Hotel
text: This hotel has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. You walk in to smart elevators and go to floor 2 to check in. The lobby is gorgeous and beautifully decorated. The staff were all nice and welcoming.The location of this hotel is amazing. You can walk anywhere you want. You can also call an uber easily and get in and out safely. I recommend requesting a room with a river view on a high floor. It will not disappoint. We upgraded to a king suit and it was a great decision. Very spacious room and bathroom with a floor to ceiling window. Great view of the river and all the bridges. We were on the top floor, below the rooftop and I rarely heard any other guests. Very quiet.  We did not have a car there so we did not have to worry about parking. Based on the prices I saw, I would not recommend bringing a car to the LondonHouse. Parking prices were steep. If I am ever back in Chicago, I will stay at LondonHouse again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Chicago Fave!!!
text: We had the perfect experience at Chicago‚Äôs London House hotel. Their computer system was down but they handled everything calmly and made us feel very welcome. They upgraded us to a corner room with a magnificent view. The room was clean and updated. Loved the Nespresso machine! The bathroom was high compared to most Chicago hotels. The bed was so comfortable I didn‚Äôt want to get out of it. We stayed in our room almost until check out because we didn‚Äôt want to leave. Not kidding! The staff was very friendly and check out was a breeze even though their computer system was still down. (It wasn‚Äôt just Hilton but an entire area of downtown that was affected) Our new favorite hotel in downtown Chicago and we‚Äôve stayed at many!! We‚Äôll be back for sure! ‚ù§Ô∏è

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great Location - service not so much
text: Location is great - very convenient for Michigan Ave, River and ParkRooms are small and feel a little dirty - elevators are difficult to use and time consumingReception staff were slow - called down to check out and ask for copy of bills and then got down there nothing was done Late check in and the desk was so slow Its only a maybe for a repeat performance I'm afraid

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great boutique luxury hotel on the river
text: I have stayed at the LondonHouse a couple of times. Each time has been a great experience. As a diamond member, I have some higher expectations and the LondonHouse has met them each time. The entryway is always staffed with helpful valet and bellhops. The check in area is large, bright, and well decorated. There are multiple sitting areas and a fabulous bar. Not that you need them, the check in process is quick and pleasant. I recently stayed in April 2019. At check in I was greeted pleasantly, and upgraded to a suite along with early check in! The suite was magnificent, next to the elevators, but the noise did not carry into the bedroom. There was a nice sitting area with couch, chair, desk, and TV. The bedroom had another TV, couch, and two closets for storage - more than enough.The fitness center was modern, new equipment, plenty of treadmills and ellipticals. Sadly it was cold and rainy and I could not run outside. Finding a well maintained fitness center was fantastic.I did not visit the rooftop bar, due to the weather.Breakfast at the land and lake is good, and very fast! Service is great. My only complaint is the credit for diamond members is $12. That will get you one of several entrees - but do not expect a cup of coffee with that, you will have to pay extra for that. Normally I can get breakfast and coffee without extra charge, as a diamond member.
