hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible!
text: This was our first stay at London Hotel Chicago and it was a total treat.  The location is perfect - close to great restaurants, shopping, the lake, Michigan Ave etc.  Our room had a great view overlooking the river.  Room decor very well done and on trend.  Loved the lobby bar area and rooftop area.  However, the most impressive part of our stay was the incredible guest service and warm hospitality provided by the staff.  In particular, Shayne and Trevor at the front desk were especially professional, helpful and friendly; and Kenny at the bellstand was great.  Going forward, we will most certainly be making London House our go to spot in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The staff is helpful and wonderful! The room was beautiful! Our bed was so comfortable.  The Location was great, and our view was awesome! Food was delicious! We had a fun family trip! I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, but a few minor issues
text: The room here was beautiful, especially the bathroom. Go with the vista window...great view! Also loved the lobby bar. However, the elevators here can be slow, and the room keys randomly stop working.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel- exactly what I thought!
text: Great location on Wacker and Michigan.  It‚Äôs a Curio, so they strive, and succeed, to be ‚Äúon trend.‚Äù  They‚Äôre known for great views of the river and a desirable rooftop bar.  As Diamond members, we were offered upgrade options (one at a cost).  We chose a one bedroom with minimal view, and it was spacious and nicely appointed.  You get $12 Land and Lake vouchers for breakfast (coffee not included).  It‚Äôs a great spot, feels like a vacation, nice lobby for lingering and excellent and thorough front desk check-in. It didn‚Äôt feel exclusive, or uncomfortable but did feel trendy with a touch of luxury.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Couple‚Äôs getaway
text: Location is excellent - close to everything. Beds, linens, pillows and towels were wonderful. Sleep quality was excellent - surprisingly almost no road noise or noise from other guests. Rooms are small but well appointed and clean. Carpet was a bit worn and bathrooms, while large, have small functional space. More towels hangers and/or additional place to store toiletries would be appreciated. Coffee in the room was lacking but there is a Corner Bakery attached to the hotel (though doesn‚Äôt open till later than we preferred) and a Starbucks across the street. Most of the staff we encountered was excellent. Lobby bar was very nice, but we weren‚Äôt impressed with staff/service/food in the upstairs or rooftop bar. Very grateful for the umbrella provided for our use on a rainy day.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a great experience
text: I cannot express that gratitude I have for this staff. I wanted to plan a "staycation" for my girlfriends and myself and Andrew at the front desk did everything he possibly could to help. I was being very particular in what I wanted out of a room. This went as far as asking not only once but twice to move rooms. I felt terrible for being "that guest" but Andrew made me feel very comfortable asking for such accommodations. I work in the hospitality industry and I must say, WELL DONE LONDON HOUSE. From what I experienced, GRADE A, TOP NOTCH. This will definitely be my go-to for my monthly staycations!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It‚Äôs my new favourite- Ill be back
text: Just amazing. Incredible location, really central. Gorgeous views, a ‚Äònot to miss‚Äô rooftop bar (even in winter). Beautiful rooms with very comfy beds. A few tips, if you van afford it, the river view rooms are so worth it. There is a cafe next door (called around the corner) that has good espresso based coffee. And a restaurant on the other side (called Land and Lake) that does a great meal. It‚Äôs very close to a drop off for the architectural river cruise. One other point... before you get in the lift in the lobby, you need to press the floor you want to go it and then the left registers that floor and takes you up... there are no buttons in the lifts!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best in the area
text: My favorite place to stay downtown.  Total luxury for a bargain price if you can find a deal on hoteltonight or another reseller.  The bar is a little pricy but worth it--outdoor roof deck with river views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We will be back!!!
text: Loved everything about this hotel. A perfect location, fantastic service, spotless rooms and a spectacular roof top bar! This is our second time staying at this wonderful hotel and we will be back again and again!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse-Chicago
text: I recently stayed at LondonHouse as part of a conference that I was attending at the hotel.  My room was great!  Excellent view and very comfortable.  The bathroom was spacious and while the room was small, I felt that it was very efficiently designed.  I was on the end of a hall so it was exceptionally quiet.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous
text: We stayed here for four days and we‚Äôre treated like royalty by the staff especially by Mark the Bellman. He made sure we had everything we needed while checking in and during our stay. He truly is an asset to this hotel! Very Professional, knowledgeable, friendly and so helpful. The rooms are great ...only complaint was the room was very dark...needs more lighting especially on a dark day...we even had a corner room! Try and get a river view...just beautiful! The hotel is very clean and the beds are wonderful. We had a very pleasant stay and will return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The only place I will stay in Chicago
text: I stay here whenever I‚Äôm in Chicago.  I won‚Äôt stay anywhere else.  The rooms are clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooftop is fantastic.  Like any high end  hotel the prices are a little inflated - but not too bad and no worse than the competition.  The food is very good.  You can‚Äôt beat the location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great property, even better staff!
text: I‚Äôve stayed at several hotels in the downtown area, but London House is my absolute favorite.  Great location and easy to get to.  Very well maintained with top notch amenities.  Rooms are larger than most in the area and very well maintained.  Custom bedding and pillows.  Great bathrooms with walk-in showers.  The staff makes to whole experience better.  Everyone is friendly and they all go out of their way to help and answer questions.Andrew and Trevor are the best.  Sincere shout out to both of them over multiple stays.  They‚Äôre attitude and professionalism are top notch.  Thank you both!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary!
text: Wow!  This hotel was amazing!  As soon as we made our reservations, I reached out to the concierge for restaurant and parking recommendations.  It was our Anniversary weekend and Shannon wanted to make sure it was awesome!  Our room had a beautiful view and we were greeted with a nice card and chocolate covered strawberries.  The weather took a turn for the worse, so we decided to spend the evening in the hotel bar near the lobby.  The musician was wonderful and the whole evening turned out to be perfect!  I strongly recommend this hotel when visiting Chicago!  We will definitely return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience for a brief staycation
text: I travel for business constantly, and my husband almost never travels outside of our vacations. So when I volunteered to help set up for a benefit we were attending in downtown Chicago one Saturday night, a day which also required me to kill a few hours and change in between setup and event, we decided to make a mini-staycation of it (even though we only live eight miles away and I work down the block) and book a room at the LondonHouse. We chose LondonHouse not only for its proximity to our event, but because, as part of the Curio Collection, it has more character than your average Hilton. We weren't disappointed. The check-in process was smooth (and I noticed the representative next to me handling an entitled tourist who was upset about not being able to check into a room that didn't have her name on it with great skill. Bravo on the patience!). Not only was I offered an upgrade thanks to my Gold status, but I was given the choice of a room with a river and lake view or a suite. I always appreciate being asked when the hotel has flexibility. Were I alone, I probably would have chosen the suite, but the view was a nice touch for our staycation. Speaking of the view -- it was indeed gorgeous, but being on the 13th floor meant that we were basically eye level with the completely obnoxious DRUMPF sign on Drumpf Tower, a sign so comically large and tacky that it caused the City of Chicago to later pass an ordinance restricting such huge building signage so close to the ground (the sign is one of my least favorite things about living in this beautiful city, and pretty much universally hated in this city of great architecture, regardless of your political affiliation). So this has nothing to do with the LondonHouse, just be aware if you have strong feelings on such things. Had I realized this, I probably would have chosen the room with a view I was offered on the 4th floor instead.Back to the room -- the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom had great Malin + Goetz products, and they made great use of a relatively small space. And the woman who granted us a late check-out couldn't have been nicer. We'll definitely return to LondonHouse for our mini-staycations, and I'll recommend it to visiting family and friends.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Came for work but had time to play!
text: Thank you London House staff for being welcoming and helpful during my 2 night stay for work! I love the check in‚Äôs from the staff making sure my stay was to my specification and just being available when needed. I had a standard king and it‚Äôs not huge but spacious enough for me. The bed comfy and shower great pressure. My location on the 18th floor was not noisy and the blackout curtains was nice touch. Rooftop bar has a wonderful view and tasty drinks! The location very convenient to attractions, shopping, river walk, etc. Again thank you Matthew (supervisor) and staff for a wonderful stay and being accommodating to my needs.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First time and will definitely stay again!!!!!
text: I stayed here as I travel to Chicago every easter and Labor Day weekends.i normally stay at Westin but decided to start building my HHonors points.Upon arrival i was checked in by Matthew Sheehan and what a ward wonderful welcome  to start.I kindly asked for an upgrade as an HHonors Amex card holder.I also did not want to face the tall building across the street (a certain tower named after a person i dont agree with ) anyway that was granted as well as the upgrade.i also want to congratulate the room service young lady that delivered our breakfasdt and returned with a lovely amenity few minutes later.I was so impressed!This property has a great roop top but i didnt get a chance to visit due my tight schedule over the weekend.i intend on staying there over the labor day weekend and looking forward to it.To manangement i noticed on Matthews card he is the front office supervisor,I truly hope you vale him and reward him for gaining a new loyal customer based on his approach upon arrival and during our stay!Matthew is a GEM so hold on to him as long as possible.With all my sincerety Darryl Mckinnon I stayed in Room 802 and loved it !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new place to stay in Chicago!
text: Perfect location, perfect views of the river, friendly staff, very clean rooms, rooftop bar with gorgeous views, huge TV (important to my husbandüòÄ). The rooms were very pretty and updated. No complains and we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Staff
text: I've stayed at the London House several times, and it is one of my favorite hotels in Chicago.  From the moment you arrive, the doormen, concierge, and front desk staff are extremely friendly.  My interactions were with Shayne and Trevor, and both times they were very attentive to my questions/needs and even took the time to make me laugh in the midst of a very busy work trip.  Convenient, clean, friendly and the view of the river is refreshing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: LondonHouse is an excellent choice on Chicago. Great location on Wacker right on the Chicago River. Numerous restaurants and points of interest within walking distance. Rooms are very modern and Vista rooms have exceptional views of the Chicago River. Comfortable beds. Large TVs with Chromecast so you can steam Netflix. Very nice rooftop bar. Staff is consistently friendly and helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great night out!
text: We were recently there to enjoy a great meal at the rooftop and drinks at Bridges. They had wonderful live entertainment and such a friendly staff. We didn‚Äôt stay overnight but just enjoyed a relaxing, stress-free evening. We will be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Hotel Poor communication Issues
text: London House Chicago Curio by Hilton,This hotel is in a great location,  Hop on Hop off bus stop directly opposite so getting around Chicago is quite easy..  The Hotel room (we had one that was directly over the main entrance and had views of the river and bridges (great views),  was clean and well laid out, also quite a good size.Check in process was fast and easy,  my only issue is the hotel doesn‚Äôt appear to respond to emails,  firstly advising the of updated details prior to visit,  being initially over charged, which was resolved once I spoke to the Front desk.  However the 2nd time at check out time the processing wasn‚Äôt so smooth,  the Front office staff member seemed unorganised .  I was over charged by the hotel for the Roof top bar account which they processed against my credit card when we had paid the account by cash (and have a receipt).  Efforts to contact the front office by email have failed to receive any reply.  Whilst the Hotel might be clean, neat and tidy don‚Äôt rely on emails in the hope they reply (they don‚Äôt).  In the end I have raised a disputed transaction with my bank.Would I recommend the hotel, Yes, but with a very big warning to ensure the way they process charges to your credit card,

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best place to stay in Chicago!
text: I initially had a few issues at LondonHouse Chicago (valet and front desk), but I have to commend the management of LondonHouse, as they were exemplary. They took very personal and exemplary care of every issue that I faced at the property. All managers and supervisors including Juan Leyva, Jalesa Shields, Kevin Stabile and Matthew Sheehan were great listeners and took time to address my issues and make me comfortable. They truly made every effort in their means to resolve every issue and to make sure I am satisfied and pleased with my stay. I would highly recommend LondonHouse and will be back there soon.  Being a frequent Hilton Diamond member traveler, I was truly very impressed by the management team. In my opinion management at LondonHouse is the best and it doesn‚Äôt get any better. Juan personally stayed in touch with me even after my check out and addressed all the concerning issues. We were given complimentary room upgrade with great views, which was a nice surprise. Breakfast was great (Avacado toast was my favorite). Ocean Prime is a great place to dine if you don‚Äôt want to leave the property. Great service at Ocean Prime. Ask for Cataline. She was the best server (among many restaurants that we dined at) on this trip to Chicago. Rooftop is a must place to hang out in the evening hours. I would definitely go back to LondonHouse Chicago and would love to spend a few days relaxing there again. Thank you for taking exemplary personal care of my concerns. It‚Äôs truly appreciated!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: High Tea Overlooking the Chicago Waterfront
text: I didn't stay at the hotel, but I enjoyed afternoon tea and drinks on the rooftop at LondonHouse. High Tea was a highlight of our weekend vacation in Chicago! The food was delicious and it was so beautifully put together. Each tea sandwich and dessert had such attention to detail from the egg salad stuffed cannoli wrapped in chives with caviar to the tiny custard dessert bunnies in celebration of Easter. And enjoying this amazing food, champagne, and hot tea in wonderful location just made the experience all the more unforgettable. High tea is served in their second floor lobby alongside the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the waterfront on a gorgeously sunny Chicago spring day! And the rooftop!! What a view and what a fun and relaxing ambiance. Definitely a must see when in Chicago!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fun in the city
text: I came in from the burbs for a girls night out and decided to spend the night rather then getting on a late night train. I checked into the London House and was pleasantly surprised by the charm, friendly and courteous service. The manager, Matthew greeted me with a smile and after chatting for a few minutes he had me registered with a room upgrade and a beautiful view. The room was warm, cozy with a modern and elegant feel. I live in the Chicago area but if I decide to stay downtown again I would definitely stay at the London House again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect weekend!
text: My favorite hotel in Chicago. A perfect weekend! The room was clean and the rooftop bar had a wonderful view. It was a great stay for my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday. Would recommend staying here. The location is right on the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago London House Trevor Matthew and Shannon
text: Well I really can‚Äôt say enough, we had 2 rooms 1027 and 1709 and they were perfect! The views from these rooms both day and night were just super, housekeeping on time and friendly I don‚Äôt know about other rooms but the bathrooms are huge walk in shower rain forest shower heads, if you are looking for a bath tub to soak you maybe out of luck so your gonna have to check with the hotel but I think it is a personal preference my family did not miss it. The elevators are fun no buttons you hit the floor you want and then stand in front of the elevator. There is no executive floor or lounge so if your looking for that walk across the river and pay a stupid fee at the Trump. There are a lot of places around the bakery at the bottom of the hotel is highly recommended! They have a great roof top bar hotel prices great for a picture and it is so popular sometimes there is a line to get up there but well worth it. The thing I like is when you get the good feeling and great first impression on entering a hotel, Trevor and Mathew on check in boy.....smart, enthusiastic, great knowledge of there hotel and there both funny and make you feel welcome right away. Let‚Äôs face it...working a front desk in a major hotel can be a pressure and demanding job these two handle them self‚Äôs like two pros from Dover. I listened to some people checking in for this review (boy can people be rude and demanding) these two employees with no shaking of heads or eyes rolling stood up to the plate and hit a home run! Lastly Shannon you are new to town and want to see stuff and eat well this is your gal..a great added addition to Trevor and Matthew she is that factor that you want in your Corner she knows the city like the back of her hand and can and will tell you the fastest way to get there.(don‚Äôt for the pic of Uncle Tom). Well there you have it with the location in between the Hancock Tower and the Chicago Art Institute London House is the place to stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: This hotel is beautiful and close to everything! It's super clean, quiet and safe. Nespresso machine and tea available in the room. The bath supplies are nice and everything is there. I flew with a carry on and didn't pack many toiletries such as soap shampoo etc... All rooms face Trump tower with the name in your face but it's a nice building and we used it as a mark to find out hotel.The hotel is in the loop right along the river. there is a place downstairs to get a quick breakfast to go. Catch the architectural boat tour with Shoreline across the street. 10 minute walk to Navy Pier, 20 mins to Cindy's rooftop and bean, 30 minutes to planetarium. The rooftop terrace has a great view! The bar on the top floor has nice drinks and we caught a dance party one night with a DJ. Ken at the front desk was super helpful and really nice. I would stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Unforgettable!
text: We booked three nights at the hotel as part of an eleven day visit to the US. It was our first time in Chicago.We checked in on line the day before - the earliest time to check in was 4pm. We arrived at the hotel at around 2pm, catching the Loop from Midway Airport and just a short walk. We were fine leaving our luggage and going for a short walk although we were very jetlagged. The receptionist said they would send us a message once the room was ready.At 4pm on the dot and having received nothing we went back to the hotel, we were told the room still wasn't ready but we were offered a drink in the bar. Waiting for a room is always annoying especially after long flights and with a five hour time difference, but there was nothing they could do so we chose to wait around at reception and finally at 4:30 we got the keys.Room 1410'was amazing, we had a wonderful view over the river - in fact all along the river! It wasn't a huge room, there wasn't a massive amount of storage space and it is the first time we have had drawers under the bed in a hotel! The safe was low down and drawer style so very comfortable to use. There was a large TV with all the usual channels  and the internet was fast. The room was beautifully decorated with a huge floor to ceiling window framing the glorious view. The bathroom was compact but had everything and the toiletries were nice. There were plenty of towels and two robes. There was a Nespresso coffee maker, with 3 capsules, one sachet of sugar and one creamer - not exactly generous for 2 guests! With some clever thinking and lots of patience we managed to make tea for us both- with our own bags.We had dinner the first night in the restaurant at street level. The burgers were very good, the service pleasant, and there was a nice cosy atmosphere. Later we  had a glass of wine  in the bar by reception, staring out at the view!We had breakfast two mornings at the restaurant, everything we tried was very good and the coffee nice. There was always a nice buzz and being at street level is pleasant. On the third morning we had breakfast at the pastry shop which can be accessed from the hotel. We had delicious cinammon rolls and coffee.We slept very well every night at the hotel, a comfy bed, just the right temperature. It was also very quiet, no noise from outside or neighbours. The staff was very pleasant, receptionists, porters, cleaners, restaurant staff.... but what made us really fall in love with this hotel was the view and its position. It is just a short walk from the nearest Loop station, right next to Michigan Avenue and the river. There are shops and restaurants metres away and you can get the boat just across the river to do the architecture tour. If we visit Chicago we would not consider staying anywhere else!.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excelente bartender
text: I certainly recommend Victor bartender, he‚Äôs works in the night! He‚Äôs very attentive, kind and respectful! I‚Äôm grateful for amazing night he gave us. Thank you! Beautiful place for spend a time with friends and family.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel
text: Shannon, in guest services was terrific. Check in was easy and the staff was very friendly.  The LH rooftop was very nice and the atmosphere was pleasant. The view from our room was great. I would stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great customer service
text: My interaction with Abel at check-in was extremely pleasant. When checking in for a business trip, you want it to be fast and painless. Thanks for the upgrade on wifi and locking me into the city view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse for business
text: The LondonHouse was lovely. I stayed there with a group for two nights for a conference. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and staff was friendly. The location was good! There is no pool - so know that if you are traveling for leisure or with children.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay and Convenient Location
text: My wife and I stayed for a weekend trip and the stay was great! The room was modern, clean, and comfortable. The location is convenient area to either walk to restaurants/bars, get an Uber, or walk to the nearby L station which can get you anywhere in the city. The rooftop bar has an amazing view and is a must when it comes to taking your picture to remember your stay and the lobby bar had live entertainment both evenings of our stay. The entire time, the friendly staff (including Caitlin, Keith and Trevor) were available at anytime to ensure a great stay (you can even text them with a quick question)!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely Wonderful!
text: We have made many "long weekend" trips to Chicago but this was our first time to stay at the LondonHouse. We had 3 rooms and a total of 9 in our party and it was the perfect place for us. It was fantastic in every way and will be our new home away from home whenever we come to Chicago. The property itself is beautiful with very comfortable rooms and every amenity that you could hope for - multiple dining options, fitness, rooftop lounge and more. It's also is the perfect location in close walking proximity to Michigan Ave, the theaters, Millennium Park and many other local attractions. Last but not least, the staff was superb! They checked on us multiple times and took care of every need while we were there - truly 5 star service! I could not give a higher recommendation for the LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Friendly service, extraordinary Suite, and amazing top roof view.
text: The hotel faces the river and is very close to the magnificent mile.  The check in service was very swift and the staff is super friendly.  The elevators uses modern technology to direct to the fastest slot.  The king suite room design and interior is extraordinarily beautiful and the condition is top notch.  Noise is non existent even though the room is beside the elevators.The roof top view is superbly and is a must go location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LOVE this Hotel!
text: Our room was perfect!  They upgraded us to a corner room with a view of the river, which we appreciated so much.  The staff at the front desk were so friendly and we enjoyed their professionalism!  What a beautiful hotel with great staff!  This is our new favorite hotel in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent place to stay in Chicago
text: I had not stayed at the LondonHouse Chicago, but definitely would return.  The room was very nice, very clean, with everything needed.  The service was consistently good.  The bar on the second floor was great and the food there very good.  Location also cannot be beat (corner of Michigan Avenue and Wacker Drive - right at the bridge).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Except for the elevators....
text: Wonderful location in Chicago. Right on the river and near many attractions. Good restaurant choices on site and a rooftop view-bar. Old building charm with great renovation to provide all amenities in furnishings and fixtures.Beds a bit hard for my taste. Clean. During my trip the elevators ran very slowly and a lot of time was spent waiting for them,,,either up or down.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxurious yes, still seems pricey.
text: I was visiting Chicago for work and for whatever reason there were NO hotels downtown for less than $350, so yes, while the LondonHouse was not inexpensive, I‚Äôm not taking off points. The Great: 1. Service!! They take caring for customers very seriously and all the staff was great. 2. Location - awesome restaurants inside of a 10 minute walk + 2 restaurants on site and access to Corner Bakery without having to go outside. 3. The bathrooms - nicely appointed and high quality complimentary toiletries, including a loofah!4. The Fitness Center - refrigerated towels (see pics) and high quality equipment. 5. Nice views from the room - See PicsCould be better:1. Espresso only machine in the room - not a fan. 2. Not enough light. While the lights had some great features, it wasn‚Äôt bright enough in the room. Some overhead or a big floor lamp in the corner would have been nice. All in all, a good stay. I‚Äôd love to go back but may be out of my price range next time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Phenomenal Service - We‚Äôll Definitely Book Again!
text: So grateful for the fantastic service and graciousness of Trevor at the Front Desk of LondonHouse who not only helped to check us in early but also upgraded our suite! Although a multi-tiered upgrade was not supported by my Hilton Honors status, Trevor made an exception as we were celebrating a special family event. I love the magic of great service - it makes you smile wide and regain faith that sometimes people do ALL they can to make your day better. Huge thanks go to Trevor and the team at LondonHouse. Service like this buys loyalty and I will definitely be returning!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rating & waiting
text: Usually a really good hotel but the elevators were a big problem. Seemed like only 2 of 6 were working. Long wait (>5 min) for elevator. One member of our group walked down 7 stories because of the elevators. My room was next to the elevators. Very noisy and kept me awake until after midnight. Hopefully, other hotels had working elevators.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Central!
text: This hotel has everything. Right in the middle of The Loop. Close to really nice bars and restaurants. Close to the marina and the Bears Stadium. The rooms are a great size. The staff are very nice and helpful. Recommend highly!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Friendly and attentive
text: I went to the LondonHouse for an evening on the rooftop bar. As I was walking into the building, I was greeted by the doorman so kindly - thank you! This often doesn't happen in Chicago. He answered my questions and directed me perfectly to what I needed. Up on the lobby level, the agents were busy interacting with guests checking in - I was just passing to go to the restroom. Everyone seemed happy and no one was unattended.The bar on the roof was pleasant, staff was friendly an prices were what we expected. I'll go back once the patio is fully open to enjoy Chicago summer!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing view and great location!
text: All the good reviews are true! The location and view of the hotel are awesome! I had a very nice experience during my entire stay except  for a bitter experience when I checked out. I requested for a late checkout and being a Hilton Honors member, the app prompted me that i was already checked out so I went down to surrender my keys and to request for printed receipt, waited for more than 20 mins in line, only to find out that I was charged an additional $50 because I surrendered my keys past 1pm (bec I had to wait in line duh?) Anyways, I didn't fight for it but the entire time while I was talking to him, he was not friendly at all, to top it off, he said that he could nt give me a printed receipt because their printer wasn't working. This was when I saw him print my receipt and put a note of late charge on it.So tips, if you're an HHonors member, just check out from your app, and don't bother checking out in the reception to avoid having the same experience as I did. Sadly, that's the last thing I remembered during my entire stay. It could have been totally awesome if not for the checkout experience. So the less one star is for that guy in the reception/check out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really good and really bad.
text: My room was decent with a decent view and a very comfortable bed I got the one bedroom corner suite on the 11th floor. The noise level through the night from the street is pretty bad however in places like Chicago and New York you expect that so bring earplugs .   They seem to pump in this sent to the lobby in the room that smells like a really bad men‚Äôs cologne and to me it was nauseating.    Also bring your own shower gel  it‚Äôs the same.  The breakfast restaurant downstairs has pretty limited options there‚Äôs good food but not much of it on the menu and not much in the way of gluten free selections.  The decor and was a bit dark and dreary.   I felt like I was in a nightclub most of the time.   The staff was amazing in the hotel very accommodating and very friendly.   The hotel itself I thought was in a very good location, it was very clean and had a great view from the rooftop bar .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Trevor
text: Good stay highlighted by Trevor at the front desk who provided us outstanding service with our reservation and early check in.  Hotel is in a great location with very nice views down the Chicago River.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Getaway
text: First time staying at London House. My husband and I enjoyed the stay. Great location for out of towners who are visitng downtown area. Hotel is decorated modern style. Our room was spacious , clean, overlooking the river. Our bed was comfy, our room and hotel clean. Breakfast on site - restaurant on site -  Cons : Valet was horrible - when we pulled up to the hotel there was construction in front - valet was unable to see or accomadate us upon arrival. Hotel does not offer free parking - parking is $72 per day! When checking out it took the valet 45 min to bring our vehicle.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect stay
text: LondonHouse never disappoints, one of my favorite hotels in the city!  Great customer service!  We have stayed here in multiple trips and always look forward to it.  Rooms are fantastic, location is great.  Looking forward to another stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mark from Hong Kong
text: Visiting from Hong Kong,  London House is well located, and the hotel has beautiful old architecture. Booked the hotel with my wife for our 34th anniversary.  I was a bit disappointed as a Hilton Diamond member,  and a Hilton Grand Vacation owner, that even though I let the hotel know in advance, I didn't get a room upgrade, or even an acknowledge. When I stay at the Hilton Hongqiao,  Shanghai, they always send a bottle of wine, fruit, and small gifts when I arrive. I guess that is the difference in the Hilton hotel product in China versus the USA!The LondonHouse provides a clean room, nice amenities. Make sure you ask for a river view room for a lovely view.Sincerely, Mark

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cool Hotel
text: Very cool "smart" hotel in a great-for-walking location. They have a rooftop bar which would be a great place to hang out if the weather was a little warmer - kinda cold in March. Valet parking was on the expensive side at $72/night. Overall enjoyed our stay and would come back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location for a Chicago visit!
text: In town from the suburbs for work meetings.  This location is great for all out of towners that want to be in a spot to be able to walk to or taxi, Uber to anything in short order.  Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business Travel
text: Exceptional property for Chicago based business travel. The location is perfect and the accommodations are fantastic. Recommend relaxing in the lobby bar and if you're lucky you will have an opportunity to be served by Michelle.  Nothing but great things to say about her hospitality and conversation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent class of staff!
text: Been to this hotel for the 2nd time and still the same amazing experience. Great professional service from the staff and the atmosphere is always pleasure, especially after a long week of work, this hotel is like a reward for the weekends. Special thanks to Ken and Able for the outstanding service at the front desk. Definitely the only place I will stay when I come to Chicago City.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My Home away from Home with the Best Staff and Beautiful Accommodations!
text: My first visit to the LondonHouse Chicago was February 2018. I was greeted by the Valet team and Bellman, Donnie. He took my bags up to the Lobby and it was amazing.  I was greeted by a very friendly front desk staff member and his name was Abel. I was booked in a One Bedroom Ciry View hotel room and it was so nice. The room furnishings are very modern but welcoming. The bathroom was spacious with luxurious toiletries. They also have service on the tv that you can launch Netflix which was nice to binge watch your favorite shows on a snowy day.I went down to Bridges Lobby Bar where I met a very attentive Bartender, Michele D.She made me the best French 75, that I enjoyed often the week I was there. She was always helpful in suggesting local spots for anything you want to do while in town. The decor is so classy, with an even more amazing view especially when the snow is coming down. It is a great place for a Business Metting, a Romantic Place for a weekend getaway and a great place to stop in even when you're not staying at the hotel. They have a limited menu for someone that may be picky like myself but the few things I ate, were very good. They had music which was very nice for the guests. They have a Rooftop Bar which was trendy and they have events in the Winter as well. They have a DJ on the weekends which was more of a nightclub environment if Horne into that kind of entertainment. I stayed for the week for work and had a flight cancellation my last day. They were very helpful to let me stay in my same room since it was last minute change. I got a chance to meet so many of the staff and that is why I have stayed at LH five more times this last six months. On my most recent trip in March 2019, I got to see some of my favorite staff members, Michelle and Abel and met a new Front Desk Staff Member, Trevor. The hotel is my favorite because it is a Boutique style with amazing rooms and the staff are SUPERB! I always look forward to my next trip to LH! Thank you!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: This place has 2 of my favorite bars in town
text: I am semi-local (in the burbs), but I keep coming back to the London House to visit the bars on the 2nd and 21st floors, each of which serves up what I think is the best Old-Fashioned in town. The 21st floor offers access to the roof and a gorgeous view of the city, and the 2nd floor has 2 of my favorite bartenders, Michelle and Dijana. I always enjoy visiting them!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Stay In the Windy City
text: I stayed in a double for 4 nights with a friend over the 2019 St. Patrick's Day weekend (Wed thru Sun) and it was one of my favorite hotel experiences.  The room (1916 - 19th floor) had a good layout and ample space for 2 people and our luggage.  It had everything we needed: clean, ample charging ports, Nespresso machine, toiletries, and comfy robes. Double beds were very comfortable! Best of all the floor to celling window with awesome views of the river! The hotel was close to everything including CVS, restaurants and easy walking distance to the Magnificent Mile. After a day of sightseeing it was nice to have a couple hotel restaurants to chose from.  We did small plates on the 2nd level and it was perfect.  The cupola at the top was lovely with views of the city. The hotel staff were fabulous.  Everyone from maid service to bellman to reception desk to concierge were warm & friendly and helpful.  Special thanks for Ken at reception for room assignment and helpful tips on eating places and Anthony Gates on Concierge for helping us get last minute tickets at Second City. Highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if back in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love this hotel!
text: The rooms are very nicely done, with more modern decor - very nice views too! I absolutely love the bathroom and want to model the ones in my home after these.  The beds are very comfortable, and the lobby area has nice places to sit and work or just people watch.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The perfect location
text: Great service and rooms.  great view.  Rooftop bar is pretty cool.  Hotel is right along the Chicago river and steps away from Michigan Avenue.  Many restaurants and bars within walking distance, other just a short ride away.  Would stay again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great weekend trip
text: We came to Chicago for our anniversary. London House was in a perfect location for everything we wanted to do. Experienced great customer service. Clean, trendy, and spacious rooms. We had a great time!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved the Londonhouse
text: My husband and I came for a quick trip and I selected the Londonhouse. It was our first time and it didn't disappoint. The room was great in terms of size and decor. Very trendy, but in a tasteful asthetic. My husband really enjoyed the restaurant on the top floor. We didn't go to the rooftop bar because of the cold weather, but I can imagine that is nice. We also liked being able to get drinks in the lobby bar. Very chill area that has a cool look and bartender was great. The only thing is the line of people waiting for valet, uber, or cabs at the entrance. It was totally congested due to the size of the waiting area which is a floor lower than the lobby. People were trying to get in and get out through the same door--while valet tried to bring in luggage through a mass of people. Definitely was a little chaotic but not horrible. The valet team worked steadily to accommodate people. Front desk was courteous and pleasant. Only draw back is that they didn't add my points for not using the credit. I had to call Hilton Honors to fix that. The londonhouse isn't far from main attractions or shopping, although it's not exactly close to them either. Some walking involved to get to stores, etc. Great for a nice day in chicago--but in winter, you will probably catch a ride. Overall, this is definitely one of our top Chicago hotel visits. We highly recommend and we will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wish my stay was longer!
text: I was in & out for business, but thoroughly enjoyed my stay! The room was luxurious, staff was super helpful & we really enjoyed the sights from the rooftop! I'll definitely choose LondonHouse the next time I'm back in the area.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great priced Hilton hotel on north side of the loop
text: I was in Chicago for a work trip, I just needed a hotel for one night and found Londonhouse a member of the Hilton Honors program for a great price.  Room was spacious, had a great night's sleep.  Really can't complain, if you're looking for a fairly priced hotel on the north of the loop, this is a great place to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great, quick stay at a centrally-located property
text: A list minute visit to Chicago to have dinner with friends resulted in me booking a stay at the LondonHouse so I didn‚Äôt have to drive home overnight. This property is very popular, so I wasn‚Äôt sure there‚Äôd be a decent selection of rooms available, but I was pleasantly surprised. I booked a standard room and at arrival, they let me know the room I had selected in the e-check in wasn‚Äôt available yet but they could put me in a nicer room. I loved the layout of the room they gave me... it had a bit of a hallway that then circled back around for the room itself, which helped keep any sound from the hallway to a minimum. It was actually very quiet in the hotel which was nice. The view from the room overlooked Michigan Avenue and the river‚Äîquite nice.The bedding is always so comfortable and the room was clean and well apportioned. It‚Äôs a very modern hotel in a very classic building which is a hallmark of the Curio Collection from Hilton. WiFi worked well but I couldn‚Äôt get my premium WiFi to process since the system said my information didn‚Äôt match hotel records. I didn‚Äôt need to do any significant work on WiFi, so the standard service was sufficient. Overall, a great stay and you can‚Äôt beat the location of the hotel on Wacker Drive!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Timeless yet modern
text: My boyfriend and I both work constantly, so the one weekend we had off together we decided to head into the city. I had a few hotel options in mind but landed on the LondonHouse as everything advertised about it online seemed pristine. From the outside it just looks like another regal building which keeps the inside feel exactly like a little slice of heaven. Everything marble and grandeur, very royal and timeless with a modernistic touch accompanied by the royal blue and sage green furniture pieces in the lounge/concierge area. Upon check in we had no issues, especially after the hotel staff helped us make the best of our trip. I purchased a room for a super affordable price but it turns out it was a handicapped room with no view. The concierge politely offered us an upgrade for only $50 more, extremely reasonable for what we got. We went up to our room and I was just amazed. We were in a corner room at the very end of our floor. When we walked in the room we saw the long hallway and thought no way this is the room we got for such an affordable price! The room came with a spacious sitting area and workspace. The king size bed was hidden behind the desk wall which had a large flat screen on the other side of it. Let's talk about the bed; amazing. There was so much space, fluffy pillows and soft linens, we thought we were sleeping on a cloud. The bathroom was spacious and came with eco-friendly fixtures. We had a surplus of towels which was convenient. They stocked us with fine toiletries from Malin + Goetz (a very reputable high end line). The closet was spacious with a safe, ironing board, and two complimentary robes. The best part, we had so many windows with a perfect view of the river.We were just blocks away from mag mile and minutes away from plenty of amazing restaurants; not that we needed to even leave as there is an amazing restaurant/bar in the hotel as well as an attached corner bakery. It was extremely easy to get an uber/taxi in the area and we were able to get to all the places we wanted to go. Even so, we spent all night in the room, it was perfect.Our check out process was smooth and they even held our bags for us while we went to brunch. Overall an amazing experience and we will be staying again. This hotel is highly recommended by myself and many others!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Tea at LondonHouse
text: We have had tea at the Drake, Peninsula and other fine Chicago Hotels. The tea at LondonHouse was fantastic and best in Chicago. Great presentation and delicious food. Vinny was the bartender and server when we were there and his service was exceptional. Definitely recommend LondonHouse tea.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Last minute booking for a birthday weekend in Chicago
text: Due to a snafu with my reservation at another hotel I was forced to make other arrangements. I used my hoteltonight app and was able to find this hotel for a great price. Upon arrival I was amazed, the place was beautiful and the view from my room couldn't have been better (room 610). The room is modern and the bathroom has a walk in shower and plenty of counter space.I would have extended my stay for another night but my Saturday reservation was non-refundable. Needless to say our hotel on Saturday was a disappointment after staying at Londonhouse. We are already planning our return trip to celebrate my husbands birthday. Thank you Londonhouse for making my birthday unforgettable!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding stay
text: I came into town to spend time with my daughter that lives in the city. She recommended the hotel and I loved it. The staff was very helpful even when I arrived after 1am in the morning. Concierge went out of his way to ensure that my questions were answers about one of the amenities. Finally, the fitness room was the best of all the hotels I‚Äôve stayed. I will definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location, beautiful property!
text: We came to Chicago for St Pattys day to see the river dyed green. We reserved a vista room with floor to ceiling windows, perfect view of the river, it was excellent! Large room, comfy bed, cozy robes, helpful staff, several dining options onsite, perfect location to sites, the L and restaurants and bars. Loved it and will definitely be bacl!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel with a great location
text: The hotel is very nice. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was clean and had an excellent view of the city, even from the 8th floor. The rooftop provides and amazing view of the city as well. The location was great for walking to pretty much anywhere. We walked to Navy Pier and Millennium Park and it was a very quick walk.Only drawback was one instance where one of the staff came to our door to check on us and room. He knocked and as I was waking to open the door he entered and explained he was from guest services to do a check and see if we needed anything. I‚Äôm not bothered by the check, more that he came in rather quickly after knocking. It could have lead to a rather awkward situation if I was in the shower or in bed.Definitely a great place to stay for the views and location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sleek Rooms with a Great Location
text: Spent the night here with some friends when we were in town for our annual "Christmas in Chicago" weekend.  Hotel has a great location, as practically everything is within walking distance, and the views from the rooms are nice. The rooms have a modern feel to them, despite being in a historic building.  Lobby bar has some nice views of the river, and for some really nice views of the area, head to the restaurant / bar near the top of the building. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Well definitely consider staying here next year!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Warm & Welcoming Staff
text: I was enjoying my last evening in Chicago after a busy week, and decided to stop in LondonHouse, as a few friends of mine have recommended this hotel as a great spot.  Upon entering the lobby I was immediately greeted with a warm and friendly smile from the gentleman at the front desk; Trevor.  He was so approachable that I went up to ask him what the hours of the lobby bar were before proceeding to buy a drink.  It ended up being a very brief, yet genuine conversation that greatly impacted my experience. When I went to buy a drink, I was greeted by a bartender named D, who was extraordinarily pleasant herself.  I was very appreciative of her sincere desire to strike up a conversation rather than simply serve me my drink and hand me my check.  It makes all the difference when the employees you interact with leave you with such a positive feeling.  Trevor and D help to create a great atmosphere at this hotel, and next time I am in town I will definitely consider staying at LondonHouse. What great representations of this hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse is my favourite place to stay in Chicago
text: I visit Chicago very frequently for work and most of the time, I stay at LondonHouse.  The hotel is elegant and in a great location.  The rooftop bar and rooms with views facing the river are excellent.  However, I am writing this review mostly because I think Michelle is one of the nicest people who works at LondonHouse.  When I visit the lobby bar, she always greets me with genuine friendliness and remembers what I prefer on the menu (Elouan Pinot Noir)! :-)  Thanks Michelle for always making my work trips better every time I stay at LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We will return!
text: This hotel is top notch!  We had a city/river view room on the 17th floor which allowed us to see the St Patrick's Day green river dye.  The lights at night were fantastic! The elevators were pretty cool once we were schooled on how they work (certain cars go to certain floors)  The staff was great!  The room was clean!  The bar on 21st was just OK..they were out of several  drinks.  The terrace level bar was not open on 22nd because "they are not allowed to run the heaters all the time" which was kind of a bummer.  But all in all this place was awesome and we will return when Chicago is warmer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: CEO Roundtable-Chicago monthly dinner mtg., March 12, 2019.
text: Excellent arrangements handled by Anthony Gates, Concierge staff.  Great food and service, plus spectacular views from their rooftop of the North Loop / Chicago River and surrounding skyline.  Very convenient to the city business district and to "the magnificent mile" = Michigan Avenue = Wacker Drive to Oak Street.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolute MUST! Best location, best hospitality, best staff, best overall in every area! This is home away from home!
text: We were there for the St. Patrick's Day weekend and it could not have been more perfect! The hotel staff from the time of check-in was very helpful, generous of time, and made any accommodation that we needed. Rooms (we had two) were comfortable, beds and linens were of great quality, plush towels, robes, spa toiletries, refrigerator, room service - all perfect and very accommodating! We could watch the dyeing of the river from our room or the rooftop bar area. The river boat tours are right across the bridge, a short walk from the front door. We didn't have enough time this trip, but were often told the architecture boat tour is a must. We did do the on-off bus tour (right around the corner) and that was great and worth the $45/person. We were leery of Chicago and had safety concerns - this hotel put our mind at rest, it was much safer feeling than NYC or even some other cities we visit. We will make this our go-to instead of NYC, there is just as much to see and do without the smell, panhandlers, homeless, garbage and filth that is everywhere in NYC. It is a very clean and very safe city to visit. We will be back to LondonHouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location Excellent Service
text: Our office is located very close to the LondonHouse so we use the property often. Clients and out of the town employees love the hotel and all the amenities. We often work with Ante on small room blocks.  Working with Ante is simply wonderful. Ante makes us feel like valued customers and is so responsive.  Ante is the reason we keep coming back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent All The Way
text: With out a doubt the best place I‚Äôve ever stayed. Everyone there is beyond nice and helpful. 2 years in a row and top notch both times.  A SPECIAL SHOUTOUT TO: Michelle!  The most engaging, hospitable, positive person and bartender I‚Äôve met. Vinny is also a fantastic bartender and always going above and beyond. And last but not least, Mark and ‚ÄòGrammy‚Äô the best with the concierge team.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A good attempt at true luxury accommodations.
text: It‚Äôs regrettable to write a non 4-5 star review for this lovely hotel, but let‚Äôs start with what they got right. Excellent smart elevators to help mitigate traffic on a multiuse revamp of a gorgeous historical building. Room size adequate but lacking in proper business space to get real work accomplished. Lighting is great for sexy time but no bueno for working. The bedding was A+ as was the mattress. Great closet space. Fabulous views of the river and the fabulous Trump Hotel & Tower (that‚Äôs a five star hotel!), friendly staff . What they got wrong: From check in, the staff was friendly but in a autopilot sort of way. It was clear I was exhausted and tired from traveling, there was literally a full service bar right next to check in and never once was I offered water, coffee, nothing that is basic from a 4-5 star hotel. I even said I was so thirsty when asked how I was that day. The guest to my right checking in offered me one of their cokes to which I looked at the staff member checking in like...would you like to offer your own version of hospitality? ...nothing! Lol In fact he told them how nice they were to offer and we all giggled at his response. He didn‚Äôt get it. Then this was odd he asked like most hotels to get a cell number for me so they can have contact info on file, but then the whole dang hotel was texting me asking me how I was doing. It was a bit annoying and felt like an odd invasion of my privacy, but I ended up having fun with it. They should be more clear that the crew plans to text you throughout your stay. Going on the the accommodations. No one offered to take my things to my room, ok fine but that‚Äôs def not 4 star. Next the bathroom, if you‚Äôre going to have a sexy bathroom with frosted walls you must separate the commode in its own private room with a door. Nothing sexy about having guest over and hearing and seeing them do their business. Lighting was confusing to figure out, it‚Äôs like early 2000‚Äôs high tech, dimmers everywhere no master control for room as a whole like at the Trump . No pool, no spa. Yes, having spa services like massage people on call with a couple of empty rooms is not a spa! Fitness center was an after thought, not good. My room wasn‚Äôt completely ready I had to snag glass and coffee supplies off the maid service cart. The worst was the bar, poor service very slow, rude cocktail hostesses and bartender with watered down drinks. Now I visited in winter Ave their outdoor roofbar is what they are known for so maybe this was the B team holding up the winter fort. But it was my only experience and it was expensive and bad. The food wasn‚Äôt horrible but not great and presentation was very bleak. This hotel is nice for a quick weekend trip in Summer Fall when you plan to be outside more than inside but If are here in winter, you want a great gym/pool/spa and onsite fab dining because it‚Äôs sucks going out in Chicago in the winter. So that being said visit this place in Summer for fun, not for business, friendly enough, staff great views, bedding and visuals, but you‚Äôll want to go out to eat, drink, and be entertained. A decent 3 Star place.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We love this hotel!
text: Our 2nd time staying here and we'll return soon! The staff at front desk were very welcoming and our room was super clean. Breakfast in the restaurant tasted fresh and the wait staff was nice and cheerful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thanks
text: Great attention to detail. Andrew at Front Desk was the best !!! Excellent rooms fully appointed. Great city views. Roof top area really nice to view the city skyline and its skyscrapers. Restaurant next store was very nice and always busy. Pub like place.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location
text: This is a very nice property and located in the heart of the loop. It is easy walking distance to numerous restaurants and attractions.  We walked about 15 minutes to the Navy Pier in addition to the Water Tower shopping mall.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: St. Pats weekend
text: Went to watch the river being  dyed green and this place has no equal!  Had to pay extra 50$/night  for an upgrade to Vista room even tho I signed up to upgrade for only 30$ online but somehow, communication was lost (wish I brought the printed paper) but nevertheless, this location has the best view of Chicago.  The staff is equally the best especially Ken and Trevor who always checked on us about how our stay was.  Rooms are modern and clean, a nice contrast to the beautiful facade of the building.  So many restaurants and shopping just within walking distance.  Overall, contemplating on another excuse to stay here again even though we just live 45 minutes away from the city, Ha!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: I was in town the first weekend of March and stumbled onto this rooftop bar. When I got up there it seemed like there was an event going on. I asked the bartender( I believe his name was Adam) he said it was a sponsored event but I was more than welcome to stay and enjoy the festivities. Definitely stay for the view. It was chilly that day and Adam was friendly enough to recommend some warm cocktails. I honestly didn‚Äôt even know these existed. Overall great experience! Ask for Adam super friendly!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse is running a clinic
text: LondonHouse is running a clinic on how to turn a first time visitor into one who will return again and again.  The location just off Michigan Avenue and along the river can't be beat.  We were told that this hotel is a perfect location for St. Patrick's Day since the parade goes right past the hotel and then of course a prime view of the green river.The lobby was located on the second floor.  The person who checked us in was full of personality and aimed to please.  He noticed that we were Hilton members and upgraded us to a better room.  He smiled and said that he thought we would enjoy the room.Oh my! The spacious 10th floor room was better than we anticipated!!  What a view with floor to ceiling windows!  We loved the temperature controlled refrigerator, always at 41 degrees.  The large bathroom had quality toiletries.If we had a concern about anything, we could text an employee and the message was immediately answered.  What personalized service!There was a Corner Bakery on the lower level of the hotel which was an added bonus.The doormen were charmers as well and looked after each person waiting for an uber or a cab.So, you are probably wondering that this dream hotel would be way out of your price range...NO!  It was very reasonably priced.  See you on my return to Chicago!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nicely restored older building
text: This hotel has a nice business vibe.  It is clean, comfortable and welcoming.  Its staff at the front desk is friendly and responsive.  The hotel is perfectly located.  The only drawback is that the lobby is oddly placed and it is a little hard to figure out where the restaurants are and when they are open.  Signage could solve that problem.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: An excellent hotel, please keep it up
text: This is the second time staying here. The first I thought it was a coincidence that all was great.  Second time and all is great. The whole experience is wonderful and I think I have found my new favorite Chicago hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bathroom is well equipped and well laid out. The roof top bar gets busy.  It‚Äôs going to as it‚Äôs a great feature of the hotel. I had a river view again.  Great for St Patrick‚Äôs day.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location
text: The hotel was a great place to headquarter our Chicago weekend. Right on Michigan Ave, nothing was more than a quick Uber away. We had a view down Michigan Avenue overlooking the river, the only tacky thing was Trumps hotel sign directly in view, no political direction here, just giant letters right in front of our faces-I don‚Äôt care what letters they are. Not much anybody can do about that. The room was smaller than I was expecting, maybe it‚Äôs a Chicago thing?? The only bad part was the bathroom had no vent fan and smells occur naturally when a bathroom is used...and we are in a smallish room...get the drift? Besides that the hotel was great and all the staff were great. Bed and pillows were super comfy, and we wanted to make it up to the rooftop bar but ended up spending too much time at other bars ;). The hotel helped make our Chicago weekend so much fun.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful find!
text: I stumbled upon this gem while looking for hotel for my business trip! To my surprise, the hotel is much nicer so those pictures that you've seen online don't do much justice! The check in process was sufficient and pleasant! My favorite part of my stay was my room, it was stylish, chic and beautiful! I had a view of the river from my bathroom window! The manager sent a text to check in on me to see how I like the room and if there were any problems that they could assist. That right there is exceptional customer service! It was a nice surprise! I also like the location of this hotel, it's right in the center of the downtown area so you're just a few minutes walk from everything you need! I had such a pleasant stay with LondonHouse and I will definitely return in the near future!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff
text: I very much like the Curio brand and this hotel is one if not the best.  I was informed that this hotel helped launch the brand.  It's a boutique hotel, but with the amenities of a larger hotel.  Great people too.  Trevor at the front desk offered to buy me a drink when I checked in - Thank you.  The bellmen and wait staff always greet me with a smile. The hotel has everything - spa, workout facility with peloton bikes, multiple dining options including a rooftop bar.  Complimentary breakfast for Diamond/Gold members.  Nespresso machines in the rooms.  Chromecast connections to the TV which was awesome - I could watch HBO on my terms.  I've stayed at many hotels in Chicago and found the "one".

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Birthday Trip
text: Stayed at the London House for my Birthday in March 2019. Had an excellent stay and Mathew who checked us in was very courteous and professional. Enjoyed our room and the Annenoties. Great rooftop view of the city and great view of our room. Will stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First Class
text: First class stay.  We stayed a few nights here on Thanksgiving weekend.  Our stay was excellent.  When we arrived our room wasn‚Äôt ready yet, so we checked our bags and wandered around the city, the hotel texted us when it was ready.  We had a great room overlooking the river.  The room had a separate living room area with a couch and tv, which made it great if one of us had problems sleeping we could get up and watch tv with the door closed so no waking the one still sleeping.  The room was very clean.  There were carolers walking around the lobby singing Christmas tunes.  The roof top bar was awesome with excellent views of the city.  Every staff member we encountered was friendly and professional.  I loved the soap and shampoo that was provided.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect stay!
text: I loved everything about London House. From the warm and welcoming staff to the spacious room, down to the small details a amenities. This was a mini stay-cation for the weekend and though I‚Äôve been to the rooftop of the London House dozens of times, I‚Äôve never been in a sleeping room or experienced the beautiful lobby with multiple seating areas and the pretty view of the Chicago River. This became, very quickly, one of my favorite hotels in Chicago and I can‚Äôt wait to return again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic service and hotel quality
text: There are many hilton options in Chicago. We were glad we picked London House and stayed here for 3 days. The service, room, and dining quality went above and beyond our expectations. As a diamond member, I highly recommend this hotel. They tried their best to attend to our needs. Knowing that we have special room request and a late flight, they made proper arrangements that made the trip much easier for us. I am happy that I have Hilton status and they value it. When booking, I was concerned about the size of the room, but it turnes out it wasn't as bad as the reviews said. The amenities provided such as room slippers, loofah, body lotion, and sparling water were such a treat to our stay. I also enjoyed my time at the hotel gym. Equipment was new and perfect for my weight-lifting routine.Also I liked the lobby cafe and Lank and Lake Kitchen. I had wines and tea when friends were visiting at the lobby cafe. The breakfast was served until 11:30 which I didn't feel rushed and enjoyed a late breakfast. The options were wide spread and healthy. My favorite was avocado and bread.Overall, it was a luxury and enjoyable stay. You will definitely enjoy the status benefits.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Centrally located with Great views
text: This hotel is centrally located in downtown Chicago right on the banks of the Chicago River in the River North area. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable with an inviting decor. We had a room that had an awesome view of the river. There's a rooftop bar great for chilling and linking up with friends while in the area. Close to shops and restaurants and walking distance from the Millennium Park.The staff was helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: best rooftop bar service and bartenders
text: Decor so on point, best surprise from an ex prompt pick while walking around the Mag Mile ... sat at the bar and Johnny took great care of us and had best recommends... view just icing on this delicious cake

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Guest
text: Shane Blidy we had a rough meeting at the check in but it was a very nice welcome because he is straight forward and honest and that‚Äôs what I love in people and he took care of my reservation and I was very happy with the room. I recommend going back and seeing Shane for your host at London house Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop bar...
text: stepped into the bar for predrinks before meeting some friends. the bartender Johnny on 21 was AMAZING very knowledgable on drinks and things to do in the area. We are staying in the hotel and will definitely return for the fantastic service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay... 5* all around
text: Great 4-night stay at LH in Chicago. Easy location especially if you‚Äôre a walker. Despite the freezing weather, I found it close to almost everything I wanted to visit. The ambiance is certainly at a higher level than the price paid. Great lobby bar scene and a convenient restaurant at the base of the hotel for stop-in breakfast (I did find the service a tad slow, but this restaurant is not affiliated with the hotel). Room: king bed, large space for the city, comfortable, plenty of room, corner location with neat views.Bed: comfortable, I wouldn‚Äôt say luxurious, but I had no issues with sleep quality. Bathroom: shower-only setup, large and nice. Heat/AC: room temp seemed to be easily controlled, no issues here. Amenities: I needed more hangars but probably just me, mini fridge discreetly hidden, great room cleaning service everyday, gym was small with only a couple free weighs (no machines), but plenty of treadmills/bikes/row machine for my early AM workouts. Would highly recommend LH for a 4.5-5 star stay at a 3-4 star price (probably dependent on season).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent in every way.
text: I usually don't spend this much for a hotel, but first trip ever to Chocago for myself and adult daughter and I wanted a nice river view and a good location. This was recommended to me by a friend. The view was beautiful, as was our room, as was the entire hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly as well. Could not have asked for a better experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Here We Go Again, Another GREAT Stay!!!
text: This is my 4th time staying at the LH and my position remains unchanged‚Äî-this is my go-to spot whenever I‚Äôm visiting Chicago for business.  #1 reason? The staff!!  From the doormen, to front desk, periodic texts from managers to see how you‚Äôre enjoying your stay, to housekeeping - this team knows how to make a stay convenient and comfortable!  Rooms clean & comfy as always, river view is classic (especially at night), and Nespresso machine is a must.  Fitness Center now has Peleton Cycles and always very clean.  Ideal location for those wanting MagMile.  I‚Äôm from Chicago and now live in TX (-23 wind chill one of the reasons I movedüòä) and LH just feels like home whenever I‚Äôm in town.  See you next time LH!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Hotel, Not Spectacular
text: We had a corner room.  Frankly, it is not worth the extra money.  We could see the river, but it was out the corner and was just a small view of it. Our primary view was the 2 buildings on either side of us.  The bed was very comfortable.  Bathroom was nice.  The rooftop bar was very nice.  We were outside until it closed, but it is enclosed with heat lamps.  Very comfortable.  This certainly is not The Peninsula, but it is very nice, and I love the fact that it is a historic building.  We would stay there again, but would not pay extra for a corner room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend getaway
text: First time we have stayed in a curio collection and we loved it. The hotel has managed to retrofit an office building with rooms and it really works well. There is no lobby on the ground floor as it is located in a very nice area on the first floor - which smells amazing. The bar and seating area was great and the layout worked perfectly with windows overlooking the street. The lifts are the type that you tell it where you are going and it tells you which lift to take - my one issue with this is that is does not really count the number of people getting in so sometimes it was a little crowded. Our room was very nice, though I think it used to be an elevator itself. The noise from the other elevators going up and down could be heard, not awful but just in the background. We had paid on points so assumed it would not be the best room! The mattress in the room was amazing - one of the best we have slept in at a hotel for ages. The tv was great, the view over the road to the trump hotel was good. The bathroom has a barn type door, not our favorite, but it worked well. We wished that there were more hooks in the bathroom for hanging towels and that towels could be reused - we had new towels everyday. Hooks by the door would have also been very useful in the winter weather. The best thing about this hotel was the service - it was amazing. We had an issue with a bedding change request and the manager downstairs solved the issue and got us a beverage - really , really great. Every employee we interacted with was amazing and friendly. Location wise it is great with access to various shopping and not too far from either train stop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful experience and GREAT concierge!
text: The hotel is beautiful and the restaurants have delicious food. But, it is the concierge Anthony that really made our trip. I forgot our concert tickets and StubHub would not let me print them. Anthony saved the day by insisting StubHub refund our money (which it did) then he found new tickets and helped purchase them. Our night at the concert was saved! And, he did it all with a smile. What wonderful customer service!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Staff! Excellent follow through.
text: Not only is the hotel beautiful, clean and updated, the staff is well informed and helpful.  Nicolette, went above and beyond in helping me after I checked out.  She helped me get a receipt that I had failed to get during my stay.  She didn't stop until I got the receipt in my hands.   She was extremely helpful and courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel with an excellent location
text: This hotel has one of the best location in Chicago, the room was very nice with a great view of the city. The room was clean and organized. The staff was also very nice. All reviews of this hotel are true and accurate. I would definitely come back and recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business trip
