It‚Äôs close enough to everything you‚Äôd want to visit yet feels like it‚Äôs hidden away.  It‚Äôs within walking distance to our favorite places: the theater district, shopping, Millennium Park, Magnolia Bakery and the Christkindlmarket in Daley Plaza. For the most part, we had a beautiful view.  The rooftop views are amazing as well.  There is no charge to go up to the rooftop bar like there can be at other hotels.  You can go up there just to check out the city views. We had a room with two double beds. The four individual reading lights are a nice touch.  There were lots of pillows and lots of towels, which was a nice change from our usual amenities.Our main reason for going to the London House was because of Trevor Strahan.  We met Trevor at another hotel years ago.  His personality and hospitality skills are outstanding!  When we found out he was going to be working at the London House, we switched our reservation from our usual hotel.  It‚Äôs nice to be the guest of someone who recognizes you.  That‚Äôs hard to come by in a city as big as Chicago full of so many hotels.  His smile is contagious.  His professionalism is unbeatable.  As long as Trevor‚Äôs there, we‚Äôll be staying at the London House again in the Spring and Winter of 2019.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Place in a Nice Location
text: Visited so that I could see the Christmas lights on Michigan, the Park, the Macy's windows and the outdoor German festival.  Short ride from train station.  Easy check in process.  Secured a nice room on the 20th floor overlooking the river.  AWESOME view from the rooftop.  Will return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Annual December getaway
text: Had great service from the staff during our stay. Thanks to Trevor Strahan for making our stay enjoyable along with the rest of the staff. Could can resist that smile. Trevor keep smiling. Trevor has remembered us from past years. So it's a pleasure looking for out him.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Swanky hotel not worth the price
text: Summary below but if you don‚Äôt have a car this is a great location hotel but not worth the price for us. We prefer bathroom doors that close, a fan option, water pressure, and a bit more space to move around. As for service: front desk was okay, housekeeping was super nice. Pros: Great location          Swanky          Rooftop barCons: Price            Small rooms           Frosted bathroom sliding door            Poor water pressure            Valet is $75 a night!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Annual high tea
text: My sister pick this hotel for the beautiful view over seeing river over wacker drive.  It was quite special they had singers dress up like old times to sing Christmas carols, we enjoyed that a lot! Service that day was okay, seemed like they were short staff, server was by herself running the whole area. Food was okay but very creative.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We love London House
text: What a great getaway! And Able at the front desk was very helpful.  We have a room with a view of the Chicago River and skyline. It is so beautiful to be in downtown Chicago. We come downtown every year, and this is one of the nicest hotels we've had. Merry Christmas from Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb views, fantastic service, holiday treat
text: Some of the best views in the city, right out your window. White glove service without the fuss. Shannon, Caitlin, and Pierre were so attentive to our needs.  And the LH tasting menu on the 21st floor was a surprising fantastic find!  Highly highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxury at a good price point
text: A luxury room on the Chicago River with upscale bars at the rooftop and lobby levels. The rooftop bar offers exceptional views up and down the river, and up Michigan Avenue. The staff was exceptional throughout. Rooms were well appointed with high end bedding and towels, large wall mounted flat screen TV.   Taxis are readily available outside the door. They offer valet as well.  The location is exceptional for dining, shopping, and sightseeing. I stayed on a weekend night and found the rate to be a great value. Check out is at noon which allows you to luxuriate just a little bit longer! üòÄ

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic hotel in all ways
text: The LondonHouse is a excellent place to stay for business or pleasure while in downtown Chicago.  Great location, a boutique luxury feel while being part of the Hilton family.  And mostly - terrific team takes care of everything starting with the group at checkin (especially Abel!)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great choice for wedding venue
text: My husband and I are so happy we went with LondonHouse for our wedding venue. We initially picked LondonHouse not only for its beautiful location, decor, and views, but also because of their director of weddings, Steve. At our initial meeting with Steve, his professionalism and attention to detail, combined with his extensive knowledge and experience, convinced us that LondonHouse was the way to go. Right we were! Throughout the planning process he was very responsive and patient. On our wedding weekend, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and they went out of their way to make us feel special. The food was absolutely delicious, and we heard from many of our guests that it was the best wedding they had attended. LondonHouse was a great decision and we would recommend it to everyone!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Architecturally beautiful, Snooty Staff
text: Recently stayed and checked into the LondonHouse on Nov. 29th. I usually tend to stay in hotels right off the Mag. Mile, further north, but I decided that the convenience of the Blue Line on this leisure trip to get to/from O'Hare, in addition to current Hhonors promotions, made it worth trying this Curio (I'd also never tried this relatively new brand of Hilton). Let me be completely honest. This is a beautifully-restored hotel. The photos from travellers speak for themselves. What lets it down is some, not all, of its staff members. I had chosen my room through the Hhonors App and opted for a digital key. You usually get a notification when this key is delivered to you. Since I didn't get any notification and took a wild guess that something was glitching, I proceeded to the front desk to retrieve some keycards. The greeting I got was snooty and frankly, not reflective of the kind of service this level of property should provide. I was being polite and waited to be called by one of the two gentlemen manning the desk that evening. My "good evening, how are you?", was met with a disinterested "good, last name?", no welcome, not even an attempt at small talk back to make a guest feel welcomed. They say non-verbal makes up for a lot... Couldn't even crack a smile. Upon giving that to him, I then received a reply that went along "oh, you checked-in already", to which I replied I had but hadn't received the digital key notification. He appeared puzzled, as if this had never happened before or I was making something up. I was handed over keys and asked if I needed anything else. I asked if my room choice was decent or at least had some kind of view (the hotel is greatly placed that almost all rooms should have a decent view) and I was told that "all the standard rooms were the same, they're all really nice rooms, but that for 50% off, I could upgrade". I declined and proceeded to my room. The view was good, but partly obstructed by the architectural features of the building, which rooms a few floors below probably do not have, but I guess that was too much for that front desk staff member to bother mentioning when I specifically asked that question. I only returned to the front desk and one of the original two staff members that was there during my check-in glanced over while the other gentleman I was dealing with was attempting to find directions with a clearly annoyed "oh why don't you just get a taxi/Uber look". Those two shouldn't be in the hospitality industry. Sharply dressed, good-looking people, but clearly, focused on style over substance. Neither could've cracked a smile if you had tried hard. HHonors water was never offered or delivered for status members. App check-out worked, but the folio/bill was never e-mailed to me as it should. Had to call again to get a copy. Linens were amazingly soft, and so was the bed (some may not like it). Good quality bath products. An odd heater in the bathroom ceiling that you could not turn on. Maintenance when contacted over the phone said it should start with the room's climate control but who wants to turn their room up to 25-26C/78-80F just so that the bathroom heating fan can start. Odd. On another note, room service was reasonably priced, but I never actually got a chance to try it. Location-wise, as mentioned before, it's very convenient to the airport by CTA Blue Line, and strategically placed right at the start of the Magnificent Mile, yet, it's less than 5-6 minutes on foot to Grant/Millenium Park and about 7-8 minutes to Chicago's very authentic (and busy!) Christmas market. Had it not been for the poor check-in experience and subsequent directions request at the front desk, I would've likely given it a 4 or a 5. I had no desire to have further interaction with their staff after that. I have to say, I usually agree with most reviewers when the consensus is that the staff is great, as it is here in lots of reviews, but I did not have that experience. The person I spoke to to get my folio after check-out was actually very nice, so perhaps I happened to bump into the two snobs that were having a bad day. Good-looking people, but I'd rather have friendly, approachable staff rather than models checking me in. It's back to the EMC2 for me when looking for unique accomodation in Chicago. They have both great facilities AND great staff.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago at its' Finest
text: Immensely enjoyed our stay at the LondonHouse Chicago. A beautiful hotel in a superb location close to all that Chicago has to offer. Our sleeping room was outstanding, well-appointed, luxurious and with beautiful river and lake views. The entire staff were accommodating and were genuinely happy to serve and help make our visit special. The rooftop bar and deck is a must visit. It was one of the finest weekend's I have ever spent in Chicago, even with the rain.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel with fantastic service
text: LondonHouse is amazing!  This is my second stay and I hope to stay here every time I am in Chicago.  The staff are terrific.  The rooms are modern and one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in.  The beds are very comfortable.  Good amenities for Hilton Honors members with breastfast and upgraded rooms.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect stay and friendly staff
text: I visit Chicago frequently and this is one of my FAVORITE hotels. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the city, and the hotel is gorgeous. We paid for an upgraded room and did not regret it. The views were great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Good October Business Stay
text: This was our second stay at the LondonHouse Chicago, part of the Curio Collection, right on the Chicago River, at 85 East Upper Wacker Drive.We were there for a series of meetings for my wife, in October, and we enjoyed this stay, as much as our first one. This time, we were in the ‚Äúnew tower,‚Äù unlike on that first stay, when we had a corner room, in the original building. Now, the LondonHouse occupies two adjoining structures, but it‚Äôs not so evident which of the two, one is in. It‚Äôs not really until one views the outside facade, that it becomes clear where the ‚Äúhistoric tower‚Äù ends, and the ‚Äúnew tower‚Äù begins. Now, the rooms differed, as we did not have a corner this time, so only one window, looking down to the River, and across to the Miracle Mile skyline. The general layout was pretty much the same, and was basically the ‚ÄúHilton Corporate King Room.‚Äù Except for the Curio Collection d√©cor (a bit more ‚Äúmodernist‚Äù), it could have been almost any Hilton in the USA.Still, room 2005 was comfortable, with a nice King bed, a chair, desk, lamps and closet. The bathroom was an ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù from normal Hilton bathrooms, and featured a ‚Äúroll-in shower,‚Äù as it is at least partially an ADA room. The only downside is that the sink vanity is small, to allow more space, for say a wheelchair. For some reason, Hilton thinks that when we request a ‚Äúwalk-in shower,‚Äù we need one with wheelchair access, which is not the case. The issues that we have with ADA rooms, is that first we are taking one, that a disabled guest might need, and then many of the fixtures are not comfortable for us, such as the small vanity, then very low hangers in closets, etc. I need to work with Hilton a bit more closely, and explain that we are ONLY requesting a walk-in shower, and need nothing else. Actually, the request for a walk-in is just for convenience sake for my wife, with two artificial hips. Still, even with the little accommodations for a wheelchair-bound guest, 2005 was a nice, and comfortable room.Once more, the service by the hotel staff, from the doormen to the reservations desk, to the two bars, and the restaurant, was great. Everyone was very friendly, and we wanted for nothing during this rather short stay.With rather gloomy weather, it was nice to have the excellent Lobby Bar, and then at LH on 21, the upper-floor ‚Äúpub.‚Äù I did get to explore LH on 22, the rooftop area, but due to the weather, it was basically closed down. One morning, I tried the ground-level restaurant, Land & Lake, which was OK, though the service was friendly and efficient. I was happy to have the Lobby Bar, and explored their entire wine list ‚Äì plus I did the same for LH on 21.The location is excellent (more so for us, as my wife‚Äôs meetings were just around the corner), with shopping, and so many tourists attractions, basically out of the front door. During our stay, with the exception of one night‚Äôs dinner, we walked to everything we wished to see, and I got to explore the Chicago River Walkway, in yet another Season.We are returning to the LondonHouse in a month, and looking forward to the stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome staff!!
text: The London House staff are amazing and Abel was especially helpful with directions and professional opinions! Not to mention the attention to detail and helpful tips for the city for this visit!! His counsomer service definitely did not go unnoticed!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel in a superb location with top notch service
text: This is our second stay at The LondonHouse Chicago.  We went last October.  Once again they accommodated us with a lovely room with a fantastic view of the city and the river.  We had a king room and could not have been more pleased.  The service was fantastic including the follow up text messages to make sure our stay was good.  Saif was wonderful at getting us our requested room preference and  high floor request.  We are Hilton Honors members and were treated very well by the staff.  The rooms are updated and sophisticated and very well appointed.  They gave us 2 bottles of water upon check in also.  We were traveling with another couple and they also were very impressed.  This was their first time at the LondonHouse and not the last.  The bathrooms are my favorite.  Love the shower and amenities given Malin + Goetz.  They even give you a body poof.  The rooftop view and the the bar on the 21st floor are also a very nice feature about this hotel.   The location by the river and on Wacker is central to shopping, plays and Millennium Park  and more.  We got a deal on the room last minute.  If you can go last minute look for deals online. Highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: Super nice hotel in an amazing location.  Great staff.  The penthouse and roof bar is excellent as are the views.  My only ding is that my room was not made up by about 4:30 PM, but with a call to the front desk, it was shortly taken care of.  I would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room with a View!
text: Upgraded to a corner studio with stunning views of the city.  Room was pretty spacious.  Lighting in the bar/closet area needed improved.  Nespresso coffee maker in room.  Very pleasant staff at check in/out.  Both bars need staff that are more knowledgeable in bar keeping.  The location can't be beat!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Meets all expectations
text: I am very satisfied with my stay at London House Chicago. My room was clean and spacious with pleasant and modern design. All employees were polite and professional at their jobs. I have stayed in some of the neighboring hotels but London House is significantly better. LH is more pricy but at least in my case the price difference was only 15$ so is a good value for money. Will be staying here again especially if I am able to get nice deals like this time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice hotel
text: Close to all the shopping and restaurants. Very clean.  Take a peak at the outside bar up a few floors in the hotel. It has awesome views of the city. Highly recommend. We went during the Christmas season and it was beautiful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful views
text: Had an awesome corner room with great views of the river. As I have gotten older and pickier in my travel, there are two things I love, showers with glass instead of shower curtains and nespresso. This hit on both. Plus towels and bedding were very nice. And the climate control was spot on. Check in experience was great as well. I would stay here again. Only advice, skip the spa. Facials my daughter and I received were absolutely awful. Management should consider finding a spa company with the same comittment to quality as the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, comfortable & modern rooms.
text: Our studio suite had a spectacular view of the river and the historic buildings.  Modern rooms, clean and inviting with a comfortable bed.  Excellent location in a historic office building.  It's an old office building with stately brass hardware but they have to work around the physical structure--leading to a few quirks.  The best view in our room was looking out the bathroom window.  If you like grand hotel lobbies, this ain't your place.  It was unseasonably cold the weekend we visited so we were disappointed that the dinner reservation we made weeks prior at the rooftop bar was canceled with no other option. We were able to go up there the next afternoon to enjoy the fantastic view. The location was excellent.  Parking is an eye-watering $72 per night but SpotHero led us to a way cheaper alternative a few blocks away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Definitely a Curio
text: Very well located hotel right in the center close to Millennium Park. Really has individual character that I appreciate, not a cookie cutter hotel. Polished finish. Very well serviced with friendly staff. Very tasty breakfast options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop view bar
text: This one is pretty cool but the crowd at their rooftop bar was phenomenal body to body people are everywhere and downstairs people are waiting in line. Their in house restaurant is amazing with excellent food and service

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay, great rate!
text: I was lucky enough to find a great rate for a few nights at LondonHouse before Thanksgiving. I can't say enough good things about the hotel - great location, rooms, amenities and wonderful staff. I'll definitely be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago - Totally Amazing
text: The hotel was amazing, the staff were wonderful and the food and view from the rooftop bar fab!  I booked a town car for a fantastic tour around Chicago which was informative.When I checked out I took a car to the fashion outlet stores near the international airport while they look after your baggage while you shop!Staying at LondonHouse just confirmed I need to take my family back there for a holiday.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic rooftop bar
text: newly renovated hotel located in the heart of Chicago downtown. Close to Michigan ave. Room was very comfortable with intelligent lights ,dental sets, slippers, and robes. Diamond member of Hilton have 12 credit for breakfast each person. Don't miss rooftop bar with stunning view

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Attempted Robbery?
text: My recent stay at the London House Chicago was TERRIFYING. The first night of my stay was one that still causes me so much distress. At 1:00 am, I heard a few knocks on our door. I woke up to listen what the situation was and if it was a drunk person trying to prank us or find their room. NOPE! This knock also occurred to the two rooms besides us. The knocking began to become more aggressive. When I got up to quietly walk to the door, I didn't see a silhouette of the persons feet so I thought they went away. As I looked out of the peep hole, the person put a reverse peep hole viewer on my door and saw I was trying to seem. (this was by far the most scariest thing I have ever experienced). Once the person saw me, they were POUNDING on the door so hard I thought it was going to break off the hinges. At one point they even threw themselves into door. I called the Front Desk and was put on hold for 13 minutes to ask them to send Security. 13 minutes is a long time when you're heart is racing and getting ready to defend your self out of deep sleep and ensure your safety. At this point, I was never going to open the door because the person was hiding their identity. The front desk said they would check the cameras and have security walk the floor. After I hung up with the front desk, the knocking had gone away and it was now 2am. One full hour of panic and distress. The front desk never called my room back to ensure I was safe and I never heard security in the hallway. It was impossible to fall asleep after that. In the morning I carefully walked out of my hotel room, which no one should ever have a fear of doing if this is a highly rated hotel. I scanned the hallways and elevators on my way down to the Lobby. NO SECURITY CAMERAS! For some, I can understand that is a privacy concern but for me, that is a HUGE PROBLEM! When I spoke to the Hotel Manager, he said he would check with the night manager and see if anyone else complained. He switched our rooms to help ease us. The second night, I didn't hear form any of the hotel staff about the situation. Was my concern dismissed? The last morning, I spoke to the Hotel Manager to see if he had any information, all he could say was "there were a lot of people walking in and out of the hotel at that hour of the night and it is hard to pinpoint". The Hotel Manager has a second opportunity to provide me with some closure but did a terrible job. The hotel did not have key card access points which is another fault in the hotel. Anyone could have walked in the building at 3am and gone to any floor. I'm not sure how such a nice hotel could lack Security and Hospitality. I am extremely disappointed with this hotel and its guests safety. I will never stop telling this story because this experience haunts me.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and value
text: Business group at hotel, 20+ guests.  Lobby area nice for informal meetings. Room was good, but some complaints about the big sign on the hotel across the river....Lower restaurant fine for breakfast and lunch.  Happy hour was good.  Bar on 21 ok, but table service a bit slow and confusing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: LondonHouse is a incredible hotel. The rooms are very nice and the riverfront views are great as well. Located just steps from Michigan Avenue so everything you want for pleasure or business is readily accessible. Alonso was very helpful as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Hotel & Perfect Downtown Location
text: This is a lovely hotel and we totally enjoyed our 2 night stay. We were prepared to pay for an upgrade to a  Vista room, but when we checked in we were delighted to be told we had already been upgraded. We were also given immediate access to our room, 3 hours before official check-in, again without asking if it was possible. Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for downtown sites and shopping and is within walking distance for any downtown destination. The view from our 20th floor room was lovely during the day and SPECTACULAR at night. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud and the towels are large, plush and luxurious. The HBA products provided are top notch. We had one small problem; we had to call Guest Relations twice to get our room cleaned. The second time we called, housekeeping was at our room within 5 minutes. I can't recommend The Spa. It was nothing special for the price we paid for couples massage. The Spa is located on the 4th floor and must be facing the street, because we could hear sirens, cars honking and general traffic noise, so the massage was not the least bit relaxing. That was the only part of our London House experience that we were disappointed in. We would absolutely stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place to stay in downtown Chicago
text: We spent two nights here recently on our first visit ever to Chicago. Our room was upgraded at no cost to help give us a spectacular view of the city and river.  The room was clean and comfortable.  You're walking distance from numerous places, great restaurants  and attractions.  Transportation is easily accessible and taking the CTA to the airport is a short four block walk.  No need for a car unless you want to pay for parking $60+ a night.   Our only true complaint was there is only a shower and our room safe was inoperable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The view of vista room is stunning. although I have some problems during this stay, most of problem was solved quickly.
text: The view of vista room is stunning. Although I have some problems during this stay, most of problem was solved quickly and well. the location is also very convenience. Overall great value hotel in pricy Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: This is hotel has beautiful views and very convenient location to all of downtown.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was excellent and very clean. I highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic, modern luxiry
text: I really enjoyed everything about my stay here! Usually I‚Äôm on a rush to get home during business trips - I actually felt a little sad shutting the door on my room (1410) for the last time!The view up the river, including The iconic Marina City towers, was breathtaking! My room was comfortable, well appointed and surprisingly spacious. I could relax at night in the provided robe and slippers enjoying the view. The location was ideal - close to my meetings but nearby to the river walk and a pleasant walk or run to the lakefront trails and Navy Pier.I travel so much I often forget hotels the minute I leave - not LondonHouse. This hotel is memorable!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: vacation
text: Our stay at the Londonhouse was nothing short of amazing.  The location was great.  The rooms were clean and the view spectacular.  We had breakfast at the restaurant in lobby and it was delicious.  Additionally, we visited the rooftop bar and the service and views were great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel!
text: Love everything about this hotel.  The location is absolutely PERFECT, the service is impeccable, the connected restaurants are so convenient and have incredible selections, the views are STUNNING...I could go on and on.  I love this hotel and I will absolutely stay here if I'm ever in Chicago again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Place
text: Not only was it awesome walking in and the smell of vanilla - I checked in and I loved my room - it was on the 4th floor and I enjoyed the quiet and clean rooms. In addition, my friends and family found it humorous that my room view was of the Chicago Blackhawks store - my dad won a few Stanley Cups with another team and was GM for the Kings. Anyways, I loved not only the nicely appointed rooms and friendly staff - but the location was central to all the touristy things I was doing. I definitely am making plans to return to this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Neal and Experience!
text: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful evening last night at LH 21.Jaylan W. ensured we had a romantic tableand Vana S. provided us with some great menu ideas and impeccable service!Highly recommend LH 21 and can't wait to tell our friends. Thanks again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: How I Love LondonHouse, Let Me Count the Ways
text: LondonHouse wowed me at every turn and I cannot wait to go back and visit the property! Check-in was a breeze and the hotel has this very pleasant scent throughout that feels both clean and inviting at the same time. I stayed in a corner suite with amazing views of downtown Chicago and the river. The room is spacious and well laid-out. Example, the 55‚Äù television swivels 360 degrees for easy viewing from the desk or the bed, and yes there is a small refrigerator! The bath has a spacious shower and the loofah with the amenities was an added bonus! If you visit the bar and Kurt (sp?) is there, be prepared for free entertainment. (You‚Äôll have to pay for the drinks.) Kudos to the management and staff, everyone was top notch and there was no need left unfulfilled during my stay! See you again in April.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great early birthday retreat!!!
text: I want to start off by saying that this hotel is by far one of the best Hilton properties I have stayed with.  The customer service is great ,and the people at the front desk are so professional and kind. I called to confirm my reservation with Abel....make sure you ask for him . Abel was so great to talk with on the phone and made me feel like more than a guest . He gave my husband and I a wonderful upgrade just for celebrating my birthday a little early.  The whole experience Abel gave to me was beyond great customer service. I was given a complimentary drink from their beautiful bar, and that was courtesy of the concierge and that person was Anthony.  Anthony was very nice to me and they even gave me some delicious truffles as a present in my room.  One of the things that I really loved was that the staff texted me to tell me they wanted to place the truffles in the room because I was already out for my birthday dinner . I told them that it was fine to leave it in the room . Now that's great hospitality!!!!  The rooms are great . Very spacious and I Would recommend a guest to get a vista suite ,the view of the city is phenomenal. This hotel has every thing that you look for in comfort ,class and hospitality . Also Tori at the front desk was an absolute doll as well. In short this hotel makes you feel right at home. Last year I loss my mom and my dad 6 months apart so my birthday was pretty somber ,but the staff at London House made me feel so good about celebrating my birthday and I want to thank them all for making want to celebrate my birthday again.  My husband and I will be back for NYE most definitely.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: AHHHH-Mazing - NEW property with excellent customer service
text: It has been a while since I have stayed here and I was so happy to be back at this property. This hotel is new - so everything is clean and in good repair. The customer service is incredible. People seem genuinely happy to work here and it shows in how they interact customers. Check in was fast and pleasant (unlike other Mag Mile properties...). Upon arriving to my room I was so pleased with the beauty of the room and the fantastic waterfront view. Room amenities included a refrigerator, Nespresso machine, great toiletries (shower gel and a scrubbie), fluffy towels and robes with slippers, etc. I received a text immediately asking how my room was and if I needed anything. Replies were super fast. Room service (salmon and champagne) was tasty. The gym is great. The view from the rooftop and cupola is wonderful.  Check out was super fast and pleasant as well. While the property is new and beautiful, this place excels as customer service!! I travel to Chicago about once a month for business and am always booked into a Mag Mile property - this is by far my favorite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The Lobby Bar Made the Trip
text: As a frequent traveler, I see many properties and hotels in the cities I travel to. So beds, TVs, bathrooms start to look the same the more places I frequent. They all have there unique features but the one thing that makes a good property great is the staff they hire to run it. Michelle from the lobby bar is that unique piece that really makes this hotel stand out. Not only was she friendly the entire evening, but she was extremely engaging with everyone at the bar the entire time. She paid close attention to our interactions and contributed valuable input to make us feel like she was really listening to us and that we were important to her. My friend was telling me that they closed early on her the night before so we needed to get there. Michelle ensured us that isn't the case. She was open the entire night for us and never made us feel rushed or that we were an inconvenience for her. She knew her cocktails well enough so her focus was on us. I was only planning on having one cocktail and calling it a night but between my company and the pleasant banter coming from both sides of the bar, we ended up closing the bar with Michelle. She's such an amazing asset to this hotel and if you like to laugh and have a good time to help take the stress off after a long day, come see her. You won't be disappointed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Location
text: London House Chicago is THE hotel to stay in when staying in the city! The location of the hotel is amazing, so much to do near by including; the Chicago Theater, Chicago River, City Winery, Michigan ave, etc. Upon entering the hotel, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Check in was a breeze and the hospitality was impeccable. The hotel itself is very modern and elegant. Rooms were spotless and furnished just perfectly!  Make sure to check out the rooftop bar, the views are amazing! Food at the restaurant was out of this word! You can't go wrong with this hotel! Highly recommended!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel - fantastic location and stay
text: I had a wonderful three night stay at the London House. The hotel is quiet, not crowded, and well run. The rooms beautiful and the bed comfortable. Not a Trump fan but had a great view of the Trump building and river. Loved the food at the  Land and Lake and the drinks on the ‚Äòrooftop‚Äô. The first two nights were raining and the last night there was an event, so I never got outside. Bartenders were kind of slow in there and it closed early for a hotel bar. Had a great stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend with mom
text: Brought my mother to this boutique hotel and it was more than expected.  Very beautiful hotel with lots of amenities.  I was highly impressed and Ken was very helpful at the front desk when our accommodations were incorrect in the system.  Highly recommended!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel in the Middle of Everything!
text: I had the pleasure of staying at London House.  The location is excellent, the rooms superb, the service spectacular.....overall I highly recommend this hotel. It is sleek and cool, yet comfy and quiet.  I will stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place to stay in downtown Chicago
text: LondonHouse Chicago is perfectly located for activities and restaurants in the Michigan Ave area. We stayed over a weekend and walked to all the stores and restaurants we wanted to visit.Rooftop views and drinks were amazing!Rooms are very nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: River View!
text: Excellent hotel!  The view of the river at night and in the morning is amazing.  I stayed here for work over the week.  I ate breakfast every morning and nothing was bad.  My favorite was the country benedict (for the sausage gravy lovers). The room was fantastic with very nice features and accommodations to make you very comfortable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Marathon
text: Londonhouse was very nice! Everyone was helpful.  We stayed here for Chicago Marathon and it was s short walk to the starting line .  The rooms were very clean and we had a great view. The rooftop bar was cool, beautiful view .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new favorite hotel in Chicago
text: I love LondonHouse, it‚Äôs super modern and fabulous, right on the water with a gorgeous view of downtown Chicago. I also heard it has one of the best rooftop bar, so I gotta check it out when it‚Äôs warmer. What made it special is that the supervisor Matthew upgraded my room to a corner studio suite for my birthday with a free drink voucher too! He is super nice! I will for sure come back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: Stayed over the Chicago Marathon weekend. Great stay with comfortable accommodations and attentive staff. Restaurant for breakfast was highlight of the trip. Location was central to all area attractions.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Always Amazing!
text: This hotel is always on point.  Comfortable rooms and smart elevators.  Delicious food all around.  Highly recommended.  Try and get a Vista view of the river.  Excellent customer service.  You can practically do everything from the messenger feature of the Hilton Honors App.  Digital key is always a nice touch.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Terrific service and location
text: I (and the rest of my company‚Äôs associates) stayed here during the recent OIS/AAO meeting.  It‚Äôs across the river from Trump Tower, but my room didn‚Äôt face it. The location is 15 minutes from the Convention Center and is easy access to the downtown restaurants.  From check in, room cleaning, to check out the employees are friendly and helpful.  This was my second stay, and I would come back in a ‚Äòheart beat‚Äô.  Enjoy!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: An Amazing Experience
text: The LondonHouse is not only beautiful and iconic, but had an absolutely superb staff that make staying there truly an experience of a lifetime. From the amazin location to the spectacular food, we can‚Äôt wait to come back to LondonHouse

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A room with a view
text: Views to die for. The river is exciting and it is right there. The vista rooms are spacious and comfortable. Nice tv and radio. Bath is large with a nice shower. Whether you are at the Bridges bar or roof top, it's a happening place

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Another fantastic Curio hotel
text: I continue to be very impressed by the Curio collection of hotels by Hilton. I stayed here one night on a business trip. Fantastic lobby and an excellent roof-top restaurant with amazing food (definitely get the fried oysters!). I didn‚Äôt have much interaction with the staff, but they seemed highly competent. The room was a little small (as are a lot of Chicago hotel rooms), but had a big bathroom and shower. Definitely would recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Most epic hotel in chicago
text: Every time i leave this hotel I cant wait to come back! Best customer service in town and unrivaled, high end furnishings. Espresso machines in every room and luxurious tile shower. You wont regret your choice. The rooftop bar has amazing views and the restaurant downstairs has a very legit menu.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Customer Service
text: Rarely praise customer service as hotels typically don‚Äôt impress all that much. But the sensibility of the people who work here is uniformly excellent. They respond quickly, constantly ask for feedback, and follow-thru. And they have good senses of humor which you have to when your hotel faces a big sign that says ‚ÄúTrump‚Äù.Rooftop bar is excellent as is lobby bar. Restaurant on property has lots of work to do ‚Äî bad coffee for instance ‚Äî which hopefully it does. Bathrooms are a bit odd but the beds are great. The view up or down river is better than the view across. But in the end, this place is all about really good customer relations. Amazing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Chicago Hotel
text: This hotel is gorgeous and the location is perfect. We upgraded to the king suite vista which included a beautiful floor to ceiling view of the river, bridges and the Wrigley building. It was well worth it!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fall Break Getaway
text: Perfect night following Bears game.  Perfect location right on the river. Wonderful rooftop views looking straight west down the river. Convenient walking in the Loop or north on the Magnificent Mile. Beautiful, comfortable room.  Excellent breakfast downstairs in the Corner Bakery.  Our new favorite Chicago hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superbe / perfect
text: I stayed 5 days and 4 nights in this hotel. Everything was perfect. People working at the front office were nice and helpful. The room with a view was great. I will come back, for sure. I recommend it without hesitation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Tied the knot at the LondonHouse 10/13/18
text: The LondonHouse definitely exceeded our expectations from start to finish. The service here is classy and the ambiance brings a different level of the big city Chicago vibe. When first walking in we were always kindly greeted and assisted by Firkrut, the gentleman that was always working the front entrance. We first visited the LondonHouse late October of 2017 and we knew immediately that this was the location for us. We reached out via email through the LondonHouse homepage and we received a prompt response from the Director of Weddings, Steve Slecka. At our first and several meetings, Steve was awesome to talk with. He took us step by step through the entire process. The complimentary cocktails every visit also helped up calm our nerves. Not to get side tracked, but if you find yourself at the lobby bar, be sure to ask Kurt to whip up a Blueberry Vesper. After about 4 of them you won‚Äôt even care about how much they cost. Kurt is also the most happy go lucky person I have ever encountered. Our wedding was not the traditional sit down and be served style. The setup in the Juliette Grand Ballroom was very beautiful. The floor to ceiling windows gave everybody an awesome view over the bridges and river.  We opted for food stations, open seating and a handful of tall boy tables to stand at. A few guests were confused at first but there was plenty of staff members directing the way to point guests into the right direction. The food stations allowed our guests to flow freely and not to have to wait in a buffet line, wait for a table number to be called, or have the traditional 1000 course sit down meal that takes forever. The chef also allowed us to add a few items that were not on the menu.  We needed up with 3 food stations and a sweets table.Station #1 - Asian-Lo mein noodles served in white Chinese takeout boxes-Teriyaki chicken and Jasmine rice-Veggie egg rolls and sweet and sour sauce-Cucumber saladStation #2 - Mexican-Steak tacos-Fries white fish tacos-Walking tacos with pastor pork-Large salsa selection Station #3 - American-Crab cake sliders-Prime beef sliders-Korean short rib sliders-French friesSweets Station-Cupcakes-Key lime pie-Flan-CoffeeThe food did not come out in mass amounts and it was continuously replenished and remained fresh throughout the entire dinner. The Banquet Manager, Danielle and her team did a great job in hosting a very well out together reception. I‚Äôd also like to mention that the menu tasting prior to the wedding was also very fun and her staff was very attentive and friendly. We also had a separate late night arrival party of coworkers that arrives around 8:30-9. These guests were greeted with a freshly prepared food box.The Presidential Suite was a comfortable room. It was very high class. There was a fire place built in the middle of the living room and a tv mounted on each side  creating 2 separate living rooms. All of the curtains were power operated, the showers was large and had 3 separate shower heads, the bedroom was nice and it also had a sofa, and the kitchenette had a mini fridge, sink, dishwasher, plenty of cabinet space and a espresso machine.Overall, we are extremely pleased with our entire stay from Friday to Monday. We had a total of 5 rooms books and nobody had a complaint. Our Moms were both upgraded to a suite and both were sent complimentary water and a fruit bowl. In total, our guests had 25 rooms booked on a group block. I‚Äôd highly recommend getting the rooms booked early because we did run out of rooms and the hotel became booked before we could get more rooms. We were warned ahead of time but we did not act quick enough. Our family was happy with the stay and definitely impressed with the LondonHouse and the location. Even upon our checkout, the bellman Corey remembered us from when he first met us during our check in. He made my mom laugh a little bit by letting my Mom believe that we were regulars. Don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to Steve about anything you need. He was always ready to answer all of our questions no matter how minor or major they were.Kevin and Mari#justbefranks

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful weekend
text: The staff did everything they could to make the weekend memorable. Great location.  Awesome view of the Chicago river. Nice to have a lovely restaurant conveniently located right upstairs. Very comfortable beds and room in general. Great concierge service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beds Are Lethal to Shins
text: Beds are a wooden platform with a mattress on top.  The platform sticks out beyond the mattress on all sides and is covered by the duvet.  So, walk past the corner of a bed without knowing this and you have a bloody if not at least bruised shin. I walked fast and got the bloody version.AND, the sliding door to our bath was very nearly immovable.  Moreover, the view, for which we paid extra, showed front & center the hugely big "TRUMP" lettering on the Trump property right across the street. Other than the above, this hotel has much to offer.  Location is central, scenic, and close to everything -- including the docks for the excellent Architecture tour on the river. Food on the Terrace and in the lobby restaurant was excellent.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Never staying anywhere else in Chicago
text: I travel every week for work and I am often in Chicago. I am s very loyal Hilton diamond member and have been very frustrated with my recent stays at The Drake and The Palmer House. I had given them both second and in some cases third chances. But I will never again have to give chances. I have found my new home in Chicago. The Londonhouse is perfect. Beautifully situated on the river with great views and easy access to everything. The staff is amazing from bellhop to bartender at the restaurant to the front desk and housekeeping. Honestly it is hard to find a flaw. I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite do I can only speak to that room. It was very comfortable and a true upgrade from a standard room anywhere else I have stayed. The food at the small restaurant off the front desk area and the bartender that served as my server was fabulous. I had a salad with salmon. I only wish I weren‚Äôt in meetings and could enjoy the food once more. Make the most out of your trip to Chicago and select to stay here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Chicago Hotel gem
text: The location is perfect and hotel is even more perfect.  Tucked right at Michigan Ave and the River, this hotel offers incredible views from your room or rooftop.  Room was great, lobby of hotel beautiful and the staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Win win!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay at London House Chicago
text: It is opposite to trump tower and the view was amazing. The hotel staff are friendly but the checkout experience wasn't nice, they charged me early departure fees without mentioning anywhere. The parking is not free either. They charge additional $60 per night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice form but limited in sensibility
text: My friends and I stayed here for my bday weekend Oct 5-6. The hotel is chic, well located, and had excellent customer service. I was upgraded to premium internet because of my special event. The room, once you can get through the heavy wood door, was spacious and well laid out. I had a vista view which looked out to the river and the Trump tower. The beds slept comfortably and there was a huge mirror outside the bathroom (and one on the closet door which is nice when you have multiple people primping). The toiletries were of high quality and toothbrush kits and a loofah were provided. Still, I felt underwhelmed by this hotel given its class designation. The room lighting was quite dim for my preference even with the large window.There is a large shower stall in the bathroom and motion lighting which is quite nice for those early morning bathroom trips.The bathroom has a sliding barn door closure that did not allow for much privacy because there was a gap where you could see and hear everything happening in the room (and vice versa). Add to that no fan in the bathroom to mask bathroom noise. I would take function over cute design any day when it comes to the bathroom. Because we were sharing a bathroom, the lack of storage was difficult. There was one hook but no towel racks on which to hang towels and wash cloths. The bathroom space is plentiful enough to accommodate racks and this would be a strong suggestion for management to consider. All in all, I found the room nice enough but I didn't feel like I had upgraded to a luxury hotel. A couple of nicer amenities does not make up for the absence of basic functionality.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Swanky hotel with a great location
text: We lucked out with a corner room so it probably had a little more space than the average rm (RM 435) and it had a lovely view of the river, the Chicago Tribune building, and unfortunately the Trump building (but that's not the hotel's fault!) It was a little loud with all the honking, but to be fair, it is located on a main cross street (E Wacker Dr and Michigan Ave) - Id bring some ear plugs if its a bother. The amenities were fantastic: complimentary wifi was fairly quick, the small fridge was perfect for water bottles and snacks, the bed was firm but soft, the nespresso machine was a nice touch, and the shower was AMAZING. It was also conveniently located to the L and walking distance to a bunch of delicious restaurants (Purple Pig, Giordano's, Nando, and Naf Naf to name a few) as well as sites such as Millenium Park and the Art Institute. The smart elevator thing was a weird thing to get used to, but otherwise, we were thrilled with the hotel and its location, amenities, service, and views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel and great location
text: I recently spent a week at the LondonHouse Hotel in Chicago. It's a great hotel with a good mix of modern and classic Chicago architecture from the early 20th century. I was lucky enough to get a room facing the Wrigley and Chicago Tribune buildings. it is centrally located on the river and Michigan Ave, so easy walk to anywhere in the city. If you're a business traveller and looking for a full breakfast buffet or extensive room service menu, you may be disappointed, but there's plenty nearby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Go elsewhere
text: I rarely write poor reviews, preferring to accept that minor niggles are inevitable. However, the service at this hotel is poor. We were staying for 4 nights which had been booked in 3 separate bookings because my employer had booked the middle 2 nights for me. I am a Hilton honours member and all 4 nights were paid up front. I called the hotel ahead of arrival (incurring an overseas phone charge) to explain the 3 bookings and asked for them to be linked so that we didn‚Äôt have to keep checking-in and out. I was told this would be done so long as both my husband and my names were on each booking - I made sure that this was in place. However when my husband arrived at the hotel to check-in it had not been done. The receptionist then took a while to link the bookings and the whole check-in process was more stressful than it should have been. Worse was then to come when the following day the key to the room stopped working. This meant another trip to reception who said that the bookings were still not linked and the key had to be re-issued. Believe it or not the same thing then happened 2 days later and we had to go back to reception again for the same reason. It should not be difficult for a hotel of this standard to link 3 bookings and ensure their customer doesn‚Äôt have to keep returning to the desk. Furthermore the reception staff each time were at best indifferent and at worse unhelpful.The room was fine but not special and avoid the diner at ground level - the food is average and the service is terrible. We saw two different people have wait staff bump into them causing drinks to be spilled. We had to ask 3 times for milk for the coffee and that was after them losing track of their wait list and seating people out of order.There are plenty of choices of this type of hotel in downtown Chicago - I‚Äôd try somewhere else.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thank You
text: London House is a true gem in Chicago.  Not many properties have the amenities, rooftop, views and great rooms.  The location was fantastic and right next to the park and best restaurants. I booked my parents here and will certainly be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: Location, Location, Location. Perfect setting coupled with great service makes the LondonHouse a must if you‚Äôre visiting Chicago!! My wife and I are here for work but after hours we can count on being a very pleasant short walk from great food and libations.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Enjoy a drink at sunset and watch the lights of Chicago come to life
text: We arrived for a night cap and enjoyed a tremendous view of Chicago at night.  We were lucky enough to get a table on the roof top.  Even thought it was August, the temp was agreeable.  Views up and down the river, across the sky line and even out onto the lake.  A grand way to end a fun day in the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It was amazing!
text: Beautiful view. The service was amazing. Everyone was kind, attentive, and gave great advice for our trip to help us out. They made everything as nice and convient for us as they could it. It was really excellent.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business trip to Chicago
text: Incredible river and city views. Could not be more conveniently located (walking distance from the blue line to the airport). Staff are SO helpful and lovely. The room is modern, elegant but comfortable. I highly recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hilton again masters the historic
text: LondonHouse is another of Hilton's Curio brand of restored historic properties--this one perhaps being a unique challenge. The reason: It's not a restored hotel but a restored office building. What that means to guests is immediately obvious: No grand lobby, in fact, pretty much no lobby at all. Registration and coffee service and such are instead ensconced on the second floor, and are utilitarian, lacking in any pizzaz. That's a negative, as is the room size--which runs small for a luxury property. Aside from these quibbles, LH is a great place to stay in Chicago. It could hardly be located any better for access to Chicago's shopping, eateries, sites, and shores. And it shines most brightly in service, which is the best I've experienced in my many Chicago hotel stays. Housekeeping managed to make up my room despite my giving them narrow windows to do their work. And brilliant use of texting helped me immeasurably, as I texted a variety of requests and questions at all hours--including 2:30 am. I always got prompt, accurate answers--from Abel, Ricardo, Saif, Grace, and TJ. One more small but meaningful plus: room lighting that offered nearly limitless combinations of bright lights and low lights and task lights and reading lights and automatic lights and...well, you get my drift. I strongly suggest you drift to LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: HomeRun once again!
text: I have a lot to say but I‚Äôm going to skip most and get directly to the point. The front desk associate named Trevor is beyond awesome. When your checking into a hotel there are things you simply expect. This kid was very professional and he has exactly what you‚Äôd expect t from a front desk agent. I approached the desk, said my last name and he took it from there. He handed me my bottled waters, acknowledged my Gold status with a complimentary upgrade and gave a very thorough and descriptive explanation of what to expect from a stay at the hotel. This is all within about 7 minutes. I‚Äôve stayed many times before and because of service like that I‚Äôm sure to stay again. Very very good job Trevor. I‚Äôll try to add photos of the room if I can.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and Great Hotel
text: We stayed here Friday and Saturday nights.  Our experience was great from the moment we checked in and Trevor helped us get a great room with a  view.  We were so happy with the location of this hotel. We were in town to see Hamilton (Also great!) and close enough to the Magnificent Mile to walk.  The River Walk is beautiful and just steps from the hotel.  The room we had was spacious and the bathroom was huge  (1427) My only suggestion to hotel management is to put a hook for the bathroom next to the shower door, there really was not a good place to put it while in the shower.  The bed and pillows were so comfortable, I slept like a baby.  Absolutely would stay here again.  I have stayed at several hotels downtown, hands down this is my favorite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and very friendly staff
text: Friday night before labor day we were desperately looking for a room. We originally had a prepaid booking in the Wit Hotel but the staff there refused to give us our room. They pretended that our room had been cancelled. After this shocking experience it was good to meet the very friendly Shayne Blidy at the reception of LondonHouse. He gave us a very nice room with river view. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Shannon, the friendly concierge, booked our boat trip and the tickets for the art museum. Besides this she had very good restaurant recommendations for us.The hotel has a very nice rooftop bar. The drinks are expensive but the view is worth it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good hotel, Great views
text: Good hotel located in the heart of Chicago, our room faced the river and Trump hotel, making for Great views From the room.The breakfast in the restaurant on the ground floor was always good, but service was a hit or miss. The one day we had a happy and friendly guy and the next a grumpy one.The rooftop bar is a hype, super busy but offers nice views over the city. The inside part offers great cocktails, food and friendly service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, excellent location, helpful staff
text: The LondonHouse is well appointed, perfectly maintained and well run. The lobby is beautiful and the lobby bar/restaurant has great food and drinks starting at 6 in the morning.  The rooftop restaurant and bar is also excellent, and offers some fantastic views of Chicago.The location is great, right on the river between Wacker and Michigan.  You can easily access the Riverwalk, and it is walking distance to The House of Blues, the Apple Store and several of the sightseeing river boats.I noticed that one reviewer downgraded the hotel because they didn't like the elevators.  This might be because they are different - you select your destination floor on a touch panel, then you are directed to your elevator, which has no floor buttons in it.  There is a display in the door frame that indicates the floor the elevator is heading to. These "smart elevators" are different, but they are also faster and more efficient, and often more secure.  Is it really a good idea to hate things you don't understand?  I don't think so.We found the staff to be courteous, helpful and quick to respond to our requests.  Check-in was a breeze and the doorman and bellhops were very helpful, not just with bags, but with directions and guidance.When we are in Chicago, this is where we will stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Trendy hotel, quite busy because of their rooftop! Terrible elevator situation! Normal rooms!
text: Upon arriving at the London House in Chicago we thought our experience was going to be outstanding given the hype around this hotel. The hotel is quite cool. It is fancy and has a rooftop with an amazing view. However, as cool as the rooftop might be it causes a lot of trouble for actual guests staying at the hotel.The elevator situation was beyond terrible. They give preference to the rooftop for the use of elevators. The elevator hall is packed with people, making it not only hard but uncomfortable waiting for an elevator with your bags. More so, the wait is incredibly long which forms a queue of people that all want to get to their rooms.The view from the rooftop was quite cool, but I payed for a hotel room not for a rooftop to make my stay unpleasant. Even getting from street level to the reception is a chaos thanks to the elevator situation.I have to say that the restaurant in the first floor was quite good for brunch and service there was amazing. Aside from that I was not utterly impressed. The rooms were average. The hotel is noisy. I've stayed at many hotels in Chicago and London House is now on my blacklist. There are better options that will make your experience a more pleasant one. If you are a business traveler, you should not even consider this as an option.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel
text: I liked this hotel because it is different than most, centrally located, with an amazing rooftop bar. I got a good deal, so good value for money. You can eat inside or outside (with nice view) and had a great brunch.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Saved the best for last
text: My husband and I just went to Chicago for a belated anniversary trip and to check out the Laver Cup.  We were having such a good time that we decided to extend our stay and go see Hamilton (loved it!!- it's worth all the buzz and more, would definitely go see it again).  As we were looking around for some hotels to stay at the rates were quite expensive, so I decided to use my Hilton Honors points and we splurged and stayed here.  I love this hotel!!  We stayed at a few hotels while we were in town and this was the best.  It's very chic, upscale and modern.  The location is great and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.  We were always greeted with a "hello" and a smile.  The location is excellent and it's a short walk to anywhere you want to go.  Navy Pier, shopping on Michigan Avenue, lots of restaurants around and was a short walk to CIBC theater where we saw Hamilton.  We also enjoyed the rooftop bar on the 21st floor of the hotel.  Great weather and a great view.  It was a perfect end to a perfect getaway.  I can't wait to go back and stay longer at this hotel

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: My wife and I loved our stay at the LondonHouse Chicago. We used the digital key system so we did not even go through any checkin/out process in the Lobby. The room had a fantastic view and was super clean and very quiet. Went to check out the rooftop bar with it‚Äôs incredible view and had breakfast downstairs at the Land/Lake restaurant which was fantastic. Will be a repeat customer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location
text: Second stay at LondonHouse with a group- four rooms in our party and a fabulous stay for all. The employees are great whether at the desk, through chat or other services. Rooms are very nice, my favorite is the king corner suite room, although king suite is nice as well. Great beds, nice room layout, toiletries are great quality- love Malin and Goetz products. Location is great! My favorite hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel in a great location
text: I highly recommend this upscale hotel for travelers desirous of high end accommodations. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms very quiet and well appointed. The location is excellent-with access to the River Walk just across the street and the Navy Pier within walking distance. Request a high floor with view of the river,

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The view...
text: My all time favourite Chicago Hotel. The views, service, cleanliness, location and sidewalk dining complete a perfect landing from a full day of site seeing. Don't forget to enjoy your reading nook.....

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Short but fantastic stay
text: Prior staying at LondonHouse, I had stayed at another hotel and I wish I had just stayed here during my entire visit to Chicago.I only stayed at their standard lower level room as the upper levels are charged extra. Everything about the hotel oozes luxury and quality and the rooftop bar is great for sunset viewing. Location of the hotel is convenient, easy to explore Chicago CBD and riverwalk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great!
text: I had a fantastic experience at the LondonHouse hotel. My company recently hosted their global sales meeting there, and the event planning staff was so easy to work with, and they did their job with such excellence. The hotel itself was great as well, and I can't say enough positive things about my stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great View, Quality, and Service
text: Stayed in the King Vista Suite and was a fantastic experience. The views were amazing from the room and the rooftop lounge as well. Service was impeccable from basically everyone on staff. The food in the lobby as well as from room service was very good. The price for staying in such a quality place was completely reasonable and I would stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: So rude staff
text: We as 3 people, travelled to Chicago for the business and stayed at London House Chicago. I can say that London House Chicago is perfect hotel with it‚Äôs location, view and cleanliness of it‚Äôs rooms.But unfortunately, I can not say same thing when we talk about hotel‚Äôs reception personnel. They were so rude and disrespectful. While we were checking in to the hotel, they got 1.400 $ (since we pay as cash, they got 700$*2) as deposit. We paid 1.400$ as 14 100 dolars bills.After 7 nights, since we did not have any extra expense, on our checking out date we demanded our deposit.And we were very very suprised while we saw 1400 1$ !!!! Yes!! They brought our money as a dolar bills. When we saw money bundles, we‚Äôre totally shocked!! We had a flight to Turkey in 3 hours therefore we stated that we can not accept the money like that, we demanded our money as we paid but they did not help us and the managers of the reception ( we checked out on 15 th september at 9 am, the hotel administrators can determine the managers‚Äônames by this date and time) said that ‚Äúthese is the only money we can pay you‚Äù rudely. And added ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt accept these money, we can not pay your deposit‚ÄùWe had 2 hours at the reception and because of their rude attitute we were nearly late for our flight.  Because of all these problems we had a terrible trip.At the center of Chicago, we faced this terrible attitute. We suggest you that when you go to Chicago, never prefer to London House Chicago. Additionally, I think London House Chicago has to apologise from us.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel in a Great Location
text: Stayed 3 nights in a vista view room. We had requested a room on the highest floor in a quiet location. At checkin it was politely explained a room was available on the top floor, however as the bar was located directly above it was possible there may be some noise heard in the room.We thanked the checkin agent for their honesty and requested a quieter location. Our room 1710 still had an excellent view. As expected the room was immaculate.Our only disappointment we were unable to go to the rooftop bar on our last night as it was closed for a private function. Had we known in advance we would have changed our plans and gone to the rooftop bar another night.We enjoyed walking to The Riverwalk, Mag Mile and Millennium Park from this hotel and even took the public bus outside the door to Jazzin at the  Shedd.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Curio Collection Hotel in the Heart of Chicago
text: I recently completed my first stay at the London House Chicago for a business trip. When I say that this is one of the nicest hotels in the Curio Collection portfolio, I mean it. The location of the hotel alone makes it worth a stay, as it offers pristine views of Wacker Drive and the downtown Skyline of Chicago. I arrived to the hotel easily via Uber and although there is a valet option available, I would not recommend driving unless one is familiar with driving in Chicago. I was promptly greeted by a friendly and courteous LH doorman who offered to bring my bag up to my room for me. Upon checking in at the front desk, my Diamond elite status was acknowledged and I was granted the Digital Key (nice feature of Hilton Honors app). My room was an upgraded room on the 16th floor which they called a ‚ÄúVista Room‚Äù and offered spectacular views down Wacker Drive. The room itself was very comfortable with two queen beds and a sitting area near a large window. There were premium toiletries in the bathroom and the bathroom itself was appointed with modern touches throughout. One thing that isn‚Äôt to be missed when staying at the LH is a visit to the rooftop bar/restaurant. I took advantage of the rooftop amenities to meet with an advisor of mine, and while the views were incredible, the service was impeccable and prompt. The gym facilities at the LH are as good as any gym, and there is also a day spa on-site which I was not able to take advantage of on my short stay. I will definitely be staying here again when I have the opportunity and would recommend it to any of my family or friends staying downtown in the Windy City.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect stay
text: LondonHouse never disappoints, one of my favorite hotels in the city!  Great customer service!  Kurt at the bridges bar is FANTASTIC!  Great conversation and always keeps us laughing!  The rooms are beautiful, the location perfect.  Always look forward to my stays here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 40th Birthday
text: My wife suprised me with amazing trip to Chicago for which I‚Äôve only been to O‚Äôhare for layovers for my 40th. Bellhops & front desk upon arrival were professional & courteous & location was amazing besides the bums on every corner near. Wasn‚Äôt happy that they tried to  upgrade us at a cost upon arrival as my wife already had gotten an amazing view. Restaurant downstairs was great for brunch & roof bar has amazing views of skyline as long as not on Saturday night which was extremely overcrowded. Was a great stay & professional staff for amount of time we spent in hotel. Tons of nearby walking attractions bars, restaurants & Lake Michigan...Glad we didn‚Äôt bring kids not sure would have been best w no pool & a little upgrade w kids, but will totally stay again especially after so many great restaurants & tours especially Bobbys Bike Tour & Le Colonial!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel stay
text: Great hotel, centrally located, great staff. I could walk anywhere from the hotel. The food was great and the beds were very comfy. Next time I am in Chicago, I will go back to this hotel, for sure! Thank you

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel
text: Gr√©√¢t location and wonderful service. The best view in Chicago. Definitely worth staying here.  Amazing place new and perfect!  Room was great. Ask for a room with a view of the river.  Check out the rooftop which is the hottest place in town. The view is amazing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Trip
text: Great place to stay.  Staff was great.  We checked in early and they kept our bags and upgraded our room.  I would highly recommend staying here if you are in Chicago.  The location is great.  There are a lot of cool places that are within walking distance.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Joke
text: Room service was disgusting. Room is so noisy you can‚Äôt sleep. Staff is polite until you voice any concern. There are no vending machines to get simple bottles of water or snacks. Disgustingly overpriced for what you get. Don‚Äôt do it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay at the LondonHouse Chicago
text: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay at the London House, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Very nice amenities, and the location is fantastic. The rooftop bar is small and very crowded, but as a hotel guest, you don't have to wait in the long lines that form each night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Location
text: A superb hotel not far from State street or Michigan Avenue on the Chicago river.The room was big and had a fantastic view, the service was always friendly and efficient, and the whole place was comfortable.We found the rooftop bar although good to be crowded and expensive, and the car parking charges a little inhibiting.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: IMTS
text: The location and service was great. The restaurant had delicious food and the rooftop bar was fabulous. Absolutely beautiful view from the rooftop bar and great service as well. The room was outstanding nice comfortable bed, big screen TV large bathroom with a nice size shower. The view from the room was great as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location
text: After much research, we decided on the LondonHouse for our stay in Chicago. The service was exceptional, room was immaculate & we had a River view that was spectacular.I highly recommend going up to the rooftop restaurant for the sunset views.It got crowded with outside patrons, but you have immediate access being a guest at the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Five stars for beauty but some five star touches noticably absent
text: We only stayed here for one of our three nights in Chicago, moving to somewhere slightly more affordable for the next nights, but we are so pleased we had this INCREDIBLE location for our first taste of this amazing city.  We had a room that looked straight down the river - full length windows to do the jaw-dropping view justice.  Luckily we were able to secure a table reservation for drinks on the rooftop terrace well before we arrived as we knew they had a massive conference in town and it was jam packed up there!! Well worth the expensive drink prices to go up for sunset. DO definitely make that reservation so you get in! Love the wonderfully efficient and coordinated elevators - plenty of them! Really friendly welcome on arrival.  Nice bathroom products.Now the 'niggles':  only 3 Nespresso pods in the room - really!?  Voss water is $5 per bottle.  For that room price a complimentary bottle of water wouldn't be too much to expect!  The gym is adequate but not especially large for a five star hotel and being a very busy period in Chicago it was very crowded.  Why are the cold towels in the refrigerator warm?!?! Also quite surprised there was no turn down - something you come to expect at these prices, but then maybe it was available on request - not sure.
