A perfectly situated hotel with beautiful interiors and a fabulous example of the 'hotel boom' and making a special historical building into something everyone can delight in,

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Operational Difficulties
text: I just returned from a 4 day stay at this property.  It has a great location.  The staff that I dealt with were very friendly and helpful.  Nonetheless, there were so many service glitches (everything from being initially assigned a room where the blackout shades didn't work to an elevator outage that forced my wife and me to walk down from the 8th floor as well as a 30 minute wait for a breakfast order in the restaurant).  To management's credit, they did what they could to follow-up and make amends.  However, my overall impression is one of a hotel where the various parts of the operation do not seem to mesh.  Generally, a disappointing experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved Every Minute!
text: The staff was anticipatory and attentive to my needs. I didn't feel like I was struggling to find someone to help me. When I checked in, I mentioned wanting a nice view, but not necessary if unavailable. Ken was able to find me a beautiful corner room with a view of the river and Michigan Ave. Chicago is one of my favorite cities so I the view made my stay that much better. Martha was also helpful in communicating with valet to get my car at check-out.The LondonHouse is the whole package - location, decor, amenities, rooftop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best location on the river, and the river is the only place to stay in Chicago
text: The historic London House has the perfect blend of modern and luxury.  The river view rooms are simply awesome and I can't express how much better of a view they give than staying anywhere else in Chicago.  My absolute favorite part of staying here is grabbing a coffee and cruising the Riverwalk early in the morning....you can't beat it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible Hotel and Staff
text: Last year, my husband proposed to me on the rooftop of LondonHouse. He had been working with them to plan the event for a few weeks, and even with the snow dumping outside, they managed to pull off a flawless proposal. Our stay was very comfortable, greeted by energetic staff and delicious food from their restaurant. I want to personally thank LondonHouse for making our engagement date so memorable, and being so helpful through all of the planning. We had such an awesome stay.The hotel is in a great location. They are in great walking distance to many different attractions.The rooms are the standard business look, with comfy beds and large bathrooms. Great views of the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome Hotel
text: We loved this hotel - charming, delightful, extremely clean, welcoming  room. Great customer service from all that assisted us during our stay. Perfect location, close to Mag Mile & Waterfront. It made our trip to Chicago, perfect!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in Chicago
text: This has been one of my best stay in Chicago.The location is brilliant, the staff very friendly and helpful.The room one of the best of any mid priced hotel I have ever had in Chicago. Great views, spacious, but also well designed with lots of nice touches. Great bathroom, amenities and bed. All in all this was an excellent choice and I was lucky enough that it was at a pretty good price point.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We had dinner on the twenty first floor restaurant on 9/8/18
text: My wife and I planned a trip to Chicago on the weekend of 9/7/2018, unbeknowned to us their was a Hotel Strike going on in the city. We had booked our room at the Palmer house hotel. They informed me that they didn‚Äôt have any rooms cleaned for us to stay there. They really went above an beyond to make sure we had a place to stay, that‚Äôs where the London House Hotel came into play, we were treated with the outmost respect and welcomed, the chef Ian and the waitress Chanel & Mr Eric Garber really made our trip worthwhile, we will definitely be staying at the Londonhouse Hotel again. Thank you for a Great weekend hopefully we will be seeing you soon. Gene & Sharon Beler

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We hosted an event here and the service was impeccable!
text: Hi Everyone,We recently hosted a 70th birthday for my mom at this hotel and everything was just perfect.  The staff was so attentive and on top of it.  When we pulled up for the event, the valets were aware of the party and knew to give us the discounted rate. Then, we walked inside, someone greeted us and took us to a reserved elevator specifically for our party so our guests didn't have to wait in the line.  All of the staff was so gracious and responsive the entire event.  Also, the rooms themselves were fantastic.  We had a suite and the pull-out bed in the front room is American Leather.  Amazing!  All in all, a great stay and we can't wait to come back!  Thanks, Everyone!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous Hotel with an Amazing Staff
text: I used my Hotels.com free night to get 50% off on this room.  Normally, I wouldn't pay this much for a room.  I will in the future!  This hotel was absolutely amazing!We were greeted by a wonderful valet for easy parking ($72 - inexpensive for Chicago), a bellhop who took our luggage to store while we went to a play before check in, Ken at the front desk who checked us in early and recommended a wonderful place to eat...This hotel really knows how to meet its customers needs!Before leaving for the show, we called down to have our luggage delivered to the room for when we got back.  Ken texted me to see how the room was.  During the show (Hamilton), I had forgotten the name of the restaurant he recommended so I texted back. A new person, TJ, said that Ken had left but got a hold of him, texted me back with the restaurant name and then made a reservation for us.  I felt extremely pampered.The room itself was lovely!  I really enjoyed the soft bed, roomy bathroom, and swanky toiletries.  The best part was the coffee though.  I'm a snob when it comes to coffee and they had a Nespresso maker...you have to try it.We visited the Rooftop Bar and were immediately seated since we were hotel guests.  The view was beautiful!I  will definitely go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing stay
text: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights ago and it was absolutely fabulous! It was my boyfriends birthday and the front desk gentleman named Saif was very attentive and accommodating with our needs. He gave us a higher floor room with a city view as well as a late check out since we checked in a little later in the day. We were very appreciative of this upgrade. The only issues with the room was the air conditioning which kept going on and off and didn't maintain cold air through the night. Also, the toilet paper holder was slightly off so every time we rolled it, it would fall off which was a bit annoying but for a one night stay, we could deal with that. The rooftop is extraordinary with the amazing view and sofas and seating. The only downside of that was that it closes at midnight on a Saturday. It would've been nice if it stayed open just a little longer. The drinks were great and we had the burger with fries which was very delicious. It had saut√©ed onions which made it taste even better. Our waitress Rachel was very nice and took amazing care of us. At check out, Ken was very nice and gave us water when we requested it. He was very professional and attentive as well. More hotels needs employees such as these three mentioned. My favorite part of this hotel was the lobby which set off a comforting vibe. It was extremely inviting and such a chill area to be in. There was a chess table, which I played for the first time and although it took 2 hours to complete the game, I never once felt like leaving this area due to how comforting it was. Definitely will be back again. Thank you for everything.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing facilities and location!
text: We stayed there over the long weekend for my moms 70th birthday.  The location is amazing right on Michigan Ave.  The food was great.  Service was great.  Facilities were brand new and high end.  Definitely would come back again. I don't think they had a pool.  Would have been nice to have that.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Stay
text: We stayed 1 night and we just booked our next stay here because we liked the hotel so much. From the helpful staff (especially Jessica!!), to the well stocked room to the ideal location near major attractions, this hotel is ideal for us. The spectacular views from the rooftop bar were icing on the cake!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay!
text: We had to be relocated to the London House unexpectedly when the hotel we were staying at originally was unable to get us into a room due to the hotel strike.  The front desk staff at the London House were so patient and friendly! (Even though I‚Äôm sure they had a ton of disgruntled guests coming though after our ordeal at the other location) The bed was comfortable, the property was immaculate, and the view of the river and skyline from our room was breathtaking! The entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Even though my friend and I had to stay in a room with 1 king (our room at the other hotel was supposed to have 2 beds/2 baths), we opted to cancel our second night at our original property at remain at the London House for the remainder of our trip because it was a wonderful experience! I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in the middle of everything
text: We stayed here for a Labor Day shopping trip. This hotel is in a great location..you can easily walk to shopping or Millenium Park. We were greeted warmly by every person we encountered at the hotel. Checkin was great and we were given waters for our Hilton Honors status. Checkin was followed up with text messages making sure that everything was ok. While the elevator banks are nice that you pick your floor, they were very slow. We had a king room on the 8th floor. The room was spotless and decorated tastefully. The entire hotel has a pleasant smell to it. The drawers in the bed bottom were a great touch. Bathroom is spacious with hot water and good water pressure. Linens are great and bed was very comfortable. Noise was minimal. This hotel is a 5 star hotel...the only thing that wasn't 5 star for my particular stay was that the room had recently been painted. Vents were missing and painters tape was still on the wall. Valet parking is also $86....we used Spothero and parked 3 minutes away for $45. The Corner Bakery next door was closed for renovations but it would be a great breakfast and lunch spot right next door.  I would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location
text: My husband and I decided to stay overnight in Chicago for our anniversary. We usually stay at a hotel either on or near the Magnificent Mile but decided to try something new. We chose to stay at The London House.  We loved the location on Wacker Drive - close to Michigan Avenue (but less crowded) and near Riverwalk.  From the moment we arrived until our departure our stay was simply lovely.  Every staff member was friendly and strived to ensure our stay was memorable and enjoyable.  The only negative was the Rooftop Terrace closed an hour early on the night of our stay so we did not have the opportunity to take in what is suppose to be a beautiful overlook of the city.  We hope to enjoy the scenic view on our next trip into the city as The London House will be our choice again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Disappointing
text: I've stayed at a number of higher-end hotels, and I expected London House to be impressive.  It was not, overall.  Good aspects:  Room was attractive and it was clean.  Valet was prompt.  Areas to improve:  The toilet should have flushed more efficiently.  I had to push in the handle for an excessive amount of time for it to flush completely.  The pillows were too soft.  At this price, I expected a combination of firmness so that I could choose the firmness that accommodated my needs.  The restaurant on the 21st floor had plenty of people working, but only one server seemed to be actually paying attention to guests, and she was accommodating, but overworked.  As a Silver Hilton Honors member, I was due two bottles of water upon check-in, which I was not offered. (I didn't realize this offer was open until I re-read my reservation confirmation a day after I checked in.)  The Digital Key did not work immediately, but worked about an hour after I checked in, then functioned properly.   Again, at this price point, I expect things to run smoothly.  London House has some work to do.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great views from room
text: had a king vista room. great views of the city. great location right on the river, walk to everything. tours restaurants,riverwalk. excellent service from start to finish. room was clean and bright  definitely return

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: 5 mins walk to river walk, water taxis, and Wandella river tour. 10 mins walk to the bean. A historical building with modern decor. Everything in our room looked bland new; very clean.  Amenities including disposable slippers that are good quality were a big plus. Nespresso machine and fridge in the room. We were able to watch our Netflix using their TV.Diamond member gets $12 boucher for Land and Lake restaurant.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful property, location and staff
text: From Martha at check in to housekeeping, to the room and amenities, the hotel exceeded our expectations. We typically stay elsewhere but wanted to try some where new. The LondonHouse hit the mark.Rooftop bar views were terrific, but too much people traffic moving through. Though our waitress was perfect for us.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Our New Go-To Hotel in Chicago
text: We spent a long Labor Day Weekend at the LHH. We had a Vista Room on the 20th-floor with an incredible view of the Chicago River facing west. The room was very clean and featured a separate seating area with a fold-out sofabed and a large tv. Being one floor below the 21st-floor bar was sometimes loud but bearable. We knew going in that might be the case when staying one floor below. At times there were waits for the elevators but we didn't consider this unusual as the hotel was very busy. The rooftop bar was fantastic though we recommend getting reservations far in advance. It's certainly worth it just for the view. The lobby bar staff was friendly and quick in getting our drinks. The entire staff was friendly from the people on the street all the way to the housekeeping staff--and everyone in between. We had some small issues on arrival which were quickly addressed by the courteous and efficient management staff. When in Chicago we have always stayed at the Palmer House--another Hilton property. We love it there but the LHH has now become our first choice. Our biggest disappointment was their inability to control the 90-plus degree outside temperatures and the rain. Perhaps they could work on that before our next visit. :-)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Views and in the center of Entertainment!
text: London house was recently renovated and is absolutely beautiful.. The best part was the rooftop restraunt/bar. The staff was awesome and the views were excellent!! Since we were guest, they didn‚Äôt make us have a reservation and we got up with no wait. The hotel is located in the heart of the city.. Walking distance to many attractions.. Mag mile/ city board walk along the river are right out the door!!! Worth the stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: brunch on a sunday on rooftop, very nice
text: We had brunch on a very hot Sunday on the london house rooftop. Views are breathtaking, as good as it gets. They did not have much umbrella shade for most seats on a a sunny summer day which is the only negative. Food was very good . A must see /eat for tourist.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent service
text: My husband and I stayed here for our 30 th anniversary. The concierge upgraded our room to a river view for free. They also left chocolate covered strawberries in our room! The room was very clean and comfortable . The Riverwalk was just across the street and provided a wonderful evening walk after dinner. The rooftop bar had a gorgeous view of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing service and view!!
text: Cannot say enough about the excellent customer service and amazing views from the room! Would absolutely stay again!! The staff were very attentive and courteous, from the valet, to bellman, to front desk, to rooftop restaurant staff!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful rooftop bar
text: Came here with 2 friends. We were not staying at the hotel, just wanted to enjoy the rooftop bar. We came on a Saturday afternoon. It was a beautiful day so very crowded but we were able to have a drink and stand near the balcony edge to enjoy it. Great views. Pricey drinks but of course we knew they would be so don‚Äôt be surprised. We enjoyed our time there and I would go again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stylish Luxury
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past year. My last visit was a few days ago and it was a pleasant experience. This hotel consistently delivers each time. You can‚Äôt get a bad room here, they havehuge flat screens (55 inches) and the most comfortable beds. I‚Äôve stayed in their regular King rooms and also their suite. All are wonderful. During my last visit I was recovering from a bad cold/flu bug and from the room service attendant to the doorman/bell hop- all were so personable and asked if I am okay and how I was feeling. Little touches like that make you feel as if you are home away from home. Would recommend, this is my go to hotel when in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best hotel in Chicago with a great view
text: If your looking for the best view in Chicago from your hotel window or rooftop this is the place, great front desk service. Keith & Paloma were very friendly and welcoming, Rooms are very luxurious. Best hotel in Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thank You London House!!
text: Where to start? I‚Äôm a world traveler and London House staff has made me feel like home. The Bell desk staff was so attentive and taking good care of my Louie Vuitton‚Äôs. When I checked in I was greeted by the manager Paloma, she was excellent, I can tell she‚Äôs passionate to help me. The room was beautiful!!  The view was the river and the trump tower, breakfast was so worth it, yummy and oh.. the unlimited mimosas... to die for! Best hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simply Amazing!!!
text: As soon as you walk through the main hotel entrance you have a wonderful team of employees smiling and greeting you. The Front office team is simply amazing!! Specially.. Paloma, Keith (with the good hair), Susannah & Jalesa. Matthew who checked me in was so attentive made us feel like royalty. The hotel is stunning, my beautiful room was simply stunning. The London house is a Chicago landmark and a modern hotel to visit, oh did I mention they have the best rooftop in the entire city of Chicago!!! Also enjoying some bubbly while I see my amazing views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: You'll want to stay here!!!
text: Superb personalization and professional service!  Very clean!!  Great food and surprisingly great prices.  The staff was very accommodating and kind.   Love the random text offering further service!  Excellent location to the Mile and river walking.   EXCELLENT experience!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and the hotel and staff were amazing. Trevor on reception was very nice. He gave us a complimentary room upgrade because his 'ancestors were Scottish' (and so are we!!!). Great views over the river from our room. Beds were huge and VERY comfortable. Bedding was smooth and cooling! This is a very well located hotel and the staff were all very helpful. A nice touch on checking out was Martha on reception mentioning that we had a bill for $5 for a bottle of water. We were expecting to pay it of course but Martha said ' we got it!' and wiped it. Nice touch London House. I would highly recommend this hotel for location and luxury!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Stay at the London House
text: From check in to check out we had an outstanding experience! The room was beautiful as was the entire property. We attended a wedding and reception on site and it couldn‚Äôt have been any nicer. Everything was orchestrated perfectly. The food was delicious, the staff, amazing! We also paid a visit to the rooftop bar and the views were beautiful. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to visit the London House again or highly recommend it to anyone and everyone!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous Hotel
text: I absolutely loved this hotel. Beautiful, clean, high end and fantastic location right across from the river. I faced Trump Tower and the river view was amazing. Perfect location in the Chicago loop. The room was so nice and unique. The pillows were actually comfy which is rare for a hotel. Very nice size room. A little dim however I think it added to the ambiance and in the afternoon with the curtains open there is plenty of light. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding weekend
text: We recently had my Daughters wedding reception at the London House and I Just wanted to say how wonderful the reception was along with our entire weekend stay there was absolutely the best!Steve Slecka and his staff were simply amazing! the food was outstanding!I was told by at least a dozen people that the food was the best they had ever had at a wedding!Steve's coordination of the wedding party and with getting everything organized for the reception that day was perfect!  He did an amazing job!We will definitely be coming back to enjoy the sights of the rooftop!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: have stayed there manay times through out the years always great service and a iconic place in chicago.
text: having spent time at this hotel for high school graduation engagement to my wife.  Special occasions like thanksgiving, Easter and New Years Eve over about 25 years.  If you love to experience the old grandeur of the old classic hotels this is it in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location with an amazing View
text: The hotel was really cool and had an awesome view.  Concierge, front desk, and bartenders were amazingly friendly and helpful.  My group enjoyed the roof top, their meeting space and the lobby bar.  I was so impressed with the food for the meeting as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Second Time
text: I was in town and booked this hotel through the Hilton Honors App.  It had a great rate.   I chose a regular room as apposed the Vista Room.  It was on the corner of Michigan Avenue and Wacker Drive.  This was a beautiful room with an incredible view. The staff was extremely friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice spot in Chicago
text: Stayed here one night.  Overall a very good hotel in a good location - walkable to lots of restaurants and bars.  Room was spacious, clean, and well-furnished.  Only complaints (and they‚Äôre minor) are the slow elevators and the fact that our room wasn‚Äôt stocked with coffee and it wasn‚Äôt delivered after we requested it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous location excellent service
text: We thoroughly enjoyed this historic hotel the location was perfect for shopping the room was exceptional and had a great view of the river and magnificent mile and the restaurant and lounge on the rooftop was fabulous.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel!
text: Perfect location off Michigan Avenue with good access to the redline for Cubs games. The rooms were beautiful, and I definitely recommend the upgrade to the river view with floor to ceiling windows...it was amazing. The room had a fridge, nespresso machine, robes, Netflix, WiFi, & lots of extra bath accessories including a dental kit. They really thought of everything. The hotel is very clean, & there were lots of elevators, so the wait was minimal. There‚Äôs a nice rooftop bar area as well. The customer service was great from the front desk to the valet. Really loved everything about this hotel. Would definitely go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Choice Hotel for Chicago!
text: Really nice hotel located on Wacker at Michigan. The hotel has a historic feel and the rooms are fresh and clean. Room coverings, furniture and amenities are upscale. I was fortunate to have a room with a nice view of the river, though I imagine all rooms have nice views of the city. The exercise facility is nice, though not big. Also, don't miss the rooftop bar, where you get incredible views of the river and Chicago. The hotel is in a great location with excellent bars and restaurants within minutes walking distance in every direction. Be mindful of the elevators that ask you to enter your floor then tell you what elevator to go to. It will catch you off guard if you're not paying attention. Also, the elevators are a little loud and can be distracting if you have a room near the elevators.Overall, the Londonhouse is a choice hotel in Chicago and is my new go-to for my trips to the city. You will not be disappointed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: ChicagoVisit
text: Excellent location for easy access to the city! Amazing view of the river and a relaxing atmosphere. An enthusiastic team provided outstanding service! ...and did I mention, the bed was extremely comfortable!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Most comfy beds... & so much more! Best of the best!!
text: A hotel can be incredible and have all the bells & whistles, but if the beds aren‚Äôt comfortable, does it really matter? You won‚Äôt have that problem at LondonHouse Chicago, since one look at the beds and we could tell they were going to be comfortable to sleep in. And we were right‚Ä¶ the mattress was amazing, and the linens were top-of-the-line. I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôve ever slept in such a comfortable hotel bed, and we‚Äôve stayed at a lot of high-end hotels! In fact, if there‚Äôs any complaint to give this hotel, it‚Äôs that you won‚Äôt want to get out of bed to explore the city! üòä Funny thing is, we stayed here as our Plan B hotel‚Ä¶ we have a favorite Hilton brand hotel in Chicago, but it was booked on this last-minute trip, so we were happy to give LondonHouse Chicago a try. And are we ever glad we did! It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel with friendly staff, and when we walked into our room and saw two big screen TVs with an incredible view, we were thrilled. But when we sunk into bed that night, we knew we had found a new go-to hotel in Chicago. Oh, and can we just talk about the location‚Ä¶ at the intersection of Wacker & Michigan overlooking the river, could it really be any better?! We can‚Äôt wait to come back to this gem!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing place!
text: If you want a great view and great service come here. Vana and Heather were so nice.  We didn‚Äôt want to leave.  The place is on the 21st floor right by the Riverwalk so the views are amazing.  We didn‚Äôt have the food but it looked good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Rocks!
text: The London House rocks!  This amazingly-swanky hotel offers top-notch customer service, super comfortable and well-appointed rooms, and an absolute prime location.  Highly recommend this spot for your next Chicago stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel Staff are not as professional as they appear
text: A hotel employee let a group of us board a malfunctioned elevator.  It dropped a foot and then stalled.  We forced the door open and stepped up and out.. he was smiling and giggling.. (WHAT A JERK!).  No signs that the elevator was out of service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First class hotel
text: This hotel was superb. The location was perfect. A bit pricy for room only, but that's Chicago.Staff were all nice.A good happy hour in the bar.However the queue on checkout was horrendous.Only one person serving and a huge queue snaking all along the lounge.Luckily we had plenty of time to catch our plane.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Another excellent stay
text: Stayed at one of our favorites, the London House in Chicago.  The hotel is in a terrific location at Wacker and Michigan.  The rooms are very nice here.  As always the service is excellent.  The staff members are very attentive to the guests.  A terrific place to stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great drinks & views!
text: Amazing drinks! A bit pricy but it‚Äôs downtown so we didn‚Äôt mind paying. We stayed 1 night and received a great upgrade to the river and Trump tower since we were celebrating my friends birthday. Rooms were very clean and modern, the front desk was very accommodating and nice. Will definitely be returning, so far my favorite hotel in Chicago. I‚Äôve stayed at many more, but this one has definitely made me feel great, and it‚Äôs a fun hotel with the roof top and views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Proposal at LH
text: I proposed at London House this month and it was Amazing!  Manny helped me along the way with the proposal package. He was a great host and made everything worry free for me.  My Fianc√© was in shock.  Best day of her life.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Michelle in Lobby Bar (2nd Floor) is amazing
text: Michelle in the lobby bar (2nd floor) is amazing. Makes great drinks and the best recommendations. Was there for a week long conference and I made sure to stop by every night to have a Chicago with Michelle.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Chicago Hotel
text: LondonHouse is an amazing Hotel and I cannot believe how interesting the interior is! Curio/Hilton did an awesome job with this property. Don‚Äôt miss the rooftop bar - they have an amazing view of the Chicago River and it‚Äôs a great place to take-in the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent service and location
text: Our first time to LondonHouse and it was for our anniversary.  At the desk we were greeted by Ken who was very friendly and gave us so much information regarding the hotel.  He congratulated us on our anniversary and upgraded our room.  He ensured us that if we ever needed anything the hotel staff would take care of us.  He was correct. Then we spoke with T.J., our concierge, who gave us information on several restaurants we could walk to.  This information was very helpful and we were able to walk to several great places to eat.  These two gentlemen and the entre staff from valets to bellmen were always friendly and helpful.  Our stay was wonderful and gave us wonderful anniversary memories.  I highly recommend the LondonHouse.Located on Wacker right on the Chicago River near Michigan Ave., this hotel has one of the best locations.  There are so many restaurants, stores, and sites that you could walk to without using your vehicle.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Honestly the best!!
text: Just spent 4 nights at the LondonHouse Chicago.  You can‚Äôt beat the location - easy to walk from the Magnificent Mile to Millennium Park.  I am so impressed with everything.  Matthew at the front desk was so wonderful & made checkin so easy.  As a Hilton Honors member I was upgraded to a beautiful view room.  The rooms were spacious, immaculate, and nice amenities in the room.  Great job housekeeping!!  The rooftop lounge was the best!  Eric the manager was very nice & and is doing a phenomenal job!!  I will definitely be back!  Kuddos to the entire staff!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bridges Lobby Bar is the best!!!
text: I came for a conference and my colleagues came here every night. It was a very relaxed environment with gorgeous views. Most importantly, the bartender Michelle made the best drinks :-) The food was also very good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Getaway
text: Valet staff were welcoming and very quick to get us, and our bags into the hotel.  Ken, the front desk clerk upgraded our room at check in when we told him we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary!  He asked us if we had an itinerary and suggested some additional places to go if we had time. TJ, the concierge, gave us excellent restaurant suggestions and directions.  Our room was very clean and filled with great amenities!     It is located within easy walking distance for a river cruise and many, many restaurants.  Valet parking was quick when we did need our vehicle.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: THE IDEAL LOCATION IN A CITY OF SUPERLATIVES
text: This follows a similarly highly approving review in 2017 - although with an exception to be noted.  Located within a historic building overlooking the re-imagined Chicago River and its noteworthy river walk extending all the way to Lake Michigan, this is a hotel of superlatives.  The newly expanded outside roof bar has eye-popping views of the Chicago River, famous architecture such as Tribune Tower and the Wrigley Building, even the lake.  Not to be missed.  Because the all-new rooms were made part of a 90 year building, expect that sizes and views will vary.  This review refers to the deluxe river front rooms.  Many creature comforts await in the high-quality rooms, including gorgeous carpeting, comfortable beds with pillows selection, enormous 50 inch television, individual room-lighting controls, and mini fridge.  The massive bright bath even has its own large window, with electrically operated shade for the modest.  Even a classy radio with excellent sound doubles as a clock and USB outlet.  Although the solid doors tend to close everywhere with a decided bang, the rooms in general have excellent soundproofing.  A  Nespresso machine with different coffee pods adds to the amenities.  Surprisingly, little storage space was included in the gut rehab.  The reason why the property did not earn five stars this year results from management neglecting to inform the front desk or anyone that the purpose of the visit was to celebrate a special event.  On a successful discussion with front desk agent Tori, who merits appreciation, resulted in confirmation into a river-facing room without the additional cost otherwise applicable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: This hotel is at a prime location. Great walking distance to most attraction.  I thought the hotel was very clean. Beds were average.  Staff was very friendly.  We got there a little early for check in but waited by the bar and had an esspresso martini which was amazing! The rooftop was very pretty by night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing rooftop
text: We visited the rooftop for the first time in 8 years traveling often to Chicago and I regret for not having done it before.Cool atmosphere, excellent drinks menu, wonderful views....We were lucky to be able to book a table for 7 people as soon as we arrived since it‚Äôs a very popular place all day long.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent, highly recommend
text: Excellent quality hotel with great hotel service.  Highly recommend for business or leisure travel.  Price his high, but cannot beat the service, location, and excellent accommodations.  Would book again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning views but a bit pricey!!
text: So this hotel is amazing for location. From most of the rooms facing the street you'll get a stunning view of the river and you're situated right on the junction of Michigan and Wacker which is a great place to be be downtown.The hotel has a rooftop bar which is quite impressive but gets very busy.Rooms are adequate and fairly clean but I'm not sure are quite worth the high prices. You really are paying for the location.A bit strange I found was that there is no room service after 10pm so if you arrive late forget trying to get any food from anywhere in the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Friendly staff. Lovely rooms with a comfortable bed. Big bathroom and located just a couple of minutes walk from magnificent mile. Elevators where slow because the Hotel was busy due to a concert. I would love to stay in this hotel again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of everything in Chicago. The views are spectacular from the roof top patio.  The hotel is modern and the rooms are clean and spacious. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London house Chicago
text: Had a great experience with this hotel.Couldn't beat the location.All of the staff from the door man to the concierge were always professional...polite and helpful.Location was amazing.....concierge was top notch from bookings....travel directions to recommendations.Loved the room....Fridge....robes...bFridge....robes...bathroom shower....tv....bed was great.The ice machine was great...lolOver all fantastic...the hotel was never an issue....great place to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: AMAZING
text: The staff are super responsive. They really make you feel welcome. Will help track down a taxi if needed, load & unload luggage for you. The location is great too. The hotel is located right off the Chicago River and depending on room location you can see either the city/river or a view of the river and Lake Michigan.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My kind of hotel
text: Modern interior, scenic views, excellent customer service and luxurious amenities. The lounge makes decent drinks too. My only criticism is the elevators can be very slow, even with 6 of them. Would definitely stay again though.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location.
text: Pros:-The location was perfect, right in  between the magnificent mile and Navy Pier. Close to Millennium Park.-Besides having to stare at a giant Trump sign, the view was lovely.-The rooftop area and bar were great, although we couldn't enjoy the actual rooftop because it was just too crowded, I think with a party.-The rooms and bathrooms were clean and nicely decorated.Cons:-Did I mention the giant Trump sign?-The room was a bit on the small side, but still OK for 3-We had a really hard time navigating to it, the street behind was shut down for a TV filming. We eventually gave up and went to our parking spot instead. There's not a lot of room to pull off and get your stuff out-Parking is super expensive. I just used SpotHero to arrange a nearby space for about a third of what the hotel charged.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Time at the London House!
text: Fantastic Location - Wonderful run along the river to the lake front and along the lakeshore all the way to the Planetarium - passing along the way the marina, Grant Park w/ the fountain & Aquarium.  Room was relaxing with all the amenities. Staff were amazing & sincere in wanting you to have a great visit in Chi town!  Just a block away from Mariano's groceries & many restaurants. Staff here & your trip will be a true get-a-way.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Charm. Mind the Trump.
text: The hotel is beautiful, the lobby and downstairs areas have been restored to its old world charm with pressed metal ceilings in the street level entrance and spectacular views on 21st floor bar. Rooms are beautiful and hotel service is very good to excellent. The river view rooms should be spectacular except for the ginormous Trump sign blocking the view. Centrally located and within walking distance of everything. I am a fan of the peppermint shampoo. Rooms are not sound proof to the outside traffic, you can hear every car horn, ambulance, fire truck, police siren, V8 engine and motorcycle passing by, even on the 17th floor. Despite this it is generally noise proof internally (other guests passing by within the hotel). I would stay here again just for the atmosphere and central location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Views great. Rooms Quite Small.
text: This was my 1st time to stay at a London House hotel. Given price point, my expectations were quite high.  The place was furnished well & clean. The elevators were complex & very slow‚Äîeven tho there were 6 of them. Surprised there were no upgrades available, being a Diamond member & tiny rooms. Hotel restaurant was clean. Wait time for breakfast on Day 1 was >than expected (15 mins) even tho 2/3 of restaurant wasn‚Äôt occupied. Mgt did provide a concession credit due after giving feedback that I wasn‚Äôt able to use. Overall, above average & i would try it again given high service attitude of the team.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Loved our stay at this hotel, beautiful rooms with a lovely view. Spacious bathroom. Great location by the magnificent mile and river walk and navy pier. Friendly staff. Beautiful lobby.. very efficient concierge. Lovely terrace on top floor. It was the perfect stay in Chicago. Would definitely visit again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I love this hotel
text: I have been traveling to Chicago on business downtown for months and this is the best hotel I have stayed in.  Staff is lovely and the rooms are delightful.  The caveat is the city view rooms have a beautiful view of the river and Trump towers, they are however very loud.  I had a city view room for this first trip and have figured out which rooms are away from Michigan Ave and are much quieter.  The rooms are very well appointed and the sheets and mattress are memorable.   The honors breakfast in the restaurant on the first floor is spectacular and staff is great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Epic Happy Hour!
text: My husband and I went to the rooftop bar only for a few drinks prior to going to dinner elsewhere. It was romantic and the views were breathtaking. We did not order food but I would definitely go again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location!
text: The location at the corner of Michigan Avenue by the river is perfect for exploring all of Chicago.  We walked from the hotel up to the Lincoln Park Zoo and down to the Shed Aquarium area.  There is a great rooftop bar area with great views of Chicago.  The rooms were excellent and comfy.  The bathrooms were very good.  We were in a room overlooking the river with floor to ceiling windows and the views were outstanding (except for staring at that awful Trump building ;) )  The lights in the room are a pain however.  You need to punch the buttons several times before they react.  Annoying.  Another oddity is that there is no service elevator so we rode with pushy bellman with huge carts of luggage and folks with rolling carts of room service food.  Typically if the elevator is full the bellman won't try to squeeze in but not here.  The elevators are also a bit weird.  You have to have punch in your destination on a keypad and they tell you which elevator to get in.  Make a mistake and you're going for a ride as there are no buttons on the inside of the elevator.  You go where it tells you to go.  Obviously, you get used to it and it probably is much more efficient but it is a bit odd.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great service recovery from Keith the director of rooms
text: ArrivalsHad no issue on checking in the front desk are very friendly and helpful Room and facilities Very clean and the decor is great and views outstanding. Great range of amenities and facilities are standard Service Room next to me was having party I complained about the noise and they could not move me as it was full. However the director of rooms was brilliant  and if it was not for him this would certainly not be 5/5Concierge Well I went concierge to ask to get done tickets and I was told to go google it! I was mortified. Rooftop bar The staff need realise this is a hotel not just a bar Just because you don‚Äôt fit into the look and of the normal locals and bar clientele I felt a bit unwelcome The sign of a good hotel is the recovery when things don‚Äôt go to plan. This hotel epitomises this.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice hotel
text: Everything about the hotel was great.  Very nice service from front desk to breakfast in the restaurant in the morning.  The rooms are very nice and everything is in wonderful shape.  The view of the river from the rooms was nice.The location is great with many restaurants around and right near the magnificent mile.  The breakfast for honors gold or diamond is a $12 credit in the Land and Lake restaurant on the first floor of the building.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel makes you feel like a Boss
text: This hotel is the perfect place to stay for a quick trip to Chicago if you're ok with splurging a little bit to get a downtown hotel with amazing views and awesome rooftop. It is definitely on the pricey side for hotels in Chicago but the location could not be beat - it is right on the river and in the middle of everything. The hotel is super swanky and recently updated so the rooms make you feel like a boss. There is a restaurant upstairs that is super well designed and has a really cosmopolitan feel. There is a bar on the roof that has amazing views and is such an awesome place to hangout for an afternoon drink or stop through for lounging at night. A lot of people come from other places in the city to go to this rooftop but guests don't have to wait in the line that forms at the elevators downstairs. Pay a little extra for a river view room - it is so worth it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: FABULOUS
text: First time in Chicago!! Stay at the London house.. You will not be disappointed!!! Great rooms,great service,great location. The vista rooms are amazing. If you go to bed before 12:00 do not stay on the 20th floor. You can hear music from rooftop bar!! Other than that, Enjoy!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved it !
text: Great location, great views, great room, great people ! Everyone who we dealt with were so pleasant and friendly. Being right on the river with the new river walk was the perfect place to walk, eat and people watch. Our next trip to Chicago will definitely include The London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago sky line
text: If you are visiting Chicago in summer don‚Äôt miss the real fun from London house rooftop bar. Amazing music with the best sky line for Chicago.We really had fun there.I posted some photos I hope you will like it but the reality is much better.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Stay in the Windy City
text: I stayed here for one night.  I was assigned room 550.Check-in was quick and easy.  I arrived at approximately 10:00 AM and my room was ready.  What a pleasant surprise!  Jalesa checked me in. She was such a happy, friendly person.  Great customer service!A few minutes after I arrived in my room I received a personalized text message from Jalesa making sure everything was ok.  What a great personal touch.I also interacted with Shannon, one of the concierge.  She was very helpful, patient, pleasant, and knowledgeable!The room - it was HUGE and I had a nice side view of the Chicago River.  Now, it is important to note that when I checked out, I commented that the room was HUGE and the front desk agent was surprised.  So, I do not think all of the rooms are the same size.  I loved the size of the room.  It was clean, nicely appointed, and the AC worked perfectly.  However, there are two things I would change - there is no light over the desk, so the room is actually quite dark and if you want to work at the desk, the lighting is not adequate.   The bathroom was also very large.  However, I prefer a removable or adjustable shower head.  This was just a stationery shower head, so the water pressure was not the best.I had breakfast at Land & Lake Kitchen.  HiltonHonors Gold and Diamond members receive a $12 voucher to use at the restaurant for breakfast.  Breakfast was fine and service was ok.  Neither the taste of the food or service stood out to me.They have a rooftop bar and lounge on the 21st floor.  It seems to be VERY popular, as there was always a long line waiting for the elevator.I checked my bag with the bellman so I could explore for the day. Upon arrival to retrieve my bag, it was somewhat chaotic.  Multiple people were waiting a very long time for their bags.  However, I personally did not have to wait too long.  I did overhear the bellmen say that the bags are on the 6th floor, so it takes a substantial amount of time for them to go up, get the bags, and bring them back down.The location is PERFECT.  A great spot to explore Chicago and an easy quick walk from the nearest subway/metro station. Five stars for location,Zonnie checked me out.  She was just as happy and friendly as all of the other staff I interacted with.  Five stars for customer service.Overall this is a great property.  If my travels ever bring be back to Chicago, I would consider staying here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Property
text: The London House is a perfect example of an Historical Hotel, on the National Register, that has been updated to meet the times.  The experience from the lobby to check is customer centered.  The electronic elevators and restaurants are modern; the staff is friendly and welcoming.  It is a perfect location for business and leisure.  It was walking distance to both shopping and the museums.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Poor Service
text: Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, WORST CHECK IN EXPERIENCE EVER! My family planned a last minute trip on Labor Day weekend and this was the only hotel that still had rooms available that met all our needs...particularly, has suites, kitchenette, central location, river view. The online booking experience was challenging because hotels were booking up quickly. The following day I called and requested a high floor, river view room. The staff assigned me a specific floor, notified me of the upgrade fee and I confirmed my change. Our 4.5 hour drive from St Louis took 7+ hours because of traffic. Needless to say my toddler was a mess by arrival. As we were checking in I asked the staff member to confirm the requested room type. I was then told that there was no record of my request and that the hotel was sold out so they couldn‚Äôt make any changes. What ensued was an almost 1 hour process to rectify their mistake. I was asked no less than 4 times (3 by the same person) who I spoke with at the hotel, and NOT ONCE did the staff apologize for the inconvenience (which was huge given my clearly exhausted and frustrated toddler...and the rest of my family). Eventually...after saying multiple times that they were sold out and there was nothing they could do and me standing my ground saying that was unacceptable...the manager miraculously found an available room with a river view. He then tried to charge me a higher upgrade fee, which I refused to do. Again...not once were the words sorry/apologize ever used. Furthermore, the staff made us feel like we were unwelcome and an inconvenience/annoyance to them. Unacceptable no matter how much we were paying but worsened by the fact that this was one of the more expensive hotels, plus the cost of parking our car with them for the entire trip. After that we tried to make the most of our short trip. The room was very comfortable and the view of the river was wonderful! My toddler loved looking at the boats go by. As noted above, the location is perfect. The hop on/hop off buses have a stop right outside the hotel. We easily walked up Michigan Ave all the way to 360 and back. On the last day we got breakfast from Corner Bakery Cafe in the Lobby, which was delicious, affordable and convenient. 5 stars for the hotel, 1 star for the service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location, nice river view.
text: Our family stayed here one night for a family function, last minute award booking.Location is perfect, right off Michigan ave, walking distance to everywhere.Hotel is very busy, very hip, nice view of the city and river'sCheck in was fast and easy, staff very friend'sRooms are bit small but nicely decorated, water pressure on the low side.Breakfast was $12 voucher, plenty of selections, good food.Parking is $72 a night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Buffett @ Wrigley
text: In town for the Buffett concert and stayed 3 nights...WOW, what a fantastic place! Views 2nd to none, service was over the top, great bars, and walking distance to top restaurants. Will definitely be back next time in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Hip Trendy Popular Hotel
text: We stayed here 4 nights.  This hotel is very clean, updated and very popular with wedding groups.  The location is wonderful if you are visiting Chicago for the first time.  Rooms are are the small size, but still nice.  Service is very good.  Wonderful check process with Trevor.  Breakfast was nice in the restaurant located on the premise.  We did not go up to the roof terrace...there seemed to be long lines every time to go up and I would say the only issue was that some visitors would get on the elevator to sneak up, only to find that they needed to go back downstairs to reach to roof terrace.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A lovely hotel in the middle of Chicago
text: You cannot get any closer to the innards of Chicago than staying at LondonHouse Chicago, situated at the corner of Wacker and Michigan.  Almost all destinations both north and south of the river are accessible on foot.  The hotel itself is a historic building turned into a modern hotel.  Our room, while a bit small (in the European mode!), had all the required amenities and was quite comfortable.  The hotel boasts a rooftop bar and grill that offers spectacular views but becomes very crowded in the evenings.  We enjoyed a drink there around 4 p.m. but noted long lines at the elevator in subsequent hours. Normally, a hotel such as this would be too expensive for us, but we used some Hilton Honor points to limit the cost.  I would certainly return if finances and schedule would permit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sisters Trip
text: I celebrated my birthday with my sisters in Chicago on July 19th and stayed at the London House. I was impressed with the excellent service I received from Caitlin, Shannon and Anthony. Overall, the staff was genuinely NICE which made our stay such a pleasant experience. My sisters and I love this beautiful hotel, the view from our room was amazing and location is perfect. LIZ.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hospitality!
text: My stay at LondonHouse was amazing. The coordinator at the front desk was a pleasure. I was treated very well. The hotel is very nice and the view from the window is amazing. There are lots of restaurants around. Also, Magnificent Mile is not far away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic rooms!
text: I stayed here for a girls weekend in the city, and it was great! There was a conference and check-in was a mess, but someone came to get us checked in via the app, and when we were having trouble, they went above and beyond to go grab our keys so we could get to the room. As a diamond member, I was upgraded to a river view, which was way better than the view from the rooftop bar! As a guest at the hotel, you can skip the crazy elevator line to the rooftop, but we were less than impressed once we got up there. It was insanely crowded, impossible to get a drink, and when we finally had a chance to look at the menu, we laughed and left. Even for Chicago standards, the prices were insane. We went to the Gold Coast and spent half as much per drink if that gives you any idea. The room was nice, bathroom was large with great amenities. The bed was super comfortable with really nice sheets, lots of fluffy pillows, and a down comforter. From someone who travels way more than I would like for work, and stays at a lot of hotels, I would say these sheets are probably the most luxurious I have had at a hotel in years! We did get breakfast coupons, but slept in after a late night and missed the time, so can't speak for it. The location can't be beat, the views are fantastic, employees are wonderful. I will definitely be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great hotel in an excellent location!
text: Visited as a stopover after a long flight and it‚Äôs in a great location just off Magnificent mile. Lots of good restaurants nearby and close for shopping / sight seeing. A good check in and a relaxing lobby bar. The rooms are modern , fresh with all the modern facilities . The rooftop bar is a cool location for the partygoers but I found it a bit too crowded and noisy to enjoy. There has been some comments from reward members like me about the poor breakfast but we had a voucher that covered us for a decent breakfast at the associated cafe on the ground floor - all good. The staff were pleasant and professional

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best View & Great Service
text: I come here often to enjoy the beautiful views and great ambiance, on this particular day I was with my Dad for a delayed Father's Day outing. We had no reservations for the corner tables (which are reserved for hotel guest or pre-reserved seating) It was hot and I walked my Dad all over downtown all day, so A seat would have been nice. I asked a random person if I purchased a bottle can I bypass reservations (he said yes maybe). Usually a host or hostess would accept that offer if possible. Well, Cruz (the VIP host) had overheard my conversation and came and found me a few minutes later to tell me there was a place available for 2 to sit, "no bottle purchase necessary he says, order what we want and enjoy our day" He was just an amazing host and made us feel special. Needless to say we ordered food and drinks and enjoyed a great evening because of this gentleman Cruz. This is a definite must see location in Chicago, one of the best views of the city great people, beautiful women and vibes. I have tons of images here hope you enjoy. Your selfies will be amazing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, very nice hotel
text: The LondonHouse has a great location on the Southwest corner of No. Michigan Avenue and Wacker Drive, on the Chicago River. The views can be great, but unfortunately our direct view was of the name ‚ÄúTrump‚Äù on the tower across the river.  The rooms are not large, but they‚Äôre quiet, nicely furnished, and very clean. The elevators are unusually efficient, and the four restaurants and bars in the hotel offer variety. Land & Lakes, on the street level, offers a good breakfast at a reasonable price by hotel standards. Try Bridges, the lobby bar, which has good views and an upbeat vibe.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really Nice Hotel
text: Perfect location and beautifully renovated hotel in the middle of everything downtown.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.  The room was very modern and clean.  A little tight, but thats to be expected in an old building. The only con was the horrible internet.  The restaurant connected to the lobby was not worth it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location
text: LondonHouse is an excellent hotel in a great location.   The rooms are very well finished, extremely quiet, and exceptionally clean.   It‚Äôs definitely one of the best hotels in the Wacker/Michigan area.    The pricing can change dramatically from day to day, so be cautious when booking.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse is amazing - especially the rooftop bar!
text: Just had a fantastic long weekend at the LondonHouse. Everyone was incredibly helpful and friendly (true midwesterners). Highly recommend this property.Close to the river, museums, and great restaurants. Would have loved room service to be open past 10 and the bar to be open past midnight.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hipster
text: Wow - this is the definition of a trendy hipster hotel. Registration is on the 2nd floor. There will be a number of employees standing around looking to bring your bags up for you but if you aren't looking for help I noticed that they don't tend to offer directions as freely. The room was pretty small - but not smaller than you often see in NYC and it was well appointed. The desk clerk said she was upgrading me to a room with park and lake views. I looked out the window and could only see the interior courtyard. Perhaps the desk clerks need to spend some time actually on the floors. So, zero view - bu the trade off was reduced street noise. If that was a diamond upgrade it was a fail. so, I'll assume it was a "no upgrade."The bathroom had decent space - two people could get ready at the same time. There was a small but workable desk.There were plenty of power outlets at the desk and bedside. Nice.The A/C was excellent. The property is in an area with a weak Verizon signal. Or maybe that was by virtue of being in an interior room facing the inside - whatever the reason, it was a problem.Overall, a very trendy hipster joint. Decide for yourself if that is a good thing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great views
text: The London House is a great hotel with a location that is easy to access. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and responsive. The rooftop bar was nice to hang out on and when there is a line to get in, hotel guests have priority. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Experience
text: Great people! Perfect Location. Very cool bars and rooftop. I stayed at London House for the very first time and would definitely return again. Incredible views of the river and City, but the people really made the difference.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a wonderful hotel
text: I stayed at the hotel for two nights. Best location with beautiful view, great staff with kindness, and awesome place to stay!!!Loop top is the best place to see the great view at any time after 11:00am. I took a bus when I visited some place. It‚Äôs very close to the bus station. Breakfast at Land & Lake was good. White egg omelet is the best.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Lobby Bar
text: The roof top had an AMAZING VIEW!!! But was really crowded and didn't have music pound enough to hear. We headed downstairs to Lobby Bar. Its in incredibly beautiful. Lucia server and TJ made our night extra special. TJ is a great dancer and wealth of information.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great staff, fantastic rooftop bar
text: Highly recommended.  From check in with Tori to the quick text to check out everything was fabulous.  If you get a chance you need to visit the rooftop bar on the 22nd floor.  Unbelievable view down the river and looking down onto the Trump outdoor bar area.  Our group of 14 had a pretty big table area and Mary our hostess/waitress was awesome.  Will definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Posh hotel in heart of downtown Chicago
text: Beautiful and spotless room. Large bathroom and shower. World class service. Felt as if I was staying in the lap of luxury. Nespresso machine, even soap smelled amazing. Highly recommend and would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Loop Landmark Building
text: this centrally located hotel on upper wacker is a jewel. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed - view of the river is awesome..... nice ground floor restaurant for breakfast or a snack.. the rooftop deck is a must see. you can walk practically to anywhere from it - be it River North, shopping on Michigan avenue or to the Art Institute

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a location!
text: Beautiful views, great rooms, mysterious elevators, weird toilet controls, built in Chromecast for TV.  Afternoon Tea was fantastic.  Meeting room had a beautiful river view.  Meals were good too!  Hope to visit again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and when we pulled up in front of the hotel I was amazed at the location.   Check in was not till 4oclock but when we arrived at 1 they let us check in early.   Our view from the room was beautiful looked right on to the river.The room was very spacious and had complimentary robes and slippers to use also a safe and fridge in the room and a big flat screen tv, hairdryer, iron and iron board. The hop on hop off bus stopped right outside the hotel as does the river Cruise.  The Bean is just a short 5 min walk from the hotel and the Willis building is about a 20 min walk. Shopping is right across the road and there are plenty bars and resturants near as well. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly We booked to have drinks in the rooftop bar the view was amazing and watched the sun go down.   The prices are more expensive than the local bars but you pay for the view. When we return to Chicago we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Some Hiccups
text: They did a wonderful job with renovations and decor of this hotel, you really feel like you're staying someplace special. Check in/out was easy and the desk staff was helpful. The room was nicely appointed, although small, which is to be expected for any city hotel. We stayed in a Vista King room, which had a stunning view of the Chicago River. My one complaint about the room is the bathroom door, which is a heavy frosted glass sliding door (think a barn door, only almost see-through). Several times I needed to have my husband assist me with opening the door because it would get stuck, and I didn't like the lack of privacy at all. Especially in such a small room. Tip: Even on the higher floors, the street noise is pretty noticeable, so we turned the fan on so that it masked some of the traffic sounds. The first night we went up to the rooftop bar because I'd heard great things about it. One of the benefits of staying at the hotel is that you receive priority access to the rooftop bar, which is apparently the hot place to be right now. I recommend making a reservation if you'd like to actually get a seat on the rooftop, which we did, however, we did encounter a staff issue there.We checked in about 15 minutes early. Unfortunately, the guy who checked us in disappeared by the time we returned when our table was ready, and the new gentleman at the reservation stand didn't believe me when I said that I'd made a reservation. Mind you, we'd literally just spoken with someone who checked us in and I saw our name on the list. "I made this reservation via email about two weeks ago" I told him. He replied (not kidding): "Well, that's not possible because we've been booked for a month." I had to root through my emails to prove to him that we did, in fact, receive a confirmation (even though I'd just seen it 15 minutes prior.) As it turns out, the first guy who checked us in marked us as a "no show" for some reason.  Perhaps as a concession, they gave us seats on one of the reserved couches, but we were told we could only stay there for an hour because another reservation was coming. During that hour, we were visited by the waitress maybe twice.  The rooftop certainly has an amazing view around sunset and the drinks were nice, but the service left much to be desired. You can tell it's definitely a hot spot around town because of the crowd.Overall, nice hotel and nice amenities, but it felt like it was always packed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Property
text: Great property on Wacker and Michigan.  Wonderful service.  Great rooftop scene.  Had an A/C problem that was addressed promptly and efficiently.  Food was great in the restaurants.  Property is very conveniently located.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location, staff, amenities, not overly spacious
text: We stayed for a night for personal/pleasure. Very professional and courteous staff and the location is in the heart of down town, with excellent views available. The not overly spacious rooms still feel luxurious with the posh amenities and decor. We had lunch/brunch at the Rooftop Restaurant, which has amazing views and the food is excellent. Somewhat limited menu with less than generous portions but the view and ambience more than make up for those and are worth the price.   Elevators are unusual in that prior to boarding, you select your desired floor and it tells you which elevator to board. No buttons in the elevator so a little confusing at first. Would have been nice to have a heads up on that.  Overall - highly recommend and we‚Äôll be staying again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Off the chart great!!!!'
text: What an amazing place.  Hotel is spectacular- upgrade to the view...so worth it.  Rooms are spotless and service top notch.   Bellman and doorman are on top of their game.   Highly recommend roof top bar also. Loads of fun !!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great food & staff!!
text: We stayed at LondonHouse for my friends birthday and had brunch at the rooftop the food was very good with the best view! The front desk gave us an upgraded room with a great view of the river and of course Trump tower. The front desk staff was very friendly and the guys that work there are so handsome and courteous. We had an issue with the rooms AC and was very hot, we called the Front Desk and spoke to the lady Manager who came upstairs with the lady hotel Manager and they apologize for the issue and took care of it right away. The valet is probably the only thing that is very expensive $72 for the night is a bit much. Otherwise everything is great I will probably go back to visit the guys at the Front Desk and have the waffles.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic all around
text: Professional and friendly staff especially check-in staff, bartender at the lobby bar (super friendly and cheerful), and the Land & Lake Kitchen staff. I had many meals there. Property is beautiful. Room is a good size: my corner room on the 14th floor has a gorgeous view of Chicago river and high-rises along it - well, except for the obscenely enormous trump sign directly across the river. The rooftop bar has the same view but from a higher angle. Hotel guests can bypass the line to get to the roof which can be long on the weekend. Bath amenities, Nespresso machine, and bed quality were all excellent.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel!
text: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location!  Be sure to get a Vista Room, which provides floor to ceiling windows with views of the river.  Unfortunately, the Vista Rooms are more expensive at an already pricey hotel, but worth it.  The valet parking is somewhat of a mess as there is not really a designated area to pull up so you're basically in the road and it can get backed up.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good hotel, great location
text: We paid for an upgraded room at check-in with a river view, and the room was lovely. Very spacious, nice bathroom, comfortable bed and the view was worth the extra money. However, there were a few small things which, on their own, are very insignificant, but for a brand new hotel were a little disappointing. This included the toilet roll holder coming apart, the shower door didn't close fully and therefore water could escape (bit grubby too) and there was nowhere to hang a hand towel. The roof-top bar was great, and the staff were all very friendly. The location of the hotel on the corner of Michigan Avenue bridge was fantastic. I would stay at the hotel again but I would have expected a new hotel to be faultless.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding
text: LH could not have been more beautiful, more welcoming or more attentive.  Steve Sleczka was my rock during the whole wedding process, and answered questions and held my hand even during his off days.  Everything he did was to perfection, and his staff followed suit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Views
text: Came here on 4th of July for bachelorette party. We had 2 double Vista rooms (best views of the river) highly recommend it. Only 2 things, late check in time (4pm-our rooms weren't ready until 430) and elevators were very busy. Other than that AMAZING stay. will stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely Excellent !
text: If you ever wonder which hotel to choose in Chicago, we were so happy to have picked the London House, Curio Collection by Hilton !  We were in a room with king bed, facing the river.  The view was stunning !  The room was clean, there is a mini-refregirator that you can fill yourself.  Just cross the bridge, and there is a Walgreens where to buy food, milk, juice, and yes,,, beer.  The guest service was excellent, there is a concierge who knows everything you need to know about tours, restaurants, shopping, means of transportation, and how to find your way around. And it is close to most attractions:  To walk to Millenium Park will take you about 10 minutes.  Walking to the Navy Pier is about 20 minutes.   The view from the bar/restaurant on the 21st floor is amazing.  Photographers, get ready to shoot a lot !  One thing is sure, if... no... when we will go back to Chicago, that's where we will be staying !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location
text: The LondonHouse was the perfect place to stay for a recent visit to Chicago. It is a well maintained and managed hotel, in a central location of Chicago: close to the river, lake front, Millennium Park, the theater district and River North. Cleanliness: The guest rooms, lobby and gym were all clean and well maintained.Decor: The guest room decor was modern and well-appointed.Staff: The front desk staff, and the maintenance team were all helpful and friendly.  Views: The view from our guest room was incredible; looking out over the river and the Wrigley / Tribune buildings. Rooftop: The rooftop bar (22nd floor) was a great setting to meet friends and provided even further views of the surrounding architecture. The bar area did not feel overly "fancy", and had a more relaxed feeling. First time visitors to Chicago, and even locals, will enjoy a stay at the LondonHouse for the location, ease of getting around, rooftop views and the clean/tastefully decorated rooms.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Fantastic location next to the river and central for everything. Hotel has a great rooftop bar which is always busy and we were really lucky at the beginning of June to get sunny hot weather. Short walk to Madison Avenue where all the designer shops are located and the open top tour buses and river tours are located right outside the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location!
text: Hotel is in a great location next to River Walk. Hotel is very clean and staff is wonderful. Great hotel for entire family! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are bringing your family to visit Chicago. This hotel and location will make your trip epic!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Brunch above it all!
text: Being your sunglasses because the rooftop restaurant of London House is 22 floors above the Chicago River so waiting for a table (on a nice day) is actually a fun time for unparalleled views of the cityscape. Make friends with the crowds of selfie-takers, and offer to swap out camera duties for your Windy City souvenir photo. Nice cocktail menu and a full bar, so Bloody Marys and Mimosas are easy. Food is presented nicely and very tasty. Nice options for vegetarian and vegan diets too.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great time for our Anniversary
text: We spent our 37th anniversary in Chicago and stayed at the London House.  Our first time but for sure, not our last at the London House.  Checking in was so smooth when doorman Fikret got us squared away.  Concierge Shannon planned our transportation to the Cubs game and then our dinner on the 21st floor rooftop restaurant.
