I was subsequently CHARGED TWICE for the same stay ‚Äì an outrageous error for any hotel which is all the more infuriating since I was refused a copy of my bill when checking-out. I‚Äôm a regular traveller and without doubt this is the worst experience of service I‚Äôve ever had in a business hotel ‚Äì a complete catalogue of errors and a total disaster from start to finish. The receptionist and her senior colleague responsible for check-out were rude, disrespectful and at no point demonstrated any care or empathy to me as the customer. Communication after my stay has been woefully inadequate and I only had a response at all when I threatened legal action. At no point have I had an apology or even an explanation as to why this situation occurred in the first place. The experience of having been told to my face that I hadn‚Äôt stayed in the hotel is simply ludicrous.  I understand that mistakes are made from time to time, but it‚Äôs clear that the hotel has no regard for its customers at all.  It‚Äôs now 7 weeks later and my queries have still not been addressed. Perhaps this TripAdvisor review will miraculously generate a flurry of activity from the hotel‚Äôs management, but up to this point they couldn‚Äôt care less if they tried. Don‚Äôt bother.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful!
text: I stayed at LondonHouse for business.  The room was amazing!  I looked right out on the river.  In spite of being on the 4th floor, I didn't hear any traffic or outside noise.  All the staff members were pleasant and helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It's all about the experience
text: Great Staff, Great Views, Great Valet service, Great room and staff, perfect location, amazing stay. Picking the exact room we wanted through the app upon digital check-in was awesome use of technology, also really loved upgrade options available before check in.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: THE BEST STAY & ExPIERENCE EVER
text: After a long and horrible trip with luggage being lost,to horrible service at multiple hotels. I was so beyond excited to finally have the best quality service imaginable. From the moment I walked into the gorgeous clean lobby I was greeted by Miss Martha who was  so inviting, welcoming, patient & understanding with all my frustrations. She not only accommodated us early but she went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make sure my family and I were 100% comfortable. I will ensure that anytime I or another family member travel to Chicago this is the ONLY hotel we will stay it and that is all due to the amazing customer service provided by Miss Martha & team.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location....very nice hotel that COULD be great!
text: Love the location of this hotel.  Hard to beat being on Whacker at Michigan Avenue ...right on the River when in the Windy City!The 'line up' of valets when you enter the VERY small lobby corridor (4 on the left, 3 on the right along the wall) made a very uneasy welcome.  Wow...The lobby is a quick ride upstairs.  Beautiful, but again...fairly small for a hotel this size.  The furnishings and decor are magnificent.The restoration of this building is superb.  Love the original elements that were left in place such as elevator trims, ceiling tiles, ornate grills, etc.  The mix of old with new technologies is amazing.Rooms are some the of the most beautiful in the city.  I love the decor.  Rooms are clean, comfortable and wonderful.  I had a beautiful view of the river and Chicago skyline during both of my stays here.  I could have done without the glaring TRUMP letters across the river that illuminated my room each night, but thats not the hotels fault! :)As a Gold member, i was given a voucher for breakfast at Land and Lake.  I have to say, that this restaurant (ground level) is probably the WORST excuse for a benefit I have ever experienced in a Hilton Hotel.  HORRIBLE is the only way to describe it.  Value of 'voucher' is awful.  Food quality and service were pathetic on both of my stays.  I would avoid this restaurant completely, as there are so many GOOD quality breakfast locations in close proximity...and the value of your coupon is basically worthless beyond a cup of coffee and a donut.  My impression of Land and Lake has made me assume that other food and beverage outlets within the hotel are no better, so i did not try the others on either of my recent two trips.Great looking hotel.  Great location.  Nice service.....  Dine elsewhere.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Extraordinary Stay and Perfect Classic Cocktails
text: Fabulous first time stay here. Diamond match for Marriott Platinum Elite. Upgraded to a corner suite fabulous room. Best part of weekend is Michelle in Bridges Lounge who is a masterful in making classic cocktails and her service is extraordinary  Breakfast at Land and Lake is lovely and the cappuccino press in the rooms reminiscent of Europe. First class experience

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Relax
text: Great location, very professional staff, room spacious : great bathroom, huge TV, super comfy bed ... and access to downtown Chicago walking distance ... loved it! Tried room service : it was quick, perfect , yum and I enjoyed it very much ... definitely a great choice for a short or long stay in Chicago l

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wacker's Best!
text: Excellent hotel. Clean; food and beverage service outstanding and perfect location. Staff is super!  Easy walking to Navy Pier; Park; and beautiful sites of downtown Chicago. LH will be our destination hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of my favorites
text: I have been to Chicago multiple times and stayed all over the city. The London House is very new and pretty good! I always enjoyed it from staff to location to view! Would definitely stay there again whenever i get back to Chicago - plus is the nespresso coffee machine

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It was the best of rooms, it was the worst of rooms
text: The best of rooms refers to room 2017, top floor, killer views out of two windows, lovely amenities including nice robes, fridge, in-room safe and free wifi. The worst of rooms has to do with the view from one window absolutely filled with Trump's name on the building. It also has to do with the room being too close to the elevators for this light sleeper.The other issue with the hotel is the elevator situation. The front desk folks did not tell me so it was even more frustrating but you have to key in your floor number on a digital pad and it tells you which elevator will take you there. No buttons in the elevators. It was frustrating as you can't change your mind if you pushed the wrong floor once you're in. Everyone I spoke to in the elevators thought it was a pain. BUT everything else was so fab. The service...so friendly and helpful. The roof top bar (not open yet due to weather but we could go out and see the view) crazy cool. You are in the perfect location to go to the A.I., to the park, shopping and theaters...the middle of it all. Great service at the lobby bar, great service by everyone.I'm giving the sleep quality a lower rating only because of being close to the elevators. The bed was fabulous comfy

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great view!
text: The view is of no doubt! Awesome! The room is full of technology! It faces to The Trump Building. You could see the whole view of the buildings beside the river. However the breakfast is poor for Hilton members in Hilton series hotels although the taste is good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location for exploring
text: Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to many attractions. The room was fine although you could hear people on the corridor and in the room next door. I had a problem with safe and it took me asking three times before it got fixed. There is a nice bar with a rooftop terrace. Overall good stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very chic and right in the heart of Downtown
text: We had a last minute vacation to Chicago taking the kids to see the museums and decided to stay at the LondonHouse Chicago.  From the moment we arrived we felt right at home!  Fikret and Mark, two of the Bellmen, were so kind to help us and check in on us throughout our 3-day stay.  Each morning we enjoyed breakfast at Land & Lake Kitchen, which is connected to the hotel.  You should try the Egg White Omelet with avocado, broccoli and goat cheese; it will not disappoint!  Also, close by, you can enjoy deep dish at Bella Bacinos.Our room was a corner suite and was very spacious.  The views were great from the room and the amenities were very nice.  We have attached a few photos for you to review!Around sunset, you have to head up to the 21st floor to enjoy a glass of wine at the rooftop bar and take in the sunset on the river!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Great Customer service
text: We have stayed here multiple times and it has generally become our go to Hilton Property in Chicago.  Great for couples with trendy common areas/bars, upgraded bathrooms amenities and wonderful staff.  This was the first trip with any small issue, which was entirely my fault as I failed to notice the size of the room I booked vs the size of the rooms we generally stay in and I couldn't have been happier with the way the Manager, Matt, assisted in the process.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and room features
text: I really like the feature that you could connect your iphone to the tv. My bf and I watched Netflix for the whole night and it was an awesome experience. The room was small but functional. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom. We didn't have a view from our window, but the room was totally worth it for the price ($80 ish for each of us). The location was perfect - it's only a couple min away from the magnificent mile. Overall speaking the room was awesome, and I will definitely come back if I could!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice location and room
text: The hotel is nice. The location is convenient and the room was clean and well-decorated. The staff was nice and the roof-top bar was very enjoyable. Overall, it was a nice experience. Nothing super special but very nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Spectacular surprise
text: The LondonHouse really exceeded my expectations. The rooms were very clean and well apportioned. The staff was excellent, and it was extremely conveniently located in the loop & along the river. I loved the rooftop bar, which we experienced twice during our stay. Housekeeping was very attentive. I was boasting about this room and hotel to family and friends and was routinely surprised at the immaculate attention to detail.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Don't let the Secret out
text: I have to compliment this hotel because for the price, I can not believe the service we received at this hotel.  It has been so long since we have felt so spoiled and welcomed and wanted as customers.  We loved the views from the room and we absolutely think the bathrooms are the best in the city.  Thank you for the wonderful toilet tree gifts LondonHouse, you won us over.  While we were not fond of the woman( fingernails don't impress us)  who worked at the front desk with her lack of smile and welcome, for everyone else - Thank you!  Last but not least, Patrick in the upstairs bar/restaurant, we think you are amazing and we will see you again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern Elegance / Amazing Staff!
text: We had an excellent stay at the London House with our kids. The hotel is elegant, modern and clean. We had a chance to eat at all the on-site restaurants and the food was delicious! They have an amazing roof deck with wrap-around city views. Our favorite part was the kind and caring staff that bent over backward to make our stay comfortable. Thanks, Abel! Highly recommended!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Another great stay!
text: I have an annual conference in Chicago and stayed at the LondonHouse last year. I was excited to return, as this hotel is the most beautiful hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed at. I‚Äôm surprised to see all of the complaints- as most of it appears to be from people who don‚Äôt actually stay at the hotel. I do not have a single complaint. My flight came in early and I sent a message via the Hilton app and the staff replied quickly and accommodated an early check in for me. The doormen, front desk staff- everyone exhibits high levels of customer service. My room was immaculate.  The hotel itself is gorgeous. And I opted for a Vista room again because you do not want to miss the opportunity to enjoy a great view of Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Staff was friendly, room was clean and beds comfy!  Room was ready for early check in by noon which was so nice!  Perfect location, on the river between Michigan and State street. Close to Millennium Park. High end touches in the room!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely modern amenities in perfect location in Chicago
text: Robes; lovely, welcoming and responsive staff, amazing linens and comfortable mattress and pillows.  May want to avoid 20th floor below bar due to noise.  Lights were a bit tricky to turn on and off and some went on by them selves during night.  Amazing view for top of building!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location, would stay again
text: Big cities tend to yield either rooms that are big and expensive or small and still pricey. This was a great balance of both. New rooms, new technology, a huge 55 inch TV, modern bathroom, in a small but not crowded room for two. The staff is helpful, great bellmen who will help you with suggestions on where to go. The location is perfect, close to the Riverwalk, restuarants, theaters and much more. I would highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room 1210 - four stars!
text: This is a great boutique-like hotel. I would have given it five stars if it wasn‚Äôt for the below cons. Pros:- central location - contemporary design of hotel- great customer service - view from room 1210 was amazing(see photos) - clean hotel - new hotel Cons:- Room was dusty in places, the wood trim near the floor, the books on the shelves. - coffee machine was leaky at first but then it worked - more than one chess board please in the lobby would be wonderful! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxury Details, Gracious Service and Convenient Location
text: Recently spent 3 weeknights for business and found LondonHouse Chicago to be a well-designed (with luxury touches like huge walk in shower), quiet and conveniently located hotel.  The staff was very gracious (welcome texts from front desk team).  The gym has state of the art cardio equipment but not quite enough room for weights and floor work-outs.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: St. Patrick‚Äôs Day fun!
text: My husband and I, along with friends, spent last weekend at this beautiful hotel!  The London House did not disappoint!  The location is perfect!  Definitely request a river view room.  The moment you walk in, you are immediately greeted by friendly and efficient bellmen.   Our room was not yet ready, but they gladly stored our luggage.  We took the staircase up to the second floor, which is the actual lobby.  Wow!  It is contemporary with eclectic decor...stunning and has a great vibe!  The lobby bar was awesomely attended by Kurt.  While it was busy due to St. Patrick‚Äôs Day, he was friendly and attentive.  The lobby bar overlooks the river which is super cool and relaxing!  The common areas and rooms were also beautifully appointed in contemporary/urban decor and the beds were super comfortable!  One of the highlights of this beautiful hotel is the rooftop bar which of course, overlooks the river and city.  Eddie tended bar up there and again, was friendly and efficient.  The rooftop was such a special experience for a hotel in Chicago.  The D.J. was spinning amazing music which added to the fun!We will definitely visit this property again this summer!  Thank you London House!  Hilton should be very proud of all their staff at this location.   We even met an individual from their sales staff who was very kind and made sure all of our needs were met.Thank you again London House Chicago!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the best views in the city!!
text: We stayed in one of their Vista Rooms. The room was good size but on the smaller end and the view was absolutely phenomenal. Would definitely stay again, but in a Vista Suite to get a bit more space. If you can upgrade to a Vista Room, make sure you do, the view will not disappoint.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel for location and service
text: I love this hotel. Front desk staff is welcoming and helpful. I've enjoyed great drinks, conversation and fun times with other guests,  bartenders and service staff in the lobby bar. Rooms are comfortable and upscale. They thought of everything in design. It's location is central to the major visitor attractions. You won't be disappointed here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: All around perfect!
text: From check-in to check-out, everyone I encountered during my stay was absolutely friendly and hospitable. I got a sense that everyone loved working there, even through a busy St. Patrick's Day weekend. The housekeeping and room service staff greeted me every time I passed them in the hallways! Great room, awesome view and just the best service I could have asked for. Loved it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Just a great hotel!
text: I totally enjoyed my stay here! Not only was the hotel ideally located at the riverfront, the service was great. My room was upgraded, and I got a lovely view. It was so clean and well addressed every day. I will not hesitate to stay here in my next trip

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse - fabulous location and view
text: This hotel is just fabulous. Perfectly located, gorgeous room overlooking the river - we were lucky enough to see the autumn (fall) bridge lift all from our window. Room was beautiful, service brilliant. Unfortunately we never made it to the rooftop bar as it was always packed. However we had such a good time in the lobby bar having personalised cocktails made for us that we missed the Architecture tour (all good, we went the next day!)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great View of river and bridges
text: My room was upgraded due to being a Hilton Honors member and the room type I reserved was not available when I checked in.  Upgraded room was beautiful with great views of the river and the bridges.  Staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location
text: Stayed here on a weekend trip to Chicago and absolutely loved the location. It is so close to everything, and the view of the river from the rooftop bar is amazing! Being hotel guests was super handy because we didn‚Äôt have to wait in line with the tourists to go up there.The room was modern and well appointed. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was huge, and the smart TV was nice to have. We especially liked the complimentary Nespresso coffee!We walked away from our stay in love with the hotel. However, a couple days later they charged us for a water bottle we didn‚Äôt even drink. When we contacted them, didn‚Äôt even get an apology, let alone a refund. Super tacky and in poor taste for such a nice hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Accommodations
text: I've been to this property frequently and they always take care of me. They always acknowledge my HHonors status which is always appreciated. Caitlin, Anthony G, Danny, Torri, and Alexis have all helped me in the past. Beautiful hotel in all, thank you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great find
text: The Curio offers a great location, a nice clean room and a warm, welcoming staff.  The room was designed more modern but with room so the room and bathroom did not feel small. I had a great view of the Chicago river from my room.  I will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My ‚ÄúGo-to‚Äù place in Chicago! Amazing staff and beautiful room
text: I love staying at the LondonHouse in Chicago. It has the intimacy of a boutique hotel with the consistent services and cleanliness of Hilton. The staff was awesome. It started with a great room with a view of the river!  They help with recommendations for a pub to meet a friend and they made a great recommendation and reservation to Ema for dinner with my daughter. 10‚Äôs across the board for room and staff. Thanks! I‚Äôll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Treasure in Chicago!
text: Our accommodations at the LondonHouse extended from just a stay to an experience.  Our initial encounter with the staff outside to receive us to the luxury beds that awaited a tired body. This was more than just a stay but an experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite River View Hotel in Chicago
text: Best stay in Chicago - Luxurious rooms with robes, slippers, nespresso machine and large TV. Beautiful river facing room views. Great rooftop bar and lobby lounge. Overall fantastic service that sends you text messages so you don't even have to leave your room / call downstairs!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overnight with my girl. Great location and staff
text: Flew in on Friday night with my 13 yr old daughter. Trying to impress her with Chicago‚Äôs skyline and food. Flights were late and Ohare was crowded, our room was waiting and staff were friendly. The location was better than I could have hoped for with Chicago‚Äôs skyline looming out our window. Plenty of food choices right next door and in hotel. Couldn‚Äôt have chosen better. Had in room dining next day and was placed over the moon on service and quality and quantity of food. I WILL BE BACK

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Londonhouse review
text: Great hotel!  Hotel Engineers named Bill and Ted were excellent in assisting with replacing my TV in my room.  They were very efficient, courteous, and a great help in assisting us.  We really appreciated it! Thx!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hotel Ever!
text: Currently staying at the London House in Chicago and it is hands down the best hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in. From before checking in to the stay they have gone above and beyond to help make our stay perfect. They continuely check in and send text messages asking how the stay is and it‚Äôs not a generic computer automated text it‚Äôs someone actually asking. The rooms are perfect the bed is heavenly! I want to put the mattress in my suitcase and take it home! Location is amazing as well! Perfect to where you can walk to anything and everything you could want to do in Chicago! I have found my place to stay for any future visits! Thank you LondonHouse for making me fall in love with chicago even more.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of my ALL-TIME favorite hotels!
text: I've been staying at the LondonHouse regularly for the past year, and I have never been disappointed. It is one of my all-time favorite hotels, not just in Chicago, but in general. Whenever my travels take me to Chicago, I make it a point to stay here. Prior to my most recent visit in February, I became a Gold Member with Hilton, which gives you some perks like free upgrades, premium wi-fi, and your choice of free breakfast or bonus points, I chose the bonus points. I was also asked if I wanted to be upgraded to a King Studio with a river view or a 1-bedroom suite without a view. I chose the King Studio (2033) with a view of the river. It was tucked away in its own little corner which made it extremely quiet and allowed for some great sleep even though the restaurant and lounge are just one floor above.I've stayed in various room types at the LondonHouse, and even the standard rooms are excellent and in pristine condition. Rooms are always spotlessly clean and I very much appreciate the upgraded bath products they provide. They even include a small luffa which is awesome to have to take with you when traveling on the road. I love the public spaces such as the lobby bar area where I can bring my work and enjoy tea service. And in the evening, I like to go to the top floor bar for a drink. I always have a LH Martini complete with blue cheese stuffed olives. Make sure to check out the views from the roof. In the summer, you can sit outside and enjoy the view, which is always fun, but it's usually very busy. It'd be nice if they could have a small section reserved just for guests and another for the public. The service here is top notch! All of the staff I've ever encountered has been nothing but warm and welcoming. Whenever I visit, they go above and beyond their call of duty and they make you feel special rather then just being another guest. I especially appreciate this high level of service that I consistently receive every time I stay there. That's what keeps me coming back. The girl that checked me out this last time (I wish I had her name), recognized me from my last visit over NYE, and was especially accommodating after a small hiccup happened with housekeeping, that she did not let detract from my stay. She was shorter, with brown hair, and a beautiful smile and deserves to be recognized. Keep it up LondonHouse!!! You have made me a forever guest and I look forward to staying at your property the next time I'm in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good, not great
text: A little too much glitz for me. More for guests that get pumped about rooftop bars etc than an eloquent hotel experience. Health club was small with no windows. Had been remodeled with nice, but not top shelf furnishing and trims. Location was nice, room looking out into Michigan Ave and staff were all great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Stay
text: I booked this property as a fun layover on our way to Wisconsin, and I was blown away by the location, luxurious environment and mostly the exceptional service. From check in to check out and everything in-between, the staff anticipated our needs throughout. One staff member that stood out was Mark Z., our bellman. He always greeted us with a friendly hello, got to know us and made the best recommendations of things for us to try during our short stay. Even if my review of everything else was simply ‚Äúaverage‚Äù, I would come back again because of Mark and the care he takes with every guest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overly Satisfied with our stay
text: My wife surprised me with this trip and I always wanted to visit Chicago. As we arrived in the Uber from the Chicago Midway Airport, it was a welcomed site, the bells man greeted us and asked if we needed help with our bags. He then grabs the bags and escorts my wife and I to the lobby. We were greeted by a professional staff who catered to our every needs. The lobby was beautifully designed. We then preceded to the elevator where we punched in our floor on the key pad outside of the elevator. As we entered our suite I was blown away, the suite was beautiful with a river view of the city it was magical. We then began to unpack and relax. The beds were so comfortable and the two large televisions, one in the lounge and the other in the bedroom, I was in heaven, then we ordered room service. The food arrived in a timely manner and the waitress brought our food up and she was very polite and professional. The food was very flavorful and delicious I am very impressed. We woke up the next morning refreshed and ready to venture out to see what Chicago has to offer. We went to the rooftop restaurant for brunch another amazing restaurant, with a beautiful fire place and the furniture was very comfortable, I love this place. The food did not disappoint, after having brunch we went upstairs to the outside deck of the restaurant for a view of the city skyline, what a beautiful view, the weather was sunny and windy. This establishment is centrally located in the middle of everything, went many places and no place we went was over two mile Millennium Park, CIBC Theatre, Chicago Sky Deck and so on everything was within minutes away while using Uber. When we return to our suite there were a dish of chocolate covered strawberries with a congratulations letter on the table from Shannon, Jose and Anthony from LondonHouse Concierge. You all are Amazingly  Awesome. Kudos to the Management and Staff at the LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection, I recommend this establishment t anyone who love first class service any luxurious and comfortable suites with fantastic views and minutes from all attractions. You all have made my stay AWESOME. I will return to my most favorite establishment in Chicago. Thank you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Phenominal Service and Beautiful Hotel
text: I had an amazing time staying at the LondonHouse Chicago! The service was truly top of the line. You can tell that each associate understands hospitality because every employee that I crossed paths with made it a point to at least say hello. The staff continued to check in with me during my stay to make sure that I was well taken care of. The room was very clean and comfortable. The rooftop bar was also very nice and had great service as well. I will definitely be back and I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago for any reason!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Virtual Overnight Stay
text: One night stay without any personal interaction with staff. After I checked out I realized that I booked the room online, checked in and selected the room with the Hilton app, used a digital key, departed the next morning, and received the folio via email...all without having contact with a hotel staff person. I guess it was all my choice. The hotel is in a great location. Stayed in room 1644, thought it might be fun to select an odd shaped room. It OK for one night but a little small, with a large bathroom. Might stay again if looking for that location and the rate was very good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing downtown property
text: Room, service and location were perfect. The attention to detail blew me away, in particular the service and local knowledge shown by Mark Zematis went above and beyond all recent experience. Because of him, we'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer
text: I stayed here for a night for a birthday celebration and just had a wonderful experience.  Had a great room with a view of the river.  The beds were out of this world comfy, so much that I did not want to get up in the morning.  We were also appreciative that the rooms were quiet.  The elevator system actually makes it so that there is not too much traffic.  All in all, I would say it was a very relaxed stay.  The hotel has a great location-central in the city.  It is as easy of a walk to get to Millenium Park as it is to go to the river walk or River North.  We ate at the Land and Lake Kitchen for breakfast in the morning, which had some delectable selections.  We did not get to check out the rooftop or other restaurants.  Will have to save that for another visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A nice stay in Chicago
text: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel last week and was very pleased I did. It‚Äôs location is perfect and the rooms were lovely. Staff friendly and helpful. Even though it‚Äôs down town Chicago it was quiet in the rooms.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful view, great Rooftop bar at an Unbeatable Price
text: We were downtown for a night and planning to meet people at the London House Rooftop Bar -- spectacular views for a pic!  We decided since we got an amazing deal, to stay the night as well.  The rooms are very long and a bit narrow, so as to get more rooms a river view.  However, they were still comfy and well stocked with amenities.  We will be staying again as you get the same view as Trump for a mere fraction of the price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: Great experience at this property. We had a high floor with a great view of the city. Staff was very nice and housekeeping were fantastic. Will stay here again when I am back in Chicago.If you are a Hilton Honors member, you should take the points over breakfast. It's not a full breakfast more just a muffin and coffee. I didn't know that.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel
text: This hotel had great rooms and great service. I loved the room I pretty much didn't want to leave. They had a great restaurant on the second floor with great food. I was bummed I didn't get up to see the rooftop bar as it was still cold outside. Guess I'll just have to go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House-Chicago-Solo
text: Very nice mix or modern and old fashion. Pretty elegant! The check in process went very quickly. The digital key is a great addition but I prefer the face to face greetings. Great views and even better staff. The room was larger than it appears on the website. The spa and rooftop bar are great bonuses. I look forward to my next visit! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top quality
text: Top quality hotel and a very reasonable price.Staff very knowledgeable and helpful.Check in and our stress freeRooms of a high standard and spotless cleanGreat bathroom with high powered showerRoof top bar an added bonus A very pleasant stay will definitely be returning

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great short stay.
text: Gorgeous hotel. Lovely room and great furnishings.  Large bathroom.  My new favorite Chicago hotel.  Can't wait to return for a romantic weekend with my husband. Convenient for shopping and close to great restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: February Engagement at the LondonHouse
text: Earlier in the Fall of 2017, my then boyfriend and I stayed at the LondonHouse for work trip. We absolutely fell in loves with the views from our room and how luxurious the rooms were; we felt like absolutely royalty. The bathroom was beautiful and should have been in a design magazine. After a wonderful trip, we didn't think of anywhere else to go when it was my birthday weekend for a stay-cation in downtown Chicago. We again knew the LondonHouse rooms & views would deliver on a wonderful way to experience my birthday. As we got our room and got ready to embark on a birthday evening out, to my absolute surprise my boyfriend got down on one knee and proposed right in our wonderful Hotel room. A memory to never forget and we are so lucky to have experienced it at the LondonHouse! The next morning we went up to the rooftop to take pictures as a newly engaged couple and celebrate with mimosas at the bar! I can't say enough wonderful things about the LondonHouse and will always hold a special place in my heart.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 10 out of 10! I LOVED IT!
text: (Great Location) Overall my time at London House was AMAZING!!!! Went for a long weekend get away with my boyfriend. From the moment, we walked in we were greeted and treated like gold. We stayed in the ‚ÄúSignature Room‚Äù it was beautiful. Our room was serviced each morning; the maid service was extremely sweet! Although, we spent most of our time enjoying the city we did enjoy a few hours at the at roof top bar/balcony, as well as the second-floor hotel bar. All bartenders were nothing but sweet, attentive, and polite. Michelle at the Second-floor bar was nothing short of amazing; great drinks, great service, and wonderful conversation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Service
text: The service was impeccable and highly highly recommend this to others. Great location in Chicago, and beautiful views from the room! Bathroom was huge and I loved the lotions that they used. Order room service and I had it in 15 min time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Comfortable & Quiet!
text: Our room was angled; however, it gave us more space than another couple's room.  Typical rooms aren't very big but we had everything we needed.  Refrigerator provided in the room too.  The bed was very comfortable!  Valet service was good and worth it as it was very cold outside.  Location was good and had restaurants near/within the LondonHouse.  If it had been summer, we definitely would've walked to more things as this is a great location in warmer weather.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Service like no other!
text: I chose the LondonHouse Chicago for my birthday weekend as I wanted something a bit different and unique. When I arrived, first thing I noticed was the amazing lobby and the great views of the river. Classy, chic, and attention grabbing. I knew this was going to be fun.Alexis checked me in. You couldn't ask for a warmer and more gracious welcome. She was quick and efficient but made me feel like the most important person to them. I received my Diamond HHonors recognition the proper way, not glossed over. Alexis wished me a Happy Birthday and on top of that found me the "perfect room" as a gift. It was an amazing start!The room was wonderful, hip yet classy. Very well appointed with rich linens and great amenities. I did experience a couple of challenges. A light fixture in the shower fell off and the heat kept going out. Not good for Chicago in winter. This is where a hotel can make or break the experience. The hotel sent Nelson and Eric, two of their engineers to the room. These guys were fantastic. They did their best to be non intrusive, extremely friendly, kept me updated, apologized with sincerity for the issues. The light was fixed asap, the heating unit had some gremlins. The bad news was it took multiple attempts to get it going. The good news is the I got to see Nelson and Eric again! These guys deserve huge recognition. Just the friendliest and most professional representatives of the hotel! Give them big raises!The rest of the stay was wonderful. Amazing breakfast in the restaurant, spectacular views from the best rooftop terrace in Chicago, and consistently friendly and outgoing staff. They more than made up for any hiccups during the stay. Kudos to the London House Chicago for a surprising and appreciated experience. I'll definitely be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: Great room in an amazing location. The manager even texted me before I arrived to see if I needed anything. This was my first time here and I loved it. I couldn‚Äôt believe what a great deal I got on the room!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simply Fantastic
text: We stayed here for two nights and could not have been more pleased with our decision to stay at LondonHouse Chicago. While the historic (but completely renovated) building is lovely and has all the amenities one could ask for, what really set this place apart was the amazing staff. They consistently went above and beyond to make our stay as pleasant as possible and I can't say enough good things about them. A special shout-out to Alexis and Keith for helping us out with a special request!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and Accommodations
text: This property has all of the amenities to make your stay pleasant from beginning to end.  There is bar and lounge on the top floor which is nice if you want to stay close by.  A quick walk to plenty of shopping along Michigan Avenue.  Rooms are spacious and up to date!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Just Relaxing
text: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel right on the river.  My room was gorgeous and super clean!  Curt the bartender, is awesome and hilarious.  Really enjoyed the drinks and just hanging around in the bar. The Nueske‚Äôs bacon slab sandwich was an excellent choice and tasted fantastic.  Had a massage at the Spa on the fourth floor, what a way to begin the week!  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all my friends.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location
text: We stayed for 4 days in January '18. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. We had a Vista room but was upgraded to the Vista Suite.The room was fantastic, with great views across the river. The room had everything you could ask for and was extremely comfortable and quiet.The location was perfect for visiting Chicago, and again we couldn't have picked a better location.We cant recommend the LondonHouse enough, you will be sure to love it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, very comfortable
text: Very nice room with spectacular views of the Chicago river and surrounding buildings. Bed was very comfortable other than we kept stubbing our toes on the bed base. Once you stay here you'll see what I mean. Bathroom was nice but the glass sliding door didn't offer much privacy. And it was a challenge to keep the water from spilling out from the shower due to the glass door design. Plenty of technology to enjoy including the bluetooth radio, digital room key, and TV app. Location is at the corner of Wabash and Michigan avenue so everything is within easy walking distance. Our 19th floor room was very quiet with no street noise.We'll add this to our list of Chicago weekend staycation hotels.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Stay in Chicago
text: Planned a last minute trip for a college tour with my daughter. It is gorgeous on the inside...glamorous old building completely renovated to a modern chic with a beautiful view of the river. The rooftop terrace/cupola is so pretty. The customer service is also top notch. I‚Äôve stayed at many hotels in Chicago, but this is by far my favorite...it‚Äôs that nice!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location
text: Was here for the Chicago Auto Show. Was the weekend that is snowed for over 24 hours straight. The valet service was nice and greeted me well. I headed upstairs to check in and got a room with an amazing view. There‚Äôs a bar in the lobby called Bridges. You have to see Michelle there. I think she may be the nicest person in Chicago. Pours a mean bourbon on the rocks too! Food there was great as well. I‚Äôll never stay anywhere else when I go to Chicago. Hopefully I‚Äôll be back soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel!
text: First time to Chicago and stayed at London House.  Was very impressed with both Chicago and this nice hotel.  Very clean, great location, great price.  Everything was spot on.  Then, I met Dylan the food and beverage manager who helped me with a restaurant reservation.  And later I met Lucia at the lobby bar and had some great conversation while she hustled to keep her other customers happy. Other people at the front desk were super nice and helpful too.  It‚Äôs one thing to have a good location.  It‚Äôs far better to meet hotel staff who actually make my stay even brighter.  Thank you London House.  Thank you Dylan and Lucia!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Great Location and Rooms
text: London House is a very chic and urban oasis in the middle of Chicago. It is where Loop meets the start of Michigan Ave. Perfect location for those coming into Chicago and have the ability to walk to State Street or Michigan Ave to Shop. I would have given the hotel 5 stars only for the fact the standard rooms and even some of the upgraded rooms only have showers and no bathtubs. For families with small children a tub makes a huge difference.  The bathroom amenities are absolutely one the money for an upscale hotel. They not only provide you with a shower cap but for the ladies with long hair a hair tie. There is also a body scrubbing puff for your use also. The closet houses two Terry cloth robes with house slippers with plenty of space to hang your clothing and a nice safe. It is a great hotel for people to come and stay and in the summer the Roof Top Bar is a happening place to hang out and be seen. Make sure you are an Hilton Honors Member they will give you better rates and other perks. You can use your smart phone as key for your hotel room when you use their app.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful and Classy Hotel
text: All too often when you book a "Luxury" hotel it's synonymous with "Gaudy and overpriced". However, LondonHouse was able to create an hotel with actual class.First off, it's in a great location, near the loop and millennium park. Check in was a breeze, and the the staff is extremely nice. Not in that New England or West Coast polite sort of way, but they all genuinely seemed to be happy to be at work and wanting to help you. We had brunch in the cafe near the lobby on the second floor, The staff was knowledgeable and excitable about the menu, very attentive,  and the food wasn't bad either.The room itself was well designed. It had some cool "high tech" features such as streaming video from your phone to the TV. TBH we didn't use it, but I appreciate the innovation. The toiletries brand they use is Malin + Goetz, and if you know the brand you can appreciate about half of what I paid for the room was instantly worth it in the travel sized shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, body gel, and moisturizer they give you, very nice! Espresso machine, but no coffee machine, I didn't really mind. Bathroom was spacious and had a nice shower head. We didn't get a room with a view, but it had ample lighting none the less.We didn't get a chance to check out the rooftop bar because it was too cold, but I bet it is nice.We didn't use the spa or anything because it was a sort trip.While the second floor bar prices are not cheap, I wouldn't say they are overpriced. You are paying a modest premium, and they deliver. Some of the roomservice breakfast items were a bit ridiculously priced though. Really, the only complain I have is I wasn't a fan of the fogged glass sliding bathroom door and how you could hear the bathroom from the entire room. I'll leave it up to your imagination what problems that might cause, lets just say I prefer both visual and auditory privacy from the bathroom. When I come back to Chicago in the summer I will strongly consider staying here again! Highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Location To Take In Chicago
text: This hotel and our room were very classy and chic. The pictures say it all. Nothing but 5 Star service here! You couldn't ask for a better location to see Chicago's best landmarks. You're a 20 min walk to: the best restaurants in the River North area, the Willis Tower (a.k.a Sears Tower), John Hancock Center (soon to be renamed), Buckingham Fountain and Navy Pier. We definitely got what we paid for. We are looking forward to our next visit when it's warmer to enjoy the rooftop lounge.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel - great stay
text: Gorgeous views from our 19th floor large, well decorated room with high ceilings of the river and classic Chicago buildings like the Wrigley Building. Lobby area is beautifully done and a lovely spot to hit for a drink. Easy to get all around the city from this location. Enjoyed our stay! Nespresso machine in room with a nice loofah to boot. Good bars and restaurants within walking distance - Corner Bakery attached to first floor entrance is nice for cold snowy Chicago mornings.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great rooms, great location, sort of pricey.
text: The best two features of this hotel are: (1) the location. I prefer this side of Michigan ave. It is easy to access both the stores on Michigan Ave as well as the South Shore/Metra at Millennium. The room was huge for big city standards and the staff was excellent.My only drawback is the TV is pretty confusing and ours froze (it is like a smart tv system). We could not even turn it off. Granted we did not contact the front desk, but we ruined our TV access for the night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wow.
text: The LondonHouse hotel is probably one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in. At check-in, they offered me a room with a view and I‚Äôm so happy I accepted cause i was speechless when I saw how beautiful it was. The room itself was absolutely beautiful, and had one of the comfiest beds I‚Äôve slept on. I request a spoon for breakfast, and got a call from the front desk after about half an hour to make sure I had actually received it which was great. They even offered me a late checkout since my flight wasn‚Äôt until later on in the day. The location is also fabulous. It‚Äôs directly across the street from Magnificent Mile and amazing shopping, about a 10 minute walk from the Bean, and close by to amazing restaurants as well. It was too cold for me to have a drink on their rooftop bar, but I highly recommend it if weather is permitting as it‚Äôs beautiful up there. I highly recommend the LondonHouse to anyone visiting chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location
text: I stayed in this hotel last December with a friend.The property it‚Äôs in an old classic building, now renovated.PROS- Location location locationQuite close to many restaurants, stores...Walking distante to Millenium Park, Nutella Caf√©, Purple Pig, Magnificent Mile...- LH21 RooftopTri level beautiful rooftop with breathtaking views, great cocktails. My favorite space in the hotel, for sure. Heather (one of the bartenders) was the cherry on top of this place.- Beds, linen, room amenities Comfy beds with classy linen. Beautiful shower with organic amenities (like cilantro conditioner). Nespresso machine.- Outstanding views- Warm and super friendly staff. Heather in LH21, and Cory (bellboy 1st floor).- Early Check in Our room was already at 11:00 am- Good value for moneyCONS- Check in/Payment process Both process could be easier. Not so friendly staff like the others in the hotel.Advance deposit (for incidental or damages) by the equal ammount of our 6 days... really?. Are you The Peninsula?.- Concierge/Guest serviceWe attend the NYE at the rooftop. Before the party, we called to the concierge to ask when the party was starting.When we arrived to the party, organizers told us that we need to go to 1st floor for some brazalets. Once there, we had to make a huge line and 45 minutes later climb again to the 21st floor. This definitely did not make us feel like guests. As a guests, the concierge had to have informed us more about it.Although we had a wonderful vacation, for next time to Chicago I will try another hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hands down - best stay we've ever had.
text: This was one amazing experience. From the moment we arrived, Robert and his staff were attentive, warm, hospitable and kind beyond belief.  We considered many hotels before deciding on this one but from now on this will be the only place we will ever stay when we return to Chicago.  The room was wonderful and the bed was extremely comfortable.  The whole hotel was just beautiful but again, the service was just impeccable.  This is one hotel that Hilton can really be proud of! Thank you for such a remarkable experience and we will definitely see you again soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome find in Chicago - architecture and comfort and all vyaalue for money
text: I really liked this hotel, from the rooms down through the friendly person at the entrance that would help get you are a cab or get your luggage in the uber during these cold winter days.  The rooms were a good size and location is awesome with the view of the bridges and from the roof deck and even better sight

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel and Fantastic Staff!
text: My fiance and I stayed at LondonHouse to celebrate our engagement and were blown away by how beautiful the hotel was as well as how amazing the staff was. As soon as they found out that we were celebrating our engagement, Martha at the front desk upgraded our room to a river view and got us a complimentary drink at the bar.  Jose, Shannon and Anthony from the concierge team also left chocolate truffles in our room.   The staff truly went the extra mile to make it an amazing and memorable trip for us and I couldn't be more pleased with our experience at LondonHouse.  Like the hotel, our room was also beautiful and spacious with amazing views of the city.  We will definitely be back in the future!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Drinks and Views
text: A peaceful, classy dinner with an amazing view! The service was absolutely wonderful, the drinks were well-poured and the food was delicious. We do not have a single complain about this place!! The line to get in was a bit of a wait, but definitely worth it at the end of the day! I will be going back the next time I am in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely Beautiful!
text: We stayed in a river view room for our 10th Anniversary and it was just beautiful! I found myself just gazing at the carpet and walls and decor. The breakfast downstairs was delicious and the staff in general were so kind and helpful. They even had umbrellas for the unexpected rain! We loved every bit of our stay here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The staff is so knowledgeable!
text: Had a great time despite the fact that I was in town for a funeral. The staff gave great restaurant recommendations. Please check out the bar! Great drinks and good music! The room was beautiful! I wished the digital key worked!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect place for business meetings, but would return for a staycation
text: I'm a Chicago local and stayed at the London House for four days/three nights for business meetings and can honestly say I was very impressed. It's ultra modern and chic with every comfort you could ask for. I've been told the rooms are smaller than those in Trump Tower, but I thought the size was comfortable and the modern amenities exceeded my expectations. The only issue I had was that the glass sliding door to the bathroom didn't stay closed, but perhaps that was human error.The meeting room accommodations where wonderful. Very spacious with nice views of the city - which is a plus when you're in meetings all day. What impressed me the most was the selection of food for breakfast, lunch and mid-meal snacks. We had a group of about 100 and it was the best conference food I've ever had because it wasn't the usual boring rubber chicken. At breakfast we had unique, healthy items like beef bone broth and green tea smoothies, along with more traditional fare like pancakes, oatmeal with toppings, scrambled eggs and sausage links, breakfast burritos, fresh fruit, etc. At one lunch we had a choice of 4 different fresh lettuces (iceberg, arugula, spring mix, spinach) and three proteins (chicken, beef with chimichurri, grilled salmon) with other sides. Another day we had a wonderful grilled fish, shrimp risotto and grilled chicken with a wedge Greek salad and other sides. Desserts were a variety of bite-size items like cheesecake, cupcakes, cookies. Snacks included a Mediterranean Bar with baba ganoush, hummus, pita chips and veggies and another day fresh baked pretzels with cheese dip. Yum! Enough about the food, already! (FYI: The boxed lunch on our last day was also great.) The hotel has nice bars on site, which is great for gathering socially during the winter when you may not feel like venturing outdoors. And they are nice venues where locals go there too - ran into a few friends. The second floor bar is open, bright and offers a few different seating areas and live entertainment. The 21st floor bar is darker, classy, upscale with comfy seating and entrance to the fabulous patio (a must-see even in the winter.)During my stay, the concierge texted my cell phone a couple times a day. I thought it was OK, but some colleagues found that intrusive since they didn't ask for permission. By proactively texting me, I wish they would have been a little more helpful, like making the two-minute walk to 7-Eleven to get me contact solution rather than just giving me the address - which I can Google myself. Other than that, service was amazing and courteous.All in all, I enjoyed my stay very much and would love to return for a stay-cation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful, CLEAN rooms with a view!
text: I have stayed at the LondonHouse several times in the past year, and each time I am amazed by the stellar service and the stunning views. This most recent time I received a complimentary upgrade as a Diamond Member (as I always do from the generous staff here) to a Corner Studio Suite. The room was very spacious, and I enjoyed having multiple views, even from the bathroom! Special props to Jeovanny and his housekeeping team for always keeping these rooms in perfect condition. Looking forward to my next visit!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top of the River to ya
text: Booked a large suite and was not disappointed. The views from the room were breathtaking and the service from the hotel staff was exceptional. The dining area for breakfast was cozy and had a warm atmosphere. We took tow teenage boys with us and they were thrilled by the food as well as their accommodations. The hotel is convenient to great restaurants and shopping. Loved the sculpture across from the Trump Tower. The only item that slightly marred the experience was our treatment at the Rooftop Bar. I had made a reservation a month in advance and was surprised that we were seated contrary to my requests (sofa by the edge). The host explained that the sofas had a high minimum spend, my southern accent must indicate poverty, and seated us to his lowered expectations. I'm not certain if he called the staff downstairs, or sensed an income opportunity, but he did move us to the desired location within twenty minutes and apologized for the misunderstanding. His service from that point forward was professional and courteous. The food was delicious, the drinks were tasty and stiff, and the view heavenly. Be advised that there is no shade from the sun in the summer and the sun/heat can be quite brutal. Ladies wear your hat and sunglasses.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Service with Style!
text: First time back in Chicago since 2000 and this hotel couldn't have been any better! The ambiance, the staff and the overall feel is excellent! I went in early Feb and it was cold but the staff was excellent in making sure that all guests were served from the drop off point to the front door! They were not looking for a tip, just genuine service, specifically Fikret that went above and beyond.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome Personable Service
text: Michelle in the Bridges Lobby Bar is awesome. She knows her thing while still being approachable, knowledgable, humble and with the wit to keep an amazing conversation. Kudos to her! Keep up the good work!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Work trip
text: I stayed here about 2 full weeks for work. Great location, great amenitiesand even greater service. Im guessing it was a slow week for them because I was upgraded to a suite upon check in. I couldn't have made a better choice. Everything was perfect and I can't wait to return

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of my favorite hotels
text: Have only been there once, and for only one night, but can honestly say it is one of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in. The service is excellent, the decor is chic and contemporary, the concierge was a true expert at dining recommendations, and the rooms are big and comfortable. Plus they have my favorite brand of bath products (Malin + Goetz). Only downside would be the water pressure. Could use an improvement.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Night in Chicago
text: We booked a room at the Londonhouse for a night last minute. It was affordable and in a great location. Upon arriving we were offered an upgrade to a larger room overlooking the river. The room was clean, spacious, and very beautiful. It had a large ceiling to floor window and a breathtaking view of the sunset. The only issue we had with the whole experience was the $71 parking fee for mandatory valet parking. It proved difficult to get something from our car when we realized we forgot my wallet and needed it to go out. Other than that it was a wonderful trip and we would stay there again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional
text: Fantastic hotel in a glorious location.Room was large and airy with a great modern vibe, bed large and comfortable. Good sized bathroom with great walk in shower.Staff were all very pleasant and welcoming.The view from the roof top bar is well worth the elevator rides....the elevator system is different from most, but worked well for us. The view from the second floor lobby bar is great too...watching Chicago go about it's business is strangely relaxing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience
text: Not only is this hotel beautiful, the employees are fantastic. Kurt at the bar gave us the greatest service, and made our time over the top. He was beyond great. üòäüòä even the front guy that grabbed our bags gave us fabulous service and really made sure we were comfortable with dropping off our luggage! Never been so satisfied with hotel employees.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room with a view?
text: This is my third time to stay at the hotel.  Nice location and modern.  Nice enough staff.  But beware of the upgrade to ‚Äúa room with a view‚Äù.... you will likely have a Trump Tower nightlight glaring into your room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful views
text: The London House is a clean, updated hotel with excellent views of the Chicago river. Beds were comfortable and everyone was helpful and nice. It is walking distance to everything downtown. Robes and slippers were a nice touch. Great value for the room and location, however, the food and wine seemed overpriced for the quality.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional
text: Always an exceptional experience when I stay at Londonhouse from the front desk, security, bartenders, to bell hops and valet. Everybody goes above and beyond to make sure you are taken care of. I would recommend the Londonhouse to everyone.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago stay
text: The hotel is elegant and well managed. I found its location convenient with many restaurants and convenience stores in walking distance. It was also walking distance to Millennium Park and the Miracle Mile shopping district.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice stay
text: Great experience at the hotel for an extended business trip. Rooms were clean and hotel staff was very friendly. Hotel bar was a bit pricey. Rooms are nicely update and beds very comfortable. Will stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice rooms good location, staff needs training
text: Had a room overlooking the river across from the Trump which was beautiful. Its surprising how noisy traffic from Wabash is even when you are up 17 floors! Though having lived near a major international airport once it didn't faze me but the wife had trouble getting to sleep. Rooms are modern, well decorated and functional except they could do without the fancy light controls etc. Or maybe I am just showing how dated I am.  The breakfast was so so, you're better off walking 2 blocks down State street to TheWit and getting breakfast in their coffee shop. As a Hilton Diamond member for many years I've experienced lots of Hilton properties and this was my first experience with the Curio  group. I had a billing issue when we left.  I usually skip the desk checkout and just leave and I get the bill emailed.  When it came the afternoon after we had departed I noticed they had tacked on a restaurant charge which wasn't ours. No big deal I thought. I called the front desk but it took 3 calls, multiple  back and forth between the front desk and restaurant and it was housekeeping (and how did I get transferred there??) who eventually got me to a person who could fix my problem! It was fixed quickly after that but seriously, the first front desk folks kept telling me first to speak with the restaurant and the restaurant manager (once you find a live person there in the afternoon) kept saying he can't do anything without seeing the hotel bill which he can't access. But why tell me that half a dozen times and not just say after the first one or two times that he will connect me to the people who can fix my issue. I've been in Hampton Inns in Nowhere where the staff are better trained. I know its not the Waldorf but like I said Hamptons can do better! Maybe its because the staff are new at this newer location. Aside from this hiccup, it was a very comfortable place worth trying with a great location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Great location,room has a great view of the river and adjacent buildings.The lobby restaurant is great for breakfast.The big bus tour stop is right across the street.The night view from the top floor terrace is great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Christmas in the city
text: Second year to stay at London house.  This is our go-to hotel on the river.  I‚Äôm super picky about cleanliness and awesome service, and this hotel exceeds my expectations.  Look forward to next years‚Äô stay.  I hope the awesome reviews don‚Äôt drive up the price of this hotel;the price is one of the perks!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Great experience. Rooms were exceptionally clean with housekeeping staff being very polite. Front desk staff attentive and responded with any question or concern. King Vista Suite worth the extra money because of the increased size in the room and the view was great with the floor to ceiling windows. The restaurant and bar on the 21st floor was nice and had great food. Bar on the 2nd floor lobby comfortable; heard the rooftop bar on the 22nd floor was nice by my 24 year old daughter and her friends. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect all round.
text: Brilliant stay for a few days on business. King room with river view was modern and very stylish fitted out like a home away from home. Little extras made the difference like bathroom sensor lights, perfect bed / linen, coffee machine, good old fashioned analogue clock and high spec radio, very respectful staff and handy location to central loop / restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really poor customer service!
text: I don't remember the last time I gave a 1/5 rating. In fact, if there's a 0/5, I might choose that option instead. For those of you that value services, my experience will give you a second thought on whether you want to choose to stay here ‚Äî given there are plenty of decent hotels in Chicago. So here's what happened. I had to take a last-minute trip to Chicago for some family emergency, so I booked my hotel very last minute...just to have a place to stay and a place to work. Upon checking into the hotel, the staff gave me the room (#1642). I asked if the room has a good view, they informed me that if I wanted to upgrade to a better view, they can offer me a discounted rate. While having a good view might be nice, my purpose of the visit wasn't for leisure, so I turned it down. As I arrived at my room, I was ready to take a quick power nap but couldn't get the electronic curtains down. To be more specific, I had two windows in the room and one curtain worked fine while the other didn't. So I called guest services and asked them if they could send someone up to check. They said yes. Roughly 15 minutes later, I decided to call again just to see when they will send someone, the lady on the other side of the phone said she put in a request already but not sure when. So I asked her to check and let me know. Another 10 minutes later, I got no calls from her, so I decided to call her back. This time, I asked her if anyone's coming soon, and she said "even if someone comes to your room, they can't fix it because they don't have the parts". I was annoyed and a bit furious at the time and asked her why she didn't tell me during my first call because by then I wasted half an hour just sitting on the bed waiting. So I told her I'll just go downstairs to exchange for another room. When I went back down to the front desk and told them about the situation, they told me they'll get me another room. This time they gave me room #1742, exactly the same layout but one floor higher. As soon as they gave me the new keys, I went upstairs. For some reason, in the back of my mind, I had a feeling this room wouldn't have working curtains, either. And guess what....I was right! As soon as I gave the curtains a 5-min try, I went back down to the front desk and informed them the situation. They were...unapologetic and in disbelief that both rooms' curtains did not work for me. As I asked them to give me another room that actually works...one manager-looking person peaked over and said "what's going on? Is it the room 42? don't give customers room 42!" Can you imagine how I felt at that time? How could these people NOT communicate internally? It was obvious that room 42 had issues so how could they give me that room twice. While the guy at the front desk was trying to place a room for me, I asked him if they have been having issues with curtains since the lady from guest services told me they don't have the parts. Guess what he replied? He said "nope, never heard of it". Then I told him about how I just wanna make sure the next room works, so I wouldn't have to come downstairs again. Instead of being apologetic about the situation, he asked "where's your luggage?" I said, I have a backpack only. Then he replied "oh, that's not that bad then". SERIOUSLY, SERIOUSLY? Just because I don't have that much stuff, he considered me coming downstairs TWICE and wasting my time was not that much of an inconvenience? I wanted to ask for a manager at the time but by then I needed to get some work done, so I just went upstairs and hope for the best. This time, they gave me a room on a much lower floor with a manual curtain rather than the broken electronic type. Throughout this whole time, NO ONE from the staff (either over the phone or in person) demonstrated any quality of customer service that should have been offered at the level of this hotel chain. I am very very surprised and will never come back again. P/S Initially, I was going to book an SPA at the hotel but decided not to spend even one extra dime in this place. I have travelled and stayed in many places around the world, this is probably by far....one of the worst hotel stay experience I've had.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay
text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights to attend a nearby business expo. The room was attractive, roomy, clean and attention given to so much detail down to a Nespresso machine in the room. Very comfortable bed. The staff was outstanding in attending to our needs. Mark in valet services was super friendly and helpful in storing our baggage and insightful in answering any questions we had. At the front desk, Martha and Brandy went above and beyond in accommodating us and providing excellent customer service. They all made us feel at home and we would definitely stay here when in Chicago again. We truly appreciate this experience and how we were truly treated as guests.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Chicago Hotel
text: This is a beautiful hotel that offers so much.  It's in the city down by the river walk.  They have a roof top bar as well as a bar inside the hotel.  If you want breathtaking views this is the hotel for you.  The restaurant are great too. It's hard to find friendly hotel employees but these were all happy and friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simple, classy and chic!!!!
text: 6th-floor suite for 6nights! Staycation with goddaughter.Tori greeted me with a warm smile and was kind enough to upgrade us during our stay. Thank you!My fav things:Decor-simple, classy and chic. Lots of grays, blacks, woods, and bronzes. Frankly, it's super sexy. Great place to stay for a romantic getaway with your mate. Fitness center-Great size, fully equipped and well-appointed. A pull-up bar would be a welcomed addition. Please consider.Suite-Incredibly spacious, clean and sexy! See attached pics.Price-great winter prices. Perfect for a staycation. Me:13yr Hilton Honors Man100 hotel nights per year6nights

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Would absolutely stay again!
text: From the moment I arrived, everything was great.  I was on a business trip, the staff is very friendly, bars are great & cocktails were delish!  My room was very spacious including the bathroom and the view was spectacular!  Would definitely go back!!! (Ps, check out their spa, ask for Zana - ahhhmazing!!!!)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best roof top bar in the city!
text: My girlfriend and I stayed in this amazing hotel for 3 nights and I have to say that I would not stay anywhere else when I return. The hotel has recently been updated and is clean and cool and as the title states - has the best roof top bar I've ever been too! The cocktails, although not cheap, are great - as was the food. The only thing I could fault this place for was they appeared to lose control with the check in process. It looked like a large party of people turned up and the queues stayed for a long time. I have read this in other comments and can only hope this has been addressed as it is not a complicated issue to fix. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and I WILL be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views!
text: Four of us met in Chicago and stayed here. We had requested adjoining grooms but none were available. The found us two that were just a few doors down from each other. View was beautiful from the rooms as well as the rooftop restaurant. Staff were very accommodating. Rooms were large. Would have preferred a Keurig over the type provided. Elevator system is a little quirky. You must scan your room key which then tells you which elevators will take you to your room. Not the same elevator every time. We really enjoyed our stay. Great location!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse
text: Great experience at the LondonHouse in Chicago. Hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city with easy walk to many attractions, shopping, and offices. Rooms are well appointed and several onsite restaurants provide options for food and drink.  Highly recommend a visit to the rooftop bar to enjoy some fabulous food and views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very well located and remarkably nice staff
text: Had a 3 night stay here over a weekend, the hotel itself is beautiful and the location is exceptional, right in the middle of the way between milennium park and the magnificent mile, so everything in downtown Chicago is easily reachable on foot. The room was nice and the price was very good considering its size and ammenities.There's only 2 little things that in my opinion take the experience down a bit, first of all, do not come here in a car, I know pretty much all parking in Chicago is expensive but I foiund the hotel's valet parking excessively expensive, around 75% of room value per day. Second, pillows aren't the best around so I had a less than ideal first night before I found a way to make the bed more comfortable. Other than that, the hotel is great, totally worth it.Special mention to the exceptionally nice staff, from the reception, to the valet parking person, and everything in between, just super helpful and open to questions.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and value
text: This hotel deserves much praise.  It is a unique property with a classic feel.  Wonderful location near downtown, theaters, the river, and Michigan Avenue Shopping.  Check out the rooftop bar which is a hot spot at night.  Hotel guests do not have to wait on line for entrance.  The rooms are nicely appointed and staff is plentiful, very helpful, and friendly.  We traveled with our teenage son and the two queens room was large and comfortable with a nice sitting area that overlooked a great view of the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Ayptical definition of "corner" room--  Bar is good for view, not drinks
text: In following up with the hotel about our experience, they told me:"1733 is not a corner studio suite. However, 1833 and 1933 are. They are not in the corner of the hotel but based on the renovated layout those two rooms were designed as studio suites so they are considered as such although they are not in a corner.
