The other 31 corner studios on property are in a corner."Our visit started off with the front desk staff _repeatedly_ trying to convince us that the room they originally put us in was a "corner room" (a room we'd prepaid a higher rate to get). See the picture-- clearly, 1733 is not a corner room, both because it wasn't in a corner (as the Merriam-Webster Dictionary or the rest of the world would define it) but also because it didn't match the hotel's description of a corner room having a separate sitting area.  Eventually, they put us in a corner room- which was PERFECT- but not before making us feel as if we were difficult customers.Once we got into the right room, we loved it. We had a great view of the river and the lake, the bed was so comfortable and the layout of the room made it feel roomy and cozy at the same time. The location is really awesome as well.We tried the bar.  It was Jan so although the rooftop bar wasn't open, you could go out to see the view, which was spectacular.  In the bar, however, I would say that staff were decent bartenders but not mixologists-- there are better bars in Chicago nearby.I'd stay here again -especially if I knew I'd end up in room 1635 (or similar corner room)-- it was a great room for a getaway weekend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, boutique feel, attentive staff
text: Really enjoyed getting this hotel for a last minute business trip.  A great deal!  Loved the intimate feel of this hotel and the friendliness of the staff who greeted us at every opportunity.  Rooms are well maintained although not sure about how much privacy from the windows across the river!  But love the shower and the clean lines.  Gym was on the small sie, but adequate for a quick work out.  Go to the rooftop to get a great view of the skyline!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel with a view!
text: Loved it! The view from the rooftop bar is simply stunning! Was lucky enough to get an upgrade and enjoyed the view on the river from my room as well! Design of the rooms was very nice, service was excellent! There‚Äôs a Nespresso machine too! You can get good food and drinks down in the lobby - live music included on Saturday evenings when you‚Äôre lucky! Location is great - very central!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago's place to be
text: This is my third stay at Londonhouse I will keep coming back--always a good experience, never disappointed - rooms are spacious and comfortable. My view is always perfect.  Staff is superior!  Love the lobby lounge area and the configuration of the lifts. Service is always speedy with everything I ever ask for!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Highly recommended
text: Our stay was a blast.  The second floor bar was so much fun.  Michelle is friendly and makes a great lemon drop and Kurt is entertaining and had great recommendations for enjoying a night on the town.  The view from the rooftop is the best in Chicago.  And the tatertots on the 21st floor bar menu rock.  I can't wait for our next visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location!
text: Would definitely stay here again, room was great! The bathroom door slides closed, so not super private. Great view, great location. Staff was nice and helpful. We unfortunately didn‚Äôt have time to try out the roof bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, beautiful views, A+ staff
text: I would stay here again, I visited for a weekend visit with my girlfriend. The staff all communicated with me via a text line and helped me with any questions I had about the hotel or Chicago in general. I paid extra for a room with a view, and a beautiful view it was!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Helpful Staff
text: Came into town to catch a show.  The hotel was in a great location to hit all the major spots.  The hotel was clean and the rooms we had were very nice.  The staff whether at the front desk, the bar, house keep or even restaurant were helpful, pleasant to speak with.  Really enjoyed my time there and would stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I wish I could give 10 stars!!!!!
text: My stay at London House was beyond AMAZING and FANTASTIC!!! I have stayed here three times. Once by myself and the other two times were with my mother and sister. The hotel opened in 2016 and EVERYTHING still looks brand new!!!! I have stayed in the standard rooms before and this time I stayed in the presidential suite!!!! It left me speechless!!! It was the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in!!!! Both the standard rooms of my past stays and the presidential suite were magnificent. The rooms are spacious, they feature very new, modern finishes. A wonderful spa-like bathroom and grand shower fit for a king or queen. The room was simply outstanding and so was the customer service. All employees were very, very accommodating, friendly and I really felt welcome. The location is also excellent because you are right off the iconic Magnificent Mile. You are walking distance from great shops, restaurants, parks, museums, the Chicago River Walk, the Nutella store, the Chicago Tribune and Navy Pier. I have stayed at many hotels in downtown and London House is by far my absolute FAVORITE. I highly recommend this hotel if you are young or old, a single traveler or traveling with family. The hotel is very luxurious but affordable!!! I also liked that the hallways were very quiet and I couldn't hear any noise from the surrounding rooms. London House also offers a beautiful, roof top bar, a state-of-the-art fitness center, room service and the food they serve is delicious!! Lastly, I have nothing negative to say about my stay here. My mom, sister and I think this is the best hotel ever and we cannot wait to return!!!! Thank you London House for making us feel so special!!!! All hotels should aim to be like London House!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Stay with Excellent Service
text: I recently stayed at the LondonHouse for a business trip and could not be more satisfied with my overall experience. The decor and appointment of the rooms is tastefully done with all of the modern fixtures you'd want. The staff was excellent. Abel went above and beyond to accommodate my requests and made me feel like a queen when I arrived. I really appreciated his willingness to go the extra mile for me!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love LondonHouse!
text: My first stay at LondonHouse in Chicago was summer 2017 for a multi-day business trip, and I fell in love with the gorgeous blue umbrella chairs in the lobby and ultimately MY ROOM, very well appointed and luxurious with a beautiful view. As a Hilton Honors member, I was beyond thrilled that it is part of the brand as I frequently travel to Chicago; LondonHouse is now my preferred hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My go to in Chicago - never disappointed!
text: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and consistently been pleased with the staff, the comfort, and the attention to detail. This is the first place I look when I'm booking a trip and find the location to be ideal. Be warned, GPS doesn't always play nice in this area of downtown Chicago, but that has nothing to do with the hotel. Just be aware of it and stay at the London House.   The bathrooms are great, eco-friendly lighting, comfortable beds, and bedding, and the texting with staff is awesome. My only complaint is that Hilton, in general, seems to have gone to really cheap toilet paper. Seriously?  Not the place to try to save a few dollars. Big dissatisfier.  This isn't unique to this property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Posh and Poised
text: Smaller hotel that is very clean and inviting. The views from the rooftop are priceless.The staff at the LondonHouse are very friendly and accommodating. Have never had an issue communicating with them- nice conversations with the bellhops while waiting for our cabs. Alexis, Robert, and Abe at the front desk were especially aware of customer service and how to stay personal but professional at the same time. Place to stay while in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel
text: The customer service was excellent. Beautiful hotel, great bar on the 21st floor with amazing outdoor bar area on 22nd floor, which of course was closed during the twelve degree weather, but was open to go experience the view. The concierge, Shannon, was so helpful and friendly, and she provided us with great options and even coupons through the concierge service. The view out our hotel window was fabulous. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: The LondonHouse Chicago is a great hotel. Amazing  staff, nice room, and very clean. It's  in a great location  with some views overlooking the river. This was my second time here, and plan on staying again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel with a great location!
text: We have been to Chicago several times, but have not stayed at the London House before.  It was a very nice hotel.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We ate at the bar and it had a pretty good bar menu.  The hotel is located within walking distance of several attractions and wonderful restaurants. We would definitely recommend a stay at the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing boutique hotel!
text: I love the rooms, decor and restaurant!  I stayed in several hotels in Chicago and this is my favorite hotel so far.  Makes me feel like home. The city views are stunning!   Definitely staying there again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay, New Favorite
text: Service was friendly and top notch.  From Valet to check-in to bartenders. Rooms were cozy clean and modern. Beds comfortable.  Bathrooms very nice. Location was perfect.  Walked to Gino's East and shopped Magnificent Mile.  Lounges on 2nd and 21st floor were very nice. Absolutely nothing less than stellar to say about London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: So impressed! Loved it!
text: A friend recommended this hotel to me, so on my first ever trip to Chicago, a getaway with my spouse, we decided to spend a night at the LondonHouse. It is gorgeous as elegant and the location could not be better. (We walked everywhere and rode the trains). We booked through the Hilton app and then requested an upgrade to a Vista room a few days later (also through the app- this is the best deal on an upgrade, only $15). The floor to ceiling windows were well worth the upgrade price. I loved the room, the view (as another reviewer mentioned. Choose a room that ends in 13). The bed was SO comfortable, and I‚Äôm incredibly picky about beds and pillows. The room was decorated so beautifully, the bathrooms gorgeous as well. The bellmen were friendly and helpful.  Also the soap had the best smell ever, I couldn‚Äôt stop smelling it, and I took it and the body wash home to finish using it. Classy and high quality all around. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding mistake
text: The room was cold and hot and dark.  The lighting was terrible. Not an easy place to get in and out of along the river.  The wind was intolerable in the lower lobby.  I don't know how the bell men were able to deal with the cold.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel with great staff!
text: We were staying at LondonHouse for my birthday and everyone was so kind and helpful. Our first room had faulty electronic curtains, so the staff upgraded us to a complimentary river view. Since it was my birthday, they included chocolate covered strawberries, milk, and flowers with our room service dessert order. Kurt at the bar was kind and entertaining during lunch both days while I waited for my partner to return from his meetings. They also allowed us to store our luggage and keep our car valeted after we had checked out. The beds are supremely comfortable, and the rooms are lovely. We also received excellent assistance with our luggage from Floyd and T.J.! No complaints and highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: NYE 2017
text: Great experience, excellent service. Overall, we where pleased with the Vista Suite and loved the streaming capabilities. The staff were very accommodating and ensured our stay was pleasant. We‚Äôre looking forward to a future stay at London House Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Chromecast in every room
text: Pros:-Chromecast: If you're a millennial (or have kids you need to keep occupied), you'll love the ability to watch your Netflix/HBO Go/Hulu on the big in-room TV instead of squinting at your phone in bed. This does require its own app aside from Google Home, but wi-fi is free, so you won't be eating your data to download it.-Rooftop bar with amazing views overlooking the Chicago River. If your room doesn't have a view, simply come up to the top floor and take a look around.-Little touches like a loofa, gooseneck reading lights, and bedding patterned in the hotel's monogram. Cons: -The front desk girl was pushy about getting us to pay for an upgrade. Would forgive her somewhat if she turns out to be partially paid on commission. -Getting to the registration desk is somewhat confusing. More prominent signage by the elevators or the foot of the stairs would be helpful. -Elevators take getting used to; there are no buttons inside the elevator (you select your destination floor from the call button in the hallway) so you can't change your mind about where you want to go once you get in. The building is a Chicago historical landmark, and a famous jazz club once resided in it. Though there do seem to be jazz references here and there, it might be nice for the hotel to build more explicitly around that theme. Or a British theme -- I came across a fellow guest from a Commonwealth country who seemed confused at LH's lack of British-ness.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Our trip to Decatur
text: We went to Decatur, Illinois in early December to be with our grand-daughter when she graduated from Millikan University.  On our way home we stayed at London House.  Just a few minutes from O Hare Airport and a very lovely hotel right down town. We walked to all the attractions we wanted to see and the winter rates are very affordable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed there over the holidays. The location is great and the hotel is very clean and lovely. Would stay again for sure. We had a view of the river which for the most part was very nice.  Staff was very helpful at check-in.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text: My mom and I stayed at LondonHouse in Chicago for 11 nights over Christmas. The hotel is beautiful, you get greeted by staff as soon as you walk in the door. Rooms were lovely and spacious. Their breakage policy/rate is quite high compared to other hotels. However the central location is perfect. AWESOME rooftop bar views of the canal! Would definitely stay at LondonHouse again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: ideal chicago stay
text: An outstanding combination of location, amenities and value. The views are outstanding, especially while relaxing in the lobby / bar area. Rooms are clean, efficient and comfortable. Everything we wanted to see was within a 1/2 mile walk of the hotel including museums, theatre and dining. It was a great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and View
text: Chicago is one of the most magical cities around.  I come often for work and sometimes for play, and this location is ideal if you like to get around.  You are in the heart of it all with an amazing view of the river.  I highly recommend getting a room with a view, at least once to get the full experience of this beauty locations.  The hotel has been updated in the past few years, so it's very clean/modern.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best spot in Chicago
text: Great Location with amazing views. My family enjoyed the convenience of this hotel. In a beautiful landmark building and it was luxurious but practical and unintimidating. Easy in and easy out without attendants fussing all over you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous Hotel
text: This hotel was beautiful, clean, and located right in the middle of the city. Perfect location for sight seeing and exploring. Also you can't beat the price. Would absolutely stay here again next time we visit!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good experience
text: Room was okay. The bed was very comfortable. The lighting needs improvement. The room was very dark. The staff did keep the room very clean.The staff are very friendly and helpful. Very good service. Nice gym as  well. Would not drive a car here as the parking is $70 a night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Birthday Trip
text: My husband and I booked London House to stay a night in Chicago for my 30th Birthday. If you‚Äôre not familiar with Chicago, research location before. GPS sent us to *lower* Wacker Dr when Hotel is on *upper* Wacker Dr and would constantly mix up the upper streets for the lower. Arrival was quick. It‚Äôs obviously a busy area so you pull into a small cove, hand valet your keys, grab your bags and go. VALET is $71. There is a parking garage right around the corner they used (left parking garage ticket in my car) so if you just park there yourself you could save some money. Check out Spot Hero to check out reduced parking. Wish I would have done this before. Check In was easy and quick. We booked a King Suite and room was on 20th floor with fantastic views of the the city. Room was very spacious and very clean. Did find a few over the counter pills on the chaise lounge at the end of the bed but that was it. There are several locations within walking distance to eat. We unfortunately were visiting on a 6 degree day/night that we didn‚Äôt venture too far but there were still plenty of options. There is a 7-11 on the corner if you need as well. I would definitely recommend LondonHouse to those planning a Chicago vacation. It‚Äôs in a great location and very close to a lot of spots.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb accomodations
text: My husband and I visit relatives in Chicago over the holidays most years and like to try different hotels downtown.  We would definitely go back to the London House. Service was gracious and accommodating throughout our stay.  Staff used text to stay in touch, making it efficient to make requests such as help with restaurant reservations. Our room was quite spacious, well-appointed, and the view up Michigan Avenue was breathtaking.  The location on Wacker Drive is perfect for moving around the city.   Everything was top-notch!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business Meeting - Great location & Views
text: Had a work meeting and it has nice meeting rooms. I think the hotel is relatively new. The rooms are very modern. Ran every morning along Lake Michigan which is a quick run to get to. The hotel has a decent gym as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic stay!
text: I don‚Äôt normally leave reviews, it‚Äôs very rare for me to write a review especially since I like to show my appreciation in person. The LondonHouse Is the one of best hotels I‚Äôve stayed at in many  years! Every time I come in I am greeted by a friendly warm face. Shout out to Marta at the front desk for remembering me and making me feel like family on Christmas Day. I was bummed out being away from home for the holidays but the LondonHouse does a great job at making sure you are taken care of! I‚Äôve never seen anyone happier to be at work on Christmas! Aside from the amazing personnel the view is amazing. Location couldn‚Äôt get any better and the rooms are very spacious! One suggestion is have some warm cookies at the front desk next time!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooms good; amenities and service need work
text: Coming from a year of travel outside the US, it's a rough re-entry with this one. Americans just don't get service. The rooms are spacious and modern (walk-in shower, good linens, etc.) but the restaurants and bars come up short. Especially pathetic is the 21st floor restaurant. Food is below par (though pricing is not) and served with indifference--the staff from the hostess to the wait staff were clearly not into their jobs. The 2d floor bar is stunning to look at but overpriced (and cold when we were there). All in all, not very welcoming, or professional.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was wonderful.  Unfortunately my husband got struck with the stomach flu a few hours after arrival so we didn't have the opportunity to explore all the property has to offer.  The staff was so nice when they learned he wasn't feeling well.  They asked several times if there was anything they could do for us.  The room was very beautiful and the bed was extremely comfortable.  We will be back in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary stay
text: This hotel is in the perfect location, right on the river with great views. Close to shopping and a lot of great restaurants. The room was big and spacious and gorgeous. The staff were very friendly and the check in and out process was extremely efficient. The gentleman that checked us in went above and beyond for us and upgtaded us to a room with a view for our anniversary because I had accidentally selected the wrong room when booking

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Wedding
text: A perfect, luxurious hotel. In the heart of the city on the Chicago River. Historic site ‚Äî exact spot of original Fort Dearborn settlement. Everything about this place was fantastic. Smart, well furnished, corner suite with majestic views of river and Michigan Ave.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very chic hotel!
text: The London House is a very swanky hotel located right off of the Magnificent mile(Michigan Ave.) The hotel decor is very modern...artsy. The staff are very helpful and attentive. The rooms are very well decorated and stocked with amenities. I stayed in the King suite and I have attached pictures.  The rooms are smallish but they make the best use of the space. My main con was the Hilton honors gold/ Diamond breakfast which only gives you a $10 credit for 2 people if you want to order anything other than the continental breakfast. Other than that I would definetly stay again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best in town!!
text: The LondonHouse is by far one of the best hotels to stay at in the city! I came to Chicago for a mini bday/Holiday getaway with my husband since all of my kids are grown, we like to go on vacation for the holidays. Upon arrival Martha not only made us feel at home right away with her warm smile and welcome,  she upgraded us to a suite for my birthday. Great way to start our holiday vacation especially since it was early for check in and we were freezing. The room was absolutely beautiful and the views were breathtaking. We did experience some minor issues with Room service but we called the front desk and Martha recognized who we were right away and took care of the charges for us. We are looking forward to staying with the LondonHouse in the summer! Hopefully we can enjoy the Rooftop then! Until next time LondonHouse thank you for the great hospitality and a memorable holiday.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, can't beat the view
text: The London House is part of the Hilton Chain, and recently remodeled.  At the corner of Wacker and Michigan, it provides easy access to the stores on Michigan Avenue as well as the Loop. Get a Vista room overlooking the river, ignore the Trump sign out the window.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Ideal location, lovely building and reasonable priced hotel
text: I stayed here on business for 1 week.Location was spot on, my room was quite low down which was a shame and opened onto the Trump hotel (I think a lot face that direction).If you get up to the roof top terrace (floor 21), the view is fantastic down the river.I ate every morning in the adjoining cafe area, this was not included (which is a shame).Room was nice, however the TV remote was broken/dead upon my arrival, so had to call down to have that rectified.The sole reason I have docked this a star was because during the night I dropped a water bottle lid on the floor - whilst searching the floor next to the bed in the dark I 'found' a big shard of broken glass. I didn't cut myself, but was a bit disappointed this wasn't found in the room-cleaning.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place
text: After four hours drive, arrived at midnight but the staff didn‚Äôt know where parking lots recommended is nearby. Except that, everything was perfect, especially in location and the scenery. There‚Äôs a wonderful lobby with big glass window, the landscape was unforgettable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great stay
text: The location is ideal and this hotel was a pleasant find.  It exceeded our expectations and was a great value for the money.  Staff friendly and pleasant, the room was spotless and service was great.  We would have no qualms recommending a stay in this hotel.  We‚Äôd also stay here again.   We stayed in a suite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful bars!
text: Our LondonHouse stay was one of the more memorable Hotel experiences we have ever had. From the rooms to the amenities to the bars this hotel really did have it all. We had great customer service throughout our Stay particularly at the lobby bar. The Bartender Michelle was extremely welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable about Chicago attractions. We couldn‚Äôt recommend this place more.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick one night stay
text: The location is fantastic for both business travelers and people traveling on vacation as it is located right by the river in the Loop. It was an easy Uber ride to the hotel from O'Hare during off-peak hours but the hotel is also close to multiple mass transit stops (L Train and bus) which makes it easy to get around. The doorman was very helpful in pointing me in the right direction at check-in as the hotel lobby is actually located on the 2nd floor of the building. Reception from the front desk was warm and welcoming. Check-in was smooth and painless and I was able to check in and go to my room quickly. I was given a corner room with a lovely view of the water that directly faced the Trump tower across the river. The room was well maintained and decor was modern and tasteful. Unfortunately the coffee machine did not work and the ice machine on my floor was broken which was a slight nuisance. In-room wifi did not work when I arrived in the room so I called the front desk who quickly helped resolve the issue. My main gripe was the inconsistent service. After checking in, I made my way to the lobby bar for a drink. At midnight, the bar closed and I was told by the bartenders that I could make my way up to the rooftop bar on the top floor of the hotel for a nightcap. After riding the elevator to the top floor I grabbed a seat at the bar where I sat ignored for 10 minutes until a bartender finally notified me that they were closed... It was my understanding that the top floor bar was open past midnight, given the conversation I had with the lobby bartenders but it seems they arbitrarily decided to close early on a slow night. Even if the bar was closed at a normal time, they should have made that clear instead of wasting my time. The bartenders were not rude but not very apologetic about the whole mix-up. Overall the rooms were what I expected and the location is wonderfully convenient given the proximity to downtown, the Magnificent Mile, and many of Chicago's main tourist attractions (Millennium Park, Grant Park, Riverwalk) but the inconsistent service and broken ice machine/coffee maker was a bit frustrating for a hotel of this price/caliber.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best yet
text: Staff is very helpful and kind. The room is so comfortable and warm. Just a beautiful place and location is amazing. We were able to walk everywhere and many other restaurants close by. Love that the shopping is so close also.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, location....
text: Love that this hotel is located to the loop and also to Michigan Ave.  I think it is the perfect location. Would have liked an earlier check in but didn't feel like  paying extra for that perk.  So many hotels offer that for free.   Rooms were very well appointed- good sheets, great beds- confusing but very cool lighting system.  Get one of the full view rooms- a complete wall of windows- worth the extra charge

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Maria was very helpful and responsive
text: My friends and I stayed at the London house in chicago and had a fabulous time.  The rooms were very stylish and comfortable and the lobby bar/restaurant was fantastic.  The only negative was the very poor experience we had at breakfast (at the restaurant connected to, but not managed by, the hotel). I told Maria at the front desk about our dissatisfaction and she immediately apologized (even though it's not part of the hotel) and compensated us for our meal the night before which was not necessary, but very much appreciated.  This is why I am a loyal hilton honors member.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the nicest places we've stayed
text: This hotel is perfectly located in the Magnificent Mile area and a short distance from Millennium Park.  The rooms were very nice with great views.  The rooftop bar has incredible views looking down t e riverfront.  We were most impressed with the service and hospitality of Bridges Cafe, especially with Michelle, Ashley, Lucia and Curt.  They were all very friendly and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and even gave us great suggestions of places to visit.  Our room looked directly at the Trump building and down the riverfront.  We will return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: excellent
text: The staff were extremely friendly! Room was beautiful! Location was perfect. We have a great stay! We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Chicago! The live singer in the lobby was fantastic! Great hotle

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Holiday trip to Chicago
text: LondonHouse went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were spacious and cozy with breathtaking views of the river walk. The staff at LH provided 5 star service our entire trip to ensure our stay was one of a kind! The rooftop bar is highly recommended. We will be booking at LH every time we visit Chicago in the future!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous location and great staff
text: A beautiful hotel just steps away from shopping, entertainment, and restaurants. We arrived very early on Thursday morning (8:00) hoping to check in to at least one of our two rooms. Unfortunately, the night before, someone had set off the sprinkler systems in the elevators and they were flooded making check ins difficult as the entire staff was scurrying around to make fix the issue and accommodate guests.So, we left our bags with the Bell Hop, went to breakfast in the hotel, and got started on our shopping.  By 12:30 we received a text saying the room for our girls was ready and by 2:30 our room was ready.  Both rooms had beautiful views of the Chicago River and the Magnificent Mile.  We had a corner suite on the 20th floor that was very well appointed. This hotel is in a great location for just about anything you want to walk to in downtown Chicago (just bring comfy shoes!) We will be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great choice
text: We recently stayed 1 night at the LondonHouse. A beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff. I would not hesitate to reccomend the LondonHouse. From Fikrit the Doorman to the Rooftop venues, this place is a winner.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great room and great location
text: I wavered between 4 and 5 stars for this hotel (and I'll get to the reason in a minute), but, ultimately, there were so many positives that I leaned towards 5 stars.  First, the room was great.  We had a corner studio and it was spacious (and I'm picky about large hotel rooms), well decorated, very clean, and had large windows across two walls.  Just a beautiful room.  The bed and pillows were comfortable.  The towels were soft enough.  The temperature was great.  And the room had the expected amenities like a hair dryer and coffee-maker.  The TV also had the capability to use Chromecast and broadcast Netflix to the TV from our iPad.  Second, the location is fantastic.  The hotel is located right on the river at the corner of Wacker and Michigan avenue.  It's close to the theater district, but also close to shopping on Michigan avenue and State Street.  It's also close to Millennium Park.  Just a great central location in the loop.  It's close to great restaurants, too (but most hotels are in downtown Chicago).  Everyone in the hotel was very friendly, and there's also a rooftop bar with great views of the city.  Valet parking was $71 overnight and that's pretty steep, so be warned if you choose to park down there.  We expected expensive parking so that's not my one complaint.  My one complaint is the bathroom door.  Why do some hotels have a glass bathroom door?!?  It's a bathroom.  People want privacy.  Ugh.  I thought the room was beautiful but was immediately disappointed upon seeing the sliding glass door for the bathroom.  And, yes, it doesn't lock or close 100% (so there is a 1 inch crack that you can see through).  And, yes, it is easy to hear everything the person is doing in the bathroom through that door.  I don't know if this matters to most people, but it matters to me and it would prevent me from staying at this hotel again (if I had to share the room with someone else).  I thought so much was great about the hotel, but, for me, the bathroom door is a deal-breaker.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome in every way!
text: We love our city of Chicago and every once and awhile, leave our home for a weekend in a nearby hotel. A little different take on a staycation that‚Äôs almost as relaxing as getting out of town. Maybe more since it takes so much less time to walk a couple of blocks and be at your destination!!! Anyway, we really enjoyed the London House this weekend. We chose a Vista suite which gave us a lovely view of the river toward the west and if we craned our heads up against the window, we could get a glimpse of Michigan Avenue and the Wrigley building. It was a pretty blustery weekend with snow but we still had a great time enjoying the hotel and environs. We hit the LH on 21 lounge at exactly the right moment to get one of the cozy nooks with wee sofas and fluffy pillows. It was a great place to unwind after a really crazy week and we spent two hours just enjoying the ambience and catching up. London House is perfectly placed to take advantage of so much of what Chicago has to offer ‚Äì all within easy walking distance. Just a few blocks south and slightly west is Macy‚Äôs State Street store and Block 37 and at this time of year, Chicago‚Äôs Christkindlmarket at Daley Plaza. To the south and slightly to the east along Michigan Avenue is Chicago‚Äôs famous Millennium Park with the Cloud Gate, Crown Fountain and two places to ice skate as well as the Art Institute. Just to the south west you‚Äôll find many of Chicago‚Äôs theaters including the Chicago Theater and the Goodman, the Oriental and the Cadillac Palace. Cross the river to the north and slightly west and you will have a hard time choosing which of the fabulous River North restaurants to try. Cross the river on Michigan Avenue and you‚Äôve entered the Magnificent Mile, full of wonderful shops. The River Walk is almost right outside the door and you can head straight east to enjoy Navy Pier. London House is one of the newer hotels in Chicago so everything is still just beautiful. Comfy beds with crisp white linens. A seating area with a comfy couch and big TV. A beautifully appointed bathroom with lots of gorgeous marble and granite. There‚Äôs even a small refrigerator that is wide open to hold those delicious left-overs from that restaurant you enjoyed so much and tastes almost as good for a late night snack. The one and only downside to our stay was that on Friday night, probably one of their busier times, the elevator system was really slow and very crowded. Our assigned elevators arrived stuffed to the walls with people so we had to wait for another that arrived similarly stuffed. But that‚Äôs really the only time we had issues with the elevator. We recommend London House and we will definitely be back to take advantage of LH on 21! And when the weather warms up, we will be enjoying the spectacular views from LH on 22.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impressed!
text: Accomodations, service, cleanliness, location, value are all top notch. I stayed in the renovated section of this recently opened hotel, which also features a modern addition. Even though rooms in the addition have more glass, the historic rooms have big windows with lots of light, high ceilings, and excellent interior appointments. And views of the Chicago river are excellent from the hotel's vantage point at the intersection of Wacker Dr and Michigan Ave. A great central location for exploring the city. North to the shopping mecca of the Mag Mile, and Lincoln Park. South to Millenium and Grant parks, the waterfront, and the museums. I used to stay at the River Hotel next door (which is still a great value), but you can't beat the London House for location, quality and value. The only downsides are the arrival experience (if no one tells you the lobby is on the second floor, you'll wander the first floor for a minute or two), and the fact that the 10 degree windchill prevented visiting the rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing time!
text: Couldn't have been more satisfied with the friendly staff and amazing view of the river! I had a reservation but showed up early and they allowed me to snag another room. Make sure to check out the bar and rooftop area during your stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Clean, New and Well Maintained
text: This boutique hotel met my expectations for such a property. It was well maintained, nothing looked worn out or repaired with poor craftsmanship. I liked the decor and amenities and the location within the city. Service was not personalized but adequate.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Holiday Lights
text: Booked two rooms overnight the first weekend in December for a girlfriend getaway, shopping and holiday lights weekend.  The views from our room were spectacular. I got vista rooms over looking the Chicago River and it was so stunning at night  with all the holiday lights!       The only problem we had was our rooms not being ready on time, but we were able to check our  bags with the bellman and then head upstairs to the bar to wait. Then we had a trolley tour to take. Because of the lateness of receiving our room, the hotel made a generous adjustment to our bill. When split 3 ways, the bill felt pretty decadently low for such a beautiful view.   We had a great weekend, but I'll warn you, if you go up to Chicago to see the holiday lights on a warm weekend in December, be prepared to contend with huge crowds and traffic!!!  That being said, the Zoo lights at Lincoln Park Zoo are pretty spectacular!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place. Great location. Great staff....
text: The place was beautiful. Great staff and a great location. Great room, very clean and comfortable.  Restaurants in the building were also great. Everyone was so helpful. We will be back and looking forward to staying here again.THANK YOU.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel but skip the restaurant
text: Spent 3 nights in this hotel on a business trip. Very good value on the room price. Very convenient location, historic building (although the rooms are very modern) and scenic views. Friendly staff with a convenient and fast text-message concierge service. The lobby was a bit under-heated. The gym is good for cardio (including cold towels in a fridge!) but does not have that much to do weights.The only big downer was the restaurant (21st floor). Went for a Sunday brunch. Nice setting but the place is really a bar with a very thin menu. The espresso machine was broken. While the items on the menu seemed attractive, the execution and quality was poor. Shrimp and grits... cold. Unable to serve a bowl of fruit. No fresh-squeezed orange juice. Thawed cultivated blueberries on a $12 shortcake... really? Stay at the hotel and go eat elsewhere.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My favorite Chicago hotel
text: Very up town chic hotel. I have always been welcomed warmly here, all of the staff is friendly. There is a bar at every turn. The gym has free weights, some up to fifty lb dumbbells but not your typ cardio only... nuff said

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay in downtown Chicago. Clean, convenient, eclectic. Amenities are nice. Only knock is the gym is snall.
text: and basic. Dumbbells, elliptical,running machines. Staff is very friendly. Elevators are cool. Bar on the 21st Floor is nice, Has a cool fireplace. Staff checks up on you throughout your stay. Very nice destination.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best of the Best In Chicago
text: I could go in and on about this place. Everything is all positive. Martha made it a smooth stay for me. I felt at home and knew I made the right decision when they‚Äôre are plenty of choices. Go let Martha show you how service should be done the right way. Did I mention how clean the place is? Room was perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxury Hotel with Top Notch Customer Service
text: This is my second time staying at LondonHouse as my first stay was a delight. Jose, the gentleman at the concierge desk provided excellent dinner recommendations and went above and beyond to make our stay pleasurable. Since we were traveling for a special occasion, he sent up a special amenity accompanied by a handwritten note to help celebrate.Upon arrival, I upgraded my room (for a small fee) and the view was certainly worth it. Seeing the city light up at night over the river view with snow flurries was absolutely gorgeous. The bathroom was clean with a sleek, contemporary look and fully stocked with plush towels and body care products. The welcoming king size bed was very comfortable and allowed for a great nights rest. The staff serviced us with customer satisfaction in mind. After arriving, the front desk sent a  text to make sure the accommodations were to our liking and a follow up message to check up on our stay - Nice touch!  We also grabbed drinks in the hotel lobby bar and the warm sangria with cinnamon hit the spot on the chilly day. Overall, a rating of 5-stars is well deserved. I look forward to visiting again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Treated like family!
text: Perfect location for a quick theater fix! Wonderful staff‚ÄîMartha upgraded our room (river view) and drink tickets to celebrate my mom‚Äôs birthday. Mark offered detailed, easy-to-understand directions to restaurants, theaters, and shopping. Concierge Shannon went above and beyond taking care of us! Top-notch staff‚Äîeveryone was friendly and efficient. The hotel is beautiful; clean, tastefully decorated, comfortable. We chose this hotel for the location; the subway was just a few blocks away (easy commute from O‚ÄôHare), we walked to the theaters, restaurants, and shopping; the bus stop is right across the street, and (bonus) we had a view of the river. Our room was very nice; comfortable beds and quality bedding, simply elegant decor, lovely bathroom, and a Nespresso machine (yum!). There is a restaurant and a bakery/cafe on the first floor; we enjoyed breakfast at both. Cocktails on the second floor (lobby) were consumed in a relaxed chic environment‚Äîthere is a lounge upstairs, but we were too busy with musicals, museums, and shopping to indulge.  However, we weren‚Äôt too busy for a spa treatment‚ÄîZana and Donna gave us the royal treatment with a relaxing massage . . . Oooh, just right!  Near the spa is the fitness center‚Äîmaybe next time. . . This is a great hotel for location if you are in Chicago for the theaters. We appreciated the location; but it is the fabulous staff that made our stay fantastic! The LondonHouse will be our home whenever in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love at First Site
text: LondonHouse Chicago is nothing if not spectacular. The design and attention to detail can be seen throughout the property, from lighting to carpet pattern and artwork to culinary delights. I was here to view meeting and event space and couldn't have been more pleased with the options available. And, the Rooftop Cupula is simply a divine treasure.I look forward to visiting again soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: excellent hotel excellent location
text: excellent hotel excellent location easy to find with great location and service was good .room is clean it is 5 star hotel room with all facilities and clean is the main also the spa is one of the main services their that i have to try next time

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite place to stay in chicago
text: We stayed at LondonHouse early December this year. It was our second year in a row coming to Chicago for a weekend and we knew hands down we would be staying at LondonHouse again! We absolutely love this hotel!! The location is amazing and the river views from the hotel rooms can not be beat! Make sure you book a vista room, as this will get you the river views with floor to ceiling windows. The rooms are spacious and beautiful with very nice bathrooms as well. The concierge are friendly and will hold your luggage with no issues. Front desk staff was inviting and accommodating to our needs.  We have not taken advantage of the hotel breakfast or rooftop bar, so cannot comment on those aspects, but we saw many people coming into the hotel to go to the rooftop bar. Maybe next year we will check this out! Every time we come to Chicago we will definitely be staying at this hotel and would recommend it to everyone!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stellar
text: Was staying at London House on 12/10 and 12/11 for business meeting in Chicago downtown. Room was stunning - flawlessly decorated, clean and unfussy. Service was over the top! Had front desk checking via text to ensure my needs were met and assisted me when I tried to print airline boarding passes. Also, the cleaning services were excellent and tuned into to sweet details (decorative arrangement of towels on shower door after my 1st night stay). Easy access to many amenities and friendly, efficient crew. By the way, the bed was AWESOME! I never sleep well in hotels but looked forward to going to bed every night b/c the bed was soft and had a lovely down comforter.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional Wedding Venue!
text: Our wedding was outstanding! Steve Sleczka simply extraordinary; throughout the experience he will be your trusted guide. The entire staff were delightful, warm, welcoming, and extremely professional. The food was 5 star-simply exquisite. On top of it all, Steve introduced us to the most amazing vendors to complement our affair. Add to that unparalleled views, a majestic cupola, and beautiful accommodations, you will experience an unforgettable unique event. We highly recommend Steve and the London House. Thank you, Steve!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel On The River
text: Solid 4-Star property located on the river, and a short walk from the bridge to the Magnificent Mile.  The room itself isn't huge, but not small either by old city standards, and the bathroom was very luxurious and spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, perfect view, excellent service provided by Abel and Jose
text: My wife and I visited the hotel for our anniversary celebration and were provided excellent greeting from the start.  Employees that stood out with their level of excellent service were Abel and Jose, who greeted us with complimentary champagne and a room upgrade. This gesture made us lifelong fans of the LondonHouse and will be staying there every time we visit our favorite city. Thank you!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Holiday Trip with Adult Children
text: We gathered with our adult children from all over the country for a Holiday Celebration in Chicago.  LondonHouse Chicago absolutely welcomed us and made us feel like family from the very beginning.  Of all of the hotels we have stayed in our travels, LondonHouse ranks at the very top for customer service for sure!  Rooms were beautiful and very clean.  Brandy at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure that we had a great weekend.  She even remembered our names when we saw her in the lobby and made sure we had everything we needed.  They texted to see if we needed anything.  It was a perfect location, beautiful view and over all just a fantastic weekend.  Thank you all so much!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible hotel and hospitality
text: We decided to visit Chicago, and stubbled across the LondonHouse. We are so grateful we decided to stay there. Martha at the front desk made our anniversary so memorable that we will undoubtedly stay here again on our next visit. I wish all the hotels we stayed at had the same high level of customer service and thoughtfulness that she gave us. Not to mention, the views of the river while it was snowing were breathtaking. Thank you, Martha, for your hospitality and kind gestures toward me and my husband.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Feels like home
text: Stayed here for a week with family - felt like home. Beautiful and comfortable furnishings, fast internet access, and great TVs that link up to Netflix and Hulu. Room service was quick and delicious with reasonable prices. Great location along the river (the views!) and key attractions - magnificent mile, museum campus, navy pier, shopping - are a quick walk/drive away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: OK, but not great
text: We needed a last minute room, due to construction on our home. The rooms were discounted, and easy to get on Friday night, but now I know why. Pluses:Quiet room, curtains blocked light. Modern lighting controls throughout. Nice, higher-end furnishings & design, felt cozy. Tivoli radio, bedside plugs for charging, bedside sconce & mini reading lamp. Toto toilet, modern shower, Malin & Goetz toiletries. Minuses: No ground floor lobby - big mistake, no presence on street, no free room upgrade (they offered city view for half price of $30). Very compact Y-shaped room. Sheets scratchy, not enough pillows to lounge comfortably in bed, 1 small robe, not 2. Frustratingly slow Wifi, no new or current films on demand to watch, few channels (they suggest you stream your own via chrome cast). 1 hook total in bath, zero towel bars! No handshower, no bench, center drain (who wants to stand on shower drain?).  Had to leave voicemail for room service. Finally called back, but very small, unimpressive menu. We ordered 2 burgers, a salad, fries w/ aioli, 2 waters, 1 dessert, 1 tea. We got most of it, sans tea, aioli, silverware for 2nd person, and bill was $95! We called back, she brought pot of tea & silverware, but no mug or cup, or typical cream, sugar or honey? We caught it and asked before she left room, she made excuse "we ordered so much" but then she never came back!? Thankfully we used the tiny espresso cups for tea. The food was mediocre. I know Chicago & it's foodie scene, this was a ridiculous room service disaster. I think this hotel has potential to improve on many levels, but they need to start with management and staff training. It's in a historic building, centrally located, perfect for visitors. I hope it becomes the kind of hotel I would expect in this location, with the appropriate amenities and thoughtful service to match.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Stay - a Couple of Tweaks Would Make it Better
text: We stayed at the LondonHouse Chicago for the first time - an annual birthday tradition.We arrived to a rather crowded and chaotic  entryway - the lobby is up a staircase on the second floor. The lobby is bright and airy and a very comfortable place to sit around.We were greeted by a friendly registration desk - but it seemed to take longer than normal to check us in.  The room wasn‚Äôt ready even though it was after 4:00pm. We were told they would call when ready - of course an hour later I went to see about the room - which of course was ready, but they forgot to call.  This minor glitch is really the only negative of our stay.The room while not big, was very well appointed. Great TV, very comfy bed and pillows. The view of the Chicago River and the bustle of the Mag Mile.  For some folks, the Trump lovers, the Tower and its sign may be a bit overwhelming... for his supporters, it‚Äôs heaven.We got no street noise, or noise from the hallway.We did not go to the club on the top 3 floors... but it is obviously extremely popular based on the crowds waiting in line      to get in.The only things we would have liked to see was the ability to get breakfast within the hotel itself - not the unaffiliated establishment on the first floor.  There are plenty of choices nearby, but we would have preferred to stay in.Bottom line, we enjoyed our stay - the minor glitches had no negative impact on our stay and would come back again based on style, location, comfort and importantly, price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Service & Great Views
text: During our stay, Jose the concierge recommended that we check out the lobby bar for live music.  It was a great idea, and the holiday ambiance was wonderful.  Jose even walked us up to the roof top bar and gave us a quick architecture lesson as we looked out on the city.  I thought Jose went above and beyond our expectations and we had a great time.  Thanks again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: Great location, convenient to many downtown activities. Excellent customer service, very accommodating staff. Wonderful lobby bar, roof top/ view bar and plenty of other eating options near by. Up to date fitness center.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Place to stay while in Chicago!
text: The hotel and service was exceptional. Great location. The food was excellent, especially breakfast to start the day. Rooms have some great views of the city and the lake. I would highly recommend to all Hilton Honor members. Great meeting area.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect trip. Amazing hotel.
text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Londonhouse. The room was beautiful and modern One of the nicest I've ever stayed at.  I was at a nearby conference  and everyone was raving about the hotel. The 2lst floor lounge and rooftop bar have breathtaking views. It is in the perfect location. Will definitely be back.  One word of warning,  the ride share drivers maps do not pick up the location of the hotel correctly so leave a little extra time for them to find you.  It happened to a few of us.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Not worth the $$
text: My husband and I stayed 2 nights to celebrate my birthday and while the location was great for all the different venues we were running around to, for the price of the rooms we were slightly disappointed with service ( took 2x to finally have housekeeping come to our room). Amenities were so so compared to other Hilton hotels we've stayed at. Bar was overcrowded.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: If you want to experience downtown Chicago stay at the LondonHouse. This modern hotel fuses the incredible history of the building seamlessly. From the moment you walk in your greeted by staff ready and willing to help make your experience great. The views and overall ambience from the lobby, to the rooftop and from the guest rooms are truly great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful!
text: We had a GREAT experience here for a girls weekend in early December. The property is close to transit, shopping, dining and entertainment--basically in the heart of downtown. The decor is updated and lovely, and the rooms are well-appointed with iron/board, nespresso maker, hair dryer, toiletries, plush linens, big flat-screen TV, comfy beds, mini refrigerator and good storage space (make sure to utilize the under-the-bed space!). Decent size rooms for Chicago. The lighting was a bit dim, but overall the ambiance of the room was great and we didn't hear activity from the adjoining rooms. The bathroom was nice and had a beautiful frosted glass sliding door (though no exhaust fan). The lobby/check-in is a bit confusing, as it's on the 2nd floor, but the area is beautiful with plenty of lounging/sitting space, a bar and contemporary artwork. The elevators were a bit foreign, but once we figured out the system, it was actually pretty efficient (enter floor number into a wall display and it directs the user to the appropriate/available elevator). The BEST thing about the experience was the staff! They were ALL very welcoming and accommodating, and bellhop J.T. was AMAZING! He went above and beyond to help us with some evening plans and even treated the birthday girl! J.T. is very personable, professional and efficient. He should be promoted! Thank you all for a great weekend getaway to the Windy City!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The perfect stay
text: This hotel was conveniently located with easy travel by foot to just about anywhere. It was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly with special notice to the bell hops and valets drivers. The views from the Vista rooms are well worth the small increase you pay for it. Definitely a luxury hotel with a moderate budget price tag! You won‚Äôt regret staying here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel and Location
text: A great hotel and location that is convenient to many attractions, shopping and fantastic restaurants. You feel safe walking at night. The hotel staff are professional and friendly and will go out of their way to accommodate their guests.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: I would have rated The London House a 5 but housekeeping seems to be a minor issue! The draws in the room were dirty and the closet shelf was dusty, also found some almonds on the floor by the window...at no time did we eat almonds!The hotel is beautiful! I love what they did with a building that‚Äôs almost 100 years old and introducing it to modern day! We had a corner room #1634 facing the Chicago River towards Michigan ave and Wacker! The room was a little on the small side but the decor was excellent and the bathroom was awesome! I loved the fact that we had 4 windows total in the room and 3 had views, the 4th looked directly into rooms in the other wing of The London House! The Art Deco facade of the building is gorgeous and blends in well with other period built early skyscrapers in the area! The fitness center is on the 4th floor and has a nice selection of cardio equipment and some free weights! The lobby/lounge area on the second floor is a great place to relax, I would get coffee at 6am at Starbucks across the street and sit in the lounge and look out the huge windows! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful!I would recommend The London House to anyone looking for a great place to stay that‚Äôs near The Loop and The Magnificent Mile for shopping and dinning!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and new rooms
text: Stayed at the Londonhouse during the RSNA 2017 Meeting. The location was ideal for exploring the surrounding areas and for the shuttle to the convention centre. The hotel was recently opened and the lobby, elevators and rooms were nicely decorated. The carpets in the room are still clean, though slippers are provided. The elevators had an innovative way to ensure that they were not too crowded and that guests had to wait. The hotel could do with a pillow menu for guests who prefers firmer pillows. Great restaurants are located nearby for burgers and steaks.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Holiday weekend
text: Great location for a holiday stay! You can easily walk to State street or head north or south on Michigan Ave.  So much to do in the city and you are close to most of it.  This was our second time there.  The lobby looked really pretty with the Christmas trees.  Nice room with a great view of the Chicago river. . Friendly staff!  Good breakfast.  Very nice weekend.  Recommend the London House!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location but poor experience
text: I had booked two rooms here for my family and I for a girls weekend in Chicago.  I was excited to try it out as I had heard great things but our experience fell very short.  I have stayed in over 10 hotels in Chicago and this was one of the worst experiences.  I requested early checkin for both rooms which cannot always be honored which I understand as I used to work in hotels.  We tried to check in at 10am and they weren't ready so we checked bags in and went about our day.  Come 4pm, one room was ready but the other wasn't. Then 5 pm and the second room still wasn't ready.  I have never experienced a room not being ready PAST checkin time.  Finally around 5:30pm they were both ready but we had dinner reservations at 6 and needed to change and were waiting for our bags when we got a call from the bell desk about the description of our bags.  Needless to say at this point we had no more time so I had to come down to the desk and look for myself as we had 8 people in our party and ALOT of bags.  Finally we got all the bags together and up to our room and had to rush to dinner.  They did send up wine and truffles to our room, but only one bottle for two rooms and 8 people.  We attempted to use the credit at the bar on the 21st floor but the service and drinks were significantly slacking.  Upon going to checkout I was told I had a balance as the credit was not added and my card had been charged.  I told the lady at the front desk that there was supposed to be credit on our rooms and she had to investigate to get it taken care of.All in all, the whole experience at the Londonhouse was far below expectations.  I have gotten better service at every other hotel I have stayed in and will not be returning here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning Hotel, Stunning View
text: I was in town on business, and was struck by the glamorous lobby, and guest check-in area.  Truly beautiful, with a lot of Old Hollywood touches.My room was spacious, impeccably clean, and nicely decorated, with a view of the river walk.A big Thank You to the front desk who resolved an issue for me quickly, without fuss.  They had not received the credit card authorization from my leadership, and so invited me to sit in the lounge with a drink while they worked on that for me.  It was nice to leave it in their capable hands, after a very long day, rather than figure it out on my own.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: An Extremely Good Deal
text: Strategically placed, yet not the most expensive .  Clean, well run, attentive staff, especially the bell boy position down stairs. Bar in Lobby, Restaurant "Land and Lake"  and Snack Bar " The Corner Bakery" downstairs, Restaurant on 21st floor.  7-11 round the corner.  There is almost no incentive to leave the premises - but Millenium Park, the Athletic Association building, the Museum of Art, Macy's, Target, Nordstrom beckon, and are all within a 5 minute walk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: superb location.
text: This is a great hotel, rooftop bar has some stunning views. rooms very comfortable. superb location for getting around Chicago. All staff very friendly and helpful. no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location + Views = 5 stars
text: Great location, superb views, good service and a fun rooftop bar area made for an excellent business trip to Chicago.  Modern room and generous bathroom couple with very large mounted flat screen TV.  My 3 night stay was perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing service.
text: First of all this hotel is beautiful. I was greeted by polite staff members that helped me check in with smiles. My room was beautiful! The food is amazing. I enjoyed the Steak and Fries. The roof top bar views are top notch. Room service gets 5 stars as well. The staff was very polite swift and the food again was great. If this hotel could be in every city I would book them everywhere I travel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfectly located boutique hotel
text: A must stay when in Chicago. Located on the river within walking distance of the magnificent mile.  Room was perfect in every respect and the staff was more accommodating than you can imagine. Efficiencies abound due to their us of technology. I WILL BE BACK!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern Hotel in Great Location
text: The location is one of the best in the city.  Everything is modern and up to date.  Staff were great.  Elevators were fast and efficient.  Room was quiet, and temperature control was excellent. Rooftop bar has excellent view of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overall
text: Wonderful site, excellent rooms with great customer service! Front desk attendant took the time to walk me to the elevator and explain the hotel amenities on the way, great way to get me checked in after a long day but still advise what's available.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay Here for the Location and View
text: LondonHouse Chicago is a beautiful property in a unique riverside location. Stayed there for one night for a business event. Even though I live in this city, most impressed by the beautiful views of the skyline down the Chicago River (ask for a river view room).  Updated rooms were comfortable and clean and standard size for the area.  Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Rooftop bar offers unique ambience with excellent views, but is a popular after work spot adding to the scene.  Excellent location for visitors to our city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location on Michigan Ave
text: This hotel is located on the corner of Wacker and Michigan Ave within walking distance of all the best stores and restaurants. The hotel itself is quite historical and has been very well restored. Rooms are on the smaller side but very well appointed and upscale. In hotel dining is limited but there are many options available nearby. Would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Convenient location with great amenities
text: Beautiful hotel located right on the river in a convenient and central location in downtown Chicago business district.Easy walk to the shore and Magnificent Mile. Rooms  tend to run a bit narrow but the thoughtful design and room amenities make it quite comfortable. The room includes high quality toiletries and linens along with artful decor and a nespresso machine. Would have liked to have been accommodated with more than one of each cafe option, however I didn‚Äôt ask for more either so to be fair they may accommodated me had I asked. Overall great value for a well appointed room, great location and very helpful and friendly staff - especially the bell guys.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Review #2
text: This was my second time staying at LH. Previous review: https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g35805-d9145578-r463956355-LondonHouse_Chicago_Curio_Collection_by_Hilton-Chicago_Illinois.htmlI stayed on the 19th floor in room on the opposite side of the hotel this time, with the key difference being the view (I would recommend a river-facing view if you will have time to enjoy it). Room was fully equipped with toiletries, fridge, work space, smart TV, etc., as advertised. Staff were helpful and genuinely interested in making my stay an enjoyable one. I continue to appreciate the welcome texts, which make them more approachable.Have recommended this hotel to coworkers and friends and will continue to stay there going forward.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel is beautiful! Rooms as spacious and comfortable. The staff are friendly and always ready to help you. The location is excellent in Downtown Chicago. The view to the river is beautiful. I recommend this hotel big time!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top notch and great location
text: Great location. Unreal views. Would return in a heart beat. Lots to see and do and everything is in walking distance. Only complaint was we paid extra for a better view and the coffee maker, vanity light and bathroom fan didn‚Äôt work. If it wasn‚Äôt for that it would be a 5*****!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Tis the Season!
text: First, let me say I am a long term fan of Hilton Hotels - I've been to my fair share of them. Most frequently, I am a Chicago traveler. I‚Äôm almost always up there for work but a friends wedding brought my husband and I up to Chicago for a rare occasion of fun. I knew I had wanted to stay at LondonHouse as friends and family had told us such great things... so let‚Äôs break it down! 1- Service: Quite a few things to remark about here... first, we received a complimentary upgrade to the vista suite which offered an amazing view as well as separate living and sleeping areas. This was a big win as my husband is an early riser and myself a night owl. The front desk personnel were amazing and the valet and concierge were too. We didn't have to lift a finger once we pulled up.  2- The Room: I mean beautiful and modern don‚Äôt begin to explain the rooms - they are amazing! Floor to ceiling windows with a view of the river and Downtown Chicago and one super comfy bed. One of our favorite things was the special features the room had including the motion sensing bathroom lights which slowly dim on. The other was the Chromecast capability with the TVs. For those that don't know, it allows you to stream pretty much an application to the TV from your phone like Netflix, Hulu, Etc. It was amazing and such a great way to watch movies and make the most of it. In fact we enjoyed both the lights and Chromecast so much we are literally putting both in our house!!! 3. Location: I usually stay in the loop, so River North was a bit of a jump for me (albeit it was very close!). After staying here, I'd never stay anywhere else location wise. Easy access to Michigan Avenue, The Magnificent Mile, hundreds of amazing restaurants, and of course a Starbucks on every corner ;) We were within a 1-2 mile walk of everywhere we wanted to go and it was such a great benefit. The location is worth the hotel price alone. Now to the nitty gritty, of course nothing is ever 100% perfect - but I do have to say LondonHouse was the closest any hotel I've stayed at has gotten to. So if I had recommendations for the hotel on what to consider it would be the following two items:A) The Nespresso: this was an amazing feature, but 3 espresso pods to 2 adults is a bit of a stretch and the maid did not refill these every morning, it was more of every other day. Either offering a larger selection and refilling daily or also offering a coffee maker would remedy this!B) The Hilton Honors Breakfast: There really isn't one... now the front desk was 100% transparent about this, but it was only after booking. I'm use to getting either a full continental breakfast or breakfast vouchers for an on site restaurant, which LH did not offer. It wasn't a deal breaker for us, but having to go explore for breakfast every day did put a hitch into our normal morning hotel routine!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Twas the night before Thanksgiving
text: We love London House!!! We always stay when we come home to visit our family during the Holidays. Matthew is attentive and friendly. He helped get us nestled in to the most beautiful king suite and the man to the left of him, I cannot recall his name because I was really sleepy helped us select a restaurant that was awesome. Both of these men were awesome in helping us get our needs met! The Valet guys were very attentive as well. Then, we had a man take all our luggage to our room. We felt like celebrities! This is one of Chicago's FINEST and for the money we spent it was well worth it!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and quality
text: This hotel i very well located. Easy access within walking distance to any interesting point of Chicago. The service is very good, everybody is really willing to help and make our stay comfortable, we really feel at home, a luxurious one!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: AMAZING PLACE
text: Just got back from an absolutely amazing trip to Chicago and stay at this BEAUTIFUL  hotel. The staff was absolutely incredible, rooms were amazing, location was unbelievable! Recommend 100%! Rooms were clean and very well appointed as well

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wow
text: I cant get over how friendly Robert was, he made my trip so much better, The view is simply breathtaking. As well as the bartender knowing exactly what to do to make some more appealing. Weill Definetly be returning again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel with an awesome view and rooftop.
text: Love the roof top bar. Rooms are large and nice. I really appreciated a room with a view of the water way looking at trump tower. Slightly pricey but very nice hotel. This would be my place to stay in the summer. Conrad in the winter.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location and the service
text: I stayed here for 5 nights in October 2017. There are different types of room with different views.Room size is big and their TV has chromecast which is amazing and quite useful.It has lot of closet place and long size mirrors.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice 2nd Floor Bar!
text: Came to London House to celebrate my birthday with friends and family! The bartender Michelle was awesome and made the best Carmel Apple Mules! The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very friendly! Thank you for making my birthday special!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Hotel with amazing rooftop bar
text: The hotel is very nice view an amazing rooftop bar and view over the chicago river. Walking distance to all sightseeing spots. Nice restaurants for dinner, lunch and breakfast around. Highly recommended

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great staff, great location!
text: I had the chance to stay at the London House for a few nights during a recent business trip.  It was a fantastic experience.  The staff greeted me for my luggage on the ground floor while I headed up to the second floor lobby for check in. I arrived before lunch and my room was already ready.  The room was very nicely appointed, fashionable and comfortable.  The bathroom was spacious and contemporary.  Very comfortable bed.  I was on the 17th floor and heard no street noise.  Staff was very pleasant and attentive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very comfortable, great location, super staff
text: London House is a very nice place to stay. The staff is very nice and attentive. Rooms very comfortable. There's an espresso machine in rooms instead of regular coffee, and it's very good. Many rooms have a great view up and down the river. Being in a central location, it's got some city noise.  Note on value: I had a very good company rate. Not sure if it would be great for families.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new favorite hotel in Chicago
text: I stayed here for a week during a business trip. Hotel was trendy and was in great location. I was upgraded to a suite which was awesome. Rooftop was nice, good view. I stayed at the Wit couple of times during my past visit to Chicago but I would stay here now.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My goto place in Chicago
text: Michelle and Ashley made us up with an amazing jalape√±o margarita at the bar. An awesome place to relax and recharge with friends and family.Hotel staff is very accommodating! Amazing Views from the vista rooms!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Just Perfect!
