text: Well, it's funny how I would see this from outside and looked just like any other hotel. Wrong! I love it. Let's start with the entrance bell staff are very professional and informative.  I went up to the lobby, which is large but not intimidating. Front desk staff is great. I have to say Robert the Assistant Front Office Manager who gave me a tour of the rooms was very informative. You have a person that believes what they are selling. He gave me an insight of a few details on the property and everything looked gorgeous. I saw the rooms, and the views are just great. I don't believe in the higher the better, you can still get a great view in a lower floor. This is a perfect option for any age type. Abel, took us on a brief tour upstairs to the bar. Amazing views! My first rooftop bar and I lived in this city forever. Another gentleman that knows what he is doing. I was not a hotel guest  YET, but with people passionate in what they do like this staff , you can't think twice in staying. I can't wait to visit again, and best believe I will be staying over this time. Again, thank you both, you both are just amazing!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing!
text: I have traveled for over 30 years but the staff at this hotel is by far the best that I have encountered. I frequent the Langham but not even there have I received this level of service.I hate that I am unable to remember all of your staff members names because everyone is truly deserving of a mention. I would like to make note of Alexis,Robert,Abel and Brandy (with the braids) from reception. Those four were such a pleasure to talk to and kept me entertained throughout my stay(special thank you to Abel for the applause anytime I walked through the lobby it always made my day). I really felt like they enjoyed their jobs and it showed in their interactions with not only myself but other guests. I requested to speak to a manager to share how great they were and found out that this entire time I was dealing with one which only cemented my opinion of this hotel. I am a firm believer that your staff is a reflection of your leadership skills and from what I witnessed your management is doing a hell of a job.  By far the best hotel in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: Chicago is a great city, made better by the London House.  The entire experience was extremely good and everything one should expect at this level.  The quality of the property, the professionalism of the staff all contributed to a great guest experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Champagne Welcomes
text: We recently stayed here for our "Girls Trip" weekend getaway. Upon arriving we were greeted with warm smiles. When we checked in the manager Michael Gardner  and well as Abel were very welcoming...so welcoming that the front desk did song for us:O! Then we were offered a complimentary bottle of champagne..this set the tone for hotel. Upon arriving into the room...omg the view was gorgeous. We had a view of the river, as well as Trump Tower, but hey you can't have it all. The room has a contemporary theme. The beds have the dressers under the bed...cool! The mirrors were a girls dream, and they're everywhere.The bathroom had standing shower with a glass all around. Very chic, and I love the all white marble title. Yes all white marble!!!There is dim lighting throughout the room, but that was perfect for those nights when you want to sit and look out at the river at night..beautiful. The hotel has a rooftop bar, that seems to be really popular. Although there isn't any service offered on the rooftop; but hey you can take your drinks to the rooftop. The bar has a nice fireplace with glass to keep the fire in place; nice to sit around and have drinks and mingle. The staff was excellent; from the manager Michael to the bellmen, to the bar staff. Everyone was super friendly and very helpful. I could honestly say that if I were snowed in, I wouldn't complain because the hotel and staff would me keep there:).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love This Hotel
text: I travel to Chicago for business 3-4 times a year. The location of the London House is perfect to explore River North and to enjoy State Street and South Michigan Avenue. The rooms are spacious, the views are fantastic, hotel staff is friendly and professional.  Having a drink at the rooftop in the summer is a pricey but very special experience.  It is my go to hotel if the rates fit my budget.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hotel Ever
text: My wife and I were in Chicago celebrating my 50th birthday.  This hotel is in an amazing location on the Chicago river with direct access to downtown, the Magnificent Mile, the River Walk, and public transportation.  The hotel itself is beautiful with amazing views of the city.  The best thing about this hotel is the amazing staff.  Tori at check in set the positive tone for a wonderful stay with my first complimentary birthday cocktail and gave us an amazing room.  Every encounter with staff from check in to check out was welcoming and warm giving a V.I.P. experience.  The London House hotel staff, building, and location can't be beat.  Definitely stay here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago is fantastic
text: Great staff, perfect location, wonderful amenities are just part of the fantastic experience that we had at the London House.  The attention to details are 2nd to none.  The wedding reception was incredible.  We are coming back to have more fun in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice location
text: Had a great stay the service was great Location was excellent the rooms warm and cozy I would recommend this hotel. The restaurant is the neighbor bakery it was great fast and efficient.  Beautiful river view  from the window

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love This Place
text: Stayed here twice in two weeks, my first visits after nearly a week here a year ago. The LondonHouse is becoming my hotel of choice in Chicago, with great design, a friendly staff and a location perfect for the Loop, River North and Michigan Avenue.Two weeks ago, I had a corner king, which I also had last year. Very comfortable, with a good workspace and nice views, as well as some room to stretch out. This week, I had a Vista king, with full-length windows overlooking the river (and, sadly, looking straight at the Trump hotel across the river, but you can't have everything). The Vista rooms are a little snug, but still comfortable, and the view is remarkable. The staff is amazing. From the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone acts like seeing you is the high point of their day. The dining and drinking options are nice, and having a Corner Bakery in the building helps the budget. This hotel is a keeper. Look forward to coming back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city
text: Loved my stay at LondonHouse. Room was super comfortable with a spacious bathroom. Floor to ceiling windows provided amazing Chicago River views. Everything you want to see in downtown Chicago is walkable from this location. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New favorite Chicago hotel!
text: Get away weekend with friends and wanted to stay somewhere new. What a delightful choice. Fresh new decor in rooms, modern but not over the top. Clean line spacious showers and bathrooms. Great 2nd floor bar and roof top bar and very accommodating staff. No wait on elevators, monumental. Did IÔ∏è mention great views of the River? Definite return visit üòä

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend getaway
text: This hotel was in an amazing location, within walking distance to so much that Chicago has to offer. The hotel itself was great. A little difficult to navigate at times because it's an old building. The rooms were a decent size, a little small but we hardly spent any time in the room. Bed was comfortable and minimal noise heard, considering it is on a very busy street in Chicago.The rooftop bar is the highlight here. It was super busy this weekend but being a guest of the hotel, you are allowed priority. There was no room to sit and long lines for drinks so we decided to sit one level down, at the inside bar which was quieter and a nice place to relax after a day of walking.I would recommend this hotel to people looking for a good 4 star hotel in a prime location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Londonhouse Chicago is Royal
text: Picked this place because I have a pet allergy, they don't accept them, AND it had great reviews. They were right! There on business nov 1 thru nov 5.love love LOVED IT!  Ask for a room with a view - it will cost you a bit more BUT the room was bright and clean and fresh, the bed was great. The bathroom was perfect. Will absolutely stay there again! Easy cab service. Many restaurants in the area - make sure to check Ocean Cut at 20 W Kinzie, excellent food and service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Staff
text: We arrived at the property and was promptly greeted by every staff member we encountered.  Upon reaching the front desk we were greeted by Robert Jones who checked us in.  Mr. Jones welcomed us and checked us in right away,  He answered any questions we had and introduced us the concierge as well as the rest of the staff. It was the best check in experience I've had in a long time.  We were made to feel very special.  After we were checked in, we were offered and WE accepted champagne.  Abel was delightful and it was if we'd known him for some time.  Not stuffy at all.  I love this PLACE and it is now my go to property when in Chi-town!!We were in room 1907 which overlooked the Chicago River and faced Trump Tower.  The view was awesome.  The bathroom was luxurious and modern; equipped with a glass shower stall and contemporary toilet.You must visit the Rooftop!!  Great place to unwind and relax.  Drinks are great!! Wait staff was very attentive.  Our every need was meet by everyone we encountered...from the valet, to the bellman, to the front desk staff, to the housekeeping staff....WAY TO GO LONDONHOUSE CHICAGO.  Bye, bye Ritz....this is now my Chicago Hotel!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Momentus Stay
text: While there are amazing options for hotels in downtown Chicago, check out the boutique feel and world class hotel of the London House.  This is a great place to call home while away from home.  Old feel while being complemented with contemporary makes this a special place.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: wonderful location on Wacker and Michigan Ave near the river walk and shopping. nice views from hotel. Gold and diamond honor have limited breakfast options. Nice bakery restaurant not part of the hotel but good food. very friendly staff

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect for
text: A bachelor or bachelorette party. I stayed in room 2025, which was amazing. Easily could have 6+ people crash here with all of the couch space. Amazing views of the river and the city. Too bad I was here for work and couldn't take advantage of the rooftop bar and all the space. Special thanks to Matthew and the team who treated me to a great night at the LH. Highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Location
text: My husband and I just stayed there last week and we had a great time! Location is superb!!! The hotel is very nice and comfortable. We had a river view which was awesome! Loved it! The TV is great, you download an app and you can watch anything from your phone, from any app or webpage that you have while connected to the hotel wifi. Overall a great experience!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect stay
text: Stayed at LondonHouse on business and every aspect was perfect. From check in to check out. My package sent ahead was waiting for me and they sent it to the room. Room was beautifully appointed, and I had a view of the river. Many charming details in the hotel. Location is near everything you might want to do in downtown Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London house visit
text: Great hotel, stylish, clean and very attentive staff.  Nice location. Lobby bartender was very nice and fast service. Roof top restraunt‚Äôs bar tender was not attentive and seemed like a wreck. The lobby bar made up for it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location/Great Hotel
text: We came to Chicago for a girl's weekend and we loved the LondonHouse where we stayed for 4 nights. We upgraded for a river view room on the 19th floor. It was stunning and couldn't stop gazing out the window. We were helped several times by Shannon the concierge. She was amazing and so helpful. All the staff you meet are smiling and always asking how you are doing. The hotel/room was clean and nicely decorated. It was too cold for us to enjoy the rooftop lounge but it is known as the best in Chicago and we saw why. The only negative part was that our room did not get cleaned one day and we had to call for someone to come up that evening. They responded with in 90 minutes to do so. I would stay in this hotel next time I am in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location for business and a super family friendly weekend, again.  Love this place.
text: Had a few days of meetings on a Thursday and Friday in Chicago so I brought my family along for the weekend.  My second time to stay at the London House and it certainly won't be our last.  My direct flight from BHM got in early so I called ahead and requested an early check in.  The manager Robert Jones could not have been more friendly and accommodating - I travel often and early check in's are usually a big "whatever" from the front desk crews at hotels.  Not the case with London House.  I called to double check the night before our departure and the front desk asked if I was Mr. Montgomery?  I said yes, they said that Robert was off but had called to make sure I was taken care of.  Unheard of.  Mind blown.  Walked in with my wife, 6 and 8 year olds and sure enough our room was waiting.  The staff has it together there.  Can't thank them all enough.  Other tips - book a Vista suite.  Best view in Chicago.  The new restaurant downstairs is nice and convenient as well.  Our family has a new home or rather a house - the London House in Chicago.  Goodbye overpriced Peninsula.  Thanks for a great weekend Robert Jones and team!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Recently stayed at LondonHouse for a quick business trip to the city. The location is great...easy walk from the train. Staff was exceptionally friendly. Room was spacious and well appointed...loved the Nespresso in-room coffee!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Clean, Classy, Cozy and Convenient
text: Great value for the location.  I love the texting to the front desk!  The view of the river was spectacular and the bakery downstairs delicious and cheap.  The bar on 21st floor was super fun to watch the World Series Houston Astros defeat the Los Angeles Dodgers.  Even our teenage girls loved the hotel.  Parking alternatives are nearby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 2nd floor bar
text: The best part about the hotel was the 2nd floor bartender Kert. He makes the best drinks and my friend and I had a great time drinking there. Kert is full of energy and he truly was the highlight of the hotel. I also loved the stay, had a great room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: best location, excellent service, best rooms , go for it if you want the best stay
text: Very comfortable rooms after a 15 hour flight with another 7 hour connecting flight! The room has a large flat screen TV, Gym is fantastic. Concierge is brilliant, i can't say enough god things. Our bags were taken to the room immediately. the hotel has so much to offer but best location for touring and sightseeing. close to shopping areas and museums, theatre.  Spotless and free wifi

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The Place to stay when in Chicago
text: Location, view and great service this is the place.  Easy walking downtown.  Hotel has everything you need and preserves a historical building.  No question we will be back, if only for our granddaughters graduation from Loyola.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sold, luxury hotel located in the heart of Chicago!
text: First, I apologize to the staff for being late in my review! I stayed here the first week of October.  GREAT HOTEL!  Worth of it's Four Diamond rating!  Although I was staying at a GSA rate (pre FY 2018 mind you), the staff honored my Gold Hilton status and bumped me to a really swanky room in the newer section of the hotel.  The check in and check out process was very smooth and the staff is excellent!A word on breakfast.  The clerk who checked me in was very honest about the breakfast situation; which is a huge thing for me.  He told me that they are working on it, and I fully understand.  I'm a breakfast nut--I like my eggs, bacon, and anything else thrown in!  He suggested that I take the points in lieu of breakfast coupons, and avail myself of the Corner Bakery.  I'm glad I did; the Corner Bakery is an excellent alternative and in true Chicago style, they are quick in the mornings.  My suggestion is to ask about their breakfast situation when checking in, and if that is still a work in progress, avail yourself of the extra points in lieu of breakfast coupons and check out the Corner Bakery.All in all, a solid luxury hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Beautiful hotel - I paid the extra for corner view well worth the money. Staff were lovely and friendly. Watch out as the car park charges are very expensive in Chicago. For less than 24 hours we paid 58 dollars/ hotel valet service is about 72 dollars. Super location and room had all the mod cons. Highly recommend

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Staff goes beyond expectations at great located hotel
text: We were staying for a wedding at the Shedd Aquarium and this was the hotel the bridal party picked.  The hotel is barely two years old in a complete redo of a historic building.  From the doorman, the room attendants, the concierge to the manager everyone has a smile and impressive attitude.  The lobby is clean modern and with numerous elevators so no wait time to arrive in your room.  I originally picked a room near the end of the hall at the back of the building.  The front desk talked me into moving to a room I had looked at but didn't pick because it was near the elevator but had a view.  The room was smaller but the view was truly nice.  Only problem was I am a very light sleeper and the hum of the elevator kept we awake but for most people this would not be a problem. I was in room 1411.  The room was clean modern and not overly large but adequate size.  However the best part of the stay was when we realized the tie for the suit for the wedding was not packed.  Went to the concierge, Jose he tried to find one to loan in the back, no luck.  Talking with Alex the manager on at the time they then talked to the only desk person Abel wearing a tie if he would loan it for the evening. He said I have one in my car, ran to his parked car came up with a Brand New tie to loan my husband.  Amazing service that cannot be had at even the best hotels.  Truly an incredible staff!!!  Our thanks for saving the night.  Cannot say enough about this being the place to stay while in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel...definitely worth staying here
text: I loved everything about this hotel.  From the polite, funny doormen that greet you to the wonderful toiletries in the room. Jose, the Concierge , was way beyond helpful.  Every place he recommended to visit or eat at was great. The fitness room was so nice..don't forget to bring a water bottle! If I need to make another trip to Chicago, this is the place I will definitely book...no doubt about it. Great location, great staff, great room...it's a no brainer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Upscale hotel in prime Chicago location with great views of the city.
text: This was our first stay at the Londonhouse in Chicago.  We came for our 25th wedding anniversary to celebrate with friends.  The hotel let us upgrade for a discounted fee to the Vista suite on the 13th floor.  We had a spectacular view of the Chicago River and the city.  The suite was upscale, modern and well appointed.  They even provide guests with the standard toiletries like shampoos, soaps etc but also body wash, body sponge and toothbrushes.  We loved the shower too, perfect size and water temp and pressure.  The Vista suite has a floor to ceiling window view.  These rooms are the only ones that have that.  Cool elevator system.  You select your floor before getting into the elevator and this directs you to the appropriate elevator to take.  No numbers are inside the elevators.  The rooftop bar was closed for a private party, but I did get one photo just as it was closing.  A nice outdoor atmosphere.  There are restaurants and other bars in the hotel.  A Corner Bakery restaurant is on the first floor.  Nice place for breakfast or lunch.  The staff was very accommodating at the front desk.  Great hotel in a great location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel- great views, great staff
text: From the moment I arrived, the staff was super friendly and courteous.  I opted for the upgrade upon checking in to have a view of the Chicago River--  WELL WORTH IT!  I was on the 19th floor and the city and river view were amazing.  The room was very clean (very important to me), I had everything I needed, and the rooftop bar is incredible.  I will definitely stay here again when in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Front Desk Experience
text: Brandy, one of the front desk managers was delightful (personable, connecting) and so was the front desk manager.  She offered me water (brought me 2 bottles) and an upgrade.  Lovely boutique hotel in the middle of it all.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel
text: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. Great views, rooftop lounge. I would say the hotel was not as clean as you might expect. The majority of our staff interactions were great with a couple pretty poor. All in all a very nice place.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding at the London House
text: We had our September wedding at the London House in Chicago.  I can confidently say the staff is stellar.   Everyone that I had interacted with was so pleasant, helpful and accomodating.  Steve Sleczka , Director of Weddings, is an amazing person to work with.  His attention to detail is unmatched!  I can't get over the food and the quality of the beautiful meal that was served on our special day.   All of the our of town guests enjoyed their rooms with spectacular views of the city.  The sleek design of this newer hotel doesn't end in the lobby or public spaces, but translates over to the guest-rooms as well.  I would recommend this to anyone not only for a special event like a wedding, but even for out of town guests looking to explore the city.  Nothing beats the view or location of this gem.  Really luxurious yet not pretentious.  Can't wait to stay here for our anniversary!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Gem in great location!
text: This boutique hotel in the Hilton family was terrific!  It is right on the river and you can see Lake Michigan.  When you come out of the hotel, you walk directly onto Michigan Avenue and at the beginning of The Magnificent Mile!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel and friendly staff, but not as clean as I would expect out of a luxury hotel
text: The place was beautiful.  I had a great view of the river, the rooftop lounge was amazing, and the atmosphere was wonderful.  I also had a great experience with the staff.  However, I could not give it a 5 star rating because I was disappointed with the cleanliness of my hotel room.  I found black mold around my sink, the toilet bowl looked like it had urine dripping down the sides, and I found small bits of trash around the edge of my bed, including a pill from a previous occupant.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxurious Beautiful Hotel
text: Our group stayed at the LondonHouse because we worked in this building when it was an office building in the 70's and thought it would be fun to have a reunion here. I wasn't expecting much because in the 70's the offices were really run down and old looking.BOY, what a surprise.  The rooms are modern and gorgeous the views remain spectacular and the personnel are without exception friendly and helpful.  When in the hotel you would NEVER know that you're in a structure built almost 100 years ago.  The location at Michigan Avenue and Wacker Drive, across the street from the Michigan Avenue bridge is Chicago at its best.  Side note:If you ever listened to WLS MusicRadio in the 70's, room 544 is the location of the air studio where the famous DJ's broadcast from.  Be warned though, that the view is horrible, you stare at the building across the alley but this is where Top 40 radio history was made.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Chicago Marathon Weekend
text: This hotel was perfect for our weekend.  Gorgeous floor to ceiling windows with view of the river and drawbridges. Quiet property with good amenities. Comfortable, spacious, and attractive guest room, with fantastic bathroom. Very pleasant and attentive staff; kept in touch over weekend using text and mobile app messages.  Very personalized service; one bellhop was so attentive that he even recognized us when we shared a train to the airport. Fantastically located for walking to attractions, and especially to start of race and shopping.  Would stay here on every trip to Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb hotel
text: Lovely hotel. Great staff. Great location   Would stay here again staff accommodating  friendly. Went for a wedding. Simply elegAnt. Superb location. Near restaurants. Shopping and parks. Recommend to all

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location and Excellence in totally remodeled Hotel
text: We booked this Hotel because of its excellent location and got the extra bonus of a terrific total remodeled Classic Hotel. The rooms are very nice with modern walk in showers. Beds , linens, are outstanding. Everything is new. Excellent Bar on the rooftop and on the second floor. Food was very good, but Hotel prices.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Must stay here!
text: The LondonHouse In Chicago is a gorgeous hotel! The rooms are so spacious and the view is breathtaking! We arrived to celebrate our anniversary and the staff were so welcoming! I have stayed at several locations throughout Chicago but by far this one is the best.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Extended marathon stay, will be back
text: Stayed here for the Chicago marathon, great choice.There was a problem with our booking (nothing to do with hotel, it was BA issue) so when we checked in was told no booking.  Hotel was very busy but we were given a room and told they will sort things out when we had recovered from our travels (Scotland to Chicago not quick). I am a hilton member and we were given water, free drinks and everything to make us more relaxed on the situation.  Sorted payment next morning for our 9 night stay.Then we really enjoyed hotel. Quiet large rooms, great view on 18th floor of river and Trump tower. We drank at rooftop terrace, got advice on restaurants, boat tours and even the Cubs baseball playoff games.Will be back with our kids in the not too distant future, great location, friendly staff, perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful.  Great location.  Plus when things are not perfect they make them...
text: I'm a Diamond Level Hilton person and have been for a long while.  I'm in Chicago often for either business or pleasure.  This trip was both.  I've stayed here at the Londonhouse but my wife and I will again and I will again on Business.Great location - close to all the wonderful restaurants - their rooftop bar is a amazing.  I would encourage anyone to stay here.  I did have one minor issue (no is perfect and that includes me...lol) but Mike the manager made it right.  This is all you can ask for.5 star was well earned.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Totally Surprised
text: We were in Chicago for a small planning session.  Traditionally I try to stay at the Palmer House for small meetings.  Unfortunately, the Palmer House was booked on this particular trip.  So we tried a new place.  The LondonHouse.  What a great place!I'm sorry to say I had never heard of the LondonHouse before.  Man!  Was I missing out.  The rooms are very contemporary yet comfortable.  The meeting space was more than adequate and the staff was amazing.  You have to try the rooftop bar.  It's got a great view of the Merchandise Mart and the rest of downtown Chicago.  It does appear to cater to a younger upscale crowd but we had a lot of fun.And finally... and most importantly...The LondonHouse is only about a twenty minute rife to Wrigley!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love London House
text: Great rooms, view and terrific service make  this a marvelous experience in Chicago. I will return! The bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. The bedroom includes a large TV that is (can I saw it?) discreetly mounted in the room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Happy to have been able to stay here for my work trip
text: I had a wonderful stay here during my work trip.   The staff were very helpful and friendly.   They really focus on their customers having a great experience during their stay.My king bedroom was large. The decor was very modern, which I liked.   I had a view of the river, though it rights across the Trump hotel.    The bathroom was also large. It had a  large glass shower and long sink counter.   The fitness center was adequate.   It had 2 benches, free weight, leg lift/dip equipment, and several cardio machines.  During my stay, it was never crowded, though I did use it in the early mornings.The rooftop view of the city was amazing, though the night I went up it was overcast.  Still the view of the city was beautiful in my pictures.I would stay here again for work and for my next visit to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great view from Vista room
text: Beautiful views from the Vista rooms, nice staff, great location! Right in the center of all the action downtown. The bathroom doors were the only downfall, sliding glass doors that left open spaces. Service was fast when required, check in is on the second floor.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Huge room!
text: Great location right on the Chicago River. Close to shops and restaurants. Love the elevator system where you never have to wait more than a few seconds. The room we stayed in was large and well-appointed. The only negative is the other hotel that is impossible to miss when you enter and exit the LondonHouse (hint: huge gold letters T***P)!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Almost perfect...
text: Pros:  Convenient location, well-kept property, friendly staff, roof-top bar, waterway viewCons:  Sub-par breakfast, pricey parking ($77 overnight), small in-room closetLondonHouse is a beautiful hotel situated along side the Chicago waterway.  It is only a 5-7 minutes walk to the shops and department stores on N. Michigan Avenue.  The entrance to a waterway trail for a jog or a relaxing stroll is just across the street.My reservation was upgraded to a suite but turned out the room had a claustrophobic view of surrounding tall buildings.  The front desk was able to arrange a Vista room instead upon request.  The exchanged room offered a welcoming contemporary feel with high ceiling and an unobstructed view of the waterway.  The small closet was okay for a single traveler's belongings but would be tight for a larger party.  The sliding closet doors required a bit of work to operate as they often get stuck on their tracks.   The retro design alarm clock was not lit which made it difficult to tell time when the lights were off.  The bed was comfortable nonetheless.The front desk was unclear on the Hilton Honors (HH) breakfast arrangement with the Land & Lake Restaurant on the ground floor.  The complimentary breakfast was skimpy with only juice and a pastry which made it the poorest HH breakfast selection made available among the many Hilton's I visited.  Guests have the option to receive a $10 credit toward their bill in lieu of the complimentary breakfast.  The cook-to-order breakfast from the menu was only so-so at best.  I recommend the Corner Bakery Cafe which is also located next to the hotel.One may consider riding Uber rather than paying $77 per night hotel parking if that suits your travel plan.  Uber X fare between O'Hare and LondonHouse costs roughly ~$37 one way or ~$80 round trip.It is hoped Hilton / LH management team can improve the breakfast situation for HH members.  That being said it was a pleasant stay at the LondonHouse.  I will be happy to return during my next visit to the windy city!A Helpful vote will be very much appreciated if you find my review informative.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place!
text: Very modern and comfy hotel.  The location is awesome!  I came for a conference at the McCormick place-very close by. The gym is huge, with several cardio machines, yoga/pilates area, and free weight (dumbells). There is a great bar venue on the top  floor. They a great job all around.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: GORGEOUS!!
text: I loved this hotel. Photos do not do it justice on any website. It's truly beautiful inside and out. The people who work here are also super friendly and very helpful. I loved the attention to detail and the staff continually checked on me via text message to make sure everything was up to par which I really thought was a nice touch. Honestly all of the guest rooms my friends and I stayed in were lovely , well appointed and had magnificent views. We all faced the river . I'd come here again if I was to come back to Chicago. The location was also fantastic. You are within walking distance to so many attractions. Great stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location Can't Be Beat
text: Pros:  Great location on the river with easy walking access to Magnificent Mile, River Walk, and Grant Park; Well-appointed and clean rooms; Rooftop bar had some very cool views; Easy check in and check out.  Hilton points.Cons:  Not many, but we had to call for housekeeping to make up our room on two days when it seemed like they had forgotten us.  Also, rooftop bar seems to be crowded (for obvious reasons), but there doesn't seem to be any preference or accommodation made for hotel guests (who are dropping a lot of money to stay in the hotel).Overall, good stay and I would return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hotel in Chicago.
text: This property is in the best location in the city. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful and the guestrooms are top-notch. Stay here if you possibly can, you will not regret it. A fabulous place to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing location great hotel
text: I was here for a business conference with my wife. The conference venue and staff were great. The room (we upgraded to get a view) on the 14th floor was well appointed, modern and fairly spacious. Great views of the river, the buildings and the lake a little bit away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mr. T. Frasier
text: Fabulous Location, beautiful rooms, stunning rooftop and fantastic customer service. Brandy delivered exceptional customer service. Housekeeping does a fantastic job. I travel a lot and I highly recommend you stay at this Hotel you will not be disappointed. This is my second time staying here and I typically do not take time to write reviews.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Everything we desired
text: This hotel is a beautiful old building that has been carefully modernized to be relevant yet classy.   I enjoyed the prox card keys and elevator system use of technology.  The room was decorated well with an extremely large television.  All amenities and tollietries provided.  The rooftop bar was beautiful and a relaxing way to unwind after traveling. The in-room hvac was very loud all night despite even turning it off.  The noise was in the ceiling.  I don't recommend turning it off as the room becomes stuffy quickly.  Overall it was a great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Classy rooftop
text: Went to London House rooftop by the river and was really impressed by the scene. Very classy and great place to have some scotch. The dome is impressive and great place to take clients out. A bit on the expensive side but worth it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: hotel - breakfast changed
text: what was a great breakfast of 21st floor for HH members has turned into a donut and coffee on first floor.   no notice provided till I heard through others.  poorly communicated to HH members and diamond level members.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel in great location.
text: Very nice boutique hotel in great location for views restaurants and tours. Needs better trained help. Could not work the coffee machine nor could housekeeping who didn't speak english at times. Phone did not work.sheets were not changed. Coffee was old with first pot and breakfast was not worth it.Not a good chef.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wow!  Restful, Clean and High Class!
text: I loved my experience at the LondonHouse.  I had selected this hotel because I was looking for upscale accommodations to celebrate a milestone in my life.  I was not disappointed in the least!  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  The room was spacious, nicely equipped with a refrigerator and two large size flat screens.  It was easy to come and go and access the room floors using the modern elevator sequence device.  You simply enter your floor number and the displays tells you which elevator to get on.  A great way to save time and energy (a green feature for sure!).I found my room to be spacious, comfortable and equipped with lots of seating.  I loved the feel of the upscale bathroom with walk-in shower stall.  You will be tempted to stay in the shower for an hour.  I found the overall flavor of the hotel to be styled for class and a young, vibrant clientele; however, it is one special place that everyone will enjoy.  The hallways leading away from the elevators are spacious and the floors nicely styled and clean.  Did I tell you how clean everything was.  The hallway carpets were clean from corner to corner, and I found my room to be nothing less than spotless. The price will vary from season to season, but it is definitely worth every penny due to the level of comfort one will receive to the likable convenience of its location.  The hotel is right on the Magnificent Mile, close to shopping, attractions, theaters and restaurants.  You can easily walk to the park or catch a train to other parts of the city.  Downtown Chicago is a great place to be, to explore, and to venture out for entertainment.  Like any city do be aware of your surroundings and enjoy.  Downtown Chicago has so much to offer.  Wrigley Field is a short train ride away.  Jump on and follow the crowd.  You'll all get there together.Hilton spared no expense in renovating this old business building into a first class hotel.  Pamper yourself and check in at the LondonHouse for a great, rememberable stay in Chicago.  I can't wait to return, and I will definitely patronize the LondonHouse again.  The location was perfect!!  I can't stress that enough.  You will be in the nicest part of town and centrally located between major attractions:  the Chicago Pier, the art museum, the Bean, the outdoor concert amphitheater, Wrigley Field, theaters, restaurants galore, and the list goes on.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The perfect location
text: This hotel is a perfect location in Chicago.  Its close to everything.  We had a wonderful room that overlooked Michigan avenue and the river.  The hotel also has an amazing rooftop bar that had wonderful views of the city. It is also a great hotel for the business traveler since its so close and within walking distance to everything.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impressed
text: My husband and I were very impressed by the LondonHouse. The hotel's d√©cor and ambiance made us feel fancy for our weekend away from the baby. The location was great! Just a few min's walk from the train station and the great shopping on Michigan Ave. Our room overlooked the river which was phenomenal! The rooftop bar had amazing views! The room was clean, comfy and well-decorated! I was even able to get a pretty sweet deal on the room after signing up for the Hilton Honors rewards program. I have not a single critique!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: I travel a lot for work. This hotel is great. The hotel is extremely clean and located in a nice area. It's a very nicely renovated old building with very clean rooms. All of the staff was very helpful. The rooftop bar has great views, but it gets very busy and sometimes can be very hard to find a table.My only complaint is that as a diamond member they only give you five dollars towards hot breakfast.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Left me somewhat underwhelmed
text: The hotel was clean, fine, great location, but there were some details that I think they could improve upon.  We had called and asked if we needed to book a table on the roof deck for a party of 8 friends meeting us, and were told, no worries, plenty of room.  Turns out, not true, and also no room in the inside bar.  The other main annoyance I had was that at the time of booking, they force you to choose an upgrade, that if available you will pay for.  I didn't particularly want an upgrade, I'm not in the room enough to care, but the website railroads you into it.  Additionally, an upgrade is generally something that I consider a perk for being either a regular customer, using a certain card, or just goodwill from the hotel.  I hate the weird nickel and diming attitude.  Just let it be reflected in the price.  I'll probably try another property next time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional Customer Service
text: High praises for all at LondonHouse. I had  made a major blunder booking our room. After emailing the hotel to see what could be done I was contacted by phone and everything was worked out. Since I booked through a 3rd party website the hotel didn‚Äôt really have to do anything about my problem. But they did. And it was much appreciated. Throughout our stay Guest Services, Supervisors and Managers maintained contact. Incredible customer service. Especially for a first time guest. Our room had a beautiful view of the river. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom had big soft towels and plenty of counter space. Quality windows kept outside noise to a minimum. Plenty of outlets located in convenient areas of the room. All areas including check in, lobby bar service, bellman, rooftop servers and housekeeping were professional, friendly, helpful and courteous. Very happy with our stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel and Service
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location with fantastic personal service.  Not to mention they have the best rooftop bar in Chicago!  The hotel staff checked in to see if they could make my stay any better and I jokingly said, "yes, I'd love some chocolate in my room".  After finishing a long day of meetings I arrived to find a delicious plate of chocolate truffles in my room.   You can't beat that service!   This hotel provides fantastic value for the price and amenities.  I highly recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text: We spent a week at the LondonHouse. We had a vista room which was smart and comfortable with a fabulous view along the river. The hotel is in the perfect location for a tourist visit at the end of the Magnificent Mile and an easy stroll to Millennium Park. Tour buses and boats and water taxis all stop just across the road. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful throughout the visit particularly when helping us sort out a problem with flights. We are passing through Chicago again next year and will certainly book this hotel again then.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing location & great rooms
text: My first time to Chicago and it didn't disappoint. Hotel was lovely and the location amazing. Had corner King suite which was luxuriously appointed and great views. Hotel staff were very attentive. Roof top bar had amazing views but sadly not weather proof so was closed in the rain. Breakfast was in the bar area which felt uncomfortable as I'm sure the normal breakfast area was being renovated. I would recommend for business or pleasure. I would stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: . Will definitely be back!
text: Loved this place, great staff, accommodations and location--and the rooftop bar and selections of whiskies was outstanding. Will recommend to others and look forward to returning again soon. Can't think of a thing to improve.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Long, enjoyable stay
text: I'm currently staying in the LondonHouse; it's night 7 of a 10 night stay. It has been a flawless experience so far. The room is beautiful, the bed comfortable, the river view gorgeous, and the staff responsive and friendly at all times. And of course, the location on Wacker Drive right above the Chicago River and next to Michigan Ave is perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolute favorite in Chicago
text: I freaking love this place, they just did it perfect.  I stay at about 100 hotels a year, and it is an absolute pleasure when this hotel falls into the range my company allows me to spend... it will not disappoint... the one knock I have is the new breakfast place, I know they are knew so I am giving them the benefit of the doubt but they do not have their act together, the lady at the front does, I waited over 20 mins for a tea and just walked out.  Also the breakfast u get for diamond members sucks, a donut and a coffee, super weak, if you don‚Äôt choose that you get 5 dollars off a real meal, like cmon 5 dollars, that‚Äôs a joke

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Getaway
text: We planned a family escape to Chicago and found London House on the internet.  We booked it and have found it to be so much better than described!  Location is perfect - the hotel sits on the waterway across from water tours.  It is exactly one block from Michigan Avenue.  The views from the lobby on the second floor, our hotel room on the 4th floor and the bar at the top of the hotel-21st floor- are incredible.  The decor is modern, elegant and classy.  Lots of light, airy.  Service is impeccable.  Rooms are lovely.  Spacious, lovely linens.  Bathrooms are lovely and welcoming.  The bed and pillows are terrific.We have loved the hotel, the service, and location.  We highly recommend staying here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, an old classic that has been renovated, but marked down a grade due to bar
text: Beautiful rooftop bar on the 21st floor but most of the tables were reserved with no one there which I thought was pretty sucky. Table after table empty with a reserved sign, one after another.  Felt like if you aren't there for 30 minutes, your reservation should be expired. We had to wait around for 40 minutes waiting for an elevated table.  And I was paying almost $300 a night to stay at the hotel, I wasn't coming in off the street.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazoing Hotel
text: We had a wonderful experience in LondonHouse Chicago.I had a great view of the city and the lake. Location is extremely good - on Michigan Avenue. The hotel was very clean, and staff was great. One of the best in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good but not perfect
text: Location A+, view from the room A+, reception  staff, specially Martha (who gave us a discount when we complained about some things in the room),  A+. But there were some flaws in housekeeping, for it to be considered excellent. I noticed that the sheets were brand new, but they were never washed before being used for the first time, so they prickled. There were two toothbrushes, but no shower cap, the Nespresso box had just two capsules, no sugar, just one crumpled tea bag and they forgot to put drinking glasses. Besides from that, all was good.The room was clean, large size bathroom, nice decor.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Hotel
text: Breakfast Buffet 4/5Location 5/5Room 5/5Customer Service 5/5I've stayed at A LOT of Hilton's in my career, and this is without a doubt either #2 or #3 on my all time list (#1 being the now defunct Hilton Melbourne). The people that work there are nice, informative and very helpful. I had a weird noise coming from my vent and they immediately sent someone up to take a look. They asked me daily how my stay is going and if they can do anything to improve it. The real take away here are the rooms - they're gorgeous. The best part about these rooms is that since this is an old building, the walls are thick - you can't hear anything happening outside. My room was right next to an elevator and it was peace and quiet for me. Location is awesome. You're right on the riverwalk, not to mention a 10 minute walk to Millennium Park. The rooftop has a great view, but you'll find that it can get pretty packed. Anytime I have to stay in Chicago, it's the LondonHouse for me.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Super Cute
text: I stayed here one night for business.  The hotel had a modern feel. Cool rooftop bar. Great customer service - everything was done via text messages, which made it so easy. The room was comfortable, stylish, and clean.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 50th Anniversary Celebration
text: We met friends here to celebrate our 50th anniversary. The hotel is excellent in every way. Friendly, helpful staff and beautiful, comfortable rooms. Our concierge, Jose, went out of his way to be helpful several times and left a complementary chocolate treat for us in our room. I would stay there again just because of his excellent service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Customer Serivice!!!
text: This was a perfect location for our trip to Chicago. My husband and I were greeted at  valet by a warm, friendly, genuine face of the doorman, Fikret. He was very informational regarding our check-in and interests of the city. It was nice to see a familiar face during our stay but what was even more welcoming was that his recognition of us out of the thousands of faces each time we exited and entered the building. We appreciated his gracious personality and fabulous recall of faces! The entire staff was exceptional but we felt as though Fikret really stuck out when it comes to customer service. We were also appreciative of the random texts that we received from this establishment throughout our visit. Just asking us if our expectations had been met or if there was anything else that the establishment could do for us was a very genuine show of interest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Be very careful with your belongs!
text: I stayed at London House from Sept 7-11 attending the first game of the Chicago Bears season.  Was the hotel nice? Yes.  Was the staff polite? Yes. But more than that, they have a serious problem with theft.  I immediately reported an item left in my room, within 45 minutes of my departure.  I boarded my plane and was told 2 hours later that someone had already checked in the room, which I find very strange that on such a busy weekend they could accomplish this so quickly. I spoke with guest services, head of security, and a manager receiving a different story about whether the room was occupied so quickly or not from each of them.  Mr. Cestare the manager ultimately informs me there is no way the purse could get out of the hotel by a staff member.  I beg to differ, there is absolutely no doubt that my purse did get out of the hotel by someone on their staff.  I have traveled all over the world personally and with the U.S. Dept of State, I have found items that I have turned in and I have accidentally forgotten items and they have always been returned to me until my stay at LondonHouse. Although, this review will not keep people from staying at this hotel, as a frequent traveler I feel it is my duty to worn everyone.  I have written hundreds of positive reviews and very very few negative ones.  This is one of the worst in my over 30 years of traveling personally and for the U.S. Government, mainly because they did absolutely nothing to make this right.  WARNING KEEP TRACK OF EVERYTHING YOU WILL NOT GET IT BACK! I will be filing a police report.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago's Best View of the River
text: This hotel is located right on the Chicago river near Michigan Avenue. You can walk to nearby restaurants and river tours. The rooftop bar has the very best view of the river you can find anywhere. The drinks are good but hard to come by as they need more wait staff, but overall a great must do bar while in Chicago. You can also see the Wrigley building right across the river which has a lovely clock on the top of it as well as the Trump Tower which is a beautiful building.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome
text: This hotel is 1 of the nicest hotels we've stayed inBeautiful and very professional and friendly staffRooms very cleanBeds very comfortable With it very close to all shops and amenities just brilliant

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Too noisy and overpriced
text: The location is excellent downtown.  The views are also unbeatable especially from the Vista rooms.  However the design of the vista suite rooms is not very well thought out and seems back to front.  There is no double glazing in the outer window so one can hear street noise through the window.  And rather than the suite area being close to the window, the suite area is dark and windowless while the bed is closer to the window.  Thus the sofa and suite area through an internal door feels more like a corridor to the bathroom.  It would make more sense to have it the other way round with the bed closer to the bathroom for convenience but also where it would benefit from a further barrier door and window from the street noise.They also do not have a restaurant or any meaningful breakfast option and the hotel's skyline bar at the top is packed with little room for seating and is not really designed as a space for resident hotel guests to relax and enjoy having paid the premium for a nightly stay.  Instead anyone can take the elevator up from the street.  So it's crowded and no place for hotel guests to take advantage of the venue.  Overall for the price - it is poor value.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best hotel yet
text: I have travel all over the country and The London House Chicago Hotel  is by far one of the coolest hotels I have ever stayed in. From the 3 level rooftop with its amazing  views of Chicago Mag mile and the river is worth the stay along. The locations put you in the heart of the city, plenty to do, great  place to eat. The rooms are warm and inviting. The bathroom are immaculate Best Hotel thus far.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: weekend break with friends
text: Great hotel in excellent central location. Would definitely go back. Hotel is located on the river opposite Trump tower. Modern and comfy rooms. Stunning views from the roof top terrace which is a great spot for cocktails.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The good & the bad
text: Arriving at the hotel, your better off finding parking nearby because $71 valet is all they have. We found $35 a night. You go to 2nd floor to check in and received a glass of champagne. Was very nice an unexpected.  Staff was very friendly! The rooms are very nice looking. We have a river view on the 20th floor. Was beautiful. Then our ac wasn't working after waiting hours to see if it would get any colder before calling and wasting their time,  never got colder, so called had someone come fix it. They were nice and came shortly after i called. But should of been fixed before arrival. To get to the roof top you are far better going level 1 than going up 1 floor since we were on the 20. The elevators are jam packed so if you go to the main floor and show them your key card u don't have to wait in line and they will get u an elevator right away. Then the horrible, they need to do something about guest at the roof top, they should only be able to go to the roof and main floor. Instead we had someone banging on our door at 2am no stop screaming "Melissa". Really?! We had two toddlers with us who then woke up crying. Not to mention since being on the 20th floor right under the bar, all you hear is loud noises and music. Other thing is there is no lock to the bathroom just a sliding door, that doesn't lock. Kind of dumb for rooms with double beds. All in all it is a very nice fancy hotel. I would stay here again not with kids and not on the 20th floor. Not saying anyone was rude to my kids, in fact the employees were most friendly and would help with anything, just not really kid friendly in noiseless level. Also the manager did apologize and offer us a credit for the horrible night. Very understanding.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay at the London House
text: 1923 classic beaux-arts building in Chicago redeveloped into a beautiful Hilton Curio Collection Hotel along the Chicago River.  The London House interior is sleek and contemporary - but with a nod to history.  22nd floor has a lovely outdoor terrace for food and beverages.  Vista rooms have floor to ceiling windows with a view of the Chicago skyline along the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Found my Chicago hotel...
text: I only stayed one night (bummer!), but it was enough to know that I can't wait to go back.  I didn't make it to the rooftop bar but I arrived at the hotel at the same time that a group of about 50 people was getting on the elevator - headed to the rooftop bar.  Someone from the hotel immediately grabbed my bag, ushered me away from the group and up the stairs to check in on the second floor.  He was brilliant and my hero.  I see the group as a good thing, but I had just arrived from the airport and all I wanted was room service and a pillow.Room service was a delicious wagyu burger with great fries.  I ordered shortly before the 10:00 deadline (and probably expected to be let down), but the service was very good, and the meal even better.The bed was very comfortable, and the air conditioning worked REALLY well.  It was quite warm, and I often find that hotels don't get cool enough.  I had to turn off the A/C a few hours after arriving as it became quite cold.  Perfect!I had a view of the river, which is always welcomed.  I can't speak to the other side of the hotel.  I selected my room via the Hilton app and was worried I might make a bad choice.  I was on the 16th floor, just a few doors to the right of the elevator bank.  I never heard a thing.  I did notice that the app shows a few guest room doors that appear to be in the elevator bank - as though the doors are adjacent to the elevators - yup, they are.  The rooms are probably perfectly lovely - the door placement seems a bit odd.LondonHouse is a fabulous choice in a neat city.  I hope to return regularly - it's something to look forward to.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best location, fantastic environment
text: Loved the location, walk to everything. Hotel had great views, nice restaurants. Clean and up to date amenities and style.  Rood top bar a must. I want to take my family back to stay in the fall.  My room overlooked the river and skyline, it was a mood enhancer!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Decent.
text: We spent one night here. The rooms were decent. Service was decent. Nothing really makes me want to go back to be very honest. Nothing went wrong I just wasn't wow'd. I forget who checked me in at the front desk but she was really sweet

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Concierge
text: A friend and I recently spent 3 nights at the Londonhouse Hotel in Chicago.  Great location, nice room (with a floor to ceiling window view of the Trump Hotel across the river), and fully equipped Bathroom.  Our only suggestion is to add a narrow table or shelves in both the bedroom and the bath. One entire wall in the bedroom had nothing on it but a tv and there was no place to put anything--no drawers, shelves, etc.      Without a doubt, the most outstanding feature of the hotel was Shannon, the concierge on duty during the day.  She had excellent suggestions for dining, and even had a complimentary appetizer for us at the Italian Village. Then she had chocolates delivered to our room for my friend's birthday. We saw her as we checked out of the hotel, and we felt  as if we were leaving a new friend!  I imagine all her visitors feel this way but I have no doubt she'll remember us when we return--or at least I left feeling that way!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loud continuous Trump protests made it impossible to sleep
text: Coordinated, continuous car horn honking, yelling, chanting, extremely loud music from apparent impromptu Trump protests occurred directly in front of the hotel (faces Trump Tower) every night of our stay, 3 consecutive nights, between the hours of midnight and 4 a.m. Was impossible to sleep through the insane amount of noise, no attempt by the hotel to get police involved or warn guests, nice property but will NEVER stay here again at least not during the Trump presidency.  This is not a political statement it's just that for the amount of money I spent I expect to be able to get a decent nights sleep.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Hotel, Clean, Modern & Central.
text: Even without taking the offer of a room upgrade on arrival, this hotel is stunning, modern and nothing is too much to ask for. Communication from the hotel staff and management via text is amazing, quick and personal. I text asking for an extra robe and slippers for our room, and literally within 2 minutes we had a knock on our door with exactly what we asked for, followed up by a text from the front desk asking if that was ok...... "outstanding service." The beds are perfect, our room had a large TV with the added feature of Chrome-cast, so if we wanted to chill late at night after a long day sightseeing, we could watch Netflix etc. The added features of the espresso machine ( with extra pods if you ask) and the fridge in your room, help your stay no matter the weather.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My favorite place to stay in Chicago
text: What a great hotel - from the amenities to the staff, it is outstanding!  I travel to Chicago regularly, over the past 20 years, and have stayed at many hotels in this great city. The London House is one of my favorites. Great location, it's clean, eclectic, and the staff is unbelievably friendly.  The price varies based on the time of year, but once, in 2016 was under $100!  Are you kidding??? For all that they have to offer???  Now, at peak season it will be much more than that, but my point is that you can get it at a reasonable price. It is well worth it.  The bar of the top floor is exceptional and the rooftop bar is really impressive with its views and ambiance.  I stay here whenever I am in town for business or pleasure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First and NOT the last time at LHH!
text: Positive points:  Easy check-in. Upgraded to a corner room (as I had booked via Booking.com). Spacious room (#915), great bed, not noisy, gorgeous view on the left corner of the bedroom (though straight across was the Trump Tower). Ordered room service twice; once for dinner and once for breakfast. Service is included but I did tip them both extra, lovely and professional staff both times (one called Faith). Complimentary coffee (Nespresso machine). Great bathroom/shower. A bit more pressure on the rain shower would have been even better but that is if I have to picky!Excellent location, easy walk to anywhere.Negative points: The safe in the room did not work, I called the reception and was told someone would come but never did throughout the entire stay. The expresso machine, there were no cream or sugar upon check in but coffee is complimentary. Room service - Ordered a hamburger and the french fries were way too fried (2 different colours). Ate one night at the Restaurant on 21st floor, was not impressed, too pricey and cocktail was blunt - ashamed. Asked for a late check-out, the receptionist did have a little attitude (Savannah). It was the second time I had her on the phone and I thought she was not customer oriented at all. She did agree to give me a 1:00pm check out instead of 12:00pm despite telling her I had quite a late flight. She said it was upon availability in the hotel but unfortunately, there were rooms available on booking.com. As a genius member of Booking.com, usually this 'advantage' is always given, and we are not talking about one hour....

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overpriced
text: I travel a lot and one thing I've learned is that the nightly rate of a hotel does not determine the quality or level of service you will get. The room was modern and pretty although it was noisy. View of the river was nice, particularly at night with all of the lights. Room service needs some work. They have an extremely LIMITED menu and the limited options you have are overpriced and not cooked all that well. How do you mess up a BLT? They also charge some sort of tray charge. Have no clue what that is and they don't tell you they are going to do that. I didn't see it on my final bill but don't know if it was buried in the bill somewhere. Water pressure in the shower was very weak. Their staff is very helpful. If you even show a hint of confusion about where you are and how to get where you're going, they will stop and ask if they can help without hesitation. Doesn't matter who they are or the role they play.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The hip new place is dirty
text: I must agree 100% with the Yelp reviews of the food. Very overpriced and very disgusting. The housekeeping staff also does not clean rooms well in between guests.- the cups, linens, and floor were dirty. I was placed in an accessible room without being told in advance or given a choice. The room was noisy and the elevators are very slow. The window shade in the bathroom did not work. I could go on and on... be forewarned.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: THE GOOD AND THE BAD
text: The location of this property on the Chicago River, Close to Riverwalk and on the corner of Michigan Avenue made this an exceptional site for downtown activities and public transportation.Our room was 807 a vista double room which was excellent. It was a large comfortable and quiet. Our ceiling to floor windows gave us a 24 hour mesmerizing view of the skyline along the Chicago River and all of the river activity.   The rooftop lounge is fabulous very busy at night but equally fabulous during morning and afternoon hours.We had it checked in prior to our arrival with our Hilton honors app and were able to check in early to our room.Now for the disappointments. There is a Nespresso machine in the room with coffee capsules and tea bags of green tea. I personally prefer a keurig and a large cup of coffee in the morning and my husband drinks black tea. They will not provide black teabags as complementary and were going to charge me $10 for a few teabags. What about all the tea drinkers around the world who want just tea!!!   I have never been in a hotel where they did not give you complementary black teabags.I requested from our cleaning lady at 9 AM in person that we were leaving for the day and would be back at 2 PM. Could she please have a room cleaned before 2 PM she acknowledged she understood me, but the room was not clean when we got back at 2:30. Her English comprehension was poor. She did show up about 245 to clean the room. This hotel has a policy of charging your credit card for $100 more a day for incidentals you might use or for damage to the room. We were already paying top dollar for this room and to have 200 extra dollars placed on the credit card after our first night was a shock.  Jose the concierge sent up 2 complementary black teabags.Now if we are ever in Chicago I would stay here again if my husband agrees for all the positive things I said earlier and I'll make sure I bring my own tea bags with me.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel and location!
text: This was our first trip to Chicago and if we would have walked the area and chose the hotel with the best location it would have been London House. Not only was the location excellent, the service, decor, amenities, staff, roof top bar were excellent! Would definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding anniversary+Raw sewage
text: The absolute pits. I honestly don't even know where to begin. I will say that I have never had such a humiliating disgusting stay at a hotel in my life. After raw sewage regurgitated from our toilet and all over the bathroom floor at 8am, the hotel was "kind" enough to allow us another room over looking an alley(the prior room was an upgraded corner suite) after an hour of basically being ignored by the front desk. They felt that "gifting" us 10,000 Hilton Rewards points was enough compensation. The hotel room we were in was almost 60,000 points. Needless to say a disgusting experience and they were honestly no help at all.What a joke of a hotel. With a horrid front desk team. They should be ashamed of themselves if they consider themselves part of the hospitality or service industry.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel
text: For the most part, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the LondonHouse Chicago.  We booked the King Bed Vista room and it was plenty spacious and had nice views of the river. The hotel is in a convenient location to downtown - we were able to walk anywhere on Michigan Avenue and it was also fairly easy to walk to public transportation for our trips to Wrigley Field.The main reason that we booked this hotel was due to the rooftop bar.  The views from the rooftop were spectacular but it was always slammed busy.  To be expected I guess but also somewhat disappointing because we were not able to get a seat despite visiting at all different days/times. However, we did find that we enjoyed the vibe of the 21st floor bar (no views) quite a bit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: High expectations what were not met
text: I‚Äôm loyal HHonor member. We choose this hotel for the school friends reunion.London House Chicago - Amazing location. Beautiful historical building. High daily rate. We have expected to be drown in the luxury and comfort.Unfortunately ,  it was not the case.After checking in late, we had very limited time to shower and get ready.We‚Äôve found out that there is no shampoo/body wash in our room. Wow ‚Äì totally unexpected.We called the front desk and asked for it. We‚Äôve been told that there is no ETA for the supplies delivery ‚Äì Really?! If we would have stayed in some low level hotel and experience the same ‚Äì I wouldn‚Äôt complain.But here, we are talking about London House Chicago. Not cool.Pardon for the details, we took our shower just with running water. Btw, the shower itself is really nice.When we returned to the hotel, we had to go to the front desk and ask for the soup again. This time it was delivered and it was pretty fast.Saturday morning, we had a scheduled guided tour in the city. We went downstairs to have our breakfast which was already prepaid.Once again, we were unpleasantly surprised to find out that we are not in the list. We had to go upstairs to the front desk , to make them call the restaurant downstairs, to go back and wait for the approval. Seriously?! If we would have known that  it‚Äôs such a hassle, we would have gone somewhere else for the breakfast. Needless to mention that we were late for our tour and had to run to catch up with them. We've communicated our unpleasant experience to the hotel stuff. We got some credit in the checkout, which is nice, but our bill was more than $800 for the 2 nights stay!It's a good hotel overall, with loosie attention to the details that leave bad after taste.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic, gorgeous and clean
text: Loved staying at this hotel! So chic, gorgeous and clean! The views are amazing. The rooftop bar has city and water views for days and the room view was perfect also. Our meeting was at the hotel, the meeting rooms were beautiful and the catering was DELICIOUS! So many selections and the Etoile room where we ate had gorgeous views as well. Rooms were clean, toiletries smelled yummy and beds were extremely comfortable. Cannot say enough great things about LondonHouse and even the $17 glass of Prosecco was worth it ;)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Needs some work
text: Great concept, poor execution.  Trying to be cosmopolitan top tier hotel, but they've got more work to do.  From a lack of courtesy by staff to a very limited in-room dining menu, there are some changes needed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Breakfast Rip-off
text: I had the opportunity, misfortune rather, of booking a stay for my parents at The LondonHouse Chicago from the 8th to 11th September. I had booked the Weekend Getaway plan from the hotel website which offered breakfast. During the booking an online chat assistant popped up and I reconfirmed the availability of breakfast as part of the package. Now at $1616.60 for 3 nights which is an average of $500 plus per room night, this is not an average hotel room and one expects certain standards. The problems started at check in where the hurdle of not having an additional credit card for the incidentals had to be overcome. Hotel policy. After some back and forth communication and considerable delay, the issue was resolved and the guests were checked in. The biggest surprise was at breakfast the following morning. The guest  names did not figure on the breakfast list. Another 20 minute wait outside the restaurant and that gets sorted and surprise again. You are eligible for a breakfast of value $11.00 only. What do you get for $11.00? A croissant, a PLAIN omelette, one sausage and a cup of coffee or tea. Great choice. I must say, even in budget hotel chains, the breakfast, when included in the package, is of a decent standard. You wouldn‚Äôt expect a premium hotel to belittle a guest and rip-off a customer on the most important meal of the day.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Big Disappointment even with a beautiful view
text: I was greatly disappointed with my stay at this hotel. There is huge room for improvement starting with management. Upon check- in I entered my room to what was a beautiful view. I then pulled down my bed cover to sit on my bed and do some work only to find a blood stained mattress cover that was covered with a thin too sheet that you can easily see through. It was a stain that never should have been missed by housekeeping. I reported it to management who just offered to have the bed sheets replaced. Did not offer anything else and wasn't overly appologetic for this terrible situation. I later had clients meet me on their rooftop, which does have an amazing view. I called to make a reservation and with much hemming and hawing they gave me a reservation for four. Turned out my clients brought one additional person. So I needed an extra chair. They denied me the extra chair,Claiming they did not have one and rather I had left because of it. They said I needed to be specific with my reservation. In the end two of us shared a seat. Very poor management. I don't recommend staying here. One is better off across the river at Trump!  I'm not a demanding person and no one offered to make the entire experience one that maybe I would consider staying again. Blood on a sheet is inexcusable for a new guest. Let me know if you wish for pictures.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: First the good: Great location, nice good size room with clean modern decorations. we had a room on 7th floor facing the river, so great view, but NOT sure about looking at Trump sign was any  good!
