Now the BAD: Most of the reception staffs not friendly at all, in fact the person that was there at ck in  first could not find my reservation even though I showed her the email confirmation. I have made reservation directly with hotel because i was booking special University of Chicago rate.  were there with 4 bags for my Daughter's ck in to college. The person was very un empathic and took her a while to go to a higher person to find my reservation. that made us very anxious considering being 800 miles away from home. Next was the Bellman was all nice until it was time to leave, they tried to hail a cab, however they got one that was not big enough for our bags, then they tried to shove it and that made the cab driver very upset, rightly so.Then we were in this cab, with a very MAD driver, driving like a mad man, very unnerving! in fact iI feared for our lives! My daughter was very upset , not exactly they way we imagined our trip to college would be! The guys were just concerned to collect their TIP!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new home
text: This is a gem of a hotel: great location which is super convenient  for your shopping! The hotel has a great modern vibe, super friendly staff, cool bar where food can be ordered.The rooms equally cool, modern feel, spacious and great facilities- decent shower, desk , super comfy bed. Nothing flash but exudes quality. Above all else what really set this hotel apart was my encounter with  Robert. He made my daughter feel like family  while i away during the day at meetings and that really meant alot to me. You would think once we departed  from the hotel the service would stop there but we recieved an email from Robert wishing us a safe trip back and extending an invitation to come back to londonhouse and assisting with any future reservations. That type of service is what will continue to keep londonhouse on me and my companies list to use if returning to chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the LondonHouse.  We arrived early so our room wasn't ready - but front desk staff was helpful and friendly.  Things were a bit crazy with an influx of people due to the hurricane but the staff handled it professionally.  Room was very nice, clean and well-appointed.  High floor rooms with views of the river are wonderful.  We enjoyed the rooftop terrace - wonderful views - although really crowded when we were there. Location is great - walking distance to many attractions and right by the River Walk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful!
text: We stayed in a room with a view of the river.  It was beautiful.  Our bathroom was huge and the hotel is very clean.  Location is PERFECT!  The beds are extremely comfortable.  London house is the BEST hotel in Chicago in my opinion.  Would definitely stay there again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Staycation Success!
text: My friend and I reserved a room at London House for her birthday weekend. From check in to check out we were very satisfied. The highlight was Matthew at the check in desk, he was so kind and gave us ideas on how to enjoy LH to the fullest. We will definitely be back!  Also, the roof top is amazing!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top Notch!
text: The room was spectacular!  Lots of room to move about, amazing bathroom amenities, beautiful to look at.  Comfortable beds, bathroom was stunning and modern.  Wish the bathroom had a fan, as I hate a steamy bathroom after a shower.  Also, the bathroom had a fancy sliding barn type door, which is very cool, however there was quite a gap which allowed the person in bed to see directly into the bathroom, particularly the toilet...kind of awkward.We checked in very late at night and had called to be sure that they knew we were still coming.  They literally said, "ok, we'll be sure to not mark you as a no-show".  Never have heard of that before, as I would assume our room was paid for and they'd keep it for us. Parking is $66 a night, however if you use a parking app, you can definitely find something for much less very nearby.Location is amazing.  Close to everything, including Michigan Ave, Millennium Park, restaurants, and so much more.We would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The epicenter of Chicago!
text: We had a great weekend stay at The London House, which was both comfortable and cool/contemporary. Everything was perfect from the room to the location overlooking the river.  We also walked to the lake, millennium park, art institute, all not far.  The roof terrace was ideal from cocktails our first night - unbelievable views.  And we went again for brunch on Sunday.  All the staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating of our requests.  I think if we went back and stayed anywhere else it would be a downgrade.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Getaway
text: Hotel has all the amenities of a 5 star hotel, great location at corner of Wacker Drive and Michigan Ave. Roof Top bar is spectacular with great view of cityy and Michigan river. Close proximity to major sights, restaurants and corporate offices.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect for business!
text: Loved the room, but the location was the real stand out here.  We walked to work, to dinner, to see the town... it was just awesome!  I will definitely go back.  The room was well appointed, and very comfortable.  The provided toiletries were tremendous - toothbrush kits and high quality bath products.  I usually hate that stuff, but these were great.  My only suggestion is to have a more efficient front desk.  I had a long wait for not much of a line, and the process for just getting my room seemed really long too.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Property
text: Located about 50 ft from N Michigan Ave. Very nice location and comfortable hotel. Very nicely appointed rooms, both for sleeping and for meetings. Nice facilities for business or just visiting Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic hotel
text: The very heart of Downtown Chicago.  Steps away from the magnificent mile and all the shops, but also steps away from the business areas too.The rooms here are modern and very well kept.  The rooftop bar has probably the best terrace views in downtown and also a fantastic breakfast in the morning.My goto hotel in ChicagoThe only problem is that there is an eyesore across the river

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional Staff!!
text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful! We visited the rooftop lounge. It had amazing views. The lobby bar was a great place to relax and have a few cocktails. The staff, especially Michelle the bartender was warm, welcoming and made great recommendations of activities to do in the area. Great property, great staff, great service! We had a great weekend in Chicago and hope to return soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excelente Ubicaci√≥n cerca de todo !!
text: Magnificent Service.  Ubicaci√≥n inmejorable.  Cerca de todo. River Walk, Shopping, Restsurants.  Great views...Super hotel....aunque s√≥lo le hace falta un buen restaurante. Pero hay muchos alrededor.Excellent Check in with Robert. Excellent  Martha at Check Out. Shannon the Best Concierge!!!!Congrats.  Will come back for sure !!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous views
text: A+ views are beautiful and food is fabulous had the brunch there and it was exceptional!! Service is slow as you expect in a great spot but worth the wait!!! This is the perfect place to wow a date. It's not cheap. But it's well worth it!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Location
text: The location was great, it was walking distance to many downtown activities.  The room was clean and comfortable, but not generous in size.  Although, we could have paid extra for a better view, we chose not to because we weren't going to be spending a lot of time in the room.  There was plenty of staff to make the check in process fast and easy.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very annoyed with the hotel - You can not take camera to rooftop!!!
text: We decided last minute to detour and stay overnight in Chicago - paying a huge premium for a king riverside room with views only to be stung with excessive parking fees and NO ACCESS to the rooftop (which was one of the main reasons for selecting this hotel).During the afternoon we could not access the rooftop bar (which was advertised as a major attraction of the hotel) due to a private function.Then later in the evening - even though we were staying at the hotel we were denied access to the rooftop bar because they said that any camera with a lens (meaning a DSLR) is a professional camera and that is against hotel policy - even though I was a guest who was staying in one of their more expensive rooms.Since when is having a DSLR which I use as my hobby considered professional photography.  This experience tarnished the stay at the hotel and I would never stay there again and consider not staying at other Hilton properties due to this bad experience.I asked them to provide proof of this, and was referred to the front deck and then to other staff and no one could provide anywhere where this was stated on their website or any bookings site that you.  No one seems to care or was helpful in any way - just repeating a mantra this is company policy - leaving a VERY dissatisfied and disgruntled guest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bridges lobby bar
text: A quite unique service and view of the river In Chicago London house, our host Michelle & Lucia does a superb job on the bar and with the food, awesome drinks in opposition with the 21th floor bar... the service over there it is like if they were doing you the favor to serve you a drink and besides don't even look at you when you ask for the bill.... opposite service, same hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best in Chicago for Views, Location and Value
text: I live in Chicago, but am a huge fan of luxury hotels. Whenever I want a little break, I'll book a night or two at London House. In my opinion it is the overall #1 hotel in the city for a few reasons. 1) Views. It has the best views of any property here. Get a king vista room (preferably on the 13-18th floors...the room you want ends in a 10...ex. 1610, 1710). These rooms look straight down the Chicago river with views of the bridges and many of the famous buildings. These rooms face west so make sure to get to your room before sunset and watch the sun set over the river and the sky and clouds change. Stay away from the 19th floor because you can get some noise from the bar above. 2) Location. LH is right on the river. Easy walk to anywhere you may need to go for business in the Loop or to shopping on Michigan Ave. Very near almost everything a tourist would want. Restaurants and bars are all around. 3) Value. For comparison, my second favorite hotel in town is the Langham, right across the street. The Langham will run you at least 3-4x the price on a slow night. I can usually get a room at LH in the low $220-$240 range. 4) Modern and Luxurious. The property is new and the technology is tops. Fancy lighting systems. Malin and Goetz bath products. Amazing bed. Maybe my favorite tech feature is fairly unique. They use the Hampton chain digital key system...meaning if you sign up for the Hilton Honors program and download the app to your phone, you can do almost everything during your stay on your phone. You check in, select your room, use your phone as your room key and can text them if you need anything. They are on it. For all you get here, it is my home in my town. Can't recommend LH enough. Thanks, London House. - Jennifer

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous Hotel; Great Views; Great Location
text: The LondonHouse was a great hotel to spend a long Labor Day weekend.  The room, and hotel in general, was one of the cleanest I have ever set foot in and highly recommend upgrading to a high-floor vista room which had great views of the river.  The room was equipped with all the latest gadgets including a large flatscreen TV, Nespresso coffee maker, and lights controlled from the bedside.  The bathroom was beautiful with lots of nice touches.  The rooftop bar was great with incredible views of Chicago and guests get to skip the line on the elevators up to the 21st floor.  The location was also wonderful - only a couple blocks from the 'L' without having to hear it and right in between the Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park.  All of the staff were very friendly and professional with the exception of Michelle, who have just been having a bad weekend, but I'm not going to let one poor attitude reflect negatively on the entire staff or our overall experience.  We definitely plan to return to the LondonHouse on future Chicago trips and will recommend to any friends and family heading that way for leisure or business.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop just a portion of amenities.
text: Spent four nights in August - perhaps a best time to see Chicago?  LondonHouse provided the best location in the city for restaurants, parks, tours, walks, museums and open concerts in my humble opinion.  The rooftop bar held a Friday table for drinks as we were hotel guests.  Busy and fun place for viewing sights and people.  Hold off on food however, drop down to the bar on the second level for outstanding charcuterie and drinks as well as live light jazz.  The staff were terrific!  Oh, did I mention the Corner Cafe in the bottom of the hotel at the street level?  The way to start your day.  Outstanding food and portions with a friendly and smiling staff.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I stayed at better Hilton Hotels
text: Arrived at the hotel close to 12am for a 3-day weekend and was wondering why there was so much ruckus in the hotel lobby. We saw the event screen and found out that there was a wedding the night we arrived. When we went to the front desk to check-in, the worker told us to wait to 'see if our room was ready' and went to what looked like the managers office. Came out and told us that we were being upgraded for an additional $15/night. (I wouldn't say it's really an upgrade if you're paying for it). Also, pretty sure they ran out of rooms that night and said we were "upgraded". My husband and I were really tired so said ok and just paid the extra so we can go up to our room.We didn't have the best view and the people in the room next to us liked to slam their hotel doors late at night. The room itself was clean; however, my pillow cases smelled like it wasn't fully dried. Besides all this, I have to applaud this hotel having a beautiful rooftop and lobby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Not worth the hype
text: Rooms are ok, price of drinks are outrageous, you can hear everything at night from the rooftop (music and partying), rooms with my group were given away even though the hotel was told they had a late flight, cost of the room is not worth the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay and location
text: The hotel is very centrally located.  The room was spacious and clean.  Hasan checked us in, and we were good to go.   EXCELLENT roof top bar view of the city!  Get there early for a seat for sure.   Breakfast was pretty good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful, first-class hotel!
text: Everything about this hotel was great! First-class staff at front desk, concierge, and doormen. Bell captains were excellent, especially Mark and Fadel. Newly opened restaurant had awesome food! Restaurant servers need more training and better attitude.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: There were some unexpected "surpises"
text: I stayed in this hotel from August 4 till August 20, 2017. During my accommodation in the hotel, there were withdrawn 3 guarantee payment from my credit card: 357.11 USD, 700 USD and 700 USD. From that amounts, only the first one (357.11) came back to my card, and I still wait for the rest 1400 USD. Considering the fact, that a mini-bar was empty from the very beginning, I really don't understand what for clients have to pay approximately +30% in addition to accommodation price and why they should wait so long to get their money back. Also, I have to say that London House is the first hotel in my life experience which doesn't provide the clients with at least one bottle of complimentary water. After 16 hours flight, the clients have no choice¬†but to take the bottle of water with a price tag $5 which is on the room table, because they are thirsty and just arrived. It is not client-oriented approach at all.However a location of the hotel is excellent, and overall experience of my stay was pretty good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best service ever by Jose Gonzales
text: My husband and I, along with our niece and nephew recently took a trip to Chicago to see the sights and the play Hamilton. I had a few requests that I needed from the concierge to help me with.The concierge Jose Gonzales went above and beyond what any other concierge had done for me in the past.Jose delivered on everything we requested. He was there to offer us suggestions on what to see in the city, and where to go for breakfast or dinner on our next few days.  Set up reservations and ensured we had wonderful service where ever we went.  Again going above and beyond.I have a new Chicago hotel, the Londonhouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Problem after Problem after Problem
text: So far a very disappointing experience at LondonHouse Chicago. Our first time staying here and after only one night so many problems. 1) TV switched itself on and woke us up twice in the middle of the night even though the remote control was sitting untouched on the bedside table. This was after an early start followed by a very long day so we really needed a good night's sleep. Reported to front desk in the morning and was told an engineer would look into it. No feedback throughout the day. Followed up in the evening and was told they weren't sure if an engineer had checked or not as they had no log history or communication from engineering. Offered to send an engineer to check now but it's 11.30pm and this should have been done during the day with some form of feedback provided. The lady at front desk said the TV does switch itself on sometimes - maybe if it's raining, but it wasn't raining, and even if it was, really?2) Couldn't access WiFi in the room. Logged on with name and room number following the instructions but connection refused. Joined their Hilton membership, connection still refused. Had to go down to front desk to resolve but they couldn't find any record of my reservation in spite of the fact that I had already checked in, had a room allocated and slept the night. Two staff kept tapping away on computers unable to find my reservation. Provided my hotels.com booking e-mail, still couldn't find my reservation. Kept asking if I had booked under a different name. All this time making me run late for my morning meeting. Eventually they found my reservation and asked me to try again to connect in the room. Too late as I had to leave for my meeting.3) Came back after a long day out and found our key cards don't work anymore. Had to go down to front desk again tonight to get them fixed. 4) Tried to log onto the Wifi in the room again on my phone this evening and received a warning that the security certificate for "hhonors", the hotel's Internet log-in webpage is invalid and poses a security threat. Too tired to deal with this now. So far it has been a very frustrating experience staying at LondonHouse Chicago. Very disappointed with the hotel, short on sleep, and regret choosing this place for our stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views of the river and the city
text: If you are going to stay in this hotel you are much better off paying a bit more for the river and city views otherwise its a bit drab. It is conveniently located. The building itself if beautiful and the rooftop bar is a plus. The service was quite good but there were a few issues. I stayed for two weeks and had to actually ask for the sheets to be changed and they took the bath robe about five days in and didn't replace it. If you come and go at buy times you can wait several minutes for an elevator (we waited nearly ten minutes one night to get out as two of the lifts were out for service and a third was used exclusively to ferry people to the roof top bar. It is a very nice hotel but as you'd expect from a big chain (Hilton in this case) it does have its share of problems, most of which are minor and don't detract too much from the stay but collectively are a little annoying. Having said all of that, I would still recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LONDONHOUSE RULES
text: Having been from Chicago, Im pretty well versed in the rooftop deck scene at all the downtown hotels, along with the accomodations within each.  I have to say, HANDS DOWN that from entry, to lobby, to checkin experience, to room, to meals, to rooftop deck , LondonHouse is my favorite hotel in the city.  Now that I travel to Chicago since moving away, I will only stay here simply because I feel well taken care of and proud to walk in the door. Prices are usually totally reasonable for the elevated level of experience - so its a no brainer.  It's a solid ALWAYS in my column of options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great little hotel on the river. ion , lounges, staff, elevators were all perfect.
text: Great location across river from Trump tower, affordable, great location, lounges outstanding, and most interesting high tech elevators I have ever seen!Staff out of their way to be helpful, courteous and kind

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, renovation but hiccups
text: Fabulous location- central to many attractions- right on the river at Michigan and Wacker. Lovely renovation- rooms are modern and comfortable. View of river was great. Customer service was quick to respond to first concern about housekeeping, who were arguing in the hall and missed aspects of cleaning the room one day and didn't do it at all the next, but yet someone took the tip.  We followed up twice then mgt sent someone up to clean that evening- so a few kinks in the armour that they need to work out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic!!
text: Gorgeous lobby and historic hallways and wonderful rooms. Our room did not have a view but did come with a spacious floor plan and a incredibly comfortable bed. The bathroom was stocked with a complimentary toothbrush, shower cap, q-tips, and really nice body wash. We were in town for the eclipse and were able to go to the rooftop bar which has a fantastic view of Chicago. I'll definitely be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: WORTH IT
text: Beautiful property, well maintained, nice technology, excellent breakfast, and beautiful rooftop where there are outstanding views of the Chicago river and bridges.  Staff were very polite and helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Getaway
text: I really liked the hotel and amenities.  The only issue was with breakfast.  At check-in I was given the option of "free breakfast" or 1,000 points.  I chose breakfast thinking we would get a full breakfast.  I was wrong.  They had three choices.  I remember two was a donut or oatmeal with coffee.  I can't remember the third.  If you wanted to order breakfast off the menu, they would discount the price $5.  Fortunately the prices weren't too outrageous.  We did order breakfast.  If I would have known though that they only provided those choice, I may have made a different decision.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional!
text: Just completed a girl's weekend in Chicago and couldn't have found a more perfect "home base" for the fun. LondonHouse has it all, fantastic location, attentive staff, and a great vibe. From the moment you arrive, one can't help but be impressed by the friendly and competent staff -- obviously the hotel places a high emphasis on training. Rooms are sleek, modern, and immaculate. Rooftop bar boasts magnificent views and is in high demand -- waiting line beginning in early afternoon. Good news, as guests one goes to the front of the line :). We commend the LondonHouse staff, thank you for making our stay so memorable; we'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great staff, great property, great location
text: My wife and I come to Chicago for fun 3 to 4 times a year.  I wish that we had found LondonHouse sooner.  Word of advice: I would describe this hotel as hip and trendy.  If you don't care for that vibe, this may not be as fun for you as it was for this 50-something couple.The staff was incredibly attentive with a special shout out to Jose, the concierge and Abel at the front desk.  Jose got us tickets to Hamilton at the last minute and they were reasonably priced.Great view on the outdoor deck on the 21st floor of the Chicago River and surrounding buildings.  It is located on the River at Michigan Ave, which makes it super convenient to everything.Room was clean and well appointed, with fast Internet.  The bar on the 21st floor was top notch and prices for bar food was at or below prices in the downtown area, I can assure you.Highly recommend this place amd will return again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I'm Coming Back Next Weekend !!
text: I am working in the general Chicago area for 3 weeks and decided to stay downtown this weekend. I'm a Diamond member and actually picked LondonHouse solely because of the great views of the river.  Wow, what a gem this hotel is! I had asked for a corner room which wasn't available when I checked in so they downgraded me to a different room and removed $50 per night off of the rate.  I was disappointed since I'm traveling for business and don't pay for the room out of pocket anyway but I still give this hotel top rating.  My room was beautiful with large windows looking out over the river, a Nepresso machine, wonderful toiletries and the bed was so comfortable.  The staff couldn't have been more attentive and helpful.I wasn't planning to come back into the city over the next 2 weeks but I just made a reservation again for next weekend!  Already looking forward to staying here again and getting out and discovering more of the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Bad Experience with Staff!
text: This was not my first time staying here but it is definitely my last stay. The hotel staff is very pretentious and apathetic. Check in was fine but the staff at the front desk are the most unfriendly and unaccommodating people I have ever encountered at a hotel. You better hope you don't have any issues. They will be handled very poorly.     On the first day of our stay we hit the Mag Mile pretty hard. I bought several things for my son, my granddaughter  and for my daughter who was traveling with me. My daughter had taken our purchases out of the bags and left the shopping bags with receipts in them as well as a shoe box on the floor against the wall, NO WHERE NEAR THE GARBAGE CAN. When we came back to our room the following day housekeeping had thrown everything away! Except of course an empty water bottle that we found on the floor between the beds. All of my receipts were gone! Then we discovered that my daughter's toothbrush holder disappeared so we are assuming that was thrown away as well. I called the front desk and they sent someone from housekeeping up to the room. She was kind but not overly concerned. She offered to extend our checkout time two hours later. She said she would look into it and see if the items could be found in the shoot and she would call me. I never got the call. When we returned to our room to retrieve our luggage my digital key had been deactivated and said we were checked out. I went to the front desk and they were not aware our check out time had been extended. I told the gentleman at the front desk what had happened. His response was, "well, you really don't need receipts you can just exchange whatever you don't want" REALLY?? I told him I was very upset and that I felt housekeeping should know not to throw away anything that is not in the garbage can. I told him housekeeping said they would call but never did. He said I will talk to them right now. We checked out and left the hotel. Never got a phone call. I called the hotel the following day and spoke with a manager. I believe his name was Mark. I told him what had happened. He asked what I wanted him to do about it. Ummmm, it's your job to figure that out. He asked for my phone number and said he would get back to me. Guess what???  He never called back either!!  Basically, every hotel staff I spoke with said what do you want me to do?  I guess that's my point!  Your housekeeping person threw away over $1,000 in receipts and you can't get them back! I went birthday shopping for my granddaughter and nothing is returnable.      We were supposed to stay here again in October, but we booked a room at the Radisson Blu Aqua. Very nice hotel with a professional staff.     The only friendly staff we encountered were the valet guys but they don't actually work for the hotel. The rooms are just ok. The view is beautiful and that is all this hotel has going for them. The bathroom design is horrible. The glass barn door does not really afford much privacy. The beds sit on a base that sticks out so watch yourself!  I jammed my toes more then once! There are a lot of great hotels in Chicago with spectacular views. Stay somewhere else. The Renaissance is very nice. Same view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel with great views
text: The LondonHouse is a great hotel to call home for a few days. The service is amazing and prompt and the rooms are delicious and comfy. As someone who travels frequently, this hotel was fantastic to stay in while in Chicago. Hasan H. was great to check-in with. Unless you are a millennial obsessed with selfies, I would skip the rooftop restaurant. It is crazy crowded and not as relaxing as one would assume.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, loud doors!
text: $148 including city, county and state tax was a deal for a Saturday night. We were able to check in four hours early at noon so we didn't have to leave our bags with the bellhop. That was definitely a plus!We went up to the rooftop bar for a drink before dinner and it was characteristically crowded. They allow open seating at the high top tables and reserve the lower tables and the couch type seating.Eight dollars for a Stella or Miller is about you would expect down here. Doesn't make you feel good but you don't feel completely taken either like you do in Manhattan.We headed in and went to the bar one floor below and watched the Cubs game. It was much more relaxed in there and the server was very nice.The room was well appointed. One desk chair by the desk one small reading chair with a tiny table and two very large windows with great views down the river towards the west.The best part of the room was the large TV on the wall and no dresser to take up space because the room was really narrow. There was a high-end fridge behind a door and what appeared to be a nice coffee making unit as well. Bathroom had a nice rain shower, one of those lit up vanity mirrors and plenty of space around the sink for all your toiletries.Our only complaint would be that the doors to the hotel rooms are so heavy that when you go to close them they make a really crashing loud sound. They are just way too loud and they need some sort of mechanism to slow down the action so that they don't make so much noise even if you're trying to hold the door and avoid making so much noise they still make too much.We were on the eighth floor and heard only the smallest amount of street noise. Anything higher than that and it's very quiet.One other small complaint is that the elevators are that new system where you put in your floor number on a keypad while you're waiting to get on and then it tells you which elevator get up to get onto. When trying to get to the roof from our eighth floor we had to wait nearly 5 minutes one time for an elevator. Somehow they need to reconfigure the algorithm that decides which elevators are going up because that was way too long of a wait when there were seven elevators available.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: On the river
text: The Bad1. Short stay booked for one night but was thinking of extending another day. Decided against it when the front desk charged $60 extra because my daughter was with us. Even though my daughter wasn't staying with us the next day, we'd be charged the extra amount the next day again. Not cool. So we booked at the Chicago Athletic Club tomorrow.  Effectively you're charged $30 more than if you'd booked listing 3 people in a room initially. Seems like a poor practice to me. 2.  No pool. ‚òπÔ∏è3.  Parking $71?  Park at the underground parking. Cheaper and a short 2 block walk. ‚òπÔ∏èSpothero or parkingwhiz will cut the cost of parking in half. That's the bad but the good. 1.  Very high tech. Nicely designed. Handicapped seating in the tub. Spacious. Great view of the river and Trump Tower if you like that kind of thing.  2.  Location is close to everything. Walking distance. Restaurants in River North. Cruises on the river. (Hint Get a deal on Groupon)Shopping on Michigan Ave. Navy PierMillennium Park

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay at London House
text: The location of this hotel at corner of Michigan and Wacker cannot be beat. Service was excellent. Upgrade to a room with a view if you can swing the relatively small extra amount. Hit the roof top bar and enjoy the view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel right downtown
text: I found this Hotel by doing a search under my Hilton app. Was so pleasantly surprised. This is such a beautiful hotel. It's one block off of Michigan Avenue. Everything is in within walking distance. The staff is extremely friendly. The lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are really nice as well. We had a great view of downtown.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent
text: A lovely hotel to stay for a business trip. My wife and I are planing to come and stay there. I told her how nice it was and she wants to go. So I will be returning for a wonderful weekend with my wife.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel Staff and Service but rooftop drinks way overpriced.
text: My Huband and I arrived early for our check in assuming we would just leave our bags and come back later in the day.  The front desk receptionist Caitlin was so pleasant and let me know that our room was ready early.  When she found out it was my birthday and wedding anniversary that day she upgraded our room to one with a view.  I was blown away because most Chicago hotels are not willing to upgrade you for anything.  The room was very clean and we loved the modern yet classy decor.  The rooftop is also nice but extremely pricey for drinks.  I paid $18.89 for a basic Bloody Mary which made me feel extremely ripped off.  I am still rating this hotel a 5 because of the staff.  Also we happened to be there during the eclipse.  When I called the rooftop bar the manager John had said they might be out of viewing glasses.  I told him we were guests at the hotel and he then said he would check for more glasses in his office.  When we got to the bar he had saved the last two pairs of glasses for us.  I will come back again but probably won't be buying drinks at the bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awsome Experience
text: I would highly recommend the hotel . view is amazing and the hotel is so clean.We stayed only forone night. The staff were helpful to recommend places to visit. Check in was supposed to be at 4 pm but as soon as w got to the hotel at 2 pm we were able to get to our room right away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impressive Design
text: Excellent experience at LondonHouse Chicago.  Impressive designer approach and topnotch customer service.  Hasan at the front desk made sure to give an overview of hotel amenities, check in via text to make sure my room was working out as I needed and pointed out other features like the beautiful rooftop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing river view, rooftop, location, and service!
text: It was great being right on the river and Michigan Ave! So fun to watch the action from the window, and it was very convenient for walking all over downtown. The service was very nice - even gave us free drinks while waiting a few minutes for an upgraded room!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hilton Yet
text: As a diamond member since 2014, this is hands down best front desk staff and management I have ever experienced. I cannot speak highly enough if these people. They have been phenomenal throughout my stay. The hotel itself is great, but the people were what made me enjoy the stay even more.I will stay here every time back in Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: If only...
text: Hotel is great for the most part- rooms are a nice size and clean. We would stay again. I did however have to give it a three versus a five as a result of three issues/concerns1.  I checked in at 4pm and was given a room on 4. I asked for a higher floor which was possible if I wanted to pay 40 dollars extra a night - a real bargain since it should be 60! I had already paid quite a bit for my three night stay and since rooms were available and this same speal was given to everyone- why couldn't you just accommodate? Not only did we have no view but we're on a low floor that lucky enough was right near the far afar pickup at 4am on Saturday morning 2. Saturday night when we were returning to our room and waiting for an elevator the security guy for the rooftop asked my husband to see his keycard - it was 10pm and all we wanted to do was go to our room being questioned by staff wasn't something we wanted nor required - we definitely weren't dressed for the rooftop since we had been walking around for 12 hours- was this necessary as a paying guest ? Probably Not.3. Gym was good but seriously how hard is it to put soap beside the sink so people can wash their hands

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Todd Nekola
text: Great Hotel with a killer view of the River ,staff very helpful. Corey and Fadal on the bell staff were great made sure to say hello each day and gave us tips on seeing the city. Thoroughly enjoyed our week stay. Rooms with the full length Windows were awesome. We will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Where the action is
text: Going to Chicago and not sure where to stay? Try Londonhouse. It sits in the middle of the city - opposite Trump Tower - allowing you a great base to see Chicago from. 15 minutes to Navy Pier, Millenium Park and more. Luxury rooms. Good meals. Drinks reasonable prices. Service is awesome. Lots of people from across the state, U S and the world stay there. Shopping areas not great but buses and cabs are right outside. Enjoy!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago
text: Beautiful rooms and views of the river and city-scape.  Great view from the Rooftop Terrace too.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast buffet was great and the hostesses and servers were soooo nice.  Room was immaculate and room attendants were very nice.  We'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Experience!
text: I chose this hotel for a number of reasons - the website shows the hotel extremely well and looked exactly like what we wanted; location is unbeatable; the rooftop bar/restaurant has the best views in all of Chicago and the experience (food, drinks & service) were awesome!  Highly recommended.    All of our expectations were exceeded.  The hotel is absolutely fantastic.  We travel all over the world and make it a point to stay at hotels that have a personality.  We will definitely come back to Chicago, mostly to stay at London House again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Customer Service Superstar!
text: The staff made sure we were happy and well taken care of. From the time we checked in to after checkout. Great location and fun bar on the roof. Nice Jazz music in the lobby.  Don't bring a car...very expensive to park.   Tip: you can eat your breakfast on the roof deck even though they seat you one level below.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Dare to try
text: Curio Collection- a series of hotels by the Hilton chain done in a fresh way!They select buildings with a history and a prominent location- weave their magic and voila - the perfect mix of high end luxury, great location and excitement. The interior of the rooms ( I had the new wing) in a muted palette of greys and dark wood are given a bright finish in the bathroom where hexagonal tiles and white marble are the highlight of a generous size. Guests are treated to Malin and Goetz amenities ( new sets daily) and fluffy white towels. The bed linen with discreet LH logos woven into the linen and thick fluffy slippers are a respite for tired travelers. The gem in this hotel is the sky lounge on the 22nd floor. You can sip your cocktail or mocktail while watching the sun cast its golden rays on the Chicago river while competing with the 24k gleaming towers of the carbide and carbon building just a stone's throw away. A perfect end to your adventurous day touring the architectural gems dotted along the river.   No need to check out other accommodations - stay here... no regrets.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Customer Service
text: After an exhausting trip from San Francisco I could not have been assisted by a better front desk supervisor than Paige Cobb. Paige provided exemplary customer service and being part of large group from a local university, I can also confirm that many of my other colleagues expressed the same level of satisfaction. Paige's excellent customer service is one of the main reasons we will be returning customers at the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lived up to Expectations!
text: I've wanted to stay here since the signs went up during renovations, the entire property is spectacular. The art, the lobby space, down tothe elevators-you choose your floor on a keypad and it tells you what elevator to go to! The room was an average size with tall ceilings that made it seem spacious. I loved all of the little decor accents in the room. My room was very clean with a beautiful river view. I look forward to returning!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: High end Hilton property
text: My stay at the London house was excellent  and the staff accommodated my request for a  river/lake view room. The rooms look as if freshly renovated and have mordern feel to them.During my stay, the hotel did experienced issues with the  elevators for couple of hours and walking up and down from the 20th floor was not fun. I would definatley recommend this centrally located Hilton property and it will be unfair to ding them to ellavator outage.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Phenomenal Hotel!
text: The service is unbeatable, very nice modern hotel and the rooftop is amazing. Highly recommend! Great location too, River North is close and Millennial Park. Will definitely be back. The food is also very good and they have my favorite booze, effen cucumber

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent
text: Our stay at Londonhouse was outstanding due to the excellent and attentive staff from the time we arrived to the time we left. Brandi checked us in and was gracious in upgrading us to a room with views of the river lake and the city. I will recommend this hotel to others.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome customer service
text: Recently stayed at this pretty hotel. Staff is super accommodating. They took care of every need for our group from dinner to even roof top at the Trump,they rock!!!Stayed in a corner suite with unmatched views of the river and Michigan Ave. Thanks for a great weekend getaway.Chris

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Hotel
text: As a Diamond level honors member I stay at a lot of hotels. Chicago has several great Hilton options but LondonHouse is the best. Very upscale, boutique feel. Amazing views, great location, beautiful rooms. Chromecast TV.The staff is exceptional. Very friendly and helpful. They always get me a superb room and make me feel welcome.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location pretty loud
text: The location here was really good if you were looking to go on tours or shopping. The rooms were modern and updated, but they were a little small and the windows didn't offer much sound proofing. So, if you like to sleep late and they give you a room facing the river, be prepared for some really loud boat horns waking you up.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Enjoy this beautiful hotel.
text: Great location.  Beautiful, large, well-appointed rooms.  Be sure to visit roof-top bar.Check-in challenging as you are bombarded with options, upgrade choices, views, etc.  We were traveling in a group.  Could not--with reservations--provide rooms for all parties at the quoted price originally booked.  Desk indicated a room was cancelled.  We did not cancel a room.  Three of four couples were Honors members but that did not seem to help.  Difficult to get our rewards credited to our individual accounts as one person reserved all rooms while each party paid separately.  I blame corporate on this one as the clerk was obviously pressured to pound us with these upgrade options.  Fortunately, the bar is thirty feet away!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great property & great staff!
text: Fantastic rooms that are clean, well laid out and spacious. Large bathroom with amazing shower and vanity surrounding sink that has enough room to keep toiletries out. Our room had a wonderful view of the river. The roof top bar is a must for great views - especially at night with the city lights. Staff at this hotel were top notch. The one complaint I have is the elevator situation. When we were there only a couple of elevators were in use- so we had quite a wait a few times. As long as you are not in a  hurry or allow extra time if you have a commitment- you will be super pleased with this hotel! Thanks Londonhouse! Keep up the good work!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: City Staycation
text: The London House in Chicago is a beautiful boutique hotel located conveniently for a visit to the city. The room was comfortable and the amenities first class! They have a very hip rooftop bar which was closed for a private party the night we were there. The lobby is overlooking the Chicago River and Walker Drive and you are only a few steps from Michigan Av. I would return and highly recommend this as an affordable, welcoming small hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: For a luxury brand, it's mediocre
text: My friends and I stayed at the LondonHouse for a girls trip to Chicago. At first our only real complaints were the room service hours (ends at 10pm) and the view of Trump tower. On the last night of our stay, when we arrived back to our room from 11+ hours out and about we were dismayed that our room hadn't been cleaned. We called down to the desk and we're assured it would be taken care of. Fast forward 3+ hours later and we still didn't have a clean room and were spoken to in a very condescending and dismissive manner by the night manager Alex. Thankfully the day manager, Michael, was amazing and took the time to sit down with us and discuss the issues we had the night previous and take steps to mitigate the frustration. He deserves a promotion. Overall I'd rank this hotel middle of the road. The interior is beautiful, and the bar has an amazing view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxury in the Loop
text: Beautiful hotel. The attention to detail is fabulous and opulent. The rooftop bar offers really gorgeous views of the city. It is in a great location. Walking distance to the pier and many restaurants and shops. Our room had a great view even on the fifth floor. I would definitely book again when visiting the Windy City.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect from start to finish
text: I was able to sneak away for a day from work and kids to celebrate my anniversary.As a Hilton gold member I was hoping that the LondonHouse would make it a special occasion, and they surely did. After making my reservation thru the app I was able to text the hotel on the app to ask if an upgrade was available. Within minutes the Hotel manager Alex responded " It would be his pleasure to make our anniversary special.  Upon arrival at an early time of 1230 I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom Vista suite was a great gesture to do this. We were both very happy and the view was amazing overlooking the river and across to trump tower.  The location couldn't have been better for navigating the city. After an afternoon of fun in the city we came back to the room to a personalized note to wish us a happy anniversary along with a plate a chocolate covered strawberries. We were both impressed and felt this hotel and employees are top notch.  Next morning a really nice breakfast buffet and nice service all complimentary for gold and diamond members. Walked a flight up to the 22nd rooftop for a great view of the city. We wanted to stay a little longer and savannah was glad to accommodate a late 2pm check out.  From the pre arrival courtesy to the valet to the front desk to Shannon in concierge to every employee we had contact with this Hotel got it right and went beyond normal expectations. I have stayed a few times in Chicago and different hotels and the LondonHouse is by far the best and my only choice when I return again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing from start to finish
text: Such a beautiful place, with very helpful professional staff, always greeted with a smile.  Allowed to check in early which was such a big plus fir us. The rooftop bar is awesome and the location is great.. close to everything! Highly recommended!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stellar hotel!
text: I'm a Hilton Diamond member and was in Chicago for one night on a college tour with my son. I had originally booked myself at the Drake but read recent reviews that the Internet there is defunct and the rooms tired and dreary. I decided to check out other high end Hilton properties last minute and boy was I glad I did. The Londonhouse came up for a very good rate and I booked a King suite with a request to upgrade to a Vista suite (the floor to ceiling windows with views of the river). We arrived way early and our room wasn't ready of course. We spent a few hours in the second floor lounge hoping for a room to open up which didn't happen. Throughout the afternoon the helpful staff were very good about touching base by text as to the progress of getting us a Vista suite on a high floor. That was a wonderful customer service touch! Late afternoon this was successfully achieved. Believe me, this view is definitely worth the upgrade that you are asked if you want after completing your reservation. I could have taken a chance on getting it as a Diamond member, but I think the staff put more effort into it and it only cost me $30 extra. The rooftop bar on the 21st floor offers the same fabulous views I was enjoying from my room. I popped up there with my glass of wine and took a quick look around to observe the pretty young things enjoying themselves. The next morning my son and I enjoyed a to DIE for buffet breakfast on the 21st floor. Buffet breakfasts can be very uneven and tired but the fresh fruit was SO extensive, with granola and nonfat Greek yoghurt. Many breads and pastries, delicious soft scrambled eggs, thick crispy bacon, sausage. In addition, avocado toast. Plus many offerings that the kids will love to include cereals etc. So yummy, my congrats to the staff that makes this buffet above and beyond the ordinary. Should this be offered at a Ritz Carlton, it would be $40 a person I'm guessing. I hate to at this point mention anything negative but just so you don't think I'm a relative of the manager after this glowing review here goes. We arrived at an ungodly early hour on Sunday morning I know. Of course I didn't expect to be placed in a room but I wish that I had been advised that there was breakfast being served on the 21st floor. No mention of that. Such a great breakfast that I would have loved to have taken advantage!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago on the River
text: Nice boutique hotel great views good complementary breakfast  better choices than others avocado panini  they upgraded us to a  vista sweat because our anniversary.  Great walking distance from main shopping places

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a beautiful Hotel
text: I loved this hotel.  I travel all over, and so far this was the best hotel I have stayed in.  The room was beautiful. Lots of room.  The nicest bathroom.  The bed, was so comfortable and the staff were excellent.  If you do not need to drive there, don't.  Parking and traffic were a nightmare. I am a runner, so the location is ideal.  The waterfront, is so nice to run, walk, or just sit and day dream.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Views & Location for Michigan Ave.
text: I stayed here two nights for a business conference. The staff was very accommodating, even sent text messages each day to check & ensure I was enjoying my stay. Never had that occur before & it was a nice touch. The room was small but adequate. It also had a terrific view of the river, Trump Tower, etc. I was concerned about the noise from the street below but once I closed the curtains, I heard nothing from the outside & slept soundly.I hope to stay here again in the near future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel in a terrific location.
text: Spent one night in August there.  The room was large and beautifully maintained.  The bathroom was modern and very clean.  You entered on street level and needed to go to the second floor for check-in.  I booked the 21st floor restaurant and there was some issue with the reservation but they made it work out.  Had  a drink and ordered nuts and they came as we were paying.  Only issue I truly had was with the elevator system.  Entered your floor number and told which bank of elevators to go to and it took quite a while for the elevator to arrive.  Other than that hotel would have been a five star.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend get away. Boutique hotel.
text: From start to finish we were treated like we were the most important guests there. Beautiful room. Great food. Amazing service. Spectacular rooftop view. Right in the heart of Chicago. You won't be dissatisfied.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite hotel
text: We just love this place. You just can't get a better location. Beautiful views from our room. The rooms are modern luxe, beautiful finishes yet comfortable and not stuffy. There was a lot of thought put into their guests comfort. We ate breakfast upstairs and even though it was busy, we were seated right away. My favorite part is when they text you to see how your stay is going, I LOVE THAT! This is our second visit here and looking forward to many more!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxury Hotel Experience In Ideal Location
text: I cannot say enough positive things about our experience at LondonHouse in Chicago.  The rooftop bar was a great option to have; our room was comfortable, luxurious and clean, and the lobby, cleaning and maintenance staff were all extremely friendly, as though they really enjoyed their jobs.  The location was ideal for access to the train and waterfront, with Divvy bike service right on the corner.  We were able to use our points and a AAA rate by booking over the phone; would highly recommend and come back here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great View
text: Great location fabulous views of the river and city. Fun roof top bar. Really good renovation job of what is a very interesting old building. I found the staff friendly and eager to help. Breakfast whilst good a little slow. Overall good fun

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: some pretty darn good, some . . .
text: this is an interesting property.   first time i have ever stayed here.   it is a botique hotel in the hilton family.  location is tremendous - corner of wacker and michigan.   place has a really good vibe.   check-in (on second level) was pretty easy - bit busy but i was checking in around 5 p.m. and a lot of us showed up at one time.    thought staff worked hard and was friendly and helpful.   rooms are pretty darn neat and different than the typical hotel room - i thought a bit of a european flair.  my stay was really good except for one thing - i twice requested additional towels and foam pillows and both times they failed to be delivered which was irritating.  raised the issue the next morning and they promptly gave a bit of a discount on my stay which was appreciated.    i will likely stay here again and the only reason i graded down a bit was due to the one service issue.  hotel has a really great rooftop bar and restaurant

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome and elegant
text: The LondonHouse is a class act. My family felt appreciated and the staff was excellent. The location is ideal for walking to many Chicago things to see and do.  The bus system is relatively easy to navigate. We recommend a day pass.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Ideal Location, gorgeous rooms/
text: Travelling for a short stay on business, a friend was staying here, I then cancelled my hotel booking an opted for this one.  the location is ideal. you may miss it on the street it has two entrances and the lobby is on the second floor. D√©cor is beautiful and the rooms are fantastic. The staff seem new and some fumble a little to get to the level of service a hotel like this one demands, but they do try hard. I am confident they will get there! the concierge was very accommodating as I needed to leave my bags before check in. There was a mistake in my booking ( my fault ) but they were terrific about accommodating me. I did only have 1 meal there, breakfast. It was certainly above and beyond my expectations. I would definitely go again to enjoy a leisure stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First Time to Chicago
text: This hotel was better than I expected for a fun romantic getaway with my wife! It's centrally located and tastefully decorated. Its a mix of old meets new because its a former London Insurance building with a luxurious contemporary addition on the side that has a tri-level rooftop bar that visitors flock to every night. Walking everywhere, taking a cab, taking a river tour, or double-decker bus was seconds away from the front door!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: signifcant service shortfall
text: I am a Diamond guy who travels 50 weeks a year and mostly stays with Hilton and Marriott/Starwood properties. This was point redemption stay for me - the stuff that bribes the spouse to tolerate heavy travel schedule the rest of the year. I wont be returning to this property. Rooms are nice. Service is way subpar. It looks like they are running millenial hotspot with a inconvinient hotel beneath it. Breakfast was disaster twice in a row - once they refused seating us during open hours, and the other time they both stopped serving menu order AND ran out of food in the bugget during open hours. Front line staff was polite but not empowered and/or trained to handle customer complaints, compounded with area managers disinterested in showing up to address the problem. Its a new property but you expect the kinks to have been worked out a year in. In-room dining was a disaster - salad was inedible and $20 burger was barely on par with local fast food joint - truffle fries were the only thing on the otherwise skimp menu worth ordering. Every problem encountered seemed to be answered with "well our policy is ..." despite it making no sense - refusal to boom a table for party of 3 - because policy says you got to be four - so make sure to lie when you call up to book a table; want to charge me full room rate at checkout despite me booking using standard room point redemption - yeah we do what corporate systems say - its their fault. For a hotel staff, area managers, and all the way up to GM: customers dont care if your suncontractor, hotel employed staff, or hilton corporate mess it up - you get to own it no matter which component of your service delivery fails - we dont need to know nor do we care to listen to excuses as to who is at fault - you get to own it and make it right - no excuses.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Elite Elegance
text: We are very particular about our stay. LondonHouse Curio Collection remains the gold standard for us.  The view, hospitality, & ambiance was old world, respectful and glamorous! We are grateful for the perfect accommodation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great option for stylish hotel in great location
text: From the excellent check in experience with Brandy at reception to the friendly house keeping staff and the LH21 restaurant service staff, this is one of the best Chicago experiences I have. The room is clean and well equipped. This is a historic building so the elevators are a bit touch and go, but the location at Wacker and Michigan is so convenient it makes up for some inconvenience. Every day around 5pm, a long line forms at one elevator on the ground floor to go up to the tri-level rooftop bar and restaurant with a tremendous river and city view. When you check in ( on the second floor lobby) and is offered a river view room, be aware that the giant lit Trump sign across the river may become your primary view out your window. Happy to be back in September for another multi night stay without a river view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice venue but service is poor
text: I spent a week in this hotel - the location is great (especially for Chicago Booth Gleacher Center) and the venue itself is nicely done and to good standard. There's a very cool rooftop bar and a cozy breakfast areas with fireplace. I suppose the refurb is still taking place as the ground floor was half empty ( restaurant to be open soon). Talking about the lobby - the lift system can keep you waiting in the queue at pick times, so plan some extra time for getting out of into the hotel. The food was bad. Really. Poor selection and poor quality. Quite a surprise given the nice decor in the hotel. The service was even worse. On one occasion the room service knocked on my door and I asked them to come back in 10 minutes as I was in the shower. The lovely lady responded that it's the end of her shift and she would not come back. I was working in my room all day so I know she showed up only 10 minutes before the end of her shift. I normally don't care about room service, but this time I badly needed it - no soap, lots of plates and food leftovers from breakfast etc. Not nice.I went back home and almost forgot about the service, when I realised they added some charges to my bill after I had left and paid for everything. I've been emailing them and leaving voicemails but they are not getting back to me and it's been over a month. If the manager is reading this - can you please send me your number so as I can contact you directly?Thank you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Great Value
text: Stayed here for the first time on a recent business trip.  Hotel was clean, comfortable, and decently appointed.  Very close to the hottest destinations within Chicago.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  The rooms were clean and the refresh each day was on point.  The "luxury rooftop dining" leaves a bit to be desired, but at least there were good views.  Make reservations if you want to dine outside.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: As your mother told you looks are not everything
text: Well we tried to combine my husbands business trip with some family time. Apparently for LH that is challenging. From my original call to extend our reservation to the several knocks on our door to see why we were still in the room the day before we were due to check out this hotel just here asn't got its act together. Yes location is perfect. Yes the design elements are lovely. Yes the staff are friendly. However, the elevator system is bizarre and had us taking the stairs several times. There is absolutely no room in our closet - our affectionate name for the room that housed the 3 of us - to store luggage or put toiletries in the bathroom. Called several times to get supplies for 3 although would respond had to keep telling them we were 3. Everyone tried to be helpful but somedays you just wish they would get it right.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great property walking distance to the magnificent mile
text: I stayed here for a business trip and was very pleased with the accommodations and staff. The room was very nice - I had the option to choose a larger room or better view.  It's located just blocks from the magnificent mile.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Boutique upscale with friendly staff
text: I recently stayed for two nights for business and would highly recommend for the location and service this hotel offers. Everyone I met was incredibly friendly. At arrival they upgraded to a river room happily. The lobby bar service I don't quite understand as no one came around. This has happened with previous stays as well. The rooftop bar does have an incredible view although after seeing it, I was ready to go as there is very little seating up there. Overall great stay with upscale amenities and would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Neat Boutique Hotel
text: My wife and I traveled on AmTrak from New Orleans to Chicago for a relaxing weekend in the Windy City.  The London House is an ideal location to stay, accomodations are fantastic.  It is a short cab ride to Navy Pier, the archictectural boat tours, and museums. Great restaurants, and jazz clubs are within walking distance.  The river view from the Hotel's rooftop bar is incredible.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel with an amazing location.
text: This hotel is definitely one of the best hotels in the city. The location is very close (walking distance) to all the tourist attractions and is near many restaurants. The hotel staff is also very friendly and accommodating. You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel - Great Location!
text: We will definitely stay at this hotel again.  Great location right on the Chicago River walking distance to everything downtown.  The views from the rooftop bar was amazing.  The rooms were clean and spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First Class
text: Look no further than the London House if you're traveling to Chicago.  From the moment you step in to this chic and elegant hotel, you will be treated like a VIP.  Everyone from the bellman, to the front desk, concierge and bar associates are first rate.  The room is impeccable, clean, and very chic!  It really is a home away from home, and all the amenities that come with it.  The location is second to none, and you are steps away from all the major attractions!  Will definitely come back!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business trip
text: Stayed here for four nights. Received a gold upgrade to a corner studio, which had a great view of the river. The room was a good size for a single traveler, but may be small for two.  It was super clean and modern.  Oddly, there didn't seem to be an drawers-just small cabinets. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable.  The staff were all friendly and fairly responsive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Chicago Hotel
text: This was our first visit to Chicago and ths hotel is in the perfect spot, right on the river and central to everything. My wife and I had a great stay - the rooms, service and staff were terrific. We would gladly stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Rooftop Restaurant/Bar
text: This hotel is located right on the south side of the Chicago River. It is very close to all of the theaters, Michigan Avenue shops, and River North restaurants! The room was stylish, clean and comfortable. The rooftop restaurant and bar are amazing with breathtaking views! We ate brunch on the rooftop and the menu contained a good variety of options. Definitely recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Most comfortable bed with an amazing view
text: My best friend and I wanted a weekend getaway, and the London House delivered! Dinner was amazing, even though we got rained out from the rooftop. Our beds were super comfortable, and the room had an amazing view of the river. Room service was a tad pricey, but the food was tasty.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: party house
text: We booked a 3 day stay from Thurs-Sun.  The first 2 night stay were fine except for the parking which is $71 a night.  We had to use it once but moved our car a couple blocks away at a public parking garage for half the price.  The first night we arrived around 3p and were told the roof top bar was closing at 5p for a special event.  The second night storms moved in also closing the rooftop bar. The real problem started on our 3rd night stay when we arrived back from dinner out.  Once we got off on the 20th floor immediately heard loud music.  Once we entered the room we heard a live band playing above our room.  We were leaving the next morning early for a long drive home and there was no way we were getting any rest.  The staff said there were no other rooms available  It just so happened Londonhouse booked a live band on the 21 floor. playing till 11 PM The staff tried to discount our room rates but we couldn't listen to this noise for 3or 4 more hours.  We told the staff employee that we were leaving.  She told the manger on duty (who wouldn't leave the office to speak to us personally) and we went to room to pack.  Within 10 minutes housekeeping was at our door to clean room and we weren't even completely packed yet. I couldn't say anything about the rooftop bar because we never made it.  It seems to me that the Londonhouse is more interested in quantity than quality. They want to book everything they can at the expense of the room guest.  For us Chicago has plenty of other hotels in the same area so we won't be back after this experience.  W

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite hotel in the city
text: We encountered this beautiful hotel by chance about a year ago on our way back from Europe. We were very impressed and decided to make it our go to location when we visited Chicago. Conveniently located on Wabash right off of Michigan Avenue, you have access to everything the city has to offer. Ask for a vista room,so you have views of the river.  They offer breakfast (for a charge) and have a rooftop bar that gives you stunning views of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: About Turn
text: Sometimes it's best to give a place a second chance and I did.Everything on this 10 day stay was 10 times better - staff, service, room quality.I've now stayed 3 times (10 nights at a time) and have booked a 4th.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: There is no other hotel in Chicago
text: This hotel is amazing.  The hotel team is great and very friendly.  Matt at the front desk was great.  My wife and I have celebrated our last two anniversaries here and cannot wait to come back.  This is the only hotel I will stay at or recommend in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel in the Heart of the City
text: This was our first stay at this Hilton property, we arrived around noon on 7/15/2017 didn't expect our room to be available but Savannah at the desk, who was very nice, informed us that we had a complimentary upgrade to a river view room through Hilton Honors and we were able to check in immediately. The room itself while not overly large was contemporary and comfortable and the view was breathtaking. The fabulous bartender at the lobby bar that afternoon (so sorry I didn't get his name) made us feel right at home and honestly we would have stayed a chatted with him all day if we didn't have other plans. We have stayed at several Hilton properties downtown and all have been good, The London House will be my first choice from now on and I am looking for reasons to get back to the city just to stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: Parking is expensive, with no safe place park to check in. We were almost hit several times trying unload our car to check into the Hotel. They only offer Valet parking for $71 a day. We found Public Parking a block away for $38 total for the three days we were in Chicago. We also experienced a lot of noise late at night from rude people in the elevator lobby near our room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, but disappointing for a family vacation
text: The visit started off on the wrong foot with the front desk explaining that they had upgraded us and would have to wait until the room is ready. As a Diamond Hilton Honors member, I was pleasantly surprised, but skeptical since we had booked a Vista King suite for my wife, son, and me. Unfortunately the almost 90 minute wait (past 4pm) was the first of a handful of disappointments. I have high floor and away from the elevator in my profile, but we were only on the fifth floor, close to the elevator. Hardly worth the wait.The suite is narrow, with a modest sitting area with a pullout couch separated from the bedroom. The couch and the small sitting room were comfortable and the Chromcast service worked well, so we could stream video from my iPad to the 55" screen. Unfortunately sitting sitting area doesn't get any air when the bedroom door is closed, so it was not comfortable for sleeping. For a room for this price, I was surprised to see how sloppy the details were. Paint was slopped on one wall, with a good bit on the switches. The sliding glass door looked nice to the bathroom, but hardly kept the sound in the bathroom. Ventilation conducted sound from the neighboring room into ours, so we heard our neighbors from time-to-time. The faucets in the bathroom were unusually loud. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. The offerings were broad. My son thought that the scrambled eggs were surprisingly good for a buffet offering. Although the staff was attentive, sending texts to see how our visit was going, I stopped responding because the problems we were having were not going to be fixable by the staff.The rooftop bar is very nice. Great views of the city, but very busy at night. And drinks are very expensive. It's quite a scene.For a couple, this is probably a much better hotel. Unfortunately for me and my family it was an expensive and less-than-satisfying experience. I cannot recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to use the pullout couch in a suite as a second bed. It's not as comfortable as it should be.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago London Hotel
text: Everything about this hotel was terrible.  Service, price and restaurants not to mention the $71 for valet parking.  Breakfast ends at 10am on Sunday so we had to go to the brunch which was overpriced and quality was terrible.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Few issues, but overall excellent hotel
text: The hotel is amazing in terms of location and style, if you like boutique feel with a lend of modern, chic, and elegant styles. It was very convenient to have the river immediately across the street, good eats all around (Corner Bakery literally right when you get off the elevators), and close to most attractions (shopping, museum, parks). However, I checked in online and was not only given a top floor on the river-side, but rather the bottom-most floor on the opposite right next to the elevator. They ALMOST made up for it with a larger suite, so I forgave them. The elevators were down, so it took 10-15 min at times to catch one (sometimes it would come with sardines in tow, no room to get on). Rooftop Bar staff were pretentious, not welcoming, and quite rude. Spent $120+ on a few drinks and tiny appetizers, but the view is indeed breathtaking. All in all, loved the detail to attention (loofah, motion detection lights for the restrooms for the nighttime breaks, and room light control). Would stay again, but will pray for the right floor, the elevators to work, and to go to the rooftop without having to deal with rude hostesses.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel
