text: This is a really cool hotel at a great location. There is not enough that can be said to describe the views of the river and convenience to local amenities. They did a great job renovating the old building. Great hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Vista rooms and location make the rooftop wait worth it
text: My husband and I stayed here over the 4th of July. It's an elegant property in a location that can't be beat: close to all the action, including the Magnificent Mile and many shops and restaurants. I loved the hotel's ambiance and historic decor. Pros: - Beautiful rooms, especially the King Vista Room. We stayed on the 5th floor and had a very large, comfortable room. Nice bed (just wish we had a bath tub). - The rooftop bar and upper-level restaurant really made our stay a "city" experience. Impressive offering of drinks, all very good, with views that can't be beat. I thought the service in the upper restaurant was very good. It's an experience like nothing else. -We ordered in-room breakfast and the bacon was some of the best I've ever had. Was not expecting it to be THAT good. Cons:  -We paid a lot for our room and were disappointed that it wasn't ready until about 5:30. Yes, we went to get some food and drink, but the 90-minute wait made us concerned something was wrong so we felt a bit "unsettled." That said, I did appreciate the real-time text messages from the managers on site re: status updates and being able to make restaurant reservations.-I echo what others have said about the VIP style service at the rooftop bar. I do get that it's one of the "hot" areas in town and that comes with "competitive" personalities. My husband and I were sitting at one of the tabletops and he got up to get us a drink. I was taking in the view when someone, not staying at the hotel, moved my purse from my husband's chair and just swooped it for one of his friends. Very rude, and not the kind of service one would expect at a hotel of this caliber. Overall, we would definitely stay here again. Next time I would suggest staying in a room higher up and wake up early to get a good spot at the rooftop bar :)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Active military use your Hilton discount! Best Hotel ever stayed at in Chicago and beyond!
text: I cant get enough of this hotel. Our views were amazing! Room 1135 corner suite, simply amazing. Literally using the bath room and my view was Michigan avenue.. hahaThe roof top was spectacular. The staff was friendly. The prices for room service and drinks were in line with higher end hotels. If you expect a $5 drink at a $200+ night, wrong thought process.  The valet, baggage guys lended me an umbrella for free for the day, of course he took our room number but it also saved us $$ and we just returned it at night no charge! Active military use your hilton benefit and truly enjoy over 30% off! Catlyn upgraded us with no problems! The ONLY thing we were pissed about was the VALET prices. That is ridiculous. $70 a night? no way. But most hotels in that area are $60+ so huge hint!****** Use Parkwhiz of spot hero app and pay less. We paid $30-$40 a day with a nearby service. Bathrooms were amazing. Huge showers! Cornerstone bakery at the bottom of the hotel which was a nice option. Go to the ROOFTOP bar! I wish the room had better coffee options. I am not an expresso fan. However high end, I would rather have a larger cup option. But i guess you can walk to cornerstone or starbucks within 1 min. Location location location! 1-5 min walk to Mag mile, boats on the river, the bean, and many more! They have google cromecast in the room, which was nice when huge thunderstorms came thru and we lost Satellite tv. Just connected to the WIFI. never seen this at a hotel. Be aware of the GPS mess up in chicago for Upper and lower wacker drive! Make sure you put Upper unless you want to drive all over chicago. Rooms were quiet!  What you need to realize in chicago no matter where you go! You will be awaken by the Chicago Fire trucks! Chicago is busy and you will hear them after 7am... Not a fault of the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: July friends & family
text: We met friends with their kids and me and my niece and great niece for Aladdin. We stayed sat night - valet was pricey 71.00 for 24 hours which may be standard for downtown Chicago but I travel a lot to me that was high But pay it! Worth it! The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful upon checking in. Checking out as well! Bell service held our bags after check out while we walked to Maggie Daley Park. Sat night we enjoyed walking to the Bean the hotel style is beautiful, rooms very quiet, beds so comfortable not always the case. The roof top bar has a great view - security does an amazing job making sure if you are staying at the hotel you get in. We enjoyed the bar on 21 floor even more! Our room on the 18 floor has an amazing view! Pics posted We would definitely stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Stayed here on a business trip and will definitely try to stay here each time I visit Chicago. It is right in the heart of downtown Chicago. LARGE rooms and spacious bathrooms with extra amenities. Gorgeous lobby with a big bar, and very friendly, helpful staff. I had left my iphone charger in the room and realized after I checked out. I called and housekeeping found and returned the cord to me. Definitely recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Underdelivery
text: Nice property. Poorly trained staff.  Room not ready even though I checked in online and got in at midnight. Got stuck in a room with a folding couch - which would have been okay for my 2nd bed but they failed to include bedding. Next to elevator - very noisy. Lost our luggage. Had to throw a fit for the bell staff to find it.  Room service didn't answer the phone.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Location, Friendly and Professional Staff!
text: My recent stay on the London House was lovely. Savanna checked us in (early which was greatly appreciated) and within minutes of us getting to our room texted us to make sure everything was OK. The hotel rooms are spacious, comfy beds, clean. The rooftop is convenient but you'll pay $15 or so for a drink. You can walk to Willis Tower, Millennium park, and so much more from this location. We had a room along with River and the views were amazing. If its in your budget I recommend getting a room with the view. If I ever visit again I will definitely be staying here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Never again
text: Although had prepaid fully for 6 nights stay,  on check in receptionist insisted on deposit of a further 600 dollars  against  incidental charges,  so another 100 dollars a night and upon checkout will take 4/5 days to reach your credit card account.           Wasn't  informed up front about this and restricts ones spending budget accordingly.                     The 21st floor rooftop bar is very busy at weekends with both residents and passers by equally putting  a strain on elevator availability, 2 out of service with a further 2 allocated for  the rooftop bar, meaning the last 2 had a waiting time  of 10 minutes for residents to get to their rooms.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel, great location, friendly professional staff
text: Came for business but had time to be a tourist.  Beautiful hotel, clean and comfortable rooms, very friendly and professional staff, rooftop restaurant with amazing views, walking distance to everything on Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier.  Great access to Riverwalk for a morning run or an evening stroll.  Would definitely recommend and this is my new go to hotel when I travel here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Book a Vista room
text: Lovely hotel with beautiful decor.   Our Vista room was very large, with floor to ceiling windows looking down the river. Walkable to many attractions, great service and a cafe on the main floor for breakfast and snacks. The rooftop bar is spectacular, but very hard to get a seat.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Nice Staycation
text: Stayed this past weekend at hotel. Check-in was smooth. Very nice staff and accommodating. Room was upgraded by staff! Nice view of city. Very busy rooftop but able to bypass line to get to the roof. Great night city views. Elevators took up to 5 minutes because of the busy rooftop bar, but other than that our stay was great! Would recommend for a business or couple stay. Not much for kids to do at hotel so would not recommend for small children.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Small rooms, but nice
text: This is a nice hotel with a great central location. Everything is new and the rooms are comfortable.  The concierge was very helpful -- she arranged for us to drop our bags off at another hotel (not even a Hilton) in a different neighborhood while we were sight seeing.The elevators were kind of irritating -- about half of them were out of order.  Also, the rooms are quite small, even for a hotel in that location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous Upscale Hotel in a  Great Location
text: We were in town for a couple of nights to see Hamilton.  After booking the LondonHouse on an excellent deal from a third party vendor, we were pleasantly surprised to still get a room with a great view of the river and the city!  All the details you'd expect are there from comfy bed to nice modern bathroom to coffee in the room.  We were able to walk not only to the theater but also to great restaurants and shopping.  The rooftop bar had a fabulous view but was crowded both on Saturday afternoon and later that night..  Other reviews mention problems with the elevator but our experience was that they were only really crowded when trying to go to the roof bar or to come back down from there.  Only one tiny thing missing for us--we were happy to have the refrigerator in our room for dinner leftovers but would have loved a microwave to heat them the next day!  We would definitely stay at LondonHouse again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Location and Value
text: Stayed here as a family for a weekend trip and we will definitely return. The hotel is beautifully designed and updated. The rooftop has some of the best views in the city and a great spot for pre-dinner cocktails. Our room had a great view of the river and was very clean. Can't wait to return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Most beautiful hotel in Chicago
text: I do not have enough words to describe my experience. Not only is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in, the customer service can't be beat. I have to shout out Paige and Abel who made sure my husband and I were personally taken care of the whole duration of my trip. We don't plan on staying anywhere else whenever we visit Chicago - we will be LondonHouse frequenters. The room and view were amazing, the food was delicious, and the entire experience just made our trip so relaxing and luxurious. One more reason why I love being a Hilton Honors member. Thanks again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellet Hotel
text: I only mention my Hilton Diamond level to add credibility to my review. I have spend many nights in many hotels around the world. My wife and I decided to spend Forth of July in Chicago. I booked the LondonHouse (paid, not points) based on location and what appeared to be very favorable reviews. We were not disappointed. This hotel is really nice and I would most certainly book again and I would most certainly recommend to friends and tripadvisor users. The hotel is centrally located. From the doormen, to the front desk to the room cleaning ladies...everyone seemed very nice. The downstairs lobby is beautiful. The check in area is very nice. We stayed in room 935 which was a corner room overlooking Wacker street. The rooms are fantastic. Not huge, but what would you expect in a downtown location ? Very clean, very modern. Great views. Very quite if you keep the windows fully closed. Open them up for some "city sounds" if you like. Bathroom was excellent. So...this hotel was 95 on my scale of 100. Which is an "A" even in accelerated classes !!!Here is what was lacking for the lost 5 points.....Keep in mind....Very few make 100....The rooftop.....This is proudly advertised on the website and many people speak about it.....So some might book this hotel with this amenity in mind. But please know that EVERYONE in Chicago is able to use this amenity. And EVERYONE in Chicago can have the fun of pressing against everyone to try and get a small glimpse of the view. Its really not worth the effort as you will get into a argument with someone who is saving a 2 foot space for their friend who is "in line downstairs" to come up. I will say the bartenders are very efficient and nice. The hostesses....not so much...they act like they are in Vegas at a top night club...and with very faint smiles....tell you.."find a spot yourself". There appears to be a process to "reserve" a table ?? But apparently staying at the hotel...or being a diamond level member....gets you the same privileges as everyone else in Chicago. My only recommendation to management is that on busy nights you cordon off the far section (right of bar if facing) for guests of the hotel. My wife and I did not enjoy being told off by some stranger that "that spot" (standing area) was being saved"....considering we only wanted to see the view for 3 minutes. Anyway, its what would have given you the extra 5 points.  Other than that, I will stay here again....100%.....

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel and great location
text: The London House Hotel is the epitome of a luxury stay in Chicago at some not so luxury prices. The location is wonderful and the staff are amazing! See Curt at the Bridges Bar- he's fantastic! Also, Shannon the Head Concierge -go talk to her! She will take care of you! She scored a reservation for me at a restaurant I was unable to on my own!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Rooms but Untrained Staff
text: Tried to check in at 4 PM and room was not available.  Digital key did not work.. Automated system assigned room but wasn't ready or accessible.  Staff was overwhelmed at front desk and were not customer centric.  Rooms were gorgeous.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overnight sightseeing
text: This hotel is very nice and feels high class. Has really cool view of the Chicago River. Has a cool rooftop bar and restaurant and a breakfast buffet. Its all pricey of course but that's to be expected stating at this kind of a place and in the excellent location. The elevators are crazy. They are touch screen. It takes forever and stops and picks up a bunch of floors so the elevator is very crowded. The only other problem was the people in the next room were loud and you could here them really good through the walls . we were on the 20th floor and could here noise from the street too. Overall, it is an awesome hotel in a building from 1922, just a few small problems.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: True Gem
text: I really loved everything about this hotel. The location is convenient to the Loop and the Magnificent Mile.  The hotel is housed in a beautiful historic building with good sized, modern rooms that provide great views.  There is an amazing roof top bar.  And every time I walked into or out of the building I was greeted by the friendly, attentive staff who seemed to take pride in their hotel and the level of service they wanted to provide.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location - great view
text: This was a great downtown Chicago property.  The location was excellent and the rooftop was amazing!  We visited on July 4 and it was a great place to do dinner and not get caught up in the large crowds, but still able to see fireworks and return to the room before crowds dispersed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The only hotel you need to know in Chicago
text: Since I've discovered the Londonhouse, I won't stay anywhere else. I'm a Hilton guy, but even if this wasn't a Hilton, I'd forego my points to stay here. I'm in Chicago a few times a year for work and - wow - this is my new favorite. The location is great as you can walk to most any of the hot spots on Michigan Avenue. The rooms are spotless and very modern and the staff is wonderful and very accommodating. There is a nice fitness center on the 4th floor that can be fairly crowded in the mornings, but I've never had to wait for a treadmill. The rooftop bar is awesome and, if it's too cold for that, the lobby bar is a great place for a nightcap. There is a "Corner Bakery" on the bottom floor which is my regular breakfast stop and a reasonable place to buy a good, hot breakfast sandwich and a cup of coffee.My best advice is stop reading reviews and book it now!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location for everything
text: We just returned from a wonderful visit to Chicago.  The London House is centrally located on the river so that you can walk, bike, or Uber to everywhere you need to go.  There are fantastic restaurants, surrounding the downtown area, that are within walking distance.  Millennium Park is just around the corner, where you can rent bikes and ride along the lakefront to museums and Soldier Field.  Within the hotel, we had a corner king room with a large window in the bathroom that overlooked the river (see picture below).  Since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, that view was perfect (it also was not blocked by Trump tower).  The only negative is the rooftop bar, which is a popular hangout for locals and very hard to enjoy.  The staff at the inside bar was friendly and attentive.  Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome location, great views
text: This is second trip to Chicago, we stayed for 1 night only in LondonHouse. LondonHouse location is brilliant, the view is stunning and service is very good. We really liked the big windows looking down on Chicago River and Michigan Ave, the spacious upgraded room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Can't get enough! I will be back!
text: When I made my reservation, my specific request was I want to wake up on my birthday with the view of the Chicago River. That was my wish and London House staff grant me that wish! The concierge staff actually greet me when we checked in, that was really sweet I thought for them to take note of this. I am very impressed with all the staff we encountered, from the valet, security, concierge, lobby - they were friendly, helpful, attentive,cheerful and professional. The room with spectacular view was clean, modern, spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was updated, decent size, large vanity, marble tile, glass shower. It was hard to leave our room because of that killer view of the city, the river and the drawbridges. We spent the eve of my birthday with drinks and appetizers at The London House Rooftop which has the magnificent view of some of Chicago's iconic architectural buildings. Look so magical at night too! It was a little challenging though getting to the rooftop from my hotel floor as there was  only one working elevator to get to the 21st floor even for us who are booked at the hotel. I wish outside patrons will have another access separate from us who are guests of the hotel. But overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in the center- this is the center. Coming from the burbs and only 40 miles away, we will definitely come back and and spend another weekend getaway at London House!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: This is a winner
text: By far my favorite property in Chicago.  I have stayed here for over a week at this point.  This is part of the CURIO collection by Hilton.  From the elevators, to the lobby (on the 2nd floor), including the bar and the rooftop restaurant, this property is a winner.The rooms are incredibly modern, cozy, and a great attention to detail has been given about each light or gadget.  The Chromecast option on the televions (that CURIO seems to be doing at most of their properties) is a big failure. You have to download an app that has about 1 star rating on the APPLE APP store and it does not work.  I ended up spending two 45-min slots with their tech people who couldn't get it to work either.  So each time I see this option, I just ignore it.The main downside to this property, and I did text this to them when they sent me a text asking about my stay, is the coffee.  It is not as bad as a cup of folgers, but it's bad enough that when you use a single serving of a half/half, the coffee turns into a light colored white tea.  It truly is not good quality by any means.  Thankfully, the rooms have a Nespresso maker with three cups each day, so that saves the day for me.  Great touch and a very nice amenity.  The bathrooms are big and the soaps/shampoos/towels are all of high quality.The breakfast for HHonors Gold/Diamond is quite simple, including fresh berries, fruits, croissants, and yoghurt.  The views are stunning - see my images posted.  Some are from my room and some from the rooftop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel & location
text: Neatly rehabbed 1920's hotel. Very boutique in feel, with a Corner Bakery downstairs (convenient). The elevator system could use improvement, it's pretty slow to get up and down. The rooftop bar is great, but it gets crowded from non-hotel guests on nights and weekends. Would return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pretty Property
text: I recently visited the LondonHouse for a wedding weekend. Overall it's a beautiful property and we enjoyed our stay. I'll start with the highlights of my stay. This was my first time using the digital key feature on the Hilton app. It was super easy and efficient. I didn't have to visit the front desk to check in. I was able to go directly to my room. The views from the meeting rooms are spectacular, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It should be noted that the elevator system, while highly technical and "smart", it was extremely slow. I'm not sure if some of them were out of order, which I don't think was the case because I rode most all of them. But they were soooo slow and on top of them being slow we had to share them with the outsiders who were visiting the rooftop bar, and there were lots of outsiders. Also, housekeeping didn't come to clean my room until 5pm the first day of my stay, but they came 15 minutes before my checkout when it was time to leave, which was a bit annoying. If you're in a hurry on business travel, this hotel might not be for you, but if you have all the time in the world I recommend checking it out because it's very swanky. I also spent some time in the presidential suite while getting ready for the wedding and it's gorgeous and spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel is Hitting on All Cylinders
text: My 4th or 5th stay here, stayed two nights on Honors Points Special (57,000 points, which turned out to be a steal) on July 4th weekend, when hotel was sold out and hopping. Management has hotel team stocked with polite and engaging staff that seem to be genuine in their interactions with you. Breakfast has been substantially upgraded from the subpar offering after it was moved to the 21st floor from the great offerings in original location in the lobby. Although all staff was great, one in particular, Mike in Guest Services stood out to me and was great in my interactions with him. Such great overall experience, that I wanted to post this while still fresh. Hard to believe the hotel is an year already, beautiful place in a killer location, highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago
text: Staff was outstanding, accomendations great and location in downtown perfect. Really enjoyed the breakfast selections as well as the roof top bar in the afternoon and evening. We had a corner room with views of the river and Lake Michigan.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: stay at LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
text: Excellent hotel. I enjoyed my time there, Staff is very friendly and help full. Location is good Every thing accessable. I would definatley recommand this hotel for business trip.Roof top, Gym and SPA is very good. Great revier view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: There are better venues for a special Chicago night away
text: Occasionally you get to leave the kids for a night and enjoy an evening away as a couple. If like us you don't do it that often, you want it to be somewhere special. We tried the London House because it is new and in a great location. It was a wonderful night away but we left the London House disappointed with consistently poor execution. Our booking for the roof top bar, which we confirmed at check in, could not be fulfilled. There were no tables available and they didn't seem to know what to do so we went to the Trump Tower bar across the river and that was outstanding. There was no chance of a coffee refill at breakfast and my wife's tea had a fly in it. The heavy glass bathroom door in our suite was impossible to keep closed; it's heavy weight would always slide it open. There are times you do want some privacy even from your spouse! Nothing to ruin our night away, but not what you expect from a top hotel. The elevator experience was surreal and a great way to bond with other guests. There are eight elevators but they are computer controlled and the computer seems to be programmed to make you all wait and cram into only one car!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel
text: We stayed for 5 nights in June and upgraded to a room with a view. Possibly one of the best hotels Ive stayed in. Amazing views of the drawbridges and Chicago skyline especially at night.Pros- Great central location to everything in Chicago- Modern room- Roof top restaurant/bar has spectacular views- CleanCons- noneWould definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience
text: Wonderful hotel and front desk staff. The restaurant staff were clearly hired for looks, not knowledge and service skills. We would definitely stay there again. The only other downside is that the wonderful he was somewhat turn in for the huge Trump sign right on the other side of the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice but bling bling hotel
text: Very well located hotel around river walk in front of Trump hotel Good services but visited by very bling bling people Nevertheless outstanding roof top with skyline view as view down on Trump terrace and Wyndham penthouse !Outstanding view on river d√©filee crosses by all successive bridges

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and Concierge !
text: You can't get a better location in downtown Chicago than this hotel! The views of the river and Lake Michigan are tremendous . Hats off to concierge Shannon B. for the great recommendations and help during our visit !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: roof top hip
text: the reason we booked this place was for its roof top bar. it was a great bar when you could get a seat, unfortunately every body in Chicago has the same idea when the sun comes out, so you have to get there early as they dont take reservations, even for guests of the hotel. we had a nice room overlooking the Chicago river and the Trump hotel which brought out a weekly protest. the location is terrific, as it is close to great restaurants and bars like the house of blues etc, all within walking distance. I do recommend the house of blues on a Sunday morning for bloody mary's  and a spiritual gospel sing along (Hallelujah). the negative with this hotel was the tipping expectations at the roof top bar, it seems 20% is not really good enough for them if you want standard service, but I have noticed that that is just the US these days.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel and Service
text: I stay at the LondonHouse for business and the rooms are very nice and the staff is fantastic! I highly recommend it. The location is excellent as well. Most of the rooms have a great view. I have not utilized the dining or roof top bar, but I know they are very popular.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel!
text: Friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever encountered.  The location was ideal.  The facility was extremely clean and well maintained.  I would highly recommend this site to anyone visiting Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Gem
text: I stayed at the London House on a business trip in May and I was surprised on how nice the hotel was. I come to Chicago frequently for work and this time decided to try out this new hotel that was recommended by my colleagues.The room was new, modern, clean and spacious. The best part of this hotel is its rooftop bar which provides you with a beautify view of the city. I wish the hotel would give their guests priority access and reservation to this rooftop bar as opposed to the first come first serve basis like anyone one who doesn't stay here.Location wise, it's in the loop with plenty of dining options. It's located right next to the Corner Bakery so you could grab breakfast and lunch there if you like. Nice fitness area but you could take a run along the lake on a nice day as well, just across the street. Please note, the entrance to the lobby is on the second floor.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best location and the hotel is nice and comfortable, but...
text: Nice building, the best location, beautiful terrace, comfortable room with better than average amenities, and great views from the room. BUT, the staff has a big problem. They have an attitude problem, mostly the people serving at the terrace. I thought I had to serve them, and that I was making them a favor. Not the best staff for such a hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful motel
text: We were in town for a college visit as well as visiting downtown & museums.  We were centrally located and could walk many places.  We enjoyed the view from the 20th floor and the roof; over looking the river.  The room was kept clean all four days.  The gentlemen at the valet were most helpful.  I also appreciated the hotel security with limited access to different floors and use of iPhone for room key.  The bedding was glorious!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Elevators are inadequate
text: Hotel is lovely and well located but elevators are inadequate for amount of guests and outsiders looking to go to roof top bar.  Something needs to be done to make existing elevators more efficient.  Staff of hotel was efficient and rooms quite modern and on minimalist side so the rooms seem quite spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Summer vacation
text: Very nice hotel - clean - upscale with friendly staff around every corner.  Our kids loved the touch screen elevator "buttons". Housekeeping kept our room perfect the whole stay (had 2 messy boys with us). Also, the breakfast buffet in the morning was amazing.  The hotel is across the street from a Chicago water taxi stop, so that was convenient. 15 min walk to the Cadillac Theatre and 30 min walk to Navy Pier from hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Such a great hotel experience in the heart of it all!
text: When I checked in at 2am, the front desk personnel was not so friendly, but other than that, the rest of the experience was 5 star!! The housekeeping was absolutely stellar! Not only keeping the room spotless, but I especially want to point out how super friendly they were in daily interactions in the hallway. Those little details mean so much. The room was perfect. Great size, super comfy bed, TV with all the channels, a small desk area to work, a good wash room with all the extras. Lastly, there is the rooftop. Just magical. The staff was all wonderful, especially the bartenders. With all the hustle and bustle that goes on, they maintain a top notch attitude and friendliness that is hard to find. Overall, a really wonderful stay and I would definitely stay again and recommend to all.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel with roof terrace bar in Central Chicago
text: I reserved to room at short notice at a price cheaper than the previous night Holiday Inn at Rockford. The check in lady was so helpful and we were given a room with a canal and lake view. The views from the roof terrace were wonderful and the staff just great. We were on our 40th wedding celebration trip to the USA and this particular hotel was one of our highlights. We would love to return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous!
text: We spent one night here but wish it could have been longer. Our king room with a view of the river was superb. Super comfortable bed, excellent shower & a Nespresso machine to top it off. Drinks in the lobby were pricey but the view is great & the bartender was hilarious. Would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel, great location
text: The biggest difficulty we had was locating the hotel in our rental car, using Mapquest. Once there, the service was delightful and we happily left our car parked with the valet and didn't think about it again until we left.  The rooms have been nicely renovated.  Everything about our stay was great---the rooms, the staff and, particularly, the location.  We could walk to everything we wanted to do---theater, Navy Pier, restaurants.  Worth the extra cost.  I would definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hot, New, Fab Spot in the Heart of the Best of Chicago!
text: This is our fifth stay at the magnificent LondonHouse Hotel, part of the Curio Collection from Hilton Corporation. From the moment you arrive until AFTER your departure, the incredible staff of Chicago's newest and most spectacular, uber-chic hotel attends to your every whim and desire, ensuring a luxurious, second home, experience. My partner and I have stayed at each Hilton property in the loop, downtown, and Gold Coast sections of this all-American city. We recommend the LondonHouse Chicago without hesitation to step-up your next stay in the Windy City. The decor is modern, warm, sophisticated, and inviting. Each of our five stays here have afforded us spacious, contemporary suites offering unparalleled views of the Chicago river and the city's landmark architecture. The restaurant and rooftop terrace and bar are already well-known destinations for locals and visitors alike. The vibe is alluringly trendy, yet with the signature friendliness that this city, and indeed this hotel are both deservedly known for. I've saved the best for last. The staff at the LondonHouse Chicago are true professionals, welcoming each guest as if they were old friends. The unobtrusive contact that guests have with staff throughout their stay is indicative of the latter's flagship-property training, always seeking ways to exceed expectations, even those of well-heeled, seasoned travelers, and veterans of the Hilton brand. We're proud to designate this property our new favorite for our regular monthly visits to the city. We can honestly say that with every departure, we cannot wait to return again, to our Chicago home, the LondonHouse. Cheers, and happy travels!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary Staycation
text: We really loved our stay at the LondonHouse for our anniversary. We were pleasantly surprised by the room upgrade and complimentary drinks. Staff was top notch and checked on us throughout our stay, something we really appreciated. We would definitely come back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome room and great staff!!
text: LondonHouse was so great and nice! From the moment we arrived it was so easy going. The staff was helpful and kind. Hotel had really clean rooms and was in a perfect location! Will definitely be back soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hilton service
text: Stayed for 5 nights for a conference.   Location is great, room was clean and the place was very comfortable.  Great breakfast restaurant on 1st floor and I did enjoy the fitness center - clean and spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location to experience the best of Chicago.
text: I stayed here while attending a conference at McCormick Center and could not have picked a better location.  LondonHouse is right across the river from Trump tower and has easy access to the river walk for morning runs along the water!  The hotel is new and modern- service was excellent- and if you stay in the hotel you don't have to wait in a long line to go to the rooftop bar.  The rooftop bar has an amazing view of the city at twilight.  We had a group dinner one night in a private room with a "mini" rooftop patio that was fantastic- food, presentation and service was excellent.  The rooms are well-appointed-  and have everything you need for a business trip (work station, iron/ironing board, comfy bed, sitting area and bathroom with higher end toiletries).  The rooftop bar does get crowded on the weekends- but the bar on the registration level is lovely as well.  From the londonhouse you also have easy access to Michigan Ave shopping and lots of great restaurants within walking distance.  My next trip to Chicago- I will stay here again!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: poor service at London House, Chicago
text: very poor service.  slow check in, not enough staff.  not enough staff during the day.  repair problems in bathroom promised to be repaired but not done.  complementary internet not working, staff did not care.  room coffee maker hard to work.  Do not recommend this hotel at all.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Just average
text: Company booked us into this hotel - - check-in was tedious.  If they know ahead of time a large amount of people will be checking in, they need to be more organized.  The luggage check guy was clearly stressed and the help he asked for didn't help him at all.  This is a newly renovated hotel and a huge detail in acoustics was missed.  Able to hear outdoor street traffic even from a high floor.  No microwave and no coffee maker. And no pool. Pros: just across the river on Michigan Ave so was easy to get over to shop; Corner Bakery accessible; beds comfy.  Highly unlikely I'd pick this location to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: They lost my breast milk :(
text: The bed was very comfortable and the decorations in the room were beautiful. But, the main issue that I had was that the fridge/freezer in the room was broken. The temperature fluctuated between 45F-52F. Normal fridge temperature is 30-40F. Generally, this would be ok but I have a 7mo old and was pumping breast milk. I was assured when I booked the hotel that there was a fridge/freezer combo in each room. When I noticed that the fridge was not cold enough, I called maintenance and had to leave before they arrived. I called again when I returned to my room as my fridge was still warm. Maintenance reassured me that the fridge was not broken. But they took my stash of breast milk and ice packs and stored them in their general fridge and freezer respectively. They also provided a new fridge which was kept at 40-43F. A few days later, when I checked out, they had lost all the breast milk I had asked them to store! I called an hour before I checked out to have them return the milk from their fridge. They returned the ice packs but did not find the milk I had stored with them. I walked to the front desk and they still were unable to find it. I waited a bit longer but I had to leave to catch my flight. Overall I thought the London House was a reasonable place to stay. However I depended on that supply of breast milk for my 7 month old baby and it's unbelievable to me that they would lose it like they did.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Service and Attention to Detail Lacking
text: Stayed for a very special birthday weekend.  Hilton fell short.  There were notes in the computer about the birthday weekend and at check-in no one bothered to read.  There were 2 adults and only 1 bathrobe, 3 towels... could have asked for more... but why?  Pending charge for incidentals was $100 per day.. pending charge of 4X that amount was placed on my card.  No explanation at front desk.  There are lots of hotels in Chicago to choose from... I wouldn't recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great stay in Chicago Londonhouse
text: Great location with beautiful rooms and a very friendly and accomodating staff. Great breakfast are on 21st floor and rooftop bar for lunch or a drink concierge very helpful in finding a perfect dinner location for the two of us Very nice visit to Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Favorite Hotel
text: This hotel has it all: location, pleasant & helpful staff, clean room and great food from room service. I highly recommend the Steak & Eggs & truffle fries. Also having a "Corner Bakery" on the 1st floor was Awesome.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Superstar
text: The LondonHouse is by far the best hotel in Chicago!  No detail was left out with the beautiful, modern design - from the lobby furniture, lighting fixtures, wallpaper, elevator convenience, it's all done with exquisite taste. Checking in, we were offering champagne as we waited to check in. Great touch. Our room was fantastic with every amenity one would need for a fabulous stay in Chicago. The bed was heaven. The rooftop bar as well as the bar inside were awesome.  Every staff member we encountered was friendly, respectful and welcoming. The bar food (truffle fries, raw oysters) were excellent. The location is perfect and convenient to all the great spots in the city. One of the best hotel stays ever and we'll definitely be back. Hats off to the LondonHouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Birthday weekend
text: I almost didn't want to go home . Modern , friendly , clean and  comfortable  plus that delicious breakfast bacon .... Tripple AMAZING hotel with all the good stuff from the Stunning rooftop bar to the modern shower and right in the best area of chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Stay
text: My husband and I visited for his birthday and we really enjoyed our stay. Check-in was a bit slow as there was a line. We would've checked in via our cell phones (awesome option) but both were dead. The location was perfect, the room was beautiful and clean, and we really liked that there was a rooftop bar available at the location and that hotel guests got to skip the long lines. Unfortunately, we ran out of time as we already had so much planned. We will certainly be visiting again soon and won't miss our next opportunity.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful location
text: This was our first time staying at LondonHouse, and it will not be our last.  The room was spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated.  The bathroom was very large and felt new.  Both our bathroom and our bedroom offered beautiful views of the river and Lake Michigan.  The service was great, and we loved the breakfast.  As an added bonus, the hotel is very centrally located.  We walked Michigan Avenue, to John Hancock, etc,.  I highly recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best location, service and room!
text: You can't get any better location than The London House - close to everything in Chicago for sure.  The staff and service were exceedingly great and the room had a great bed, scrumptious sheets and linens and stellar views.  Love love love!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Stay in Downtown Chicago!
text: Absolutely loved staying in the Londonhouse! Digital Key is the best thing in the world being able to walk into the hotel and go straight to our room, even before check in, was priceless! We never even visited the hotel lobby and front desk because we used our digital key. The room was super comfy, clean and the views were great. I love the set up with the bed and tv, It made for a great lazy night in Chicago! The hotel also has a concierge car that can take you up to 2 miles away ( navy pier) which is great because it is no cost ( gave a nice tip) and its a fancy Mercedes. We were having issues with the uber getting to us so we were very surprised to find out about this amenity!  Cannot recommend this hotel enough! We will 100% be back at this amazing Chicago hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Birthday Weekend StayüòÅ
text: Born and raised in Chicago the view down the Chicago River is always the best. Had a get together at the roof top bar and the view is amazing!! Good drinks, seating is tables and lounge couches. Full bar outside.  The lobby bar has the same view of the river just lower floor.  Best location on river between the Loop and River North makes everything so accessible. Pricing could have been better but major convention at McCormick raises the rates. Every visit home this is the pick. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds super comfy. Great service. Check it out and all Chicago has to offer!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Beautifully New
text: This is in a great location. On the river and Michigan avenue. Most of the prominent river boat tours jet of from the corners of Michigan Ave and the river. Across the river from the hotel is a large Walgreens, and the steps down to a great boat tour. The hotel is also only a few blocks to millennium/grant park. There is an excellent breakfast on the 21st floor each morning- complimentary for diamond and gold members. No views from the 21st floor restaurant but good service, good coffee, amazing bacon and relaxing business/hotel guest environment. One floor up is the wonderful outdoor top floor. I stayed in a corner king suite (diamond upgrade from basic room). It's was new and beautiful with amazing views. Room 1735. Large shower, refrigerator, closet with hangers and so on. Room is smaller for a "corner king" but for one person and even two it is plenty. It's nothing like a downtown Boston or New York sized room. The 400+ sq feet is plenty and the beauty of the room and hotel is the best I've seen yet as a Diamond member. The beauty of the room is matched to a room in the Wit but the hotel is nicer and, believe it or not, less snotty. I think I gathered this feeling due to the front desk of the LondonHouse being on the 2nd floor. Thus, one never has to walk by them or the little bar or other patrons much. A large bank of elevators quickly brings one to their room. I've only stayed at the Wit otherwise in DT Chicago but I would recommend the LondonHouse over any other Hilton in the location at this time. The Conrad or Waldorf Astoria may trump them but I have yet to stay at those places.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Look no further, stay here.
text: Absolutely one of the best hotels I've stated in. Excellent service, perfect location for walking, amazing views, fun rooftop bar. The room was spacious, modern, and clean. There's so much to do within walking distance. the river boat tour is just across the street, the hotel even offers a discount. It was my first time in Chicago and the stay at Londonhouse made it that much better, truly a great experience. Would 100% recommend it. Ps. One tip...Try to get a higher floor as people in Chicago love to honk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel!
text: I love this hotel! Amazing location, amazing rooftop patio. The rooms are amazing, customer service is also really good. The front desk (Hasaan?) was super personable! This was my second visit in chicago and I'm definitely coming back to this hotel on my next visit :)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good location, but overpriced
text: I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend and found this hotel forgettable.  The modern decor was very boutique-y and all but the service was barely Holiday Inn level.  The rooftop area was especially disappointing as there is no seating even for hotel guests and you are totally ignored the entire time as you wait for a spot to finally open up.  Not sure we were treated any differently than non-guests.  If anything, we might have been treated worse. Lastly, unless you are dying for a straight-on view of Trump Tower, there is no need to get a view room.On the positive side, the rooms were at least spacious and the location is great for any visitor to Chicago as it is central and within walking distance to the Theatre District, Michigan Avenue/Streeterville/Navy Pier area, or River North/Millennium Park/Grant Park area.  If you just need a place to rest your head and to be your homebase and can afford the price tag, then go for it.  Otherwise, save your money and indulge in a nice meal instead.The wifi also did not work.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Front desk staff are very courteous and friendly and even send you a text to make sure room is to your liking.  Very helpful on suggestions for local restaurants. Definitely will stay again on next visit to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great choice.  Great location.
text: I manage events in Chicago so I'm always trying new hotels as prospective locations.  I finally had a chance to stay at the LondonHouse.  Beautiful d√©cor, comfortable yet modern, great location, friendly and helpful staff.  The rooms are nicely done and the one I had was a very good size - especially for this area and price point.  My only suggestion is to housekeeping - they need to pay attention to cobwebs and dust.  With the extra high ceilings, I understand it's not easy to reach, but my room had 2 or 3 noticeable (not inhabited) cobwebs and there was dust on the back side (behind the trinkets, but noticeable from the front) of the display shelves that were in the entrance area of my room. The bathroom could also use more than 1 (hidden behind the towels) power outlet. Granted I travel a lot and I'm picky.  I would definitely stay here again.  I had a tour of the rooftop bar, which was trendy but not club like with pounding base music, but didn't get a chance to partake on this trip (maybe next time).  Overall recommended.  Just need to get housekeeping on top of the cleaning details or the hotel could get aged really quickly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Place
text: Very nice place with great location. Easy access to shopping, river tours, navy pier, restaurants etc. Would have been nice to be able to access rooftop dining being a guest of the hotel, but they were always too busy and full.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Location with a Superb view of the Canal
text: This modern hotel is very well located in the heart of Chicago. Magnificent Mile, which is Chicago's shopping district is at a walking distance. The canal ride, restaurants and all the major attractions  are all nearby. The rooms are very well designed and spacious and equipped with Nespresso  coffee machine. The staff at the reception were very helpful during checkin and checkout. There is a coffee shop on the ground floor which offers good breakfast  ( not managed by the hotel) and the rooftop bar on the 21st floor is excellent! Its great to be there to see the sunset.  The breakfast spread on the 21st floor  was excellent! especially Avocado Toast!  I would definitely stay here on my next trip to Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: All around great experience!  The hotel and room were beautiful.  The room's river view and rooftop bar view were exceptional.  We loved the convenience of the location since we only had 2 days to explore Chicago.  Clean rooms and the staff were wonderful!  Can't wait to go back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, exceptional rooftop bar!
text: This hotel has a prime location just off the mag mile.  Spectacular view of the Chicago river especially from the rooftop bar.  Staff and service were top notch.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable.  I'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A bit disappointing
text: Great location. Very nice Rooftop bar with good offer. Service is slow- Took too much for everything. Valet took 20 minutes. Laundry took 30 minutes and two calls. Concierge took over 30 minutes and 2 calls. I left the room from 11 to 3 pm. When I came back to have some rest, room was not cleaned.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great couple days downtown.
text: The city had it's pretty face on I must say. 2 days of sun and 70 degrees. Wind? it's always windy downtown. This Hotel is perfectly located for site seeing. You are at the corner of Michigan Avenue and Wacker drive. Magnificent mile to the north, millennium Park and the Museums to the south. The river well it's just across the street. The river walk is open and just across the street. So lets see, the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. The roof top bar was beautiful but pricey but so is everywhere up in the air down here.The room were very clean and the bed was great. The shower was clean and worked as it should. Not a lot of cable channels but what are you doing in your room? get out and walk. Navy Pier is a mile to the east. Food, drinks and sightseeing right at your fingertips, Hilton nailed this location. All in all a great couple days. If you want to experience downtown Chicago at a Boutique Hotel I would definitely Recommend the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Place
text: Really quality hotel. Beautifully done, overlooks the river, friendly staff service. Rooms are well decorated and clean. Fantastic lobby bar with live music. Good location for theater, restaurants, parks, Michigan Ave. shopping, etc.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel!
text: I took some colleagues to their first Cubs game and stayed here for the first time. I'd highly recommend staying here, there is a lot of "wow" factor inside and out of the property.  21st floor bar has awesome views and fantastic cocktails, had a great time.  I will definitely go back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, location, location & amazing service, service, service
text: LondonHouse hits it out of the ballpark in service, location, the food and cocktails yes all in the same place!   The staff is professional and really on top of everything.  They're empowered to make sure everything is perfect; they came through!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Many ways excellent
text: You can't beat the location. Right in the city's very center, by the river and basically at N Michigan av.Traffic makes some noise by honks, and ambulance and police sirens were regular city sounds as well. Sound proofing still alright but could not take those away, this is Chicago after all.The hotel is in old, prestigious and beautiful building which is in great condition and actually hosts modern tech inside.Lifts were smart. You just enter on touch screen your desired floor and you are guided promptly to the right and fastest lift. Worked very well and I assume wait time for a lift was significantly shorter because of this technology.I had Hilton app on my phone which allowed me to check in with it and actually even could use the app as my room key.I did not visit reception at all when arriving but just walked straight into my room. Excellent! At least for me who likes this simplicity and not queuing.All traditional reception services were though available.Several staff members at entrance ready to serve. All very good here.Room was very nice. Not average nor bland, but personal and stylish. Great bed. Views amazing at the river, bridges and Chicago's most prominent buildings like Chicago Tribune.Breakfast was served on 21st floor. No windows there but nice environment. Breakfast was good if not amazing, but good value at $19.Little maintenance issues as the shower's glass door did not close properly. I also could not use the safety box because its battery was low, it wouldn't close. I mentioned about the latter issue at the reception. After three days it hadn't been fixed. On last day I requested for late check out, extending it for two hours. I understand it cannot be done if the hotel is full. However if not, it normally has been provided complimentary as a good service almost any time I've needed it. Not this time though. One hour would have been offered complimentary but the second hour for $75. As a Hilton Honors member I expected more, though obviously understand that I cannot demand it. Still, obviously there was no next guest coming.That left a bit sour taste for an otherwise excellent stay. Still, recommend this hotel. It is very good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overall Great Hotel
text: The London House is convenient with a great location and beautiful views of the river. The room are new, clean, comfortable and modern. I can't find anything wrong with this hotel. We walked everywhere so location is within a maybe 15-20 min walk to all attractions. We heard the roof top bar is happening, but sadly we didn't have a chance to make it up there. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice room nicest View
text: I stayed for one night at the London house with a friend and it was a very lovely sort of Boutique Hotel. I think my favorite part about the London house was the excellent Riverview. As if it couldn't get any better from our room, we went up for drinks at the rooftop which was absolutely stellar. The staff was nice enough and kept themselves so it made it a nice low-key environment period I would definitely recommend going to this hotel if you like to keep a low profile and enjoy your privacy

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Downtown Delightful SUPER convenient!
text: It's a little disconcerting entering on the ground floor... doorman had stepped away the lobby is on the second floor and signage is not good... after that NO complaints.  My 7th floor room was well appointed with all of the latest amenities and a stellar view of the river.  The lobby restaurant (breakfast) was terrific with great service and food quality and the roof top bar was excellent for sunset scenic after work gatherings (the view was excellent) the service there was horrible (seated at a table never had a server despite multiple promises by other staff that someone would be right over...) We eventually ordered drinks at the bar,

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Housekeeping?????????
text: This is a Good location downtown but lacking the basics of guest service. Folks were great at the curb, the front desk and the restaurant.  What is lacking is over site of housekeeping and general empathy for the guest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A hotel for millennials
text: Vista Suite.  A second tier hotel for millennials.  Small sitting room with a couch and no chair, small closet, few drawers and some under bed that are difficult to use, large tv's in each room with Chromecast, no tub and large shower, frosted door to bathroom, nespresso but only three pods provided, and all of the expected millennial energy saving accurements.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best views in the city
text: London House is a great place to treat yourself to on a fun Chicago weekend. Everything about this hotel is great from the location to the views from the rooftop bar and the rooms that face the river. This place is nice and new which lends itself to great features like the digital key on the Hilton app that make check in so easy.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My favorite place I have stayed in Chicago
text: I stayed here for three nights.  It has been my favorite hotel in Chicago so far.Pros:-The view is great!  I was able to get a view of the river-Room was very modern.  Felt very updated and upscale-Room was clean-Great technology (Google Chromecast, bluetooth alarm clock, etc)-Good value.  Was less expensive than many other hotels-Location was great.  We were able to walk to most placesCons:-Shower door was installed in a way that the bathroom floor ended up wet most mornings.  I think the door should have opened the other way or the shower head should have been on the other side.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel. Nice location
text: Location, Location, Location! Hotel was beautiful, clean and spacious. Beds were a little firm but not so much that I couldn't sleep. Would like to have tea or hot chocolate in the room. They had coffee and creamers but no tea. I'm sure if I called the front desk and asked they would have gladly brought me some. The lady that checked me in was nice enough but the guy next to me got the royal treatment. He was told about all the amenities and where things were. I got the basic info and sent on my way. The guy that checked in the person next to me was pleasant and efficient. The lady that checked me in asked me how my day was and when I told her my flight got canceled followed by a quick 10 second rundown of my day she acted like she didn't ask me to really hear about it so I stopped and just took my keys and waited for her to go through everything the other guy went through but she didn't. Like I said she was nice and had a smile but she wasn't like the other employee.  Loved the view. Enjoyed my stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Long Weekend
text: This hotel is lovely.  Right on the river, wonderful rooftop bar, beautiful d√©cor.  Staff was very helpful and friendly. In my opinion probably not the best for younger children.  In fact I don't believe I saw any children at all during our stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My favorite so far in Chicago
text: I'm a Hilton fan and love the art deco fungsue that this gem has.  Check in on the 1st floor and grab a drink with a beautiful view and great people watching or simply relax after a long day of shopping or work while listening to the evening music band! The rooms are completely Devine and have a Nepresso machine! What's not to love right?!*only disappointment or thing to watch out for is the $6 breakfast coffee! I think that's a little much to press your guests for, after all I can get a fancy Starbucks or simply the free coffee in the room... wish this little part would be updatedOther thank that ALL else is a real treat and relaxing

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible view!!!
text: The room was huge, the beds were comfortable and go for a view of the river...it is postcard worthy!  If you are not familiar with its location, using your GPS on your phone will take you to Lower Wacker where you end up in an underground maze of streets.  Leave the Lower part out of the address and you will be fine.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Swanky hotel at the doorstep of the Magnificent Mile
text: I was born and raised in Chicago, and the London House Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton is ideal for anyone that wants to see the heart of Chicago and almost everything it can offer. My husband and I stayed there to celebrate his recent promotion. Rooms and the rooftop restaurant have views of historic Chicago buildings including Wrigley, Chicago Tribune-WGN radio, NBC Tower and the Chicago River.  You‚Äôll hear the city‚Äôs bustle and honking horns, but that‚Äôs part of the downtown Chicago experience. The hotel concierge provided us with wine and chocolate when I told them the reason for our visit. Our room was extremely clean and had a Nespresso machine, smart TV, fridge and a safe for valuables. I would recommend this hotel for families, business travelers, girls night out and couples.  We did have a few problems with our stay. Our room only had one robe and slippers. The vanity mirror and the safe for valuables were not working. Security responded quickly, but it took them an hour to make the safe operable. I was relieved the safe was fixed. However, it took time away from our night on the town. The valet and bell service could have been more welcoming and attentive. A few times we were not greeted leaving or arriving at the hotel. Valet was $71 which is about $10 more than other hotels overnight parking. I would suggest the Spot Hero app if you don‚Äôt want to pay typical downtown Chicago Parking prices.The front desk was always willing to make any problem right, and we could text him if we needed anything.  The London House Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton was a perfect hotel on the Magnificent Mile.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago 's stately, posh lodging downtown
text: All elements conspire properly in this stately, posh Chicago lodging downtown close to the Art Institute and an array of attractions.  Conferences are well supported here, aesthetic views outside picture windows, superb staff, large rooms, and a quiet air.  Better than average fitness room could use more equipment and floor space.  Gorgeous rooftop open air bar - marred only by the glass building with Trump lettering across the street. There is also a splendid Mies van der Rohe building across the way.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hip, clean and central
text: Tired of staying in a hotel that is not entirely clean, where you pay for a last century lobby and then make due with a cramped room -- LONDON HOUSE is for you.  It is up-to-date, has a hip vibe and a great staff.  Most importantly, it is central.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel!!
text: My husband and I stayed in Chicago for an anniversary weekend. We decided to try a hotel we had not yet visited . We had a great experience at the LondonHouse. We loved everything about this hotel. The location was perfect, the decor was modern and the rooms were beautiful!  In addition, the staff were very accommodating and personable. We would definitely stay there again!üëçüèºüëçüèº

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Park Next Door for $52
text: We paid $71 for valet parking at the hotel, when I noticed a sign next door, just west of the hotel for less money.  Next door, to the east, is Corner Bakery, a great place for breakfast.  We only paid $122 for our room, which was a great deal.  It was on the 9th floor and faced Wacker and Michigan.  The view was amazing, the best we've ever had in Chicago.  It was fairly quiet and room was decorated nicely.  Elevators are a bit funky.  You enter your floor and it tells you which elevator will arrive for you, A-F.   I loved the location, as it is a short walk to Nordstrom and Macy's and about 8 blocks to the PrivateBank theater, where Hamilton is playing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Planning to stay here again
text: Another work trip to Chicago . . . .  Two nights at LondonHouse Chicago.  While check in was a bit slow, I was very happy with my room;  very quiet and dark for sleeping and good counter space in the bathroom for toiletries.  Terrific location for shopping on the miracle mile or sightseeing in the Loop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sophisticated and modern retreat in the city
text: This new hotel is strategically located on Wacker Drive along the river with spectacular views up river from the Vista Rooms.  Interestingly it is a mixture of new and old architectural styles since it is occupies two structures probably 100 years apart in Age.  There is a very cool vibe about the place, but the entry is a pick cramped ... which lends a pick to the quirky, cool, exclusive feel of the place.Aside from the views, LH is perfectly located for shopping, touring, shows and dining.Although prices are relatively expensive, room sizes are smallish.  We upgraded to a one bedroom Vista Suite and are so glad we got the amazing view of the skyline and the river.  Since the space is so narrow, it doesn't feel that much like a suite, but the little extra room allowed us to spread out a bit.It has a very nice blend of modern and historic elements (e.g. classic marble used in a sleek modern style). Unfortunately the toilet paper holder was broken when we arrived.  We informed management via text and they confirmed that they would fix it while we were out to dinner.  6 hours later it was still broken.  Also, LH doesn't appear to offer turndown service, which is surprising for a hotel like this.Management apologized profusely.We will definitely consider returning for another weekend get away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Girls night
text: Wonderful service and hotel. Roof top has the best view of the river. great access to everything on the river. Parking is a a little pricey for over night $70 but the location is great if you want to be near the river. Had a wonder stay. Rooms very clean and bed was so comfortable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Experience.
text: I had an excellent experience at LH. Although my stay was brief (one day), the hotel is excellent and it showed. From the staff to the amenities, it was all put together perfectly. Hassan was the representative who checked me into the hotel. From his very first greeting to the time I obtained my room keys, he was polite, courteous, and efficient. I had the pleasure of visiting the bar on the 21st floor of the hotel. Yet another excellent experience. The staff was quick, polite, courteous, and efficient. I intend to return to this excellent hotel again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Homegoing
text: This is the second time I've stayed here and each stay has been AMAZING I SO LOVE LONDON HOUSE the staff is AWESOME they make you want to return again and again The rooms are Fantastic the service is just what you be looking for in a Hotel . I will be back again everytime I come to Chicago this is where I'll be stay . They are the best üíØ

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Disappointing
text: I am a frequent traveler to Chicago and a Hilton Diamond member.  My first visit to London house was disappointing.  In summary, it was OK, but I expected more.The Room - new and clean, comfortable bed.  I was in a corner room so no noise from the hall which I like.  Desk up against the wall with a table with a TV on top of it next to the desk.  Chair pushed in the corner.  Wonder why a newly renovated hotel wouldn't have a wall mounted TV and a logical place to sit and watch it.Room Service -- Lacking.  Limited menu, no wine or beverage menu for room service, but you have to ask.  The food was mediocre, service was very lacking.  The delivery person arrived, and left without offering to open wine bottle, left no opener on the tray.  Fortunately, I caught her in the hall and asked if she had an opener.  Her reply was "There should be one in your room."  Well, maybe there should be, but there wasn't which was why I was asking.  Took about 25 minutes for an opener to arrive....which was awesome because my food was cold at that point.  Lastly, there is no place to put the food service tray, except for maybe the bench at the foot of the bed, which is what I used after I moved it.  The rolling table that the tray was on was not allowed to stay in the room.Diamond amenities? -- Normally I at least get a welcome note in the room, a bottle of water, a text making sure things are ok.  Not here.In a nutshell, nothing really horrible, but I expected more.  I normally stay at the Palmer House and that's where I will be back to.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very upscale for a hilton property
text: I stayed at  Curio  group hotel only once before and was just reminded how wonderful they are when I walked into the lobby of the London House.  Very hip and chic, great vibe and super location right on the river across from Trump Tower.My room is spacious and great view of the city. Amenities are first rate and the staff is very friendly and attentive.Cudo's to Paige at the front desk!!I would place this property right up there with an JW or Kimpton property.  Come and enjoy the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay
text: This hotel has a great location. The room was spacious. We stayed in a corner King room. My only compliant is that of instead of a couch it had two chairs, I wouldn't opt for that room again as I prefer a couch. Service was great, they forgot to service our room and once we alerted them, they fixed it immediately.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Breathtaking Views
text: I stayed here twice in one month and enjoyed both stays!  The hotel is gorgeous, staff is inviting and helpful. Had drinks at the bar upstairs with beautiful views!  You can't beat the location... love!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great view and location!
text: The London House Chicago is located in an awesome spot for shopping, sightseeing, exercising, and incredible restaurants! Try to get rooms facing down The Chicago River for amazing view and sunset! Also the rooftop bar has incredible views and good eats, but we found service to be very slow.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location! Nice size room.
text: I stayed while visiting my daughter who is a student at DePaul. The lobby was impressive and service was exceptional.   We arrived early approximately 1:00 p.m. and inquired about early check in, which was only available through a room upgrade purchase.  It was clear early check in was not an option for many as there were several individuals waiting in the lobby (which also served as a bar) with luggage.  There was an option to complete the process and receive an text once the room was available. I received the text at 3:00 p.m. We had a view of the Chicago River and TRUMP tower.  The beds were very comfortable and if you like soft pillows you would be in heaven.  The room and and bathroom were clean and appropriately appointed. The roof top bar was awesome and they also have an onsite restaurant.   The valet parking was disappointing at $70 as most others average about $55 . Over all, I would stay here again and recommend it.  I also recommend you park else where if you do not really need your car.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A must stop
text: This may not be one of the most lux hotels in town but is one of the most unique. The three assets that make it wonderful are: the staff is not only professional but they are genuinely friendly; the top floor has one of the best bars in town because the hotel is situated at the bend in the Chicago River and the views are amazing; lastly, if you get a room on the river side, you can enjoy the views all night. The only downside to the place is that the view is ruined by the trump sign across the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Chicago Hotel in Perfect Location
text: London house is a beautifully appointed modern hotel in a perfect Chicago location.  The staff was great.  The bar a nice respite from Michigan Ave frenzy.  The room was modern and clean and very well appointed.  A great stay

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful smaller property
text: I personally prefer a smaller hotel just for the noise factor alone. The rooms are lovely and comfortable with amazing beds, giant TVs, coffee and located right on the river. All attractions and shopping are right nearby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great distance in the city to many things to do especially Michigan Ave or Navy Pier.
text: Service throughout the hotel was 5 star, the views from both rooms we had were fabulous - ours looking up the Chicago river and the other room looking up Michigan Ave and out to Lake Michigan. If you go, you MUST visit the rooftop bar. I definitely cannot even explain how amazing the view was on the rooftop. We got there just as the sun was setting. As it got dark all the city light came on and it definitely reminded me why I love chicago so much.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location
text: We booked a weekend trip to Chicago and we're truly blown away by this hotel. The lobby is nicely decorated and has a cute bar.The location is excellent for walking to Chicago attractions. The Big Bus tour company's first stop is directly across the street from the hotel. Corner bakery restaurant is downstairs semi-attached to the hotel . There are many restaurants within walking distance,which is great for transportation cost. The room was spacious,had wonderful toiletries,and came with robe/slippers. The window in our room gave us a view of the Chicago riverfront. We were unable to try the rooftop bar because of limited time. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome location, great hotel!
text: I visited Chicago in early May for a girls' weekend with friends.  I can't say enough positive things about this hotel.  First of all, the price was very reasonable.  The room was nicely decorated, very clean and we had a beautiful view of the river from our window.
