The staff was very attentive to our needs - even texting me throughout our stay to see if we needed anything.  On top of all of that, the location is great for sightseeing!  It's a short walk to plenty of shopping, great restaurants are all around it and we had no problem walking to many of the popular landmarks.  I highly recommend this hotel! We

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice hotel great location !!!!
text: Stayed for a quick weekend getaway. This hotel is recently remodeled and very nice. The location can't be beat as it is a quick walk in either direction to everywhere. The room views were nice to look out onto the river. The room we had was on the 9th floor and very small. We did not get the room I reserved due to the hotel letting us check in early at around 11:30. (Our online room I pre-booked wasn't ready until 3/4). That was a sacrifice I was willing to make. The room was new, very nicely decorated, as was the bathroom. Be advised, small room equals bathroom noises easily heard :) also there is no "door". It is frosted glass on a rail. So the bathroom door does not close/seal totally shut. It slides with a gap. Weird choice for a bathroom. So if you're not traveling  solo or comfortable with your partner hearing everything-- you might want to look elsewhere. Check in was quick. All staff from the doorman to the front desk and everywhere within the hotel- greeted/acknowledged you but did not go over the top just said hello/acknowledged you and/or smile and asked if there was anything you needed help with. Very professional and seemed trained well on customer service. High marks there. Had wine and small plate type food at the lobby bar with live jazz. Was a great time and good food. Staff was amazing there. Also check out the rooftop bar - amazing views and worth it!Overall great hotel, location and staff!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel
text: We were a group of 3 couples that rented 3 rooms at the Curio London House for 3 nights.  The location was fantastic.  We walked everywhere we went with the exception of the easily reachable, convenient train to Wrigley Field.  Every employee we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms were beautiful.  We had a corner room with great views of the city.  The bars were very comfortable yet luxurious.  The rooftop bar has amazing views and is a wonderful place to have a drink.  If I had one complaint it would be that the bar prices are high but we absolutely loved everything about the hotel and would highly recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Downtown Chicago
text: Great experience. Super location in the heart of Chicago. Couldn't be happy with this beautiful hotel. The staff were excellent and we won't hesitate to stay here again. Even while seeing family in the west loop we still loved staying here in the heart of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Curious
text: This building is of architectural significance, having been a 1920s vintage office building designed by Alfred Alschuler, and located on the site of Fort Dearborn.  The exterior and first floor retain most of the architectural details, but the rest is jarringly modern.  LondonHouse is not competitive with the several similarly-priced hotels in the area.  It lacks a dedicated restaurant for breakfast, and its dining venue can't compete with the Langham or nearby upscale eateries.  Rooms are small, austere and lack sufficient storage space (ours had a narrow armoire, drawers beneath the bed and no closet).  Bathrooms are small but functional.  The view from rooms facing the river is impressive - but the glowing "TRUMP" sign across the river may be irritating to some.  The location is excellent, but so too are nearby hotels.  Staff are uniformly pleasant and helpful.  There are better choices in Chicago at this price point.  Clicked on "luxury" in the "expense" category, but it's not luxurious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Graduation UIC trip
text: The quality of the hotel was very good.  The cost was a bit high. The people working there were excellent: the front desk, the bar service, maid service, dining service, and the concierge.We did not have time to use the fitness center.  We wanted to do that.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous hotel in a great location for exploring!
text: LondonHouse is a fresh new hotel in Chicago and the location is ideally suited for exploring the city. I loved the overall vibe, my room was great and the rooftop is gorgeous. I would like to give a 5 star review but the room service food was not on par with what I would expect from a place of this caliber. Overall a great stay though!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Second stay superb
text: Wonderful on all counts... Service, location, ambiance, gorgeous room, amenities and great value to boot. I can't say enough good which surprises myself because I'm picky! Well done. I look forward to my next stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location and Value
text: I stayed at LondonHouse with a group of women for a girls weekend, and it was fantastic! Gorgeous views of the river, beautiful accommodations and very friendly staff. They even managed to get our 4 rooms all on the same floor! Also, the bar and rooftop are amazing, definitely check it out. I would 100% recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden london house surprise
text: Hotel has great location, friendly staff, marvelous roof top view and closeness to points of interest that could be reached by foot or with public transportation. Room and bathroom in particularly very spacious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Location, Great Views and Superb Service!
text: My boyfriend and I came here on a business trip and stayed three nights. The service was fantastic and we were overwhelmed by the location of this high end modern Hotel. Most of the famous places you would want to visit in Chicago are in walking distance which made it perfect for us, we didn't have much time to explore but we got to see all the must-see sights in only a few hours. Even made it for a walk by the lake and a little shopping in one of the near-by malls, just across the bridge. The rooms are clean, quite large, modern and have great views overlooking the city (if you are on a higher floor) and if you want an even better view, there is a rooftop bar for you to visit, from where you can take some amazing pictures with skyline backgrounds!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location!
text: London house is in a great location, stylish and well kept ! Abel at the front desk was so welcoming upon arrival and made us all laugh! The rooftop has wonderful views and friendly staff.  I look forward to another stay in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely Views, Great Hotel
text: This is a very nice, comfortable and modern hotel located in a fantastic spot in downtown Chicago. Seriously, the location cannot be beat and it was an excellent home base for playing tourist for four days. I arrived ahead of my travelling companion and enjoyed a coffee (albeit an expensive coffee at $7) with a view in the lounge adjacent to the reception area on the second floor. When my companion arrived an hour later, we were cheerfully checked in before the official check-in time, which was appreciated.It is worth spending the extra money to book into one of their "vista" rooms - we were in room 1107 and I am attaching a picture of the view from the room (one just has to ignore the other view of the horrendous TRUMP branding across the river). The room itself was large, clean and modern and we enjoyed how quiet it was; we did not hear any noise from our neighbours or from the hallway.The only downfall to this hotel is that it seems that they have made design and appearances a priority over functionality. Let me share a few examples. In a room that could sleep four (we were two), there was only one chair to sit and enjoy the view, there was one small hook in the bathroom (forcing us to throw towels over the glass shower door to dry) and we were supplied with only three coffee pods per day (don't even get me started on the in-room coffee machine because it provided pathetically small cups of coffee and took a Ph.D. scientist two days to figure out how to use) and two coffee mugs. While we didn't fuss over the latter few issues, we did request a second chair and it was cheerfully promised but never delivered. We also requested a wake up call on our check-out morning that didn't happen. We rather felt at every turn that service was friendly and well intentioned but somewhat lacking in delivery.Make sure that you visit the rooftop for magnificent views of Chicago, the river and the lake, but perhaps give their restaurant (On 21) a miss - it was noisy and expensive with small serving portions.At the end of the day I strongly recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay here again should I ever return to the fabulous city of Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: High-end
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse twice in the last 2 months.  Both times I was upgraded to a suite with my Diamond status.  The first suite had a river view, was smaller but well laid out with a separate bedroom from the small living room, both of which had large flat screens.  The second suite was larger but the view wasn't as great.  Both rooms were very nice, definitely luxury accommodations.  I liked that they have Chromecasts to be able to cast your own entertainment; smart light switches that turn on/off everything; and USB ports in the electrical outlets.  The outdoor rooftop bar has an unbelievable view, though I wasn't able to fully enjoy it as it was still winter.  The hotel lobby is large and busy with table service, and the entire hotel definitely has a European vibe.  My main compliant was the lack of a hot breakfast included with Diamond status, which I get at every other Hilton property... the continental breakfast had bagels, cereal, juices and pastries but not eggs, bacon etc.  Overall, definitely a high-end hotel with a great location and great lobby and rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cubbys Trip
text: Great location, 20 minutes from Wrigley but food, shopping perfect location. Navy Pier pretty views but not a lot going on in May. Went to Harry Carries and great atmosphere waking distance room hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cool modern hotel
text: I am so happy found this little gem in Chicago.  It is part of Hilton's curio collection that includes boutique type hotel.  This hotel has a great location Right on the river and a few blocks from the Mag Mile.  Both times I had booked a "Vista" room.  These rooms are larger and have great views of the river.  This hotel has one of the best rooftops in the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really really nice hotel. Highly recommend it!
text: I have been a diehard and faithful Hilton honors traveler this year. This has been the nicest property I've stayed at thus far. I used the mobile key and was able to check in during the cab ride to the hotel. Very seamless, never went to the front desk. The rooms are very well appointed with high and materials. My only negative was that the toilet paper holder, while modern, isn't designed properly. Every time you pull on the roll it falls off onto the floor LOL!! I ordered room service one night after working late. Ordered the burger on gluten free bread. Yummy! ...and it didn't cost an arm and a leg. The location is convenient to the loop and the Magnificent Mile.I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: No need to read this review- just book it!
text: Hands down my new all time favorite hotel out of all the hotels I've stayed at.The LondonHouse Chicago is a gorgeous hotel with an old school feel but modern luxuries. You must make it to the rooftop, as it offers a beautiful view of the city. My room had a modern large screen tv (larger than the one in my own bedroom at home) and the bed was very comfortable. My room was clean, the staff was professional and friendly. I didn't eat at the hotel but they have an onsite restaurant, a gym with all of the basic equipment, a spa, and I believe there was an onsite pool.I don't have many details as I was just there a few days for work so didn't spend too much time in the hotel but it was such a lovely hotel that I want to take a personal trip to Chicago and am planning to stay at the LondonHouse again just to explore the amenities!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved this place--Best possible location and view
text: Our new home away from home when we visit Chicago.  Whatever you do, pay the additional money and upgrade to a River view.  Really impressive. Everything well furnished and very modern.  Elevators ver efficient with a system where you put in your floor ahead of time.  Upstairs bar and terrace area great.  Very comfortable lobby and a fairly OK gym.  Entire staff very nice, I am a Diamond Hilton member and that seemed to help.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Solo two night stay.
text: This is my second stay at the London House Chicago. The first was with my wife and the second was a two night solo stay for a Chicago Cubs weekend. The price was in line with any luxury hotel on the Mag Mile, river north or the loop. This property offers is some of the best views of the river and Michigan avenue. Also the building itself is a work of art. If your looking for location the LondonHouse is a must. I would not call this hotel kid friendly unless your children are over 21. The rooftop bar is one of the best I've seen in any city luxury hotel. I would recommend it over the Wit and other downtown properties. The bar offers great drinks and appetizers with a price tag to match. There is no shortage of local eats, drinks and entertainment within walking distance.I would recommend this hotel for anyone over the age of 21 and the means to cover the expenses. If your with young children I would recommend the Embassy Suites or Homewood Suites also Hilton properties.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous Hotel
text: The hotel was fabulous.  As a Hilton Gold Member, I was able to get an upgrade without any trouble.The hotel is very chic and hip.  The Curio Collection is the best.  It's home a way from home.  The rooftop view is beautiful. The front desk was amazing.  Thank you Paige, Savanna, Abel, Michael, Keith and Shannon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel with some kinks to work out
text: Stayed Saturday night and were surprised to find our room a couple of floors above a wedding reception in full swing.  Was so loud we might as well have been at the wedding.  Manager was kind enough to relocate us (and return some of our $ as we were downgrading from a river view) after front desk told us music would "probably" end around 12 or 1 am.  On way from new room to old room to pack up our belongings, we were locked in the stairwell and had to be rescued.  Major fire hazard if trapped in stairwell!  Elevators don't have buttons in them and that is really baffling.  Have to select floor outside, get into elevator and trust you will get to your location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Subpar experience...
text: Stayed at the Londonhouse in April expecting a premium boutique hotel experience. Overall the hotel was a huge disappointment and not worth the price. When we to the front desk at 3:50PM after being notified in the morning our digital key was ready ("Blue" members have to stop by the front desk before they can use the digital key); housekeeping had not been to the room yet. We waited about over an hour in the lobby for the room to be ready. We saw a number of other guests try to check-in after 4PM and be told their rooms were also not ready. It appears they have a lot of staffing issues in this area. The $18 continental breakfast was just plain bad (we received vouchers after asking because of the issues at check-in). The service at breakfast was non-existent and the selections were not being restocked. The room itself was fine, albeit small. Their location does offer good views of the river if you're on the right side of the building. On the morning of check-out, housekeeping knocked on our door at 8:30AM to see if we were still there and by 9AM our key cards no longer worked (we picked up a pair of key cards after realizing we still had to go the front desk to get the digital key to work) even though check-out is at 12PM.If you're looking for a hotel in downtown Chicago that offers nice accommodations and good service, look at other properties including any of the Kimpton hotels for a boutique experience or Virgin if you truly want something different.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Almost Excellent
text: This is a wonderful hotel.  Our "Vista" room was a good size at 500 square feet and had stunning views onto the river.  All the staff, from front desk to cleaners, were unfailingly cheerful and helpful.  And it was blissfully quiet.  Why then can I only rate it "very good"?There were too many minor niggles.  I'll just mention two:There was only one chair from which the stunning views could be appreciated.  We asked for a second chair (there was ample space for one).  The front desk representative played on her key board and said "It's on its way".  We were impressed.  But the chair never came.In a room that could sleep four people, we only got two or three coffee pods per day.Finally, I really can't recommend the small restaurant for dinner.  It has a cocktail lounge atmosphere, the selection is limited and the noise from the adjacent bar is too loud, although the quality of the food and service is good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location
text: Love this hotel.  Wish all were like this.  It was clean, modern, and inviting.  The room was comfortable.  The view was great as it was of the canal.  It was beautiful and well decorated and the staff was very friendly.  The rooftop restaurant and bar area is very pretty with an amazing city view.  Top notch.  Well done.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great view but some issues
text: The Londonhouse offers immaculate views of the loop and the River. The front desk was friendly. Great bar on 22nd floor rooftop bar and retro bar on 2nd floor to get in that Chicago chic feel. What didn't feel chic was the frosted glass floating panel they call a bathroom door. And the door sometimes just floats open while you are peeing. So no privacy in the bathroom. Just one knob in the entire bathroom to hang either your towel or toiletry kit. You decide. The shower door kind of floats too, so your floor will get wet. Guess what they have, digital keys, so in theory your phone is your key. However, it's fraught with bugs. It seemed to make my other keys not work.    I can't tell you how many key issues we had. (Deep breath). The elevators are interesting. Hit the button and it flashes which elevator that will open. Don't miss the flash. Tall building, so be patient.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location!
text: We came across this hotel on a last minute trip to Chicago for a funeral.  What a great find.  For the price, it was probably the nicest hotel we've stayed in.  The rooms were modern and well designed.  The bathroom and shower were huge.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We will absolutely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a pleasant stay!
text: I travel to Chicago often for fun (having previously lived there) and always enjoy discovering new hotels.  This is a real find!  Wonderful location, great building and rooms, and an incredibly friendly staff. I had a great stay, and will return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A gem!
text: The Hubsy booked this hotel/room on a friend's suggestion. We are so glad! Reasonable rate - especially for the easy & perfect location. A room over looking the river? Yes please! Helpful staff? (Thank you concierge Jose!) Not gonna say no to that! Beautiful room & bathroom. Our new go-to.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love this boutique hotel!
text: My fav hotel in Chicago.  Family of 6 stayed in 3 rooms.  Recommend the rooms with the river view.  Amazing location, great staff, great service.  LH Rooftop was great, food was good and good service.  We are in Chicago at least 3 times a year to. Is it family....will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Gatsby Great Room
text: The LondonHouse Hotel is located in a great area. Close to many restaurants and attractions, about a 15 minute walk to the shops on Michigan Ave and 20 minute walk to Navy Pier. The lobby often smelled like cigarettes, even though management says the hotel is non-smoking. The room was beautifully decorated, great furnishings and very large - we had the one bedroom suite. The only issue is that the rooms are set up facing Trump tower opposite of the river so it's hard to take in the view. The bedding was not very soft.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: This is a superb location with incredible views. If you go north on Michigan you are on the Magnificent Mile, south, the Cultural Mile. The rooms are beautiful, and the rooftop bar, though expensive, is worth a visit for the view and atmosphere. I would definitely pick this hotel again and highly recommend it if you are in Chicago for the first time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic
text: I stayed here on business and upon the recommendation of a friend.  I was not disappointed.  The staff was friendly and attentive, asking if this was my first visit to the hotel, welcoming me, and thanking me for choosing their hotel.  They explained how the elevators worked, which was helpful as I have not seen one where you select your destination on the keypad next to the elevator.  All you do is enter the floor number and a display tells you which elevator to get on.  Fancy!The room was well appointed and comfortable.  The toiletries were by Malin + Goetz, which I appreciated.  There was sufficient lighting in the bathroom, which is sometimes an issue.  The bed itself was heaven.  I slept very well even though I was on the 4th floor facing Wacker Ave.  I can definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to treat themselves while in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic hotel!
text: I stayed here using Hilton Honors points and had a great stay. We did pay for an upgrade to a river view and ended up on the 15th floor. The room was a decent size for Chicago with modern furnishings. It was very clean and quiet. The location is great because it's relatively close to the El and walkable to lots of locations on Michigan Avenue. We didn't try the rooftop bar but there were quite a few people waiting to get it on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location / Beautiful Historic Building / Fantastic Rooms!
text: I have stayed in this general area a number of times but this is the first time at LondonHouse and I will definitely be back. Booked a vista view 2 queen room. Found that signing up for the Hilton Rewards and booking through the app to be very easy and since they don't require full payment until check-in I was able to watch the rate and rebook the lower price a few days prior to arrival (saved me $40). Room was imacculate. Loved it! You can select your exact room the day before arrival using the app as well. Views from the rooftop bar are beautiful. You can see the lake as well as a direct shot West down the river. You won't be disappointed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good location but iffy service at times
text: The location is great, very close to the river and convenient to many Chicago spots.  Rooftop bar/lounge is awesome with superb views.  Room was comfy and furnishings were OK.  There some stains on the walls in our room and there were some worn edges in the room itself.  The service at the bar and at breakfast was not great and that was disappointing.  The service we received Saturday night and Sunday morning was less than top notch.  The breakfast buffet available to Hilton Honors members was pretty week.  We would have gone to Corner Bakery right next door if the Honors program did not provide free breakfast.  Front desk service was good though.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Disappointing
text: We were looking forward to this property and our weekend in Chicago. At checkin we were told by the agent that this was his favorite room.  Well, surprise, it was small and no view of the river as described. It actually seemed it was planned as a room for one.  One chair, one robe....Something I don't usually notice but very thin walls. We are Hilton Honors diamond members and have stayed in many of their places and this was a clear disappointment. Oh, the rooftop lounge was closed!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great All Around
text: Perfect location near many of the best places in river north. Rooms are nice with elegant touches. Roof top bar provides a great setting and view. Get the park and stay rate to avoid nightly parking charge. Staff is friendly and helpful with everything. Food in the lobby bar was very good. Would recommend and I will return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, great views and servixe
text: This was my second stay at the London House since they opened. I  brought a group of friends down for a girls weekend and they were super impressed just like I was from the first visit. They did a fantastic job with the design and decor of the hotel.... contemporary, classy and beautiful rooms with great  views of the Chicago River and city. View from  the rooftop bar and the lobby lounge are awesome too. The staff is always great and accommodating. LH rooftop is a favorite of mine for cocktails during the day on the upper level if the weather is nice or in evenings before heading out for dinner.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent redo of an historic property in a great location.
text: Our room was quiet and nicely appointed with a large TV we didn't use. It had a large bathroom with big walk-in shower. My wife commented on the high quality make-up mirror with is infrequently found in most hotels. Were we to add one design change, it would be to frost the window in the bathroom so their could be natural light and not require the shades to be drawn for privacy. The bed was firm but noticeably comfortable. The London house sits in a great location on the south side of the River at Wacker and Michigan Ave. It is an exceptional use of an historic property

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Birthday Stay in the Heart of Downtown Chicago
text: My husband and I both work in downtown Chicago, but were looking for a place to stay in the Loop after a night out for my birthday. This was the perfect top off to a fantastic birthday weekend. I loved everything about this hotel, from the decor in the lobby and rooms, the fancy soaps and loofah in the bathroom, to the views and rooftop bar. The creators of LondonHouse did a fantastic job transforming this space into a swanky-but-approachable hotel space. The bedrooms felt like a stylish office in a house I wish I owned, and the views from the river-side rooms and rooftop bar were breathtaking. If I had one complaint, it's that the lobby and check-in desk are on the second floor (a product of converting an old office building into a hotel), and it could use better signage to point the way. Other than that, I loved every minute of my stay here, and I hope to make this a birthday tradition!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impromptu Staycation
text: Cool hotel in a super location. In rehabbing the former building they have done a nice job preserving the cool older, art deco details of the building while updating the hotel modern with a hip vibe. Our room was great. Very comfortable bed, great view of the Chicago river. The only bad thing about the view was that we had 5 gaudy (and in my opinion offensive) letters 'T-R-U-M-P" when we looked out the window. Hardly the hotel's fault...Walking distance from cool restaurants/bars/clubs in River North and right off Michigan Ave's "Magnificent Mile". I highly recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great choice
text: Had a one night business stay at the Londonhouse.  This is a great update to an older building.I selected a room on the corner, and thus had two large windows.  The view of the river is great.  Other rooms would look toward the lake.The 21St floor restaurant made an easy dinner of very well prepared, reasonably priced food.  The roof top bar is pleasant on a nice evening and has great views.The continental breakfast is adequate.  Good menu options for the same price.The gym area has about a dozen aerobic machines, a rack of weights and a pulley machine.  Not a lot of open space for body weight or free weight workouts, but it will work depending on the crowd.Nice walks in all directions, including down the river and across to river north.The Trump tower occupies most of he block across the street.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay for girlfriends getaway!
text: Stayed here in November as part of a girlfriends getaway. We are all mid to late 40's..looking for a nice hotel that was central and not too expensive (as we all wanted our own rooms).Rooms were a nice size and we all had stunning views!  We all particularly LOVED the young/bar on the first floor  where we met for bubbles and snacks before we went out for the night, or went shopping for the day.  The rooftop bar had views to die for...didn't like that anyone from other hotels, or outside could just wander in and go to the rooftop..it congested the elevators.I would return in a heart beat.  Loved the location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding New Property!!
text: We love the London House!  The location and views are amazing! The room and bathroom are gorgeously decorated.  Several bars throughout with views of the river.  We've stayed all around Chicago (Trump, Wit, Palomar, W, Peninsula) and this hotel is leading the pack right now in my opinion, considering the value.  Get a Vista room- well worth the bit of extra to upgrade! (View from our 12th floor room below.)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Great facilities,
text: I recently stayed here 3 days for a business trip. I loved the hotel. Rooms were modern and well appointed. High quality towels and toiletries provided. Good water pressure in the shower. Very large flat screen TV. Nexpresso machine instead of a typical coffee machine. It didn't work in the outlet it was plugged into, but they moved it for me. It's nice to have a refrigerator that you can actually use, that's not already filled with stuff. The safe is on the floor in the closet. An odd location but since I don't use the safe, it really didn't affect me. At first glance I could not find a dresser until I realized that there were drawers built into the bottom of the bed. Nice table to work at. Complimentary internet with Hilton Honors. The room was quiet and I had one of the Vista rooms with a great view of the river, and unfortunately the Trump sign on the hotel across the river. I don't care what your political bent is, the sign is too large and obnoxious, and directly across from the hotel, so there is no way to miss it. The bar/restaurant is very nice, although they are not as enthusiastic about using breakfast vouchers as other Hilton properties. After the first day, I didn't try again. Not worth the aggravation and there are some great breakfast spots nearby. For me on a business trip, I was mostly in the room for sleeping and changing so it was perfect. The lobby is on the second floor, so it is a bit harder to interact with the staff. It has one of those modern elevator systems where you type in the floor you want and one of the elevator doors opens. This is great, if you know what floor you want. It doesn't work as well when you type in 1 and get in, only then realizing that the lobby and bar is actually on the second floor, so you have to exit the elevator to go up stairs or type in another number. I really hate these elevators, because sometimes I forget and want to go to the spa/health club or the restaurant, but there is no ability to change your floor once you are in the elevator. I am not in the habit of being that organized to board an elevator. Also, if you get on the wrong one, you are going for a ride. Sorry for the elevator rant for those who are still reading.Bottom line - I will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great weekend with my daughter
text: The hotel is located in a super location.The staff is very nice, polite especially at the front desk!Valet was very fast to get my car, usually it takes a bit.Our room and the view was great, we wish to get the same view next time.We loved how the hotel and the room are furnished, very European.We loved everything of this hotel, the rooftop is probably one the best I have seen in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
text: Very great location. We did a lot so ended up walking quite a bit, Just about everything is with-in decent walking distance. Awesome view from the room. Fast elevators. Rooftop bar was nice. Always a fun time in the city. My third time to the city and this room and location was the best of the similarly priced others.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love this Hotel and the Hotel Staff
text: This is my favorite hotel in Chicago downtown area.  Absolutely impeccable. Fair price, outstanding rooms and high-end service. Location is close to many attractions including shopping and restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Girls weekend
text: Celebrated birthdays with my best friend. Hotel was beautiful! It was in a great location, staff was wonderful and the bar was fun! I would definitely stay there again and plan to return with my husband.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Disappointing Hotel and Hilton Honors
text: First, the Hotel.  The good:  Paige at the front desk; one of the gentlemen at the bell stand; and our room was pretty.  That's about it.  My primary critique is that the staff appeared disinterested and "doing a job" versus provide a service and caring. It's too bad because the property is really pretty and in a great location. The lack of service/staff then makes other issues less tolerable (e.g., skimpy and basic Continental breakfast, room coffee service not replenished for 2 days; dirty dishes in the hallway; allowing 2 really loud drunk guys in bathrobes in the restaurant).  Fortunately, I had a great rate and the hotel was a 3 minute walk to the office.Hilton Honors:  All that said, I had planned to stay LH again the following week.  (I'm in Chicago every week for the next 3-months)  I had a reservation for 3 nights but needed to change my reservation to check-in a day later so shortening my stay, not extending it.  I tried to do it via the online reservation system but website showed "no availability" to shorten my stay??  Then, I called the hotel directly to be told again "no availability" to shorten my stay?? Finally, I contacted Hilton Honors with the first agent telling me.... wait for it.... "no availability" to shorten my stay.  I asked to escalate and spoke with an escalation agent who again told me....you guessed it!  "No availability" to shorten my stay.  So, I cancelled.   Heading back to Marriott...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Views spectacular
text: The personnel at this Wacker Drive lodging are very personable and the views from the rooftop bar are simply unbelievable. The wine list is quite good and there is a Continental breakfast in the 21st floor bar. Rooms are equipped with Nespresso, though mine was unplugged but impossible to plug in because the outlet was in a cabinet behind a refrigerator. It had to be carried across the room to the desk to brew a cup of coffee.   Inexplicably, too, the safe is on the floor of the in-room armoire, making it difficult to use. Overall, it is a very nice hotel, but it is certainly not a four or five star according to traditional standards.  There's a hip vibe, a vibe that might please the under 40s, but which seems to cut corners to those of us plus 50s looking for a little higher level of service.  In comparison with other Hilton properties in the Loop, the water here doesn't seem to be filtered.  As an Honors member, I did receive two bottles of water today, but once that's gone there is Voss water available in the room for $5 a bottle.  You may end up drinking those pricey bottles because there's a very metallic taste to the tap water.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Hotel with Some Service Issues
text: Stayed at the LondonHouse over the Easter weekend and felt it was an average stay overall. Was welcomed as a diamond member and offered an upgrade without asking. Benefits were well explained and frankly all experience with the main hotel staff were very good. Main letdown during the stay was the poor service during breakfast at the restaurant. Restaurant was unwilling to use the continental breakfast as credits towards other items which isn't the norm but I guess that's up to each hotel to set their respective policy. The main issue was that once the staff knew you were they for the continental breakfast, getting service was tough. We weren't given place settings, had to ask for them and were ignored by the waitress/hostess. In the end, the friendly bartender took the initiative and came from behind the bar to serve us. This happened to a few other groups as well...  Other than that, some minor issues with the housekeeping staff not emptying the trash and not replenishing all the toiletries but nothing too serious. Overall, an average stay and good value for money (at $119) but would like to try one of the other properties nearby instead.. Definitely would not pay the $200+ rates some other posters have mentioned.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: I usually stay at the four seasons but am a mid-twenties professional and wanted to switch things up to something more along the lines of a hip, boutique-style hotel. This hotel is newer and very nice and very cute! The staff is all helpful and kind. The rooms are great and clean. They come with an easy espresso machine which provides a good cup of coffee to sip on in the morning. The hotel is also in a great location, close to all the necessities of Chicago. It was so nice, I woke up each morning and ran down to the river and the pier. And there is a great rooftop bar that all my friends that live in the city have gone to for drinks after work or on the weekend. Definitely recommended :)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location with a great view
text: We upgraded to a suite and we were not disappointed, is a great location, easy to walk to Millenium Park and Michigan Ave.  The view of the river is spectacular and the rooms are very quiet and comfortable.  The breakfast location is very relaxing and if you are lucky enough to be served by Elaine you will be well taken care of, she is very pleasant and attentive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Phenomenal hotel
text: So I stayed here April 2017, and let me just say this is the most conveniently located hotel one of two reasons. 1. it is very close to Michigan ave, where you have most of your retail stores and a few restaurants, and 2. if you are ever lost, just look for the trump building which is easily noticeable and the hotel is conveniently located right across it. The hotel also has amazing views on the 22nd floor, and the food at the restaurant in the hotel is spectacular. The rooms are also very nice, and extremely comfy. You honestly can't go wrong with this hotel so defiantly check it out and book a night.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely! But.....
text: We arrive for a two night stay and as a Gold Hilton Honors member they were kind enough to let us check in at 11 AM. We were even upgraded to a corner suite! The room was lovely, but the bathroom was literally 2 ft from the bed, didn't love that. We ordered room service both mornings and it was prompt, delicious and reasonably priced.  Great beds & shower & Nespresso. Location is convenient, however the 2 AM motorcycles screaming down Michigan Ave made it difficult to sleep. My biggest issue was with the elevators. We wanted to have a drink at the rooftop bar, and when the elevator door opened there were 10 completely drunk 25-year-olds who are as rude as they could be for the next 13 floors up. There should be a separate express elevator for the rooftop bar. The next afternoon on the way to our room we were met with another crowd like that going up to the rooftop...that's unacceptable. Also the elevators had a terrible smell because of all the party crowds . Are you a hotel or a bar?  make up your mind ..We also had a late checkout, but our key was disabled at 1 PM when we had a 2 PM check out.  We were told WE needed to have it rekeyed... again it is was not seamless service. The staff was very accommodating but due to the crampness and darkness of the rooms and especially the crowds going the rooftop,  we would not stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Didn't feel the love from the staff
text: First off hotel is in a great location. Me and my wife did not have to walk far to get anything we needed and plenty of restaurants are within walking distance. Room was large with great view, bed was comfortable, shower was large enough for a whole group of people. We had a room with a great view of the river below.The elevators were comical. I'm pretty sure the system was put in to be as fluid as possible, but I think it does the opposite. 1 couple goes in 1 elevator, then they jam 5 in the next.We did not eat any food purchased from the hotel because there is a small cafe on the bottom floor that has some good breakfast foods.Now my issue was the service. I drove into the city and called beforehand and when I asked if there was a parking deck at the hotel I was told yes. Well after driving around the block 3 times on a Friday night I realized that was incorrect. Pulled up in front of the hotel in the middle of the street after I saw someone else do it and that triggered someone to come to my vehicle and get my keys. It's not very obvious what to do. I wasn't told where to go, just given a ticket. Found lobby on second floor and interacted with someone who probably thought I didn't belong there in his hotel because he didn't seem to enthusiastic to be dealing with me.Later in the evening I was told to move away from the building while smoking a cigarette. Mind you there was a young crowd all dressed up hanging around close to the front door, but didn't say anything to them.I'm a HHonor member who is usually gold or diamond year after year. I've been loyal to Hilton, but I'm finding the service lacks more and more with these other properties Hilton has under there wings (with the exception to the Waldorf properties). Yes they have big, beautiful, and expansive properties, but the service just lacks. They also put a hold of $200 on my CC for incidentals. I was told this was common practice after I called and asked why $200 more is being added to my bill because a larger amount in currently pending. I've stayed at plenty of other hotels and none do this. This is something that should be told upfront so I'm not calling HHonors then the hotel 3 hours after I check out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Visit
text: I live in the suburbs and went to stay downtown for the weekend for my boyfriends birthday. I was greeted at the door and given directions to the lobby without even asking. Upon hearing that we were staying for a birthday they upgraded our room to one with a view for free which was unexpectedly gorgeous. The location is great because it is right next to a lot of shopping and there is a corner bakery on the first floor (perfect for breakfast). I didn't get a chance to go to the bar on the 2qst floor or the terrace but if the view from my room is any indication I am sure it is beautiful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous location and customer service
text: I had the great pleasure of staying here for one night last September, and wish it could have been for longer.  I had been in touch with Keith since before the hotel opened and he couldn't have done more to make my stay comfortable and memorable.I arrived early and the staff happily looked after my luggage whilst I explored the local area.  On arriving back later in the day I was quickly checked in to a fabulous room with a great river view.  The quality of the finish to the new rooms was high and, although the room was quite narrow, it was perfect for me.  I saw no issues with cleaning and bathroom amenities felt special.I requested a recommendation for a steakhouse and the concierge suggested several options.  I decided to take the short walk to Benny's the other side of the river, and it as a great choice for me; see separate review.I had been warned that the rooftop terrace gets very busy, and on the night of my stay it was no exception.  I had a quick look at the view and then went back down to the indoor bar for a drink, where prices were relatively high and service was nothing special if I'm honest.  Perhaps a visit to the terrace earlier in the evening would have been a better choice.Breakfast in the morning was quite busy although there was a fair spread on offer, including a popular cooked to order omelette station.  Check-out was efficient and I was quickly on my way.  For the right rate and room availability I would happily return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Trip
text: Loved the hotel decor and elegance. Everything was great until they never delievered my breakfast. No wait they never even came down my hall and collected our menus then when i call at 630 am because i expected breakfast at 730am she says she is on her way to get menu. No one ever came. So i called down and let her know i had changed my mind all together. That was so unprofessional to me.. for them to not even check our hall and collect menus my neighbors menu is still on her door smh. Check out is 1pm for me so next trip to chicago i might try another hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful view!
text: Came to the LondonHouse to stay for a long birthday weekend. What an amazing view of the river!  Our room was always clean, as was the bathroom. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse
text: Modern. The elevators were a special treat to me. You've stayed at the best hotels in the world, right? You check in after 3pm local time. Push the button for your floor. Up you go with no stops. The next morning you have a meeting at 8:30am. At the elevator you push the button for the lobby. Depending on the floor you are on it may take a few minutes for the car to arrive. The London House has the smartest elevators I have ridden. Enter your floor number. The display screen directs you to the selected car to wisk you to your floor. OUTSTANDING!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!
text: The staff was either nonexistent or just plain rude. The AC in our room went out at 5a..waited on maintenance until 6a-he rigged the AC so it sorta work. Credit card machines out an entire weekend! Hated it

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous views, great hotel
text: Stayed here with family for a night of fun in Chicago.  Staff was friendly and helpful and hotel is clean, modern and 'fancy' as my 8 and 6 year old described it.  We stayed in room 623 which had a gorgeous view over the river.  Room size was adequate and fair for a city room, bed was comfortable - overall, a great hotel.  We went up to the rooftop to check the views and it was stunning.   Would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wow beautiful
text: Beautiful view. We got a river view room.  It was gorgeous.  Modern and fresh and huge.   Had two double beds that were comfy and pillows were nice.  The bathroom was large and very modern with frosted glass door and a large shower.   The front desk Jim was amazing.   He said he would text me so I could ask for anything I needed    That he did.  We had questions about breakfast and parking and he answered immediately back.   I will definitely be returning on our visits to Chicago.  Location is perfect.  Quick walk to water tower and just across the street from architecture tour.   Great job Hilton!!!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Book the Vista Rooms
text: I had originally booked a "Vista King" room, but changed the reservation to a "Corner Studio" thinking I wanted more space.  This was a mistake.  The living area was tight (2 chairs) as was the sleeping area.  The room was divided buy a wall with a rotating tv.  A very odd layout.  The room seemed dark.We did look into a  "Vista Suite."  The design seemed more functional and the view was outstanding.  These Vista rooms are certainly the best rooms in the hotel. The hotel seemed full, the staff was busy and friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel to stay: great rooms, friendly staff and close to everything!  Would definitely recommend!  If you are looking for a luxury hotel close to the Navy Pier and Millennium Park, this is the place to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Birthday Celebration
text: We visited the Londonhouse for the first time to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and had an awesome experience . Paige checked us in and was wonderful to accommodate us with a beautiful room with a view of the river . We were surprised by the champagne that was sent to our room to celebrate our occasion , very nice . The hotel is in a great location . We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go . The lobby bar had music till 8 :00 which has a nice atmosphere . There was also a bar on the 21st floor that was nicely laid out in different sections , the rooftop is beautiful and the view amazing . The rooms are decorated beautiful and upscale . We were texted by several people during our stay to make sure we were satisfied with our accommodations . Paige and Connie were able to help me set up my Hilton rewards # so thanks to them .  We will definitely stay at this hotel and location again . Great customer service by everyone that we were in contact with . Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Hotel In A Good Location
text: Stayed here for four nights and it was wonderful!  Quiet place to hunker down after a busy day in the hustle bustle of Chicago.  Very comfy bed and the room was VERY clean.  Not the biggest room but adequate.  Staff was friendly and helpful Only complaint was that the soaps had to much scent for me.  Great location - hotel is at one end of the Miracle Mile and within easy walking distance to restaurants, shopping, museums, etc.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel Has it All!!!
text: I rarely write a review before I depart a hotel but I am so enthusiastic about this place.  The location is just perfect for anything you would want to do in Chicago.  Love the charm of the building and all of the room appointments:  great lighting, master layout plan, Nespresso machine, Malin & Goetz toiletries, luxurious bedding.  Even a shower cap that comes with a little scrunchie-in case you forgot your's.  Just love, love, love. And must mention the stunning rooftop restaurant, views of city, and Cupola.  Just a marvelous place.  The staff is amazing.  Shout out to Savanna for picking just the right room for my tastes.  Concierge is helpful beyond.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved the Londonhouse!
text: Great hotel in the middle of downtown Chicago.  I stayed 4 night with my family in March. We walked most places in the city... shopping on Michigan Ave, parks, dinners, Willis Tower, & the theatre.  The rooms were spacious with a large bathroom.  Loved the under bed storage drawers, you can actually unpack at this hotel!  Empty mini fridge is great too, you can purchase your own snacks and water!  Great views of the river, we enjoed beautiful morning and sunsets.  We had a room just 2 doors down from the elevtor and it was totally quiet!  Except for a 2am arguement from a neighboring room in the hall, not the hotels fault on that one!  The rooftop has amazing views of the city, it was cold when we were there but that will be a great place to socialize on warm days!  Staff was friendly and accommodating.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stay here!
text: The location is perfect if you want to explore the best of Chicago on foot. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable. LH on 21 is great for breakfast. Service was as expected. Great value for an upscale property in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent new addition to Chicago.
text: I am a frequent business traveler and a long time client of the Palmer House.  A colleague suggested that I try out London House.  I am so glad that I did. This is a beautiful hotel with excellent service, very comfortable rooms and wonderful amenities. The breakfast each morning was delicious. The location at Wacker and Michigan is perfect. In the two stays I've had, I was given a large room with great views.  I have found a new favorite hotel in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful boutique like hotel
text: Beautiful, very clean hotel in a great location.  Staff was great.  We had a beautiful view of Chicago from our room.   Surprisingly quiet for downtown Chicago.  Only drawback - drinks and food very expensive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect....For One Person
text: First of all, let me just say that the LondonHouse is a gorgeous hotel. It blends modern luxury with classic architecture so perfectly, and both the rooms and public spaces are wonderful. The staff is also incredibly friendly. From checking in to eating breakfast, we were met with constant smiles and the want to accomodate us, even though it was obvious that we weren't their target audience. The rooms were obviously designed for a single businesss traveler, with a closet barely that was certainly not suitable for all of our cold weather gear, and a few drawers under the beds. The four of us just didn't have enough places to put our stuff! Also, there was no pool, and the only places to go inside the hotel were bars that weren't suitable for children at night. That being said, because of how nice the staff was and the London House's stupendous location, we would all stay there again, now that we know what to expect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful facility, slow service
text: The hotel is beautiful, all facilities updated and well maintained.  The only issues we had were service-related. We requested two foam pillows the first morning.  Request 1: concierge.  She said "I'll get right on it." Returned to our room several hours later, no pillows, so I called guest services.  Told them second request, they said "I'll get right on it."  Came back at 1 am, no foam pillows.  Day 2, went to front desk and requested two foam pillows again, told them it was our third request.  They said "I'll get right on it." My husband also left a note for housekeeping.  When we got back that evening, we had ONE foam pillow.  That's when we gave up and accepted that one of us would have a neck ache this entire trip.Service in the restaurant at breakfast was extremely slow to non-existent.  Day 1, we waited a very long time to order.  My husband ordered pancakes, they brought him an omelette.  By the time they made the right order, I was done eating.  Then we had to wait for the bill.  Next two breakfasts, we did continental, STILL had to wait for a bill to leave a tip.  Very frustrating.  If you want a quick breakfast, go anywhere else.  Also, if you want the continental breakfast, go early. They don't replenish often, so by the last half hour your choices beyond toast and fruit are pretty limited. (No cereal except oatmeal, very little fruit, pretty slim all the way through.)On the plus side, every employee we saw in the common areas said good morning/afternoon or hello.  Very friendly.Also, the afternoon concierge, Anthony, was very helpful in finding us a dinner reservation for 8. The restaurant he recommended was outstanding. Bottom line: if you don't like extremely soft pillows, bring your own because they can't seem to bring anything else.  And if you don't want a long wait for breakfast, eat somewhere else.  If those things don't matter, bed and everything else are great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Polished modern hotel, great location
text: I stayed here for three nights for business in April. I come to this area three times per year and have stayed in many hotels in this area. Everyone in my group was really impressed with this one. It's very well appointed and modern feeling in a great location. Staff were helpful and attentive. The second floor lounge is a great little hangout spot with a fantastic view. The hotel toiletries I usually don't find worth a mention but these were special and are going home with me. The elevators were oddly confusing and a source of entertainment throughout my stay as I laughed at self and others. Eventually they will need to probably replace these with a more conventional setup to avoid complaints from people less easily amused than I am.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good but expected a little more.
text: Concierge was great! Got us reservations into a popular restaurant on a Saturday night last minute. We also loved the texting option available to us. Made communication with the hotel super convenient.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent service at downtown location
text: Stayed at the property for 5 nights while attending a show and meetings.  Enjoyed excellent service.  In particular from Anthony Gates working the concierge desk.  Front desk team was excellent too. Very good rooms.  Excellent TVs.  Average beds.  Pillows are way too thick.  Great showers.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel
text: I spent 3 nights at the London House for a conference and enjoyed every minute of it. The rooms were stylish and extremely clean with everything I needed. The service I received at the bar and restaurant were superb as well as the food and drinks. The front desk attendants were friendly and efficient as well as the other hotel staff. Will definitely stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love this hotel!
text: Stayed 2 nights for fun before 2 night work trip.   Fantastic location and really awesome space.   Amenities in the room were great, and decor was just perfect.  LondonHouse will definitely be my hotel of choice on future trips to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse a lovely, chic surprise
text: I came to Chicago for a conference and the hotel rooms at the Hyatt were booked.  So glad LondonHouse was an alternative.  Just a block away from the Hyatt, this was a stylish, comfortable, clean, chic hotel with a spacious room, sumptuous linens, and river views.  The staff was attentive and friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel and great place to stay
text: I an currently in my last night of 5 nights and this  has been a great experience.  The hotel is gorgeous and preserves the feel of its previous life while providing all the comforts of a modern stay.  The fitness center had everything I needed and fully media-friendly.  The room was spacious, well put together, and the bed was incredibly comfortable.  The rooftop bar is a great experience with an incredible view.  Will absolutely return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Service and Attention to Detail!
text: I highly recommend this hotel for service, location and attention to detail.  I am a long time Hilton Honors member and stayed here because the conference hotel was completely booked.  What a breath of fresh air.  The LondonHouse rivals other Hilton brands, such as the Conrad and the Waldorf Astoria in NYC.  Great experience!  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (even texting me several time daily to check on my needs and satisfaction), the room extremely fresh, new and clean, and the dining facilities were great.  Not a big of fan of the "reimagined cuisine" at the 21st floor restaurant, but did have an exceptional omelet there. Drinks were awesome.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Choice for 4 day stay on business
text: I have been a Hilton Honors member for many, many years and have never stayed at a Curio Collection hotel.  It was awesome!  From being greeted upon arrival, to being  upgraded to a one bedroom suite, to the front desk personnel, to the staff in both restaurant locations - all truly exceeded my expectations!  I received service rivaling the Conrad and the Waldorf Astoria (NYC).  Hilton should be very proud to call this hotel one of their properties.  Strongly recommend this hotel when staying in Chicago.  Did I mention just steps from Michigan Avenue and all the great shopping on the Miracle Mile - awesome location in addition to service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stumbled upon LondonHouse-----So Glad I Did!!
text: Attended a conference in Chicago last week (which alternates between 2 different chains each year) and this year was Hilton.  When traveling, I prefer to not stay at the host conference hotel (services suffer, too crowded).  My search offered LondonHouse as an alternative and I loved the boutique feel of the place.  This is a new property (not sure what it was before LondonHouse) and, upon arrival, I was very pleasantly surprised.  First, I was allowed via the app to select my room ahead of time and it was ready when I arrived.  Had a very comfortable and well appointed room on the 20th floor with great views of the Chicago River and N. Michigan Ave.  Oh, I forgot to mention that I was born/raised in Chicago!  Only concern I had w/the 20th floor room was the restaurant/bar was on the 21st floor and I could hear tables/chairs being moved from time to time - not enough to become a real concern though.  Room was super clean, comfortable bedding, and bathroom spotless.  Room had a small sitting area (in the corner) and a Nespresso Machine.  Wow - I hadn't used one before but now planning to purchase one.  Used the fitness center and though small it had very good equipment, free weights, and a separate area for core exercises.  TV monitors on treadmill and elliptical machines are huge.  The only reason I didn't give LH an excellent rating was the service lapses, especially from the housekeeping staff.  Front Desk staff was very good/attentive.  I actually had to make 3 separate calls to have my room cleaned.  By the 3rd call, i'd decided that all I needed was to have my towels and coffee replenished (as I was not ready to take a long nap).  HK arrived with coffee but not towels, then with only the very large towels and not face/hand ones.  They got it right eventually but I attribute it to this being a new property and service kinks still being worked out.  The Bell Staff were also fine but one of my pet peeves is to be hounded to assist with bags - when it's clear that I don't need assistance.  Finally, the location is 2nd to none! If you want shopping, there's N. Michigan Ave right out the front door - or State Street in the other direction - all very short walks.  Overall, this is definitely among my new top facilities to stay whenever I'm in Chicago.  Again, glad I stumbled upon this place!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Chicago Experience
text: 131]------original review-------Subject: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by HiltonLocation: Chicago, Illinois, United States, North AmericaTitle: Perfect Chicago Experience ID#: 471896879The LondonHouse is the perfect juxtaposition of modern comfort and classic architecture in a hotel. The building is beautiful and well preserved from the 1920's with classical features (marble walls for example), and then completely updated and modern rooms. The location may be the best in Chicago, on a wide boulevard intersecting Wacker and Michigan Avenues, it is very easy to drive to and to get anywhere in Chicago from. There are stunning river views from every floor, with huge windows to enjoy the views from.The lobby's open bar and restaurant is comfortable with beautiful views and attentive friendly service. The 21st floor restaurant and bar has the best lunch special in town with a 3 course meal and cocktail for $20. It was delicious. It does seem to be a hot spot for young locals and deservedly so. The 21st floor outdoor bar and lounge is spectacular with stunning views. The rooms are attractive, comfortable and quiet. The beds are very comfy and the housekeeping service was excellent. I loved the bathroom products and they were restocked daily. The staff made us feel very welcome and I look forward to staying there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Birthday
text: Great view and atmosphere. Rooms were a bit small but nice and clean. Over all it was a nice place to stay for a weekend although I didn't like how much it cost for valet parking. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice property
text: Very nice stay!  Property was very modern with some old world charm.  Rooms were very nice, food was pretty good and the staff seemed to enjoy their positions and were helpful.  I would check out this property again in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely from start to finish
text: This hotel is well situated, QUIET, and has a highly professional staff! Rooms are spacious and linens are beautiful on comfortable beds - love, love, love it!  There is a fun, energetic vibe to the hotel that helps give you a sense of place, but the room appointments afford a luxurious respite from the vibrancy of Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Staycation
text: We live in chicago and love to venture out in our town.  Was amazed to find Londonhouse right on the river and Michigan ave.  The room was a large king beautiful modern clean great views.  Staff was so helpful and friendly.  Great Gem !!! We will be back

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel!  The rooms and bedding are top of the line.  Great location.  True luxury for an extremely reasonable price.  It is my go-to hotel in Chicago.  If not for the horrendous TRUMP sign accross the street, it would be the perfect hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful stay!
text: LondonHouse is located a stone's throw from the Magnificent Mile, great restaurants and the Millennium Park. We stayed here for a night - I wish I could extend my stay here! The staff was very warm and helpful. The concierge helped us with reservations to restaurants and sightseeing tips. The room was comfy - clean with great views and great linen! Loved the breakfast and the view from the top.  I loved how the hotel integrates old and new architecture seamlessly. Will definitely be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very pleasantly surprised
text: My wife and I stayed here for a quick getaway night and really enjoyed this hotel, the decor, and the service.  While the Waldorf remains our favorite hotel in Chicago, this will be our "go to" Hilton property in Chicago when looking for a value alternative.  We definitely preferred this property to the Conrad.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience at LondonHouse Chicago
text: The LondonHouse Chicago is one of the best Hilton Hotels I've ever stayed at. They provide excellent service, clean, comfortable rooms, and two nice restaurant/bars. Michelle in the Lobby Bar is the best bartender - fun, polite, and she makes a great margarita and also recommends great wine! I'll be back next year.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite Chicago Hotel and Lobby Bat
text: This new boutique hotel from Hilton in the heart of Chicago is a must stay when visiting the city. Amazing and attentive staff. Killer rooftops views! Plus, the bartender Michelle is personable & one killer mixologist located in the relaxing and well decorated lobby bar of the hotel. Will always stay here when in the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bridges Lobby Bar
text: The hotel is amazing!  Michelle is a genius mixologist at the Lobby Bar.  Highly recommended!  The Vesper and Cosmo were unparalleled with any I have had before.The rooms are very quiet and comfortable.  Love being able to use my phone to open the door.  I will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick business trip
text: What a interesting hotel!  We were in town for a two night business meeting, and I was very impressed by the hotel very quickly.  Excellent rooms, great location!  But the best part was the restaurant on the 21st floor.  Great decor, service and place to meet for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or at the end of the day.  To top it off was the access to the 22 floor, which had great roof top views of the city and river!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the Best in Chicago
text: We had a wonderful stay at the LondonHouse for our "birthday weekend".  Of course the location is perfect but the staff of this hotel made our stay one of the best we've ever experienced.  They were attentive and service minded, always paying attention to the hotel patrons.  We had a little glitch with the heat in our room but the Engineering Department of the hotel quickly resolved the issue and all was well.  This is a great hotel in a perfect location with fantastic staff that makes it patrons comfortable and at home.  I strongly recommend staying at the LondonHouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: First time at this hotel and have to say it is wonderful. Great location and the rooms are comfortable. I did not have dinner on the 21st floor, but understand the view is amazing. I did have drinks and dinner on the 2nd floor at Bridges bar.  The food and drinks are great, but the friendly customer service we received from Christine, Lucia and Curt was amazing. They truly made a difference in our stay and I recommend asking for them when you visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Had a great experience on a recent business trip to this hotel.  They did a great job taking care of our whole group. Thank you for the great hospitality.  Looking forward to coming back to this hotel during my next business trip

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A lovely upscale hotel with perfect location
text: Tastefully decorated rooms with concern for guests comfort. Hilton consistently has the most comfortable beds and pillows. Staff was friendly and very helpful. A great experience. Could have more storage space for long visit clients. "Dresser" drawers were under the bed.  A gorgeous view of the Chicago skyline and Trump Tower.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning views and THE BEST STAFF
text: Stayed here for a company sponsored workshop and can't say enough great things about the entire event and stay. The location is EXCELLENT, the views are to die for, (do not miss the viewing deck on the 21st floor) the rooms are stunning and less than a year old at this point. The staff was so sweet/fun/kind/helpful. Authentic, approachable, non-snooty folks (very different than what you'd get across the street). The event space was perfect (a wedding there would be incredible) and everybody from staff to client attendees raved about the entire experience. Big love to the LH folks. I would love to come back and explore chi-town a bit more. Stay here. You will not be disappointed! To the bellman, thanks for accepting my hug since I was out of cash for a tip! ;)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: room
text: The rooms were not tidied daily, and the products were not replaced in the bathroom.  The bed was not tidy, even requesting.  Extremely noisy suite because it is near the elevator,  Very difficult to understand such an attitude, in a hotel of this category.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, nice property
text: Not a fan of hotels where the lobby is anywhere other than the ground floor, so the stay got off to the wrong start when we had to take an elevator to check in.  But thankfully that was the low point.  Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, nice lobby bar area, a pretty extensive fitness center, good sound proofing.  Excellent location for sightseeing and dining.Desk lamp was a total joke, More like a giant frosted Christmas bulb that puts light out in all directions, which is actually counter productive to getting work done.Unfortunately, every time someone on the hall within 3 or so rooms closed their door it reverberated into the room.  Excellent views of the river and up Michigan Ave.  We got a view across the river which, because it is partly cut off by the edge of the building, read "RUMP", on the front of his hotel.  Corner Bakery on ground floor.  Cafe/Bar on top floor.  Nice place with good ambiance, but falsely billed as rooftop. There is not so much as glimpse of any view from the couple of small wire-covered windows, let alone a true rooftop,  Excellent internet.  Would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, Elegance, Class
text: Unfortunately, I was only able to be here for a night. This hotel is perfectly located on the Chicago River- within walking distance of all the major loop attractions. Have spent many business trips in Chicago and this is by far my favorite hotel in the area. The valet parking (only parking option) is a little expensive, but the room is well worth the rate. The continental breakfast is sufficient and other, warm/hot options are available as add on's for small change. Hilton Honors benefits are delivered quickly and with a smile. I will make this property a priority when looking to book in the future! You should too. The room is immaculate, decor is beautiful, views are great. No complaints.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: I was in town for business, the location was very good and the accomidations were great. The view is great, from the roof top bar. The staff was very helpful and curteous at all times. The elevators are interesting!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Convenient location, Beautiful hotel
text: I stayed at the Londonhouse Chicago for work, was super impressed by the luxury accommodations and loved the location - not only was it a short walk to my office, but it allowed me to explore the surrounding areas on foot, with many popular attractions being within a few blocks or less.  As a female traveling solo, I felt safe and secure coming and going from my room and also to/from the surrounding area.  The staff was super attentive and helpful to me from the moment I stepped foot onto the property until my departure - they even flagged down a safe taxi cab to get me back to the airport.  I hope to stay at the LH on future business trips but will also consider it for personal travel and will recommend to friends/family who are traveling to the great city of Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A must-visit for your trip to the Windy City!
text: friends    2 reviews5.0 star rating3/25/2017I would like to start by saying this hotel is absolutely breathtaking. From the location and the view to the inside of the establishment, I promise you will not be disappointed. However, my main reason I felt compelled to write a review was the experience I had at the spa within the hotel. I had never had a facial before purchasing the service here and I was quite excited and hopeful for a positive experience. I was beyond impressed with what I received. My esthetician Cassandra was warm and welcoming all while being extremely professional the entire time. She is sure to describe all that she is doing should you ask so you know exactly what is occurring if you are curious like I was. Or if you are a more frequent facial customer, she keeps the experience very serene and peaceful so you can enjoy the service to the fullest extent possible. I purchased the hydrafacial and I left the spa with my skin feeling so rejuvenated and moisturized! Also, it is very apparent she is skilled in giving facials as her process and technique is FLAWLESS.
