If you choose to visit the hotel's spa, be sure you don't leave without getting a facial from Cassandra, you will be so happy you did!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect hotel management, perfect rooms and best views in chicago
text: This is our 5th or 6th trip to Chicago.We stayed at four seasons, langham, conrad etc. and this time we canceled conrad after two days, we moved to hotel Londonhouse...First off all Jim from the front desk was so much helpfull to find us a right room, with a floor ceiling windows and best possible view, he came with us and showed us few free rooms for our 9 night stay, i think that no one would do that for you. They deserve 10 stars!Jim was asking every time when he saw us do we need something or do we have some problem or some question...During our stay everything we had problem with, Jim was there to help, we also had their phone number.Stuff is incredible, restaurant is very nice and cosy, rooms are clean and pretty, with awesome views of chicago river and city.Hotel management is very professional and of course once again JIM.Such a kind and polite person who wants to help and to make your stay beautiful and you will feel like a princess or a king!Location is the best!Best hotel in Chicago, worth every dollar.Superrrrrr

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Customer service
text: Lady at the front desk called Savannah was fantastic....superlative customer service. The property is central located and restaurant st floor 21 was  excellent. The rooms were good and spacious. It over looks the river side. It was a good experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: CPA
text: Very nice hotel! Have stayed in many 4-5 stars in the same area and this one is definitely right up there. Fitness area a little small but adequate. View from rooftop is spectacular! Operable windows also a plus for fresh air.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Place
text: This hotel is conveniently located. The room was spacious and tastefully decorated. The most impressive feature was the lighting system; room lights turned on upon entering the room and during the night, bathroom light turned on when approaching the bathroom. Staff were efficient and polite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Had an overnight trip to Chicago, it was a superb hotel. Beautifully decorated, staff was excellent, room was quaint but very tastefully decorated. Very Well Worth it. I would absolutely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, exceptional service
text: Loved my stay.  Location is ideal with excellent views of the river.    Staff was amazing.   One small flaw is the transition to a "continental" only breakfast fir HHONORS member. Unfortunately they have decided to forego the practice of a simple upcharge and this is not good for someone like me who cant eat sugary cereals and bread. I think this is short sighted and will be resolved when HHONORS members voice their concerns.  I will tell you this,  the omelet was great!  Just not worth the $36 I was charged to eat it!!!!Thank you for your hospitality.  I have tweeted and posted my praise on social media. Hope nobody hears me though so i can have this hotel available whenever i am in chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Stay
text: The LondonHouse was absolutely perfect in every way. The staff was exceptional from the door man to the front check in desk and everything in-between. Our room was facing the river so we had a beautiful view. Even being on a busy corner you do not hear the street noise at all. The rooms are a perfect size, clean and very up to date. This is a great hotel with everything you need to call it home for a day or a week. We had an amazing stay and will come back to stay in a heart beat.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome Gem
text: Excellent Hotel.  Stayed 4 to 5 days a week for several weeks. Great staff at front desk and 21st floor Bar/Restaurant.  Excellent Bar and Restaurant and enjoy Roof Top facility during milder weather. Enjoyed my stay each time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHotel in Chicago
text: Great hotel in fantastic location. Would highly recommend. Nice breakfast and lunch on second floor and dinner and drinks on 21 floor. Within walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Beautiful views.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Could Be My New Favorite Hotel
text: My wife and I went to Chicago to visit our son. I had points to use so we tried a new hotel, The Londonhouse. Firstly, what  great location! The hotel is located basically right on the Chicago River, right off of Michigan Avenue. But there are many hotels in Chicago with a great location. It takes more than that for me. The Londonhouse delivers.Like every Hilton I have been in, the people are fantastic. From the valets to the bellmen to the front desk to the people in the bars, everyone was so professional but also outgoing. All seemed to truly care about my needs. We arrived shortly after 3pm. Our room was not ready. Zonnie, at the front desk, was extremely helpful. She took time to see if there was an upgrade that would work. There was not (we already had a suite reserved so there wasn't a lot to upgrade). She offered us two complimentary drinks at the bar in the lobby, stating she would put a rush on our room.Speaking of the bar, there are two in the hotel. The lobby bar has a great view of the Chicago River and is great for people watching. It is quiet and there was a gentleman playing keyboard. The hotel has some signature drinks. I tried the old fashion. It was fantastic! The other bar is on the 21st floor with rooftop availability. This bar serves meals and the music is louder. The vibe is more "hip." My wife and I agreed, we like the more subdued atmosphere of the lobby bar. To each his own...Our room was magnificent. It was large, clean and well appointed. The bedroom was separate from a nice living room area. The bathroom was down the hall and was quite large and plenty bright. Plenty of room for the both of us to get ready at the same time. Two large flat screens, one in the bedroom, one in the living room made it fun to watch the NCAA basketball tournament when we were in between events.We have stayed at many hotels in Chicago. There is one in particular that we frequent. It would take a lot for me to change to a new "go to" hotel. This one just may do it. I put a high premium on the people. The Londonhouse scores a perfect "ten" with it's people. The rest is just icing on the cake. If you want a well located hotel on or just off Michigan Avenue, stop searching. This IS where you want to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: St. Patrick's Day
text: This hotel was exceptional.  It was in the perfect location and was beautifully appointed.  Theer are a number of restaurants and sites within walking distance.  The staff were also outstanding.  We cannot wait to visit again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Still My Favorite Hotel!
text: Revisited the LondonHouse for one night on business and still it a great experience!I would highly recommend checking in via the Hilton Honors Mobile app, this will also allow you to chose the rooms available from a hotel map (by floors) and receive a Digital Room Key that will lock/unlock your room door and letting you go straight to the room upon arrival at the hotel.On this visit I managed to get the personal device entertainment working on the TV. This allowed me to stream my Netflix account onto the in-room TV via the hotel wifi.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Again, flawless.
text: Once again, LondonHouse scores a perfect score from me.First, I made reservations for two clients that accompanied me on the trip, and needed to make an adjustment- I got immediate help. I love this place.With service that exceeds expectations, and one of the most spectacular views in Chicago, LH is a sure fire winner.It's upscale-modern, but never pastiche. It's a comfortable, accessible, stylish alternative to some of the Chicago stalwarts.The staff texted me after I had checked in to make sure all was well. When I needed to extend my stay, I did it all via text.  That may sound impersonal to some, but to me- it was so convenient- it felt hyper-personal. And I was super busy, so this took the headache out of the  process.Kudos to LONDON HOUSE.I'll be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location!
text: Even though I was here for work it was the perfect choice for me. Convenient location, amazing views, very spacious room, extremely clean with a very chic vibe. The restaurant/lobby bar was excellent. I can only imagine that this is the spot to be in the summer on the rooftop!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House
text: Beautifully done with excellent service.  Love the shampoo and conditioner!  My company has secured a corporate rate at the Trump hotel across the street for a better price/night, but I choose to stay at the London House and have done so for the past 3/4 trips to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay for St. Pattie's Day Weekend
text: Our hotel was great and everyone we dealt with was very kind. We also got to see the river turn green from our hotel room and skip the crowd below. Loved our stay at a great hotel. My wife also had a dress issue as the hem came undone just before our night out and the front desk gladly sent up a sewing kit within minutes and saved the dress!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Relieved!!
text: My daughter picked this off the internet for a short spring break getaway. The hotel was worth the price to us. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and amazingly quiet. For an older property (I think) everything was quite modern. Wonderful view of the green river and downtown, walking distance to most of our destinations or a short Uber ride, wall mounted large screen tv, huge shower, great bathroom lighting, and excellent room service. Many safety features for checking in and elevator use were appreciated. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Bar prices are high and would like more menu items in the restaurant, but this didn't affect our stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Poor management
text: I have stayed 3 different times at this "new" property.  My last 2 stays were met with total disappointment.I was placed in a dirty room both times. While the 2nd stay they put me in a different room, my 3rd stay I didn't even care at that point having yet again experienced another dirty room.  I reached out to the GM via email and phone messages, but the GM didn't even have the care to respond.  I think this reflects absolutely how this hotel is managed. And there were other issues making my stays more stressful instead of relaxing and enjoyable.I won't discuss the unprofessionalism of the front of the house staff and have never been treated so rudely at checkout.   I suggest that if you encounter the male at checkout, wait and change lines to avoid him!It's to bad. This hotel is a hot hot property.  And could be tops in Chicago, but I would never return because of how poorly it is run.üëé

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely hotel in great location
text: Lovely hotel throughout. Stayed on the 20th floor with a great view. The hotel upgraded us to a suite as Hilton Honors members. The room was spacious and quiet; included robes, slippers, refrigerator, and a Nespresso machine. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Want to mention Michelle in the lobby bar, who made her own crafted cocktails, gave great service, and was very nice to talk to.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the best hotel locations in Chicago
text: This is brand new Curio Hotel by Hilton in a historic bank building. It is on the corner of Wacker Drive and Michigan Avenue, a unique spot close the Art Institute,  Architecture Foundation and Michigan Avenue.  It faces the Chicago river offering some great views including from the Lobby Lounge.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location; Great Beds; Great Service
text: I spend a lot of time in Chicago for meetings.  Sometimes I am here just one night; sometimes for 4 or 5 days in a row.  My go-to hotel was the old Conrad.  It became the Glen, although a new Conrad has opened.  I had been waiting for the Londonhouse to open for quite some time.   The location is absolutely perfect for walking to meetings in the Loop, but also walking to Michigan Avenue.  You're really just close to so many things.  The staff is incredible, also.  They text you to make sure that things are going ok and yet they aren't intrusive.  The elevators are awesomely cool -- you program in the floor you want and you're directed to an elevator.  It does cut down on the traffic of waiting for an elevator.I have to admit I am a Hilton Diamond member, so I probably get some perks that other don't, but certainly less perks than a Doubletree Inn.I can't say enough about the beds or the bedding.  I wish I could just take it home with me. The showers are nice, but I wish they had included a removable handle for the shower head.  I love that they give you a small sponge so the delightful body wash isn't ruined by using a washcloth.The breakfast could use some help.  I loved the breakfast at the old Conrad and breakfast at the Wit down the street is fantastic.  They have a long way to go.  I know they can do it becuase they have a great hamburger at night!This is my go-to in Chicago.  I am here now for one night.  Was here last week for 4 nights.  Will be back in 2 weeks for another night.  I just can't say enough good things.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Even the Commode Flusher Is Great...
text: Reviewing a different hotel in Chicago is very hard for me. You see, most of my favorite hotels are right here. I'm very picky about where I stay here because the hotel quality is amazing. I found out my organization had booked me at a place I'd never heard of, Londonhouse, so I was a bit skeptical.Ugh. I have a new favorite place in Chicago. Sorry Gwen and Conrad, I feel like I'm cheating on you.Let's start with the location. While it's across the bridge, it's the closest you can be to the Michigan Avenue action on this side of it. The big plus is you're closer to the theater district.The decor is insanely great. Each tiny detail is absolutely perfect. And it's just not perfect in the common areas. The room details are exquisite. From the etchings in the sliding bathroom doors to the perfect, fresh light fixtures to the built in cabinetry, it's all flawless.They use Malin+Goetz toiletries, which I usually order, I love so much. Even the stupid things like the commode flusher is cool. Their elevators are timed perfectly, too.I had to find something wrong with this place, so I decided it had to be in the hot water and how long it takes to get hot. So, I timed it. Ugh, it only took 3 seconds to get hot. I seriously can find nothing wrong with this place besides having to look at the Trump logo outside my window, and that's not their fault. Home run, Hilton family. Home run.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bar/lounge
text: The lounge area is amazing and the food and service is great as well. Michelle at the bridges lobby bar was super great and attentive. You should definitely stay at the London house hotel, and if you can't stay than definitely come at checkout the bridges lobby bar or the rooftop that overlooks the city

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location and great staff.
text: If you're looking for a great hotel in Chicago, in a great location with great staff you can't go wrong with the LondonHouse. The hotel is modern and contemporary and has everything you need for a relaxing stay in Chicago.  The food and drink is high quality, the bedrooms are well equiped and modern, and the staff are outstanding.  The location is perfect - close to the business areas but also the plentiful shopping on Michigan.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Originally rated it higher, downgrading based on further experience
text: I originally gave this place a much better review when we first checked in. However, I'm downgrading that to reflect further experience.First the good. The location is outstanding. Close to theaters, shopping, Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park. Staff is nice.Now for the not so good. We booked a one bedroom suite. The desk is in the small bedroom, and the living room is just tiny. The room is very dark, and the (hard to operate) lighting can't compensate.Just like the room isn't enough, well, room, it doesn't have enough of a lot of other necessities. Five hangers is not enough for one person, much less two. Nespresso is nice, but two pods and one sugar is barely a portion for one (even though two cups are provided). Only two drinking glasses in the bathroom. Both dirty. No other glasses to be found. I know one can request more coffee and hangers, you shouldn't have to. We requested more coffee before we went out, came back much later to find request not met. Called again. They brought up a hodgepodge of coffee stuff in what was clearly a used Ziploc baggie. In addition to the dirty glasses, we found debris of some sort next to the desk. Never picked up the entire time we were there.Other odd details: the safe is on the floor in the closet. The drawers are under the bed. All very nice if you are low to the ground but most people aren't two feet tall. The somewhat frosted glass barn door to the bathroom is odd. No way to use the bathroom unless everyone is very familiar with each other. The closet is also small and the sliding doors don't really slide but will grudgingly move if enough force is applied. Only a tiny portion of the shower handle can be used to hang towels. No other towel bars. At. All.The final annoyance with this place was that the last two nights were confirmed at a slightly lower rate than the first. I called to check out and they emailed the invoice. They charged the higher rate for all three nights. HHonors customer service asked the hotel to fix it. They never did.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Shh, don't tell anyone.
text: This is a gorgeous Hilton property that I hesitate to review positively, as it will be forever booked, and the rates will go through the roof. The rooms are beautiful and the staff goes out of there way to make sure everything is just right. I travel close to 45 weeks a year and would put this property in the top 3 Hilton properties I've stayed in.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Hotel - An absolute gem!
text: I stayed here for 1 night during my vacation in Chicago.  I absolutely loved it (apart from one aspect which I will cover later).  The hotel is modern, slightly funky but not forced.  It was warm, inviting and friendly.  I checked in and although my first room was near a loud ice machine, so I asked to be moved, my second room was wonderful.  And as it turns out had a great view of the turning the river green ceremony!The lobby is on the 2nd floor, along with a bar.  The staff were really friendly and I got an upgrade for being a Diamond Member, along with a voucher for breakfast on the 21 Floor restaurant.  The room was wonderful - actually one of the best hotel rooms I have stayed in.  It was not over the top luxurious so it was homely and cosy.  A great layout and a wonderful bathroom.  The amenities were high end too - not the use Hilton ones.  The bed was so comfortable - in fact I am annoyed as I was going to look for a brand -  I have issues with my back in some hotels but not this one.  I slept wonderfully. There were sockets in the right place and the hairdryer was of good quality.I had a few drinks and some food in the bar.  This is the only thing I would ask the manager to look at - the staff in there were a little off-putting.  There was a barman who thought he was auditioning for a cabaret show and took all the attention towards him in a quiet bar relaxing bar.  In fact he kept raising his voice to go over the jazz duo!!.  I was also disappointed that when I ordered a LH daiquiri off the menu, he made a big song and dance about how he had never done one and he had no idea how to make it and what was he supposed to do with the black lime that it was topped with!  I very nearly went over and said dont bother, pour me a wine!  The bar lady that took over from him was in a right sulk about something and at one stage stormed off - I was not sure she would be back but when she was she was quite unprofessional talking about how 'management...etc etc' - something to do with stock levels.  I say this as I thought it was a little odd to have such unprofessional folks in a bar that was high end and had a great atmosphere!  There was a lady with long red hair that did her best to calm everything down and deserved a medal!Normally, I would take a star off for something like that, however this hotel is that good that I just couldnt - I just hope management have a word.  Location wise you cant get much better - it is right in the centre of things and next to the picturesque part of the city.  I had breakfast at the restaurant on the 21st floor and it was nice, the waitress and door men were particularly stand out.Please please stay here if you can - you wont be disappointed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Super nice
text: We found this in our search for a HH hotel. Initially we had opted for a higher floor but upon checking in - very early, the higher floor was not ready. The gentleman at the hotel suggested the 6th floor and he was spot on. The view was wonderful. The facility is very classy. This is our new go to hotel for Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing!
text: We stayed for night for a couples get away. We reserved a King corner studio suite. We were located on the 17th floor of the hotel. After walking in the place it looks just amazing! From the front desk to our room. We ended up with the most amazing views! Front view of the city and if we looked out the side window we could look right down at the lake. The Nespresso was a great touch in the room. Bed was so comfortable, plenty of hot water and great extras in the bathroom. We enjoyed the bar on 21st floor however $34.00 for 2 drinks was very expensive even for Chicago! We had the breakfast included the next day and it's also served in the bar in the mornings. It would have been a great breakfast BUT the service was terrible. We asked for coffee and juice that took a good 20 minutes to get. Once we got our breakfast then we were ignored until they came to take our plates and he took my plate before I was finished and cleaned the table. We ended up just leaving at that point. Overall we will stay here again but we won't be going here for a meal. It turned me off that all the service wasn't the same level throughout the hotel. The front desk was great and the bartender & waitresses were fantastic but during the breakfast it seemed that many of the employees could care less if you have a good experience or not. That's the only reason I wouldn't rate it a 5.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location. Style. Service.
text: Older converted hotel that is part of Hilton's Curio Collection (you get points *and* character). The lobby area is very nicely designed and is manned by some top-notch people. Finding my room was a bit tricky as I'll argue that the little signs outside the elevators on each floor (rooms "100-105 that way" etc) aren't clearly laid out. Then again, I may just be slow-witted (or a slow-witted person who sleeps in hotels many times a week).For an old hotel, the rooms are nicely sized - which is usually not the case with these converted older properties. Great bathroom. Great shower. Comfortable bed and a nice desk for working. Oh, the windows open a bit which is great if it's february and the weather is in the 60's for some reason. View of the river and the city is spectacular - even though there is a huge TRUMP sign on the building across the street. Classy.Would gladly stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Sanctuary of Luxury
text: I cannot praise this newly-renovated, Hotel and its staff highly enough!  I have traveled the world, both on business and pleasure, and looked in this case for a luxury hotel, with a friendly, accommodating staff, in an excellent location downtown.  I found that and more in the London House, in its front desk staff that personalized our experience, and in the luxurious comfort of our Guest Room, with its great view of the City and the canal.  That and an excellent value, with excellent Bar, roof-top view, Gym, and guest services - concierge.  Above all was the friendliness of the Staff throughout our multi-day visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: This hotel's beauty is second to the amazing service
text: This is a long overdue review of my visit to the LondonHouse in June 2016. I arrived just a few days after it opened. As I walked into the hotel I was greeted by the valet and bell staff. I always travel light so I didn't need luggage assistance but I did ask them for directions to the lobby. The lobby was located on the 2nd floor and had beautiful lighting and art hugging the walls. I was greeted by Savanah who checked me into my reservation. She explained my Honors benefits that included daily breakfast, wifi, and a little information on the area. The guest room was modern, sheek, and just stunning. As you walk in there is a restroom with a giant glass shower and a rainfall shower head, the amenities were luxury as well. The space smelled clean and fresh, which is exactly what you expect. Next was a good sized living room with a sofa, table, TV, and espresso coffee maker (which was impressive). The bedroom had a king sized bed with crisp white linen, plenty of lighting, a small work desk, TV, nice sized closet space, and floor to ceiling windows that overlooked Chicago's riverfront. The view was worth a thousand dollars itself. It was evident that the AC was not functioning, but after a phone call a technician quickly addressed the issue and there were no further problems. The morning breakfast was located on the lobby level. Fresh coffee, pastries, fruit, yogurt, and a cook making fresh omelets and eggs. I also had the chance to visit the upstairs lounge/bar. Their selection of whiskey was nice but the crowd was stiff, nothing against the hotel of course. Overall the accommodations were superb but the staff was the star of the show. Their level of service is commendable. I cannot wait to return in a few months.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Enjoyed our stay
text: We enjoyed our stay at the LondonHouse.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was nice and relaxing.  It was excellent walking distance to a lot of the tourist activities and the miracle mile.  The room was a lot quieter than some hotels that you have in the city were you here all the siren and car honking noise.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Newer, Great Location, still Affordable!
text: This is a great hotel, you sit  right on Wacker Street with views of the river.  The rooms are elegant and sporty like Virgin hotel without the in your face look at me of Trump and the W.  The staff are welcoming and room service is quick and tasty.  Decent wine is served by the glass and less than feeling violated prices.  Only hold back is you might need to walk down the street closer to the Wyndham as the taxis seem to line up there rather than go an extra 100 feet.  In general it is a great spot to stay for business in the loop or pleasure elsewhere.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place downtown Chicago and VERY QUIET!
text: OK... as a platinum, I had a terrific price and room upgrade for a Sunday evening into a suite right next to the elevator. I asked for a quiet room and she guaranteed me that due to the multi room design, any noise from the elevator would be well away from the bedroom and she was right on. Breakfast for HH was very good.If you need to park, best to walk a few blocks to find $20 overnight (no in and out) vs $70ish at the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location - hot water problem
text: We loved the hotel location and room.  We were walking distance to all the places we wanted to see.  I'm a Hilton member so they upgraded us to a beautiful corner unit. The first night I noticed that the shower didn't get hot enough and I reported it to the front desk.  The next day I reported it again and a maintenance man came up.  He told me that the water gets warm but I expect it to get very hot especially in Chicago in January.  The interesting thing is that the water in the sink was much hotter.  Anyway, the problem never got resolved. We used the gym which was fine but not special.I really wish I could give this hotel 5 stars because I loved everything else about it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, beautiful hotel
text: You can't beat the location of LondonHouse - centrally located on Chicago's riverfront Wacker Drive. Easy walk to shopping (Michigan Ave), great dining, Millennium Park and Navy Pier.  Rooms are spacious, nice lobby and impressive rooftop bar (obviously not open in winter months but you can still enjoy the view and take spectacular photos).   Worth a mention - - you enter on a ground floor and lobby is on second floor so it might be nice to have a security guard just watching the hotel/elevator activity.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay!!
text: Stayed at the London House for a family weekend. Centrally located between the art museum and shops on the mile. Service was exceptional, room was clean and beautiful, and the hotel itself had old time charm with modern touches. Our room had a view of the river!  The view of the Trump tower was a bonus!!  Attendants at the door were quick and efficient and kind. Always smiling and a polite greeting. Being a Hilton property is a bonus as points get added for stays. This is definitely a place we will return!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top Notch, Great experience
text: Wonderful hotel, great location. My advice is go to the roof top, and also call before you check in. The staff is top notch and will make your stay extra special. Experience matters and this was a great one.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing stay
text: Me and my wife came here for our one year anniversary. Immediately felt at home. The people at the front desk (especially Jim) were so kind to us and helped direct us to some great places to dine and visit. The in hotel dining and breakfast was so delicious and beautiful. Rooms were the perfect size, very well decorated, and the view was great! I definitely recommend this hotel for those visiting Chicago. I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome new hotel in Downtown Chicago
text: This is a great hotel, perfect location, awesome staff and very good food!  Went for a business meeting and would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.  Staff was very professional and attentive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and great service.
text: Stayed here for long weekend and had a great time.  Walk to many bars, restaurants and high end stores.   The staff is very attentive and the bartenders at LH21 were very courteous.   I would definitely stay again, be sure to ask for Vista View Suite to get most light in room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice
text: Enjoyed my stay here. Clean, modern, the rooms are well appointed, and a comfortable bed. The location is the bid draw here though. Great location if your in town for business or to tour the city. Plenty to do nearby and very Central. The staff is very helpful too. It's not cheap, but it's to be expected. Is stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impressive
text: Perfect location, great personable staff. Beautiful accommodations. Room, everything immaculate. Rooms incredible. Corner view was awesome. Walking distance to everything.  Views awesome. LH club on 21st floor and rooftop terrace gave incredible skyline views

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent
text: This hotel every bit of excellent from the rooms to the service. Everyone is so friendly and helpful..If I come back to chicago this is definitely the spot I'm coming to...Also you are surrounded by everything ..

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: LondonHouse Chicago was a very nice stay. Hotel was situated in a great location. Rooms were very small but perfectly what we needed. It is a new hotel. Rooms have Frette linens and bathrobes, a nice touch. View from the room was also very nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A good hotel in a great position, service so/so.
text: The hotel is well positioned in the middle of downtown Chicago. Our upgraded room was generous in size. We were promised a room with a great view. It was not. That, and the hard beds, but I guess firm mattresses seem to be fashionable in the United States. Large room, comfortable. Service was ok, but room-service forgot the (otherwise exceptional, but expensive) truffle fries, and brought them to us cold. The waitress at the bar in the reception area obviously did not want a tip. She was sour and aloof, unusual for America. Still, I would not call this a bad hotel. Fixing a few niggles could make it great. It has presence, gives an air of luxury and it is in an absolutely great position. The views from the roof top were also great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new hotel, beautiful rooftop
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse for 4 nights in February. The hotel is fantastically located right next to the river and the heart of town. It's very modern but classic. The hotel lobby and bar is very inviting. The staff at check in were very helpful.  The room was small but nice. The bathroom was huge! One flaw with the room was I had no drawers that I could use to unpack.The bed was super comfy.  The fitness center had a serviceable number of machines and weights (at 6am each one was occupied). All the equipment was high quality and new. One of the main feature of the hotel is their exquisite rooftop bar on the 22nd floor of the hotel. It overlooks the river and the lake. We happened to have arrived on 70 degree day in February so everyone in the hotel and the city had the same idea to head up there so it was great!I will absolutely go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great room, awesome view, great location
text: I recently stayed here for business and couldn't have been happier. It is located near Wabash St, directly across the river from Trump Plaza. Our headquarters is right across the street, so great location, but it would be great for anything. A elevated train station with a direct line to Midway airport is only a block away. You are in the heart of downtown with the Hancock build 10 blocks one way, Sears Tower 10 blocks the other way, and Lake Michigan and the Navy pier amusement area just a few blocks along the river. It isn't one of the giant hotels, but is a very nice, intimate business hotel. It has a rooftop restaurant & bar with really good food (pricey). It also has a very quiet lobby bar to relax in. I highly recommend for the business traveler.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Definitely would stay at Hilton Curio again
text: This was the first but not the last time I have stayed/will stay at a Hilton Curio Hotel.  The decor and amenities were up-to-date, warm, and not sterile like many chain hotels.  The staff was extremely helpful.  For example, they stayed by my side to teach me how to use their MAC, as I am used to a PC.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Review
text: Enjoyed my stay.  Room was very nice with all the latest fixtures. Staff were very nice and I thought the text message check-ins were a nice touch. As a light sleeper, one thing I noted was that there were various noises emanating from the floor above (I stayed in room 2019).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Physically Great Hotel - Service Good - Just a few glitches to mention
text: You can't do much better than this location in Chicago. Walk from here to the Loop or to North Michigan Avenue.Steps away from several places you can take a cruise on the Chicago River and/or out onto Lake Michigan (but not in the winter, of course). Wacker Drive at Michigan Avenue is a busy, busy location, but I was surprised at how quiet the room was!Our check-in experience was very good. The staff is great about checking up on you to be sure you are comfortable and to ask if you need anything. The room we were in was small, but beautifully appointed. At first we thought there was hardly any drawer space to put things away, but...be aware that there are spacious drawers under the bed.We really liked the lobby bar, and spent a little time there every day we were guests. The bar on the 21st floor is nice, but when we checked it out it was crowded and too noisy for us to enjoy. I guess you can call us old farts for that.Just 2 things kept me from rating a 4 instead of 5. First, I was a little surprised that you could walk in from the street and take the elevators directly to guest floors without inserting a room key. This, to me, is a security issue that made me a little uncomfortable. Second, we had breakfast 2 mornings on the 21st floor. First time was OK. Second time, our food was inedible. My husband's skillet breakfast was very dry, and his eggs on top extremely overcooked. My pancakes, although hot, were flavorless (how is that even possible?), and gooey and under-cooked on the inside. We did not complain, because we had free breakfast coupons. Also on this morning, my husband was seated for at least 5 minutes before he got coffee. I observed enough staff for the guests present, but a lack of coordination of service.All in all, we would probably stay there again, but would go elsewhere for breakfast.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved this hotel!
text: New favorite hotel in Chicago! You cannot beat this spot for the rate! The service was amazing and the texting ability really added an extra touch. So convenient to just text your needs/questions/requests! We visited the spa and the services were really nice. The bed and shower were amazing. Loved the lobby bar and the rooftop bar. The view from our room was amazing. Everything was clean and beautiful. Highly recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful and affordable
text: I booked this hotel as a treat for my best friend who has had a rough few months. I spent two nights there and found everything exquisite. For the location and the style, I found the price to be extremely reasonable. Also, I received a wonderful reference to a great sushi place from the woman at the lobby bar. This was an all around beautiful hotel with great service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend getaway
text: My wife and I went to Chicago for a weekend trip, took in Hamilton and had a great stay. The London House was a excellent hotel, great location and a great value for the price. The rooftop wasn't open given the time of year but the bar was very nice. Staff were excellent, room was clean and well appointed. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay, incredible view!
text: Very nice Modern hotel with excellent views of Downtown Chicago. Make sure you get a room with a Floor to Ceiling window, it'll be worth the upgrade cost. Staff was pleasant but with the electronic key I didn't really have much experience with them. This might become my next "go to" hotel when in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new favorite Chicago hotel!
text: Stayed at the London House last week while on business trip and absolutely loved it. It's in a great location right on the river and in the middle of downtown. It's also a short walk to mag-mile which is a nice bonus. In each of the rooms there is a Nespresso machine with three espresso capsules filled each day and they also use high end toiletries which is always a nice touch. The rooftop bar is very cool and offers great views of downtown. All that being said, the best part is the staff and communication. Instead of calling down to make any requests, they are available by text message and respond very promptly. I forgot a razor and shaving cream so I sent them a text and it was delivered in no time. I will stay at this hotel every chance I get when traveling to Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: I have just returned from my first trip to Chicago. The London House Hotel was perfectly situated for all the main attractions. The hotel was lovely, nice spacious rooms, comfy bed, very quiet and the staff were friendly and accommodating. We were offered to upgrade our room to a room with a view but as we were going to be out sightseeing most of the time we didn't think it worthwhile.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lobby Bar Review
text: Michelle in the lobby bar was kind, sweet, and funny. The bar was VERY busy and she made us feel like we were the only couple sitting at the bar. She answered all of our questions and suggested custom cocktails. They were great. We will return soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
text: Location of the hotel is perfect to easily navigate the city.  Lobby bar is modern and inviting with very friendly staff.  "Rooftop" bar was equally nice with a fireplace and outdoor area that has awesome city views.  The staff was in constant communication with me via text to ensure we had a great stay and offer any assistance.  Great food, location and staff!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bar visit only
text: It was a little cold to actually sit outside and enjoy the view but we went up to look around anyway. The inside is elegant and stylishly furnished. Prices are comparable with other bars in the area. Very professional staff, clean,  and great location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great service once again!
text: This was our second time back at London House. We had a great experience with the bartender Michelle the last visit to Bridges. So we stopped in to see her again. She remembered our names and what we liked to drink! I was impressed. It made us feel at home. We will return again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A glorious repurposing of a classics building into a contemporary classic hotel.
text: With so many great hotels to choose from, I picked the London House for its location and Riverside view. What I had not anticipated was the excellent quality of the finishes and details of the building itself, or the quality of decor in the room. This is top notch.The room was spacious and very comfortable, with plush carpets, a very comfy bed, good size desk and ample hanging and closet space. The bathroom equally roomy,  with a good size walk in shower. But it is the extra touches - Malin+Goetz toiletries,  books on the shelves, blue tooth facility on the HiFi, Chromecast on the TV, and high speed WiFi for $6 per day. The view sideways from the room is a special one, looking down the line of bridges across the Chicago river. The view directly opposite is less special, as you face straight into the Trump tower parking garage or his 2 storey high illuminated sign high dominates the lower 15 floors.A small note of caution, if you book your room through a third party site (such as Booking.com) you will not receive Hhonors points. You have to book through directly through Hilton to get them. This is not something I was previously aware of, and given that there are other equally high quality places to stay in this part of Chicago, is a policy that Hilton may need to reconsider in the age of online hotel booking sites, as I feel that I should be rewarded for choosing to spend my dollars with Hilton.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing room and service
text: We were in Chicago for a family function and stayed at the London House.  Beautifully restored  older building.  Service was excellent and the room was very clean.  We had a mini suite and it was very comfortable.  The views were wonderful.  I watched the Michigan Ave. bridge go up to accommadate yachts returning to the boat yard.  the bathroom was fantastic.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very good hotel and service
text: We stayed here over the weekend and can highly recommend this hotel. Great service, perfect location, clean rooms - and a great view from the rooftop bar. They also have a small but modern fitness room. The only tricky part was to find the address on the UPPER Wacker drive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and all around Property
text: When we checked in we were greeted with smiles and willingness to accommodate any request we could come up with.  The staff was very informative about the local area and the very knowledgeable about the history of the property.  The rooms are spacious and if you are able to get a suite, they are beautiful, modern, and in some cases have phenomenal views of the city.  The restaurant and bar on the 21st floor is well stocked with a plethora of options.  The rooftop bar provides incredible views and is usually open for viewing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse
text: Hotel was beautiful!  Location is amazing!  Clean, modern, quiet rooms.  Lounge bar was great as well the restaurant and bar on the 21st floor.  Easy to walk to shopping and dining.  The bell staff was great- very helpful. Concierge helped us with restaurant suggestions.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, Location, Location
text: Downtown modern, great location. Luxurious bath rooms.  Wonderful beds.  Nice view of the river.  Near the water taxi and tour boats.  Easy walk to the Magnificent Mile for shopping.  I do plan to return again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Service at the Bell Stand
text: A giant thank you to Corey at the bell stand. My trip was from the hotel to Vernon Hills, and Uber/Lyft were not interested in traveling that far. Corey secured reasonably priced, safe transportation for me.Much appreciated!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing property, Amazing staff, Amazing view....just amazing!
text: I am in Chicago regularly for business. Since my first visit at the LondonHouse, I have changed all of my future bookings to this hotel. The staff is exceptional. Everyone I come in contact with gives extra attention and a personal touch. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are chic and comfortable. I love the location on the river. My view of Michigan Ave and the river was beautiful.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great weekend in downtown Chicago
text: We had a wonderful weekend in Chicago. Hotel staff was excellent and very accommodating. Great location, close to plenty of fine restaurants. The roof top bar was the best view of downtown Chicago with great food and drink. It's a "must do" on a sunny day!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: don't eat the food or drink the water
text: perfect hotel in a perfect location, except for the restaurant. the restaurant lack of service and bad food quality ruins what would otherwise be a perfect experience.   The hotel is new and the rooms are modern and attractive.  Great water pressure n the shower.  Great view from the roof

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional Hotel Exceptional Location
text: Had a room overlooking the Chicago River and spectacular buildings nearby.  This location can't be beat-The River @ Michigan Avenue...close to practically everything.  This hotel was a former office building that was recently opened into a phenomenal hotel.  The room was great, location awesome and great staff.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Great Addition to Chicago
text: The London House is a boutique hotel run by Hilton.  I travel a lot, so I am not easily impressed, but this hotel is great at several levels.  First of all, it has a great location at Michigan and Wacker.  Whether you are going north for shopping in the Gold Coast area, south to visit the museums or into the Loop on business, this is a convenient location.  Second, it has taken the famous, architecturally significant Stone Container office building and done a brilliant job of turning it into a hotel. The rooms are large, comfortable and beautifully decorated.   The bright, modern lobby on the second floor looks over the river and city, and features a lovely bar.  The bar on the top floor was crowded with young locals, though a bit noisy and expensive for my taste.  Finally, the staff is attentive and friendly to an extreme which is always refreshing in a large hotel.  I will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location! Great roof top bar!
text: Our stay was awesome! This hotel is located on the river. It's close to the CTA that gets you to and from  both airports.  It was also close to the theater and the magnificent mile. The hotel is swanky and elegant. The bar on the 21st floor with access to the roof offers an amazing sunset experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse - Where History Meets Hospitality
text: We have stayed at many types of hotels in the ‚ÄúHilton family,‚Äù from the Waldorf-Astoria Collection, to the Conrad hotels, to any number of Hilton properties worldwide, to the myriad other brands, in the ‚Äúfamily,‚Äù but the LondonHouse was our first ‚ÄúCurio Collection‚Äù property.My wife was attending meetings in Chicago, and the organization provided accommodations at the LondonHouse, at 85 East Upper Wacker Drive ‚Äì right on the Chicago River. Because we had managed to secure reservations at Alinea for dinner one night, we extended our stay for an additional day and a half.We have stayed in the general area (hosting organization‚Äôs offices are on the River too), but always at other properties. We were impressed by the LondonHouse, from the moment we checked in, until we departed. We were greeted as HHonors Diamond members, and given an upgrade room (Corner), free WiFi (did not use, so cannot comment on speed, or reliability), and two bottles of water. As our room was ready (we were quite early for check-in, and I had anticipated spending time in either the lobby bar, Bridges, or upstairs in the Tri-level Rooftop Bar), we unpacked and did head to the Tri-level Bar for a bit of light lunch, prior to my wife‚Äôs meetings.The room, 835, was in the original part of the historic, London Guarantee and Accident Building, structure (there is a glass and steel ‚Äútower‚Äù next to that), and while not large, did have an interesting floor plan. It was a ‚Äúsuite,‚Äù but the sitting/desk area/entrance hall was small, as was the bedroom, but with a good utilization of the actual space, it felt larger, than it really was. Being on a corner meant that we had views in two directions ‚Äì directly upon the River, across from Trump Tower, as well as down-river to Lake Michigan. Both views were very nice, and changed throughout the day/night, as the sunlight changed and the lights came on.The room has a comfortable King bed, four good pillows and a swivel, large-screen TV, that can be viewed from the bed, or from the sitting area ‚Äì nice feature. The bathroom is directly off of the bedroom, and while large, with a walk-in shower and single sink and vanity, it seemed a bit too close to the bed, and with a frosted-glass ‚Äúbarn door,‚Äù not quite as ‚Äúprivate,‚Äù as I would have liked. The toilet was a dual-flush ‚ÄúEuropean‚Äù model of Toto. While the water pressure in 835 was adequate, it would have been nice to have an adjustable shower head. Ours functioned fine, but only allowed a rather broad spray. We had a full array of nice Malin+Goetz bathroom amenities.At the entrance hall, the room had a cabinet with a mini-fridge, storage space, and a Nespresso coffeemaker. There is a closet, just to the left of the entrance door, with mirrored doors, but the closet doors were rather sticky, and reported to the hotel for maintenance. The closet also had a safe, mounted onto the floor, but it opened at the top, unlike many, so one did not have to lie on the floor, to access it. It also featured a light, when initially opened, which is a good feature, and one that I am seeing more often in hotel rooms.The room windows all had both sheers, and then blackout curtains, which were all manual. Due to their location, and the chains to operate, it would have been nice, if those were automated. We had no issues closing the blackout drapes fully, on any of the windows. The curtains on the large window in the bathroom did get a bit of a workout. This window did not have privacy sheers, but only the blackout curtains ‚Äì a combo of both would have been ideal.There was adequate drawer space for our short stay, and additional under-bed drawers (did not use those), for more storage.Our room was quiet, though we did hear a few motorcycles in the concrete corridors of the Loop, and a couple of emergency vehicles, on the second night. We heard zero noise from other rooms, or the hallway.There is a small exercise room (did not use), and a Spa, which is small, but very quiet and nice, on-property. Also, there are the afore mentioned Bridges Lobby Bar, and the Tri-level Rooftop Bar/restaurant.In all, a very comfortable room, and a lovely renovation to an historic building. The d√©cor is quite modern, so a departure from the outside of the building, and while a bit minimalist, it was very pleasing to my eye, and aesthetic sense. Coupled with the very helpful, efficient and friendly service, from the doorman, to the reservation agents, the Concierge, and all bartenders, and waitstaff, our stay was very good, and we look forward to staying at the LondonHouse in the future ‚Äì location is perfect (shopping, dining and business in/near the Loop all right outside the doors), and hospitality excellent.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Boutique charm with the amenities of a grand hotel.
text: The London House is a great pick for a weekend visit to Chicago. It is centrally located along the river, perfect walking distance to the major points of interest. We never used a cab during our stay. The recently renovated rooms are the best I‚Äôve seen. A TV wall separates the entry area from the sleeping quarters creating an intimate and thoughtfully partitioned room. Bathrooms are spacious and spa-quality. The views are incredible and worth the cost of an upgrade. Although the rooftop bar was closed during our February visit, they did allow viewing from the terraces; incredible views. It certainly must be the go-to-place in the warmer months. The concierge was very knowledgeable about the area and all the staff went above and beyond to meet expectations. This will be my first hotel choice when I come back to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Crown Jewelbox Style Boutique Hotel
text: Spectacular Views wrapped around this boutique Curio Jewel box boutique styled hotel nestled right in the thick of things in Downtown ChiTown Historic use of this Landmark Fort Dearborn Vintage office tower

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business Trip
text: My company had our annual kickoff at this hotel and the accomodations where impecable.   The food preparation was great and it was some of the best food I have had at a hotel in awhile.  i would stay here any chance I could get.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love the Lobby Bar
text: Michelle Bridges, in the lobby bar, crafted a custom cocktail for me to PERFECTION! Her service was impeccable and she went above and beyond, even snapping an amazing photo of us chronicling the evening! Love the LondonHouse hotel and always enjoy the Lobby Bar! If you stay here make sure you visit the Lobby Bar and ask for Michelle!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago
text: I was scheduled for a business trip w/ events at the hotel. I went in a couple of days early to spend time with friends. The London House was lovely! The staff was friendly, helpful and informative at every level.  I would recommend and stay again and again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: RT Great View, Food Average
text: Indoors, the name does not deliver its promise. RT is an excellent spot for all types of travellers. Small portions. Mix menu. Average prices. Average service from bartenders-not friendly, no smiles unless you are somebody.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and nice hotel
text: Good location - right in the middle of Michigan Ave.  Nice rooms - but they are small, Hated the Restaurant - almost no selection and poor service but there is a Corner Bakery next to it and I love that restaurant.  Overall nice hotel but they need to step up their food service

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful details!
text: Just got back from a break in the city. Chose to stay at the London House. They really thought of everything in the details. Staff operates at a high standard, so kind and welcoming. Our king room was comfy and one of the most quietest hotels we've stayed at in Chicago. Our view to the left was amazing. Really looking forward to returning when we can visit the patio on the 21st floor.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel in heart of Chicago
text: I really enjoyed staying at London House.  Rooms were great, wide and spacious, which is hard to get in the city.The location is hard to beat and their restaurant was great.  I can't wait to go back in the summer and experience their roof top bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice room with a view!
text: I stayed for business. The room was spacious without being overbearing. Parking is done at the front of the hotel by vallet which was nice and I liked the coffee machine in the room. Staff were great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago weekend
text: Family weekend in Chicago to celebrate daughters 21st birthday. Staff extremely warm, helpful and professional. Rooms beautiful and location perfect for venturing out to see the sights of Chicago. Loved it and will return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House - Chicago
text: Great location and great views of the Chicago river. Room was very clean, large bathroom (bathroom door a bit awkward) , great shower and comfortable bedding.  Two large screen TV's with Chromecast, nice touch.  We stayed in a corner suite, nice room, best view was in the bathroom unfortunately.  You have to be selective in your room choices if you are in the old section, the room layouts vary.  Kurt, the bartender in the lobby bar, is exceptional and has to be THE funniest bartender I have ever met.  In fact all the bartenders in the lobby bar were exceptional and extremely friendly.  We took the time to check out other room types and Donnie  assisted us with the tour, he was awesome and what a great personality.  Even took the time to come back just to show us one more room that we may like, wanting to make sure we were 100% satisfied with our room selection.  The concierge desk was also very helpful in making dinner reservations for us, even going so far as sending drinks from the bar when we arrived for dinner, very nice touch.  The only point the staff missed was the celebration of our 34th anniversary, no mention upon check in and nothing sent to the room, that is usually a given in all the other hotels we have stayed at in the past.  Overall experience was very good and would recommend to others as a great place to stay when visiting Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views, nice rooms, good service.
text: We've stayed at the London House Curio twice now. Both times we had a very positive experience. The rooms are very nice, the location is terrific...easy walk to shopping and Art Institute, and the staff has been very helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel and Great Staff!
text: I absolutely loved my stay at LondonHouse Chicago. The staff was incredibly friendly and super accommodating. I think Roman checked me in and was very welcoming.The hotel's restaurants were also nice. I was in Chicago for work and ended up eating at the Lobby bar the first night. The salmon was delicious and the bartender/server was great. The service at breakfast the next morning was wonderful as well. I actually ended up eating at the rooftop restaurant (LH on 21) the next night (got stuck in the hotel) and I was pleasantly surprised. I don't think the ratings for the restaurant were that good but I thought the food was excellent and again, the service was great. I ordered the Amish chicken and brussel sprouts. Both were really good! Sooo flavorful. The restaurant was nice enough to take the brussel sprouts off of my bill because I asked for them without bacon and they brought them with bacon the first time. Not a big deal to me at all but it was a nice gesture for them to remove it from the bill. Overall, everyone I encountered at the hotel was really friendly, the rooms are beautiful, the view is gorgeous and I really loved this hotel! Stay here, you'll enjoy it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Posh hotel  with incredible customer service
text: The rooms are always clean comfortable, like new, spacious and have an awesome view of Chicago.  I would recommend that anybody and everybody stay here. It is located  in a central location with public transit access and plenty of things to do within walking distance

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Unique place to stay in Downtown Chicago
text: This an extremely unique place to stay in downtown Chicago. The hotel is very clean and the staff is great.   For us was the Rooftop Bar stood out from the rest of the hotel. The staff was phenomenal and extremely attentive. Great bartender (sorry I cannot remember his name) and an amazing atmosphere.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely Place
text: The drop off for valet is not the most convenient. Their elevator system is a bit bizarre.  With that said, the hotel is gorgeous.  The rooms are modern and luxurious.  The upper level bar is classy and has a good wine and beer selection. Well located with a great view.  A nice addition to the Hilton offerings.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel
text: Truly the place to stay for a short business trip. Great room and amazing location. Try the bar on the 21st floor and definitely order an old fashion. Good breakfast. Only negative would be the terrible water pressure but the overall experience and especially the friendly staff completely makes this place a hotel I will return to

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First time to Chicago
text: We could not have picked a better hotel or location to enjoy Chicago. As a frequent traveler I know hotels. This is a beautiful property with an amazing staff. We will be coming back to Chicago soon and staying at the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A NEW HOTEL AND A GREAT FIND
text: My wife and I went to Chicago in February  for two nights We stayed at the London Curio. It has a great location, and it is 10 months NEW. In my experience the rooms are unique and well designed.  The bathroom is comfortable with a large shower. All linens and towels were new and delightful. The hotel staff were gracious, helpful and competent.  There is an  bar/restaurant and open terrace with a beautiful view from the 21st floor.There are many good hotels in Chicago...give this one a try. I will tell my friends about it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel, Great Service, Great location
text: The hotel is in a great location, with a beautiful view of the Chicago river.The room was absolutely beautiful. it was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was was large. I cant say enough about the staff. They were very helpful super polite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great New Option in Downtown Chicago
text: The London House is a great addition to Hilton properties in downtown Chicago.  It is recently remodeled, conveniently located, and the staff is eager to serve.  Views of the river are nice and the rooms are very comfortable and modern.  Another advantage in its newness is that rates were GREAT for Chicago, but I anticipate that will not always be the case because this is an upscale place.  This will become my new go-to space because of its upbeat feel and its Michigan Avenue location, close to places I frequent.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Chicago
text: Just wrapped up a business trip to Chicago and can't say enough about the LondonHouse. It is at the corner of E Wacker and Michigan, which means it is convenient to everything. The rooms were very nice with convenience lighting and plenty of plugs. Being able to use the Digital-key feature enabled me to bypass the front desk for check in. The fitness center is great and the staff is very attentive. Had drinks at the rooftop bar, which will be great in warmer weather. Will definitely be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely fantastic!!!
text: When I visit Chicago, I always stay here.  There's no question. Very comfortable hotel ‚Äì great location ‚Äì excellent people.   Since it's in downtown and close to trump towers, it's very easy to travel anywhere.  Stay here and look no further.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new favorite Chicago hotel!
text: Great location, interior isNew and very updated. Great view of river, Nice bathroom with walk in double shower. Large flat TV . Concierge and management very accommodating . They text and check in daily. I wasn't feeling well and they are making me something that isn't on the room service menu! Only concern is the two ellipticals in the fitness could be better. Precor preferred.Hope rates are affordable when I come back next time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Big room, great price, good sleep
text: My room was big, had a great view, was quiet and I slept well.   I didn't get a chance to go the gym but it looked really nice.  All in, there's plenty of nice room amenities too with Chromecast.  My breakfast was good but pricey relative to the quantity of food.  Two slices of bacon for $8 seems a bit much.  I'll be back because it was a good stay at a good price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Couldn't have stayed in a better place for my first anniversary
text: From the moment we stepped into the London House Hotel until we had to sadly leave we were treated like royalty. As we were checking in we asked if we could have a king instead of The singles and they were more than happy to upgrade us but it didn't stop there. We mentioned it was our first anniversary and they moved us to a king room on the corner of the building.  We had 7 windows in our room with at least 3 different views of  Michigan Avenue and the river.  Again. We couldn't have been happier.  As a new hotel they are doing everything right. We came back on our first night to our room and they left us chocolate and champagne with a happy anniversary note.  That made our night and weekend even better. The staff was awesome Keith, Bryan and Daniel were all amazing and immediately answered all of our questions and text messages within seconds.  The rooms were beautiful and the view from the roof was second to none.  Thank you London House for a great memorable first Anniversary.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of my favorite places to stay
text: The London house has superior quality rooms,  ambiance, and a sexy rooftop bar.  This is one of my favorite hotels to stay in during my visits to Chicago.  The view from the rooms are outstanding, the quality of the bed and materials used in each room is superior, and the location to downtown is perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel
text: My wife and I got a night away from the kids, and while we usually uses those rare nights to stay at very high end hotels, my wife's diamond status and a great rate prompted a night at London House. Front desk was incredibly welcoming, immediate recognition of diamond status, a great room upgrade, and very friendly. Room was excellent, great views, spacious, wonderful amenities. Breakfast next morning on 21 was excellent as well. Overall this is a very nice hotel, a steal for the rate given. We will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cool hotel with just a few quirks
text: We stayed at the LondonHouse for three nights in February while we were in town for me to take a professional certification exam. Overall, the hotel was nice. The staff, in particular, were excellent and made us feel right at home, even though we were beanie-and-jeans wearing travelers who looked completely out of place in such a swank hotel. The location is excellent, just a short walk to the L and right on Michigan so you can take a number of buses up north. We chose to pay a little extra and stay in a room a bit higher above the street, so we had an amazing view of the river and the lake, which was fantastic. It was wonderful to wake up every morning to that view.The beds were comfortable and the huge TV with multiple apps on it was a good way to unwind at the end of the day. I liked that there was a small refrigerator in the room. The room was very quiet and had it's own climate control, which was nice as we like to sleep in a cool room, so we were able to run the fan all night and stay comfortable.Now for the not-so-great quirks. While the bed was comfy, the pillows were terrible. They were king-size duck down pillows that were hard and flattened out to the point that even sleeping on your back it felt like your head was below the rest of your body. I ended up putting a towel under mine to support my neck, which helped, but wasn't ideal. Also, and this is a common complaint at many hotels, but the curtains didn't close completely, so there was always a small gap of light coming through. Why hotels don't put magnets or some other fastener in their curtains, I'll never know. But the gap in the curtains was nothing compared to the horrible blue LEDs on every light switch in the room. Study after study has shown that the blue light emitted by LCD and LED lights messes with our brain chemistry and makes it hard to get a good night's sleep. In addition, blue and green LEDs emit very bright light compared to orange or red ones. The light was so bright from just these LEDs that I could easily see around the room at night and I had to cover the ones next to the bed because they were keeping me awake. Finally, the bathroom door is a barn-style door that offers no privacy. You can hear (and smell) everything coming from the bathroom, which isn't very pleasant. In summary, the LondonHouse is a cool hotel with some neat features, a good location, and a great price, but it is almost to hip for its own good, which detracts from its comfort and purpose as a place to catch some rest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pretty good
text: The vista suite was pretty small.  It was very similar to an embassy suites.  Breakfast items were very simple and boring (for $18) .  View was great up the river...but had to stare at a GIANT TRUMP sign all night.  No wonder the place is so cheap.  Lol.   ;0)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location for shopping and theater
text: We stayed as a last minute trip. Got a great price and a great room, overlooking the river. It was a ten minute walk to the theater district and about 5 to the miracle mile shopping. The facilities were beautiful and the staff very friendly and helpful.  A Corner Bakery was in the same building so it made breakfast easy. Parking nearby was expensive so we parked about a 7 minute walk away using a parking app to get the best price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Getaway
text: All of the staff was exceptionally friendly from the welcome we had from Miguel to Alex, who checked us in. He was able to offer us an upgrade once we were at the counter too! After checking us in, Alex took the time to give us a tour and explain the great history behind the London House, including the outside architecture from the rooftop! When we arrived at our room, everything was perfect, we were able to see views from multiple angles, the bed and couches were comfortable, and beyond our expectations. I would definitely recommend the London House as a guest from out of town or even just a weekend getaway to the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New favorite Chicago hotel
text: Great experience! From the moment we arrived for night away my wife and I were greeted by Carlos at the front desk who did not hesitate with our upgrade request (room with a view) and made us feel welcomed. Eddie (bartender) was awesome! Great cocktails and he helped select some great bites from the menu.  This is our new favorite hotel in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Home away from home
text: I have been staying at the LondonHouse Chicago at least two weeks per month since Sept. 2016.  Service, professionalism, and accommodations in all areas are always spot on.  From the gentlemen who greet me when I arrive and return after work each day, to the front desk staff who are so welcoming and helpful to the breakfast staff (especially Jasmine) who make sure my coffee cup is never empty every morning, to the excellent housekeeping personnel -  service is excellent with personal touches.  Since traveling for business takes up so much of my life, I cannot express how much these little touches mean to me.   The LondonHouse has become my home away from home for business travel to Chicago.  Considering the many Hilton properties available for choice in the city, I feel this speaks volumes about the staff.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: curtain proplems
text: The worst trip. The curtain was tied up and I could not fall asleep.You can see the light from the picture. It is so light that I can be taken from the phones!! They even charge money for drinking water?! This hotel is expensive and the service is even not as good as those cheaper hotels. It absolutely does not worth the price.The worst ever.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago favorite
text: My favorite Chicago hotel by far. I live in the suburbs but am downtown frequently for work events. The rooms are comfortable, views are nice, and the staff are top notch. The rates are an absolute steal relative to other nearby hotels of the same caliber. Carlos at the front desk is the man.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved it!
text: All the staff I had contact with were very helpful and welcoming. The room was quite with great windows and views. The bed was comfortable, not as great as my mattress at home, but for a Hotel it was a good quality. All the linen was clean and soft. The elevators are set up so that you don't have to wait so long. Also a great location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I so wanted to  love this place
text: First the good - Staff are amazing, really friendly and helpful - couldn't fault any of them.  Easy check in and out.  Wifi (free for HHonors members) is fast in the room and didn't drop once whilst I was there, which is a major bonus.  Rooms are spotless with lovely decor and linens on the bed with plenty of fluffy towels in the bathroom.The not so good - the fan in the bathroom switches on / off every 5 minutes so not good for trying to get to sleep.  Ended up calling down an they came to turn it off - apparently it is meant to do this to keep the bathroom warm.  Not ideal.  The room was fairly small and the lighting not brilliant - as has been mentioned in other reviews.  I didn't find the bed that comfortable so didnt sleep to well unfortunately.The elevators do not have floor buttons inside but a "touchscreen" outside - fine if you hit the right button to start but if you hover over any number it will double up example instead of hitting 17 if you hover over the 1 it gives you 11. so you then have to go to another pad and try again!  No major wait for them having said that.As others have mentioned odd number rooms give a view of the river which is really nice.  Bar and menu prices are expensive - especially the bar. Good views from the rooftop

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice hotel with a grea view
text: I stayed here for 1 night on a business strip. As a Gold card Honors member I was instantly upgraded to a business room with a view of the city. The room was generous in size with a separate sitting area with its own massive flat screen TV, in addition to the massive TV in the bedroom.
