The TV's are fitted with chromcast so you can stream to your hearts content with your own device.The bathroom was very nice and big. The shower was huge with only a small complaint. When you have your back to the shower head, your elbows keep hitting the tap and thus changing the temperature. Slightly poor design but nothing to spoil the stay. The Corner Bakery is right downstairs so great for a quick breakfast / snack.The elevators are pretty cool with an electronic touch pad to tap in your floor and compass style arrows indicating which elevator (from 8 i think) will be coming next to take you to your floor. Staff were great too. I would certainly stay here again for the total package of location, style, service and amenities. Thanks LondonHouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago
text: Couldn't ask for much more. The staff was the best I have encountered. Rooms are good size with beautiful views of the city. Water front adds to the beauty of this property. Will be staying at this hotel going forward while in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel and view
text: London House is a great value downtown Chicago.  Walk to Michigan Avenue shopping. Great staff, fitness center, and breakfast (Mexican skillet was awesome)! Rooms are spacious and very comfortable.  Highly recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location off the Magnificent Mile
text: Was here for work a few nights and it was in a very walkable location, close to the park and excellent restaurants (check out the Purple Pig!).  The elevators are a little weird, take a bit to get used to but other than that, a really nice hotel and experience.  The guys downstairs are super friendly and the check in staff as well.  The bar staff was a little slow but friendly.Panera is downstairs so we ate there for breakfast instead of the hotel.  We did have a snack in the lobby bar one night which was fine.  Oddly they don't have any sweets - so no desserts at all.  The rooms were well sized with a massive mounted TV.  The bed was comfortable and I had a nice clean, modern bathroom.  The room seemed very soundproof, I didn't hear any outside noise or neighbors.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Stay in Chicago
text: We traveled to Chicago for a long weekend to attend a memorial service for a family member.  All the employees at the LondonHouse were professional and welcoming. The hotel was beautiful; both the common areas and the room.  Our room was plenty spacious and the beds were very comfortable. It would have been nice to have two queen sized beds, but the full size were just fine. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, so I cannot comment on it, but we did eat breakfast at the bakery on the first floor and it was delicious.  We had the rate that included parking and found it to be more than competitive with surrounding hotels.  It is in a great location, close to many restaurants and shopping. Can't wait to return in warmer weather for a vacation!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Clean, modern hotel
text: Excellent value, clean and luxurious rooms. The beds were very comfortable and the room was well appointed with small but considerate accouterments. Staff was professional, efficient and accommodating.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House - Chicago
text: I travel frequently for work and pleasure. Historically have stayed at the Drake and Conrad in Chicago and now prefer this property to those. Excellent hotel and location. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Value in Downtown Chicago
text: My husband and I stayed for one night in late January as a birthday surprise for him. Loved the one bedroom king suite. We are hotel snobs and typically stay at Four Seasons as hotels in general creep me out. The LondonHouse Chicago was extremely clean, especially the bathrooms. They even had loofahs to use in the shower. I thought that was a nice touch as I do not like to use wash cloths. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We were next an elevator and were nervous the room would be noisy. We didn't hear the elevator nor any other noise! The service was great. Everyone was very friendly. We will definitely stay there again. Next time in the summer so we can enjoy the rooftop bar with the great view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: If you want a great hotel with at a great price, this is it!
text: Experience was great.  They took care of everything we needed and knew your name when you came back to the front desk to ask for something.  Manny, the gentleman that runs the valet, is really good people and will take care of you.  Probably one of the best experiences I've had with valet and someone really taking care of you.  If you're in the area, make sure you stop by and have a drink or food, you will be glad you did.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel, amazing view
text: If I am going to be in Chicago, this will be the place that I stay!  The mattress and pillows are the most comfortable that I have slept on, better than my house!  The shower is great, and the bathroom soaps and loofa is a nice added bonus.  Staff is more than welcoming and more than willing to help.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Centrally located hotel with stylish urban charm
text: My friend and I stayed here for a weekend overnight in the city in late January. We booked a few days before our date of arrival and got a Hilton Honors rate of $97. I'm not sure if their rates are usually this good for weekend stays, but neither myself nor my friend had stayed here before and we couldn't find a better rate anywhere else. The service is very inviting and professional at the front desk. In addition, the lobby has a bar with windows that overlook the Chicago River and surrounding architecture. We didn't have a drink there, but it would be a nice place to do so. There is a ton of seating.Our room was very modern and well-appointed, with books and nicely selected furnishings. The TV was very large, as was the bathroom. The front desk agent who checked us in provided us with a room that had a direct-facing view of the river and the Trump Tower. It wasn't the $25 upgrade we were offered that would have had floor to ceiling windows, but the view was very nice  no less. The noon checkout time was ideal; we were able to sleep in on Sunday morning and enjoy our coffee in the room before we had to leave. If you're looking for a modern, smaller hotel with a central location to the loop, Gold Coast, and other areas in downtown Chicago, the LondonHouse is perfect.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely view
text: Lovely view of the river and great location. Room was nice and cozy! A little small but still good. Loved the decor of the room and of the lobby/bar area. The staff were very accommodating and we felt very at home! I would recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Favorite in Chicago - Outstanding!
text: Visited for three night with my wife and daughter for a college visit.  Used my Hilton points and stayed in a king suite with a spectacular view of the Chicago river and skyline!  The location is amazing, the hotel and rooms beautiful but it is the service that stands out.  Everyone greeted us whenever and wherever we encountered them!  I liked getting the daily txt message just to check if everything was okay!  Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bridge Lobby Bar
text: Stopped in for a nightcap drink and a bite.  The bartender Michelle, came over to check on drinks.  She was very knowledgeable and friendly, I remarked that I couldn't remember the last time a bartender came over to advise on drinks!  Food was ok, but the drinks were large and great.  Will be back again.  NOTE: I was not staying at the hotel, but the winter rates seemed like a good deal.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great first experience
text: The reviews are spot on! This is a wonderful remodel of a great building in a wonderful location. The price was right, bar experience was terrific and the staff are exceptional. My room was great but only shortfall was bed and pillow comfort. Great area to walk around with restaurants and shopping closeby. Recommend strongly for business or leisure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Business Hotel
text: First off.  I am so excited this Hotel finally opened.  It's my new favorite hotel on my many visits to Chicago.  The service is always consistent and awesome.  I have always been fortunate to get a great room with city views and the rooms being very comfortable and quiet.  The lounge and restaurant is on the top floor and is very roomy. I love unwinding there during the evenings.  When the weather is nice. you can walk onto the outside patio with Great views of downtown and take some great pictures!I love the hotel for its location as it's so convenient to where I mainly do business when in town.  Keep up the Great job London House!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location for first timers
text: Location: This hotel is in the perfect location for fist time visitors to Chicago. Lots of things are within walking distance both north and south and it's close to the El, though with four of us traveling together, Uber turned out to be cheaper than public transport would have been, and warmer since it was door to door. Room: Although right next to the elevator it was very quiet. Couple of things, design-wise....(sometimes I think the designers should spend a night in the rooms). The little "lobby" inside the door is crying out for a row of hooks or a coat stand. If wet, you have nowhere else to hang coats other than in the closet. The shower if not adjusted towards the wall, would spray water over the floor whilst it was warming up due to the way the shower door opened. Not a fan of the sliding glass door on the bathroom, huge gaps all around it so little privacy sound-wise. Enjoyed the Nespresso machine and the lovely Malin & Goetz toiletries. The pouf was a nice touch too.Breakfast: From booking with a AAA deal, breakfast was included. We were given cards for this at the front desk on arrival. They entitled us to the continental breakfast inc. tea/coffee/juice or we could spend up to $18 (with beverages separate) from the menu. I have to say, as a frequent traveler the continental breakfast for $18 was one of the sorriest breakfasts I have ever seen. Tubs of very pedestrian yogurt, pedestrian fruit, bread, and small pastries and cereal. No cold cuts, cheeses or eggs, I guess their main audience is the business traveler on an expense acct. Needless to say, we chose from the menu and the omelette for example came with toast and fruit which was great, and with a beverage, within the $18. Service was slow. The Corner Bakery Cafe is downstairs if you prefer a choice.Would I stay here again? Hmmmm, maybe. We had an incident with the security swing bar closing us out of the room one day. Despite the housekeeper requesting help earlier in the day, no one came till we made a fuss on returning at 7pm and therefore no hk till after 9.30pm. Then, just a pile of towels. I didn't feel as though anyone owned the problem.I think this reads a little negatively though overall we did enjoy staying at the hotel. Beds comfy, room clean, staff nice etc. We stayed for four nights.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: College Visit
text: We stayed at London House January 12 - 16, 2017 and loved it.  I upgraded to a king-suite since my 17 year old daughter was traveling with me.  This gave us a living room and very spacious bedroom to make our home-away-from-home.  We were in town visiting potential colleges.  The suite has plush, soft carpet and lush window coverings which were important to keep the rooms warm.  The bathroom was big and offered a beautiful setting with a walk-in shower.  Everyday our room was cleaned and a staff member text me several times during my stay to ensure I was satisfied.  Each morning we ate at the Corner Bakery on the first floor.  Their breakfast were affordable, delicious & the view is just amazing.  I will make London House my destination when my daughter moves to Chicago for school.  Friendly staff, excellent location and the feel and warmth of home!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: NICE BUT SNOOTY
text: Desk was very snooty at time of check in. My card was declined at check in not a prob. I did not know that this hotel charged 100.00 per night for incidentals. When the card was declined she looked at me and said" its declined" I more felt like i was not welcome there. I work in Hospitality and there are many other ways she should have stated this or asked me questions. I do not remember the Front Desk agents name, but i do remember she had to broken fingers. As you know the Front Desk can set the tone for your enitre stay. I must give you prop on your housekeeping staff!. They are very good at what they do and also your Executive Houskeeper does a great job with guests. She always asked me is ther anything i can go do to make your stay more enjoyable..Great job!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: loved the london house
text: I went to the london house for for my 30th birthday. Though i live in chicago i wanted to stay at a hotel w/ a beautiful aestetic. The hotel was stunning w/ great views and decor. The art deco nature of the hotel was beautiful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chi-Town Staycation
text: My boyfriend and I decided last minute to have a little staycation down town this weekend.  After doing a TON of research on all the 4 star or higher hotels on or around the river - I chose London House.  The building and building site has so much history it's unreal!  The building was also built in the 20s, which was a big selling point for me, as I love the roaring 20s!  One of their signature cocktails actually is also called the Roaring Twenties and I recommend having one or maybe two ;)  And if you are able to go to the roof top - DO IT!  One of the best views of this beautiful city and I have seen many!  The room was perfect with a million dollar view of the river - we were on the 15th floor.  The entire staff was a pleasure to deal with and everything we asked for was taken care of SO quickly.  They also text with you personally your entire trip if you choose and they reply just a quickly as your request is taken care of!  Super happy with my choice and the next time we do this - we are going back to London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location
text: Stayed here for the weekend - great style (very cool decor), good size rooms, really comfy bed, great service, and perfectly positioned for everything in downtown! I had a great view over the river looking towards Chicago Tribune...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel in Great Location
text: Stayed here while my daughter was competing in a tournamemt at a nearby conference center and we couldn6t have been more pleased with our decision.  Location was easy to find as we drove into town and we had incredible views. It is within walking distance of all our favorite Chicago fun...museums, dining, shopping...perfectly situated to enjoy both north and south Michigan Ave. The decor reminded me of jazz age updated to this millenium with it modern take on historical fixtures. Every staff member from front desk, to valets, to housekeeping and restaurant staff was friendly and helpful. Room size was larger than we expected and full of amenities that were little things that just made the stay more comfortable. Loved the espresso machine and supplies in the bathroom (q-tips make us smile). The elevator system was awesome....no trying to guess which door you should aim for as it is programmed based on your destination (you put in the floor and it tells you which door will open). This is really nice when your arms are full. Valet parking would have been pricey for us because we needed to park 2 vehicles for 2 nights, but there is less expensive public parking nearby that worked well for us at half the cost. We wouldn't let that stop us from staying here again and we actually plan on doing so when we come back for the same event next year. Thank you, London House, for a fantastic Chicago family weekend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pleasant Surprise
text: My husband and I won a one night stay here at a silent auction.  Based on the reviews, we were expecting a great place.  However, we were a bit apprehensive because we couldn't believe the price point would be that inexpensive for such a highly rated hotel.  Let me say that the hotel itself lives up the ratings.  The service is friendly and prompt.  They even text you to see if you need anything about an hour after check in!  The smart elevators are a neat touch.  The rooms are clean and modern.  Our room was also surprisingly quiet considering the busy area and the fact that we were right next to the elevator.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because the restaurant service was abysmal.  We had to wait (no kidding) 21 minutes to get someone to bring us our coffee, and event then the server forgot the sugar and milk/ cream. What should have been a quick twenty minute breakfast was an hour long.  It was't even busy. Half the tables were empty.  It looked like some of the staff may have been in training, but that isn't an excuse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Date Night with Wife
text: Reserved a beautiful top floor corner room for the wife and I this past Friday 1/20. Was amazed at the decor, friendly staff and comforts of the room. All Art Deco and more than meets the eye. After dinner at Flemings (also amazing) we enjoyed adult beverages in their rooftop lounge. Cruz, the on duty manager was beyond belief. Made sure our every need was met. Check in was flawless, our room was impressive, the rooftop lounge was amazing complete with a bartender that created a drink from scratch based My my wife's taste and the managers on duty made our date night a true success. Hottest spots in Chicago- and we live here. Highest recommendation.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great rooms and views
text: Love the hotel...beautiful rooms, beautiful Chicago River views...great staff.  BUT....their continental breakfast is $25.00 and it includes a few mini-boxes of cereal, some fruit...some yogurt...and toast.  They also charge $5.00 for a CAN of diet coke.    The rooftop bar is really cool...but during the winter, there is zero view and they charge nearly $15 for a simple drink like a gin and tonic.    I stay here because of the rooms, views, staff, and the corporate rates are spectacular.  I just wish I enjoyed the breakfast to be better and the prices for things like a drink not so insulting.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good location, nice room
text: Enjoyed my stay here! Was a nice location and great place to stay on business, Nice modern room, newly updated it seemed, with a great view. Was quite and easy to sleep. The lounge was nice and I look forward to coming back when the weather is nice to enjoy the roof top view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing
text: Great location, wonderful rooms, on-point staff ... sure to meet your every desire or whim!  I have stayed here many times and have many comparison points to other hotels in the area - they have become a favorite.  This Hotel will not disappoint.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick Visit
text: An amazing Hilton property that provided an excellent level of service.  The location was great.  The view from our room was excellent.  Service was amazing.  The bar was very nice and friendly.  I can't wait to go back in the summer to enjoy the rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new favorite (at least for the money)
text: Given how tattered some of the mid-priced hotels in Chicago have become (see my Hard Rock review), it's nice to have an affordable new option that's well located and beautifully appointed. My room had a beautiful view of the river (aside from the garish Trump sign across the way), a comfortable bed, huge TV and nice bathroom with really good soap and shampoo. They may all seem like small things, but it seems like they get every detail right. The room was quiet and peaceful and the staff was super friendly and helpful. I honestly can't say enough good things about it. Especially for the price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I <3 LondonHouse
text: Modern decor, giant tv that swivels back and forth as mirror or tv. Espresso machine, slipper, & robe what else can you ask for.  Got an upgrade as a diamond member and breakfast voucher are $18 per person (can be combined).  As a HHonors I was satisfied and reminded me of the hotels in Asia which are usually wayyyy nicer than what we have in the US

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Terrific value. Great Location.
text: Extremely well priced on this weekday winter's night. My room was high up, on river and had great view. Great looking lobby, one floor up. Used the HHonors app to reserve and select my room, used the app's check in feature and digital key to go directly to my room upon arrival - worked like a charm and so convenient! Room and bathroom amenities quite nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary Trip to Chicago Jan 2017
text: My husband and I stayed here for our one year wedding anniversary. We had a great time, and really want to thank Murphy (Door man) for all his help, and all the good laughs. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, staff was super friendly. The hotel did not send us anything for celebrating our anniversary with them, which I thought was weird but was not a make it or break it as, other Hilton properties have sent chocolates, or macaroons in the past. I do have to mention, our room window faced another room, and well, if you don't want anyone to see something they aren't supposed too... i would suggest you close your blinds!!!   The only thing was the first night we were so exhausted we were in bed by midnight, we couldn't sleep because all we could hear was music coming from somewhere outside. Luckily at around 2:00 AM it stopped. Other than that, we really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I do have to mention, the pillows are not as comfortable as i hoped they would be.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pleased
text: This was a long overdue couples getaway for my significatn other and myself. Our stay was excellent. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Location was everything!! I highly recommend the London House Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location!
text: We are Hilton Diamond and the London House did not disappoint. Treated graciously by staff, customer service was excellent. Room was boutique sized but felt plenty roomy. We had a regular king room. Frosted sliding door on bathroom not a problem as long as others don't walk by. Husband and I are modest and was not a problem for us. Perfect location on Wacker Ave & Michigan for shopping and being in Chicago for thanksgiving weekend. Will stay again definitely!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: In A Word......."AMAZING"!!!!
text: It is difficult to put into words how amazing this hotel really is!  From the great location to the stunning views, the wonderful and attentive staff and the amazing food....the LondonHouse Chicago is, well, amazing!  When we booked our both business/romantic couples getaway we did go with a king vista room....which by no means is at the top or the bottom of the "food chain" of room choices but it is a room choice about right in the middle of the choices.  We stayed over the MLK holiday weekend and got a fantastic price working directly off of the LondonHouse/Hilton website so no "reseller" deal was needed or wanted.  The ease of booking the room was an initial highlight as most of the room choices populate on the site as you check one box or the next. Our King Vista room on the 14th floor facing the Chicago River could not have been nicer or more comfortable.  It was large and well appointed without being too large or overwhelming with wasted space.  To say it was quiet and that we were undisturbed is an understatement.  We had neighbors but you would have never known.  Noise in this hotel is non-existent anywhere.  Our king bed...faced a very large (probably 55 inch) LED TV with most of the channels you could ask for but why stay in when you can either explore Chicago or just sit in a chair by the "floor to ceiling" windows and watch the world go by.  To put a finer point on this room....while parking the car before I entered....my wife texted me when she got to the room with a text that said......"Honey....in a word....WOW!"  The marble bathroom was very nice with a walk in two person shower (sorry for those needing a bath tub....not in this particular room) ;~}There is a Nespresso Coffee maker in the room and all the supplies you could need.  The toiletries were great and plentiful.  We did attend an event at the hotel and the meal was absolutely the best meal I have had in a long while.  And I am including many top notch restaurants in that assessment.  Truly it was a fantastic meal with tremendous service. The event rooms had wonderful views and balconies from both the 3rd and 21st floor overlooking the city and some other hotel next door.....it was hard to read the sign so not sure what that hotel name said....the letters were quite small....when you get there you will get that reference (joke). Although we did not make it out to the rooftop bar/deck as it was quite cold in January in Chicago....from what I have read, seen and been told....the outdoor rooftop bar/relaxation space is NOT, repeat NOT, to be missed.  Finally, just viewing the architecturally significant building in an architecturally significant town like Chicago, in a very historic area (Ft. Dearborn) it makes me proud to say.....I am a Chicagoan and could have gone wherever I wanted but I chose the LondonHouse Chicago!   In a number of words........"WE WILL BE BACK!"

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mom and daughter Christmas
text: This hotel is right next to everything Chicago has to offer! The rooms are brand new and very modern. Great location and also I love that they text you about your room, versus calling the room. Very modern and great views! Be sure and go to the top floor restaurant and go on deck and check out the amazing view!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend in Chicago
text: Great location, right in downtown Chicago. Great service, the staff was super nice. Great Bar, the cocktails and the music were a lot of fun. Great accomodations. I will be back and/or look for other Curio locations.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend in Chicago
text: This is an outstanding hotel--from the attentive staff and striking interiors to the magnificent river views and very comfortable beds. LH dosent miss a trick. Very courteous and professional staff. Be sure to visit the roof bar. Great perspective on the city. Would definitely stay there again. Ideal location. Short walks to MM, parks, museums and great restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: MLK Weekend in Chicago
text: My wife and I took always take a long weekend trip over MLK weekend.  This year we chose Chicago and were tipped off about the LondonHouse....and boy are we glad we got that tip. First, location location location!  No matter what you are doing or where you are going, the LondonHouse is a wonderful central location.  Train stops are near and Michigan Ave shopping is short stroll away, as is Millenium Park.Savanna at check in was so gracious and gave us a great room with a river view ---- and I particularly loved the view of the Trump Building!  Everyone we encountered here was so friendly and gracious...the breakfast was nice and the Bridge Lobby Bar provided a relaxing place to watch Chicago go by .....We will be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: WOW!
text: I'm from Chicago and have loved this historical building for many years so was very excited to see it tuned into a hotel. I now live elsewhere and was in town for a visit and was excited to try London House. The location on the corner of Michigan and Wacker is wonderful as you can walk everywhere, It is a Hilton property and as a Diamond member I was upgraded to a suite. The views were absolutely stunning! The room had a large bathroom with Frette robe and wonderful thick towels, toiletries, and makeup mirror. There was a sitting room with sofa and two stools under a sofa table that held the Nespresso coffee machine (nice!) and a door that led into the bedroom area. Wow! Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river were fantastic. Incredibly comfortable king size bed, desk, a wardrobe, nightstands, lights on dimmers (which I love) a chair and small table by the window. Wonderful. The staff at the hotel was incredibly professional and friendly. Everyone said hello and offered to help in any way. There was a spa on the 4th floor, but I did not have time to explore it on this trip. The bar upstairs on 21st floor was very busy and attractive with a fireplace and large sofa groups. The cocktails were very very good. Looking forward to returning in the summer so we can take advantage of the stunning rooftop bar! I could not have been happier with this hotel. Can't wait to return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Views
text: The first thing that struck us was the interior design of the hotel. We knew that it was a newer, redesigned property, but this hotel spared no expenses. It's modern with retro accents. It has a European feel to it. The lobby is gorgeous, spacious, has a nice view, and has a great cocktail lounge built in. The staff was beyond friendly--they gave great recommendations for meals and even texted us to see how our stay was going and to offer any assistance.The room wasn't huge, but wasn't small either. We had a king bed with enough space to store luggage, etc. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful. I'd be curious to see what a suite looks like in this place. But for a quick weekend stay, our room was perfect. The London House also has a lounge and restaurant on the 21st floor. We had a cocktail there, but no food. Unfortunately, we didn't get to check out the view because the place was super busy that night, but I heard from the staff that it is beautiful. Finally, the location was perfect. The view from the room was beautiful--especially when you look up-river, away from the Trump Tower. It is right on the river, and of course within walking distance to shopping, theater, and restaurants. All in all, a great stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Invredible hotel
text: This hotel was fantastic - really accommodating staff and a unique design allowing guests to skip the lobby when entering the property.   Amazing views from the room and rooftop bar.  Will definitely return to this property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel with excellent service
text: This hotel is very nice and is the best within it's price range. Brand new rooms with great bathrooms. Common areas are nicely furnished and the hotel is very clean. Service was great, with the hotel messaging you upon check in and you have everything you need at your fingertips. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is for the food. Although they do have room service, their menu options are very limited. They have few options and in my opinion they should expand their in room dining menu to include more options. Also , if your already going to have a refrigerator in the room which they do, why not stock it with all the basics plus some snacks like most other hotels do? I still plan on staying here again in the future and would recommend it to others.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great bartender in lobby bar
text: Michelle made our stay at the London House an even better experience. She is a great bartender and very warm and friendly. I would hang there for a nice conversation over going to the nightclub. Everything was nice in our room also. The cleanliness was top notch and the bed was very comfortable.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: Great location and amenities. We got a very good rate and the room was clean and well supplied with a great view of the river. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Michelle at the lobby bar. Will stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Small Room; Huge Bathroom
text: Great location right in E Waker Dr. We found a great deal on the room, and it being a somewhat new hotel, we booked. The room was tiny; just enough room to walk around the king bed and room for a chair. The desk doubled as the night stand on one side. Mini-fridge was handy to store water or snacks. Bathrobe and slippers were nice to have. Huge flat-screen that we never turned in. We could have upgraded to a larger room with a view for $25 but for the amount of time we'd spen in the room wasn't worth it.The bathroom...HUGE! Almost as big as the sleeping room! Ample walk-in shower with large countertop. The lighted makeup mirror was a nice touch. In-closet safe that is laptop size. Valet-only parking with in-out privileges at $71. As this is a Hilton property, and we are HHonors members, we may stay again; however, there are comparably-priced Hilton properties that offer larger rooms that we might check out instead.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A WOW, but not perfect
text: I‚Äôve waited a few weeks to write this because there are so many positives, a few negatives, and I wanted it to be a fair review.  We‚Äôve been visiting Chicago for 20 years and have stayed in many of the downtown hotels.  LondonHouse has a superb location, but the entry they chose is unattractive, narrow, and busy with parking valets.  Next to this entrance, however, is a beautiful one with a lovely domed ceiling that leads you directly into the corridor with the elevators to the 2nd floor.  Checking in was fast, and staff were very efficient and pleasant.  After a bit of a learning curve with the elevators (you have to enter your floor # and then go to the indicated elevator A-H), my husband and I made it to our double Vista Room.  Note:  the beds are Full, not Queen.  The room is sleek and beautiful, but not as functional as it could be ‚Äì why is there only one chair in a double room to enjoy the awesome view when there is enough space for a second one?  The color scheme is modern, the bedding is luxurious.  The room is not really large, but there wasn‚Äôt much in it to take up space.  For instance, there is no dresser with drawers so that you can unpack your suitcase.  There is only one nightstand with two 30‚Äù x 15‚Äù drawers.  We chose to move some of the artsy items that the hotel put in the bookshelves so we could use that space for hats, scarves, gloves and other foldable clothes.  The TV is huge and is the only thing on the largest wall.  The bathroom is gorgeous with trendy and heavy glass shower doors that I‚Äôm sure they will be adjusting weekly.  In fact, ours had a crack at the top from only 6 months use.  Also, the bathroom door to the room is frosted glass.  It does not close shut, only slides leaving a 2‚Äù gap, so it‚Äôs not as private as some may want.  Guess we are showing our age, but we would have preferred a Keurig to the Nespresso machine.  We had to make multiple trips to a nearby Dunkin‚Äô Donuts.  Restaurants were close by and who could miss Trump Tower out the window!  We did not eat meals there, expensive.  We did go up to the rooftop on a sunny 27 degree day (brrr) and it was gorgeous view.  Would I stay here again?  For us, no.  But, I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend it to those wanting something beautiful and a little different.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice new property
text: We've stayed here twice in the past 6 months and it is a great choice. It has a fantastic location right at Michigan Avenue and the river with wonderful views from most of the rooms. The staff is great ‚Äì friendly and helpful. The lobby bar is fabulous. Our rooms were both clean and comfortable, and we loved the mini fridge that allowed us to keep things cold. The coffee maker was nice to have; it would have been nice to have had some tea available as well. But ‚Äì do hotel designers ever stay in their own ‚Äúcreations‚Äù? A few things would make the rooms much more comfortable. In a double room , there was only one bathrobe ‚Äì do we have to share?! The tile floors in the bathroom were lovely, but very cold, especially in Chicago in the winter. An area rug would be nice. The rain shower head was very nice, but a lack of water pressure made it difficult for me to wash my long, thick hair. And there was only one towel hook ‚Äì made it difficult when the two of us needed to hang 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels and 2 washcloths.  Lighting in the rooms was very dim. There was task lighting on the desk and reading spots bedside, but you couldn‚Äôt read in the chairs because it was too dark. And finally, the drawers under the bed were great for storage, but we kept stubbing our toes on them. Having them recessed a bit would be helpful. All that said, we really like this place and will return if the opportunity presents itself.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay!
text: Very nice, comfortable hotel, in a great location.  Helpful, friendly staff and huge plus that they accommodated a 9am check-in since my room was available.  Stayed in a king with nice views of the river. Only downside is you can hear street traffic.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay!
text: The central location of this Michigan Ave hotel is great but there are many more reasons to come back including the service (I got a text asking if everything was good 5 min after check-in), the two stylish bars onsite and the room had a Nespresso maker and TV's with Chromecast, how cool!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulously Comfortable Rooms
text: London House is more than just a hotel or a place to lay your luggage and sleep--it's a retreat. The rooms are fabulously comfortable, spacious, modern with a retro throw-back, and great views all around. The bathroom is gorgeous--great lighting and a huge shower.  Love the entryway--makes the room feel more like a small condo than a hotel room.  The empty refrigerator was a bonus, so cool to have a place to store my left over Chicago pizza without have to move around a bunch of miniatures. Bedding, pillows, and the large screen TV made it hard to leave the room, but when I did, the views from lobby and bar made it hard to leave the hotel.  This hotel is truly a retreat. Definitely recommend a stay here.  Come during the winter to try it out--prices are amazing low.  Will also be back in the summer to enjoy the rooftop bar in nicer weather. Chicago is a wonderful city with lots of hotels to chose from, but London House has to be in the top 5 in my opinion.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love this hotel
text: Well located hotel with access to Michigan Avenue and the Loop.  Hotel has an excellent staff that works very hard to meet guest needs. Food is good too on the 21st floor and in-room dining is very good.  This is now my go to hotel in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay
text: I love this hotel.  The people are all nice.  From the bell guys to the waiters and bartenders, the front desk and everyone in between.  They make you feel welcome and offer a warm experience to someone traveling alone.  In addition to that the hotel is very cool and the location is amazing at the corner of Michigan and Wacker.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Service, Beautiful Rooms, Appointments
text: I absolutely love this brand new Chicago property with all my heart.  Try out the elevator, what fun! You put in your floor level, it TELLS you which one to jump on, and away you go to your room.  Simple.... Everything is spectacular and brand new.  The views are incredible.  Nespresso machine in my suite, on the 20th floor.  Even the continental breakfast was excellent.  Bryan texted me even before I left my home airport with a welcome.  Paige was working front desk, and I needed a bit of help, she was professional, quick and extremely polite.  Mike was the manager on duty and answered my questions, took immediate action and helped me with an issue.  Alex sent up a couple of extra Nespresso pods to make sure I could power through my afternoon work in the room.  Seriously, top notch property and management. You never know how good a hotel is, until you need their help, which I did, and they delivered.  Excellent hotel. AAA+++

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved It
text: Loved this hotel. Located on the river and is very nice. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Very quiet. Several good restaurants nearby. Would definitely book this hotel again when I am back in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
text: This was the first time I used the digital key which is amazing.  Just walked straight to our room and used my phone to open the door.  The view from our room was a beautiful view of the river.  The bed was very comfortable.  There was an empty fridge and Nespresso machine in the room.  Nice selection of toiletries in the bath but our room had no tub.  Not a problem for us.  Even the elevators were smart.  You just tell it what floor you want to go to and it tells you which elevator to get on and it takes you there.  The concierge staff kept up with me by text and if I had an issue it was taken care of immediately.  All the staff were encountered were pleasant and helpful.We had a delicious lunch in the Bridges bar.  I had the BLT and it was the best one I've ever had.  My husband also enjoyed his burger.  Last but not least, the original part of the building is beautiful.  We will definitely return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel and Staff, Great Experience!
text: My wife and I just had a wonderful mini-vacation in downtown Chicago and it started and ended with the LondonHouse.  I'm compelled to share my experience, both, to encourage other couples to get away and to praise the hotel and its staff.Our reserved room was not ready when we arrived, prior guests were late checking out.  Alex at the front desk offered to move us but the lobby bar was so inviting that we opted to wait.  We had a couple drinks by the window overlooking Wacker Drive, down the river.We were very pleased with the room, like the lobby, it had tasteful, modern decor and since the hotel just opened, everything still looks and feels new.  We had the same view as in the lobby, just from the 18th floor.  The next morning, my wife enjoyed an Espresso by the window.In the evening we cabbed it around downtown, we had dinner reservations a few blocks down at the Chicago Cut and we caught the ballet a little south at the Auditorium Theater, that was alright.  Upon our return to the hotel, we briefly watched TV and then proceeded to the 21st floor, to the bar.  Again, great service, great drink suggestions, surrounded by modern elegance, just a good looking bar.Great hotel and staff, great experience!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location excellent service
text: Stayed in 1 King corner room studio for two nights. Very nice view, clean, modern room.   I brought my HD cable to connect my laptop to the TV and they sent up engineer to help  I would recommend this hotel to anyone- I had an awesome stay with my girlfriend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful!
text: The stay was absolutely wonderful. I enjoyed many amenities being a diamond member, and the staff was absolutely amazing. They were very quick to help with anything I needed. Not only that, but the rooms were fantastic as well, the bed especially. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone who visits. And the best part is, it wasn't overpriced.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superior Accommodations and Service
text: Superior Accommodations Large Room, Great Bedding, 60 inch Swival TV. Can See From The Bed Or Couch Mirror On The Opposite Side.X-Large Bathroom and Shower. Great Room Service. The Staff Takes Pride In Their Jobs, They Are Good at What They Do, and They Do It Well.Dr.J.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, excellent view!
text: Hilton really hit a home run with this new property!  They renovated a former 19th century office building and constructed a new addition right next door.  Our room was in the addition and it boasted floor-to-ceiling windows and a jaw-dropping view over the Chicago River and its many bridges.  The room decor, bed, bath products, everything was chic and comfortable.  Possibly we had an introductory rate - the room rate was very reasonable!  You really can't beat this location, either:  right at Michigan Avenue and Wacker, equidistant to the Art Institute and Millennium Park and the shopping meccas on the near north end of the Ave.  The bar on the 21st floor was unexpectedly windowless but the fireplace and great cocktails made up for the lack of outdoor views.  I understand there's an outdoor space farther up, but being there on a bitter December weekend, we missed that.  It's a great property and I would definitely return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience
text: I remember hearing my parents talk about the London House of the 1960's and wanted to try it. Had a great time. The room was excellent. I also had great service in the bar area. The server was Fernanda. She was very efficient and beautiful.I will have another "staycation" here again soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great business hotel
text: Stayed here while in town for a trade showNice location on the waterfrontA bit confusing on arrival, doorman was not right there and we didn't know where the front desk was,  turns out it's the second floor Nice lobby, check in area connected with barRoom was modern and clean,  only Nespresso in room, so no large coffee in morningNice roof top bar, lounge  Can walk to Michigan Mile shopping!!Would stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic place, outstanding service
text: This hotel is one of the best in Chicago! The views are absolutely gorgeous! We stayed there with our kids during Christmas and it was absolutely perfect. Daniel L. the manager on duty made sure to make our stay an unforgettable one! Recommend this place to everyone visiting the city!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great view, shame about the street noise!
text: We visited Chicago for a couple of days between Christmas and New Year. We picked up a room at LondonHouse for a very reasonable rate, just under $100 per night (ex. taxes) and I assume this goes up quite a lot when the city is busy (and warmer). The location of the hotel is seemingly in the middle of everything, most of them within easy walking distance, even in December.Check in was simple and although we only had a standard room, it was plenty big enough for our needs and our view was fantastic.What we really liked about the hotel was; our view, the bed (very comfortable and very large), the Nespresso machine, the 55 inch TV (although we barely switched it on), the Bluetooth speaker and the hotel bar upstairs. The bar, although not particularly cheap had good service and some decent cocktails. The upper outside bar was (unsurprisingly) closed, although I still popped out for a look and it must be fantastic on a warm summer's evening.What we didn't like was; the walk-in shower which, although a decent size, didn't appear to have any temperature controls, only on or off. Very odd and not hot enough for either of us. The bathroom door was also a bit of a problem, because although it slides and looks great, there is still a large gap that means the room is not sound proof. Not a problem for one person, could be awkward when you are two, depending on how friendly you are. I also found the exterior noise a problem. Even though we were on the 7th floor, sirens in particular were very apparent in the early hours and the locals aren't afraid to use their horns either. As the hotel hasn't provided better glazing, ear plugs are required! As we were on a lazy couple of days and lounging in bed, we could also hear housekeeping in the hallway knocking on other doors.We didn't have breakfast, nor did we use the spa, so can not comment on either of those points. I was amazed by how many huge hotels Chicago appears to have, all within a close distance of each other. There is certainly a lot of choice available.  For our rate I would say we had great deal, but my problem with noise would lead me to look elsewhere next time I was in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Frustrating Location
text: If you travel to the London House Hotel by taxi or Uber you'll be fine. However, if you drive a car there you'll be extremely frustrated with the fact that they have no dedicated street space to load or unload your car. You have to double park or park illegally on the other side of the street to get it done. The rooms are very nice and there is a magnificent roof top bar and entertainment area. The hotel has a ton of great restaurants within a five block radius.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Location - Get the rooms with the view
text: Lovely view over the river from the rooms with the floor-ceiling windows (these are priced out as an option). Great location, very clean, very attentive staff. Too "modern" for my tastes, but apparently the whole world wants funky now. Will definitely check their rates the next time I'm staying in the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel with Awesome Views!!!
text: My family and I stayed here over the holidays to take in the city and do some shopping.  We were pleasantly surprised at how great their staff was.  Our room was very modern and had a fabulous view! If you're looking for a great hotel, with awesome views and in the heart of the city, this is it!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Favorite
text: Great staff, well appointed, and amazing views! Alex at the front desk did a excellent job during the busy check in time. The lobby bar is a cool place to see and be seen. Will definitely be back and recommend to others.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing one-night stay!
text: Family of four's first stay at London House was absolutely perfect.   Our hotel reservations were narrowed down between this property and Hotel Monaco, & the amazing London House reviews won us over.  Our expectations were by far exceeded.  Self parking a few blocks over was a breeze.  Check in/out was super smooth. I cannot remember if it was Jim or Tim who checked us in, but he ensured our stay was exactly what we had planned.  Upon arrival to our room, we received a text from this awesome London House employee to make sure we were happy and well taken care of.  We're foodies, so he recommended places that we're in walking distance.  I cannot stress the amazing location; literally a few blocks walk from everything!  The bakery menu is awesome and extremely affordable for downtown. The Nespresso machine was an awesome treat to wake up to, as well as the complimentary robe and slippers.  Were very picky as far as hotel cleanliness, and this was the cleanest hotel We have ever been to, and we travel a lot.  We will be heading back to Chicago in a few months' time, and there's no question, we'll happily return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A new favorite
text: A new favorite in Chicago. Fresh and modern. Great design, smart choices: we loved the idea of gettin' in touch with the concierge via SMS, very convenient and every request was quickly processed. Breakfast was excellent as well as all the services.Room was not too big but very cosy and had a great view on the river and bathroom was very good size. We definitely loved the Nespresso coffee machine: a great plus (finally something that taste almost like real coffee!).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pre New Years Stay
text: Had a lovely stay at this unique Hilton property.  Rooms have great amenities, such as 55 inch televisions and high end bath products.  Many thanks to Daniel at the front desk for making sure my stay was comfortable and my room was the one I wanted.  The location of the hotel is great and rooms also have great views of the Chicago river.  They are nice and quiet as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Near Everything for New Year's Eve.
text: I am a Hilton Honors member and this is a new hotel. It was in a great location for New Year's Eve in Chicago! We were in walking distance to everything- great restaurants, the countdown to New Years ChiTown Rising Concert, and the River. We had GREAT views of downtown and the River. Even though we were in the midst of everything on New Year's Eve the hotel was still quiet overall. We did have a problem in which the person at the desk checked us in incorrectly. This resulted in someone trying to come into our room at 3am! Never had that happen before. The front desk apologized and took care of the mistake. We also did not get hour Hilton breakfast coupons ...since this was our first time I am hoping we just got one employee that didn't know what they were doing at check in. Over all service was okay from everyone else at the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A New Favorite Hotel in Chicago
text: As a Hilton Honors Diamond Member, I get around.  A very pleasant New Years Eve one night stay- Corner room with a City/ River View - an excellent bed, large TV, panoramic views, tasty and quick morning room service.  The best part of the stay ABUNDANT Door Men, that were extremely helpful in navigating the congested Upper Wacker Drive, along with excellent Bell Men service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Christmas trip
text: Had a wonderful stay at the LondonHouse. The hotel is gorgeous. Rooms were beautiful and very quiet. Staff was amazing. Went over Christmas time. Can't wait to go back during the summer months. BEST location. U must go to the rooftop top....Stunning Views!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Christmas window displays
text: Our room was facing Trump Towers, in the original part of the hotel. It was actually kind of cool, you could tell it was once the opening to one of the elevator cabs, smaller, but sparkling new.  The whole hotel was state of the art, staff very friendly and helpful. Chicago was decked out, beautiful, however we were disappointed in the windows. The store displays were just not there!  I remember them being all decked out for Christmas, it was the Harry Potter era - but nothing this time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay
text: Wife and I were able to get away for a night in the city.  Stayed at LondonHouse and enjoyed it immensely.  Check-in was quick and courteous, rooms are very nice and comfortable.  Rooftop bar was closed for the season, but the view was amazing all the same.  Look forward to visiting again soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Our hotel stay was excellent.  Clean room, comfortable bed, and great location. Located on the river at Michigan Ave, so easy walk to Magnificent Mile shops and Millennium Park. I give this hotel two thumbs up.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Would not recommend staying at LondonHouse
text: The rooms and hotel were nice, but I would not recommend staying here. I left a valuable gift I had just received for Christmas in the room, and when I called they informed me nothing had been turned in. My guess is that it was stolen by a staff member when they found it, instead of turning it in.The pillow cases were dirty, we found dirty marks on two different pillows. The walls are relatively thin, so we were woken up by noises from the other guests.We asked if any other rooms with a better view were available when we checked in, there was, and we were put in that room -- but they did not tell us there would be a charge for this. We later found out on the bill what the additional charge per day was.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Hotel, Exceptional Staff!
text: Recently, I stayed at the LondonHouse Chicago for the first time.  Nice decorum, great location, and exceptional staff.  Shout out to Bryan for accommodating my upgrade request as a Diamond member.  Continental breakfast was nice.  Even better if it included boiled or scrambled eggs to expand protein options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Rooms, Location, and Staff
text: This hotel is in close proximity to shopping and restaurants and not a terrible walk all the way down to Grant Park.  Parking is a little high, but there's a place around the corner for roughly half price, so plan on that, if you don't like the sound of $40 per night.A couple interesting things about the London House:The rooftop bar is a hot spot with lines to get in from happy hour through most of the night when the weather permits.  Plan ahead if you hope to check out the scene.The rooms are modern, artistic, well-appointed, great shower, and well-insulated from interior noises. You'll still hear the cars honking at each other outside, but that's about all.River view rooms are obviously great, if you can get one.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel, great location!
text: The rooms seemed to be recently updated and the staff was very accommodating. The location in downtown Chicago is absolutely great! We will definitely choose to stay at this property again and hope the price will be reasonable when we come back in the summer months!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning Hotel
text: We just finished up our stay at LondonHouse in Chicago.  We stayed in room 1723 and had a view of the river and Trump tower.  The location was close to everything we wanted to go see while there.  The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful.  So many modern details in every part of the hotel.  We did not get to go to the roof top deck since it had just snowed but the restaurant on the 21st floor is beautiful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Brand new deco at perfect location
text: Great location, brand new renovation with modern bathroom, chic decoration, friendly staff, super high speed wi-fi connection, delicious room service, hi-tech system both in room and in public area, comfortable bed etc. We got 2 rooms, one with king bed and one was the double bed with river view. Both were spacious, clean and well prepared. The only thing I find it not really satisfying is the breakfast, there's not much choice (but the staff in the restaurant are very friendly even it's 6 am in the cold winter morning), it's a pity. Except this, this hotel is definitely a great place to stay with it's reasonable price. (even better with Hilton's membership).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Christmas night
text: It was absolutely amazing! Beautiful environment, very friendly and helpful stuff. Very tasty cocktails and breakfast. Breathtaking view from rooftop patio. Rooms are fabulous very modern, clean and comfortable. View from our Vista room was just all you can dream for.Thank you guys. It was unforgettableüôè

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel - Downtown Chicago
text: Until my recent retirement I have travelled to 20 countries and would be on the road 40 weeks of the year. This hotel was perfect with amenities, rooms and location offers walking distance to majority of Chicago's sights and shopping.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb Short Stay at the London House
text: We stayed only one night, but we were impressed.  We were there December 19-20, 2016.  It was frigid in Chicago.  Crowds were light, prices were low.As a Hilton Honors Gold Member, we were upgraded to a suite with a million dollar view of the bridges crossing the Chicago River.  The suite had tall ceilings and new furniture.  It was immaculately clean.  The bathroom was large.  We were given robes and slippers.We asked for very late checkout (5:00 p.m.) and got it.  We also got a free continental breakfast.  The service was friendly, the fruit was fresh, the croissants were so flaky we would have been on the Champs Elysees.We had a light lunch in the dining room.  Not cheap, but interesting, well-prepared dishes.The health club has plenty of equipment.  It might be a little on the small side during high season.  But I had plenty of room and easy access to the equipment.The location is unmatched in Chicago:  E. Wacker Dr. and N. Michigan Avenue.  There is easy access to corporate Chicago in the Loop, but the Mag Mile is just across the bridge.  There is easy access to the South Loop, home of one of our favorite inexpensive Chicago restaurants, Eleven City Diner.I loved the fact that you called for you elevator to take you to a specific floor.  No more pressing up then pressing your floor once you get in.   A small thing, but so brilliant you wonder why it is not a feature of every new hotel.Downsides?  Not many.  There is no closet.  Just a small hang bar which is jammed with hangers and the robes.  So there is no room to hang clothes.  There are no hooks on the doors, so you are really stuck.  We ended up laying our coats on the sofa in the small parlor area.  The suite is really one big room with a divider, the new trend.  But those are minor quibbles.  This is a great choice for business or leisure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House is the epitome of a swank, elegant Chicago loop hotel.
text: The London House location is amazing at corner of Wacker and Michigan; the Vista Suite has an amazing view of the river.  The soundproofing in this hotel is amazing--no outside noise from hall or other rooms evident. Restful, elegant, beautiful hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Suite not so sweet
text: The hotel was recently updated so everything is newer and clean. Location is perfect! Views from the vista rooms were nice and faced the Trump building so you're looking at the letters TRUMP.  The views from the Hyatt are better as you can see the Wrigley building and the river. We booked the King Vista suite and a connecting 2 double Vista room. I was highly disappointed with the suite. The sofa is a love seat and when the bed is expanded, it takes up the entire sitting area making it difficult to get to the bathroom. The sofa table needs to be moved to the bedroom to open the sofa bed and it's very heavy. The connecting door could not be kept open because there wasn't enough room to fit between the door and the wall. This room is extremely awkward and I would never recommend it. The 2 dbl. was spacious. They advertise a microwave in the room but, there wasn't one in either room. I expect a microwave and refrigerator when paying top rate for a suite. It was 11:00 pm when we realized there wasn't hot water in the double room. The maintenance person fixed it but we had to stay up until 1:30 while he worked on it. That was rough after a 5 hour drive to Chicago and then walking around town in the cold. There wasn't any bedding for the sofa bed so they had to bring that up to us as well. Housekeeping came in the next day, made the bed, locked the connecting door and left. Didn't leave towels, clean the bathroom or leave clean glasses. I finally complained and was told a manager would call me the next day. I'm still waiting for that call. I could go on but, it would make this review too long. If you want more information about the London House, send me a private message.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Vacation
text: This was a beautiful hotel with a great location. The only downfall is the beds are a little too firm for our liking. And we wish they were at least double queens instead of double full beds. The spa experience was great.  We would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago for Business
text: The hotel occupies an historic building in the heart of Chicago, is modern and luxurious, yet has a classic style. The views of the city are amazing. The Service I received was fantastic. Highly Recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views, great visit
text: Followed others recommendations and got a room with a view.  Amazing!!!  Also stayed away from the expensive drinks at the bar and the regular breakfast and went to Wildberry's and the corner bakery down stairs on the corner.  If you're just looking for a beautiful, clean, large room with an amazing view of Chicago this is your place, we loved it.  If your looking for a hotel with a fancy restaurant, breakfast go elsewhere.  I would definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mom and daughter overnight
text: My mom and I loved this hotel. Everything from the location, views, amenities, comfort, and classy atmosphere!  Our room was perfect. The view outside the window looked over the river and you could see down Wacker Drive either way. The lights were spectacular at night. This hotel is located in a prime spot so close to everything. We came in on the train just two blocks away. Michigan Avenue shopping was less than a block away. Macy's and the Christkindlemarket was within a 5 minute walk. We loved the check in lounge area and enjoyed a cocktail overlooking the river in the evening. The beds were extremely comfortable and bathroom had everything we needed. We will definitely return!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Arriving on a very cold December day, the Valet and all the guys near the front door are exemplary.   And everytime we left, they were there to help, direct, or answer a question. It's $71.00, but worth it.   Up to second floor to check in, the whole area is modern and clean.  The gal at the front desk, Tatiana, was friendly, albeit a bit robotic.  In my reservation, I had asked for a larger room and a view of river, which she acknowledged, but upon entering my room, I did not have the view.  The room, however, was perfect.  Beautiful, clean and spacious, Room 1342.  Euro modern feel.  Front desk gave us wrong info on opening Wi-fi, had to call and even then, the person was trying to figure it out.  But the room had a dreamy, comfortable bed and pillows with white sheets and comforter.  Plenty of space for luggage, refrigerator, great reading lights, large flat screen tv, very clean bathroom, with a large counter.  I couldn't have had it better.  Even the Ritz doesn't give refrigerators.  No breakfast, but I usually like to bring my own.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel service sucks
text: Great rooms nice expect bad service if check your car bad at a price of 71 dollars  pure price gauging and service sucks for high end hotel.    If you don't use that service great place and excellent view

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We really liked this hotel! Quiet, lovely rooms, great views.
text: We really liked this hotel. We had a suite on a high floor that had spectacular views of the river. I ate in the lobby bar and it was very good. The breakfast room on the top is also very good and a great place to get drinks next to the outside firepit. There are excellent views from up there too!  We also liked that it was quiet and not so full of drips wearing jeans and hoodies. It seemed more professionally oriented.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: "Almost Home"
text: My wife booked the LondonHouse for my surprise birthday stay, and I couldn't have been happier!! From the bellman to room keeping I have no complaints!! The staff was very accommodating, rooms/view beautiful. I like the LondonHouse so much that I cancelled my hotel arraignments on new years just to stay again. Thank you LondonHouse for making Chicago visits simpler

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room with a view
text: The location of the Londonhouse was perfect and we had an incredible view  overlookiing the river  looking from our floor to ceiling window. Our room was well apppointed  and designed.  The staff was friendly and helpful and we'll be returning in the summer to check out the rooftop lounge.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House -a refined refuge in the Windy City
text: I use this app and rely on the reviews posted for helping to decide activity and hotels. So if I can help one person have as as wonderful experience, it's worth writing. London House surpassed my expectations in all areas. Quality, refinement, and comfort echo though out this beautiful architectural gem. Staff could not be more accommodating and friendly. It was my daughter's 12th birthday and we flew there in hopes of getting last minute tickets to Hamilton- which I did at box office. The staff surprised my daughter with a beautiful dessert and card hoping she enjoyed her special Hamilton evening. The view of the river while enjoying a lovely nespresso in your room;  listening to the trivoli audio are the kind of details that creates a quality experience. The lounge on the second floor with a bar is a perfect place to enjoy everything from a cup of tea to dinner with drinks and fit any mood because of the various seating arrangements. I did not have a drink on the 21st floor lounge, but toured- again quality with a more Chicago night life feel. Treat yourself and stay at the London House- the specials make it a affordable option for many. Pay a little extra for the vista rooms with the floor to ceiling windows - worth it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My favorite Hilton in Chicago
text: Not often do I drop a review for my hotel stays but as a multi year Diamond Hilton member, this hotel is worth the value.  Staff is tremendous, especially Paige, and I owe her a debt of "thanks" for going the extra mile.  Room views are tremendous, the rooftop and high level bar ambiance are amazing and the food and beverage guy deserves kudos for the quality.  I will be back often.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First time staying and impressed
text: Beds very comfortable, bathroom spacious and has amble counter space. Elevators are a bit confusing because need to pass key and select floor on key pad, no buttons in the elevator. Have room with City view nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pricey
text: Don't get me wrong, the room was beautiful, the view was spectacular.  However, the drinks are overpriced.  There was no price on the menu so I assumed i would pay the average price for a glass of wine.  I was floored when 4 drinks cost us 115.00.  in addition, the hotel placed 100.00 a day on my card for incidentals, which is fine,  I expected that, what I did not expect, was to find additional holds on my cc simply because I used the incidental dollars on actual incidentals. I would recommend London House for the hotel only.  For dinner and drinks; go somewhere else.  Otherwise you may have a  not so nice little surprise on your credit card.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fun in Chicago
text: We had a fabulous stay at the London House. The design of the interiors is great, the staff was helpful and friendly and the amenities were wonderful. Can't beat the location. We will definitely be back

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in the heart of the city
text: This is a fairly "new" (newly revised building) hotel. The rooms are a good size compared to other locations in the city. Beds are comfortable. The bathroom amenities are nice and smell great. I have stayed here a number of times this year and have always been content to come back. The internet is slow though and this seems to be an issue in most hotel rooms in Chicago. The rooftop bar is hard to get into during peek times in the summer so make reservations. Breakfast was pricy here, if you do not have it included with your reservation then go downstairs to the Corner Bakery (not related to the hotel) or check out other options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely New Modern Hotel. Great Location. Great Price Point.
text: Our King ‚ÄúVista‚Äù room on the 12th floor was spotless and beautifully appointed.  It was a bit smaller than we anticipated but adequate enough for a short stay.  The view from the floor to ceiling and wall to wall window of the Chicago River and surrounding architecturally historic buildings was EPIC.  Our bathroom was a decent size with a shower-only option.  Water pressure was OK but we encountered a bit of difficultly maintaining hot water throughout our stay.  Nice bath products and plenty of new fluffy towels.  The decor is mid-century modern and quite lovely.  Our bed was dreamy comfortable with great pillows and top-notch linens.  We had a Nespresso coffee maker as well as an empty mini-fridge; both convenient and much appreciated.  We were able to maintain the room temp perfectly even though we had huge windows and it was FREEZING cold outside. WiFi was good.  Set in a beautifully restored,1920‚Äôs high-rise building, you can tell this hotel is on the newer side as everything is fresh and not showing any signs of wear and tear.  We enjoyed the architectural detail and artwork throughout this beautiful old building.  Nice bar and Living Room type environment at lobby level. Every staff member we encountered were polite, welcoming and helpful.  The location is EXCELLENT and perfect for a downtown Chicago experience.  Michigan Ave is just steps away and is truly beautiful during Christmastime. SO many great restaurants and bars nearby.  Walgreens right around the corner.  We took the Blue Line to the Clark/Lake station from O‚ÄôHare and it was a 10 min walk to the hotel.  Not sure I would walk it again in the cold but not bad during decent weather.  The only odd thing we encountered were the elevators.  You must choose your floor from an iPad type device which will then tell you which elevator to use.  There are no floor buttons inside the elevator so be sure you get on the one designated specifically by you and for you.  We noticed other guests thought it was an odd concept as well; kind of funny actually...The LondonHouse is a lovely modern hotel with a great, convenient and scenic location. Very fair price point on our dates.  We travel to Chicago several times each year and have stayed in many wonderful hotels throughout the city.  Although a quick one night stay, we throughly enjoyed LondonHouse and would not hesitate to return.  Highly recommend!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome location and decor.
text: This hotel is very conveniently located in downtown. Hotel lobby and room decor was very modern. Views from the room are great, if you are on river side. Breakfast and bar area was great as well. Staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location
text: We stayed on 13 floor - quiet with fabulous view of the river.   Perfect location for all areas of the City, great bar on 21st level and really helpful and friendly staff.   The room was clean and spacious with really comfortable beds.    Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What an experience
text: What a pleasure it was to stay at LondonHouse. At the beginning i was a bit shaky about the service however that turned around rather quickly. A very attentive and courteous staff which is very hard to come by in todays service industry. Keep up the GREAT work. Kudos to Mr. Hernandez at the desk for his wonderful guest services and also Eduardo from banquets. It was a pleasure to meet the both of them. Also thank you to the entire team. Troy, David and Keith how wonderful it was to meet all of you.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Milk @ 4am
text: This is not about the hotel itself!! That you can see from the photos. The people are awesome on every level! My daughter was having a fit in the middle of the night and the kitchen was closed! But some how they brought me milk @ 4am! That was the icing on the cake! They constantly check on you to make sure your awesome! Plus, due to weather conditions my boyfriend couldn't make it. We had an extra room, they didn't charge us for. Can you believe that! I travel at least twice a month and that has never happen! Anyway! They staff!! Awesome, hotel super cute and clean. But! The staff 5 plus stars! I gave 4 stars because the elevator situation is crazy! You'll laugh!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent from the moment we walked through the front doors
text: From the moment we walked through the doors and were greeted by the gentlemen at the front door to the moment we left and they said goodbye was wonderful. We had complicated multiple reservations and decided to stay an extra night while we were there and they accommodated us with no problems.
