They even upgraded us to the Presidential Suite the first night, much to our delightful surprise!  The views of the river are spectacular and the location can not get much better to all the shopping and sight seeing.  We will be staying here again, hands down.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved this beautiful new hotel on the Chicago River
text: We recently spent 2 nights here. The service is outstanding, the room was comfortable , clean and the view spectacular. Can't wait to return. Have a drink at Bridges on the second floor. A wonderful addition to Chicago hotel market. Patricia

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What warmth despite the cold!
text: Great stay at the LondonHouse! What an inspiring job renovating this perfectly-positioned building into a chic, modern masterpiece with historic charm. The LH branding scheme is prominent throughout as further evidence of the hotel's attention to detail. The front desk team was genuinely welcoming with Hasna, Jim, Daniel and others going the extra mile to make my stay memorable. Breakfast was great as well with outstanding, courteous service. My room was terrific and the spinning tv/mirror combo was really neat! Looking forward to staying here again when it's warmer to enjoy the Rooftop Lounge offering a classic skyline view of Michigan Ave with the river running through it. They should've named it the "Magnificent Lounge!"I occasionally post on TA but only after an all-around, amazing experience. Congrats to Hilton on this Curio Collection gem in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern and efficient!
text: Loved this hotel. Great service. Great price. Great location!   2nd floor lobby was comfortable and a great place to relax or meet up with friends. Can't wait til the weather permits enjoying the rooftop bar!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Above & Beyond
text: Let me first say that I've never left a hotel review but this trip warranted one. I was on a weekend getaway to propose to my now fianc√©. We had an early flight and I knew early check-in would be tough to come by. We were greeted by Lorelei at the front desk and she could not have been more accommodating. We went out for a walk and brunch to pass the time until the room was ready a few hours before standard check-in time. We stayed in a King Vista Room and the views are no joke as other people have reviewed.  My fianc√© was blown away by the view and how modern and clean the hotel lobby and room was. We were there for two nights and on the second night we came back from dinner to complimentary champagne and chocolates in the room. This was not requested and apparently the engagement was overheard by lobby staff and was sent as a ‚Äúcongrats and thank you‚Äù for celebrating at the LondonHouse. I couldn't be happier with all the staff as they made us feel so welcome and special. Oh, they also checked in via text message just enough to be accommodating and make sure there was nothing else they could be doing to make our stay better. I thought that was awesome. I can't imagine staying anywhere else and will without a doubt recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago. Well done LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Gem
text: An inexpensive hidden gem in the loop, a very rare find indeed. The food and drinks in the hotel are well overpriced, that said the Emerald Loop is just around the corner and other decent restaurants are nearby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great VAlue
text: Very attractive, nice rooms, decent size, vista suites good layout, quiet, accommodating staff, reasonable price, perfect location for my meetings. Some, like me, may not enjoy rooms on Wacker Drive as the views are tainted by the oversize letters of Trumpolini. Must keep blackout shades drawn.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful find
text: I really liked the location of this hotel, right at Michigan & Whacker. We rode South Shore to Millennium station and walked an easy 3 blocks to hotel. Easy walk to theatre district and magnificent mile. Friendly staff, Anthony at the concierge desk helped with getting our restaurant reservation and coordinated an in room gift. Very clean overall and the rooms very comfortable. We had a river view which was great to see the lights and hustle/bustle of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved the Vista Suite and location
text: Upgrade to a suite if you have an opportunity - totally worth the extra money.  Bed was so comfortable and loved the river view (Vista Suite). Great location, able to walk to everything.  Great experience and hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern Hotel with Great Views and Location
text: My boyfriend and I just recently traveled to Chicago for my birthday, I selected this hotel because we live in a small mountain town and we wanted city views and a modern/hip hotel vibe. The staff was very friendly, and location was great to Michigan Ave and State street and we loved the city views from our room. Hoping we can return sometime in the summer to take advantage of the rooftop bar area.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cozy, Modern Rooms... Amazing Views... Friendly Staff! Love This Place!
text: I absolutely loved our stay here at the LondonHouse Hotel in Chicago. From the rooms, to the service, to the rooftop and room views... it was all amazing!The LondonHouse Hotel is in a great historic building right along the river in the heart of Chicago. You could not ask for a better location, as you are steps away from the theater district, Magnificent Mile, and Cloud Gate (the "Bean"). It was cold (but not insanely cold) so we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go, even to the Fulton Market area. The Chicago's First Lady Architecture Cruise boards right across the street.The lobby is on the second floor and has a lovely, inviting lounge. Alexandra helped us when we arrived, and she made the check-in a breeze. As a Hilton Diamond member, she made sure to check for upgrades (we got a great view, see pics) and recommended a lot of things to do/see/eat in the area. I really liked that she remembered my name whenever she saw me the next few days, and I especially enjoyed the texting service. If I had not OCD-planned this trip in advance, I would have loved to use their Concierge service to score some restaurant/show tickets.We had a corner king room, Room 1x10, with an incredible view of the river. I wish I had taken pictures of the room, but it had a nice modern studio feel to it. The bed was so comfortable, and the fridge and Nespresso machine were a nice touch. As a Hilton Diamond member, I received 2 continental breakfast coupons per day. The coupons are used upstairs at the 20th floor restaurant. In lieu of the continental breakfast, you can also swap for $18 per person on the ala carte menu. I liked the lounge vibe of the restaurant, and the service was fantastic. Everyone in this hotel is so nice! We even got to go up to the rooftop bar, which was closed for service, but open for the views. Pretty cool up there!And really... how much did I enjoy this place? So much so that I'm going back to Chicago for NYE and staying here again! Kudos to the incredible staff and to the Hilton! We will see you in a few weeks!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: We enjoyed our stay here this weekend. The staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable. Rooms were small but had everything we needed. The rooftop was closed due to weather-bummer. We loved the view of the river the best! This place was worth our money. For a romantic getaway, I would recommend this place. Close walking distance to many shops and restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel with class
text: This is a beautiful Hotel well located downtown Services is goods from restaurants to lobbyRooms are large and ver modern I would defiantly go back Theatres are close, restaurants   I took a cab from airport cost about $55.00 dollars one way

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Can we move in?
text: Everything about this place was amazing. The front desk staff were all great and they gave us a room with an incredible view. They text you to see how you're liking your room and you can make requests that way. (Can you tell I'm a millennial?) I texted to ask for a couple more Nespresso pods and they were left in an adorable bag on our door handle for when we got back later that evening. The room was beautiful and all of the high tech lighting and TV were fun to play with. Even the elevators were cool. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a log. Everything was as pristine as you would hope a hotel to be. Didn't have a chance to check out the rooftop bar but room service breakfast was pretty good. There's a Corner bakery on the first floor and 3 Starbucks within about a block. The location is great, though a little far from the L. Lots of shopping and activities nearby too!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: On its way to being one of the best in its class!
text: My wife and I spent two nights at LondonHouse for a weekend getaway. Being an longtime HHonors elite, I always aim to try out new Hilton properties when I have a chance to do so. LondonHouse does not disappoint. A merging of new building combined with a total restoration of an existing, historical building flows seamlessly. The public spaces are best described as "vintage meets West Elm" -- stylish, complimentary to the vintage architecture, but very comfortable. Outside of the recent improvements to the Conrad brand, this is a concept that will help Hilton go after younger clientele who feel like Waldorf is for their grandparents.Don't be fooled by the narrow main entrance off of West Wacker - this is an expansive property. The shame is that the seemingly "marquee" way to enter at Michigan Ave./Wacker is locked (you can exit from there, though). On the second floor of LondonHouse is the main desk and lobby lounge. We had cocktails there the first night and found the seating areas to be enjoyable, but the service to be slow/unmotivated for a Friday evening. The space also has a fatal flaw during the winter: it is susceptible to the cold wind gusts that blow in from the entrance below. I'm someone who always "runs warm" and even I was a little uncomfortable. Hopefully, management will quickly install blowers or an air wall on the entry doors to help prevent this. This is the property's first winter, so I imagine they are just working through some initial, seasonal knicks. We reserved a "Vista" King Room online and were given one on the 7th floor. The view of the Chicago River was breathtaking and surprisingly, the outside noise was largely muffled thanks to heavily-glazed floor to ceiling windows. Only a random fire truck/ambulance could be heard when it was roaring at full-blast. The room itself was nicely-sized and well-designed. High-level trim was noted throughout, including premium fixtures and handles. The only complaint I would have is that the bathroom itself was rather small -- with a single sink and shower stall. It would have been fine for a business trip, but was too cramped for a couple trying to get ready simultaneously. The bed linens were comfy -- soft and warm -- with a mid-weight duvet. The pillows were king-size with down filling, but a little too flat for my tastes. Would have appreciated 2 firm/2 down pillows placed on the bed as a happy medium. Plugs and USB ports were throughout the room, including on both bedsides (always appreciated). The 55" HDTV was the focal point from the bed and included Chromecast capability, which is such a simple, but welcomed innovation. To be able to watch a favorite Netflix show or YouTube video while traveling - without having to view it on my iPad or laptop - is a real treat! Outside of the small bathroom, the only other gripes I had with the guestroom experience was the free HHonors internet speed, which was <1mb/s the entire visit -- unacceptably slow for 2016 -- and an oddity with the entry door. Any time another guest on my side of the hall would close their door, our door would rattle in its frame. Annoying!Overall, you simply cannot beat LondonHouse's location for work or play. It's a solid addition at its price-point/class for the area and I'll definitely be back for another stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: nice place to stay in Chicago, no pool
text: first time in Chicagothis hotel has excellent location for the tourist:  easy to walk to the Bean and the Art Institute and the river cruise boatsnewly renovated hotelgood size bathroomshowercoffee maker was outside the bathroom.....unlike some newer designs in other Hilton set upscomfortable bed....sleep was goodmy view was of the river and the Trump tower directly acrossthe rooftop view is pretty good....but basically you see the Trump tower with some more city views no swimming pool :( but i knew that when i bookedhotel staff were friendlynice clean roomno free breakfasti had a king bed and so it had a little desknice for 1 or 2 people.....wouldn't bring more than that for this roomwould go to different Hiltons for family stays

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House - Dec 8 2016
text: I enjoyed a single night stay at the LondonHouse this week.  For a new hotel, the staff was excellent - very friendly and available to help.    The lobby bar was small and cozy, but very nice - with a duo performing Holiday Music.    Front desk staff was very efficient and welcoming.  I like the new touch of a text message asking about my stay vs the voice mail from the manager on the room phone.  I rarely touch a room phone, so it is nice to see this type of innovation.The 21st floor lounge/restaurant was very nice - and was accommodated to our "after party" group that found it's way there after our company event in the 3rd floor ballroom.   They kept their bar open and their staff available for at least an additional hour, and I'm pretty sure they had a very lucrative final hour.The location is excellent - the view from my room of the river was very nice also.   The room was small, but well organized and never felt cramped.   Bed was very comfortable as was the single chair in the room.I would easily recommend the LondonHouse to another traveler that wanted to stay in the heart of Chicago.My only regret is that it was too cold to enjoy their outdoor balcony.   This gives me a goal of returning in the summer!Thanks LondonHouse for a very nice stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Is the 4 Star rating a typo?
text: I'm going to keep this as short as possible - if you only want a place with a nice view, this is the hotel for you. The staff is also very friendly. But this is not a hotel for someone looking to stay 5 nights, especially if you have children with you. -Lighting or lack of lighting..the room was dark and figuring out the light switches to the one pendant hanging in the back of the room was daunting, especially in the dark. There are little lights near the bed and luckily the bathroom was well lit. It felt like they wanted the room dark in order to hide something..-Size..the room was very small. We even booked the larger double room with the view. Sardine box. -Room Service, sure sounds nice right? Especially when it's snowing and you have children and can't really go anywhere. Well think again, there is no where to eat any of the overpriced, mediocre food they offer. They don't bring a roll-in table and you have one very small desk to huddle over..in the dark. Also, there is not a single child sized option on the menu, not kid friendly at all. You are however, able to order food to be delivered from any of the restaurants in the area if you can't go out but good luck finding a place to eat in the room, unless you enjoy eating in your bed. -Linens, they are rough. The beds are dressed in a way that if you move in the wrong direction the cheap polyester-stuffed comforter becomes exposed showing you the blood stains hidden underneath. Who knows when those things were last washed..the pillow covers had blood stains as well. Lovely. -Thin walls, we could hear other guests and their TVs all night long...-Need a place to plug in the hair dryer? Don't look in the bathroom. Instead go to the mirror in the dark hallway, only outlet in the room besides the nightstand. If you like drying your hair in bed or the dark hallway, they've got you covered. -Lastly, if you need a place to hang your wet snow/rain covered coats, they will have to go in the closet with the rest of your dry clothes. Who would think you'd need a place to hang a wet coat in Chicago?Would not stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful boutique hotel with everything one could need!
text: This hotel hits all the marks...gorgeously styled, wonderfully appointed rooms and excellent customer service.  We stayed in a king studio corner room and it was extremely spacious.  A good hotel, to me, has the little details that I enjoy.  Such as: lighted vanity mirror in the bathroom, Nespresso coffee machine, top of the line mini fridge, plush towels, bathrobe & slippers and bedside reading lamps.  We called the front desk for extra Nespresso coffee pods and they were brought up to our room within 3 minutes! When does that ever happen?! From check in to doormen to lounge servers, all staff are professional and pleasant.  The decor is fabulous and the location is hard to beat.  Cannot wait to return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite Hotel
text: This hotel is amazing. From the super friendly valet and bell hops to the wonderful front desk attendants - everyone was great. The rooms were spectacular with amazing views and super soft beds. I will absolutely be returning to this hotel in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The hotel is fine, but customer service is lacking.
text: As a Gold Hilton Honors customer, this was my first London House stay. I very much like the boutique concept and location of the property. The rooms are quite comfortable, and larger than I expected. What was a huge disappointment was the lack of quality service in the lobby lounge area and the 21st floor. Not only did the servers completely ignore us, they had the audacity to charge $15 for a 5 ounce glass of not so great Chardonnay. Is the concept to charge London prices?

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Experience
text: I have been coming to Chicago for years and this was my best stay yet! The hotel, itself, was immaculately clean and updated.  The staff provided the highest of service that you would expect from a luxury hotel. Our room was incredible! The walk-in marble shower was amazing! The views of the city were to die for as well!  I can't wait to go back! LondonHouse is definitely our new go-to!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing!
text: Amazing staff, food and rooms.  Room service was awesome too!  Spectacular view!  We stayed in the Presidential Suite and everything about it was wonderful.  A lot of space through out.  Breakfast was delicious and not skimpy on the portions as I thought might me the case.  We can't say enough about our GREAT experience and we will be staying at the London House again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simply amazing
text: This is, hands down, the best hotel I've ever stayed at.  Elegantly styled, friendly staff, and lots of amenities.  Anytime I am in Chicago, that will be my go-to place.  It is located right on the river and is close to the Magnificent Mile.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Weekend Destination in Downtown Chicago!
text: Mt wife and I plan a holiday weekend in Chicago every year for us and our two children (ages 11 and 15) and this year we stayed at Londonhouse. While my first thought was the hotel wasn't a great choice for younger children and teens, both our children loved the hotel and enjoyed our stay. The room was modern and well-appointed with an amazing view of the Chicago river and upper Wacker Drive. The beds were very comfortable, a small fridge was standard -  perfect for the champagne  we brought with - as was a safe for valuables and great flat screen TV. The staff (including Front Desk, Valet and Room Service Attendants) were all exceedingly polite and professional; all did amazing work. Location could not be beat. Walking to Michigan Avenue was easy - even for the children! We walked to the Drake for tea and then RL for dinner. Highly recommended!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: This is a great new hotel
text: I booked directly with the hotel and got a great rate.  More importantly the view of the Chicago river and Michigan avenue was unbelievably gorgeous!  Best view ever.  The location is perfect for business or pleasure. I uber when in Chicago.  I can't imagine what it would cost to park over night.  Staff was very professional.  The lobby is chic and hip with a great view as well.  Can't wait to book here again.  They've only been open for 6 months.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best View!
text: This hotel has the best view! My boyfriend took me there and while we were enjoying the great view on a cold winter evening he popped THE question and asked me to marry him! The roof top bar is just great, we can't wait to go back in the summer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing stylish modern hotel with macgical views of river
text: Stayed in a king room, room was oversized and bathroom was nice and large, a really modern and lovely hotel. Check in was super friendly and quick, thanks Jim. What was fab? * Large modern rooms* Furnishings * Friendly staff * Value for money * Quality Toiletries What was drab? * Nothing at all What can't be easily changed? * n/aWould I stay here again?* Absolutely

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago!
text: The London House Hotel surpassed my expectations! My overall experience is a 10! From my check in process to my magnificent hotel room, my stay was amazing! The customer service at this hotel is second to none. The London House will always be my "Home" when I visit Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay in Windy City
text: Come to Chicago every December for anniversary trip - always stay at a different place. The hotel was very modern, comfortable, hip and refined. Awesome corner studio room with great views of city and riverfront. Carolers for enjoyment were a great holiday touch!Service was a bit lacking in refinement. Manager did an awesome job but they were slammed when I checked in and I didn't receive text updates on room readiness and had to call back in. Minor thing, but just lacking in refinement. Valet was a bad experience. No parking attendant waiting outside hotel. Had to park with wife in car, head in to desk, the staff member walked outside with me and she and I could not find him. He happened to be inside entrance on phone... no way to tell he was managing the BUSY parking right on Wacker (there is not separate pull-in). The adjoining Wyndham attendants were more helpful. Everything worked out okay, but at $71 bucks a night for parking, expected a bit more.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location - very nice staff and excellent rooms
text: Everything about this hotel was great - excellent service, very nice, comfortable rooms.  Great place for meetings and social events.  Our holiday party at the hotel was very nice - great food and excellent service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location with Great Service
text: Having the hotel in the heart of downtown right on the river was wonderful. The fact that everything was within a half mile was my favorite part. The service was amazing and very accomidating. They did anything we asked for. We were quite needy and they accomidated every bit of our needs. The hotel is newly remodeled and it is a very comfortable place to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Value in the Loop
text: Stayed here one night on a quick trip to the city, and we thought this was a great value. Superb location in the middle of the downtown, with dozens of great restaurants in easy walking distance.Room was spacious, modern and clean, the whole hotel was in great shape. Highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Curious at Curio
text: Fabulous location and hotel experience in the Windy City.  The design of the hotel is very unusual as Hilton is retro fitting old buidlings and repurposing them.  The elevators are unique in that you identify the floor of travcel from the lobby and it tells you the elevcator of choice,  Like, us it is interesting to watch people just jump on a moving elevator exopecting to hit a floor button; only to find out there are none and return to the looby to start again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Boutique Hotel with all the "Hilton" perks
text: Besides the location of this hotel which is enough to have me stay there again, the style and design is excellent.  Its modern chic but still true to the heritage of the old building that it is in.  Amazing roof top bar area with an incredible view!  Can't wait to come back in the summer and enjoy a drink and watch boats pass up and down the river.  If you can, request a room with a river view.  Some of the rooms can leave with you building views which isn't terrible because you shouldn't be in your room that much in this amazing city!  My hope is that this hotel stays budget friendly for both work & pleasure travel as it could easily be very pricey if they wanted to be.  Great weekend @ a great hotel, THANKS!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great place to stay!!
text: We loved this hotel! It's a beautiful modern hotel. Great location close to Michigan Ave. and State Street. We loved that we could text guest  services for what ever we needed and they responded almost immediately. We checked out the roof top bar which would be awesome in the summer. We will definitely stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cool hotel, great location
text: Londonhouse has a luxurious feel to it and the location was great. Very close to Michigan Ave.We got a room with a wonderful view of the canal.The room was narrow and felt a bit claustrophobic. Nice products in the bathroom.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay |WONDERFUL PEOPLE
text: Great staff that works for your positive experience.  Loved the room though there was a little noise from the street as well as from neighbors.  Loved the amenities and the layout of the newer portion of the building.  Digital key a plus.  Bar area service slow so I left twice before I could get anything.  The third time I was with a friend and stayed.  Not my favorite part of the hotel.  Gym was nice, not too crowded.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, Great room
text: The hotel was beautiful, the river view was magnificent, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. I have stayed in many hotels and this is high on the list for comfy beds.  We can't wait to stay here again. The only funny thing was that we upgraded for the river view, but the view was very large letters T R U M P

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, amazing staff
text: Accommodating, clean, friendly staff. This hotel was awesome, my friends and I really enjoyed our stay. The beds were so comfortable! The only problem was our view of the large Trump sign across the river, we will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding experience
text: Great recently renovated hotel with great views and location.  Service was superb at all levels, from the bellman, front desk, room service, housekeeping, and at the restaurants.  Will definitely stay again the next time I am in Chicago ... well done, Hilton!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic, Swanky Experience
text: I just love this hotel. Excellent location, well appointed rooms and common areas, awesome rooftop bar, technical elevators, excellent service. Bed was nice pillow top mattress cover. Espresso coffee, not that watery crap. Robe and slippers!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Makes business travel pleasurable
text: Loved staying at the LondonHouse.  Modern, attractive hotel with a great location.  The staff goes above and beyond being friendly and helpful.  LondonHouse would be my first choice anytime I was in town.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely done with this hotel
text: During my last stay, not only did they not tag my laptop bag that I left with the bellman, but they took it to the wrong room. Luckily it was returned back to security after I was completely distraught and I personally had to recommend that they talk to security.So I came back because I'm a Diamond member and I like the location. So this time I booked 2 rooms. Second room was on floor 20. When I got back from Bulls game at 10:45, my room was so loud in couldn't sleep.I was given keys to a new room after throwing a tizzy, but before I had time to pack someone cane into my room without knocking to change the sheets. I have never felt that violated.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The staff are very rude.
text: This hotel is Hilton hotel. I am a Hilton Diamond member. But I got a tiny room for one person(There is only one pair of slipper and only one bathrobe) even though I booked for two people. Also, I got breakfast coupons but I was very disappointed. They served only some bread and coffee in the restaurant. If you want hot food like egg and bacon, you should charge. That was the most terrible experience that I have been hotels. So I made a complaint about these things. However, I was more and more upset because they were so rude. The staff at the front told me "What are you looking for?". I did not want money! So I asked."What can you do for me?". They gave me $40 discount with not respectful face. I will not go to any Hilton brand hotel anymore because of this hotel. They are so terrible.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic river view! Great location!
text: We loved our stay! Perfect location, quiet and spacious room with a pleasant modern design. Did not regret selection the river view option. It was fantastic! With floor to ceiling windows Staff was very courteous and efficient! Great internet too!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thanksgiving Holiday
text: Great location, top notch staff, and rooms that you will remember!   Highly recommend.  Bryan was extremely helpful during our visit. We were here over colder weather weekend so we did not get opportunity to enjoy rooftop views but after stay committed to be back in the summer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great location and nice redo
text: mostly positives: brand new furnishings, friendly staff, clean, efificient elevators, fairprice.  didnt splurge for river vieew room but should have great view.only negative was the rooftop restaurant for lunch - slow slow service even though few patrons, and no sense that it was an inconvenience to customer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location - Service - Staff
text: Friendly staff. Excellent location!!! Cleanliness and service very good. I will stay there always. Even that the hotel is full, you dont see the people and you never have to wait for elevators. The people that work there always have something nice to say and always wants to help you. The only thing was the breakfast. Didn't like it and no to much of choices. The waitress was cain of lost. But you have a lot of choices to eat around the hotel. I think that its not better location to stay in Chicago. The bed and pillows are excellent. The view is breath taking.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: The location of this hotel really is fantastic. Easy to get many places walking and quick in a cab to the great restaurants in the west loop. Even in winter the rooftop and its views are spectacular, can't wait to see it in the summer.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and amenities
text: You can't beat the location for a stay within walking distance from all of the Chicago Magnificent Mile attractions. Right on the river with a beautiful skyline view, the hotel is right in the heart of Michigan Avenue shopping and less than a 10-minute walk from Millennium Park.The rooftop lounge is gorgeous. We didn't get to try drinks because service was closed due to cold weather, but the super-friendly attendant took us up to show it off and let us enjoy the views.Speaking of staff, the bartenders in the second floor lobby bar--which also has nice river and skyline views--are among the friendliest, funniest, and most knowledgable about the city we've ever met on our travels.Rooms were nicely decorated, very well-maintained, and have wonderfully comfortable beds. They also have Nespresso makers rather than plain coffee makers.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exceptional stay...outstanding customer service
text: Stayed at the LondonHouse Chicago on the Saturday after Thanksgiving.  I've stayed at many hotels in Chicago, and I can say that this was one (if not the) best experiences I've ever had.  From the bellmen, to the front desk and every other staff person...customer service was at the forefront of the exeprience.  We arrived early afternoon, and our room was not ready.  The frontdesk staff took my cell number and continually sent me text messages that we pleasant and showed that they cared about me as a guest.  The guestroom was immaculate with a beautiful view of the river and downtown Chicago.  Had cocktails in the hotel bar before going to dinner...again, an enjoyable experience.  The location is perfect, centrally located...between Michigan Avenue shopping and Millenium Park and the cultural institutions.  Of course, fabulous Chicago dining in any direction.I think I have found a new temporary home when I travel to Chicago.   Loved it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding - a cut above in the loop
text: I can't imagine a better stay.  This property pays attention to every detail and it shows.  You can tell they are putting their very best effort in everything they do.  As a lifetime Hilton Honors Diamond member, my loyalty is with this brand but it is without bias that I can say this truly is the best of the best.  I would highly recommend it for business or personal stays. The location could not be better, just steps away from the mag mile.  It's hidden just off wacker and the river.  Incredible views.  Breakfast was off the charts.  In room Nespresso machine?  Are you kidding?  Well done London House and thank you Savanna for going the extra mile.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel and Location
text: Reception and Doors staff give great first impression of hotel. Couldn't have been more helpful and facilitating an early check in. Everything about the hotel was exceptional, It was clean, stylish, roomy with excellent service in the bar where we had lunch. Room itself was stylish and comfortable. The roof top bar is a must do. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thanksgiving Get Away
text: Very nice property, with a great view right in the middle of shopping, theaters, dining and nightlife. Very walkable and right next to the Chicago Riverwalk. Water taxi is right across the street. The concierge was very helpful with suggestions and offered discounted / free admission to clubs or restaurant perks.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Attended World Series game in Chicago over late Oct weekend. The reservation desk at Embassy Suites recommended London House.  We had never heard of the hotel, but decided to try it.We had a Vista room.  The room was great.  The view was excellent.  We were looking west along the Chicago River.  The TV was huge.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.  Usually we stay further north near Michigan Ave, but willchange because of this hotel.  Also very convenient to the Orange Line from Midway Airport.  Rooftop bar seemed very nice !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful 40th Anniversary
text: The Curio London House really made our 40th wedding anniversary a special weekend in Chicago. A room with an amazing view (1809), help getting an "impossible" restaurant reservation and the royal treatment by a staff that was so nice and professional. Everything was perfect. Great location. The London House will be our go-to hotel for Chicago.H Green

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing experience
text: The hotel is perfect from everything, location, housekeeping, modern, decorative, luxurious, safety.Most attractions places are near to the hotel. The hotel toproof is amazing. You will need all days of you staying to enjoy it

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, location, staff and location
text: Very well located. The door and bellhp staff are extremely helpful and knowldegable.  The modern room decor is refined and functional. The beds are super comfortable, like sleeping in clouds.  The only drawback is that is is a bit of a maze getting around the place - being an amalgam of several buildings.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My best-ever hotel experience in Chicago
text: It was only by luck that I discovered this new hotel and I am amazed.Location, service, rooms, cleanliness and friendliness are just unbeatable. Large windows towards the river offer spectacular views and the size of my vista room allows the feeling of a junior suite .8 elevators guarantee quick in house transportation. Very clean and new fitness club.I will certainly come back next time!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great find
text: Was looking for a place with easy access to train to Wrigley Field for Cubs' World Series games and also near the Magnificent Mile. This hotel was outstanding. Converted office building with rooftop lounge right on the river. On the edge of the loop and short stroll to shopping and dining. 5 minute walk to subway. Great rates, large clean, quiet rooms. Very friendly staff. Will bey first choice when looking for a place to stay in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Kept getting better and better.
text: Staff at the desk were superb - friendly and helpful.  I was told that I would be receiving a text and could reply if I had any requests, concerns, etc.  I did indeed receive a few texts - they weren't intrusive at all.  I felt it was an efficient way (and friendly) way to communicate.  I had asked for extra pillows and a room with a view if possible when making the reservation.  Check and check!  The room was spotless and very attractive with stylish details that were also functional.  Let's go down the list.  The king bed was extremely comfortable and the bedding was sumptuous.  Lovely sleeping.  There were many different lighting options - general room, sconces at each side of the bed, adjustable reading lights. A huge flat screen TV mounted on the wall - it had the ability to Chromecast from your phone, play music, etc.  The room's radio could also be used as a Bluetooth speaker.  The door to the bathroom was a huge, frosted, sliding glass partition.  And the motion of walking toward the bathroom, say in the middle of the night, would turn on the bathroom light ... so no fumbling around in the dark.  There was a rainfall shower head and the bathroom amenities were lush, from the bath towels, robe and slippers, to the soaps, large magnifying mirror, hair dryer.  They also provided your own personal, brand new shower puff.  The room safe was a very large drawer and would accommodate items as large as a laptop with no problem.  There was a great coffee maker along with the usual ice bucket and a very nice wine opener.  All in all a great place.  I would go back in a minute and would heartily recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Chicago Hotel
text: Recommended by friends living in Chicago. Loved it! Beautiful with modern decor, friendly staff, nice amenities. Our room was comfortable with great river view. Conveniently located to walk to many hotspots or quickly Uber where we needed to go. Don't miss the rooftop deck!!!! Gorgeous views! Bar staff nice and good drinks. Hotel rates were good but parking salty. We took advantage of park and stay package, which was better than daily parking rate...make sure you check bill upon checkout. I had read another review to do this and was glad I checked. We were charged for daily parking in addition to room night charge. They quickly fixed it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House
text: This a great Hilton property. Excellent location. The bar and breakfast were great. Every member of the hotel staff we met was friendly and did a great job. Our server at breakfast was very helpful with Chicago highlights. We will be back

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room and breakfast are outstanding.
text: The rooms are very modern with a variety of lighting options for so that you can have different brightness levels.  The bathroom light operates by a motion sensor.  The thermostat worked well enough to control the temperature.  I am a Hilton Gold and I have not seen much about the alternatives to the continental buffet.  The offering on that are underwhelming.  Our breakfast coupons did allow us a an 18 dollar per person credit to order off the menu.  I recommend this.  The menu has all of the hot breakfast items that are normally desired. The pancakes were some of the best that I have eaten in a hotel. Light and fluffy.  We paid an additional 12 dollars.  So prices were not too outrageous.  The service is can do here.  The hotel was prepared to give me the room that I selected for on line check in.  I changed my mind when when we pulled up and I saw a possibility for rooms that looked north down Michigan.  The front desk agent cheerfully looked for one of these rooms.  The dining room staff was the same.  Everybody was friendly.  Service recovery was quick and friendly.   An incorrect order was returned and delivered promptly and hot.   Though I told the front desk agent there were two guests in the room, she only gave one coupon. I assumed this covered both.  The waitress cheerfully went and got a second.  This type of service overcomes small errors.   We enjoyed our stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good location, good hotel
text: We had a Vista room with a king bed. The absolutely best thing about the room was the view to the river (even though there is a Trump building straight across which was the only negative aspect about the view). The room was a bit on the smaller side but very comfortable and everything was new & modern. We had some issues with the wifi during the stay but they were sorted out pretty quickly. The breakfast is nothing to write home about and definitely not worth paying for if not included in the room price: a limited selection of pastries, yogurt and fruit, plus an omelette station. No cheese, charcuterie or fresh vegetables of any kind. The location of the hotel is excellent: lots of sights, shopping, restaurants within a short walking distance.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Most Stay Here!!!
text: I can't explain how beautiful this hotel is  and how Amazing my experience was. The Staff is super professional, always smiling and their service was excellent . Carlos ,Michael and Lorelei and the rest of the staff were beyond amazing...they went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable..This hotel is spotless and if you love drinking Champagne the roaring 20s drink is must try. I will be staying here again .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Curio Collection by Hilton
text: This is a beautiful hotel located in the heart of CGO, just south of the Chicago River. The amenities are great and the rooms, clean and comfortable. It is a historic landmark on the outside, but the inside is updated and very technologically advanced for a property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Ruined my wedding weekend
text: Horrible service from the minute I checked in. We live in the city and were excited to try out this new luxury Hilton property (we're honors members) for our wedding weekend in October. I arrived at 3:30pm, to a very long line and no one staffing the honors check in line. I had my wedding dress in town and was told my room wasn't ready. I had to leave my belongs including my dress with at the bell desk. I was very hesitant to do so, but I had to run to my rehearsal. My husband was texting with the hotel at this point since I was obviously very stressed over the situation. He asked (they didn't offer) to send up a bottle of wine to make up for the mistake. When I came back to the hotel for the night and asked for my things to be sent, I was told they'd be up in 15 minutes. Also, the bottle of wine was not waiting in the room like they said it would be, it arrived about 30 minutes later after I asked about it. At this point I'd been in the room for 45 minutes and my dress still wasn't there! I  finally called down asking where my $2,000 wedding dress was. They apologized and sent it up immediately, but I should not have been made to wait.We then when up to the rooftop bar for a drink before bed and while the views are amazing, the service was again awful. My wine glass was soapy and when I asked for a replacement, the bartender was snotty and did not even apologize for the mistake. Next morning, we went for breakfast (free for Honors members) and were shocked at the options. The only thing included were stale pastries, yogurt and the tiniest chopped fruit I've ever seen. Where's the protein? Every other Hilton property offers eggs, and meat. I went off to get married starving. Thanks LondonHouse.All in all, we splurged on this hotel to feel special on the most important day of our lives and were left feeling like we stayed at a Best Western. In fact, I've been treated better at some Best Westerns. The hotel itself is nice, but the rooms are quite small including our suite. For $400 a night, we expected a much grander experience. Save your money and head to a number of better hotels in the area.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Chicago Trip
text: If you are coming to Chicago the place to stay is without a doubt here at the London House.  Hands down this was in my top 3 Hotel experiences of all time!!!!   From check-in to check-out this group really knows how to make you feel welcome, assist with all of your needs, and goes above and beyond to make sure your experience is beyond amazing.  Do ask the concierge for recommendations!!!  Because of them we did not have a bad meal all week.  One night we just walking by the water, only to realize our desired destination had just closed for the winter.  I texted the Concierge only to be led to an amazing place for dinner and drinks!!!  Do hit their roof top bar as well!!!!!!! Beautiful.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse is an Excellent Hotel!
text: LondonHouse hotel is absolutely beautiful. Our room was beautifully decorated and impeccably clean.  The view was gorgeous, the bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable and the TV was awesome. The staff was amazing as well, very friendly and professional.  This is my new favorite hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: If your going to Chicago you need to
text: Love this hotel and there staff.   Murphy is always very kind when we pull up and makes us happy to be there!  Front desk staff makes you fill at home.  Perfect location, great views and nice rooms.  The location allows for the true Michigan Ave feel.  Roof top bar provides some of the best views in the area.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We hit a home run!
text: We'll come back! Our fantastic room faced the river giving us a great view and added bonus of the holiday lights parade! We were able to walk the few blocks to Symphony Hall and enjoyed a nitecap later in the 2nd floor lounge. Centrally located for shopping and great restaurants. We found the price just right when booking at the last minute.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel for weekend with friends and for "me" time...
text: Had a GREAT time staying here this weekend. I went to Chicago to spend time with friends on Friday night, then take some "me" time on Saturday. This hotel was perfect with a centralized location to enjoy myself....spent ALL day Saturday in the room relaxing, doing some work, watching tv, and sleeping. The staff was super friendly and helpful during my sabbatical weekend.  Looking forward to coming back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent weekend in Chi-town
text: Excellent room & bed and loved the coffee in the room but watch out for the $71/day parking fee. We just unloaded and then parked a couple blocks away. The hotel was in the heart of the city and we walked to everything. I would recommend it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic hotel in fantastic location
text: This is an absolutely fantastic hotel, overlooking the Chicago river and down Madison Avenue. The bedrooms are beautifully decorated - no expense spared! Yet I found it very competitively priced. Definitely will be back!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Elegance and Comfort
text: What a great building architecturally and the view of the river and beautiful Chicago skyline are second to none. Comfy and yet elegant king bed room. Within walking distance to all kinds of restaurants and night spots. Check out the breathtaking views from the roof deck. Friendly staff just a plus. Definitely going back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The heart of Chicago!
text: Warm and engaging staff! Perfect spot at the heart of Chicago & has a great view of the river! Yet you don't hear the outside noise.  Clean room and well kept bathroom! Digital key, a plus! Unfortunately, the outdoor deck was closed for the season.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Cooler than Kimpton - awesome property
text: Finally Hilton rolls out something that isn't bland and boring.   I was most impressed wit the hotel and staff.   The hotel reminded me of a Kimpton boutique.   We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which had a wonderful view of the river, with separate sitting and bed areas.   Very well decorated.   The roof top area - when it isn't 25f - is stunning.  The staff was very accommodating and really appreciated the text messaging, which is more personalized.   Highly recommend for either business or leisure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: My first stay here and chose the property on a whim.  What a pleasant surprise.   Big rooms and very quiet.   I was even right next to the elevator and couldn't hear a thing.   Huge TV on the wall, great HVAC system.  Worked flawlessly even with a 40 degree temperature swing.  Internet was quick.  Furnishings very nice.  The hotel is a little "trendy", but still great!  The front dest was very attentive and provided excellent customer service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome Hotel All Around!
text: Loved this hotel!  Was in town on business for 1 night/2 days. They checked me in early as there was a room available using my arrival and were super accommodating to my late departure time. Absolutely wonderful staff in every area, the food was tasty (those croissants, mmm), and my room was tops (clean, modern cool interior,  comfy king bed, a mini fridge, and wonderful view of the river). Did I mention they have Malin + Goetz toiletries?  LOVE. To women, this is a big deal.  Will absolutely being staying here next time I'm in Chicago on business OR for pleasure!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business Trip
text: Hilton hotel. Second floor bar / lounge had a great ambiance. Rooms are very contemporary and the location of the property was proximate to multiple restaurants, bars, the river, and other amenities. Will stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A wonderful experience!
text: I will gladly give this gorgeous and sophisticated hotel a standing ovation for providing absolutely superb service during our one night leisure stay.  Each and every employee we encountered were incredibly polite and helpful. We had a well decorated, cozy, and immaculate corner room with a beautiful view overlooking the Chicago river. The bed was extremely comfortable. The location of this hotel is perfect because you are walking distance to many of Chicago's most popular attractions. It's very close to the Magnificent Mile- Michigan Avenue and you are steps from the river walk.We also had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant and the food was quite delicious, especially the Mexican skillet dish and the Breakfast croissant sandwich. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for a very comfortable stay in a prime location of Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel - Charged for more than my confirmed reservation
text: Beautiful hotel.  Vista room overlooking the Chicago River and Trump Tower. Had a front-row seat to demonstrators two days after the election.Would have given them 5 stars had they not overchaged me for parking.  Parking was included in my rate, yet they still added on a valet charge of $71.  I will NEVER pay $71 to park overnight, even in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: This hotel is located at the heart of city center .The hotel is nice and has very good view from room windows .I really like the service in the hotel .Cloud gate ,the Bean are just across the street .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really Loved It
text: My first time here.  Spent four nights while in Chicago for business meetings and thoroughly enjoyed this new gem in an old building.  The location, at the corner of Wacker and Michigan, is convenient to River North, the Loop, Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park.  I was in a corner king studio, which was spacious and comfortable, with lots of windows and a good workspace.  Complimentary wi-fi was reasonably fast and strong. The building, formerly an office building, is oddly shaped, and it appears that the rooms are too, but I think that's part of the charm. And the phenomenally thick exterior walls make this one of the quietest urban hotels I've ever stayed in.  I didn't sample the rooftop bar, but did have the continental breakfast buffet that came with my HHonors status.  It was not extensive, and would have been a bit pricey had I been paying for it, but what was there was good, the space was nice, and the servers pleasant.  My interaction with the staff was limited, except for the friendly and helpful doormen, but the encounters I did have were all pleasant.  This is definitely not a standard hotel, but it has the Hilton quality behind it and really gives you the feel of being in the heart of Chicago.  I loved it, and hope to stay here again.  Highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the best I have visited in the past few years
text: First time in chicago and no idea at all about the city. We just looked for a fine rate and it had it. In the reviews we saw that it was close to everywhere, and we found out it is. That is all we needed. The service was perfect, even though you do not see many people if you do not want to. Front desk is on the second floor and you can move around freely. My room was not very big but it was enough. Our view was north; nice. West looks good too but I did not get to see it. We were at a walking distance of everything we wanted to see. And you have Nespresso coffee in the room. I would repeat a hotel like this one in any city. By the way I do not know how they made the picture you see here. The view from those rooms are to Trump tower across from the river. It is far enough, but you can't see far away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new hotel in the heart of the ciry
text: Great new hotel with modern amenities in a historic building. Couldn't have been a better location to the Gleacher Center where my conference was. Loved the Nespresso machine and well appointed bathrooms with a huge shower. Would absolutely stay there again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel & service
text: Our visit to this hotel exceeded our expectations ! Very charming interior , historic building that was completely redone and looked even better then pictures ! How often does that happen? Interior was so authentic that it felt like being stuck in the decade of beaux arts! Location was very central , walking distance form many local attractions ! Our room had a fantastic view of the river and gorgeous architecture on the other side ! Stuff was extremely kind, profesional and helpful ! We arrived way too early for a checkin , however they happened to have availability and were more then happy to accommodate us hours before! They gave us no hard time at all ! They constantly stayed in touch via text messages to make sure we are happy and that our needs are meet! unfortunaty we didn't have time to check out the roof lounge and bar ! Something to accomplish during our next stay ! Will be back for sure üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great price and location!!!
text: My husband and I were in Chicago for a weekend get away. The price and location London House could not be beat! The room was comfortable and cozy with a stunning view of the Chicago River. The bed was very comfortable and we did not hear any other guests. One the downside:the rooms might be a bit small for some people and there was no bathtub. When visiting Chicago, we always take the train from Midway into downtown. The hotel is about a 5/10 minute walk from the State and Lake drop off point. London House is a great central location within walking distance of so many great restaurants, nightlife and many of the sights. You can't go wrong.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, spotless rooms.
text: Overall the stay was very positive.  Beds were the most comfortable I've ever stayed in.  The staff were pleasant including all room cleaning staff.  The rooms were absolutely spotless including the glass shower screen which is usually impossible to get looking brand new. We unfortunately had a dirty bed quilt discovered on waking the next day though.  This took a couple of attempts to have rectified but the receptionist immediately offered us a small discount on our stay which was a swift and fair resolution.  I would say that for the room price the entrance to the hotel isn't very impressive if that matters to you.  The main reception is at first (second in american) floor level so you can enter a small lobby and go to the lifts and your room without ever really getting that wow feeling of entering an impressive lobby space.  Other than that the room and view up and down the river from the 18th floor was fantastic.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overnight stay in a great downtown location
text: Quaint hotel on Wacker was just the place for our overnight stay. Single King room was very cozy and quiet. If you don't need a lot of space, the price is right for a decent stay. Close to many Chicago attractions, restaurants and bars. Not to mention the view of the river. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, though we didn't need a lot of extra attention or services, since we were out and about enjoying the city. The outdoor patio was closed for the season. The first floor lounge was comfortable to sit and plan our day. Will definitely keep this hotel in mind for our next stay in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Found a new home in Chicago
text: I am a Hilton fan and was looking forward to the opening of the London House on Wacker Drive.  The rooms are laid out very well, the front desk staff is very accommodating, the views on the higher floors are spectacular, you know you are in Chicago! The roof top bar was pricey, but the views over the Chicago River are stunning.  I will be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wow!!  Just WOW!!
text: Where to begin....WOW!  What an amazing eventful stay.  First, the room:Gorgeous d√©cor with straight, seamless design.  Elegant yet comfortable.  Wonderful linens in the bathroom as well as beds.  Carpet is plush and clean.  Our room was also adjoined with a sitting area.  The pull out sofa was phenomenal.  Forget the usual "futon mattress".  It was almost...almost :)....as comfortable as the bed.  The flat screen TVs are crystal clear.  Refrigerator in the room also.  The bathroom was immaculate.  Second, the view.  Hello, Chicago!!  Absolutely stunning.  My 4 year old was in love.  Mommy was in love.  Hours...hours....hours....just people watching. Lastly, the staff.  Professional, friendly, and compassionate....yes compassionate.  During our stay, my son had an "in room" accident and bumped his head.  So much that currently, he is still healing from the abrasion.  The staff immediately sent up what could be used for an ice pack.  Later that evening, we had a knock to our door.  There was a beautiful tray of cookies and milk for him.  Yes, happy Mommy, happy family.The bellmen, are pure happiness.  Great conversationlist, amazing at offering suggestions, and just happy.  They were always great to my family.  My husband was here on business and I felt safe at ALL times.  I felt as if I had extra eyes aiding me from them each.This is our Chicago destination hotel from this point forward.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop Splendor
text: Wow!  Went to the to the bar on the 21st floor.  Everything was great!! The view was spectacular and the fire was warm and inviting.  The staff was surprisingly friendly and accommodating.  The prices were reasonable for Chicago and its a venue you must check out!!  I recommend it!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay
text: Excellent property. Room was large and well appointed. Roof top bar is wonderful. Staff very helpful. Well situation, close to restaurants, shopping and bars. Did not dine in the hotel, but food looked very good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend fun
text: My second visit to Londonhouse confirmed my new go to place to stay in Chicago. Great location, excellent service and accommodations! I have been here for both business and pleasure and have nothing but good things to say about it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent!!
text: We stayed for one night and it was a excellent stay!! Bedding , bathrooms and service were are 5 stars!!  55" flatscreen right in the heart of Chicago..short walk to Shaw's crab house, millennial park!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Short visit to Chicago
text: Visited Chicago and this hotel  last week. Found the staff very serviceminded and forthcoming. And they gave very good advise as to where to eat, what to do. High five to the guys in the door. It is also a historic building, nice to have a guided tour to get to know the city. The rooftop bar is great!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome hotel sets a new standard
text: My husband and I stayed here just overnight on a Saturday night. Everything about the experience was perfect for us. We have stayed in hundreds of hotels from basic to luxury ritz and four seasons and this one is on our top ten !In addition to must haves (great bed hot shower) So many things that were unexpected and different ! Here are a few: Digital key means no worrying about losing key and no standing in line to check inPick your room online means the room layout and configuration are perfect for you. We got a river view fantastic Corner bakery inside the building means no going outside when it's cold and you want a quick bite before the airportCool restricted floor elevators add to speed and security Bluetooth radio means easy cool tunes your own no cordsMotion sensor lights in the bathroom mean no fumbling for light switchEspresso machine wow My husband and I were floored honestlyHe called the room 'sexy'Do not hesitate to stay here if you need what we were needing .. we were wanting privacy comfort for an overnight getaway we got so much more. !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exquisitely Renovated Hotel
text: We stayed downtown for one night to 'get away from it all' and enjoy the culture of Chicago. The hotel was quiet, comfortable, and well designed with large rooms with beautiful views up and down the Chicago River. The terrace up on the 22nd floor was a great place for drinks, snacks and fantastic views of the river and Michigan Avenue.We enjoyed the changing light throughout the day on the historic buildings in downtown and the activities on and along the River. Services and amenities of the hotel were first rate. Location along the Magnificent Mile of Michigan Avenue makes it convenient for shoppers, tourists, and business people. Chicago has successfully transformed another 100 year old building into a gem of a hotel which preserves history and updates it with 21st century style and comfort.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: rooftop bar proposal
text: I needed a last minute out of the box proposal idea. It was the night before i was to propose with nowhere to turn. 24 Hours later I had the most magnificent proposal I could have imagined and all thanks to the excellent staff at the LondonHouse including Jamie and Katie. We Were late because of the post election riots but none of that mattered! the view from the 22nd floor were magnificent overlooking the skyline and i HIGHLY recommend anyone to use this location to pop the big question!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My Number One choice for staying in Chicago
text: This hotel and stay were absolutely fantastic. The room is beautiful, the amenities were great, the location is perfect (right near a favorite section of Michigan Ave), and the staff are the most friendly, helpful hotel staff I have ever seen.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful new Hilton hotel
text: We came to downtown to celebrate my birthday and decided to stay downtown. We booked this hotel for one night. When we arrived and saw our room we decided to stay for 2 nights! It is great location in Chicago, beautifully decorated and the views of the city from your room are breath taking.  If you get the chance stay here! Staff very professional and friendly. We will stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic downtown hotel
text: This hotel was sleek and modern, but still comfortable, and the location was fabulous. It was a bit pricey, but worth it for the location and views (I was on the river side of the hotel). The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and excellent hotel!
text: This hotel was unique and in a great location!  I highly recommend checking it out.  The beds were very comfortable and the room had an awesome view.  It would be a perfect hotel for a wedding or just to stay the weekend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Will go back
text: This hotel is amazing! I got to the hotel early and they said no problemthey, they had a room ready for me. The room was very clean and modern, and the bed and linens so comfortable! The bar on the 21st floor is very fun and funky! I ended up having to use the shampoo and conditioner provided by the hotel and now want to switch hair care products. The hotel is very centrally located near the magnificent mile, the museums and plenty of restaurants. I will definitely stay at London house next time I'm in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a treat!
text: This new hotel (in a landmark building) lives up to the recent hype. The location is great (just at the confluence of East Wacker and Michigan). I snagged a suite - small seating area separate from the bedroom) that had floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river and (ugh) Trump hotel.I did not use any of the amenities of the hotel (gym etc) but we did pop up to the 23rd floor to see the great view from the sexy rooftop bar. The bathroom was good - but the shower head was pathetic with poor water flow and I feel sorry for anyone with thick/long hair. Good toiletries too. Staff was friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Cubs Rally 2016
text: Booked a room last minute for the Cubs Rally. We arrived early and even got an upgrade for our room.....Great views ...very posh....great staff...very attentive....love the rooftop terrace bar!...would love to stay there again! Was in walking distance to alot of places.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: High Tech Luxury in Central Location
text: Stayed at the LondonHouse for one night for business and am a Hilton Honors member. I used the iOS app to check-in and select my room 24 hours prior to my arrival; I was also able to obtain my Digital Key via the app so I didn't need to stop by the reception desk.The hotel is centrally located in Chicago next to DuSable Bridge and opposite the Trump Hotel. There were many restaurants and close to shopping within minutes walk of the hotel. The reception and lobby is located on the 2nd floor but there are many bell boys and concierge located on the 1st to help you navigate your way around the hotel.Elevators are really efficient in this hotel by using floor selection keypads and nominating an elevator to use; never had to wait for one during my stay. I used the Digital Key on the Hilton iOS app and just had to turn on bluetooth for this to work. It was a very slick and convenient way of entering my room, much better than having to deal with a keycard and potentially wiping it near my phone.The rooms are very well appointed, luxurious and modern. I had plenty of space to move around and a great view of the city/river. Modern technology touchpoint throughout, with USB chargers built into power sockets, a big (50-60 inch) flat screen with chrome cast built in so you can stream your own tv apps onto the screen; although I couldn't get this to work.Room service was efficient and even served me after the allotted time (10pm); but I felt breakfast was rushed. They didn't provide all the condiments and the food was pretty flavorless; in addition most hotels give you a pot of coffee but this one only gave you a cup.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location in Style!
text: Quick 3 night family trip in the heart of everything!  We walked almost everywhere...a few Uber rides.Staff helpful, very clean rooms, beds in double room arevery small but we were exhausted from eating and sighting seeing!Mid to luxury pricing.   Great view of river and it's the city so it willbe a bit noisy through the night so it didn't bother us...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A beautiful hotel with some kinks that need to be worked out
text: Beautiful hotel, beautiful rooms, less-than-great customer service. A ceiling light in our room came on on its own throughout the night then turned off after a minute or so. Repeatedly. Throughout the night. Despite repeated attempts to turn it off at the switch at the wall. I mentioned this to several staff members, but no one seemed to take the concern seriously. Finally on the second night, the front desk said they'd send an engineer -- who never came. I finally had to cancel the request because we were exhausted -- so we could attempt to go to sleep, despite the light still coming on and off. After checkout, it took 45 minutes to get our car from valet parking, although we had been told it would take only 15. I expected better customer service from an upscale hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely Stay
text: Hip hotel. Location couldn't be better. Rooms are on the smallish side but clean and well stocked.  View rooms are a bit noisy, as they overlook the street. Beds are very comfortable.  Elevators very high tech!  Staff are extremely responsive.  Nice lobby bar - it would be nice if they served more food, though.  We would stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved this hotel!
text: The LondonHouse is a very cool hotel! Great location, over the top rooftop bar and terrific customer service. The room I was in was a little small but perfectly laid out for business travel with a massive tv in a frame type thing that separates the bedroom from the workspace and desk. I'll definitely be back here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I expected more. Concept has potential, execution is a bit off.
text: From a hundred feet away, this hotel is intriguing. Especially at night. The hybrid structure is a well scrubbed, repurposed former office building from the 1920s connected to a 21st century glass box. As you enter the hotel it seems like little thought was given to how a customer would experience a first impression of what the Hilton Corporation wants to say is a luxury property. It looks bland, and unfinished. I could have walked into an office building, an apartment building, or into a corridor that would lead me to some other place. The entrance of a luxury hotel should be high on brand message and something memorable. A leader of the firm obviously felt that was unnecessary. That's a shame.A friendly and super professional member of staff greeted me and escorted me to the elevator. I exited at the lobby to check-in which is on the second floor. It is high on quirkiness. Mostly executed successfully. Some items were just strange seemingly for the sake of being strange. I found the rooms to be comfortable and quiet. The bed super comfy. I loved the Nespresso branded coffee maker in the room and the high quality clock radio with a bluetooth connection that will allow you to listen to your choice of tunes in hi-fi. There is a translucent glass sliding door to the bathroom that could be problematic for travellers lodging with a partner. The materials, finishes, and colours used in the hallways and rooms feel modern and calming with a masculine slant. The gym is a joke. The size of the room would be no surprise for a motel built in the 60s that wants to appeal to a "health and wellness trend" but is not acceptable for whom it seems like this brand wants to appeal to. There is little equipment, no proper place to stretch, a few treadmills, and pretty much nothing else. It is clean, it does look like someone gave thought to how it looks, but no thought on functionality or usability.If you want grab a cup of coffee or tea in the lobby before you head out to work or a business function, you're out of luck. The hotel will direct you to a caf√© in the lobby that is crowded with folks exiting tour buses. Breakfast in the hotel I tried once and only once. It was slow, and seemingly geared towards those who are happy with a buffet. Ordering a-la-carte took too long and there was just too little food for what I paid. One night I ventured up to the roof bar. If you are content being around self-centered, loud folks whose vocabulary highly favours the word "like", love to take selfies, and stare at their devices to see who posted what on Facebook or Instagram, you will love being there. I left after five seconds.Chicago has great hotels. London House misses the mark in too many places for me to seriously consider returning. Perhaps the moment will come when it feels customer focused. I left feeling like it checked the boxes for the executives of the firm who signed off on moving forward with the capital expense but failed to look at any of it from a user perspective.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Hotel
text: This hotel is in the perfect location!  The staff is friendly and attentive, and really make you feel like part of the family!  The Hotel is new, so it is beyond Gorgeous!  The rooms are very spacious, refrigerators in each room, they have a rooftop restaurant that has fantastic views of the city!   You can walk to Milenium Park, it's right on the Chicago River and the magnificent mile is just a few steps away.  I have nothing but great things to say!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Poor choice in great city
text: This is one of those hotels that thinks it's something but it's really not.  You know when you walk in.  You really know when you hit the cheesy rooftop bar and restaurant with some of the worst service ever and most uninspired menu imagined (mostly fried crap).  And the rooms are nothing.  There are many other choices in this town.  Regret I wasted my time or my money here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, amazing location.
text: This a wonderful new hotel in a historic 1920s building located riverside. A luxury hotel with complimentary service. Rooms are finely decorated and the beds are extraordinarily comfortable. Highly recommended. Go Cubs Go!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very odd lobby layout and the demand for the rooftop bar makes it unuseable
