text: I think this place is ok.  Great location and great views of the river.  The room was nice and quiet and clean but on the small side.  The rooftop bar is on high demand and we planned the trip on short notice so no luck getting up there.  It's kind of annoying how they book it and I had difficulty figuring out the process.  It's a great town with plenty to do so we didn't do things where there were lines or it was difficult to get in.  I might stay here again.  It wasn't bad and in fact it was fairly nice.  There was just nothing about it that blew me away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Chicago Location/Views, Fantastic Decor, Good Service
text: We stayed here for 3 nights. This is a great, new hotel to the Hilton/Curio collection. The hotel is literally located right next to the river and just a few steps away from the Magnificent Mile for shopping/dining. The rooftop is definitely a sight to make sure and see if you stay here. The hotel decor was fresh and luxurious and the rooms were beautiful and clean. The only complaint of our stay was that we ordered room service breakfast one of the mornings and the employee was not especially friendly.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A new, refreshing hotel in Chi-town
text: We stayed here when we rented a bar for our twin sons 30th birthday celebration, the location was great, the bar at the top has an amazing view of the city, and the rooms were very comfortable.  Everything was new, and looked fresh and clean.  The greeters outside were great and the parking -although expensive, but it is everywhere in the city- was quick and efficient.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Roof top is amazing
text: This is a great property with a great staff and amazing location. Located between the magnificent mile and state street "that great street" there is always something to do. No matter what weather permitting have a drink on the roof. The bar is great and the views are tremendous.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location, beautiful historic building.
text: This hotel is located in a 1920s era architectural gem, originally the London Guarantee & Accident building, located at the corner of Whacker and Michigan.  There are beautiful city views in all directions.  The Rooftop deck is especially fabulous. All staff people were very helpful and knowledgeable.  Our room was exceptionally comfortable and quiet.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful experience
text: From the moment we checked in the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Concierge services were top notch. Great location, could walk to  downtown Chicago activities.  Super clean, opened about four months ago.  Rooftop bar had great views of the city skyline, particularly at night.   Least favorite was the breakfast, slow and  eggs were not cooked how we ask for them.   All in all, a great experience and would definitely use this hotel again

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick trip
text: It is a fantastic location.  The staff was very nice & always helpful.  The view was breathtaking.  The room was very comfortable with nice big TV.  It had chromecast (which i use at home) and i couldn't get it to work, but there was plenty to watch for short time i was in the room.  Will stay here again, next time I'm in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views of the river, excellent location
text: The location of this hotel, right on the bend of the river by wacker and Michigan, affords excellent views from many rooms.  There are a lot of different room levels so you can book what you want, all at different rates.  Make sure you book the room you want...descriptions are all well detailed.The rooftop bar is fantastic although the offerings are limited and it closed at 11:30pm when we were there the end of October.  Not sure why that was.  No explanation was given.Room was small but very well appointed.  I liked the shower especially.  Unfortunately, our room looked right over the giant Trump sign across the river.  Not the end of the world but something to know.Staff was friendly and helped make the stay very positive.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What an amazing find!
text: I'm a loyal Hilton customer but never stayed at the Curio...I traditionally look for a Conrad but Chicago Conrad not yet open so tried Curio.  What an AMAZING find!  The hotel is a jewel in the heart of Chicago - amazing service, amazing comfort, amazing appointments, amazingly close to everything AND in-room dinning very good...not only convenient but tasty, good quality food!  Enjoyed my stay and will return for sure!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: perfect for business trip
text: Will definitely return. great location, clean and attractive.Roof bar with spectacular views.Room a bit small but sufficient.Staff couldn't be nicer. Not dated like so many other Hilton properties.Enjoy

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great time in Chicago!
text: I spent three nights at the LondonHouse Chicago hotel in August, and had a wonderful time!!  I Loved the location of the hotel, the spacious and well decorated rooms, as well as the view from my 10th floor room.  The continental breakfast was pretty good.  A special thanks to the guys at the concierge, who were both friendly and helpful.Would definitely stay here again!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hidden Gem in Chicago
text: Booked LondonHouse because it was available but didn't know anything about it.  Found it to be an exceptional hotel. Staff and hospitality were on par with the finest hotels.  Room was bigger and nicer than expected.  I will attach a picture of the view. Because of how it is situated on Wacker Drive, it has a great view both during the day and at night through the floor to ceiling windows.  Really a neat place and the hotel I will look to first when visiting Chicago going forward.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and nice hotel.
text: The room was great, very comfortable and well appointed.  The rooftop bar was very nice, until we got back at about 11 pm.  We wanted to order some appetizers and drinks for up on the rooftop.  We were rushed, told we had one minute to order and to sit "right here!" We were told we couldn't go up to the rooftop because they were closing it since it was under 60 degrees.  (It was 57 degrees).  I don't know if it was the bar manager or who he was, but he was not pleasant.  Then 15 minutes later he told us we could go up to the rooftop.  We finished our fries and went upstairs ordered drinks, sat down and there he was again telling us they would be closing the rooftop in about 15 minutes.  WHAT?  It's October, the weather is great, the rooftop bar was full and he has the wait staff removing pillows and cushions from the seating areas while we are still sitting there.  Really not cool, when other rooftops are open until 2 am.  They should have appreciated the business and left their clients socialize up on the roof in the beautiful Chicago night.  Really a beautiful view but hard to enjoy when they won't let you stay there.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely a wonderful hotel
text: We had a magnificent time at the Londonhouse. Situated in a prime area of Chicago within walking distance to shopping, dining, and cultural attractions. The Hotel is beautiful and the staff incredible. It exceeded our expectations in every way. If it's not too cold check out the rooftop bar. Amazing views of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago is an amazing hotel
text: This  was a real treat to stay here. The hotel had only just opened its doors to business and it's staff impressed us. I loved the dress cod.    e of the staff that directed us at the front door. We had a great room overlooking the river. Great to watch the river traffic from the height. Beds are comfy and all facilities in the room were perfect.  Great location to explore Chicago. City tour buses only across the street and shopping is only a short walk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, awesome views, classy
text: Business Suite on 7th floor was quiet and had captivating views of the River and Classic Chicago Architecture. Enjoyed watching sunset from the window and then watching the city come alive in the morning.  People watching is fab entertainment in Chicago. There is a stylish bar on the 2nd floor with more river views and a live jazz singer with pianist. Overall a wonderful stay. If I could give 4.5 I would. Its a fairly new hotel and room carpet already shows signs of heavy traffic so it gets a 4 star.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gotta love the Londonhouse
text: Super cool atmosphere and vibe.  D√©cor is awesome, rooms clean and comfy.  Nespresso machine a nice touch...excellent location, super friendly staff, amazing rooftop bar.  Can't imagine staying anywhere else in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pricey yet elegant, modern hotel with breathtaking views of the river.
text: I was in a vista room and had a stunning view of the riverside. All facilities are well-maintained - the fitness room, the restaurant. It's just too bad I didn't get to eat at the rooftop restaurant since it only opens 12 noon onwards. Food at the place where they serve breakfast is good, service is even better. Most staff I interacted with were friendly and knowledgeable. Prior to my trip, I messaged the hotel via Facebook to check if they had a microwave, and I although not standard, I was pleasantly surprised to have gotten one loaned to me during my entire 7 day stay, with no additional charges! Needless to say, that made me a happy customer. It was only the service of the bellboys that did not quite meet my expectations. I was hauling my luggage from the curb and didn't get any assistance on check-in. During check-out, I had to wait more than 20 minutes and made several follow-ups before I got my stuff out. And yes, there is technically no driveway for the hotel, so guests need to walk from the curbside to the 2nd floor lobby for check-in/check-out. This won't be an issue if you're assisted all the way especially if you have heavy luggage.Overall, I had a great experience at this luxury hotel. Highly recommended for all travelers.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: great central location
text: Awesome hotel and location in Chicago. I've stayed in the city a few times and this is the best. Easy to get to Magnificent Mile in one direction and Millenium Park in the other.  beautiful view of the river from the rooms.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Affordable Luxury and Elegance in a Modern Hotel with the Best Views
text: Hilton‚Äôs finest luxury resort in the heart of downtown Chicago.  The LondonHouse is a exquisite hotel with fabulous views of the Chicago River and the Chicago Skyline.  The service is met with exceptional staff greeting that goes above and beyond the friendly Midwest rapport. The trendy stylings of the entry and modern lobby pull you into a world of luxury and class, even for the pickiest of travelers.  The ambiance of the hotel is set to engulf your senses into a euphoric state of elegance.  Modern technology is abound throughout the hotel to include the wireless gateways that allow for fast, uninterrupted wi-fi conections.  The elegance of dining options and bars keeps you wanting to stay in however the incredible views from the hotel rooms, lobby and rooftop bar will pull you out to explore the heart of the city.  The rooms are modern and stylish with comfortable beds and pillows.  The bathrooms are state of the art and the amenities are top-tier. The best part of this hotel is the location.  It is in the middle of the city along the Chicago River with spectacular views.  The best part of this offering is the price. Similar hotels would easily be double the price. If you are budget conscious traveler but desire a taste of luxury with outstanding customer service and the most comfortable room while in Chicago, this is your place, hands down.  I have already planned my return trip thanks to this stay at the LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Highlight of my trip
text: I started my week at the Downtown Marriott on Mag Mile, and kind of hated it, so I switched hotels. From the moment my uber dropped me off out front, my stay at the LondonHouse has been a dream. The gold leaf ceiling as you walk in and the midcentury modern lobby decor are stunning. A few minutes after I got into my room, admiring my city and river view, I got a text from the front desk checking in to make sure I was happy with everything. Throughout the rest of my stay, I was able to text the concierge for anything I needed. The room was decorated in brass, leather, and wood - very classy. The bed is incredibly comfy, and the marble shower had me dreaming about home renovations. I liked my room so much that I opted to stay in most nights, but when I wanted to "go out", the rooftop lounge was perfection. Long story short, I stayed here on a business trip, but I loved it so much that I'll be back for a romantic weekend with my husband.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wedding night
text: We stayed at the London House for our wedding night as we got married a few blocks away.  The room had amazing views of the city and was very comfortable!  The building itself is historic which is a great touch.  We were also to walk there using the Chicago River Walk.  The lobby had a wonderful atmosphere!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simply a truly Excellent Hotel
text: The London House had impressed my wife and I from the moment we walked in. The doormen welcomed us with a friendly smile and offered assistance, then showed us to the elevator to the 2nd floor lobby. The front desk attendants were professional and also friendly. The lobby was open, bright and welcoming.Quick note, the digital elevator panels!! Awesome!!!Every person we came across that worked there, greeted us with a smile and made my wife and I feel right at home. Our room was amazing, from the layout, to the decor, to the river view and bridges (well minus a certain building directly across) I gave the room a 9/9.5 out of 10. If it had a separate soaker tub, I will give it a 12 out 10The 21st floor lounge and rooftop bar was the icing on the cake. Absolutely amazing spots. I have to give a big thank you to Johnny (lack of a better term, the bouncer) He went out of his way to ensure my wife and I had a good time from the first time we went there to the last. Overall, thank you London House for helping make our 1st time in Chicago absolutely wonderful. Your hotel was the perfect hotel to stay and celebrate our anniversary. We shall return

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern Luxury with a Twist
text: Excellent experience - amazing views, rooftop bar and sparkling clean rooms - the bathrooms are lacking a bit of privacy and tubs but other than those two things, you can't beat it! Location is prime and the amenities and outlets are awesome!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Well Worth It!!
text: The is a beautiful hotel with top notch service. The views are amazing and it is close to a lot of different activities. It has close proximity to great restaurants and shopping. I highly recommend this hotel. We where on the 17th floor, and we could still hear quite a bit of street noise, but again you are in the heart of downtown and that's to be expected.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Newly Opened Hotel with a great discount!
text: I had stayed in this hotel during the last days of june 2016.  I picked it in the Hilton Honnors app, while desperately searching for a hotel to stay in Chicago, 2 nites before arriving.  Turned out to be there was this great deal, so I made a reservation for 3 nites, hoping to get a room as nice as the one advertised in the app.  Couldn't believe my eyes when I entered the Reception Area of the hotel, located on the 2nd floor of the building, which is located strategically on the corner of Wacker Dr. and the main avenue, beside the canal.And when I entered the room, it was all I had dreamt of!  Net and stylish decorated, with complimentary Nespresso coffee machine, and full of amenities.  I was very lucky to get this promo!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great hotel In the heart of the City
text: Visiting for business, this hotel has been on my radar to try out since it's been newly renovated. In a great location at Michigan Ave and Wacker Drive, it does not disappoint. For a Hilton property, it's got a modern feel with a cool vibe in the reception/lounge area. If you are a Blackhawks hockey fan, their store is right across the street. My room over-delivered and I was truly impressed. Check out Room 2048 for a great corner room with alot of space. Love the espresso machine in the room and the amenities from Malin + Goetz. Another highlight is the rooftop terrace on the 22nd floor. Spectacular views, great cocktails and there's even a fire pit for those cooler nights. A definite must visit and a great place to stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop lounge bad service
text: Unfortunately I am writing this review as I was shocked about the behaviour of the waitress at the hotel lounge. I really liked the hotel, location and everything, and I will probably stay there again but never again will I use their restaurant lounge.  My friend and I wanted to have a drink and we asked for a tequila Anejo. Also we specified the brand. The waitress came with two silver tequilas. Immediately we told her it was not what we ordered, she was not even aware that tequila Anejo has a yellow colour and probably she thought we weren't either! Her answer was that they didn't have that one that's why she replaced it. We refused it and received another tequila, still not sure that was not a reposato as the light yellow colour was not really corresponding with what we wanted. So you order a premium drink and you are served the cheapest one but for the expense of the other!  What a service! My friend did leave a tip, I would have not!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel in a great lication
text: Stayed at the LondonHouse per a recommendation from a friend.  WOW...beautiful!  Hotel just opened in May 2016.  Decor is eclectic and lovely.  Our room was very pretty and the bathroom and shower are great!!  We stayed on the 11th floor ..overlooking the Chicago River as it winds down Wacker Dr.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: WOW!! What a view!!
text: The most important thing I can say about this hotel is that the location is PERFECT! It is right on the river - easy walking distance to Millennium Park and Grant Park. We even walked to Skydeck and 360. The hotel will give you a map of the downtown area and it's very easy to find your way around. The hotel has a fun rooftop bar with amazing views of the city. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked nice - upscale. Located on the first floor of the building is a Corner Bakery Cafe (sandwiches, breakfast, pastries, coffee, etc). Every aspect of service from this hotel was excellent. Brandon in guest services helped us select the perfect room with an amazing view of the river. He recommended staying between the 10th and 15th floors on the west side - to see down the river towards the sunset! We chose room 1310 and the view did not disappoint! The gentlemen at the front door were outstanding - taking great care of our car and helping us with bags. Everyone was courteous and cheerful! We will definitely stay here the next time we are in town!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect
text: I hosted my leadership team here for a meeting. The property is stunning.  Staff is friendly and accommodating.  The food was outstanding!The views from the rooftop are amazing.So many wonderful surprises.You have to stay here when you are in Chicago!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent new downtown hotel
text: Hilton took this 1923 landmark property, gutted the interior, and put in modern style rooms. The rooms are small but have all the amenities that you'd want in an upscale hotel. The location is prime downtown real estate, you can't get any better than this. There is a nice 21st floor outdoor bar with amazing views of the Chicago river. The service was good but not great, but I expect it will improve since the hotel opened just 4 months ago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good Hotel Great Location
text: I stayed there during a convention so I did not spend a lot of time in the hotel. There was a nice view over the river. Considering the room faced the road it was very quiet. The room was comfortable. Not huge but plenty of room. There was a small useful empty fridge, a Nespresso with coffee replenished daily, good lighting, a large TV and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was well equipped and nicely finished with marble and chrome. It had good lights for shaving.The staff were pleasant and unobtrusive. I did not use the bars or restaurant.The location is very good. Close to the park, public transit, the river, the loop and the Mile.The elevators were exceptional. I don't think I waited more than 30 seconds in the 5 days I was there.I would stay there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wanted to Try it Out
text: Used Hhonors points to book a night since my wife and I had a show to watch in the city.  Really nice room and was able to use the app as my key.  Made to order omelettes was nice and the service was great at breakfast which is upstairs now.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice place but...
text: The hotel has a really nice view but the service it is not that good. People were kinda rude and did not cara much. It is good located and easy to find. The breakfast it is not that good for the price that is paid.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: This new hotel has great rooms, friendly service, and wonderful views from our room and on the rooftop.  The location, on the river and at the corner of Wacker and Michigan was great for walking to shopping, busses, the Art Institute

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, nice property, but poor service
text: 1. Great location. On the side of river, you can see the beautiful city just from the window in your room. The building is also a popular sightseeing spot for tourists, so remember that there may be a lot of people in the elevator with you but only you going for check-in.2. Continental breakfast is OK, but do not expect that is going to make you full and fresh in the morning. As a diamond member of HHonors, I feel totally fine since the breakfast is free after all. But, it is not worth $18 if you'd like to pay for it.3. I stumbled upon two tiny little cockroaches walking on the wall of my shower room and the wall next to the mirror. You can see them from my pictures. I killed one but another was moving so fast. I believe every hotel might have these kind of problems, so I chose not to report it. I also believe that I was just so unlucky.4. The personnel ARE NOT OK.(1)I checked-in through Hilton app on the day before arrival and picked the room 2031. When I was checking-in at the hotel, 4PM, the room was not ready for me. The male staff offered me another room of 1629, saying that the view is exactly the same. I accepted it because I was tired and needed to take a shower immediately and went for the ball game. However, the truth is: the room 1629 is much smaller than 2031. (He did not mention it.) I was very unlucky.  By the way, the staff did not say anything like ‚ÄúYou are a diamond member and we have tried our best to upgrade your room,‚Äù which is weird, because I used to stay in IHG/IC hotels and they have these kind of ‚Äúformal notice.‚Äù I did not mention that, but he seemed totally not aware of it either. Perhaps their procedure is just to ignore your status if you do not beg for an upgrade. (Even if you are not willing to upgrade my room, you can simply lie to me that the rooms are full today. I would believe you.) Or, their system is not not connected to Hilton?(2)Restaurant for breakfast: I showed up at 8 AM at the restaurant and there were already three people waiting in line. At the first place, I thought the restaurant was filled with people, but in fact I was wrong. That was just because the waiters were not enough to take care of every customer. I was brought to a table, where one of the seats was packed with somebody else‚Äôs luggage. The waiter (the madam standing at the entrance brought me to that seat) did not even move those stuff away. What‚Äôs worse, there is no napkin, fork, or spoon on MY table. (There were utensils on any other tables.) Maybe they just do not have time to prepare it for me.(3)Check-out: As usual, lots of people. You must wait in line. And, this time, a guy in front of me might have some issues regarding his stay, so the madam at the desk was (a little?) upset. Unfortunately, she treated me like she did to that man. She used her single hand to wave to notify me to move forward. I was about to tell her that the fact that I saw live creatures in my room yesterday, but, unfortunately again, she did not even ask me how my stay was. As a result, I chose to report it here.5. I guess that the only well functioning personnel in this hotel is the madam who talked with me through ‚Äútexting‚Äù. I asked for a toothbrush kit and she delivered it to my room immediately. Remember, there is no dental kit in the room.This was my first time staying in a Hilton brand hotel. I just got the diamond member status a few month ago because the airlines that I am affiliated with offered me a ‚Äúmatching.‚Äù So, maybe this hotel does not care a diamond member with no stay records, or it just does not have enough time to take care of him because they have tens of thousands of diamond members through ‚Äúmatching‚Äù.Overall, I would have stayed in Holiday Inn Express for a night over 200 dollars. Without expectation, there is no disappointment.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Location
text: Our first trip to Chicago met our expectations.  The hotel was very clean, perfect location and the staff was so nice and helpful.  it was a pleasure staying here and will absolutely stay here again.  If you are looking for a great experience then this is your place to stay!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: Nice modern clean hotel in the heart of the loop.   Friendly front desk staff.  Modern well appointed rooms.   Only problem with my nice river view was the huge TRUMP sign at eye level out my window on the Trump Tower opposite.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great View, But There Are Better Hotels Nearby
text: My experience began BEFORE checking in was less than stellar.  I live near Chicago but decided to stay downtown for Architecture Weekend, and since the Hilton London House was on the tour and a recently renovated historic property I decided to stay there.  I used my Hilton Honor points to upgrade to a Vista Suite, but a few months later a good friend warned me that they had thought they were staying in the historic London Guarantee & Accident Building (completed 1923) but ended up staying in modern glass skyscraper that they built a couple of years ago.  I called Hilton and they had no idea what I was talking about and they told me to call the hotel.  I got someone the next day who confirmed I was in the George Jetson office building and not the historic property.  They told me it was more desirable because of the better view and they were effectively the same otherwise.  I was skeptical of this but my sense of it after staying there is the room interiors /decor are very similar and the view from the enormous glass windows is indeed better.  Nonetheless the website trumpets the ‚Äúhistoric‚Äù property so I was quite surprised to be upgraded OFF the historic property which was the reason I booked the room to begin with.  While I don‚Äôt think I suffered real harm I do feel the website is a bait-and-switch. The room was nicely decorated in a sort of modern take on old world elegance ‚Äî dark wood, stainless steel fixtures.  Walking shower, large bathroom, well lit.  The view of Trump Tower and the Chicago River was stunning and the highlight of the room.  Nice TV but to be honest if you turn on a television in a room with a view like this I have nothing to say you.  The view of the Chicago river, with the tour boats and incredible buildings and kayakers and street activity is beyond breathtaking.  Did I mention the view?  Let's mention it again.  It was spectacular.The room had some nice features, like really nice toiletries and a button that turned all the lights on and off with one press, and not so nice features like an elegant sliding door armoire that would have been more elegant if it was on the track and a pen on the desk that was out of ink.  The concierge (Shannon?) and the front desk clerks were wonderful:  cheerful, efficient, and perky.  They got 5 stars.  When I went up to the restaurant at 10:15 PM on Saturday night they were still serving, sort of, but there was no hostess and when I wandered around for a while asking someone eventually showed me to a table.  To be honest there were a bunch of people in black T-shirts wandering around and I wasn‚Äôt at all sure who was working and who was hanging out.  The waitress was working but there appeared to be no management presence at all.   After 10 minutes I gave up hope of being served and went up to look at the rooftop bar.  Crowded, but the views were stunning.  So the views were incredible, the service non-existent.Then I caught a cab to a restaurant that had a manager.  Disappointing.They were having a wedding that night and they were playing SHOUT! until 1AM loud enough for me to sing and dance along, but I was up anyway and it didn‚Äôt bother me.  I‚Äôm mentioning it because noise might be a problem if you want to turn in before the party ends at 1AM.  Personally, I don‚Äôt really expect them to turn off Chicago at 10PM on Saturday night, but I know this might be a problem for some people.  The next morning the check out staff was (again) amazing.  I checked my bags and continued my architecture tour.   When I came back about 3:45 PM (hoping to catch a 4:30 train) the bell staff had vanished.  After about 5 minutes I went and hunted down someone, who sent someone else, who then couldn‚Äôt find my bag, and then brought the wrong bag, then complained the bag was left in the wrong room.  The problem was corrected and the bellman was very nice, but when you‚Äôre trying to catch a train you don‚Äôt want to play baggage-hide-and-go-seek.  There were several people in line behind me waiting endlessly as well.   Not good.So overall service gets a ‚ÄúC‚Äù which is an average of an A+ and a ‚ÄúF‚Äù.  Wifi service in the lobby was a problem which was a nuisance before and after checkout when I couldn‚Äôt get e-mail. Hilton has an uncontrollable lust to charge you $9.95 for a service that should be free with a $300 hotel room.   If the Corner Bakery downstairs wasn‚Äôt mobbed I would have gotten my e-mail for free.  However although I eventually established room connectivity the lobby was a lost cause and I decided not to spend the afternoon playing tech support (hey, you need time to get your bags!)Elevators have the keypads where you enter the numbers and then it tells you what floor to go to.  I‚Äôve seen this before at HUGE hotels (Marriot Marquis, Time Square) but it works better when the elevators are much more clearly marked and there is someone on staff there to explain the system to the puzzled grandmother who has no idea how to use a touch screen.  It‚Äôs hard to tell the ‚ÄúA‚Äù elevator from the ‚ÄúB‚Äù elevator because of the historic decor and training people in how to use the elevators quickly became my part time job.  Even with the programming system the elevators seemed to be using the same mechanism as 1923, which gave me lots of time to admire the renovation.   The confusion of the keypads only made it worse.I was VERY glad the property was on the Chicago Architecture Foundation‚Äôs Open House as that is what drew me to the property and it was good to get a little tour.  Five stars for that!  THANK YOU!! In summary, the hotel is excellent in many ways, but lacking in many others, and every WOW moment had a ????? to match it.  Give that there are probably 75 awesome hotels within a mile of the London House, I can say I‚Äôm glad I experienced it once but I will not be rushing back anytime soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gem in Downtown Chicago
text: This hotel appears to be brand new. Corner suite assigned to me was spacious and has high end fixtures. It has a espresso pod espresso machine that I used quite often, a tv that is 60 inch that flip to the room and the desk/living room area, modern alarm clock, and key is Bluetooth enabled. The bathroom fixtures appears to be made of marble and towels are very plush. The rooftop bar oversees the river side of downtown and Trump towers. It's close to shops, parks (millennium and grant), restaurants, and sight seeing. I would have rated this hotel an easy 5 but it lacks hot tub or swimming pool. I did not use the gym or day spa within the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gem in Downtown Chicago
text: Great location in downtown Chicago that has the view and close to restaurants, parks, and shops. Rooms and amenities (espresso machine, blue tooth key, modern alarm, and 60 inch tv) are phenomenal. It is close to the river and less than half a mile to The millennium park. Rooftop bar give you the option to chill and mingle.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Flawless From Check-In to Check-Out.
text: Before we all get bogged down with words, I'd like to announce the MVP of my stay at LondonHouse. The award goes to....CRUZ! The reason I started with this is because it's not often you can pinpoint someone on staff who literally made your night. But in this case, that's exactly what happened.I lived in Chicago for almost 15 years and recently moved away. This was my first time back. Selecting a hotel was not an easy task. At one point I had 4 different reservations. Because of cost, location, and reviews, I finally went with LondonHouse. I'll start from the beginning. First of all, it's very easy to walk to from the Blue Line. I know how insane the city can be, so this was important to me. If I can avoid cabs, I win! Check in was super easy and it gave me time to take in the lobby, where I knew i would most likely be having a cocktail in the near future. The man who checked me in was very polite when I requested a quiet room. It was the first time a way from my 9 month old and SLEEP was on my agenda. He put me at the very end of the hall on the 13th floor. I barely heard a thing. (They also check in with you via text a few times throughout your stay to make sure you're happy. I consider this ballsy as it's very easy to complain when you don't have to use your face and mouth.)I will say, when I walked into my room for the first time, the size of it was underwhelming. Felt a little claustrophobic, but when I saw how big the bathroom was and realized you could spin the TV to face either way, whether you're in bed or the office area, it felt a little more open. And that view of the river will fix just about anything. I went out for the night and then returned to the hotel and had a nightcap in the lobby bar. Very friendly, welcoming...and yes, expensive. Well, at least the price of a whiskey on the rocks kept me from having another one. I got a massage the next morning. I am extremely picky about massages. Like, I get irate when a masseuse is too gentle. Waste of money. The masseuse at LH was heavenly. Perfect amount of pressure and she couldn't have been sweeter. My plan for the evening was to hang with my best friend on the rooftop. This time is especially important to us now that I no longer live 5 minutes away from her. We made our way up there around 7 pm. We cringed when we saw how busy it was, but asked Cruz, the guy at the host stand, if there was a way to reserve a seat. When he said there wasn't, we were ready to figure out a plan B. As two women in their late 30's, it's not the first time a guy at a host stand would foil our plan for the night. But wait -- Cruz was not going to let that happen. As we stood, awkwardly, trying to figure out what to do next, he ran over to us and pointed out one seat next to the fire. "One of you sit there, I saw another open chair that I'll bring over." And that, friends, is how Cruz made our night. Two chairs, best spot on the whole rooftop. Not to mention the fact that he helped get us drinks at the overly crowded bar. In all my years of living in Chicago, rarely have I seen this kind of customer service. He truly wanted to make sure we had an amazing night. And we did, mostly because of him. My only semi-critism (other than size of room) is the room service menu. I miss Chicago food. Really REALLY miss it. The menu isn't terrible, but it's not great either. I'd probably skip it next time and order in from somewhere else so I can still eat dinner in bed:)All in all, I had a wonderful experience from the moment I walked into the door until the time I left. I will definitely return in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Chicago stay ever
text: This was a fantastic hotel - friendly staff, central location in the middle of the Magnificent Mile with great exercise facilities and wonderful historic ambiance.  The Chicago River view is incomparable.  I would highly recommend and would stay here again the next time I visit Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My kind of hotel...
text: The LH offers the best quality, service, ambiance, and views. I loved the digital check in, the specialized elevators, and beautiful rooms. We had a King Vista room with floor to ceiling windows. The view of Lake Michigan and the neighboring hotels was amazing!! The beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The rooftop bar seemed overrated. There was a long wait, but I couldn't understand why because it appeared to be fairly empty. Pending reservations.. We were told. The LH is perfectly located. We walked to restaurants, for shopping, and to visit some must see sights. If you can't walk,  there are always taxis waiting at the door. This place is trendy and modern. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel with some minor hiccups!
text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a mix of business and pleasure and for the most part was really impressed with the location, decor, views, rooftop, comfortable bed and most of all the staff that was always willing to make my stay perfect. I'm giving the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 due to the following hiccups. 1. I was first put in a beautiful corner room that I immediately was impressed with but realized it didn't work for me because it was on the 4th floor. I'm a fairly light sleeper and the noise from being on a floor so close to the street was just too much. I honestly felt I was practically outside the hotel. I asked the hotel for a new room and they relocated me to the same corner room on the 13th floor the next day, which was much better! If you're a heavy sleeper the noise may not bother you but if you are or just want a more quiet room, ask for a higher level floor.2. I wasn't able to connect to wifi from any of my devices the night I checked in, which was a problem because I needed to access my corporate email to get some work done but couldn't. After trouble shooting with hotel wifi tech support for a while it was determined the problem was with the wifi router on the 4th floor. Regardless of what the manager on duty tried (and I could tell he was really trying to resolve this issue for me) including rebooting the router, nothing helped. I had to finally resort to using my phones hot spot which was a terribly slow connection for accessing my company's email system and network. Before I was moved to my new room, Mike the manager, made sure the wifi access was working perfectly in that room so I wouldn't have anymore connectivity issues. Thank you Mike!!3. The room safe needed a new battery, which isn't a big deal at all but I had to wait for almost 45 minutes to have an engineer come to my room to replace it. Normally that wouldn't be that big a deal but I needed to leave for a meeting and the 45 minute wait made me 10 minutes late to my meeting.4. The little refrigerator wasn't working properly so the engineer replaced the unit rather than trying to fix it, to be on the safe side  5. The rooftop bar didn't serve any desserts or hot drinks (coffee or cappuccino). It would have been nice to enjoy the beautiful rooftop setting and views with something other than a cold drink and appetizers. Maybe they'll add those options in the future.There's no question that when I return to Chicago I'll definitely stay here again. Every staff member made me feel appreciated and for me that's the key to having a great experience at a high end hotel!  Thanks LondonHouse!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great if busy spot
text: Stayed here a night or two a couple of months ago. Very nice hotel and finish throughout is of a high standard. Great central location as central as you can get. One criticism would be the lobby situation - it's shared with the quite popular bar on the roof and presumably other offices. It's a bit chaotic and comprises of essentially a corridor and some elevators with lots of people standing around. I arrived late at night and there was no one there to point out to me (with two cases) that the hotel reception is on the first floor. Minor inconvenience, but takes the edge off what would other wise be a great spot. I stayed fairly high up, 14th floor maybe and noise was not an issue.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Service and Stay
text: We recently spent three nights in late August at the London House.  I was definitely more than impressed with our whole experience.  Everything from chick-in, the room itself, and the staff far exceeded our expectations.  The room (we had a one bedroom suite) was fantastic.  I'm a stickler with beds (hate these ultra fluffy pillow top ones), and their bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in.  I even tried the rollaway, and it was firm and supportive as well.  The room was super clean and I really like that they had an empty fridge in the room for drinks we purchased.  Toiletries are by Malin and Goetz, so you cannot go wrong.  Service is where the London House truly stood out.  I cannot say enough times how awesome Jessie at the front desk was.  There was a last minute addition to our party, and Jessie went way out and beyond to accommodate us with a suite.  Every time we ran into her in the lobby, she always asked about our stay.  She exemplifies what every hotel professional (or anybody in the service industry) should strive towards.  I definitely look forward to my next trip to Chicago and the London House.  I hope to get up to the rooftop bar next time around too.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Hotel with Nice Views
text: Very excited to stay at this property.  Check in was a breeze. The front desk asked if we wanted to upgrade to a room with a view for an extra $20 a night. We declined and I'm glad we did. Our room did have a view, just only from the bathroom. But we didn't care. It was a nice view of the river. The room itself was a bit cramped but adequate. The big divider in the room was what made it a bit tight. But let's be real, we didn't spend that much time in the room and we weren't in town for that long. At first it didn't seem as if there were any dresser drawers in the room but we soon discovered the bed was a storage bed with drawers. The bathroom was very nice and roomy and well lit. Our room was on the 17th floor above Michigan and Wacker.  So we did hear a lot of street noise but sometimes you just can't escape the noise when staying in the city.During our stay we decided to try out their room service. This is an area where they need major improvement in. Our first morning I called to place an order but kept getting voicemail.  I left a message but call back.  Finally after 30 min I called the front desk. They placed the order. I went with coffee and oatmeal.  The oatmeal was lukewarm to the point I couldn't eat it.  And I only got a cup of coffee, not even a small pot.  Usually when ordering coffee a small pot is provided.  We decided to give room svc another chance. This time dinner. We ordered 2 entrees, one being a grilled chicken sandwich.  What I received was a chicken salad sandwich. Gross. No where on the menu is a chicken salad sandwich. Then to top it off they only provided 1 place setting.  So one of us had to use a bathroom towel as a napkin. The hotel itself was nice. The room we had was sufficient.  Housekeeping was always on top of it.  It was a pleasant stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Going somewhere else
text: Tried the digital check in and arrived expecting one room only to be given another, which happened to be one floor below the bar. We went to sleep each night to the sound of tables and chairs moving and loud music. Spent some time on the rooftop bar only to wait 40 minutes for some one who knew how to lite the fire pit, only to discover it was a remote control that had been at the hostess stand the entire time. Spent a lot of money for a super small room that we couldn't get a good night sleep in. What's the point of being a HH member if it's not recognized upon checkin?

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent hotel, great staff.
text: Except for some noise from Michigan Avenue we were very pleased by our stay.  Centrally located, walking distance to stores and restaurants.  Well appointed, excellent friendly staff.  Particularly liked the second floor lounge.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best views and rooftop in Chicago
text: LH is simply amazing from the service, quality, ambiance and an incredible addition to Chicago.  The sweeping skyline and riverfront views are breathtaking and the best rooftop lounge to grab a cocktail and small bites.  Reservations for the rooftop are online only and there is a waiting list. The rooms are comfortable and elegantly appointed.  London House is the new top dog in town.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Trendy and Updated Hilton Brand
text: Could not have been happier with my choice in Chicago for the Chicago Marathon. They have espresso makers in the room amazing! Not your standard bland usual hotel coffee, no need to find a Starbucks while staying here. Chromecast capabilities on the TV so you can stream your own content, shows, etc. while relaxing. The experience from check-in to check-out was fantastic. The staff is helpful and unintrusive; the great common area's to sit and relax, and extremely fast elevators. Their location is one of the best in Chicago with great views of the river and a short walk to all the shops on Michigan Ave., State St., Grant and Millennium Park, Art Museum, etc. If you are not staying at the Waldorf this is the place to stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location!
text: I stayed here for the Chicago Marathon weekend. The rooms were clean, modern and I personally appreciated the Nespresso machine! The rooftop bar is beautiful, and service was friendly & accommodating. Best part of the hotel is the location - close to many L stops, Grant Park, shopping and restaurants. Would stay here again for sure!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Renovated Gem in the Heart of Chicago
text: I spent a total of 17 nights over a 2 month period at The Londonhouse Hotel.  The rooms are beautiful with most having spectacular views of the Wacker-Riverfront-Michigan Avenue intersections.  Spacious, modern and comfortable!  The staff are friendly and service is excellent.The lobby is on the second floor and has a bar with equally nice views.Food was my only issue.  The bar has food but it is exorbitantly expensive and very limited in choices.  Up at the top of the hotel is a restaurant and bar with rooftop access.  The crowd up there is stylish and it is always crowded.  In all my stays, I was not able to get a seat on the rooftop area or eat in the restaurant, even though I was staying at the hotel. I will stay there again and would like to enjoy the rooftop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Hotel - Great Location
text: Spent 3 days/nights here while on a business trip to Chicago.  Wonderful new hotel within walking distance of Millenium Park and Michigan Avenue.  Room was very spacious with large double bed, walk in shower and functional bathroom.  Equiped with an espresso coffee machine for the early morning risers.  Great massage at spa after a long disance flight.  Varied menu at the restaurant.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A jewel in the heart of Chicago
text: Wow!! We can't say enough good things about this beautiful gem of a hotel in the heart of Chicago. I was there for a few days  (at another hotel) for work. After my work meetings were done, I moved to this hotel when my family flew in to meet me for the long weekend. It is in the PERFECT location---right in the heart of everything. It is so beautiful and well-appointed. I could get lost in its architecture and cool lobby. Every single person from the doormen to the housekeepers clearly love their job and went over and above to speak to us and make a big deal over my little boy. Michael G (the manager) is out of this world and over the top with his customer service. He checked us in actually, and texted us throughout the trip to make sure we had all that we needed. The room made us feel like we were in our own home. I can't tell you how comfortable we felt there. It was so great. There was not a single detail missed from the towels, to the spa-quality shampoo samples, to the bedding, to the technology used in the hotel. No stone was left unturned when it came to details. Be sure to not miss coffee and fresh pastries at The Corner Bakery in the mornings or a drink on the GORGEOUS rooftop bar. We are still gushing about our wonderful weekend. Thank you for a fantastic family memory for our little boy's first time to "the big city." It was unforgettable! And Michael G should be in charge of more things for your brand. He's great!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location, Exellent service
text: LondonHouse is right in the center of downtown Chicago.  The property is very clean and overall, the staff was really accommodating.  Honestly I never really had any issue with anything bad.  Room 1913 has a great view of the river and downtown Chicago and the Trump tower building, which could be positive or negative depending on your political leanings, but I digress.  Rooms are not overly big, which is almost expected, but are nicely appointed.  I was worried about sound being somewhat close to the elevators and also right above a very busy downtown, but honestly, I never heard the elevators, and had no trouble sleeping.  Keurig type coffee maker was in the room, but I never used it.  Everything else was exactly how I would expect it to be.  I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member which just means, I spend way too much time away from home and in hotel rooms, and I would gladly return to this hotel for another trip - business or personal travel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very modern clean and excellent staff
text: I can't say enough good things about my recent stay at Londonhouse. From the moment I arrived Lorelei from the front desk made my stay seamless. She was both friendly and professional and helped me get a room with an amazing view and even texted me throughout my stay via the hotels digital text concierge which was awesome. She found me tickets to the Cubs playoff game that evening and ensured my stay went off without a hitch. The concierge was just as friendly and helpful and one point I think I created a panic when we were both trying purchase Cubs tickets - thank you for letting me use your compote to log into facebook!üòÇ Then there was Brian the bar tender upstairs - excellent service young man! You did a fine job handling the chaos. I will return! Keep it up Lorelei, Brian, and the concierge!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved LondonHouse
text: After reading some of the less-than-stellar reviews, we had some reservations about making a reservation, but did, and stayed for five nights in October. And, boy-oh-boy are we glad we did. Don't hesitate to give this new hotel a try. We'll be coming back for sure.PROS: LOCATION: Right on the river. Right on the corner of Wacker and Michigan. A perfect location for tourists and those with business in the Loop, North Bridge, or Michigan Avenue area. ROOM AMENITIES: The bed was Hilton plush. The linens very, very nice. The lighting is a bit unusual. You'll have to get used to operating it. If a bellman takes you to the room, have him show you how the lights work. The bathroom was roomy and the shower excellent. Toiletries were first class. Towels were large and plush. Very nice. ROOM COMFORT AND SIZE: Other reviewers complained about small room. For Chicago standards we found the room roomy and well appointed. NOISE: Other reviewers complained about noisy rooms. No us. We were on the 12th floor facing the river and had little to no noise infiltration. But, ever if we did, you can set the room AM fan to HIGH and have all of the white noise you would need. SERVICE: We found the service, from the front door, to the front desk, to the concierge, to the guest services staff to be excellent and very attentive. Earlier reviewers found problems with service. That appears to be fixed. ELEVATORS: Modern and very fast. You program the floor to which you're headed, the computer panel directs you to one of 6 elevators, and before you know it your at your floor. We never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. ROOF TOP BAR: A lovely place to visit, especially if the weather is fine. We found the prices average for Chicago, especially given the view. CURTAINS: The black out curtains in our room were 95-98% dark. Very good. CORNER BAKERY: There is an entrance to the Corner Bakery from inside the hotel, just by the elevator. It was a great way to get economical morning breakfast and coffee for our room.CONS: We really had no complaints other than access to newspapers. At least during our stay, they ran out of papers very early. A couple of days we didn't get a paper which was disappointing. Nevertheless, we were delighted with the hotel, our room, and the wonderful service. However, we cannot comment on parking or food, as we used neither.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice experience in the curio
text: First time staying in this hotel or the curio brand. The entrance on the 1st floor might surprise you with modesty but the hotel makes up for it from the 2nd floor. Big nice and welcoming lobby (although no operational wifi when I was there - they said there was an issue that day), great staff, amazing rooms (large, clean, pretty), good fitness center and the rooftop is very nice as well. Location is very good too. To a Hilton club fan this is the spot to stay at I believe. Will come back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, amazing views!
text: Stayed here for just one night. All staff we encountered were very willing to help and ensure you had a good experience. The rooms and amenities were very sufficient and the Nespresso was a great addition (possibly if they had a couple more pods would be better). First thing we did was headed up to the rooftop bar, but unfortunately weather did not permit us going out. The bartender asked us what we were in the mood for and suggested themes and ideas. Once he got a good idea, he conjured up the perfect drink to start the night.After going out for the night for dinner, we returned to the room to a bottle of wine with a note from the staff to celebrate a birthday. Great touch by the staff/management. The breakfast was kind of chaotic as it was their first time operating their new system. Even though we were left waiting at the table for 20-30 minutes, the staff was very apologetic and sincere. The LH sandwich is probably now my new favorite breakfast, and I'd probably would go here just for that.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel, nice staff, lots of kinks to work out
text: As a newly opened renovation of an older building, the LondonHouse is stunning to look at. The second floor lobby is open  and light, and the staff generally was very friendly. My room, with a river view, was great. However, there are some kinks to work out. Breakfast service is atrocious. You're on the 21st floor while the kitchen is on 2 or 3. So it takes forever, the food could sometimes come up cold, and often wrong. Not worth the price they're charging for it, for sure. As well, the elevators led to very long waits during busy times. Should be much smoother.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome views and Great service
text: My boyfriend and I visited Chicago this past August, business for him and pleasure for me. The LondonHouse was amazing and when we return to Chicago we will definitely stay here again! Fantastic customer service. The bell hop Cory in particular! He was always so helpful and smiling. Wonderful views from your room! However be sure to ask for a room with a view. First room we checked into faced a building which obstructed our view. Corey made sure we were moved to a room with a better view which was fantastic! This location was perfect. There were plenty of shops, restaurants and attractions within walking distance. The LondonHouse has delicious restaurants to dine at and bars with great atmospheres. Their rooftop is one of the most popular in downtown Chicago! Our room and all common areas were always immaculate. Thank you LondonHouse for your top-of-the-line hospitality!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Well done effort by Hilton group.
text: Hilton hasn't been leading the unique hotel pack but this one is the real deal. Outstanding local and plenty of style. The rooftop is amazing. And if you love Trump you will have his building and giant sign to admire across the street

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sleek newly renovated hotel in great location
text: Sleek modern hotel in great location.  Rooms have plenty of space. Food was excellent.  Especially like lights that turn on when you go into the bathroom.  Rooms were very quiet and beds were super comfortable!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience!! Great Ambiance!! Great Drinks!! Great Bartender!!
text: My boyfriend and I visited London House on Monday in hopes to enjoy the views on the rooftop, however, the rooftop was closed for a private event but the host mentioned that there was a bar on the second floor of the hotel that was open to the public and hotel guests. We were immediately greeted by Michelle, she offered us suggestions on her favorite London House signature cocktails. The roaring twenties was AMAZING!! She was upbeat, kind and knew her cocktails! She prepared us a cocktail that wasnt on the menu with mango vodka that was so delicious.  She ran the bar as if she were hosting a party in her own home! We will definitely be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gorgeous Roof Top Bar!
text: This somewhat new hotel was lovely. The roof top bar was amazing and the rooms were beautiful in a contemporary style. We had a view of Lake Michigan and were on the 18th floor. The staff need to figure out how to better serve breakfast and clean the rooms in a timely manner but this was minor compared to the great location/hotel amenities. We would go back to this hotel in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The fit and finish of a luxury hotel with the service leves of an interstate chain motel
text: Our go to Chicago hotel The Waldorf Astoria was booked for this last minute trip, so upon the advice of a HHoners Diamond representative, we stayed here thinking it would be a comparable luxury hotel. While the fit and finish was certainly up to par, with quality beds and linens, the service levels and amenities were sorely lacking. First let me say I accept that despite their marketing, The Curio Collection of hotels is a step down from Hilton's top luxury brands, The Waldorf and The Conrad. I can accept that their 1 Bedroom suite lacks a bathtub, that it only came with one robe or the complete lack of a minibar. I can even accept the incredible limited room service menu that stops serving at 10pm, leaving the wary late night arrival with no viable options for a snack.But I cannot accept a so called luxury hotel that does not serve a hot breakfast. The entire breakfast experience was a poorly executed fiasco. To start, there is a digital display board in each elevator informing guests that breakfast is served on the 21st floor. Upon reaching the 21st floor, you are told it is closed for a special event all week and to go down to the second floor. When I asked why they don't modify the digital display in every elevator when they are having a special event, let alone notify their customers when booking that their restaurant is closed for THE WEEK, the person on the 21st floor stares back impassively, seemingly incapable of a verbal response. So we proceed down to the 2nd floor where we find out that due to the special event, it is a cold continental breakfast only. Incredulous, we ask is there no way to get a hot breakfast all week, and are told only thru room service. So we ask if we can sit in the restaurant and order our hot breakfast though room service and are told no. Ready to scream, we return to our room to order room service and are told we can only get hot coffee drinks ourselves on the second floor, they will not deliver them. Game over.So to surmise, you can either sit on the second floor eating a cold breakfast with hot coffee, or you can sit in your room eating a limited selection of hot breakfasts with no coffee. This is the kind of blatant and needless stupidity that drives a professional traveler nuts. If LondonHouse wants to call themselves a luxury boutique, they need to greatly improve their restaurant and room service offering.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Stay so far in Chicago
text: 5+ stars!!!   This hotel is by far the best one I have ever stayed at in Chicago!   I have been to Chicago 6 times, and we will be back to this hotel.   Service was great, rooms were amazing, and location was the BEST!!   It is in the center of everything we needed.  We were looking forward to going to the "rooftop" bar and resturant, but after looking at the menu we had no desire.   This will be our primary Hotel of choice!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great downtown hotel
text: I have stayed at multiple hotels downtown Chicago and this is one of the best. Location is great on the river but it is difficult to find and get to the front entrance. This is an old historic hotel that has been brought up to date by Hilton. The rooms are very stylish and modern but feel somewhat small. The bed and linens are comfortable and the bathroom is nicely appointed but small. The rooftop terrace had amazing views, what a place to have a drink. I would stay here again without question

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new property; all the bells & whistles
text: I love this hotel; I've now stayed twice on rather cheap (sub-$200 rate) last minute rates as they likely looked to fill rooms. On both occasions, I've used Hilton's Digital Key technology - it worked flawlessly both times. I appreciate the numerous outlets both by the desk and the bed; very helpful for charging multiple electronic devices without having to go outlet hunting. The bed was quite comfortable, especially considering how new it was (I expected it to be rock hard). I also like how they used the contours of the building to carve out unique rooms. They aren't all boring rectangles like most hotels. In one room, the wall-mounted TV formed a divide between the 'bedroom' and the work area of the room, making it seem more like a suite. The views from the bar and restaurant on the top floor is fabulous; although it was a little crowded given the good weather, it was still worth it. My only qualm is that the hotel didn't provide a paper copy of the bill under the door on my final night's stay. Other than that, this is my new favorite Chicago property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loud or Quiet, Your Choice
text: This is a fantastic hotel that should compete very well against the many great hotels within blocks.  This newer property does a great job emphasizing more old school sophistication and keeping the hipster shiny-object fluff to a minimum.  The Art Deco building is done in mostly black and gold which looks cool without appearing dated.A few quick observations:1)  Best blackout curtains I've ever had in a hotel room, period.  I could not tell if it was midnight or 8 am.  Also, the air conditioner was nearly inaudible.  As expected, the bed was great.  If you can't get well rested here, seek medical attention.2)  The bed sits on a platform that extends beyond the mattress.  Watch those toes!3)  Great river views out of the north side.4)  Bizarre elevator system.  You enter your destination floor on a touch screen and are assigned an elevator car via onscreen message; i.e., enter "17" for floor 17, then read "Please use car A" or whatever.  Don't just get into the first open elevator door or you'll be back on the ground floor trying it again.5)  When the rooftop bar is closed, visit the "On21" bar coincidentally located on floor 21.  No views, but a very good, friendly staff who were actually nicer than what you'd expect at a hipper cocktail lounge.  Drinks are pricey, but welcome to Chicago.  I visited at about 6pm on a Friday and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and multiple televisions.  I returned that same Friday at 11pm and endured the extremely loud house music now playing through the monster PA system.  It was too loud to have a conversation, but there was no dance floor.There a lot of great reasons to check out this hotel and I look forward to returning.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, brand new and classy
text: I was here for a wedding, so this is where everyone stayed.  The hotel is very recently remodeled, so probably still working on some kinks. Overall I'd say it's great - beautiful decor, walkable to everything in the heart of downtown, friendly staff, and cozy robes in the room!  My complaints are minor, but made enough of a difference that I wouldn't quite give the 5 star review - functionality in the room.  The in-room lights are weird, they go off on their own, probably to save energy, but didn't like having to keep turning back on. Also, not dimable which I do like to have. Other thing is the elevators - don't know what to call them, but again, falling victim to the 'too high tech.' I'd happily come back next time I'm in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great views, but a lot of kinks to work out
text: My husband and I spent the weekend at LondonHouse for our anniversary - a splurge from our usual hotel in the city.  Upon arrival, we were very impressed with the bell hops and the front desk team.  All were top notch, and eager to help.  From there, however, things were a bit disappointing.When we arrived on Friday, we found that the rooftop was closed due to the weather (misting all day).  When we found it was open on Saturday, we tried to go up prior to our dinner reservations, but sat through 4 full elevators before giving up (our room was on the 12th floor, and there was only 1 elevator going to 21).  We finally got up there on Saturday night -- the views werephenomenal.  Be prepared to pay for those views, though, as after a tip drinks will run you $20+ each.Speaking of overpriced drinks, skip the lobby bar.  We had some less than stellar vodka tonics, which the bartender didn't seem to care to make, for $16 a piece.The biggest frustration was breakfast.  3mornings, 3 different setups.  Saturday morning was an attempt at a menu, with a weak continental breakfast running $18, and a cup of coffee running you $6 (HHonors voucher covering $18).  The service was...well, there was no service because our server quit before bringing us anything.  The beverage manager did his best to help us, and that was appreciated because the restaurant manager was overwhelmed by the situation.  Sunday, we found the menu had been abandoned (per our server, the previous day was a "hot mess"), so we got a continental breakfast, coffee, and eggs for our voucher.  Monday morning, breakfast was on 2 instead of 21, with only continental breakfast available.  Doesn't Hilton have a template they can use?  4 months in, we didn't expect so much chaos on something so simple.  The Hampton Inn has a better breakfast than anything we saw during our stay.As for the room itself, the Jr. Suite, it was what you would expect for the price.  There was a Nespresso with 3 capsules.  For a suite, I would have liked to see 2 chairs/robes/towel hooks, though.  It seemed to cater to a single traveler.  Housekeeping was on their game, as the room was clean and inviting each day.This place wants to be exclusive, but if you can't figure out the service on the basics, it's not going to work.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice
text: This hotel was very nice and very beautiful.   The staff was very attentive to our needs.  The only real issue we had was that it took about 30 mins to bring our car from the valet service which made us late.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location but other issues deracted from experience
text: My wife and I decided to stay downtown (we live in the suburbs) to celebrate her birthday. I decided to surprise her with the hotel. After much research about hotels in the Michigan Ave. area I decided on this hotel. It had a great view, with the Vista Suite I booked. Among the best in the city, overlooking the river, and with a great skyline view. It's also very close to everything we wanted to do.Upon arrival, admittedly early, I was told the room wasn't ready yet but that a request to prepare it quickly would be made. An hour and 15 minutes later the room still wasn't ready. Of course I was annoyed, especially since I had been told the hotel was not sold out. If it had been my hotel and I knew a customer was waiting I probably would have immediately gone to prepare that room first, but that's just me.The suite was small, about 60 ft. larger than a vista room. I knew that when I booked but I still would have preferred a larger room. The view was great, as promised. Unfortunately, that didnot make up for the the fact that the flowers I had ordered for my wife's birthday were not in the room as I requested. When I complained the hotel sent up complimentary champagne and chocolate-covered strawberrys. Nice, but not what I requested.Additionally, sound travels very well through the hotel. We were there on  a weekend and heard music from the weddings hosted below both nights. Not a huge deal but evident even though we were 16 floors up. The other thing which was evident is that wherever the kitchen is-there really is not much of a restaurant on the premises-the smell of  grilling food permeated our room. I know this could sound good to some people and was okay for about the first hour, but after that it was annoying.Overall the weekend was great, despite the few problems that arose but I think I'll choose a different hotel next time

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Staff Needs an Attitude Adjustment
text: Beautiful hotel, but horrible experience with staff. Next to impossible to get a drink in a lobby with almost no one in it, was locked out of my room, housekeeping didn't clean my room... I could go on but you get the idea. Will be trying a different hotel on my return to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Do not waste your time with breakfast at this hotel
text: I'm a longtime and very loyal Hilton Honors member and stayed here for the weekend on business travel. They gave me complimentary continental breakfast and it was horrible. The service was horrible both days. They said they had a new menu the first day we were there and didn't get anyone's orders right. Not just my party but the five tables around us were wrong. We had to ask four times for salt and pepper. Food came out cold and would forget things like sausage or something that was supposed to come with it. I know I shouldn't complain about a comped breakfast, but we did pay to upgrade to the warm breakfast and it was a waste of money. We went back the second morning and just had the complimentary fruit, bread and yogurt and none of the wait staff came to ask if we wanted eggs or coffee for thirty minutes.  A couple next to us was shocked when they were charged $18.00 for such a small selection of food. The reason that I'm taking the time to write this review is that the management of this hotel needs to know this restaurant isn't ready to be functioning for guest yet. They have training and staffing issues that need to be addressed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Chicago
text: Just returned from 3 nights at the London House.  Great hotel, location and amenities.  Would highly recommend.  The rooftop bar is amazing.  Beautiful views of the city and River as well.  Overall a great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 5 stars for Abel
text: My experience staying here had a big part to do with the moment I waked in to check in. Abel was awesome so helpful and sweet. He is up at the front desk. If you can I would suggest asking for him to help you get checked in.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely and great location
text: A really lovely hotel, great location and very friendly staff. The rooms are clean  and well kitted out. No complaints at all! There's also a roof terrace on the 22nd floor but it was closed so unfortunately we didn't get to see it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fun Place to Stay
text: The Londonhouse is perfectly located for touring the city.  At East Wacker and Michigan, it is located at the beginning of the Magnificent Mile.  It is a block away from the architectural boat tour sponsored by the Chicago Architecture Foundation and an easy walk to Millennium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago.  We had a room with a spectacular view of the river - definitely worth the money.  The room was sleek, comfortable, and had everything we could want.  Do not miss the rooftop bar.  We had a late dinner there - food was delicious and the view well worth it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overnight
text: The staff were very friendly and helpful. I did  order room service which was great but pricey. My room was very clean! My bed was super comfortable. It rained pretty hard that night so cable was cut out several times. The view was amazing!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I'll never stay anywhere else
text: I just arrived today but I'm already so impressed. The service is excellent, the location is perfect, the rooms are so nice with gorgeous design and decor and the always comfortable Hilton beds. We have a corner room with killer views of the river and the lake off in the distance.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great weekend at a great hotel.
text: I give the total experience a 9. 10 on the following: 1) The staff was so friendly and helpful. 2) Room was perfect and the view was unbelievable. 3) The staff was very receptive that it was our anniversary and concierge sent up Chocolate covered strawberries üçì. Over all a 9 for the following: few suggestions: you might want to be more aware of people's special needs. 1) have hypo-allergenic pillows available. Some people (my wife) are allergic to real feather pillows. 2) ordered the lox and bagel off the door card. Kitchen only had everything bagel (doesn't specify what type of bagel on the door card) I can not have seeds so I couldn't eat the bagel. Had to go to corner bakery for a plain bagel so I could eat breakfast. Just thought I would let you know that I would have loved giving you a 10, but thought those two items were important.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice hotel!
text: With an ideal location and excellent accommodations, this hotel is a top choice for visiting Chicago! My only complaint would be the price of the drinks on the rooftop bar were excessive and the crowd was a little pretentious.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Another stunning new Chicago hotel
text: There's.a hotel renaissance in Chicago and the London House does not disappoint.Right on the river at the perfect location, accessible to both the loop and Michigan Ave. Great lobby, incredible rooftop and very well appointed rooms. I had the corner junior suite in the original building and preferred the space, layout and views to the Vista rooms. My only complaint are the elevators which don't have floor buttons inside the cars. You program at the floor and it directs you to the arriving car.
