The problem is other guests will enter the car and they cannot select their floor. I had to keep explaining to riders this elevator wasn't going to their floor. Very annoying.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel for a 10 year wedding anniversary celebration
text: This is a new property to the Hilton chain.  Our past visit has been hotel near the Chicago river and Michigan avenue.   The London house does not disappoint.  Live the location, we were checked into a corner room with a direct view of Michigan avenue and  the Chicago river.  Everything within walking distance and you just can't wrong.    The service is great, housekeeping made sure our 2 night stay had a spotless room.  The breakfast buffet is served on the 22nd floor but there is really no view.    Wished we could have enjoyed our breakfast with a view of the Chicago river.    The price charge for a room, we expected top notch service and they delivered.   Same level of service as our past stay at the former Conrad hotel.  I think there has already a lot said about the beautiful bathroom and spacious living area.   My only wish was more comfortable seating than 2 chairs in the sitting area.  We love the hotel, wish the food menu in the lobby has more of a selection..    but if you didn't see what you like, there are plenty of options at street level.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Boutique Hotel perfectly located
text: Perfect location and a more intimate setting for a lovely get away in town.  Easy walk to shopping and excellent restaurants. Only drawback was not having 24hr room service.  Enjoyed the lobby bar area and view of the river. Staff are professional and cordial. Nespresso maker in the room - started our day right.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Great location, fabulous rooms, and impeccable service! Checked in for a quick work trip and was beyond impressed with this hotel from start to finish. Check-in was quick and simple...The room was large and pristine. Large bathroom with modern finishes and a nice sized shower.  The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Would highly recommend and can't wait to stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel for the first time. Once I arrived at hotel front, bellman assisted me to elevator. When I tried to check in, there was issue (already past 4:00pm, but hotel system had issue to check). However, clerk did their best to check and kept updating me. For hotel room, it was so nice to stay/relax (good bed, nice view from room).I had good time here and would love to stay for next time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautifully done
text: They did a fantastic job renovating this old office building / historic landmark into a hotel. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are a little on the small side, and are in need of an another lamp or two (I was struggling to have enough light to work at night).  Lobby bar is swanky, rooftop bar and restaurant are amazing - views, views, views.  Great location on the SE corner of Michigan Ave and the river. Easily walk to restaurants, shopping, millennium park and the lake. That said, having lived in Chicago for 15 yrs, crossing the river in the winter can be a bit brisk ;-) Overall I found this hotel better for leisure travel than business. I'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pretentious.... customer service is not a priority
text: Let's start with the positives... amazing concierges in Shannon and Jose who really know the city and the places to go. Equally Abel on front desk who did his best to accommodate our early arrival at 3pm for a 4pm check in, and noticed our honeymoon which was rewarded with a complimentary glass of champagne.However, that was where the customer service stopped even as a diamond member of HHonors. An hour later a room was available, but no help with luggage or being shown to room which other guests seemed to get.Rooms are functional but not practical. We were in a vista suite, but embassy suites do better for room size. Best of knowledge would say that every room has shower only and they are warm at best.Customer service quite honestly sucks. You literally have to ask and chase for everything and have to say that whether or not you had HHonors status they really didn't care.The showcase is the 22nd floor outside bar. However, be warned if you want a table there is a $50 minimum per person and you have to prebook, seriously?!Continental breakfast is available which if you are gold or diamond is free but again service is lacklustre, every day it took at least 20 minutes for a latte! The hotel has a great location but they really need to refocus on customer service and realise that the customer is king, which right now they don't. Location is great, but there are cheaper alternatives and they need to be mindful of this. Unlikely to stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning hotel with an amazing view
text: We stayed here for a night while making a stop in Chicago Wednesday before heading to the upper peninsula of Michigan for a wedding. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful on our first visit to Chicago, giving suggestions on sights during our brief time.The room was beautiful, quiet, and had a great view of the river (minus the Trump building). Everything was perfect. One suggestion from the front desk was the rooftop bar on the 22nd floor. We decided to check it out upon arrival and were bummed to see it closed until noon. We came back and the views and service beyond made up for the bar being closed when we originally wanted to go. We were promptly greeted by Tim, who made us feel welcome with his quick and witty banter (apparently he's a standup comic in the city, it showed). He went over the drinks and suggested his favorites, which we took him up on. I had an old fashioned, and my wife had the Roaring Twenties. Both were amazing. The Old Fashioned had to have been one of the best I've had in a long time. We had duck fat fries, as well as some sort of cheese bread and a basic salad. All of them were amazing, and are great for sharing.The bill was what you'd expect for a downtown rooftop (we're from NYC, so it was actually less than expected), running around 100 for a few drinks each and the food. Our afternoon at the rooftop at London House will be something we remember for years to come, and will suggest all of our local family visits. If only Chicago's unpredictable weather didn't cut our visit short, as it started raining shortly after we finished our food. Overall, our experience at London House was amazing. Superb service, outstanding accommodations, and incredible views have got us doing something we've never thought of doing before; planning a long weekend vacation to Chicago. I can guarantee that we will be staying at London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Checking out, Very Different than Checking In!
text: We stay all over the world and are generous with our ratings, especially when we receive awesome service. We live locally in Chicago, but were staying at the LondonHouse while we hosted a senior executive conference and several attendees staying here as well. Everyone was wonderful checking in. Valet gave a special tip to us: parking is $71 overnight, but download SpotHero and pay $40, which we did. Thank you!  Bags brought to room, room was clean and like new. Small but furnished nicely. My wife ordered room service when I went to meeting and it took only 6 minutes.  Perfect. We had our meetings in one of there meeting rooms and my wife stayed in the room, and then requested a late check out, given that I was presenting and finished at 3:30. This was a Wednesday. They said they would charge $100 per hour for a later check out. So she said she would wait in lobby (on second floor) and dragged both of our bags down. Upon checkout, the front desk clerk said that my wife could store our luggage while she waited for me. HOWEVER, she would need to haul the luggage downstairs on her own to the bellman. My wife has fibromyalgia and a degenerative spine disease, but that did not matter to this clerk. So my wife sat near the front desk for two hours, until I saw my text and could excuse myself to help her. They were not short staffed, bellman waiting in a huddle on the first floor, but front desk would not ask for help. And this is the service for a family with a group that booked a block of rooms and a private event room. Very disappointing. We wont be booking our firm's holiday party here either (my wife was there to look at rooms) because of this experience upon departure. Thumbs up to valet staff, room service staff, housekeeping and the terrance bar staff (they allow you to sit at reserved tables until those with reservation arrive). Better for a quick drink up at the bar on 22 than a stay given other more service-oriented options nearby.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb Service
text: Beautiful River view room. All of the staff were highly professional, and handled all of our requests for restaurant, and tour reservations with ease. Be sure to visit the rooftop lounge. Fabulous view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Unique Classy Hotel
text: The hotel entrance on Wacker Drive is small and unassuming, however, the doormen are right there to take your luggage or hail a taxi.The lobby is on the second floor and has a contemporary vibe and offers your first view of the Chicago River with its many bridges.  There is a small bar located here and with comfortable sofas for people watching or reading.This hotel is really two buildings, an old ( totally renovated ) and a new,that are joined so well, you don't notice it   Our room was a Vista King on the 19th floor.  The bathroom was spectacular!  It was large with a glass enclosed shower, a marble topped sink, excellent lighting and a sliding frosted glass door for privacy.The room was good size with a platform king bed and no apparent drawer space. However, two large drawers are located in the platform itself. The closet also provides ample storage The room was quiet and there was great attention to detail in its design and furnishings.Let's face it, It's is all about the view here, since the river looks great day and night. It's too bad that Trump towers was directly across the way, but I got over that quickly Rooftop access is from floor 21 and then up several  of stairs.  The ambiance and view are not to be believed!  There is a fantastic lighted cupola from the original building, a view of Michigan avenue and its unique rooftops as well as a river view, both west and east to the lake .  Cocktails and a light appetizer selection are served here.The breakfast, not included in the room price, was a quite satisfying buffet of fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, breads and an egg omelet station . During the day and evening, this space  is a cocktail lounge  If you choose to eat elsewhere, there is a Corner Bakery Restaurant on the ground floor that serves breakfast and is open for lunch and dinner   There is no shortage of restaurants in the area This hotel is walking distance from many of the key sights such as Millenium Park, the Art Institute and Michigan Avenue. It is also a great location for a river walk Overall, the London House is an excellent value and an extremely enjoyable hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing service!
text: I stayed here for a business conference and was very impressed with the service. From the moment I arrived early, the service was exceptional.  The advanced elevator operation caught some off guard, but everyone mastered them by the second try. The food was very good and the view from the rooftop lounge is hard to beat. Perfect river view day or night. The ability to text the concierge was great and they checked in several times a day to see if I needed anything. I asked for a Diet Mountain Dew, but they didn't have one in the building. The closest place was a 7-11 which was a 25 minute walk round trip. I was blown away to find 4 of them perfectly chilled in my room refrigerator when I returned that afternoon. I stay in several upscale hotels and resorts every year. None have gone to that extent to make sure my stay was perfect. When I shared my experience with others in the group, I learned several had similar experiences where employees of the hotel went above and beyond to guarantee a great experience. I can't wait to return with my family!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Close to Everything
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse for a work conference and loved it so much that I am going back later this month to stay for fun.  It is located close to just about everything you would want to go to downtown.  Great restaurants, outdoor activities, shopping.  The hotel is very well maintained.  The rooftop bar is a great perk with a good view of the river and the rest of the downtown buildings.  I would recommend checking out the rooftop area first thing in the morning if you get a chance.  It is a very peaceful way to start the day.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect!
text: Stayed here this passed weekend for anniversary/game trip. We had a corner room which was huge. The river view wasn't great, but you could still see it. They have a texting program set up, which is great! They even brought us Champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries. Great service, great rooms, great location!They have a fridge in the room which is great too. My only suggestions is a microwave to heat up those delicious Chicago leftovers :)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel in a great area
text: The LondonHouse is a great hotel in a really good idea along the Chicago RiverWalk and Michigan Ave.  The rooms are very nice, but the crown jewel is the rooftop bar.  Amazing views and great service - if you visit the hotel, definitely take the time to enjoy a drink on the rooftop.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent stay
text: I was hesitant after reading some bad reviews but my stay at Londonhouse was perfect. Chicago is a halfway point between my mother and I, so we met here for the weekend. I was able to check in early upon arrival with a beautiful river view facing trump tower, a few floors down from the room I chose on my HHonors app. This was fine with me as I had checked in nearly 4 hours early. Valet went smoothly with my mothers vehicle. Hotel interior is beautiful. We visited the rooftop bar around 1pm for mimosas (although they were pricey) you couldn't beat the view and at that time of day the roof was empty. We also visited after dinner (around 11pm) and were able to skip the line as hotel guests. It was very young and hip and even had a fire in the corner as it got chilly at night. Our room was gorgeous and modern. I felt extremely comfortable at this hotel from my room to amenities at the hotel to their customer service. Londonhouse will be my new "home away from home" whenever I visit Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Location, Iconic Building !
text: The Hilton Curio LondonHouse is a fantastic addition to the upper Hotel Segment in Chicago. Location at the Michigan Av and directly at the river could not be better. The Hotel provides excellent interior design in the colours of the Chicago style. The best amenity and probably the future usp is the Roof top terrace providing fantastic views to the Chicago CBD and down the Illinois river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel at a great price
text: What a pleasant surprise this hotel turned out to be! I was only staying there one night and looking for a deal so I searched of the Hilton Honors website for hotels in the area I need it. This one was only $155 a night and in a great location so I scooped it up. I was not disappointed.As soon as I got out of the Uber, a friendly bellhop asked if I needed any help and directed me towards the second floor check in area. Once I arrived there, the staff was very friendly and checked me in quickly. They were kind enough to change the room I picked out on the Hilton app to one with a much better view. And it was a fabulous view (except for the name Trump right across the river).The room was spacious yet cozy. The bed was very comfortable. They had nice soap and hair products in the bathroom and even a loofah. The location is perfect. You're just a short walk away from Millennium Park, Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier, the Magnificent Mile, the John Hancock Center and much more. I had a great day and would highly recommend it to a friend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: NOT your typical Hilton...
text: Had a short stay in Chicago and wanted something that was nice but also convenient to Union Station and also the Magnificent Mile area.  The London House is a perfect location that is convenient to the "loop" and the "mile".   Outstanding service, and a beautiful property.  Definitely not your typical "business" Hilton.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Hilton, Chicago Illinois
text: Loved this hotel! Beautiful rooms, outstanding service, central location. Will definitely return in the future with my husband. The only problem was I found the internet to be a little bit inconsistent, but this was workable.  The staff were ready to serve at every turn...and did so with clear training and recognition of their value to the organization.  The room was nice, large, comfortable, pretty, with a great view of the water with water taxis and the TRUMP hotel across the street.  Easy walk to any locations for dinner.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful but...No Way!
text: Positive: the hotel and room were lovely Cons: I have never stayed in a hotel and be that high up and still hear every single thing going on outside...we were on the 18th floor but were awake all night 1. Because although on the 18 th floor the windows are not sound proof and 2. you can hear EVERYTHING even the street traffic. I don't think the fire engines ever get cut off. The vent over the door cuts on and off every 3 minutes or so and sounds like a vacuum cleaner is being run when the room is finally quiet. So now you have to fight through that noise. Then around midnight there was some party or something going on above us. I called the front desk who said security would check it out. The noise still didn't stop until about 3:30am two hours after I called  and no follow up call either. The next day Sunday I went to the front desk and was told it was a Trump protest. I said playing music? There was no talking just music vibrating through our room on the 18th floor. I asked if we moved would it be more quiet or all the rooms not sound proof? She didn't know. So, basically all the rooms are equally noisy. No need to move if the noise can still be heard from the streets. So, we kept our room. Because we were up all night, we slept most of the day. We left the room and requested the room be cleaned around 5. We came back to our room about 10:30 the room hadn't been touched. I called customer service who said she would leave a message for the house keeping supervisor. Nothing happened and still no one came. We didn't even bother on Monday, since we were leaving at 3am to catch an early flight. Overall aesthetically it's a nice hotel but pretty busy and noisy on the first floor and that may be due to the popular rooftop and restaurant. I just expected a better level of service and we didn't get it.  I like to think of my room as an escape from the Hustle and bustle but no such luck, this go around. The level of noise and service is not worth it. Especially with so many other options at a fraction of the cost and better noise quality and service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent
text: Perfect location and warm, friendly and helpful staff. Very comfortable room at the front overlooking the river and Magnificent mile. Close to most attractions. Iconic top floor bar (busy because it is iconic). Very good experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooms
text: The room originally assigned to us was so small you could not turn around.  The bed was behind a wall with only the bed and a large screen television.  We asked for a different room. For an additional $35 we got a room with a direct view of the Trump name on the hotel across the street.  The room was noisy and the air conditioner blew air directly on the bed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Stay
text: We loved everything about this hotel! The location was perfect; close to Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier and train station.  We were on the 16th floor with an incredible view of the river and downtown. The staff was friendly and very attentive.  Loved that they sent us a text to check in to see how our room was, and we could text with a question and they responded within minutes. Room was gorgeous with more than enough space for the two of us. We were there for our anniversary and the staff left a card and chocolate covered strawberries in our room. Would highly recommend LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new place
text: We stayed at this Hilton location for a couples weekend get away.  It is situated in a great location in downtown Chicago, walking distance to all that one needs to do and see.  The rooms were clean and spacious and the staff all have that winning attitude that made the stay worth while.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel
text: This is a new addition to the Chicago list of hotel - very nice hotel right in the heart of the city.- rooms are apcious and well appointed - the staff is very friendly and attantive.- I would reommend this hotel to anyone coming to Chicago

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Stay with good value
text: As a HHONORS gold member, I saw the high reviews of this hotel and booked it for a 4 night stay.  I got an excellent price.  Arriving I was welcomed as a Gold member, but did not receive my two bottles of water (I forgot to remind the staff).  I did, however, receive my complimentary breakfast coupons.  We got a room overlooking Chicago river.  It was a luxurious, but tiny room - basically enough room for the king sized bed, one chair and a little desk.  The air conditioner was soooo quiet.  The TV was gigantic and the bathroom was lovely.  The complimentary bath products were wonderful.  The bed was so comfortable and didn't have any lumps in it.  The breakfast was outstanding.  Made-to-order omelettes, chocolate croissants, fruit, fresh squeezed juices and strong coffee.  The location is close to many parts of Chicago and you can just walk to many places, however, Wrigley Field may be a bit too far.  The hotel is very close to the elevated train, so you can come directly from the airport and not get a car (parking is $71/night at the hotel!).  The front desk was a bit off-putting.  When I went to retrieve my water, they wanted to first verify I was a Gold HHONORS member.  I understand others may not be eligible, but it's two bottles of water!  I recommend the front desk rethink having the guests prove they are GOLD - at least until they remember to give the water out at check-in.  The staff in the breakfast area was outstanding.  Personable, efficient, and willing to get you items even though it was self-serve.  I do, however, recommend that a process be put in place to retrieve the complimentary breakfast coupons.  One server would take them and others would ask for them.  They always believed us that we have given them to someone else, but this happened every morning, so it is something to improve in.I don't normally stay in luxury hotels.  I now see the difference.  The only thing that would have made it perfect is if we had gotten an upgrade to something slightly larger.  But for the price I paid, I was more than satisfied.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel at a wonderful location
text: Londonhouse Chicago is a wonderfully located hotel on the River. Rooms are spacious and modern. Beautiful views of the river and lake. Cross the bridge and you are on the magnificent mile. Staff were friendly. Internet connectivity was good. Would recommend this property if one wants to stay downtown.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My stay at Curio Hilton
text: excellent hotel, good location, very convenient to shopping and close by train station. will be back to stay in this hotel definitely.  The room is clean and quite spacious , is very comfortable for those require more space for their stay

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: NEW and hip hotel near the Magnificent Mile
text: I stayed one night at the LondonHouse Hotel on business in August of 2016. The hotel is located in the business district at the corner of Wacker Dr. and Michigan Ave., which makes it ideal for walking along the riverfront, catching a show at The Chicago Theatre, or exploring the Magnificent Mile on foot.The hotel offers valet service for around $72, but you could park in a nearby public parking garage for around $56. When you enter the hotel you must go up the elevator or flight of stairs to the check-in counter. The reception area is beautiful and brand new, and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The lobby offers plenty of seating and a full bar with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Chicago River. This allows for a lot of natural light. My room was on the 8th floor facing south, so I lacked the nice view of the river. Like every room in the hotel, it was a non-smoking room, and included free WiFi, a flat screen TV, and spacious workstation. It lacked a spacious closet. The room also had a mini-fridge and safe. My room in particular had a very comfortable king size bed and nightstand with a cool, retro looking alarm clock. The bathroom had a large, full-length mirror, which was great for getting ready for work. The bathroom also had a stand-up glass shower and vanity mirror, complimentary towels, toiletries, and hair dryer. The hotel has a 24-hour fitness center, spa, meeting rooms, a grand ballroom, and a one-of-a-kind rooftop terrace and bar with great food and pricey cocktails ($20 for a mixed drink). It can get crowded, but show your keycard, and you won't have to wait togain access to the rooftop. People do dress up when going to this bar in the evening. Everything is relatively close. Walk across the street to the Chicago River, where you can hop on a boat tour or walk the riverfront to Navy Pier. Walk Michigan Ave. north to the Magnificent Mile for all of the hottest shopping. Take an Uber south to the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum, and Soldier Field. It's all at your fingertips from this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel
text: this is an outstanding hotel, great service, gorgeous facility and very nice rooms.  Conference rooms and food were very good, nothing cold or overcooked.  Bar was very pretty, great service and excellent food

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Hotel
text: The LondonHouse hotel exceeded our expectations for both location and views...not to mention the beautiful, well appointed room. I would highly recommend a vista suite. The view from our window was spectacular, we were able to see far down Wacker (which runs parallel to the river). From our room we were able to enjoy  both the sunrise and sunset! Check in and check out went smoothly...the "front desk" is actually on the second floor of the property. We loved the boutique feeling of this hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pricey but worth every penny!
text: This hotel is amazing, from the exceptional staff to the high quality of the room. Did I forget to mention the views from my room,  breathtaking. Top floor corner room looking West onto the Chicago river. Couldn't ask for better. It's a bit pricey as I mentioned in the title, but it's so worth it. I will be staying here my next trip to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House
text: Stunning, central location, with great views and easy walking distance of more shops than you could possibly imagine! Hotel staff are extremely welcoming and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble - more coat hangers, towels etc........

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Location
text: Fantastic hotel, little pricey, but you should know that before you book.  The location was perfect with great views.  Great amenities with the rooftop, lounges and club,  Being 2 blocks from the train station is huge for the weekend warriors coming in from the burbs.  Staff was extremely friendly, though the lower lounge was a little slow.  We were in no hurry so it didn't much matter.  Rooms were well done and extremely comfortable.  Had a normal room with PLENTY of space.  Strongly recommend this hotel if you have the means.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel just recently opened...they are doing everything right to set a trend of high service.  The staff uses current technology to contact you via text to make sure everything is going well.  The staff personally asks you as you see them daily on the property if the can assist you in any way...Great Staff...great location...great place to stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Visited for my husbands bday
text: We stayed 2 nights here and from the moment we checked in they were awesome. They gave us complimentary breakfast for my husbands bday and later that night delivered chocolate covered cherries, water, and a card to the room. The views from the rooftop bar were amazing although the drinks are a little pricey. $23 for a glass of wine and a beer. My only complaint would be that they don't have a microwave in the room or anywhere at the hotel for you to use. We ordered pizza the first night and half of it went to waste. Other than that I have no complaints and would definitely visit again. Room 929 had a great view of the water and was beautiful at night!!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: In teh middle of all the action and a great Rooftop Bar
text: Found a last minute deal and stayed at this brand new hotel right on the Chicago River across from the Wrigley Building during Labor Day Weekend. Rooms were larger than most downtown hotels with large bathrooms.  Beds and room climate were very comfortable.  Parking is expensive ($71 per night), but not really the hotel's fault.  All downtown Chicago parking is expensive.  As a guest, we had preferred entrance to the rooftop bar which is well worth the price of the well crafted cocktails.  Most theaters, Grant Park and shopping are all within an easy walk.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing hotel to wind down
text: I stayed at the Chicago LondonHouse by coincidence on a work trip and it was a treat. The rooms are very comfortable with modern decor, comfortable bedding and nice touches such as Nespresso machines in every room. The lobby/lobby bar decor are beautiful. Unfortunately it was raining while I visited so I wasn't able to see the rooftop bar.I would highly recommend for anyone needing to be downtown in Chicago for a work trip or someone looking for a comfortable and stylish stop on a weekend trip to Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chic and with a formal style!
text: Stayed last week as a first time I would say that loved the concept. The room was very spacious, bed very comfortable, bathroom big and nice amenities. The was great! I would recommend no to ask for a room in upper levels as there is a bar at the roof and lots of people going up. I chose one in the corner at 6th floor. it was quiet and had a great view. I will totally nook this one again as it is in downtown and close to subway station.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hilton Property in the Loop
text: This is one of the newest "hip" places to be in Chicago. The rooftop bar is amazing, and the hotel staff are fantastic. I have stayed here several times, and never been disappointed. There is a text service upon check in, and if you ever need anything during your stay, just text and whatever you need is handled, or delivered to your door. The continental breakfast on the 21st floor is high quality, especially for a complimentary buffet, although the selections are a little slim. The bath and shower products are high quality as well, I love the peppermint shampoo and bay rum body wash. This is a very modern, hi tech establishment, in a premier location, with excellent service and amenities. Highly recommend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Hotel, But a Few Service Issues
text: New, dramatically designed, and at a great location...not a bad start!  Add-in a good staff and the hotel manages to be both modern and welcoming at the same time.  This is a winner for downtown Chicago.Strong recommendation for the Vista King rooms as they face the river and bridges with floor to ceiling windows.  They must have used airplane glass as the room was silent even though we faced Wacker Drive.Our experience with the concierge was hit or miss, with one being fantastic and the other appearing to approach the job as a chore.  When we asked the first for a dinner recommendation he asked about our preferences and referred us to a spectacular Peruvian rooftop dinner.  Same question to the second received a curt "Here you go" as he handed us a pre-printed list of 20+ restaurants in the area (it dd not include the previous Peruvian option).The elevators were the other issue.  When there is a wedding or event, the service becomes very slow.  We were told by two different employees (waiting with us at the time) that on the weekends a wait of 5 minutes for the elevator was not uncommon.Annoying, but certainly not enough to keep us from coming back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Book this property !
text: Fantastic hotel !  Location, staff, and the building were amazing. I would recommend this property 100%. Nothing was missed on this stay. The concierge staff was awesome. We had a fellow by the name of Jose helping us and he was all class and made our stay great

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing Hotel & Location
text: The hotel is outstanding and the staff and service are what gives this hotel a Five STAR rating! The attention to detail by the valet, bell service, concierge, front desk, housekeeping and wait staff is simply fabulous! Wish I could go back tomorrow

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel!
text: This is probably the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. The lobby and the room itself were beautiful. We had a great view of the river, and it was super affordable compared to our other options. We were right where we wanted to be in terms of sightseeing. Our only regret was that we didn't pack for the rooftop bar - after a certain time the dress code is business casual, and we had more touristy attire. We still went up to see the view but didn't stay. Definitely recommend staying here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice New Chicago Addition!
text: Stayed at the LondonHouse Chicago in August 2016.  This is a beautiful new hotel in the Chicago area. Very nice views of the city (see my pics of views from my room); comfortable rooms with beds that sleep oh so nice!  There is a restaurant and bar area on the roof over looking the river- oh my!  The weather was great so imagine the view.  There is no better location - across from the river, steps away from the start of the Magnificent Mile on Michigan Ave, very close to great restaurants and shopping.  The staff was so very nice and accommodating.  I will definitely stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: All the amenities in the best location
text: This modern and efficiently run swanky hotel was perfect for this particular traveler!  From the grey and black smartly decorated room to the crisp white and black bathroom with all the latest features. No detail was overlooked. The staff was attentive and helpful. Definitely a place to stay again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best hotel stay
text: The staff was amazing. The style and design of the hotel is beautiful. Very clean. Best location in the city to get to everywhere. We brought our children. For children, we recommend a room with view of the river. So dynamic and beautiful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. A little pricier than some of the other hilton brands, but very worth the little extra money.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: State of the Art
text: From the moment you enter the London House, you are greeted with State of the Art technology and friendship.  The Front Desk assistant (Karen) was exceptionally helpful and upgraded my room for my situation.  The location is top notch and in the center of most everything I needed.  The two of us were extremely impressed with how neat and clean the Hotel rooms and environment are.  Congrats on a wonderful renovation of a Chicago Landmark.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a Great Find !
text: We loved everything about the Londonhouse (except for the parking rates). It was a perfect location for everything my wife and I wanted to do. The staff went above and beyond-- especially Markas. The lobby and rooms had a modern and inviting feel. The outdoor bar on the 33rd floor was spectacular. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay in Chicago. The only negative was the cost of parking. The valet and staff were very accommodating and excellent to deal with.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Manager
text: Murphy is a gem!!  He is the BEST door man at this hotel. He is friendly, responsive, helpful and provides great customer service. I will definitely book future business trips at this hotel. Thanks Murphy!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel and rooftop
text: This hotel was extremely clean, as it is brand new. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. And the views! Omg. It was amazing, especially for the price we paid per night. We had a vista room and had the most perfect view of the river and bridges. We visited the rooftop at 2pm (no reservations) on a Thursday and the staff were super friendly and unpretentious. The vibe might be different at night time, but I have nothing but good things to say about our day time visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Pearl Jam Concert
text: My boyfriend and I found this hotel online and were so impressed with it. Its in a great location, its very modern and up to date, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was beautiful and very nicely kept. The rooftop bar was so neat but very pricey. The view was worth it though! Would love to return

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel with excellent location
text: Hotel has very modern decor and its clean. Rooms are clean and great decor, if they are not full you can ask for upgrade or river view rooms. We stayed in standard King bed room with a river view but i heard vista rooms are nicer. Our room was great big bathroom, clean, bed and pillows were comfy. Awesome 55 inch TV and has chrome cast built in you can stream any app you might have with free wifi. Room was bit small compared to other places ive stayed but i didtn care since it was just two of us. Nespresso coffee maker was nice touch and smart fridge. Two bars one on second floor where you check in with great views and of course the 3 tier roof top. No preference given to people who stay there but again lot of people who stay there go up there. Great views from top go there at least once. Location is great right on Mag Mile and across from river north bars, restaurant and next to river walk. If you like night life this is a great location. If you park here its $70 per night but you can use Spothero or other app to find cheaper parking. Have fun

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The Room 930 is weird
text: Good overall but again the room assigned to us is weird. The location is excellent. But there was difficulty for us to get to the rooftop. I think the hotel guest should have premium access to the rooftop instead of being in line with other partiers.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice stay
text: Great rooms and beds. A good bed and a nice clean bathroom are 99% of the reason you stay in a hotel and they got it rightThe service and prices for lounges and restaurants are below average, but when you are in the greatest city in the world why would you eat or drink in your hotel Go out and enjoy the city Good place to stay reasonable room rates and excellent rooms and location. Highly recommend

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful new hotel, excellent service and amazing views of the Chicago River
text: The LondonHouse is a new hotel conveniently located on Wacker Drive/Michigan Avenue, right along the Chicago River.  We stayed in one of the Vista rooms on the 20th floor that had floor to ceiling windows.  The views were spectacular.  The hotel was impeccably clean and so nice.  I love the fact that they saved floor space by having drawers in the bottom of the beds - genius!  The bathrooms could have been re-thought a little because the sliding door made a lot of noise and I was always worried about waking my friend in the middle of the night.  Also, the hotel seemed to have elevator issues during our trip - it seemed like there was constantly only one or two working out of six.  If you are a Hilton HHonors member, opt for the continental breakfast instead of points - it's worth it.  The breakfast included the most wonderful coffee, yogurt, fruit, pastries and an omelet station.  I look forward to staying at the LondonHouse again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location, Location, Location! Amazing Hotel!
text: By far my best stay in the Windy City. LondonHouse is within walking distance of everything you want to see in Chicago! The hotel itself is lovely - modern and updated rooms in a historic building. The rooms even have Chromecast so you can stream your own shows/movies from your devices if you'd like! My room had a great view of the river.The night of my stay, I enjoyed some quiet working time in the lobby where there are tons of little seating areas. Then - off to walk Michigan Ave for food and shopping! The river stroll is perfect as well.Once I walked and shopped til my feet hurt, I headed back to the hotel and up to the LH Rooftop for a cocktail. The bartenders were super friendly and made me the perfect whiskey sidecar to sip while taking in the best view of the Chicago skyline. Make a reservation if you want a great seat. I didn't -- but still had a lovely time milling about.If you stay in Chicago, LondonHouse is a must. I recommend taking the train from O'Hare. It is an easy jaunt to the hotel from Clark/Lake and you can grab a coffee or bite on the way. Then take the train or Uber while you are in the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Not your normal Hilton Hotel... better!
text: Four-night stay as a Hilton Honors member.  Stayed in room on 20th floor with amazing view of the river,centrally located at Wacker and Michigan Avenue.  All the amenities of a much more expensive hotel, friendly and helpful staff.   Rooftop bar is a must see!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Brave New World
text: Only a twenty minute walk from Amtrak Station or a $7 taxi ride, @LHChicago was the right place at the right time to enjoy Labor day weekend. The polite and professional staff were very accommodating throughout our stay. The beautiful and unflappable #LHRooftop gatekeeper was very kind in allowing us early access to the "standing-in-line" popular bar because of our Hilton guest(s) status. There may not be a better location anywhere: @Mortons, @McandSchmicks, @HRCChicago, and @HOBChicago, just to name a few, are all within a walking 270 degree perimeter; @artinstitutechi is less than a 25 away on foot.There are ample taxis and tour buses at the ready across the front street. Michigan Avenue, State Street and Wacker triangulate for perfect walking tours and people watching. The high-speed internet in the spacious and post modern 2nd floor lobby allowed for easy access to Facebook, Twitter, Google and other platforms. The baroque chic room and incredibly romantic river view was beyond compare. Our ergonomic bed facilitated comfortable left side/right side sleep disparities - we both slept like babies.With the jumbo Samsung Flatscreen TV beautifully mounted on a stark black background, we could have easily been at an old-fashioned Drive-In Movie. Kudos to @HiltonWorldwide

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel is great but the parking is a nightmare!
text: Once you arrive at the hotel, everything is great but trying to valet park a car, which is the only option they give you, is a complete nightmare on top of the ridiculous $71 per night they charge you to park.  The staff is very nice and the hotel itself is great.  They just need to fix the parking issues and price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend with my wife. We arrived early Saturday and dropped by to check in and drop our bags off. I figured our room wouldn't be ready. The gentlemen behind the counter said  they would give us a call when the room was ready. When they called, however, he had some bad news for me. Our room was having some issues with power and they needed to move us rooms. We had booked a Vista room with views of the river, but since none were available they put us in a suite on the other side of the building and comped us for part of the night's stay, which I thought was fair. The next day we packed our bags up and went out for the day. When we got back they had moved us into a real nice Vista suite. I thought they handled that situation really well and we were both happy with the outcome. The rest of the hotel was great as well. We had some drinks and food at the second floor bar that we really enjoyed. And of course, the rooftop bar was outstanding. You can't beat the views from up there. We went Saturday afternoon for a drink and Sunday night. I really enjoyed seeing the view both during the day and evening. Overall this hotel was great. It's in a great location, has some really nice amenities, and the staff does a great job. Would definitely recommend staying here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Labor Day Weekend
text: Solid 8 out 10.PROS:- Good service/friendly staff- fun rooftop lounge- centrally located downtown- decent rates for a holiday weekend (Thanks HHonors rates!)- good room size- great views from vista roomsCONS:- worst elevators. I've seen this done at other hotels and quite successfully, but it's really not working for LondonHouse. Incredibly slow and WAY too jam-packed for the number of elevators they do have. - rooms are not soundproof. Noise from hallways prevalent at all hours of the night (doors slamming, people talking, the elevators running and dinging, etc)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent staff, service and decor
text: Hotel has wonderful beds, food was great, staff was superior. this hotel has a great location and exceptional facilities.  Meetings were serviced and staffed exceptionally. Nice and I will return to this location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very pleased
text: The main reason we pucked this hotel was the rooftop bar. I was very pleased that they let the hotel guest in without a wait! We didnt eat there went just for cocktails it was a beautiful view of downtown Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Riverwalk and Spectacular Views
text: Londonhouse is a very posh and hip hotel for mostly 30 somethings. Very modern and vert clean. It seemed everyone was rushing to get to the roodtop. We're bummed we didn't get a chance to hang out up there.The staff is great. They were very helpful in holding our luggage while we toured the city before our room was ready. Pros: large tv, great location, helpful staff, beautiful views, and very comfortable bedsCons: slow elevators, room was still not ready at 4 (check-in). As Hilton Honors members, my husband and I expected our room ready on time at the latest.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Stay-cation
text: What a lovely place to stay and enjoy the city, just steps from the Riverwalk and all the River North Restaurants. Staff was wonderful, nothing but smiles, and the hotel itself is beautiful. Will go back again! (And again, and again!)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful night
text: Having seen pictures of the LondonHouse on Twitter/Instagram, we chose it for a one night stay before a concert at Pritzker Pavilion. Check-in was efficient and the staff took care by placing us on the 19th floor. The room was spacious and beautiful. I particularly loved the faux-wall behind the TV and a very modern style. The view down the river was jaw-dropping.The bed was amazingly comfortable and the shower pressure heavenly.I will absolutely choose the LondonHouse for another stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning New Hotel--Worth trying, Greal location
text: This new hotel is really beautiful.  The d√©cor is tasteful and modern, it has a fantastic second floor bar in addition to a rooftop bar overlooking a fantastic view of downtown Chicago.  It is just across from Trump Tower and river, and a few blocks from Pier area. One thing to note if you are DRIVING TO THIS LOCATION.....DO NOT TYPE IN "LOWER" WACKER into mapquest or google maps. This will take you on a circular journey below the hotel areas.  Just use the name of the hotel or 85 E Wacker.  Also, it is very expensive to park.  We tried Spot Hero for the first four hours at $18 and then decided to do $71 per day since we were only there two days.  The rooms are very clean and amenities are nice except there was no creamer provided with the Nespresso.  The six elevator banks did not seem to work in a timely fashion as each use was a minimum of a five minute wait.  A few things to be aware of but otherwise my family enjoyed a very nice stay and this beautiful new hotel!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience
text: The entire experience was great.      I have stayed at the hotel in 2 prior occasions and have 2 more scheduled.     I enjoy the location, the staff, the room, the location   Several people from my company stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location with great outdoor rooftop bar
text: I am SO glad I chose this hotel.  Perfect location at corner of Michigan Avenue and Wacker Drive.  Terrific views from outdoor rooftop bar.  I used Hilton points and it was a very simple process.  Very nice room.  I would stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Location
text: I recently stayed at The London House for several days on business. Loved the location as it was very easy to access the city from this address. Although the room was somewhat small, it was perfectly adequate for 1 person. The bed was very comfortable and my room was kept very clean. Bathroom was very nicely designed and appointed. I do find hotels that place their checkin areas on the 2nd floor somewhat strange. On the 21st floor there is a bar over looking the river and the city which is a must on a nice evening at sunset. I was put off by the parking fees $70 per night and was able to find self parking in a garage, a couple of blocks away for 1/2 the price. I thought NYC was expensive for parking, but Chicago hotels are keen on hitting up both the tourists and business visitors to pay exorbitant fees. You can do better by using some mobile apps such as Best Parking. I would definitely prefer staying at the London House than paying even more $$ to the oversized narsiccistic ego maniac who has a hotel right across the river and his named blazoned across the exterior for everyone to see.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel and Fabulous Staff
text: This new hotel is beautiful and in a great location.  I had a "vista" room that had floor-ceiling windows overlooking the river and bridges.  Room was very spacious with a separate sitting area.  All of the staff are exceptional - Brandon and Shannon outdid themselves in providing for a special request I had...Thank you!!  The only downside is the elevator system - became very slow on the weekend when the hotel was full and in general seems to need the kinks worked out.  But, not to take away from the very pleasurable stay - definitely will stay there when I am in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in great location
text: All staff was friendly and helpful.  The person checking us in made our request for river view room happen.  She even ask about our stay later in the week when we passed at the elevators.  (Didn't get her name) Bar tender makes a great old fashion.  Hotel location is great for river walk access and tours.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: DISAPPOINTMENT ON MIRACLE MILE
text: There was potential here but I don't see how  the hotel  will survive.    The staff is exceedingly well meaning but  they haven't been properly trained.  Two out of three days the AC was down for hours.    Twice in three days I had to walk down twelve flights after waiting fifteen minutes.   There was no maid service until six o'clock and only after I called about it.  The continental breakfast comes in portions fit for a doll house.   Waitresses dropping trays, spilling coffee.    Again, staff very solicitous; asking how they can help but then they forget to bring what you've requested.    The elevator is like a Ouije board;  it's probably very sensible approach programming elevators where they are needed most.   But much of the time, there isn't service.  From the much vaunted rooftop bar (cover charge $125 per person), we had to walk down two flights to find an elevator.    The maid ran out of toiletries before she got to my room.  On the plus side, while the rooms aren't spacious, they are efficiently and elegantly designed with good quality furnishings and  fixtures.   No doubt they will be ripped out and sold at auction after the property goes into liquidation.   A shame because the potential was here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A hidden gem!
text: You could walk right past the hotel along the river and not know the beauty it holds.  The hotel brings you back in time with the classic decor and even keeping some of the original building decor.The elevator and room lighting technology was top notch. The rooms were spacious and had plenty of room. The soaps and shampoo smelled amazing!The rooftop bar has a great view, but with limited seating and covering.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning roof top bar
text: Gorgeous room with large luxurious bath room and spectacular views.  Hotel staff are very helpful and easy on the eyes.  Roof top bar/restaurant is a must see.  The experience and views are fantastic. Hotel location is primo (even if it does look at the garish "TRUMP" building).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Poor communication with guests, dealership type treatment
text: Rooftop staff are not very professional and treat hotel guests as though they are selling you cars at some dealership. Conflicting information is given to guests by staff. Breakfast food quality is not great yet very pricey.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location and Vibe for Chicago
text: Really enjoyed this ideal location for Chicago.  Easy to walk to see major sights and a quick walk to the Loop.  Rooftop bar has beautiful views and is one of the current "happening" places in Chicago.  As a guest, you have quicker access to getting into a very fun and popular place to have great cocktails.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Location for Tourists
text: My wife and I selected this property because we enjoy staying at Hilton Curio collection hotels and the location was ideal. We traveled to Chicago by AmTrak from New Orleans, a short taxi ride from Union Station to the London House. Located on the Chicago  River Walk, not far from Navy Pier, Andy's Jazz Club, the Untitled Supper Club, and literally across the street from McCormick Bridgehouse Museum. Room was well appointed, great king size  bed, big screen TV, Nespresso machine. Be sure to venture to the rooftop bar on 21st floor for view to die for.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful location and great rooms with a few glitches
text: The view from the Vista rooms along the Chicago River is spectacular, and the rooms are spacious and elegant. Location is perfect for tourists. Bed was comfortable, and all the usual amenities were top-drawer.  The room I booked smelled of smoke and Brandon at reception quickly found me another one and gave me passes for breakfast as compensation.  Other staff members were equally friendly and helpful.  Glitches:  Only one hook to hang towels and clothes in the bathroom; Nespresso machine but no tea bags in the room, and the elevators worked well only two out of the four days we were there.  The rooftop bar was fun, but expensive.  The second floor lobby bar was more relaxed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a find....Great location, wonderful hotel
text: Decided to spend two nights on Magnificent mile because of scheduled meetings in the area.  We opted to try the LondonHouse because of its link as a Curio Collection to Hilton.  Thanks to Jesse at the front desk, we were able to check in a bit early and my diamond status got us a lovely corner room which was outstanding. Great bed, nice furnishings, great shower and very spacious.  We went up to the rooftop for drink and enjoyed the spectacular view.  Breakfast is more than adequate in terms of choices.  Can't beat the location.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hotel with benefits of being new but few of the glitches of being new
text: We are loyal  to the Hilton brand and were excited to try this new boutique location.  It doesn't have a typical Hilton 'vibe" and the contemporary setting was a lot of fun. But most importantly, the attention from the staff, the amenities, and surroundings were all first class. A special thank-you goes to Effy who was managing, very expertly and smoothly, the late Friday afternoon traffic flow at the popular rooftop bar. It was a surprise for my husband and me, but the visit to the bar ended up being a happy family event, and Effy could not have been more helpful, gracious, and professional. Actually, all of the staff we came in contact with during our weekend were professional yet eager to please if at all possible.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Totally Classy
text: Really best experience I've had in Chicago.  If you want a pool- try Blu Aqua for your stay.  Roof top lounge - elegant rooms- Stay at LondonA new hotel- so good deals. .................Forget boutique Hotels- often nickel & dime U.  For London use Hilton app

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Romantic Night Away.
text: My wife and I spent one night at the LondonHouse Chicago. It was almost a perfect stay, so I'll start my review with what I loved. First of all location, Location, LOCATION! Wow what a perfect place to stay when visiting a world class city. I did check in online, however my room was not ready so I went to the front desk and Laurelei provided me with another room with a perfect view. Interestingly if my room I asked for was ready I would not have had to stop by the front desk, a key and room number would have been provided via the Hilton Honors App. The view from my room on the 6th floor was great but if you want to be amazed visit the 21st, 22nd and 223rd floors. This is where we had breakfast and enjoyed a view from the rooftop bar. The line was a little long at happy hour on Friday so I would recommend making the rooftop bar an early stop weather permitting. I only had one problem with this property, the shade in the bathroom was broken and I would have loved the view. The Room was small but perfect for the two of us. The bathroom was large and well lit. If your looking for a city get away without children I found the LondonHouse ideal. If you run into Laurelei at the front desk please say hello.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It doesn't feel like a Hilton (and use the hotel guest line for the rooftop bar!)
text: We stayed here for 2 nights & were impressed by the renovation. Rooms & bathrooms were spacious, nice linens, and generally well-appointed. Our only complaint was hearing lots of car horns & sirens during the night despite being on the 15th floor & facing away from Wacker - makes me think the windows could be better. We went to the rooftop bar at 4pm on a Friday & stood in a long line. They finally asked if there were hotel guests waiting in the line - we raised our hands & were escorted in. They said "oh, hotel guests stand on the other side of the rope!" With no signage, how were we to know?! Rooftop was nice with great views, but with it being standing room only, we left after 1 drink each (pricey ones at that!).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Could Not Be Faulted
text: This was my first trip to Chicago and  selected London House based on its location, I  wasn't disappointed.  Great location for seeing central Chicago. Well appointed new clean room and great staff, highly recommended.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Something new and refreshing from Hilton
text: If you are looking for a base in downtown Chicago this place fits the bill.  Newly refurbished, it tastefully blends old and new.  The rooms are replete with everything you could want and expect.  The staff were friendly but professional.  The location on East Wacker, over the river from Trump Tower, and adjacent to Michigan Avenue means that you are in the center of it all.  There are a plethora of eating and drinking establishments within walking distance.  As with all downtown Chicago hotels I recommend leaving the car elsewhere and using cabs or trains - you'll save money and time!  I give it a One McArthur - I shall return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: City View
text: I found a great deal for the room I booked after eyeing it up for a week and am so happy I did. I upgraded to a city view when we checked-in and I could not get over how amazing the view was! The room size was great, I loved the d√©cor, location and view so much I didn't want to leave! I went for a short trip with my friend-she loved how comfy the bed was and we will definitely book again. I've stayed at a few hotels in Chicago but was not so blown away with the room, view nor staff as much as I was at the hotel. Not only were the views incredible and the d√©cor perfect but the room was clean and the staff was outstanding-even with some of them in training. We were greeted by Murphy when we arrived and the experience was fantastic from that point on!! (:

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location and very modern and extremely comfortable bed
text: It is right at E. Wacker and Michigan. We walked everywhere, to the Millennium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, nice restaurants on the River North, the river cruise departure location, the stations for almost all local trains. The new riverwalk is right in front. Our room was on the 18th floor at the corner with a partial view of the river. It was quiet and surprisingly spacious. The bed was very comfortable. The tv has chrome cast and can be controlled by our phone. We just loved this hotel. The breakfast was adequate with omelette cooked to order. Be careful if you use apple map to guide you to the hotel. We got lost at the underground highway under the E. Walker. We then just looked at  the map and found our own way. One comment about the rooftop bar. It has a great view but was extremely crowded after 10pm even on a Tuesday night. Don't sit at the table across from the bar counter. Lots of people would be standing behind you. Get a sofa seat, it will be more relaxing. We loved our stay in this hotel and highly recommend it for anyone. We will definitely go back again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxurious hotel right at the Riverwalk
text: This is a unique and beautiful new hotel right in the heart of Chicago's Riverwalk. What's it was walking distance to many great attractions like the Art Institute and theaters.  There is a corner caf√© bakery restaurant on the ground level which is extremely convenient. I found the restaurants in the area to be very hit or miss.  I was frankly shocked that the continental breakfast at the hotel was $24. I walked a block and a half up to another hotel and for less than that had a complete all you can eat breakfast buffet that featured  incredible baked goods, tons of breakfast options as well as meats and omelette bar.  The 22nd floor outdoor balcony bar is quite lovely. I recommend going mid afternoon when there's not mobs and you can take in the view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Convenient and Modern LondonHouse Hotel
text: The LondonHouse Hotel just opened this year. It is conveniently located in the corner of Wacker Drive and Michigan Avenue. Close to the Magnificant mile and State street shopping area, steps from the Chicago river, minutes from the Millenium park and lots of cafes, bars and restaurants around the area. Also close to bus stops, hop on and hop off tour buses, river cruises and the "L" train station. The reception desk is on the second floor and the check in process is fast. The staff are polite and friendly. The room is on the smaller side but appears to be big as there's no more bulky TV cabinet and huge writing desk. The bathroom is huge with bathrobe and Malin + Goetz toiletries. I like the Nespresso coffee maker in the room and the complimentary bottled water they handed out upon check in (not sure if this is only for HHonor members). Had an awesome view of the Chicago river, be it day or night, it  gives you the multiple hues/faces of the river. Went up and had some booze on the rooftop bar on the 22nd floor. It has great ambience and of course great views of the city and the lake. They do have a spa and fitness room but unfortunately no swimming pool. I have to mention their high-tech elevators. Type in your floor destination on the keypad in front of the elevator cars and it will let you know which elevator car will open next for you. Once it opened, just go in and it will bring you to your floor. No more keypads inside, just look at the monitor for the status. That's a first for me. Overnight parking at the hotel costs $71, but if you use spothero.com, the same valet of the hotel costs only $35 for 24 hours.I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good looks will only get you so far
text: This is a brand new, stunningly beautiful hotel with amazing views from the roof deck right in downtown Chicago.  But unfortunately that's where my accolades end.  I am a Hilton Honors member and spend a fair amount of time in Hilton family hotels traveling for business--from Hampton Inns to Doubletrees to Curio properties.  I seek them out wherever I go because they nearly always offer a great experience.  The London House was the exception.  First, I used Hilton's app to check-in electronically and picked what looked to be a fantastic room on the 19th floor.  Upon arrival, a colleague of mine who had also checked in after me using the app, noticed that he had gotten the room I had chosen and I had been relegated to a room on the 17th floor.  Maybe he had more points?  What's the point of letting someone think they are picking one room, only to give them a different room when they arrive?  It creates disappointment where it's not necessary.  Service was also very deficient.  There was no iron in the room (a must for business travelers cramming everything into a carry-on).  The first time I called guest services, it rang about 10 times and no one picked up. The second time I called I got a woman who asked, with a slight hint of condemnation, if I had looked in the closet for the iron.  I assume they have to ask that because many people don't look before calling, but the tone was annoying when I was already starting to run late--and yes, I had looked and there was no iron.  Finally, I called for room service breakfast and specifically asked for hot tea with milk.  It sounds stupid, but most people are pretty particular about how they take their breakfast beverage--nothing fancy for me--just a little milk.  When it arrived the water was tepid and there was honey but no milk.  With service charge and tip already included, a yogurt parfait, english muffin, and a tepid tea was $41.  Understandable for room service in a big city, but at that price, please get it right.  This is not the Hilton I know and love--but it does have great potential so I hope they can work out the service kinks.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great decor
text: Great location - with the exception of being opposite the Trump tower - with friendly staff and amazing decor. Our room wasn't particularly big for the price but was well laid out and the bed was soooo comfy.  The only detail lacking was no free bottled water in the room, which for a $299 room was disappointing.The rooftop bar offered great views but it was way too hot up there to enjoy on the day!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Night Out On The Town
text: This was my very first time on the rooftop of The LondonHouse Chicago. I heard amazing things about this place and it didn't let me down. I have to mention the manager Jamie of the rooftop. He went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our first time on the rooftop. I will definitely be coming back, because of Jamie. It was amazing. Nikki the host was also amazing!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent modern hotel
text: The hotel is well laid out for meetings and has modern, spacious rooms.  The amenities were modern and hotel, even though on Michigan Avenue in downtown Chicago, was very quiet.  I'd recommend this property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location & staff with really nice rooms & super rooftop bar
text: We got a great, last minute deal from Hilton at this hotel right on the river.  We arrived straight from O'Hare and walked 4-5 blocks from the train to the hotel.  Very nice, clean hotel with a great staff.  You are right near Michigan Avenue Shopping and right across from Trump tower, in fact we had a great view of the river and Trump tower.  Roof top bar was very cool.  Would stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice experience
text: Recently opened so everything clean and new. Very comfortable and attractively furnished room with large, modern bathroom as this is a complete renovation of a classic old building. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location on Michigan Ave at the river, we had a great room view and the location is perfect to access the best of Chicago including the Riverwalk right across the street.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fun Weekend
text: Stayed here with my wife. Close to everything you would want to do or a short uber ride away. Really beautiful to look out side the window and see the river and the outdoor bar on 21st floor had great bartenders and service. Want to reserve seats unless you are okay sitting at the bar or standing. Really good time though

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing rooftop views
text: If you have never been to Chicago or you just love the Chicago skyline, you have to check out the rooftop terrace here. The scenery is breath taking...so remember that when you drink is nearly 20 dollars...you are paying for more than just your drink. The service was excellent...so why 4 stars? Well, personally, I have an issue when every single table is reservation only beginning at 4pm...and you look around and no one is sitting down. So, maybe they have a 4:30pm or 5pm reservation...fine, just tell me you can have this table until 4:30...I get it. But, to hold tables for no reason? I just don't get it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Underwhelmed overall
text: The hotel is nicely appointed, the views great, and the rooftop bar very enjoyable.  However it was a comedy of errors during the stay.  I had reserved 3 rooms for a business trip.  We arrived early hoping to check in if the rooms were available.  About 1 pm they said one room was close the other two weren't.  No problem as checking is at 4, we were just hoping to get in early.  The issue was two rooms were not ready at 4 o'clock.  When they were ready one smelled of smoke and when an ozone machine was offered it wasn't ever delivered.  The first room which was ready on time, the luggage was lost for almost two hours.  it was delivered to the wrong room.  The third room was nice when it was available.  The gentlemen at the desk, Able, was extremely accommodating and tried his best to make the situation better.  A discount was give to the room with the lost luggage but nothing to the room which smelled like smoke.  The rooftop bar is a great place to hang out.  The drinks are good and service good.  The only issue here we ordered three apps and two came with cheese bread coming later.  Unfortunately it never came.  We moved to the 2nd floor lounge area and were told it would be brought there but when it never arrived and no one knew anything about it.  After all of this I just gave up and left it on the bill.  As a Hilton Gold member this experience was not what I expect from Hilton.  Overall I would choose another location when i return to Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The first hotel I've stayed at that didn't provide water
text: For $400+ a night you'd think they'd provide some water for god's sake - even if its not free, at least a bottle I could purchase... don't force me to either drink from the bathroom faucet or call room service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: The Best of everything
text: Best location, staff, views, rooms, bars, lounge, lobby, walk-ability, courteousness, d√©cor, bath, etc.  Located in a historic building, right on the river, the employees were amazingly friendly, hard working and gracious.  The little touches of excellence were noted everywhere.  Will definitely put this spot at the top of my "go-to" list.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Downtown Hotel
text: I was just in Chicago for one night traveling inbound to ORD and outbound out of MDW.  Rather than stay at either airport I decided to take the train downtown and saw a good rate on this hotel.It was on the river walk across from Trump Towers and had a nice view out my 18th floor window.The bed was very comfortable ,very large flat screen TV that was interactive with my smart phone, a nice sitting and desk area and a very nicely done bathroom.The staff was very accommodating and pleasant.  My floor was at equal height as the TRUMP sign across the street so it lit up my window.I found the rooms quiet even with the traffic outside.Would definitely stay here  again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel in a beautifully remodeled historic building
text: We had a great one-night stay! Although rooms are small they are designed to make the most out of every square foot. Even though the hotel is in an old historic building, the room was modern with all the amenities we needed. We arrived much earlier than the 4:00 check-in time and were lucky enough to  be able to check in early and had a corner room with a view of the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue. The weather was great so we were also able to have a drink at the rooftop bar and enjoy the amazing view. Location of the hotel was perfect for us and all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay in a cool new hotel
text: Spent two nights at this cool new hotel in the Loop and would definitely stay again. Got upgraded to a spacious corner suite thanks to Diamond status. The staff was generally all around friendly and accommodating - especially Sherman at the front desk who who did outstanding work resolving our 1am pizza cravings. Only down marks are for the breakfast amenity which was poorly organized and staffed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Few New Hotel Missteps - High Hopes!
text: Overall, I would probably stay here again. I'm a HHonors member, so I try to always stick with Hilton hotels. I would hope that by the time I'm back in Chicago, the kinks would be worked out. Pros: Great location. Beautiful, clean rooms. Awesome view. Priority lines for rooftop for hotel guests. Skipped the line and went right up. Great rooftop view. Was comped a night after a really bad guest incident happened next door (see below). Cons: We had guests in the room next door have an all out brawl. Slamming into walls, bleeding, screaming bloody murder. This happened after 2 AM. We called down and it took someone 30 minutes to come up, by this point I'm sure many people called down.
