This was the worst fight I've ever heard, let alone in a nice hotel. They were banging into our door and shared wall. Girls were screaming bloody murder, guys were yelling at each other. Sounded like there were much more than 4 people, how did they all get in without security questioning? Why did the response time take so long? Took another 30 minutes for security to successfully get them out. Was almost 4 AM by the time this was settled, by this point our anxiety was through the roof. Hotel was apologetic after going downstairs the next morning, said they were actually going to reach out to us and comp our room before my husband came down. I had to be up at 6 AM, did not get any sleep at all. They were conscious of this and didn't put anyone next to our room for the additional nights we were staying. I went upstairs for the hotel breakfast to grab a banana and coffee after my run, was handed a receipt for $26 (plus tip = $30) for the "Continental Breakfast". When I asked for a bottle of water to take, she tried to charge me an additional $5. I left the water bottle and paid the $30 for my banana and average coffee. Spa was just alright, booked a massage (wasn't asked which kind upon booking) and an upgraded "$30 - 15 foot and leg" described as "Calves and feet are massaged with a stimulating peppermint balm and then cocooned in steaming hot towels to wake up tired" since I'm currently marathon training I wanted some extra TLC. $30 on top of the $120 massage. "Upgrade" was a complete ripoff, I'm very uncomfortable saying something when it's happening, but I was really disappointed I paid $30 (plus extra tip) to have about 5 minutes of a mediocre foot rub with no touching of the legs/calves, no "cocooned towel wrap". Massage was average, way overpriced. Left pretty irritated. Elevators shut very quickly and left my husband or me on the other side, not even giving us a moment to walk in before shutting the other person on the floor behind. No buttons, so you can't even stop it. Closed on a bunch of guests trying to leave breakfast, took over 10 minutes for us to be able to go downstairs.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Curio Hotel by Hilton - LondonHouse - Chicago, IL
text: This hotel was very nice and new. It is an older building, so there were a few things out of their control like space to pull up, upon arrival and the location of the front desk. Can't complain too much though, it's Chicago. It is a crowded and busy city. When you pull up, there is limited space and time for you to park and give your keys to a valet. Arrival is always stressful. However, the bellmen and valet were helpful and friendly. Also, the hotel front desk is on the second floor. It would have been very confusing, but they had an attendant there to greet you, make your elevator selection and answer any questions we had. Once on the second floor, you'll find the front desk and a very nicely decorated lobby and bar. Loved it. The elevators are very advanced... you make your selection on a touch screen and it tells you what elevator to proceed to. There are no buttons inside the elevator... so cool. Rooms are very nicely   decorated and come with a Nespresso machine and pods to use for free. Bathrooms are roomy and nice, good showers, high tech toilets, clean! Also, there is a smart TV that you can cast apps on from your phone. You are able to watch Netflix in your hotel room... this has revolutionized hotels for me. I will always be looking for this service now. I loved the hotel, I already booked another weekend trip in December!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Why not stay at a LANDMARK
text: Brand new hotel, and while some of the rooms may be small, the building is enough! Amazing landmark converted to a hotel, so it's got a really awesome vibe to it. Didn't realize it when I booked it, but so happy when I got there. Cool elevators with no buttons!!! Amazing view from the rooftop (with the exception of the Trump building). Right along the River Walk. Corner of Michigan and Wacker so you have access to everything within walking distance or a short ride. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Definitely coming back here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fab new hotel with great service, great location, great rooms and an amazing rooftop!
text: Couldn't have been more pleased with my two night stay at this hotel. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, we had a top notch experience. Far exceeded my expectations. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Hotel
text: Very pleasantly surprised with the renovation of this old guard hotel on the river at the corner of Wacker & Michigan Ave. The staff was super friendly, and the rooms are dynamite. The amenities in the room are excellent, and the rooftop lounge is way cool.I could have lived without the elevators that run via computer (a la the Marriott Marquise in mid-town Manhattan), but that is the only chink in the armor.Was really disappointed when the Conrad left Chicago, but happy to have found an awesome new spot to stay when visiting my hometown.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Honeymoon period - open just 60 days
text: Front Door staff simply outstanding and welcoming.   Not a fan of having lobby on second floor.   Front desk staff need a little more training.     Elevators are very different.  Select floor from outside elevator.  Confusing.    Roof top bar great.  But no shade for heat and rain conditions.   Fitness room very nice.    Convenient location to River Walk.    Very European culture / style hotel.  Not typical Hilton facility.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice stay, a bit of a work in progress
text: For the most part, I had an excellent stay.  Beautiful room with a great view but not a great use of space. Small chair where a loveseat could be.  Amazingly comfortable bed. Only one hook in the bathroom.Room was not cleaned until late on first day.  Much better second and third day.The rooftop bar is spectacular.  Amazing views and nice cocktails.The hotel has a great location and friendly staff.  Gym is a tad limited for a hotel of this size.It is a new property and they are just getting started.  Look forward to another stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick 1 night stay in this modern Hilton family hotel
text: I was only staying 1 night while being downtown for the Pearl Jam concert.  I arrived early and was able to check into the room at about 11:30am.  They would have given me a Bette room had I waited a bit but I need to get into the room to get ready.  It was a 6th floor room, no view to speak of but I was warned that would be the case with the early check in. The elevators don't operate traditionally so don't be surprised when there are no buttons inside the elevator. You need to enter your floor outside the elevator and then it will tell you which elevator to go to.  Then once in the elevator it will stop at the requested floors. On the inside of the door there is a small display of you want to check the floors.  The room was a king which was quite comfy. It was really just the bedroom with a small noon with a desk and chair.  The TV was on the large side.  The bath room was nice with a decent size shower.  The hotel has a european / modern feel to it.  The location is great.  Easy access to Michigan Ave and State Street and right next to the Chicago River.  For the Hilton family hotels it is definitely in a different genre than the Hampton/HGI/Embassy etc.  I had lunch at the 2nd floor bar, a nice salad with tuna. We also had room service breakfast as we missed breakfast on the 21st floor.  Room service at hotels is always expensive.  We had an omelette, lox/bagel, side bacon, 1 coffee, 2 waters, literally $85.  We didn't get the chance to check out the roof top bar which has to be nice but I've read is a "place to be seen" kind of place.  Would stay here again if the price is right.  Happen to get a good deal for this Saturday night so took a shot on this hotel.  My stays are usually for a night or two coming from the suburbs so we are usually out and about and not using many of the hotel amenities.  For me, I'd save a couple bucks and stay at a lesser Hilton family hotel but this was nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel and location
text: Recently visited for a family event.  Hotel is very nice. My hotel room was clean and uncluttered.  Hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance of House of Blues, Willis Tower, Millennium Park, a bunch of restaurants and much more. I arrived in the city 8 hours before I could check in, but I was able to drop off my luggage and go around the city. The roof top bar has great views, but it's popular at night and can get very crowded. Overall really enjoyed my time here.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Taste of Chicago
text: I enjoyed my first visit to Chicago, this is a nice property in a great location. The staff was my favorite part. Jose in concierge and Bryan at the front desk were very helpful. The room is spacious and beds are comfortable. The property is new. The only drawbacks for me are: no microwave in the room or on site for use, the elevators are slow due to a lot of traffic to the rooftop which is something you should check out. Also for the price/point redemption the breakfast could have more and also be covered. There were gnats and flies close to the food which could be avoided if covered. However I would stay here again due to location, room and service. Also the 5,000 bonus points for 3 nights or more was a great addition. This deal is valid until 9/7/16.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning hotel, perfect location and with fabulous staff
text: I stayed only two nights at this fabulous new hotel in Chicago. The hotel itself is wonderful, great rooms, facilities, three bars that I visited and spa. The best thing though is the staff. Literally all helpful but some stands out. I came back after drinks at 3am on Saturday morning only to find that food service was closed. Not having eaten anything all day I needed help. Shermen at front desk not only called the outside restaurant personally for me, but called the manager when the staff there was not helpful and organised personal delivery of the lifesaving pizza. Thank you Shermen and staff!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: It was okay.
text: As a platinum member for several years this is the quintessential downtown hotel. $50 for a large pot of coffee and $34 for a small pot. I know hotel have to make money but that was ridiculous. The homeless guys outside are rude (not the fault of the hotel staff) but still if staying here be mindful. Room was nice smelled like cigars which wasn't good. Hotel has an Art Deco feel and was cool. Just disappointing for the price

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend get away
text: Great Valet service to start with. Very nice rooms, clean and spacious. Everyone was helpful and willing to assist.Valet was a bit costly but Stephane the Bellman got up packed up to go and was very good.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A cut above!
text: While I am Hilton (and SPG) Gold, I had not stayed at a Curio. This property was classical with old charm, yet had every modern hotel convenience. The staff were plenty & always helpful. The roof lounge was very nice and comfortable!  Central location was awesome!  I will return for sure!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Service and Location
text: Beautiful Hotel ...very clean. Busy lobby area but got checked in very quickly. Nice views and walking distance to everything.I didn't get a chance to visit the rooftop lounge. Everyone was talking about it. Wish I could have stayed longer

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: CUSTOMER SERVICE
text: I had the pleasure of meeting Arielle who works as an outstanding hostess on their rooftop! She was very professional and made me feel like I was only guest there! The minute I entered the rooftop, she greeted me with a smile and definitely made me feel like I was VIP! She welcomed me graciously and made sure all of my needs were met that evening. Because of her , she made my experience at the London House Rooftop outstanding!!.I will most definitely be back again!! Jan

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: awesome hotel in perfect location
text: This is everything you want in a hotel. location is perfect. staff is friendly. rooms are beatiful and spacious. We had a river view which was fantastic. walking distance to magnificent mile, millennium park. 5 stars all the way!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new hotel.  Rooms are terrific.
text: LondonHouse, a Hilton Honors property, is new hotel with great rooms that are very modern looking. Staff are great. Location is good. I enjoyed staying here, and would do so again the next time I'm in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing time
text: Went to Chicago for 2 nights and had an amazing time. The hotel is gorgeous.  The staff was wonderful.  You can tell theylove what they do and take pride in the hotel. Brandon at the front desk was AMAZING!!  So friendly and helpful. I can't say enough great things about the hotel.  Room was gorgeous.  Roof top bar had a wonderful view of the city.  Can't wait to go back!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend outing
text: Family weekend visiting and Cubs game. Busy weekend running around with family. It was very relaxing to know you didn't have to worry about your Hotel because it was Awesome. The rooms were super clean and gorgeous.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outside noise permeates the room even on the 19th floor
text: I really wanted to like this new Hilton property London House Curio Collection. Bell service and room service were exceptional. The staff checking in and out not so much. The biggest problem with this hotel is the outside noise. On the 19th floor the sirens were extremely loud. I stay downtown quite often and have never had this much noise in a room. Especially that high up. I think the London House needs new windows. I would stay a couple doors down at the Wyndham Grand. We had no noise issues there.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great all around
text: One night stay on business and it was great.  Staff was very cordial, rooms are clean and nicely decorated. I chose the 20th floor and that was the only flaw.  The have a nice bar on the 21st floor and I was able to hear tables moving late at night and very early in the morning (5am).  I would stay again but probably go with the 19th floor.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Customer service-A+
text: What a breath of fresh air. Hands down, THE best customer service I've ever experienced. Genuine, fast and thorough. They've thought of everything here! I'm so thrilled. View from our room in picture.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Beautiful Hotel
text: My wife and I decided to head back to Chicago to celebrate our 10th anniversary, and we chose the new LondonHouse hotel for our accommodations.  It absolutely didn't disappoint, and we'll be excited to return.  The front desk staff was very welcoming, and upgraded us to a river view suite for our stay, even sending up some chocolates and a couple bottles of sparkling water.  The rooms are very well decorated and designed. Soundproofing seems to be very good, as I couldn't hear hardly any noise from other rooms or the hallway.  I do recommend traveling with ear plugs regardless, and still found them handy, as you're in the city, so you do get the occasional emergency vehicle noise from the street below.  The bed was comfortable - not my absolute favorite, and I wasn't an enormous fan of the pillows, but we're all a little different in our preferences along those lines, so I can imagine others have very much enjoyed both.  Either way, it wasn't a deal-breaker for me by any means.  I slept well both nights.  I enjoyed the new, large TV with it's modern, Smart TV technology, and the bathroom light that detects your presence is a nice feature for nighttime visits.  We also enjoyed the Nespresso machine, which was better than the average in-room coffeemaker.  It did take me a bit to find the instructions for how to use it, but they are simply picture instructions on the box that contains the coffee, sugar, creamer, etc.The location (on the corner of Michigan and Wacker can't be beat).  Views from our room were outstanding (and from LH22 are even better).  The fitness center is well-appointed and was a joy to use (though it would be fantastic if they could put some instructions up on how to use the core training equipment).  The continental breakfast (complimentary for HHonors Gold level guests) was generous if defined as continental.  We enjoyed it.  The gentleman running the omelet station was phenomenal...very friendly and quick.  Most everyone at the hotel was super friendly, and provided excellent customer service.  We had wonderful encounters with the front desk, concierge, girl at the baggage storage/valet area...who loaned us an umbrella (she was wonderfully friendly - and a lifesaver with that umbrella as it turned out).  The server at breakfast wasn't as warm as others, but who knows...it could have been an off-weekend for her (I couldn't justify a tip on the 2nd day - my apologies to her if she was just feeling off and could have benefited from that as a pick me up).  I will say; however, that with the exception a couple individuals in the breakfast area, I did detect a different feel up on the 21st and 22nd floors.  Perhaps a little more pretentious...and just not as welcoming...so combined with other reviewers saying they had a much worse experience, I'd say that's an area of opportunity for the hotel.  I also want to highlight one "negative" of sorts that we experienced.  It involves the in-room refrigerator.  I put negative in quotes, and I don't take away from my rating of this property, because I felt it was a bit of a bonus that they had a refrigerator of any kind, but the design of this particular refrigerator is questionable at best for me.  The name on the front of the unit is "SmartFridge", but it seems to be anything but...technology for the sake of technology, but not aiding in utility if you will.  It has several buttons to turn the unit on and off, change the view from celsius to fahrenheit, and a quick cool button...all fine and good.  I'm not sure of the need to turn your fridge on and off (just unplug it perhaps?), but the owner's manual I found online claims it is so guests don't have to hear the condenser running at night if they don't want to.  It's not loud...but anyway, the reason I looked the unit up was because it wouldn't stay below 41 degrees fahrenheit.  I played with the buttons, trying to find a way to set the temperature, but to no avail.  The owner's manual states that the unit is set to cool to 41 degrees...the quick cool will take it to 34 degrees, but then it returns to its normal operating temperature.  This is a lengthy note about this topic, but I bring it up because many of you probably know that perishable items should be kept at 40 degrees or below, so the fact that it will not stay at that level makes it useless for leftovers, milk (which we ended up throwing away), etc.  It's a wonderful bonus to have in the room for your non-perishable beverages - soda, wine, water, beer, etc...and works well for chocolates and the like, but it's a shame that it was designed neglecting good food safety.  Anyway - the length of that "negative" wasn't indicative of our overall feel of the stay.  We loved basically everything about this hotel, and we will be excited to return and use it as a home base for exploring the city of Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great room, just don't plan on enjoying the roof top bar
text: Excellent service from the bell boys and lobby staff. Room new and spotless.  Nice to have fridge and large tv in the room. But don't get your hopes up about the roof top bar.  They have turned it into a mini hipster club. At first we were turned away because we had shorts on. Bouncer was suprised to see us return with pants, but did let us in. However every seat was taken or "reserved", and the only room to stand was in the isle ways.  So our view was of the sky, and upper floors of Trump tower.  Waitresses didn't even bother asking us if we wanted a drink, just shooed us side to side out of the way. We enjoyed our hotel room,  and it's location on Michigan Ave. But we were looking forward to being able to enjoy the roof top bar, and it was a very disappointing experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful and inviting!
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse for my 21st birthday. I was greeted by multiple agents as I walked through the entrance and headed towards the lobby. Everyone I encountered was polite and just made me feel really great and welcomed. The hotel is extremely beautiful! I had an incredible view of the city from the 8th floor. My room was clean, had all the essentials, and a king sized bed. However, for a king corner suite, the room was kind of small. It had me wondering what regular rooms looked like. Besides that, the front desk agents were incredibly kind and forgiving of my annoying and constant questions! Brandon and Abel at the front desk definitely took some of the stress of booking my first hotel as an adult.They even suggested spa options (which I def. did and it was AH-MAY-ZING). They gave me suggestions for night life as well which I appreciated. They just went above and beyond for me willingly. Amazing customer service! Whenever I head back to Chicago, I will definitely look into LondonHouse first. Thank you for the best birthday!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Luxe and Lovely
text: This hotel is both breathtaking and centrally located, and boasts the nicest staff you will ever encounter in a luxury property. Our weekend experience was phenomenal and this is most certainly the only downtown hotel in Chicago we will stay in moving forward.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Week end!!
text: This newly opened property has it all!! History, location, rooftop bar, second floor lobby bar, interesting elevator system, convenient street level Corner Bakery, helpful staff....and oh yes wonderful room!!Large corner room beautifully appointed, lovely linens, large flat screen and great view!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bad experience
text: Along with what seemed a hundred or more disgruntled travelers we showed up for their seemingly late 4pm check-in only to find our room was not ready. Unfortunately, the other hundred or so people in the lobby, most of whom were waiting in a very long line, were in the same predicament. The place had the look of an airport when all the outgoing flights have been cancelled. Had to change our evening plans as we had no room to change in. I cannot believe this is a Hilton property. I am a Hilton Honors member and usually a big supporter. Very shabby treatment and very disappointing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay!!
text: the staff was very helpful and welcoming. The rooms were fantastic and kept very clean. The view was great and the location is fantastic. Easy to access anything as well as public transportation and shopping.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick Summer Trip
text: Great facility in a great location.  Look forward to returning and staying longer next time.  The bed was extremely comfortable (though it took two tries to get the foam pillows to the room) as were the towels.  The television (which was huge) was great for catching up on the Olympics.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New and inviting
text: Stayed the weekend at the London House.  We had a corner room was very spacious, quiet and had a nice view of the river.  Everyone we encountered was friendly and professional.  Great location on Michigan Ave with many options for eating and shopping.  There is a large TV that swivels between the bed and sitting area and a good size refrigerator.  The bathroom door was a frosted glass barn door, which offered a bit less privacy than a traditional solid door.  Valet parking was $71 a night.  The rooftop bar had a magnificent view at sunset.  The rooftop bar was filled with the hipster crowd on a Sunday afternoon.  The continental breakfast was good and included a made to order omelet.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Choice! Don't look any further, this is the place to stay!
text: This hotel is outstanding! The staff was very friendly and welcoming and the front desk was very courteous and quick.  We were on the 18th floor with a King bed.  The room was gorgeous and obviously new, with very tall ceilings, beautiful furnishings, and a gorgeous large bathroom. The housekeeping was impeccable as it looked as though we were the first to ever use the room. We walked to Millennium Park, the River Walk and the Navy Pier, so the location was outstanding! On a side note, there is a great little Bakery Caf√© that is adjacent to the hotel that serves a great hot breakfast or you can grab something to go.  Honestly we were thrilled with our choice of hotels.  The LondonHouse Chicago is Perfect!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Great Location for a Business Meeting
text: I was at this hotel for a two day business meeting attended by twelve people. The accommodations were excellent; meeting rooms very nice and the staff very helpful and professional. Rather than dining out, we had breakfast, lunch and dinner in a private room off of our meeting room. Although initially disappointed we were not going out for dinner, my disappointment quickly disappeared when we were served an excellent dinner. Another great feature of the hotel was the roof top lounge. Don't miss it as it has great views of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Swanky, Centrally Located and a Must to Experience their Roof Top Terrace
text: The LondonHouse Hotel (Curio Collection by Hilton) was a pleasant surprise for me while I was visiting Chicago for business. It is in the middle of the bustling downtown area of Chicago and is right on the river. It is virtually in striking distance to all the notable things to visit in Chicago and it is in walking distance to many of the top restaurants in the city. The entire hotel represents a complete renovation of a historic building in Chicago and it doesn‚Äôt disappoint. The street level has a very nice dual bank of elevators. There is no guessing as to what elevator will open its doors as you specify the floor and a digital display tells you what elevator will take you there. Registration is on the second floor and it is very swanky and richly appointed. Service is very professional, friendly and efficient. The rooms are well decorated with an accent on minimalism. The view I had was of the Chicago River and the many bridges and buildings that pepper the landscape. The air conditioning system was highly effective and extremely quiet and great if you are a light sleeper. There were ample plugs for your computer or accessories.When you stay at the LondonHouse Hotel make sure visit the roof top terrace known as LH On 22. You can take in a great meal, your favorite cocktail and enjoy the wonderful elevated view of Chicago. Be certain to make your reservations in advance of getting to the hotel as it is a popular place.I had room service the very first day as I was just too tired to go out and I have to say that the food was actually delicious. Lastly, I would like to praise two of the managers of the LondonHouse Hotel, Carlos and Keith, for being completely devoted to customer service by taking care of a couple of things for me and making sure that my experience was nothing but the best. Kudos and Ciao.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing place
text: Had a great time staying at the London Curio. I would recommend it to anyone staying in Chicago business or personal. The upgrades of the rooms are great, the views of the city are to die for, walking distance to anywhere you want to be.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing views, great rooms
text: The room is equipped with everything you may need from an espresso machine to a great cooler for beverages. The views, location and staff made this a great stay. The workout facilities are just the cherry on top!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Aug 2016
text: Carlos (hotel mgr) upgraded us to a Suite and recognized us as a 'quality' guest as well as a Hilton member. Also, the main reception person guy (can't remember his name) was VERY helpful throughout our stay !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel with great views and close to everything! !
text: Wonderful stay for my family huge rooms and wonderful views of the city. Close to shopping and night life.  We lived how friendly everyone was furniture our whole trip would stay again in the future! !!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice location, Service ok
text: Pros: Excellent location in the heart of Chicago; chromecast TV allowed me to use my apps on the TV. Room is quiet, bed very comfortable. Cons: The minute we checked in, we were given a room that was already occupied. There were scattered used clothing in the room. Fortunately the occupants weren't there. Talk about a sullied first impression. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels ranging from 1star to 5 stars and never had this occur before. We did get a complimentary dining credit and hhonors internet access, but still, that was not cool. Secondly, in the bathroom in our new room, there were used shampoo and soap in the shower... ugh. I dunno if that's the fault of the housekeeping or management or both, but it's disgusting. Conclusion: For the price we're paying, if we visit Chicago again we'd probably choose one of the other ones nearby

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Can't Rave Enough!
text: This hotel has brought customer service back at a whole new level. Michigan avenue is right outside the door. Everything was within convenient walking distance. The rooms are fabulous, we'll decorated with LARGE bathrooms! We will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Don't be fooled
text: I was.  I am a frequent business traveler (Hilton Diamond and Marriott Gold) and feel that I know what to expect at these properties.  Since I live in Ohio and my office is in the John Hancock building I was anxiously awaiting an opportunity to stay at LondonHouse.  Boy, was I disappointed.  To me this property is trying to be quite NYC "she-she" like the Ian Schrager hotels, however, the service is terrible and most employees have a big time attitude that they are better than their guests.  Everything from denied access to the bar because I wore shorts ("but if I want to go to my room and dress more appropriately I am welcome to come back"), to not able to get a Sprite onsite ("you can walk to Walgreens"), to not having an executive lounge for Diamond members, to trying to charge me $24. for a coffee and croissant.  This place has way to much attitude for me and no service to back it up.  I will say that the doorman was very kind and polite.  He is the only reason that I did not rate this as a 1.  There are many better choices in the Windy City.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Chicago!
text: Loved the city and this hotel!  Will definitely be back.  Really enjoyed!  The hotel was beautiful...but the rooftop club is too small.  I wasn't able to enjoy at night because way too crowded and definatly for the young people (20's).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay at the LondonHouse
text: Brand new hotel, Hilton property, beautiful room, great staff, especially Murphy, who was kind and helpful with arranging a cab ride. Love the elevator system! Great location right on the Chicago river, close to many attractions, Michigan Avenue, great restaurants a short walk or cab ride away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: What a wonderful "StayCation!"
text: Living in the western suburbs of Chicago, my husband and I needed an overnight break from reality. Being a Hilton Honors Reward Member, we were pleasantly surprised to find LondonHouse. Each and every employee that we came in contact with treated us like royalty. The views of Chicago were endless, with her skyline and river taking center stage. Seeing this beauty from our crystal clear floor to ceiling windows in our Vista Suite was postcard prefect. But those views were nothing compared to the scenery that was framed from atop the rooftop bar. Comfy seating and a server willing to track down a favorite cocktail from a bar on another floor made it that much better. The drinks were pricey, but we decided that the view was so worth the cost. Chocolate croissants, freshly sqeezed orange juice, and a personally prepared omlette made for a delicious breakfast. From the decor, to the ammenities, to the placement of the floor mirror (reflecting the river and bridges, we could tell that attention to details were met in our suite. In lieu of the expensive valet parking, consider one of the local parking garages, as they are (relatively) less expensive. We will definitely be returning to LondonHouse.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: You must go here!
text: This was a great experience from the second we arrived to the second we left! Rooms are beautiful and the rooftop was absolutely breathtaking! Can not wait to come back! Highly recommend staying here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Place to Stay
text: The rooms were great, and we had a wonderful view.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  We really enjoyed our stay.  The location was perfect, and just across the river from the Miracle Mile.  We are glad to recommend the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A nice surprise from Hilton
text: I was quite surprised to find out London House is part of the Hilton chain under the "Curio" moniker. It's a departure from their bland corporate properties and the answer to many of the independent boutiques and the Kimpton Hotels of the world. The location is fabulours, can't get better in fact and occupies a magnificent renovated old office building. The rooms are beautifully appointed and though not large very comfortable. Go for one of the rooms overlooking the river.Hotel service and staff is very nice (kudos to the desk staff and doormen) but their are some faults. The biggest being the rooftop bar which is a must visit but not for the libations. The roof has one of the most stellar views of Chicago as if you can reach out and touch the top of the magnificent skyscrapers (don't bother with the disgusting Trump disaster across the river ;) ). The problem with the bar is the horrendous service and unnecessary attitude. The bar, which I'm guessing is a concession is believing itself to be a hip bar in lower Manhattan rather than a hotel bar their to service first and foremost the guests. The bar gets a large population of local wannabes which I guess accounts for the faux exclusivity of it all. Go up for the view, take some pictures and then go elsewhere for a drink. Theirs much, much better in town.The second fault of the hotel is the buffet breakfast served in the lobby. It's an uncomfortable set up for a full breakfast and a bit awkward especially if you're having a breakfast meeting. I'm guessing that a full service restaurant will open eventually and that the breakfast lobby is a temporary set up until then.PROS:Wonderfully helpful staff hotel staff.Comfortable, well appointed rooms. But don't expect large, who cares anyway, it's Chicago.Fabulous architecture.Stellar views.CONS:Awkward and uncomfortable breakfast set up.Rude staff and terrible service in the rooftop bar.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Close to everything!
text: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights this last week.  Beautiful hotel.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Room was very nice.  We were on the 12th floor, floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river and Trump Tower.  Only complaint was the bathroom.  Could hear everything from the bedroom that went on in the bathroom.  Also, they had motion lights in the bathroom, which are great at night, except that the bathroom door is glass, so it lights up the room while people are sleeping.  Also, wouldn't really recommend the spa.  Not impressed with my massage for the price.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Brand new hotel located at Wacker and Magnificant Mile!
text: We traveled to stay at this lovely hotel in an amazing location for a "family" wedding. Hard to find the entrance when you are driving, not sure really where to go so we had to drive around in icky Chicago traffic for a bit. Once we figure out where to go, the valet and bellmen were right there. We arrived there way before check in, as our Army daughter had arrived at 5 am and we were anxious to see her, they had a room for us when we arrived at about 12:30. Front desk reception was very friendly and nice. We were given a room with a lovely view of Michigan Ave and the Chicago river on the 16th Floor. Cool elevators that you just inputed the floor you wanted to go to and they send you to that elevator. No buttons in the elevator to push so if you entered the wrong elevator it would not stop at your floor. very inventive. Rooms were also very advanced in lighting and drove my husband nuts because I knew how to do to the dimmers, reading lights, et all. Hotel was just in it's 2nd month of operation. Everything very clean, super comfy beds, cool decor and again an amazing location. Only thing we were disappointed about was they is a very cool roof top lounge that obviously EVERYONE that is 29 or under wants to go to, streams and I mean streams of young girls filling up elevators to go to upper lounge. Hotel guests ( and we were attending a wedding of 110 people at the hotel and 1/2 of those were staying at the hotel) could not get up to the rooftop. had to stand in line with everyone else. Upstairs hostess not very nice but I am sure they were overwhelmed. view from upstairs lounge very pretty, we snuck up there to see when we checked out and got scolded even thou I told the two women up there we just wanted to see the lounge and view. Other than that this is a beautiful hotel and amazing staff! could do a review of having an event there as we attended a wedding that all components took place at London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House exemplary
text: Everything at this hotel is exceptional. It's at ground zero of Chicago, can be a little noisy but the hotel is fantastic as is the staff. I usually don't like to do reviews but was happy to do this one.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Did not Disappoint!
text: My stay at London House was great.  I am an avid Trip Advisor follower and not the easiest hotel guest to please.  I read a few not so positive reviews so I was looking for things to not go too smoothly.  Wow, they proved me wrong!  From the minute I checked in, I was impressed.  It was Lollapalooza weekend and the city was packed.  The gentleman Bryan, at reception, went out of his was to make sure everything went well.  I asked to upgrade to a larger room for Sunday, Monday night.  He was so kind to put me in a room that I could have all four nights, without switching, and it was actually less than what I booked online.  My room was beautiful, 12th floor, double, with river views and floor to ceiling windows.  (1203)....  Thank you Bryan, you are the type of employee that keeps me loyal to the Hilton brand!  My next stop was the rooftop.  I went early and had a salad.  I am sure  it gets packed later on, but I had no problem finding a table and the Buratta salad was really good.  The hostess, Aubrey, was a real gem, and I am sure her job is not the easiest at night when she has to do her job and tell people the roof is full.  Thank you Aubrey for also letting me take some pics of the Cuppola.  I had a perfect long weekend in a very busy place and I looked forward to returning to the peace and quiet in my room at night!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Views are beyond, service horrible
text: For any of you wondering about #LondonHouse Hotel, here is my review:  fantastic views, fantastic rooms, great cocktails, great location.  However- problem w service.  Front desk very snotty (seems to be the theme here). #HiltonHonors member & weren't given points or breakfast or wifi info- person right next to me given all that.  Barely looked at me or said hello.  Went up to rooftop at 3pm & got snotty attitude again.  Had cocktails in regular bar & there were maybe 3 other tables & 3 bartenders couldn't be bothered to walk over & serve us.  We had to keep going up to bar.  So we left & spent MUCH money elsewhere. (Felt like Pretty Woman- "big mistake---HUGE"). Overall I would come back to stay but don't count on friendly service!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location - Fantastic Rooftop Bar & Restaurant & Great Room with Digital Key on Your Cell Phone
text: This hotel is conveniently located, with nice rooms that allow you to utilize a "key" via your mobile phone.  With checkout on the TV, and check-in on-line, I never visited the front desk.  I found the staff extremely helpful, and the hotel amazing and environmentally friendly.  The rooftop bar & restaurant is one of the best locations in the city.  The bedding was excellent, and I travel very often, sometimes having trouble getting to sleep in a new hotel.  No issues at all at LondonHouse.    I highly recommend this Curio by Hilton property.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop experience
text: It was a rainy day on 7/28/16 in Chicago, but there was a little break of sunshine for our party of 10 at London House!  The service far out shined the weather and the view was still the best in the city!!  I would highly recommend one to place this on the "sites to see" while visiting Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: anniversary
text: Great location.  Everything was in walking distance.  Excellent customer service.  I would stay again.  The bed was comfy.  The bed room was unique and the view was terrific.  I really liked the I closed glass shower.  Me and my wife walked to navy pier and to the taste fest.  It was food options really close to the hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location (except that you have to look at the Trump monstrosity across the river)
text: a very nice central location in chicago. the staff were all exceptionally attentive-- from the folks opening the door, to the front desk, to the bar tenders. The hotel was nicely appointed, though a few small things were broken or in disrepair in my room, nothing major (loose toilet seat and a shower door that wouldn't fully close; digital keys in the hotel were glitch prone at best--had to get a real key eventually b/c it was too frustrating). I would recommend this place and would go back. Fitness room was also nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous location but not a hotel for 50 to 65 year old ladies.
text: Bellman Sandy is wonderful. Hotel is gorgeous except for very tacky lobby/breakfast area.  Breakfast staff was kind and helpful.  Don't ask for a shower stool they have none.  They will tell you they have built in seats in handicapped rooms.  Only drawers in room are under the beds like in kids furniture. Our room had no surfaces for our belongs other than the small desk between beds. We had 1 desk chair and no others chairs in our room.  The mattresses slide around on platforms.  You can get bruised walking into them. You can only see the back of your head in the bathroom mirror if you can lift a really heavy electric makeup mirror.   Staff in 2 of 3 bars didn't know how to make the drink I ordered and were rude and dismissive, telling me they didn't have the liquer needed even though their bouncer confirmed they did before I entered the bar..  They turn off the elevator from the 21st to 22nd floor roof top bar at night.  If you use a cane, they don't want you up there anyway.  Even after we asked, they didn't service the second room my sisters and I booked so they had no clean towels, soaps, coffee etc.   They have no quarters at front desk should you need change for CTA.   One of our phones quit working.  They told our sisters in the other room that we turned it off and did not want to be disturbed.  We booked at $189.00 a room.  They charged $220.00 or $240.00. You would think that Hilton would have done a better job of customer service, staffing, training and decorating that lobby with their 90 year history in the hotel business.  My sisters and I will look elsewhere for our next Chicago adventure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Business Trip
text: This hotel was perfectly located we had a great room and superior service. The restaurants and both lounges have excellent service, great food and drink.  Many locals gather here. The river view was fantastic and you can walk out the door and be at the river, lake or Michagan street in no time.  I loved the Nespresso machine in the room. I would ask to be further from elevator as you can hear the dinging in the living room. Easily sleeps 4 people. The entire staff was excellent but a big five stars to Brandon who helped me everyday with his knowledge, smile and perfect service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Superb hotel loved it all
text: From the moment we arrived to the minute we left the staff were great.  So helpful and polite it was really useful on a number of occasions especially with directions. The room was all new, special lighting, comfy bed, huge T.V. and keeping coffee machine.  The view from the window was out over the river, I am told every room has a good view.The lifts were brilliant, fast and direct loved the whole design.Honours breakfast was adequate but not as varied as many hotels. Lots of places nearby to have a good cheap breakfast if you wanted more.The only valet parking which is to be expected in this area, only down side was sirens during the night.Hope to stay again soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location and fabulous stay,,
text: No need to look any further the LondonHouse has a friendly staff, well appointed modern rooms, picture perfect location and an awesome rooftop bar!  The bed was so comfortable it was hard to get up to start my day. The bathroom was large and well appointed with high quality toiletries.  I loved the temperature controlled mini-fridge so you could keep water chilled.   There is also a fancy coffeemaker but I didn't use it.  I enjoyed the coffee in the lobby bar for breakfast.  The breakfast was great with custom made omelets and of course  great view.  The staff was prompt clearing up after people were done with breakfast so there was no problem finding a place to sit.  The staff was friendly and attentive to any needs you might have. This experience has made my future travels to Chicago a simple one....I will only stay here!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice stay
text: We stayed here 3 nights using HHonors points.  This is a nice modern boutique hotel catering to couples.  The location is perfect, right on the river with a subway stop only a few blocks away.  We had a fantastic dinner within walking distance at Doc B's Fresh Kitchen.  I highly recommend this place, very unique high qualify food. The room was on the small side (single king), but newly appointed amenities including a Keurig (Nestle) espresso machine, upgraded Hilton linens, a large 50-60 inch tv, motion sense night light (very low, but perfect for finding the toilet).  Our room had a view of the river and was walking distance to the river walk restaurants etc.  The complimentary breakfast (HHonors benefit) had minimal items, but good quality food and very friendly staff.  The elevators utilized new technology and when you select your floor (from outside) the display tells you which car to go to.  Took a little while to get used to not seeing buttons inside the elevator, but seemed to be very efficient.  We really enjoyed our stay, when we return for another quick getaway we will look to this hotel again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new Hotel in the heart of it all
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse a week after it opened. I think I was the first person to stay in my room. Great location, rooms are well appointed. The rooftop deck is worth the effort to get to (almost impossible after 6PM Wed-Saturday) The restaurant is good and I'm sure will improve as they get the kinks out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A super stay!
text: Londonhouse is a newly renovated hotel in the perfect location in Chicago. We we surprised they had our room ready for an early checkin. The rooms are smaller than standard rooms but well appointed with modern amenities...one of which is a very large flat screen TV. The roof top bar is a bonus, with spectacular views of Chicago. The staff were all polite and extremely helpful in taking care of your needs. We are not breakfast people but did pop down for coffee (which was a perfect cup) and noticed they had an omelet station, fresh fruit, yogurts and muffins. All nicely laid out for guests. This hotel is a boutique hotel and is perfect location for a Chicago stay. We enjoyed our views from our room. I recommend this hotel for those who like a fresh coat of paint and new modern decor. Longhouse was a super stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great addition to Hilton properties in Chicago - great rooftop
text: I just completed my first stay at the Londonhouse and was impressed across the board. Great renovation of a historic property similar to the Wacker Hampton, but with much larger rooms. Excellent views of the river and the rooftop deck had excellent cocktails as well as people watching. Definitely will return!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LondonHouse Chicago
text: Hotel is in a great location with an amazing view of Chicago's upper side. The rooms are beautiful and modern and the staff is helpful with any recommendations or requests. Would recommend it for a getaway.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Corporate event
text: Johnny was incredible with helping set up for our meeting. We asked him to move the sun and moon and he did without question. What a great asset to have on your team! We could not have had such a successful event without his help. Thank you again for everything.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Views
text: This hotel is all about incredible views of the city.  They are amazing from the lobby to the rooftop bar to the rooms.  It's beautiful, great location, and good service.  I would definitely book this again on my next visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent very comfortable stay
text: Waited for this one to open since I heard about it in the summer of 2015 and finally had a chance to stay there. It was worth the wait! Corner suite had a nice layout that made good use of space. The desk/sitting area was separated from the bed (may be the most comfortable Hilton bed I've slept in) by a floor to ceiling divider that also contains the television on a pivot (opposing side is a mirror) so you can rotate it depending on which side you are on. Master light switch by the door and the bathroom light switch has a motion setting and the shower has a Kohler rainhead (awesome). The mini fridge has LED lighting and a digital temp control (nice touch) and there is also a Nespresso machine (note that a The Corner Bakery is also on the first floor and is very good too). Lobby on the second floor also has an open bar with nice view of Wacker and the river and a rooftop bar on the 21st floor has excellent views. London House has a great modern, classic feel and one of the best locations in the city. It knows what it is and doesn't try too hard to be cool or trendy. Definitely worth checking out and while I was here on business this stay, I plan on coming back for a romantic getaway.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice boutique hotel off on Michigan Ave
text: Located right off Michigan Ave and Wacker.  Nice updated boutique hotel.  Most rooms have a good view, the higher the floor the better.  Modern rooms and bathrooms.  Stayed on 14th Floor, but would try to get a higher floor next time.Nice breakfast in the morning in the bar / lobby area.  Staff was nice and helpful.  We were able to get into the rooftop bar without a reservation, but most nights there is a long line in the lobby.Would recommend staying if you are looking for a nice hotel just north of Millennium park.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Family stay to visit parks, pier, and Shed.
text: The stay was great! The staff was very personable and helpful. Location was amazing. A small detail, I asked the doorman were I could buy a water, he said down the road, while handing me a bottle of water for free. Very nice! He also said that the front desk should have gave a bag to me with first time stay items, along with 2 bottles of water, which I didn't receive. Other than that, it was an amazing stay at a newly renovated place with a perfect location. If you like a view from your room, I would highly recommend upgrading to the city or lake view. We did not upgrade to a view.  Saying that, we will never stay without upgrading to a view again. Overall great nice clean well located place.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Location is key!
text: We had a great time at the LondonHouse. We were right in the middle of everything - great location. The room and housekeeping staff were excellent. Our view was amazing - facing the river and Trump hotel. Breakfast was simple but gold - the blueberry muffins, wow!  Would definitely stay there again. Thank you for a great long weekend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel in great location
text: loved our time there...will repeat for sure.  staff was wonderful ...  awesome breakfast and view ...roof-top bar was amazing...although a bit of a challenge to be allowed to enter ...exclusive and limited numbers only

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very nice luxury hotel
text: The hotel is quite new and very well done inside. It is luxurious, comfortable, and excellent location. The staff was good, the rooms nice and location excellent. However I found it a bit sterile and anonymous. If that is your taste in luxury hotels, then by all means it is a great place. But it wasn't quite to my taste.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Toenail clippings & dirty toilet
text: Yikes. Yeah, this joint could be wonderful. New staff and lack of attention to detail and service. Toenail clippings adorned my bed and the toilet was very dirty when I entered my room for the first time. 45+ minute wait to get a new room. Toiletries weren't replenished during my stay. Nor were the Nespresso coffee pods... called for my car, told 15 minutes and it took 50 because they "forgot"...  there's more but hey. For $500+/night and $75 night valet I'd go elsewhere for the next few months. Perhaps they'll improve with experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I would stay at the Londonhouse again.
text: Our room was very clean and comfortable. After the hot summer days it was great to get to the room to cool off and relax before going out to dinner. The bathroom has a good size and is very modern. I loved the bath amenities.The location of the hotel is perfect, close to everything and across the street from the riverwalk.The staff was always very friendly and eager to please. I mentioned we were celebrating our anniversay and the lady at the counter made a note of it and we received a tray of chocolate covered strawberries with a handwritten note on the specific date (see pictures).Before arriving you can check in and choose your room but not much information is included as to the difference of the rooms available. I just chose the highest floor available but we were very lucky to get a room with a view of the river.The only thing that I would have liked is more drawers because we stayed for five nights and except for the closet there were only two small drawers to place everything.The truth is that we liked it very much and would go there again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great staff
text: Came to Chicago to attend a Cubs game. Lalapalooza was going on and we had trouble finding a room. Ended up here even though it was a bit out of our price range. We have not been sorry. Brandon Peyton checked us in and took such good care of us. We could not get a room with two queens and he sent us up enough bedding to make a great bed on the floor for our son. He greeted us at the door when we returned for the evening and asked if we were ready for the linens. Chatted with us,about our night and made us feel so welcome. Rooms are a little small but very very clean and nice. Great location, super comfy bed! Great job!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Home away from home
text: I travel to Chicago every week for work and LondonHouse is my choice hotel. The staff are extremely pleasant and accommodating. The hotel itself is new, clean, and modern. The location is great as you are close to downtown as well as Magnificent Mile and River North. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: LOVED London House!
text: Loved this clean, crisp hotel right on the river, perfect location!  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room rate was excellent value!  Breakfast was good, interesting as it was only omelet station with muffins, yogurt, apples, juice, coffee and a wonderful view!  Room was spacious with nice bathroom amenities and a clean feel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Loved London House, Chicago
text: We absolutely LOVED London House!  The staff was awesome and the hotel was extremely clean and fresh!  We kind of liked the breakfast, not wonderful though, however, the view was beautiful!  Location is ideal, excellent value, will stay again... hopefully soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Room w/ views
text: I'm pleased with our stay at LH Chicago. I'm currently in my second trimester of pregnancy and arrived early hoping to check in a little early due to some morning sickness. I made the person who originally helped me aware of my circumstances and let him know I would be sitting in the lobby waiting until there was a room available. The bar in the lobby is nice, yet severely overpriced (IMO) for quality and quantity. I opted for for some iced tea that cost (with tip) almost $8. Having said that....hello Chicago. After two hours of not hearing a room was available I checked back in with the front desk to see if a room was available and it still was not. I chose to get some fresh air as my husband was still at a meeting for work and by this point in time I felt like I was going to get sick. After a hour or so, I went back and meet up with Carlos (works at the front desk), whom was sensitive to the way I was feeling. He was a Godsend to me. He personally went to make sure my room was available and checked me in. I was beyond excited to rest upon a bed. Our room was a Corner King Suite with views of Mich Ave. as well as the river. Fabulous size. Comfortable beds (but scratchy sheets), Nespresso machine with three choices of Joe, but no tea options (#preggoissues). The bathroom was a nice size and the shower had great pressure and was huge (relatively speaking for chi- hotel standards). The toiletries were lovely. TV and mirror wall interchanged from bedroom to living room space should you so wish. We loved our room. So long as the price was right, we'd stay here again. Looking at dates in the future, I think they may be charging a little much; having said that, for the amount we paid for our hotel stay this trip, I was content.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel with excellent location
text: Stayed in a beautiful King corner suite. Had lovely views of the river at the corner of Wacker and Michigan.  Easy check in and great complimentary bag check so you can arrive early or stay a bit late.  Great place highly recommended to a couple looking for a beautiful place to stay for a night out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Simply Wonderful
text: In a word - fantastic.  Stayed here for 3 nights and honestly can't think of a complaint. The rooms are clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. Nespresso machines and excellent bath products (brand is Malin + Goetz) are a nice touch.  I did not try the breakfast, though I heard it was excellent - but I did go to the bar, which has a fantastic view of the city and excellent drink menu. Not much else to say other than "stay here, you will be happy."  Or maybe don't - that way, I will always be able to get a room when I need one.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lovely But A Bit Quirky
text: I stayed at the London House twice in the last couple of weeks and both times it was a bit of an uneven experience.  The hotel is lovely and it's an excellent location, right off the Magnificent Mile.  If you're lucky you'll get a room off the river where you can watch the boats go down as the water glimmers at night. The rooms are very nicely appointed and the bedding is crisp and comfortable. The grey tones the rooms are decorated in are hip but tasteful and the dupioni silk drapes in dark grey provide a very soothing backdrop.  The bathrooms are functional and aesthetically welcoming.  The clean style offers lots of space for sundries. The tile is quite pretty and the wall paper is very cleverly done in a style that mimics a high end shimmery tile. The showers are large and the shower heads provide a very comfortable soaking.  The staff is really warm and very informative and helpful.  And the elevators are speedy and quiet. So what's the problem?  Our first room had a very odd problem.  The bathroom had wiring issues. The fan kept going on and off seemingly of its own accord and the lights went on and off as well.  We called down to have it attended to but no one was able to fix the problem and it kept us up for quite a while. During the summers Chicago hotels can be hard to come by and very pricey so I was very glad that as Hilton Honors members we got a very good rate both times but our first room was small and a bit oddly laid out.  For a single person it would have provided some very welcome separate areas to organize living space but it was a bit cramped for my husband and me. Our second room was far more spacious and nicely laid out and no issues with the bathroom wiring but the room faced away from the river and the traffic noise was a bit loud despite being on one of the upper floors.  Nonetheless we had a nice stay overall.  You couldn't ask for a better location and the halls were extremely quite and the room remarkably clean.  We'll definitely be staying there again.  It's a newly renovated hotel and I'm sure they'll be working out the little quirks and kinks over the autumn.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: London Chicago is in a great location. Right off Michigan Ave overlooking the bridge and the Chicago River. The front entrance is not very visible from the street. It feels more like a service entrance. You are required to go up one floor to the 2nd for the lobby and check in area. Rooms are beautifully decorated. Comfy bed and pillows. Great toiletries. Glass showers may need some attention as the water spray does escape out between the door onto the floor.A big hit for us was a Nespresso Coffee maker in the room. Kudos!Breakfast in the lounge in the morning seems awkward. The bar/lounge in the evening converts to the breakfast area in the morning. Very comfy laid back chairs and sofas works for the evening, just not enough areas to sit and eat a breakfast meal really. Very cramped behind the bar for the staff to refill food trays or make omelets.We did have reservations for the rooftop and unfortunately because of the rain they moved everyone indoors to the Bar on the 21st floor.The staff was busy trying to create more seating areas and accommodate the crowd. It didn‚Äôt seem to work well for most of us.After a long wait we were placed an a room of the bar that seemed more for private parties. It was very tight with room and extremely cold in there.Would suggest requesting a room with a view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location
text: Loved the view from our room on the 20th floor.  Rooms are beautiful with superior detail, bathrooms are gorgeous and clean.  Rooms are nearly soundproof and bed was very comfortable.  Room service was prompt & coffee is fantastic.  Reception area needs some improvement (more bling).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: nice hotel but terrible experience
text: I have been in my room for the last 90 minutes listening to the two least talented musicians in the entire world playing amplified music right across the street from the hotel.  Someone please make them stop.  Someone please explain to the drummer that he cannot just randomly hit his drum.  The front desk was very happy to tell me that they met my request to get me a quiet room.  One wonders, what is a noisy room here?

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Still working out the kinks
text: Beautiful property! Every surface of the front-of-house was a polished as the smiles and welcomes of the staff that checked us in. Our Queen room is outfitted with modern decor and has a warm inviting sensibility to it - along with a stunning view of the Chicago river.We dropped our bags, and after a little admiration decided to check out the rooftop bar. We found a table across from the bar and helped ourselves for a bit. It's atmosphere is the perfect spot for some sun-worshiping and cocktails in the late afternoon. We sat for a bit and really enjoyed the mildly swanky but unpretentious environ. We waited a bit, chatted a bit, and I then took my camera out of my bag to take a pic of the view of the river. I squeezed the shutter twice before a manger appeared at our table.  "Excuse me sir...", he politely explained that my camera was too professional, and I would have to pay a fee if I wanted to take pics of the view from the roof.  Now... I really did come to the roof for a few drinks, and I really did not feel like getting into a discussion about exactly how one can copyright the light particles that come from outside of a property inward, and how those can prohibited from capture ... especially as I was there as a paying customer...... but that's beside the point.  I asked his forgiveness in exchange for putting my camera away. He agreed cordially, and excused himself.  It was at this point that he turned around, looked at our table, and asked "Has anyone taken your order?""No" I said, "you're the first person here to speak to us."He was exactly as embarrassed as he needed to be, returned with water and menus, and promised a server would appear soon.  We had a few drinks and forgot about it, then excused ourselves to our room - where we ran into a similar issue getting the wifi to work.....  but it will be beautiful!  They'll get the rules and order of operations worked out, and it will be prohibitively expensive in a year or so.  Best of luck to the property and its staff.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, modern amenities
text: Stayed only for one night in downtown Chicago. The location of London House is the best; close to river attractions, landmarks, and restaurants. The room itself (18 floor facing Trump Building) is spacious with many modern amenities. TV with Chrome Cast is fancy but I doubt many guests would stay inside the room for TV while in Chicago. I checked in late (around 8:55) and the front desk said I can still order dinner in lobby lounge (2F) or rooftop club (21F) and rooftop bar (22F) by 10:00. After I'm all settled and took the smart elevator up, unfortunately it was pouring raining that night and 22F is closed. Also, it was very loud on 21F, given it's a club. When I finally sat down at the 2F lounge, it's almost 9:40 and I waited for 15 minutes without anyone asking me for orders or drinks. I walked outside to dine somewhere else instead. Will stay here again for its location and room. Maybe will give the service another try, maybe not.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Not a good choice for business
text: Don't be fooled by the Hilton affiliation...you'll get better service at even the low-end Hilton brand hotels. These guys are completely in over their heads. Meager food service, nonchalant desk staff, sloppy and uneven housekeeping. All of the negative comments you read here are true...and it's well beyond "opening day jitters" at this point. This is a gorgeous facility in a terrific location that is completely unreliable for the business traveler. For the price they're charging, your stay should be miles better than what this team is offering up. Will be shocked if they can make a go of it an a market with so many other, better places to stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, Beautiful Rooms, Incredible Rooftop
text: If this hotel is within your price range, book it. Don't look any further.I'll keep this review short so you don't waste any more time looking. You can thank me by passing this information on to someone else.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Spot, Great Hotel
text: Perfect location and absolutely spotless. Rooms are really sharp, staff are very helpful and there's a bar in the lobby for those who may need to wait for their room. Bar/cafe area on the roof is really wonderful, must be 21, so our kids were not able to see the view. Shopping on Michigan Ave is several blocks away, this is closer to parks. Valet parking is around $71 a night, or you can use a parking app for valet parking literally steps from the hotel for $42 a night. Love this place and will return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Surprisingly Nice
text: What a nice hotel!  The rooms are all newly renovated from the looks of it and my room was spacious enough for a hotel in the city.  I loved the large bathroom and shower, everything was super clean.  The service was great too and the perfect location to walk up Michigan Avenue.  You must check out their rooftop bar and get the foie gras appetizer!  The view is amazing!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing
text: Best hotel we've ever stayed in. The bed was incredible, and could not get over how comfortable and clean everything was. The shower and and bathroom was also amazing, and loved the view of the Chicago River from both the bed and bathroom. Will definitely be staying here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Nice Hotel But Aloof Staff
text: Room was was well appointed and coffee maker was great. Large TV and good shampoo / conditioner. Only had one robe in room for two guests.  Great location but limited common space and no executive area.  Printer was broken. Odd that you show up for breakfast and staff doesn't speak to you other than the omelet chef. Otherwise, delicious breakfast.  Could be a great hotel but not yet there.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Almost there. It wiill be great
text: Plus: Rooms are beautiful and the hotel is beautiful. Bed comfortable, furnishings spot on. Great location.Cons: Hotel just opened so they are is still getting the kinks out. Customer service desk is not sure how to run the systems. Room service has no attention to details when serving food. No mini bar in room, drinking glasses or items in the room to use to entertain. I would stay there again hoping that the service kicked it up a notch to match the price of a 5-star hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great pick before back to college
text: Awesome hotel! Perfect location, great service, immaculate room. Perfect for my daughter and I before she returns to college. I can't wait to go back with my husband for a weekend getaway! The roof top bar has amazing views. Service was a little slow, but there wasn't much they could do about that. Staffed properly, but was at its max. capacity so it did take a few min. to get a glass of wine. Would definition recommend to friends and family .

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful Stay
text: We had a wonderful stay at this new hotel.  The check in staff was friendly and provided sufficient information at check-in.  The hotel is located in a great location with spectacular views.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large and spacious.  We enjoyed the electronic pads at the elevators to get to your destination.  Another plus for us was that the TV was set up with chromecast so you could stream Netflix to the TV.  Would definitely stay here again.  We also had the opportunity to have a reservation at the rooftop which was great!  One note - Uber had some difficulty with pick up and drop off since gps gets a little off on lower/upper wacker.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Still a few growing pains but delightful in all important ways
text: We spent 7/22-24 at this property and can't wait to return. The staff and common areas exceeded our expectations. The evening rooftop experience was missed due to a conflict with availability and a previous commitment, but we were able to "walk in" for mimosas on Saturday morning to take in the view. It is spectacular to say the least.We had a corner studio on the 19th floor (1933) that had a couple of issues. The fan in the bath was not operating during our stay. No big deal. A bigger deal was the air conditioning unit/fan located in the ceiling adjacent to the sleeping area. It seemed to be incapable of operating for more than a minute or two and was LOUD during the activation and shutdown. Perhaps that's because the thermostat was on the wall directly in the path of the airflow. Kicked on and off continuously both day and night sounding, each time, like a car traveling across a metal - grate bridge. (No, we didn't complain. First night arrived so late due to airline delay that a hurricane wouldn't have disturbed us - busy during the day before the second night and forgot to mention it before leaving. By the time we settled in for our second night it was too late to expect any remediation, if otherwise possible. Our mistake!)Only other issue is that I have yet to receive our electronic invoice despite being informed at check out it was being sent at that precise moment, and again 4 hours later when I called to report that it had not been received.  We'll give it another day or two before I annoy these people further.Location of the property can't be beat-convenient to everything we wanted to do.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing!
text: I stayed here for a week while I was on business in Chicago. The LondonHouse is in a perfect location for shopping, dining, and everything in between. I stayed on the seventeenth floor and had a stunning view of the river. The rooms are clean, modern, and decently sized. I did not interact with the front desk at all, as I checked in on the Hilton Hhonors app, and used the digital key. This worked flawlessly for me, and I did not have any issues unlocking my door. The bar on the twenty first floor was trendy, and the bartender was great. He remembered all of our orders every time we went, and gave us plenty of suggestions for dining. The rooftop bar has stunning views. You really have to experience it for yourself. I already have this hotel booked for upcoming business trips in Chicago, and hope I will always be able to book it!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love This Place!
text: We stayed here during their 1st week and loved it. Our room was on the 21st floor, with gorgeous river and big building views. Good sized room with comfy bed & very soft bedding, huge flat screen tv across from bed and the bathroom had lovely marble and came with nice toiletries. The staff were all incredibly warm and friendly. A few of the staff members greeted me by my name during our 5-day stay which was really impressive. My husband and I had a problem with the in-room safe, and the manager (Mike?) was very attentive and handled it immediately by coming to our room and then letting us store our passports in the hotel safe when ours couldn't be fixed. He even treated us to a complimentary drink while we waited for everything to get sorted in the hotel lobby!  The rooftop lounge at sunset is a must do while here. Also experienced friendly staff, great service and unbeatable views.Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel, poor service
text: Obviously a very nice, luxurious hotel, but I had several service issues. The front desk initially had a wrong credit card for me on file and was unable to change to the correct one... Also on my day of checkout, I stored my luggage to pick up later that day. When I came to pickup it took them over 20 minutes to find my luggage.
