I saw the attendant going back and forth between two different storage rooms, and asked if I could come in to help identify the bags - which I was initially denied. Finally, once I made it apparent that I needed my luggage to catch my flight, the manager decided to let me in. It took me all of 10 seconds to spot and grab my luggage...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Outstanding Stay
text: I recently spent a night at the LondonHouse Chicago in a Vista Suite, and the room was incredible!  It had great amenities, including 2 large flat screen televisions, and innovative technology.  They really worked hard to make this a stand-out experience.  Keith and his wonderful team made me feel welcome, and I will definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Major Brand Hotel with Boutique Hotel Touches
text: Husband and I stayed here as a quick weekend getaway for our wedding anniversary ! Location: Convenient enough for us to walk to the shops on the magnificent mile, John Hancock building, and navy pier in about 20 minutes to each destination. Hotel Atmosphere: Lush, boutique hotel style with chic masculine room decor. Service/Hospitality: Bellhops and front desk staff were attentive. We forget out toothpaste and toothbrushes- the were happy to send some to the room, although we had to request them twice , with them eventually arriving the next morning . The bellhop, Marcus, was such a pleasant person to see and chat with each time we returned to the hotel-- a real bright spot in our experience !! Food: With no menu available online we bravely ventured into the hotel restaurant for a late dinner. Menus was limited and appeared to be going for an international flare. *note, food service here at in the room ends at 11pm*. Thus,still hungry from our busy day, we ended up having to stumble around the neighborhood before we found an open bar to grab a bite. Pizza delivery would have been our back up plan had we not found a bar. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and would stay here again if we found a great package deal! ::vlm::

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Too hip to bother being a hotel
text: Avoid this latest attempt at contemporary. There isn't a professional anywhere in sight. No one knows how to run a hotel as they believe their own hype. Rooftop lounge is chaos and service is abysmal.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel & Amazing Staff
text: We stayed at the LondonHouse for one evening.  The staff was top notch especially Carlos - front desk manager.  He went above and beyond to make sure our experience was unforgettable.  Abel was so informative and enthusiastic about the restaurants in the area.  The hotel is busy with people but each time we talked with any of the staff, they did not rush you, instead they made you feel like you were number one.  Cruz the manager in the bar area was extremely helpful.  He took the time to take us up stairs to LH Rooftop and show us all around.  This property is gorgeous.  Thank you everyone at the LondonHouse for an incredible stay!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A great hotel with friendly staff
text: I only stayed one night but received exceptional service before and during my stay. I want to give a special thank you to Sherman for his help & patience in answering my questions before my arrival. In fact, all the staff I came into contact with were friendly and always acknowledged me whether I was coming or going. My room was clean and spacious with an excellent view of the river. The hotel is in a great location on Michigan Avenue and I highly recommend reserving a river view room. Be aware, though, that you will hear some noise from the streets below so if you don't like hearing buskers or honking cars you might want to bypass the river view room or try a higher floor. I was on the 8th floor and could hear everything pretty well. It didn't bother me because it's part of the whole experience of staying in downtown Chicago and I always travel with earplugs since I'm a light sleeper anyways. Overall, I can't say enough good things about this hotel or the people who work there. It's definitely one to stay at again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Really wanted to give this place 4 stars
text: I really wanted to give this place 4 stars but cant.  The service & location was fantastic but there just something about an office building converted to hotel.  The lobby is sterile and unwelcoming and the hotel just feels cold. The roof deck has a stunning view but rain the day we were there forced us to the bar on the floor below which is dark with no windows.  I also wanted to get dinner inside the hotel on another stormy Chicago night but i couldn't figure out where to go and the corner bakery in the building was already closed. There is also NO pool or sundeck which i found odd. The location is fantastic a with the river walk directly across the street.  If you can get a good rate Id say go for it but there are far nicer hotels to stay at in Chicago if you cant.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Substandard Hotel / Serious Issues
text: I spend approximately 300 nights per year in Hilton properties, and this has been one of my worst Hilton experiences. On the first two nights, I had to sleep with the A/C out of service, and the room over 80 degrees F. Maintenance came 4 or 5 times to the room, and could not fix the problem. I was not offered a room change until the third day, when I spoke with the Front Office Manager. The new room was of a lower category. The room was not cleaned on the second day, even after I asked three times. On the other days, the room wasn‚Äôt cleaned until I called the Front Office at around 6pm.Breakfast is absolutely ridiculous. It‚Äôs a makeshift buffet at the lobby bar, with a couple of pastries, fruit and omelets. I asked for toast and was told I‚Äôd have to pay $6 for that! There are only five proper tables, which are always occupied. The other few tables are low-height coffee tables and are not appropriate for a meal. The lines for breakfast are ridiculous, and ultimately this means we ate somewhere else most days.There are a lot better options in Chicago, Hilton or otherwise.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Pleasure Trip
text: We stayed here with two other couples, our three rooms were outstanding, the decor was very nicely done.  Bathrooms plenty of space and the shower was a dream.  Staff was accommodating, customer service was above and beyond and they want out of their way to assist.  I will be returning for my next visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Room with a Great View
text: We loved our large, comfortable room at the LondonHouse with its Nespresso coffee maker and wonderful view of the Chicago River, although it was hard to ignore the "TRUMP" in twenty foot tall letters on the building across the river. The hotel just opened, and management needs to do some work on breakfast, but the staff was unfailingly pleasant, helpful, and responsive. We would definitely stay here again. I should also point out the location: walking distance to the theatres and shopping.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House Hilton
text: This hotel is very new; when we arrived it had only been open a couple of weeks.  The valet parking went fairly smoothly and check-in was easy as I had done it electronically.  We received a Hilton Honors Gold upgrade to a superb room with a view across the river looking north toward the Tribune Tower and to the east all the way along the river to Lake Michigan.  The bellman was very helpful, bringing us extra towels and water bottles as we got settled in.  There is an expresso machine in the room which also was a nice touch.  The hotel is elegant and the elevator system very modern, allocating service based on room numbers as entered to the six cars, so there was little waiting.  Upon returning to the room after dinner, however, neither our electronic keys or the scannable key found in the Hilton app would open the room door! This required an aggravating trip down to the from desk and some additional fiddling with their computers to get back in our room.  The included breakfast (for Hilton Honors Gold members ) the next morning was quite good, including excellent pastries, great coffee and made to order omelets.  This was overall a great experience, but for the unexplained door lock malfunction.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location
text: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights mid July.First off we found the hotel to be gorgeous and the staff to be incredibly friendly and so attentive.We needed parking while here and I was not willing to pay the $75.00 per night the hotel charged so I used Spot Hero. You reserve and purchase a parking spot at this hotel for a fraction of the cost. I paid $23.00 per night and was pleased with the service and ease.Since we were playing tourist and were looking for help to find the most effective trips/tours. We sat with the concierge. Anthony, was his name and he was by far our favorite person we encountered on the entire trip. He offered us a lot of information, choices, and even booked some tickets for us. All the while, having us in stitches! Thank you Anthony for being such a great help!!I would definitely stay at this hotel again as we had no issues and loved the location. We walked everywhere (our fitbits were sooooo happy with us). And since the hotel is in the middle of everything it was perfect. Highly recommend the London House

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location, beautiful rooms and helpful staff
text: Great hotel. It is beautiful and views of the river were amazing. The staff was exceptional. Very friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend LondonHouse.  I will definitely be back. It is close to shopping, Navy Pier and great restaurants.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Follow my advise and stay somewhere else
text: I had a reservation for 07/22/2016 and when I got to the hotel they couldn't find it. Ok, that could happen. However, the concierge was rude and made us feel like we were not welcome. We were patient and tried to work with him on finding it but he wont cooperate. When he finally found it, it was to late for our mood and ended up staying somewhere else.. I know it sounds odd but that was our experience. I'll never put a foot in here ever again and I'll highly encourage people I know to stay somewhere else where you don't feel as unwelcome as we did.  Trust me, it was that bad of an experience. This is my first negative review on TripAdvisor ever. That should tell you something.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A hip place to lay your head
text: Flew into Chicago to see a concert and for a quick getaway. Stayed two nights in this posh hotel. Great room, very fashionable. A place to see and be seen at. Extraordinary location with amazing views.  A tip - grab a bite at the rooftop restaurant on a nice night. You can look over the city and see what you are going to conquer next.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: On my list for return visit
text: First stay at London House Chicago.  I'm in Chicago for work regularly and have stayed at several of the Hilton north loop, mag mile hotels.  London House is a great addition to the portfolio.  Well designed, comfortable room.  Big bathroom, nice toiletries. Nespresso machine.  Very comfortable bed.My free breakfast as a HH gold was continental but they do make a sort of omelette to order for you.  Good pastries but a bit disorganized on my second day (I did say something to the guest agent on checking out and she offered to take something off the room rate; I asked for extra HH points instead, she said she needed someone else to approve that so we shall see.)Great location at corner of N Michigan and the river.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: London House
text: The Hotel was recently redone. Overall a Nice renovation. Less street noise than other Hotels in the City that I have stayed at. Very convenient be close to the River. Walking distance to many restaurants. The Hotel was very clean and Modern, yet had an old feel to it for the city. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Experience, Great Service
text: Amazing hotel with fantastic finishes in the bathrooms, and great views of the river. Staff was super helpful. Efficient checkin, room upgrade, great service. I was locked out of my room and they sent security up within minutes to take care of it. the rooftop bar is amazing as well.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best rooftop bar in the City!
text: Our stay at the LondonHouse Chicago Hotel was a great experience for my family.  The rooftop bar is fantastic, with glorious views of the river and downtown Chicago.  The renovated lobby was "chic" and the rooms, with floor to ceiling windows,  overlooked the City.  The location of the hotel was perfect and the staff (with special thanks to Karen at the front desk) could not have been more accommodating.  A tip for Hilton Honors members---if there is a waiting line to get into the rooftop bar, tell the host that you are an Honors member and you will be placed at the front of the line.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Mixed review - Nice hotel but needs to sharpen service Issues and elevators
text: We picked the LondonHouse for a guy‚Äôs weekend - July 15th -17th.  Overall, we had a disappointing stay due to service issues and slow elevators.  The hotel has a cool look but the constant service issues/slow elevators masked the novelty of the hotel.  We arrived for a 3 pm check-in on Friday and after a two 1/2 hour wait the front desk finally found us a room.  The room we booked online was supposed to have floor to ceiling windows - we ended up with a brick-wall view and a weird interior window that separated the bedroom from the living room.  They did provide Breakfast vouchers for the delay but the morning continental spread was very sparse and wasn't refilled and we couldn‚Äôt find a service attendant.  The rooftop offers an amazing view but you'll have to be tolerant due to the elevator system that can be very slow during peak hours.  During checkout we had to dispute our bill since they charged us for parking and we didn‚Äôt park at the hotel. Overall, the hotel has a very hip look but can be confusing and difficult to navigate.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel on the River
text: I stayed at this property and was very pleased. The view was fantastic. The ambiance was perfect. I love how close it is to everything. The view in the lobby on the 2nd floor is even great. management and staff is amazing. I will stay again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago Londonhouse
text: Very nice hotel brand new.  The rooftop bar is amazing. Cafe on first floor is great for breakfast. It is in the center of downtown. Old building that was recently renovated. Rooms are very large. You will not be disappointed

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Poor Service for A Luxury Hotel
text: I have never been treated so poorly before at a hotel until this stay. One would expect more from a luxury hotel. The wait staff named Shannon was outrageously rude to me, to my guest, and to my sister-in-law who also stayed at your location during the same weekend. She was rude by rushing us during breakfast and said "We close in 10 minutes so right now would be a great time to make your selection." The following day when my sister-in-law asked if she could take a to go cup of coffee because the breakfast area was closing, Shannon told her "This is a luxury hotel. We don't have to go cups!" The bartender at the rooftop bar was completely obnoxious and rude. Housekeeping took our dirty towels and never replenished the towels nor the toilet paper. We actually had to borrow toilet paper from my sister-in-law's room. Housekeeping left 2 orange dust mittens and a dirty washcloth on the desk in the hotel room. One staff member was assisting walk-ins to the rooftop bar but never assisted hotel guests when entering floors on the elevator keypads. As we were checking out the concierge never asked us how our stay was just basically rushed us out.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful New Hotel
text: My sister and I are always looking for new places to see.  I have never been to a Texas Ranger game and I'm from Texas soo....why not Wrigley Field. LOL  We stayed at the new London House and it was amazing!! Our room was beautiful. Outside our 1oth floor window was Trump towers. The design of the entire hotel is breath taking.  The doorman (we neglected getting his name) was so very helpful with these two Texas girls. We were not disappointed with anything!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel
text: Most of the reviews I read about this hotel were great however there were a few minor complaints. If you want to complain about the valet taking 30 minutes to retrieve your car from the parking garage, then you're just looking for something to complain about. This is a great hotel, in a great location, with great staff. Hilton never disappoints.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Impeccable hotel in a great location!
text: You can't beat the location of the hotel. It was impeccably decorated and the rooms were top notch. I loved having a robe and all the high end amenities. The only drawback is the street noise. Ask for a room away from the street if you don't want to hear the extra noise. The hallway noise was very quiet though.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top Notch!
text: The staff at London House did not disappoint!  They went above and beyond my expectations.   The design, view and service were top notch.  I will be back and so will my friends.  We can't wait to experience the Cupola!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very cool
text: This hotel is as cool as the city in its name. It oozes modern European chic and flair. The room (king) was spacious and clever in its use of space, the bed was one of the most comfortable king I've slept in, it felt lush and luxurious. The breakfast / lounge area on the second floor (aptly named "Bridges") has a fantastic view over Marina Towers and the river with its many bridges. Never made it up to the rooftop bar but I heard it's great. My new favorite hotel in Chicago, would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent New Hotel
text: Excellent new hotel crafted into a landmark building. Up to date conveniences, quiet and a staff that is more than friendly and accommodating. View from hotel room over the Chicago river can not be rivaled. 22nd floor lounge and roof top bar with unparalleled view will amaze. A couple of minor service bugs that are a result of the "newness" that were appreciated feedback and resolved.Perfect location and close to all that downtown Chicago has to offer.I would highly recommend this hotel without reservation.Also if you really like seafood, a few blocks away is Shaw's and certainly worth your time.RM , Oregon

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel
text: I would give this hotel 10 stars if I could! Brand new and every staff person we interacted with was very friendly & helpful. We enjoyed the luxurious touches & we hated to leave! The access to the elevators & rooms made us feel very safe & secure! Fikret (bell hop) was extremely helpful and even gave us driving directions when we left! I would highly recommend a stay. And try the Corner Bakery for breakfast. Very reasonable & tasty with healthy options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful service, wonderful view, quiet,
text: Superb service, the view was fantastic, and it was a quiet place to sleep.  Every person working there was unbelievably accommodating and pleasant. The room was very clean, and comfortable, but there really wasn't a place but the floor to put the luggage. I wasn't thrilled about the room service food quality and the price for throwing the food away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location!
text: Spent 2 nights. Most hotels were booked for this somewhat last minute trip. Decided to try LondonHouse. Only open 7 weeks but what a great place! Spacious room. Great views. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds. Breakfast is awkward just out in the open. Maybe will change down the road??  Highly recommend. Central to everything!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Modern Excellence
text: The Hilton Curio LondonHouse was fantastic all brand new design! The views of the river and city were fantastic! We had a Vista King Room that featured floor to ceiling glass windows! These were great rooms that I would highly recommend! Also it has a roof top bar that was great as well! Great location in the city as well!Definitely great value for the price for the rooms!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
text: Once I heard about the opening of the LondonHouse Chicago I canceled my other hotel reservation and booked this hotel. Best decision ever! Perfect location, amazing and extremely helpful staff and just all around great hotel to stay at when visiting Chicago! Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here every time I go back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Gracious Hospitality
text: My stay at the London House was PHENOMENAL! I will rave about this place to absolutely everyone I know. The hotel is only a few weeks old so everything is new! My girlfriend and I had a room on the 19th floor with a breathtaking view of the river and city. The beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless! My girlfriend and I were in town visiting just for the weekend and the London House could not have been in a better location- it was next to everything! I could go on and on about how great the hotel is but what truly made our stay was the great hospitality we received! Sherman and Jackie at the front desk went above and beyond for my girlfriend and I! I work at a Forbes 5 star resort and have been in the hospitality industry for over 15 years and I have not seen someone as great as Sherman or Jackie in a long time. We truly appreciate everything they both did to make our stay so memorable.Next time I am in Chicago I will definitely be returning to stay at the London House not only for the hotel but because of the hospitality!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great New Hotel and Location
text: I stayed at the LondonHouse in July 2016 with two other friends, but I booked my own king bed room for myself with my HHonors points.  It was a very good hotel, and the location was perfect along the river.  Room 1848 had a small view of the river, and a window in the bathroom with a rolling shade for privacy.  The lack of light at night was disappointing in the room; I felt it was too dark especially in the rooms hallway...which had three Good size Windows in the daytime for light.  The room was pretty clean, and the hotel just opened a few months before our stay.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I will say the most disappointing part of the stay was the breakfast.  compared to other Hilton properties I've stayed at overseas, the breakfast was very very small.  Luckily it was complementary for me as a member, but it is not worth the money if you had to pay for it.  They had a small breakfast station set up at the bar and an omelette station.  The seating in the bar area was not comfortable for breakfast or eating at.  I can see the look they are going for, but eating there for breakfast to me felt uncomfortable and the selection was very small for the price if paid for.  The location of the hotel is right across from the major bus tour companies.  When you walk outside the hotel you can see the Chicago Tribune and Trump buildings.  Overall, it was a great stay and I would consider staying at this hotel again.  It is very new, nice looking, and the staff is friendly.  It reminds me of some of the boutique hotels I've seen and stayed at in Europe.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: TAKES ITS PLACE WITH TOP LUXURY HOTELS IN CHICAGO
text: The 1923 built London Guaranty Company Building at Wacker Drive and the Michigan Ave Bridge - the best location in town - has undergone a gut rehab from an office building to a deluxe hotel, and did it without changing the exterior of the historic section of the two-part building.  Unlike the vulgar 17 foot sign on the Trump Tower directly across the river, LH added only a discreet sign on the historic building along with a small metal canopy with sign on the new addition.The exterior rooftop lounge and bar with its deep views of the Chicago River on both sides, including a partial view of Lake Michigan on the other, is a dazzler and a must-see, although often not immediately available because of the long lines.Perhaps guests could be given priority access by showing the room entry card?Oddly, the original building entrance is no longer being used, although it has two highly informative paintings describing the immediately adjacent river as being the original port of Chicago and the busiest on the Great Lakes. (The port was moved with the addition of two-level Wacker Drive in 1926, and it is now a sophisticated and pedestrian-friendly River walk). Perhaps management will yet open this as an alternate entrance, especially since it is so dramatic.The overall decor is stylishly modern with luxurious patterned and sculptured carpeting especially noteworthy.  Decor in the medium size lobby, which is on the second floor, is also appealing, and the large windows with sensational views add to the first impression.  Friendly front desk with personnel nicely attired and helpful.  Another feature of interest are the 'intelligent" elevators, from which the floor is tapped-in and one of 6 elevators is shown as being next.  The six elevators from the previous office building era means that an elevator is almost always nearby.  The carpet style continues into the wide hallways and generously appointed guest rooms.  The following refers only to the front facing rooms and not to the interior rooms, which are about one-third of all rooms.  (Views from interior rooms are completely different.)  The views front front-facing rooms are not merely outstanding, they are unforgettable, as powerful as anywhere in Chicago or anywhere in America..  The larger rooms, such as at corners, are practically junior suites with sitting area and desk on one side and then the bed and bath on the other, each separated by what must be the largest HD TV in Chicago, an impressive 55 inch flat screen within an attractive wood patterned frame.  Except that so much is immediately available within steps of the hotel, it is almost a reason to linger longer.  The TV is also interactive with the ability, for example, to stream content from I phone to TV.  A classy vintage look combination radio, alarm and blue-tooth also allows streaming with good sound. Excellent, quiet ventilation and air-conditioning.  Comforters on top-quality mattress, among the best experienced.  Large, bright bath with patterned glass translucent door that slides into a frame from room to the bath also succeeds.In keeping with many new hotels, tubs are no longer a bath feature, but the separate shower enclosure has a wide and inviting shower stream, although the shower enclosure lacks places for towels and face cloths, although the handle suffices.  While the toiletries are good quality and the soap bar, while not especially large, is sufficient, not everyone will agree with the essence or even recognize the name of the brand. (When asked for the name at the spa, the attendant said she didn't know and that the brand was not used in the spa.)  The bath area itself has only one hook for clothing or towels.  A min-fridge and Nespresso machine are thoughtful additions, at least in the front facing rooms, many of which may be higher-priced, but worth it. Another oddity is that no stationery or note pads are in the room. The free wi-fi is also noteworthy, because staying in a deluxe hotel that requires guests to pay extra for wi-fi is as offensive as beachfront or resort hotels charging a "resort fee" for the "privilege" of using the pool and towels. Avoid them.  As of mid-July 2016, the hotel is about 2 months old, but is already very popular in a city that greets 52 million visitors every year and increasing.  With some fine-tuning, the London House is most certainly a five star hotel and fully capable of competing with the city's other five star properties.  Along life is assured.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hot Spot Cool Decor Scores Big
text: Whoa, we hit the jack pot on this one. I've been a Hilton Honors member for a few years now and I decided to go Hilton this time for our last minute stay in downtown Chicago. The chain knocked this one out of the ball park. Here's why: the hotel is in the best location ever. It's on the river, walking distance to everything downtown- Michigan Avenue shopping, the Purple Pig (more on that in another review), the river walk, even Navy Pier and Andy's jazz club...And here's what I loved the most about it: the decor is super design oriented - rooms and lobby are beautifully designed with great attention to detail-  beds are super comfortable- sheets are crisp- the tile design in the bathroom is gorgeous. Hexagon slate colored ceramic tile with lots of amenities and glass and polished dark wood...Clean, high end, with outstanding views of the river and Chicago sky scrapers, all integrated within the bones of a beautiful old hallowed Chicagoan building. I felt like Ferris on his day off even though I'm a girl! Here's what you need to know though. My kids are teenagers. This isn't a place for the littles. There is an on trend bar on the roof top which sports amazing city light views. You are on top of the world here, nestled amongst the colored lights of the adjacent skyscrapers with movers and shakers. Our first night my husband and I took the digital elevator ride (don't even ask or this will ruin the fun- It felt like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory in a very bad way) up to the top and we had a romantic nanosecond under the summer skies while we left our moron kids to duke it out in the room. But the next night when we returned, there was a line to the elevator replete with arm crossed bouncers and a gal with a clipboard asking if we were on the list. I'm just saying! Turns out (from an adorable girl at Nordstrom's) - London House is the new night time hot spot in downtown Chicago. Oh, and one last thing: if you happen to have a car, which is ill advised in downtown Chicago under any circumstances- but we did - please know that parking is $70 per night. Sticker shock at first - but parking is in and out all day so it was what it was, as we needed a car for our stay.  Valets were very accommodating- apart from one I wanted to punch in the mouth. Ha! Overall, gorgeous new property. Well done Hilton 'Curio Collection' whatever that means - curious? We had a great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel and location! Exceeded our expectations!!!
text: This was our first time trying Hilton's Curio collection. It surpassed our expectations!! We arrived around 10am and asked if our room was ready (knowing that we arrived early for check-in but hoping the room was available). Bryan at the front desk was amazing!  He upgraded us to a suite since it was our anniversary and let us check in early!  The room was beautiful and spacious!!!!  When we came back to our room from exploring the city, Bryan had chocolate covered strawberries waiting in our room!!!!  The room had a nespresso coffee machine which I loved since I have a machine at home!  The amenities and the continental breakfast were great!!!!  We had a very nice view of Wacker St from the window we were sitting next too at breakfast!! My husband and I will definitely be returning to this hotel!!!! This has been our favorite Hilton brand hotel so far!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience @ LH Chicago
text: LondonHouse chicago did not disappoint!! It's a New Chicago hotel with Great views of the Chicago River & old Chicago Architecture.  My wife & I recently stayed for our BDays in July. The staff was extremely friendly & accommodating from Front Door to the Roof top!!The Concierge Jose helped w/ our Dinner reservation at Mastros which did not disappoint and accommodated us with a table for drinks on the 22nd floor, which had exceptional views.  On the 22nd floor we were greeted by a Gentleman named Cruz which gave us a small tour of the roof top & made us feel at home.  The Rooms were nice w/ an amazing view & the most comfortable Beds. Slept like a baby!!In conclusion , I would definitely recommend this place if you would like to enjoy a fun relaxing time in chicago!!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary
text: What a wonderful experience!!! I've stayed at many hotels in Chicago but this hotel is definitely top notch!  The views are unbelievable! We showed up at the lounge and had not made a reservation.  We spoke to one of the staff members and explained our dilemma. They introduced us to Leonidas Fronimos and we explained to him our dilemma again. He was attentive and accommodating.  He was able to get us a table and made sure to have staff bring us our drinks quickly.  We were so grateful for his accommodations. Through out the night he checked in on us. Before we left he asked us for our contact information and if there was anything else he can be of assistance during our trip.  We thanked him and said he had already gone above and beyond.  I didn't expect much but a few days later we received an email from Leonidas.  He asked about our trip and invited us back when we were in Chicago again.  The hotel and staff are excellent. Thank you Leonidas for making our trip super special and memorable!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect Location, the rest is average
text: Spent 3 nights here with extended family. The hotel is beautiful, clean & new.  The rooms are average sized & the beds are comfortable. The light switches are buttons & there is a master switch, it takes a little getting used  to. The closet is small, but it has a safe. There are drawers under the beds for storage. Nespresso Coffee Maker & mini fridge are in all the rooms.  The river view is beautiful!The staff at this hotel is okay. Not friendly, but pleasant enough to be polite. We were given misinformation by the front desk twice just after our arrival, so we were not confident about their knowledge of the hotel & it's operation.   Hotel guests are given priority access to the rooftop bar. If you plan to go up, I recommend a reservation. It is a small space with a nice view, but not worth waiting in line. The breakfast is weird. Fruit, (small cups of diced cantaloupe & honeydew melon), bananas, yogurt, muffins & made to order omelettes  are all included in the breakfast, but you have to pay extra for toast.  Toast.  $3.50

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful room & Excellent service
text: I have stayed at many hotels and boutique hotels in Chicago and this is one of my favorites by far!  I had checked in digitally via Hikton app and my room wasn't ready at 4pm as promised. They were awesome and gave my date and I complimentary drinks of choice while we waited which was over 60.00 for 4 drinks and complimentary breakfast for two! I had selected the king vista suite and was highly impressed!  The view from floor to ceiling Windows was amazing and an excellent choice! Our room overlooked the canals on Wacker and Trump towers. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and provided a good nights rest. The room was clean, furnished well and the bathroom was spacious with a huge walk in shower. Though I enjoyed the toiletries I do wish they would have been less fragrant or more non gender.. They smelled like the men's cologne Farenheight.  Though I love that cologne.. I didn't want to smell like it. Other than that it was a perfect stay!  The front seat also chewed my phone for me since my charger wasn't working. The service received went above and beyond my expectations!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Good, A solid 4.75 stars
text: Everything was very nice, Service/Staff was on par with a 5 star hotel. Breakfast was a little thin Muffins and Omelets. My room was new and very nice with a great view of the river, it was just a little on small size.  The size of rooms and lack of common areas keep this from being a 5 star property. Don't misunderstand my review, This is a Very Good Hotel!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Very Nice
text: I recently spent a few days at the LondonHouse Chicago during a business trip. The hotel is new and clearly working hard to make a name for itself as a solid choice in Chicago's Loop/Miracle Mile area. I was really impressed during my stay.My room was well appointed and very comfortable. The Internet connection was not what I'd call "blazing fast" - if you want to stream content or need to upload/download large files, it's worth the upgrade. The TV was surprisingly large and reception very clear (although being in the heart of downtown I doubt you'll spend much time watching TV).The rooftop bar is really nice and seems pretty popular. The only concern I had is the breakfast service. It is held in the lobby bar area, which is quite small (and loud), and doesn't really offer much comfortable seating for diners. There was a very limited selection of foods - an omelette station, a few bread items, and that was about it. The breakfast was definitely not worth the price.That being said, though, everything else about my stay was excellent and if the pricing remains competitive I'll certain keep the LondonHouse on my shortlist of places to stay when in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Chicago at the LH
text: Brand new hotel, great location u can walk to both main Chicago attractions....Navy Pier and Michigan Ave, also activity on the river which the hotel overlooks, have got to do Kayaking on the river, it's a lot of fun

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Disappointed
text: As I diamond member, I travel Hilton hotels quite often. I was very disappointed when I stayed at LondonHouse. I wish I had stayed at theWit hotel instead. When I first arrived, I had to wait in a 20 min line to check in. I was never greeted as diamond member. In fact, there was no acknowledgement (No water, no note thanking me for being a guest at the hotel).  The rooms are very small!! It is very difficult to get a seat for breakfast. It was impossible to get up to the roof and restaurant on 21st floor. Every time we tried to take the elevator, it was packed and couldn't get on. The location is great though.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great luxury hotel in the heart of Chicago!
text: Londonhouse is a brand new hotel right in downtown Chicago.  Let me start by saying that the room rate we got was quite inexpensive so the normal room rates may be higher.  But nevertheless, this hotel is pretty amazing.  The room has everything you could possibly need and the staff are extremely accommodating.  The room is virtually brand new and extremely clean and updated.  We stayed in a corner suite that had a long hallway so it felt as if we had our own apartment.  The rooftop bar has great views and the drinks were good (yet pricy).  Overall this is a hotel you never want to leave.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great property, Lousy service for the price
text: We upgraded our room with points and our check-in process was good. I was welcomed as a Diamond member. It was a beautiful room overlooking the river. However, the service aspect of this hotel is weirdly lacking. They charge you 71 Dollars for a Valet and what you get is attitude from the Valet service and the hotel employees. They won't even respond to questions about when the car can be requested (I was told 15 minutes. It's going on to 40 minutes now. No sign of our car yet! Awesome, right? Just what you expect from a hotel you just paid 600 Dollars to!)The free breakfast is so ridiculous, that they don't even have toast or any kind of meat - just some cold pastry, fruits, jam and coffee. Oh! And omlette. I always associated that with toast... Nevermind, I guess! Another weird experience happened when I called to ask where I could find our breakfast (because I wasn't informed about it at check-in), the lady who answered kept going on and on about how free breakfast was only for Gold and Diamond members. This was after I mentioned that I had coupons for breakfast. What was she trying to imply? That I was trying to score a free breakfast sneakily?Amazing how the best situated, most glitzy hotel can ruin your experience with bad service.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Room with a view
text: Amazing views throughout hotel. Incredible service at both hotel and rooftop!  Especially Jennifer, Chanel and Leo who went out of their way to make our experience special.  Close to everything right on the chicago River and Michigan avenue!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect
text: Im pretty picky or shall I say, candid?  This place was perfect though.  The location was wonderful, right on the river and central to Michigan Ave. shopping, theaters, the Art Museum and restaurants.  Some rooms have a breathtaking view.  My room (corner studio) had a nice view of the river and the the room rate was modest.  Higher rate= better view I assume. Never mind though, because the roof top bar is amazing!  Also, the rooms have a Nespresso with pods (nice touch!!) - just like home! Ahhh.  The bed is comfortable, the bathroom lovely, all is clean.  I had to wait a bit for my room and was rewarded with a complimentary continental breakfast (omelet, pastries, yogurt, fruit). The only thing that was not perfect was the wait for my car (valet) - it did take some time, probably 15-20 minutes?? But I was told that parking is across the river and under another building.  Anyway, it was not a big deal as the staff were all very friendly and accommodating.  I would definitely stay here again.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Taste of Chicago
text: Very nice hotel. Bathrooms were  outstanding.excellent location. We took train to Chicago for my hometown to attend taste of Chicago and do the architectural river tour. Beautiful view of the city from the top of the London house. Please note there is a dress code after eight o'clock.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great service
text: Great place to stay!!! Came in for 1 night, and we will defiantly be back. Everyone from the Valet, Bellhop, to check-in to check-out. Awesome!!! Rooftop bar a must visit, great cocktails, and the scenery beautiful! The rooms are very clean, and the bed was cozy. A shout out to Miguel Perez & all the gentlemen for making it very welcoming.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great addition to Chicago hotel scene
text: This new Curio by Hilton hotel is a great find and definitely a step above most other hotels in the immediate area. Nice clean spacious room, great Chicago river views and a killer rooftop bar. Will definitely go back soon.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new Chicago Hotel
text: Just opened 6 weeks when I arrived. Great location on one of the canals. Very modern , chic d√©cor. Staff were excellent . Just watch out if you have to park a car...$71 valet per night and no self park option

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top notch find.. and great prices.. Love this hotel
text: This hotel is two months old and I must say one of my favorites. Soooo glad its a Hilton property. The service is spot on and fabulous, the room I had was great. (I had 19th flow looking over the river. , The bar scene is great and love the way they have breakfast set up. Just a wonderful hotel.. Look forward to going back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful rooms, lobby and best roof top
text: Enjoyed this new hotel. Elevators were confusing at first but soon figured out. Rooftop food was fabulous but u couldn't order room service from there nor bring drinks to your room.  Rooms were well appointed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location, friendly staff!
text: My husband and I wanted to spend a fun summer night in the city. We chose the LondonHouse  based on the great reviews we read.  And we are so glad we did! First of all, the location is perfect.  It is in the heart of everything.  We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Second, the staff was so friendly. Every single person we encountered smiled and greeted us.  Third, the hotel itself is just beautiful.  Everything is new and fresh. The room was perfect.  We really liked the empty fridge for drinks and leftovers. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a great temperature. We had drinks at the lobby bar and the view of the river was wonderful.  We didn't have reservations for the rooftop bar, so we went to the 21st floor and enjoyed the amazing views from a small outside terrace.  We walked through a small room with a temporary bar set up in order to get outside. Not sure if it was a private event we walked through or if it was an overflow room for those who couldn't get on the rooftop.  But no one seemed to mind.  LondonHouse is a unique hotel in a wonderful location.  The friendly, helpful staff help set it apart from the many other hotels we have stayed.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice, new hotel in convenient location
text: Spent the weekend before July 4th with friends from California. We were both upgraded because of my Hilton status and the fact that we were celebrating my husband's 50th birthday. The hotel delivered chocolate covered strawberries and a nice birthday note the first night. The hotel was quiet even though it is on the corner of Michigan and Wacker. It was convenient to transportation and activities. We had breakfast at the hotel. Coffee was warm, not hot. Selection was fine. Nothing special. The staff was very friendly. Hard to get to the rooftop to have a drink before dinner. We stopped after dinner and could go to the top but their were no tables to sit. Nice view. Workout room was clean and well-equipped.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Lacking in amenities
text: They bill themselves as a luxury hotel but in my opinion they fall a bit short I stayed in a suite for one night and I'll admit it was well appointed it had an amazing view of the river the room was small but that's quite typical for Downtown Chicago where I feel they fall short is some of the amenities and services the hotel offers sort of for example I checked in Sunday afternoon and the spa was closed no way to get ahold of anybody I actually walked to the area twice and both times the door was locked and the lights were out I don't think you should advertise that you offer spa services if you don't actually offer them and the other issue was the fitness center I've seemed larger fitness centers at roadside Hampton Inns no locker rooms no steam room I considered ordering room service but their entire room service menu breakfast lunch and dinner would fit on a 4 by 6 note card and then there's the parking at $71 even for Downtown Chicago definitely outrageous and whether you're parking your car or just being dropped off it's such a mess I witnessed multiple guest  being dropped off three cars deep out of the middle of the road there was no way for the cab to get any closer during my stay you also had issues with the elevator resulting in only one elevator working and saying that it was working is definitely a matter of opinion as people were forced to get off on the wrong floor and use the stairs to get to their floor and although the hotel sent out a letter explaining that it was just a small minor hiccup it was more than that and went on for quite some time. There was also a couple housekeeping issues in the bathroom the hotel is new and that's the reason I gave it as many stars as I did I feel like maybe they're still working out the Kinks I did bring up some of these issues to the hotel they did respond but they definitely didn't go out of their way to make anything right it's not a bad Hotel by any means but I feel like it is lacking and both amenities and service hopefully they can improve these things in time.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Road trip 2016
text: What an extraordinary hotel!  It's new and everything is fresh. Comfortable beds, Nespresso in the room, quiet for sleeping. Love this place especially the staff. Everyone is friendly, helpful, and accommodating. One of the best hotels we've stayed at. If we're ever back in Chicago, this is my first choice for accommodations. Oh! And the rooftop lounge should not be missed.  Stunning views. And the small plates selections are interesting. We loved the cheese bread. If you do go, be prepared for the attire of the patrons--on the dressier side, especially the ladies üòÄ.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous New Hotel in Downtown Chicago
text: I work in downtown Chicago and currently I am hosting a three day corporate meeting at the LondonHouse.  This new hotel opened in Spring 2016.  The hotel is not a big convention hotel nor would I consider it a boutique hotel....it is somewhere in the middle.  However I must say the hotel looks fabulous.  If you prefer a more contemporary design, this is your kind of hotel.  I stayed overnight and the standard king room is modern, elegant and clean.  The bed was amazingly comfortable.  The room was equipped with a 55-inch HDTV and walk-in shower with floor to ceiling marble.  The meeting rooms are nice.  The food served for breakfast and lunch during the meeting was delicious!  It is a little on the pricey side but you do get what you pay for.  Best of all, the service at the hotel is impeccable.  Special thanks to Sini and Justin for their top-notch, friendly service.  I highly recommend this hotel for business and pleasure.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay!
text: Heading to Chicago for a getaway night in the city and selected LondonHouse as our hotel.  We knew ahead of time that getting to the rooftop bar would be next to impossible (due to the popularity of it) so we didn't go with that expectation.  We arrived around 3pm and were able to check in to our room.  We didn't even ask about the rooftop as we heard the desk tell another guest it was sold out (again it wasn't part of our plan).  No big deal for us, so we heading to the room to see what it was like.  We loved the room.  A little on the small side, but had everything we needed.  Also like the decor in the room.  We looked out over the Chicago River which was very nice.  Bathroom was fine for it intended purpose and bathroom amenities were very nice.  The room has a large TV with many options for channels, a mini fridge and a desk.  The closet contained robes and slippers.  Next we headed to the lobby for an adult beverage and to catch some of the match.  Service was quick and friendly and prices were on par for Chicago hotel lobby drinks (a little pricey, but we were only there for one...)The location is fantastic.  You are close to the Riverwalk, steps from Michigan Ave and close to many attractions.  After exploring the city, we returned to the hotel for a night cap.  The lobby bar is small, but still had plenty of seating for the "late crowd".  Our bartender was very helpful and recommended a few drinks.  We were ready to pay the bill but the point of service system had crashed and our bartender had to do everything by hand.  He apologized for the dealy and offered comp breakfast for our troubles.  We thought that was extremely nice.  In the morning we attend breakfast (back in the lobby bar).  It did seem a bit unorganized and hard to find a table (again - small bar area).  People were sure where to sit or how to get service, but it all seemed to work out.  The fresh omelets were a nice way to end the trip.Overall extremely satisfied with our stay.  Great decor, clean rooms, friendly and helpful stay and superb location.  We will definitely stay here again!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent location and roomy
text: I used Hilton points to get a great rate and booked a double room with 2 queen beds for a day/night in the city with a friend. It was spacious and attractive, with a nice bath with walk in, oversized shower. The interior is decorated like in a "Euro-chic" but on the dark side, with no light over the coffee bar. I had to call down to housekeeping to get someone to demo the Nespresso machine -- no instructions could be found, and who knew that the coffee pod goes in sideways? Staff is nice; there's a convenient Corner Bakery right outside the front door, so you can grab some breakfast and head north or south on Michigan Avenue. (There are also restaurants within the hotel.) The location can't be beat. Lots of siren traffic at that intersection, so ask for a higher room on the interior if city noise disturbs your sleep.  Some housekeeping wrinkles could be ironed out -- a used bandaid was on our floor, and there was only one, not two, bathrobes stocked in the closet for a double room. I recommend installing a few more hooks for towels and cosmetic kits in the bathroom.  That aside, I'd gladly stay there again. Accessible from O'Hare on the El, if you don't want to get stuck  interminably in traffic and you are not hauling huge luggage.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bad Attitude and Lousy Room
text: I booked through a third party booking service and got a tiny room with an interior courtyard view.  I got the feeling that the hotel purposely put me in a lousy room because I had paid less, even though the hotel clearly wasn't sold out.  The attitude of the all the staff at the rooftop bar / restaurant was terrible, even when I stated I was a hotel guest.  Even though several tables were open, I was told I was welcome to stand at the full bar and wait for one of the high tops to open up.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend getaway
text: Amazing hotel, everyone was so helpful. The rooftop bar on the 21st great  and the food was wonderful. Great location...views overlooking the Chicago river. Walking distance to Michigan Ave and Millennium Park.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Business Stay
text: Stayed at the hotel for 8 days shortly after it opened and there were some kinks that were being worked out, especially the elevators.  There is a bank of six and it seemed only one was working.  A lot of guests were frustrated as they would wait 10 mins for one that was empty.  What also led to the elevator frustration is that the staff was using the same ones as guests and after waiting a long time, the elevator arrive only to be crowded with staff and their equipment, and thus the wait continued.  Hopefully, this has been resolved by now.  The room, 1717, was nice and comfortable and I had a nice view of the river, and Trump Hotel.  The only aggravation I had with the room was a flapping noise that I would occasionally hear form the bathroom vent.  While the location was convenient, be aware that you will hear emergency vehicle sirens somewhat frequently.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Sexy hotel in a great location
text: My husband and I decided to take a stay cation over 4th of July weekend to see a concert and be touristy.  A 5 minute cab ride from Union Station, smooth, fast check in and delicious bloody mary's in the lobby bar where we could people watch out the expansive windows.  The property is brand new and looks like it. We had a regular room with a king bed. The room was uber luxurious with stunning views of the river and the lake.  The room comes equipped with a Nespresso coffee maker and you can sip delicious coffee while lounging on the ultra comfy bed. We stayed for 2 days and slept like the dead.  The bathroom was huge and also had great views from the window - there is a shade to pull down! The toiletries provided smelled delicious.  We ordered breakfast one morning from room service, prompt and delicious. Now for the LH Rooftop - WOW! Gorgeous views. You must make a reservation online for a table, it's not that large up there.  Drinks were delicious - an Old Fashioned and Gin & Tonics were $16 each - typical for what you will pay on city rooftops. The food was foodie food - delicious and small bites. Try the duck fat truffle fries! All in all we had a great weekend and will stay again. The location cannot be beat, around the corner from Michigan Ave, walk across the street to enjoy the Riverwalk and various boat rides. The staff was courteous and accommodating.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Incredible Rooftop Lounge
text: The room was lovely, great design with the space, rooftop bar was fabulous.  Make sure you make a reservation if you want a seat.  If you are not staying at the hotel there will be a line to wait in, guests though get express line.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Weekend Stay
text: This is a brand new hotel, so it feels and smells that way. The carpet in the hallways is plush. Rooms are large and luxurious. I appreciated the great service and friendly staff. We did go up and checked out a roof top view. Gorgeous. Breakfast is prompt and tasty.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I love my stayüëçüëçüëç
text: My wife and I loved our stay at this wonderful hotel. The people that worked there was very helpful and nice the LondonHouse have gained my trust. This is my new home in Chicago for now on while I'm in town...üòä we had a good time on the roof top...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel, great location!
text: This hotel is in a great part of the city with fantastic views! Very close to the Navy Pier. The staff is extremely friendly and always had a smile and offered to help. Would definitely return here in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful new hotel in perfect location
text: Hotel had only been open 4 weeks upon arrival so clearly fresh and clean, but it is the perfect location for families or business travelers. We had a corner room on the Michigan Ave side. Great views up and down Michigan and of the river. Close to all shopping, water taxi and restaurants. Will definitely return for my business travel too!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 60th Birthday celebration
text: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at LondonHouse to celebrate his 60th. The room was beautifully appointed with awesome blackout curtains. These were really effective as our room faced east and we were not woken by the sun peaking through. The staff was very friendly and professional. They offer a very nice breakfast featuring muffins, croissants, fresh fruit, yogurt and an omelet station. Of course there are also juices and coffee as well. Now for the negatives. The wifi was wonky.  We had a very difficult time logging in. They have a beautiful rooftop but it's impossible to get a reservation as their website is very clunky. You cannot call a person to reserve and I found this particularly disappointing as I had wanted to have his birthday dinner on the rooftop or at the very least a cocktail! Those reservations are harder to get than lollapalooza tickets! We were able to at least go on the roof to see the view which is spectacular.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Shortest stay ever
text: Booked a room for 4 adults with two beds. Traveling with college aged kids. Room ready at 441p.m. Planning shopping, dinner, and a drink at much publicized rooftop. Room with view of brick walls, beds not even full sized, room tiny.  We were willing to suffer it all thinking it would be fun to be bar that evening.  Private party at bar and no way to get in.  Michael the manager assured us there were no other rooms and no access to bar.  He did refund our room charge and we checked into a suite at the ritz for 130 dollars more

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Business Trip
text: Very nice and new hotel. Very fancy expensive feel, felt a little under dressed in shorts and flip flops. :) the staff was nice, the breakfast was good but all of the food and beverages very expensive. I paid $5 for an 8 oz Diet Coke.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thanks Murphy!
text: Excellent stay starting from the warm greeting from Murphy!  After a long trip it's nice to have someone so helpful.   Murphy assisted us over and over from his warm smiles, offered help and guidance, to fulfilling we were sent on our way with all bases covered. Murph you were the first person to greet me and the last to send me off on our next adventure!  Cheers!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Location - Beautiful Hotel
text: Let me first thank the staff.   What an incredible job they do at this property.  Everyone was exceptionally accommodating and friendly.  My group stayed on the 19th floor of this totally remodeled building.  The only thing about this hotel that I saw as a negative was the approach by car.  Sharing the front with 4 other businesses on a busy street makes it tough to check in / Valet or drop bags.  There's got to be a better way.  The rooftop bar has incredible views.  The whole place was beautiful and check out the elevator system...

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Decent Accommodation Overshadowed By Parking Abuse
text: The rooms were efficient (aka on the small side) but  reasonably well appointed, although not spacious or extravagent.  Bar doubled as breakfast venue and was comfortable and airy and lots of light.  However the situation with the parking is so terrible (and ridiculously expensive - $71 per night and inconvenient) that it causes this to be a poor experience.  You would think after paying $71 to park the car overnight they would be great about retriving,...not so much.   Too a half hour and two nudges to the front desk.  Turns out they park the cars across the street with a river in between.  Would justify 5-10 minutes, but certainly not 30 minutes.  Felt injured over the charge and retrieval experience.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel downtown
text: New hotel, amenities very nice, friendly staff, great view, and conveniently located!  I would definitely return.  My bed was comfortable and room spacious.  We got a great rate since it was a group.   Londonhouse hotel is high end, you won't be disappointed!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Spectacular Wedding at the LondonHouse
text: We spent two nights at the hotel for the wedding of our son and his new bride and the venue and service were spectacular.  This was, I understand, the first booked wedding to the public since the hotel opened a few weeks prior, and the staff had their act together as if they'd been hosting such events for years.  Joy was instrumental in making sure that all the details were attended to.  We got to know the front door/valet staff very well over our stay with all our comings and goings - they were extremely personable, helpful and friendly, particularly Fikret and Corey.  The entire venue is an elegant and seamless blending of classic, vintage detail with new contemporary sensibilities - and in an unmatched, one-of-a-kind location on the very site of historic Ft. Dearborn.  When you're there, be sure to visit the Rooftop and walk the Riverwalk on a weekend evening - an outstanding urban experience.  Five stars! We'll be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect location downtown Chicago
text: Stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. Check-in was quick. We had a standard double room with lovely view of the river; like other travelers mentioned, the Trump sign could be annoying. Love the online check-in where I can pre select our room prior to arriving. Appreciate the hotel in accommodating our request of a room with view :) We didn't use the gym or pool but did check out the roof top - nice view! The room is clean and nicely appointed. My husband enjoyed the nespresso machine. We didn't really have any interaction with front desk other than at check in and check out since we just take the elevator straight to our floor. I noticed housekeeping didn't replenish bath products nor capsules for nespresso on our 2nd day there. Had to call guest service to request for more coffee supply. Overall, we had a great time; the location could not be any better, right within walking distance of all actions in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel with outstanding service and employees!
text: We live in the north burbs of the city and booked here for a mini staycation for a few days.  The hotel is beautiful and the service even better!  When we checked in Brandon at the front desk was very hospitable.  He gave us a room with a great view.  My youngest name is Brandon too, but we would have remembered him either way.  He was very personable and helpful throughout our stay.  Everyone was very inviting and smiling especially Juan L, one of the hotel managers.  He took some time to ask us about our stay when we were in the lobby.  Looks like a hotel that people enjoy working at from management to the employees!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Try something New and Love it!!!
text: I looked and looked for a place that I could afford in Chicago, Ill. We wanted to surprise Our granddaughter with a visit. We found the Landon House Chicago. It has been open for only 6 weeks, it is a Hilton property and filled with wonderful people. When we arrived we were shocked by the greeting, the d√©cor and the beautiful structure we found ourselves in.  The Location was perfect, near the river, one street over from Michigan Ave. and within walking distance to everything. The great treatment started at the door with Murphy/Don, then we were checked in by Able who couldn't have been kinder/or more professional. Eddie parked our car with a hugh smile (believe me this was a great treat). We will go back and stay here as often as possible....We love it.  The only neg. was the price of the breakfast--Having said that it was very good.....

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing!
text: After reading so many wonderful reviews of this hotel, I was skeptical that a stay would be a disappointment. I was wrong! From the initial reservation, to checking in, to the delicious breakfast, and the outstanding room, the stay was the best! Everyone went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The room was well appointed and delightful. Thank you, by the way, for the very nice upgrade! I highly recommend this excellent hotel.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Front Desk Staff Saved The Day and Stay!
text: I could write how nice the rooms are and outlets; but most hotels i stay are really nice.  I have to put this in writing for everyone to hear about what was a horrible travel situation I was in and two front desk people saved the day.  First, i checked in the stunning hotel with Alex Kleppe (Front Office/Desk Manager).  I would explain the horrific situation that occurred earlier that day but, let's keep this shorter.  Anyway, Alex listened and helped me through my stressful time, turning things to "Thank God" everything is good.  I checked into my room, which was very nice, clean and had a great view, super large shower too.  Went out the next day and finished my business, enjoyed the night and before I knew it was time to go.  Able Rodriquez checked me out with another pleasant experience, thanked me for being and staying there and hope that i come back.  I left not home, but on vacation feeling great after staying here.If I managed or owned a hotel, these two need to be cloned.  Positive, smiling, helpful, assistive, welcoming and appreciative of the business at the hotel.  They are top of my list of list.So, want a hotel where you and your business is appreciated?  Look no further!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the best stays ever! Going back in a week so impressed!
text: I have traveled the world, I personally worked as a Hotel Concierge in Chicago for a competitor for years, and I have to say the service at the LondonHouse exceeded my expectations. I knew they would have a great view due to location but the service is what puts them above the rest. Beautiful rooms, and Carlos the Assistant Front Office Manager went above and beyond to make my stay memorable. He even noted that he could see I was returning and said to make sure if anything was needed before hand to email him. This is what top service is. I can't wait to return with my niece and celebrate her birthday.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Terrific stay
text: This was our first trip to Chicago. I picked this hotel because it was new and it looked like a good location even though some of the first reviews were mixed. Well, it turned out to be a terrific location, right across from the river and central to Magnificent mile and the Loop. The hotel is beautiful and the renovations are modern but classy. The room and bathroom (good towels! and toiletries) are very nice and the bed super comfortable. We had a wonderful view of the river.The service was very good from front desk, restaurants, concierge to porters. The first day we were there our room did not get cleaned after we had been gone all afternoon. It was taken care of promptly when we told the staff. The first night we stayed here we went up to the roof top bar and the views are spectacular! Try the duck fat fries!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Management, As a World Traveler, Hotel Staff Suburb!!!
text: For your review prior to booking a hotel in downtown Chicago - My husband and I arrived at the London House Hotel in downtown Chicago on Friday, July 1, 2016 to celebrate the July 4th holiday.  After a five and a half hour drive we were met by a friendly valet parking attendant.  The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and most inviting.  After exiting the LCD screen elevator, we arrived at our spacious and clean room with spectacular view from both the picture window in the room as well as the excellent views from the restroom window.  The king size bed was most comfortable and was complemented by the relaxing walk-in shower. The Hotel is located in the downtown area and within walking distance to many sites around the Loop, i.e. the Chicago Tribune, the Marina as well as Trump Tower.  You also have the option to enjoy the sites of this magnificent city via the Roof Top with some of the most STUNNING views in downtown Chicago.  Please keep in mind the number of individual with a similar objective of wanting to view Chicago from 22 floors or higher.  The restaurant provided healthy and delicious selections and the coffee was superb!  Lastly, but most important, was the personal attention my husband and I received from the staff at the London House but especially from both Carlos and Roman.  They made our stay most comfortable and extremely enjoyable!  Each time my family, my friends and I travel to Chicago, The London House will be our choice for overnight accommodations!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous hotel and great location
text: I took my family to the city for a staycation and chose this hotel for its location. Right at the corner of upper Wacker and Michigan Ave you couldn‚Äôt ask for a more perfect location. Shopping and river front are just outside the front door of the hotel. We had two adjoining rooms for us and the kids. The hotel only opened a month ago so you figured the rooms would be pristine and they were but more so they were so well thought out. The room had everything you could ask for and so elegant. Large bathrooms with walk in glass surround showers and a large (maybe 65‚Äù) flat screen TV. The rooms were also spacious with our room (king) have a separate seating area with a sofa, large flat screen tv and refrigerator tucked away nicely inside a credenza. Staff rivaled any service you‚Äôd get at the finest hotels and what we found interesting is they remember our first names as we came and went throughout each day. Wi-Fi had a great signal even at the highest floors which made my kids very happy. Rooftop bar is really something to see. Great views of the city, river and surrounding buildings. We used valet service for our car and just a quick call downstairs and our car was there in less than 10 minutes. Enjoyed some people watching from the lobby bar out onto Wacker Drive while enjoying a cappuccino one evening. We will definitely be back and are already planning a date weekend for just the wife and I.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Rooftop Happy hour
text: We only went to see the view from the roof. Small wait in line, better to make a reservation, however, within 30 mins we had a drink and were on the rooftop with a beautiful view of Chicago. Absolutely breathtaking.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Hip, stylish, new. (Yet, some problems)
text: This hotel (just opened a month ago) is going to be a perfect choice in Chicago. Any cons? - Breakfast is disappointing and poor (and you might wait 15 min for a chair). - Our room hasn't been cleaned until 4pm. - Window shade above the bed doesn't block light from waking you up at 6am (if you aren't used to sleeping with light). - Lots of problems with the wifi. - Some rooms have no safe. - It's annoying how the entrance from Michigan Ave and is closed and you need to walk around.  - And they don't totally treat Diamond Hhonors members as perfect as other properties do. - housekeeping knock on your door and immediately open not waiting for an answer.  But having said that-Great experience! - Not only best location, (You are on the riverwalk, the corner where Michigan Ave and Magnificent mile meet the Chicago river) - beautifully stylish, hip, relaxing - and a sexy roof top bar with an amazing view (stylish party at night) and professional staff (Shannen the concierge was perfectly helpful).   But also, The Curio collection is a brilliant exciting move that Hilton is developing. If you want to be loyal to Hilton (for the rewards) and want a holiday in a boutique young modern atmosphere, you couldn't hardly find any options around the Hilton brands.  waldorf astoria and conrad are not the answer usually. Curio gives exactly that. Adding to the face Hhonors club has improved significantly in so many fronts over the recent 2 years - this club is incredibly smart and rewarding. The LondonHouse building from 1920 (Insurance company) where the old dearborn castle stood, with the famous battle, where Chicago was born. Prices?As long as you find a room here at >300$ this is a really good hotel. They need a good scent in the lobby and common areas, the kind Westin and boutique spa hotels would have.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Bad View, Hotel Staff make up for it.
text: This hotel is beautiful and has a staff to back it up.Walking into the hotel I was greeted promptly by the Valet. They explained the cost, educated me on the process then informed me where I could check in.  This was all before I entered the building!  Check In was simple and efficient, I was informed of the features of the hotel and locations and near by attractions.  The elevators are very efficient and time consuming.  You select which floor you need to visit via a touch screen then the screen directs you to the best and most efficient elevator for your destination. The room itself was very clean and very very quiet; at times I felt like I was the only one on my floor.  The view in itself was lackluster.  I was facing a brick wall.  The bed and bedding was super comfortable, like sleeping in a cloud. The staff, location and room more than make up for the poor view.  This hotel had a lot of guests, but treated me as If I was their only one.  The doorman was very informative, giving me directions to nearby coffee, even told me his go to spot to view fireworks for fourth of July.  Even the cleaning staff was pleasant, they said good morning in the hall, and if you happened to get lost they would stop what they were doing and walk me to where I needed to go.This was my first visit to Chicago, this hotel and the staff was a great ambassador for the city of Chicago and would return in a heart beat.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice Room / Great View / Quirky Elevator
text: Spent a week at the LondonHouse. We had a fabulous view of the Chicago River and a well appointed room. The omelets  included with the continental breakfast were excellent most days and the Corner Bakery was very convenient as well. The new-fangled elevator system took some getting used to.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great stay
text: Stayed one night at the London House in Chicago. The hotel had Great style that reminded me of the great gatsby. Very nice rooms except the shower door wouldn't close because of a construction error. Grabbed a drink on the rooftop bar and it was nice. Super friendly staff and great location. Nice fitness room.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location!
text: I love the hotel, great location, rooms and staff! Check-in at 4 however if you have some luck they might check you in around noon!
