The rooftop on the 21th floor has a great view of the city and Lake Michigan(partial). I arrived at the hotel today and don't have any comment about breakfast yet.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Quick business trip
text: Only open 5 weeks. A beautiful boutique hotel. Location was awesome. Right in the river and Michigan Ave. loved it and would definitely return. Only there 2 days for business. Didn't eat there but the terrace is beautiful with a spectacular view.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: One of the most memorable nights
text: It was my first time being at the London House and the rooftop especially. I thought it would be great to have drinks with my best friend. We had a great time. One of our favorite and most memorable nights. The staff was great. They kept checking on us, which was something we greatly appreciated. The food was great, we even had seconds. Our choice of drink that night was The Chicago. It tasted great but was definitively strong. It was vanilla, peach, cognac, and sparkling wine I believe. I definitely cannot even explain how amazing the view was on the rooftop. We got there just as the sun was setting. As it got dark all the city light came on and it definitely reminded me why I love chicago so much. Definitely coming back and definitely going to recommend to everyone!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Anniversary
text: The concierge Anthony G. Was awesome! He took care of all reservations spa, dinner, & rooftop (also a bottle of wine with chocolate covered strawberries) was waiting for us in our room after spa. Thanks Anthony! Room was very nice with a great view.  We will definitely be back.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My Chicago Home Away from Home!
text: Wow! My first-ever trip to Chicago, and I did it in style. Check- in was quick. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I got an upgrade to a sick suite that was spacious and clean! I was worried that the suite being by the elevator would lend to a lot of noise, but I didn't hear anything. It was so quiet and peaceful. Daily breakfasts were great (thank you, Ann Marie!). The proximity to all things cool -- Riverwalk and the Navy Pier -- made this an ideal location! The front desk was incredible as well. Thank you Karon for the late checkout. I will be back!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Favorite Hotel
text: LondonHouse Chicago just opened earlier this year and has quickly become my favorite hotel. I have stayed for both business and for personal. The staff in all areas go the extra step to make everything great. I have stayed here 4 time over the past several weeks and always look forward to coming back. The rooms are very classy whether you have a king room or a full suite. They have included some great touches in the room including high ceilings, a Nespresso machine, advanced light controls and a scrubby for the shower that all make my stay more enjoyable.On my latest stay the front desk staff and the concierge left me a tray of chocolate dipped strawberries, a bottle of wine and a personal card welcoming me back. (Thank you Alex, Roman and Jose). In addition, LondonHouse has a great rooftop with an amazing view of the Chicago River. Unfortunately staying there doesn't get you priority access. I recommend going up there earlier in the evening or on Sunday evening as it can be a long wait on other nights of the week as its one of the hottest rooftops in Chicago. I'm looking forward to my next stay in a couple of weeks.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel and a Great Rate
text: I was in Chicago for a conference and was looking for a reasonably priced hotel downtown.  I got a great rate at the LondonHouse and the hotel was beautiful and really modern. I would definitely go back again the next time I am in Chicago. The in-room Nespresso machine was great, but I was surprised that I needed to move it to the desk in order to plug it in and read the directions on how to use it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Love the View
text: I stayed in Room 1710 for a short conference in Chicago. Although this corner room is small, it has a great view of the river. The only eyesore is the HUGE lighted Trump sign on the building across the river. The room had a small fridge and excellent bath amenities, plus complimentary slippers. The elevators use a unique system that entails logging your desired floor on a key pad that then directs you to Elevator A, B, C, etc. The elevators can be slow during busy periods. I did not visit the rooftop bar because others told me that it is always crowded and the service is not great. The room service menu is limited but the food is very good. Hotels near the Miracle Mile can be spendy and Londonhouse is no exception. For the price I will likely stay elsewhere in the future.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Views and very good service
text: The london house is a fantastic hotel with some of the best views of Chicago.  I would recommend paying the extra amount and getting a room with a view.  The rooftop is nice but they are still working out the kinks in regards to how to best use the space.  Check in isnt until 4 so I would suggest getting there at noon, check your bags and then go to the rooftop for a drink and then go grab lunch.  The hotel pricing for breakfast is crazy expensive and not a great setting.  Definitely a great place for a quick getaway or a romantic weekend.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: I am writing this post to prolong my time in the room and avoid leaving
text: I stayed her on vacation in June of 2016. I chose the LondonHouse because of it's TripAdvisor rating and being a part of the Hilton network. I stayed for two nights - one for 70k points and the other for 25k points and $125. The location is undeniable - right off the Miracle Mile and Millennium Park. The rooms are super comfy with towels bigger than my own and pillows that seem to multiple overnight. The little touches like the in-room Nespresso machine and brand new Samsung flat panel TV make staying here a treat. The rooftop bar is nice, but as a New Yorker, it is a bit overhyped. I recommend going to the 21st floor, getting a place in the queue and grabbing the first round there then going to the roof for your second round and requisite Instagram photo. Only (minor) gripe is the gym is a little (note: only a LITTLE) disappointing - it has dumbells (up to 50lbs), an egometer, spin bikes and treadmills, but not much more. Therefore, no yoga mats nor medicine balls, but those are easily added. I will look to stay here the next time I am in town. I write this post to avoid leaving.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful Hotel! Such Friendly Service
text: Visited Chicago this past weekend to see some live music and stayed at The LondonHouse Chicago.  Modern and elegant.  I can't say enough about the the friendly service.  Everyone was smiling and helpful and genuine.  Great location too.  Easy to walk to anything.  The roof top bar was perfect!!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic Experience
text: The Londonhouse in Chicago is fantastic.  I can't say enough good things about it.  I was there for a conference, but I would definitely stay for fun. The food was out of this world. It's so far from the bad chicken and mashed potatoes of usual conference food.  It was fresh, creative, varied.  I love how well the staff treated me and most importantly, they all seemed to be genuinely happy!  Great stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New Gem of Chicago
text: When I arrived to check in at 5PM, my room that was supposed to be ready at 4PM, but it was not.  The folks at the front desk took a moment to resolve the issue, but I did not mind waiting too much as I was getting an upgraded room.  Ended up with a very room corner room.  Staff was excellent, and very welcoming.  Keep in mind the rooftop bar is not run by the hotel.  Hopefully in the future it will be or they will work out the bugs of making a reservation and the bar's professionalism.  There are great views from the roof.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel!
text: Girls weekend and we chose the LondonHouse. Beautiful lobby and room, staff was attentive and helpful. Hotel is right on the riverfront across from trump hotel. Rooftop bar with spectacular views and cappuccino machine in room. We got a good price through Priceline. What's unusual is that there are no floor buttons in the elevator. Also, housekeeping is noisy in the morning and knocks too early and beds are very soft/squishy. Other than that it was a great visit.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Overpriced
text: This hotel has potential to be a nice place to stay. Maybe by the time you stay there they will have found a way to reach that potential, but till then, you could do a lot better. Very nice rooms, but the hotel doesn't have a lot of soul. The bed is essentially a huge pillow. Fantastic service at the bar. I recommend getting a good drink and a tasty snack recommendation from the friendly bar staff, and then sleep somewhere else.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel.  Rooms were clean and modern.  lobby had a great atmosphere and the staff was terrific.  Highly recommend this hotel. Location was perfect as it was right on the river with great views of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Downtown Location
text: Great new hotel across from the Trump building, very upscale, very nice rooftop bar, my only complaint was the $71 a night charge for parking, other than that it was a great experience, very friendly and helpful staff, great location. This would be a good place for a business trip or a romantic weekend away.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Conference in the City
text: The valet Fikret was very helpful from the minute I stopped the car.  Offered info/options on parking/checkin/dining and help with luggage (Miguel-also very friendly and helpful). You feel like royalty the minute you step on property until you leave.  Rooms tech savy and modern design. Comfort a 10 l+ on scale 1-10. The bar on the second floor is nice to unwind. The sky deck has amazing views but make reservations or you may be disappointed.  Great distance in the city to many things to do especially Michigan Ave or the Lake Shore Area/Navy Pier.  I will definitely recommend to colleagues.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Top Service, Top views
text: We had a wonderful weekend getaway at the London House.  Brian from the front desk was most accommodating in ensuring our stay was memorable.  I had called ahead and told him we were celebrating my wife's birthday and my brother's birthday and he asked what time we expected to check-in.  Our room had a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting and my brother's room had premium beers from the tap and a bowl of nuts.  Service throughout the hotel was 5 star, the views from both rooms we had were fabulous - ours looking up the Chicago river and the other room looking up Michigan Ave and out to Lake Michigan.  If you go you MUST visit the roof top bar - the champagne bar on the lower level offered a quite, comfortable alcove while the upstairs bar was packed and hopping.  Only negative was waking up in the morning and seeing the "TRUMP" sign  :-)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic stay
text: Service: Superb. Bell staff is on point and extremely professional. Room: Fantastic decor, high-end toiletries.  Each room is configured differently based on the historical nature of the building; therefore, if you are staying in a group and needing multiple rooms, the hotel layout does make it challenging to have rooms all on same floor (my only complaint). Our 10th floor room had a stellar view of the river and skyline.  Location: There is a Corner Bakery Cafe and a Starbucks on the same block, extremely convenient. Hotel proximity is fantastic for events at Millennial/Grant Park or Michigan Avenue. It's located above the river walk shops and boat cruises.  Additional thoughts: The rooftop bar has quickly become "the" rooftop in Chicago; however, I believe hotel guests should get first rights to reservations.  It's a bit strange you are paying for the hotel and can't use the amenities. The hotel has opened the terrace, without reservations from 12-2 p.m.  If you are not able to secure reservations for the rooftop bar, there is a small terrace (located behind the hotel sign) that you are able to capture an outdoor view of the city.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great experience! Clean, friendly staff! I highly recommended and best place to stay in downtown Chicago!
text: A great new hotel in Chicago! A must stay hotel in prime location!  The staff was very helpful giving direction around town! Room is very large with great view to the city! Best place to stay in Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great location
text: I actually booked my parents a room here when they were visiting in Chicago. I thought that the lobby was really impressive/swanky, and they had no complaints about the room. In fact, my mother raved about the shower soap (an odd thing to appreciate, but credit where credit is due, I guess). The best part was definitely the location right near the river. They were in the center of everything so it was easy to make plans. Staff was nice. Someone kindly and quickly fetched something out of my mom's car after it was valet parked. Tip: request the 4th floor if you don't want a high floor. The spa and fitness area is on that floor and is awesome.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay
text: We stayed here for Father's Day weekend.  Very conveniently located. The service was very friendly.  (I don't recall walking by an employee who didn't speak to us.)  We had a great view of the river and downtown.  As my wife noted, "this might be our new 'go-to' place to stay when we some to Chicago!"  My only knock on the experience was our inability to visit the rooftop area.  It was booked for several days in advance.  It would have been nice if hotel patrons were given some priority.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great downtown stay
text: Very nice hotel! Great location for getting anywhere in the city. Lobby bar/breakfast has great views for people watching. Some of the best views of the city can be found on the roof top lounge. The room was very nice.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best Hotel in Chicago!!
text: Jacqueline and Sherman are the best hosts and they have the most beautiful, sophisticated hotel in the city to share with you!!  Every detail is finely crafted, from it's luxurious and breathtaking rooftop and lobby bars to the elegant hallways and room interiors!  This place is not to be missed, enjoy, fellow TripAdvisors!#555

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wknd getaway in chicagp
text: Beautiful renovation- work of art! Highly recommend staying here! Amazing location, friendly staff and rooftop is awesome! Views are the best - be sure to make reservation! And Murphy is a 5-star!! If you're lucky he'll greet you on arrival!!üëç

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome!
text: Very trendy hotel. Staff everywhere being there to help and frankly, the only place where I ever experienced something similar was Dubai.Room is great; not big but not really needed when there are 3 bars to chose from:-) However, the room has all what one could expect including a Nespresso machine in the room and a great view on the river!Make sure you reserve a table upfront when you want to enjoy dinner or a table at the rooftop terrace. I stayed in quite a few hotels in Chicago but this is truly the first one I'm sure I will return to!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Magnificent Mile!
text: A sparking gem at the foot of Mag Mile!  A great destination for business or pleasure.  It's clear the Staff have been organized to provide a tailored-made approach to service.  Fun club on top floor and great health club!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A small European Style hotel in Chicago
text: Small but not tiny.  They serve breakfast, have a bar (two, one on the roof), and a small  fitness center.   It is a  great location on East Wacker with  a view of the Chicago River.   The building is old but newly renovated in a complimentary, modern style.   Nespresso machines in your room.  Try it if you like espresso -- it is the rage in Europe!   My only complaint and they are working out the bugs (open a week or two) -- breakfast at 630 is never quite ready.   But the price for the room is very good -- a good value as they say.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Better Deal than the Trump
text: Have stayed there in the last month twice.  Desk staff, Dan S. and others, were excellent at providing service fit for a queen.  Check-in, breakfast in the morning, and the pricing were above average for this area of downtown Chicago with great views of the Chicago River.  I love location as its on the south side of the river and so close to taxis or the brownline (1 block away).

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing views...
text: The location of the hotel is great and the views that it offers from the room at unmatched. We stayed in the corner king on the 16th floor and had four windows, each with a spectacular view... even one had a view of lake michigan! The rooms were nicely sized for downtown and offered a fridge for personal use and a nespresso machine which we loved. The bathrooms are huge and well lit, also a huge window!! Beds were comfortable and the tv is large ! Staff is very accommodating and polite, would ever remember what elevator we needed when we walked in. The price to park is out of cotrol, even for chicago standards... 71 a night. The food and beverages were less than expected... room service was terrible, but quite pricey. Our air did go out one day and it took quite awhile for someone to address it... but they sent up some cold beers while we waited. I think this place will only get better with time !

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Came for drinks!
text: We had a great time at the london house rooftop. Eric Ortega was our server and he took care of us. He was very professional and got us a great table. Cater to us the whole evening. The greatest customer service. We met the manager too and we was also very careting to us.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Worth giving this new hotel a try!
text: This hotel is recently opened.  It is right along the river and the River Walk.  We had a King Vista room.  It was spacious and nicely appointed.  Just a few blocks from the train stations for easy travel to anywhere in the city!  Many great restaurants within walking distance.   Will definitely come back to the hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: My new Chicago Fav!
text: I loved this hotel! I love historical buildings so I thought I'd give it a try. I wasn't disappointed at all. The staff was friendly and attentive. The entrance is a bit odd. You have to go to the 2nd floor for checkin and there is a restaurant there. They also have 2 Apple computers to use if needed. The room: I had a gorgeous room that overlooked the water & bridge. It was quiet (except for street traffic, even though I was on a high floor.) They have amazing coffee in the rooms (usually hotel room coffee is gross.) The room was well designed & comfy... Not a ton of space, but not tiny. The bathroom was large and spacious. The bed was perfect. An enjoyable stay all around! Will return.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: 5 Star BUT
text: Everything about this hotel is 5 star - the staff, the rooms, the location BUT a hugh disappointment was our inability to access the much promoted 22nd floor rooftop bar and lounge. There is a small, standing only viewing area on the 21st floor, which was not very notable and very crowded when we visited it.  The 22nd floor has limited, controlled access and you need a reservation to get in. We were told they were "sold out"  for months!!!  This would not have been such a disappointment, except we chose this hotel specifically for the  roof top.We had a wonderful view of the river from our room and everything else was 5 star so that mitigated things. I would recommend this hotel, but be aware you may not be able to get to the rooftop during your stay.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: A Truly Exceptional Hotel
text: My most recent stay at the London House blew me away from the moment I checked in until the moment I checked out. It was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. Three things, in particular, stood out to me:1.	Cleanliness ‚Äì The hotel is SPOTLESS. The lobby and elevators are extremely bright and clean, and this makes an outstanding first impression. The hallways leading to each individual room are also clean as a whistle. I sometimes find that the hallways in some hotels can be a little dusty (from all the foot traffic), but the attention to detail in keeping these areas in tip-top shape is a testament to the staff at the hotel. The cleanliness inside of the rooms was also outstanding. You can absolutely tell that this hotel prides itself on cleanliness. There was no dust whatsoever to speak of in my room, the glass shower was spotless (no soapy film, or ground-in dirt on the floor), stainless steel finishes were freshly polished, and you could tell that the windows in the room were recently washed from both the inside and outside. I was truly impressed with the cleanliness and organization of my room. This was easily the cleanest hotel and cleanest room I have ever stayed in. 2.	Hotel Staff ‚Äì In general, I expect hotel staff to be friendly and accommodating to all guests. The staff at the London House goes above and beyond. The staff at the reception desk immediately make you feel welcome and like a privileged guest. They are extremely helpful and accommodating to any requests you may have. The general atmosphere of the hotel promotes a warm and hospitable feeling, and the friendliness of the staff only increases that feeling. Additionally, there are always staff at the entrance of the hotel ready to help you with your bags, valet your car, give you directions, etc. Even you don‚Äôt need assistance with anything, you will always receive a ‚Äúgood morning/good evening sir, welcome back‚Äù. Some people may not think this is a huge deal, but it is just one of the little things that is often overlooked. Aside from being so welcoming, the staff at the entrance of the hotel are also an added level of security, giving you some additional piece of mind while coming and going about your business.3.	Rooms ‚Äì I was pleasantly surprised with how large the standard king rooms are. As someone who spends roughly 90 nights per year in downtown hotels, I am used to their relatively small size (compared to hotels in the suburbs). The rooms at the London House are definitely much larger than what I consider ‚Äústandard‚Äù. Additionally, the design and layout of the room was absolutely perfect, maximizing the space while staying completely functional. It looks like something out of a design magazine ‚Äì nice wood fixtures, granite/marble finishes, stainless steel accents, and dimmable inset ceiling lighting. Each room also comes with a wall mounted 55 inch tv at the foot of the bed. The bathrooms were also a welcome surprise. The new fixtures, cleanliness of everything (as well as being larger than normal), all made it a luxury experience. The shower in the bathroom was fantastic - water pressure was fantastic, and had no issues with temperature (staying on the 13th floor, and warm water was instant). Again, this is just one of the little things that makes a difference. Aside from the actual size and layout of the room, one of the unsung features of the room was its windows. The windows in the room are massive, and let in an enormous amount of natural light, and also give you some of the best views of the city and river. The bed was also one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. My room also had AC that worked perfectly (for the record, it was 95 in Chicago during my stay, and my room was always at a perfect 68). Bottom line - If you are traveling to Chicago on a business trip or for vacation, this is the place to stay. Make your reservations while you can...rooms will surely be in high demand once word spreads about the London House.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Another Chicago Rooftop Bar That Also Happens to Have A Hotel
text: Don't expect to access seating to the rooftop terrace just because you're a paying guest of this hotel. That won't matter. Reservations are made via a separate website ticketing system and, as this hotel is brand new, it's completely sold out for the month and expect the rest of summer to be the same. If you pop up in the late afternoon after check-in, they may let you grab a drink and stand around for a bit to enjoy the view--if you don't mind having to stare at tacky DRUMF letters while you sip your cocktail. Hilariously enough, the LH rooftop is actually a few floors ABOVE the DRUMF terrace so you can look down on the DRUMF patrons while you too sip your overpriced cocktail in the sunshine.But seriously, the view is great--I've seen it once now and that's good enough for me.The hotel is definitely nice enough. The room interiors and layout are very similar to the Conrad Hilton London in which we stayed last summer. Functional but a bit cramped. For the money, however, the hotel doesn't have much over any similar price point in Chicago. Chances are you'd choose this hotel over the rest of similar caliber just for the rooftop, but again since being a paying guest will not increase your chances to access, try any other hotel that will. There are plenty in a similar location. PROS:The hotel staff was incredible. Doormen, valet and everyone else in the hotel were great.Huge bathrooms.Nice bath products.Decent views even if you're not facing the river.Chromecast available on the TV.CONS:The LH Rooftop staff. The rooftop clientele.Smallish rooms.No turndown service.No in-room mini bars.Beds are hard.Some noise coming from Michigan Ave. 17 floors up might bother light sleepers.No blackout curtains. Room is super bright in the morning.PARKING TIP: Don‚Äôt pay full price valet. LH valet parking is available on Spot Hero for half the price.  No in-and-out, but worth the price.BREAKFAST TIP: Corner Bakery is on the first floor adjacent to the hotel. Order ahead of time with their app and skip the long morning coffee & breakfast lines.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Exellent
text: Lovely hotel, great location, great views of the river and many bridges and buildings; especially enjoyed the light play off the buildings and water from my room.  Staff very attentive and eager to assist, inform, direct. A little new, as they had just been opened sixteen days before my arrival, but good start and definitely something to build from.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Wonderful hotel!
text: We were lucky to happen across a reservation at this great new hotel! The view from our room of the river was absolutely stunning.  The room was spacious with fantastic contemporary design touches.  The common areas of the hotel were a beautiful combination of original charm and modern design - lovely!  The staff was helpful, efficient and polite, and you can't beat the convenient location.  We look forward to our next visit!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Business Trip
text: Booked last minute for business, this deluxe hotel has fantastic service from front desk to bar to housekeeping. Great location. Don't miss the rooftop bar, but do make reservations--there was an hour wait.  I will go back

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Nice hotel. Great service
text: This hotel had just been open one week, so everything was squeaky clean. Comfortable rooms and mine had a view of the river. I was most impressed by the service. At every turn someone was there to help you, without being a nuisance. Very clever elevators with no floor buttons inside and no one is reaching over to push a button. You enter in the floor number when you get to elevator and it will tell you which elevator to go to. Hotel is in a great location. Buffet Breakfast with cooked to order eggs was $24, but I just went outside to the Corner bakery adjacent to the hotel. Wick and reasonable. Wifi was great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Best views and rooftop in Chicago
text: LH is simply amazing from the service, quality, ambiance and an incredible addition to Chicago.  The sweeping skyline and riverfront views are breathtaking and the best rooftop lounge to grab a cocktail and small bites.  Reservations for the rooftop are online only and there is a waiting list. The rooms are comfortable and elegantly appointed.  London House is the new top dog in town.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Stunning views amazing hotel
text: Stayed at the London house in Chicago the night before my return to England - the London house has only been open for a few weeks - stayed on the 15th floor absolutely amazing views across Chicago.  Could see 7 bridges in the distance and was aOpposite trump towers.  The views are amazing.  The staff at the hotel were so helpful polite and so knowledgable,  would definitely recommend this hotel.  Superbly clean and staff so friendly and couldn't do enough for you.  Room was amazing.  Our room wasn't ready so was given another room.  Had air conditioning and anything that you needed - AMAZING

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Amazing
text: I loved every bit of my stay. Going to a 2nd hotel form this was a bit of a let-down because of the totally amazing experience at the LondonHouse. Everything was fantastic; the decor, the staff, the room; and the bed was amaaaazing. I would totally return to the LondonHouse, and i look forward to trying out other hotels in the chain.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic new hotel convenient to Loop, shopping on Michigan Ave, and River North nightlife
text: Last week I spent three nights at the LondonHouse and was solidly impressed. I travel to Chicago for work regularly and was excited to try out this new Hilton property since it was less than two weeks old. First positive: the staff. They were so friendly, positive, and helpful. The front desk, bellmen, housekeeping - you name it. Super nice people proud of their beautiful new hotel. I even met a woman who was learning to stage furniture and fluff pillows at the crazy-popular rooftop lounge and she was so excited. Secondly: well-appointed rooms with comfortable beds, Frette linens and robes, and great desks to get some work in. My room on the 15th floor had beautiful views looking north across the river to the Wrigley building. It was also quiet and restful. Third: location. Convenient to the subway, Metra, and walking distance from most popular tourist spots. Across the street from the must-do Architecture tours and just a few minutes walk to the art institute. Centrally situated for most sightseeing destinations. As a former Chicago resident, I felt kind of jealous of this location. :)Highly recommend this new hotel!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great hotel. Great Staff.  Great location. Bad Bloody Mary
text: Overall experience at this new hotel was great.  From the door men to the front desk to those helping with the elevators to bar/restaurant staff....all very friendly and professional.  Stayed on the 14th floor.  Great view of the river with Trump building across the street.  The location was very convenient to everywhere I needed to be.  Thought the room was modern and comfortable.  Spacious enough.  The only 2 "negatives" was that the "digital key" they touted didn't work for me.  Not really a big deal but would've liked to have tried it out.  The other was the Bloody Mary.  I know it sounds a little silly, but I really wanted one prior to heading to the airport to catch my flight home.  Rebecca at the bar was fantastic.  Awesome personality and she sincerely tried to help me with an alternative drink.  The Bar Manager or whoever created the Bloody Mary mix certainly lacked creativity or didn't feel like putting a lot of effort into it.  Seriously...embarrassing.  Either get a good mix like Zing Zang (which is from Chicago area btw), make the effort to create a good in-house mix, or simply don't offer one.  Taking tomato juice, adding sugar and Worcester sauce doesn't make a good Bloody Mary mix.  Okay...there you have it.  Absolutely loved the LondonHouse Chicago...except for the Bloody Mary :). Will definitely stay there again and will probably order a bourbon from Rebecca instead.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome!
text: My stay was great! Everyone was so helpful and friendly. The location is wonderful. The room was magnificent and the view was even better. Alex and  Savanah from the front desk made my stay very enjoyable. I look forward to staying many more nights.:)M.Taylor

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Good location, small room
text: I stayed at the LH on business. The staff at the reception desk were very nice. The room was small but fine for me since I was just sleeping there and then going to my meeting. The room was spotlessly clean and the view of the Chicago river and up Michigan Avenue was nice. The decor is nice but pretty much what you'd expect for an upscale but not top of the line hotel (with the exception of the truly ugly armoire/closet). If I had wanted to spend any significant amount of time in my room and awake it would have felt very small.  The gym is functional. Just to see what all the fuss was about I went up to the rooftop bar. Even though I didn't have a reservation the host was very nice and let me go up for a look. The view and the vibe are both lovely. In short, the LH is unlikely to become my favorite Chicago hotel but it is perfectly nice and the location is great.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fabulous NEW hotel in Chicago
text: I've been waiting for this hotel to open since I heard about it and tried it out on Friday night. It most definitely lived up to my expectations and more in every respect. The room product is fantastic. Classy, contemporary, comfortable, great view of the Chicago River, a comfy bed and well appointed bathroom. I travel weekly and know a great place when I stay in one!   The hotel staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. You can tell that the management knows what they are doing.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great New Hotel in the City
text: Loved this hotel.  The style was awesome, the bed comfortable and the authenticity was amazing.  It's new, so I have to be sure to mention that they need to get there plan together on morning breakfasts.  Only area that I think needed improvement.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Londonhouse chicago
text: Very good, freshly renowated hotel. Lokalization is just perfect. Nice street view as well as on the Trump Tower on the oppositeside of the river. Very noce rooms. Mini bar is empty. Lobby bar quite expensive- glass of wine 12-13 USD. Breakfast tasty but small. Lunch bar is also expensive vs size and content of the portion but must admit very tasty. Very friendly staff. Nice gym:))

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Perfect hotel
text: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in. The view of the river was phenomenal. Very relaxing room with comfortable beds.The staff were so helpful. The location is great for shops and restaurant's. My family from England loved it.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Not worth the money
text: Shower not working on arrival. Staff did not deal with the situation appropriately. For the price paid and a business trip, really inconvenient and disappointing. The rooftop needs reservations while ahead of time, don;t count on having drinks there unless you booked way in advance.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Excellent Quality
text: The London House has very high quality services and modern room accomodations. The staff at the concierge/activity planning desk are extremely helpful and can provide you with excellent, personal recommendations. Rooms were always cleaned, even when leaving our room in mid-afternoon. We were always greeted when entering the hotel. The only areas I feel could be improved are the efficiency of the elevators (there's 6 or more and for some reason it can take a long time for any one of them to get to you) and also the price of the breakfast ($24/person). I felt there were nearby cheaper options.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New hotel - love it!
text: Brand new hotel as of June 2016. Got a great rate as no one is booking due to lack of reviews, so I felt the need to help out. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. They have made a first rate job of renovating the hotel, it is very tasteful and modern. Maybe more a masculine / European feel to the rooms with white and black colors and clean modern lines. Breakfast omelet bar was delicious. Has rooftop bars which I did not visit but look nice. Excellent central location and very nice views. Will be my first choice next trip to Chicago if not too expensive by then. Snag the rooms at low rates while you still can!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Awesome Sauce
text: Such an amazing hotel! Great location. I loved every moment of staying at the London house! The view is nice and I had a partial view of the river and trump tower. I can't wait to stay there again. I live in Chicago and would have stay cations there whenever possible.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: City trip
text: This hotel just opened 12days ago. They are so friendly and the customer service is amazing! We had a room on the 13th floor with an amazing view of the north river straight across from the trump tower. The roof-top bar has a super cool cocktail list with a breath taking view. Better than the view of the trump tower terasse that everyone was raving about. All in all tumbs up!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Beautiful hotel and outstanding staff
text: From the moment i walked into the Londonhouse, I was pleased with all staff encountered, very accommodating and extremely friendly. The room was clean and has incredible views, especially from the Roof top bar. My only complaint would be my food was not as hot as I would have preferred when ordering room service. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Stay in Chicago
text: Hotel lounge/lobby manager made our stay very enjoyable.  He went out of his way to bring us up to the rooftop bar where reservations were already sold out.  The hotel had just opened and the service and cleanliness were excellent!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: New hotel
text: This is a very pretty hotel. It was brand new (only open a couple days). Obviously working on little things like room service being cold when it arrived, no coffee cups or water cups in room. It will be a very nice place to stay in a few months, but expensive!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great Hotel!
text: The staff and hotel at the LondonHouse was very accommodating! They were beyond helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and modern. The location amazing. I will definitely stay again when visiting Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: First Visit to Chicago
text: I had my first visit to Chicago recently. We stayed on the riverfront at the Londonhouse, on day 3 of their grand-opening over the holiday weekend. Hotel and room were clean and charming. Staff was friendly and helpful. Shout out to the front desk attendee who personally helped us get an amazing riverfront view. Definitely a great visit overall and a do-over in my book! ;o)

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Promising hotel
text: This Hilton hotel is one of the most beautiful I've seen in Chicago. It looks very promising, and I can see it will be one of the hottest in Chicago in the future. The decor is upscale and modern. I stayed in the corner room in a low floor. Really beautiful room, very comfortable bed, huge TV (at least 60"), nice views, and a Nespresso machine.I have to say, it gets noisy sometimes, and I'm a guy who is usually not bothered by noises, so light sleepers beware, make sure you get a high floor. And I'm sorry to say this, but the shower sucks. The flow is weak and the heat is not great. Also, the faucet is confusing. It's a well-known fact that two faucet knobs is a bad design. You make it worse when you remove indications. Which one is hot? Which one rotates anti-clockwise? I'll leave you the thrill of figuring this out. The lighting system is confusing as well. Slow response, and lots of buttons around the room. When I say confusing, it's not like lost-in-a-forest confusing, I mean it's inconvenient and requires some time of getting used to it. Finally, visitors should note that the elevators are not like the conventional ones. You type which floor you're going, and then the screen tells you which elevator to go. The only problem here is that there are six elevators, and still they manage to be really slow (relative to other hotels). The elevator never comes quickly.All that aside, these little things didn't really bother me, and I wrote them here just to let the visitors know. I'll still give this hotel 5 stars. At least they make a very nice omelet.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Great new hotel.
text: I stayed here for a night on business. The staff were very helpful in finding me a great room and making sure I was happy.  The front desk even when out to get me a newspaper !  And the pain chocolat were best had had outside of Paris.  Nespresso machine in room a perfect touch.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Fantastic service and beautiful hotel
text: Had a wonderful stay for the night at LondonHouse. Absolutely lovely room with great river view.  Service was phenomenal and very friendly.  In particular the bellman Murphy was a joy and greeted us with such warmth and welcome.  Would give 7 stars if I could.

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Absolutely Stunning
text: This hotel is beautiful from head to toe. The staff are so friendly and so helpful. The views are gorgeous, the bed is comfortable, the shower is fantastic. This hotel is in the perfect location to walk to Michigan Avenue, take a boat tour, or just be in the city. My stay here has been the best experience I have ever had. I hope to return soon!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: Almost Perfect!
text: So, we happened upon a reservation at the new Curio Collection Londonhouse in Chicago for a getaway trip over the Memorial Day weekend.Of course, it didn't hurt that everything was brand new.  Upon check-in one of the managers informed us that we were probably the first ones to sleep in the bed in our room!The staff was impeccable.  Check-in was a breeze & the concierge helped us with late reservations to Harry Carey's.Right at the corner of Wacker & Michigan the location is excellent.   I mean you are litterally across the street from the Wendella boat tours, and less than a block from the Magnificent Mile.  An Uber ride from the airport without hiked up fees will cost you about $25. Our 8th floor room overlooked the intersection right down into the river at the Tribune & Wrigley buildings.  So, rooms on this side do give you some outside noise.  If you're a really light sleeper, you'll hear the boat horns and sirens.  But you'll be downtown anyway so you might want to ask for higher floor or something away from this busy intersection.The rooms come with Nespresso machines!  the bathrooms are a comfortable size with the showers actually having glass doors as opposed to curtains.  There are armoire's but no chest of drawers.  Actually, the drawers are in the night stands and underneath the beds.  Also, each room comes with a smart refrigerator that only operates if you put something in it.  Big HD screen TV's are in each room as well.So, as with most things brand new there are some hiccups they are trying to work out.First, our room didn't have any cream or coffee cups to enjoy the nespresso machine our first morning.  So, I go down to the lobby and see a spread of muffins, fruit, yogurt, plates, silverware and coffee urns. So I help myself.  Well, it's not free - even though it sure looks like a help yourself.  Even though nobody hassled me it was a little strange.  However, the panoramic view from the hotel lobby while you sip on coffee is outstanding!The LondonHouse has a fabulous rooftop bar!  Or so, I've heard.  Unfortunately, nobody informed us, upon check-in, that reservations are required and you HAVE to do them online.  We weren't the only ones though.  Several people got turned away like us only to be offered the indoor bar on the top floor which, if I'm going to pay alot for a drink and get slow service, I'd rather do it with a spectacular view!  Note to Londonhouse:  if you start excluding paying hotel customers from this I just don't see how it will be successful.But, if you're not into rooftops, bars or drinks then none of this will probably matter to you.Well, they've really started off well here and I will certainly take a look at this hotel on future visits to Chicago!

hotel: LondonHouse Chicago, Curio Collection by Hilton
title: We celebrated 41st wedding anniversery here 6 days after Hotel Opened
text: Great location in the heart of Chicago on south side of the river and just off Michigan Ave. We truly loved this location as you can walk to so much good in Chicago including Andy's Jazz Club.   Initially ordered a king corner room.  Very nice room.  Well decorated, large and good views.  When checking in mentioned our anniversary and when we returned to room found complimentary sparkling wine on ice.  While this was very nice it was 6 days after they opened and this room had some fatal flaws including HVAC that did not work.  Try to call customer services but phone in room was not wired.  Using my cell phone did get customer services and they compensated for our anniversary problems with an upgrade to a King Vista Suite which had a truly spectacular view up the river and plenty of room.  Great bed, Great room, great service.  Nothing like the view from 22nd floor roof top view.  Truly spectacular.
